collins.title: 柯林斯COBUILD高阶英汉双解学习词典
collins.publisher: 外语教学与研究出版社
collins.copyright: HarperCollins Publishers & Foreign Language Teaching and Research Press
collins.editors: John Sinclair, Alison Macaulay, Maggie Seaton

sense.def: A is the first letter of the English alphabet.
sense.tran: 英语字母表的第1个字母

sense.def: In music, A is the sixth note in the scale of C major.
sense.tran: C大调音阶中的第六音；A音

sense.def: If you get an A as a mark for a piece of work or in an exam, your work is extremely good.
A or a is used as an abbreviation for words beginning with a, such as 'acceleration', 'ampère', or 'answer'.
sense.tran: （用于首字母为 a 的一些单词的缩写，如 acceleration，ampère和answer）

sense.def: People talk about getting from A to B when they are referring generally to journeys they need to make, without saying where the journeys will take them.
sense.tran: 从一处到另一处；从甲地到乙地

example.ex: Cars are for getting people from A to B in maximum safety.
example.tran: 汽车用于将人们尽可能安全地从一地送往另一地。

boxx.note: A or an is the indefinite article. It is used at the beginning of noun groups which refer to only one person or thing. The form an is used in front of words that begin with vowel sounds.
boxx.tran: a 或 an 为不定冠词，用于表示单个事物或人的名词词组之前。an 用于以元音开始的单词之前。

sense.def: You use a or an when you are referring to someone or something for the first time or when people may not know which particular person or thing you are talking about.
sense.tran: （指初次提及或非特指的人或物）一（个）

example.ex: A waiter entered with a tray...
example.tran: 侍者端着托盘进来了。

example.ex: He started eating an apple...
example.tran: 他开始吃苹果。

example.ex: Today you've got a new teacher taking you...
example.tran: 今天有位新老师来教你们。

example.ex: I manage a hotel.
example.tran: 我经营一家旅馆。

sense.def: You use a or an when you are referring to any person or thing of a particular type and do not want to be specific.
sense.tran: （一类人或事物中非特指的）任何一（个）

example.ex: ...expensive make-up that we saw being advertised by a beautiful model...
example.tran: 我们所见的由一位漂亮模特代言的昂贵化妆品

example.ex: I suggest you leave it to an expert...
example.tran: 我建议你把它留给专家来解决。

example.ex: Bring a sleeping bag...
example.tran: 带只睡袋。

example.ex: I was waiting for a bus.
example.tran: 我在等公共汽车。

sense.def: You use a or an in front of an uncount noun when that noun follows an adjective, or when the noun is followed by words that describe it more fully.
sense.tran: （用于前加形容词或后加修饰语的不可数名词之前）一（种）

example.ex: There was a terrible sadness in her eyes...
example.tran: 她眼神中流露出深深的悲伤。

example.ex: He did have a real knowledge of the country...
example.tran: 他对该国的确知之甚多。

example.ex: Baseball movies have gained an appreciation that far outstrips those dealing with any other sport.
example.tran: 以棒球为主题的电影获得的青睐远远超过了其他体育类电影。

sense.def: You use a or an in front of a mass noun when you want to refer to a single type or make of something.

example.ex: Bollinger 'RD' is a rare, highly prized wine.
example.tran: 博林格RD香槟是一种名贵的备受推崇的葡萄酒。

sense.def: You use a in quantifiers such as a lot ,a little, and a bit.
sense.tran: （用于表示数量的词组中）许多/少许/一点

example.ex: I spend a lot on expensive jewelry and clothing...
example.tran: 我花很多钱购买昂贵的首饰和衣服。

example.ex: I've come looking for a bit of advice.
example.tran: 我特来讨教。

sense.def: You use a or an to refer to someone or something as a typical member of a group, class, or type.
sense.tran: （一类人或事物中典型的）一（个）

example.ex: Some parents believe a boy must learn to stand up and fight like a man.
example.tran: 有些父母认为男孩子必须学会像男子汉一样顶天立地，勇于抗争。

example.ex: ...the operation a patient has had.
example.tran: 病人做过的手术

sense.def: You use a or an in front of the names of days, months, or festivals when you are referring to one particular instance of that day, month, or festival.
sense.tran: （用于日子、月份或节日的名称之前以表示特例）一个

example.ex: The interview took place on a Friday afternoon...
example.tran: 采访是在一个星期五的下午进行的。

example.ex: It was a Christmas when shoppers passed by expensive silks in favor of more practical gifts.
example.tran: 这是一个购物者不理会昂贵的丝绸衣服而热衷于更实用礼物的圣诞节。

sense.def: You use a or an when you are saying what someone is or what job they have.

example.ex: I explained that I was an artist...
example.tran: 我解释说自己是个艺术家。

example.ex: He was now a teacher and a respectable member of the community.
example.tran: 他现在是一位教师，并且是社区内受人尊敬的一员。

sense.def: You use a or an in front of the names of people as a way of indicating that you do not know them or anything about them and you are saying their name for the first time.
sense.tran: （用于不为说话人所知的首次提到的人名前）某一（个）

example.ex: The full address on a stick-on label was that of a Mrs P. R. Slater of Peterborough...
example.tran: 不干胶标签上的完整地址写的是彼得伯勒的一位P. R. 斯莱特太太。

example.ex: A Dr Matthew Owens was reported missing while on an expedition to north-eastern Turkey.
example.tran: 据报道，一位叫马修·欧文斯的博士在前往土耳其东北部考察的途中失踪了。

sense.def: You use a or an in front of the names of people when you want to refer to someone else who has the same qualities or character as the person named.
sense.tran: （用于人名前，表示与该人有相同特性或品质）类似…的一个（或一位）

example.ex: When I listen to her play I can hear a new Nigel Kennedy.
example.tran: 从她的演奏中我听出了新一代的奈杰尔·肯尼迪。

sense.def: You use a or an in front of a surname when you want to refer to someone who belongs to the family with that surname.
sense.tran: （用于姓氏前，表示某人属于某姓氏家族）一位姓…的人

example.ex: As far as I can recall, Patti was a Smith.
example.tran: 我记得帕蒂是姓史密斯的。

sense.def: You use a or an in front of the names of artists to refer to one individual painting or sculpture created by them.
sense.tran: （用于艺术家名字前）一幅…的画，一件…的雕塑作品

example.ex: Most people have very little difficulty in seeing why a Van Gogh is a work of genius.
example.tran: 多数人不难理解为什么凡·高的作品是天才之作。

sense.def: You use a or an instead of the number 'one', especially with words of measurement such as 'hundred', 'hour', and 'metre', and with fractions such as 'half', 'quarter', and 'third'.
sense.tran: （代替数字one使用，尤用于hundred，hour和metre等表示度量的单词之前以及half, quarter和third等分数之前）

example.ex: ...more than a thousand acres of land.
example.tran: 1,000多英亩地

example.ex: ...a quarter of an hour...
example.tran: 一刻钟

example.ex: The skirts were shortened an inch or two.
example.tran: 这些裙子被改短了一两英寸。

sense.def: You use a or an in expressions such as eight hours a day to express a rate or ratio.
sense.tran: （用于表示比率的短语中）每一

example.ex: Prices start at £13.95 a metre for printed cotton...
example.tran: 印花棉布以每米13.95英镑的价格起售。

example.ex: The helicopter can zip along at about 150 kilometres an hour.
example.tran: 该直升机能以每小时150公里左右的速度疾进。

sense.def: A- is added to the beginning of some adjectives in order to form adjectives that describe someone or something that does not have the feature or quality indicated by the original word.
sense.tran: (用在形容词前构成反义形容词）表示“非”，“无”

example.ex: I'm a completely apolitical man...
example.tran: 我对政治毫无兴趣。

example.ex: She was amoral but honest.
example.tran: 她是个真小人。

example.ex: ...asymmetrical shapes.
example.tran: 不对称的形状

sense.def: In Britain, A & E is the part of a hospital that deals with accidents and emergencies. A & E is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'accident and emergency'.

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 ER

sense.def: In some American universities, an AB is the same as a BA.

sense.hdgr:
usu v-link PHR, oft PHR
by n
sense.def: If you are taken aback by something, you are surprised or shocked by it and you cannot respond at once.
sense.tran: 吃惊，震惊（以至于无法立刻作出反应）

example.ex: Roland was taken aback by our strength of feeling...
example.tran: 我们反应如此强烈，令罗兰大吃一惊。

example.ex: Derek was taken aback when a man answered the phone.
example.tran: 德里克吓了一跳，居然是一个男的接的电话。

sense.def: An abacus is a frame used for counting. It has rods with sliding beads on them.
Abalone is a shellfish that you can eat and that has a shiny substance called mother-of-pearl inside its shell.
sense.tran: 鲍，鲍鱼(有壳水生动物，可食，其壳内发光体为珍珠母)

sense.def: If you abandon a place, thing, or person, you leave the place, thing, or person permanently or for a long time, especially when you should not do so.

example.ex: He claimed that his parents had abandoned him...
example.tran: 他声称父母遗弃了他。

example.ex: The road is strewn with abandoned vehicles.
example.tran: 道路上满是弃置的车辆。

sense.def: If you abandon an activity or piece of work, you stop doing it before it is finished.
sense.tran: 中途放弃，中止（活动、工作等）

example.ex: The authorities have abandoned any attempt to distribute food...
example.tran: 当局中止了分发食物的尝试。

example.ex: The scheme's investors, fearful of bankruptcy, decided to abandon the project.
example.tran: 因为担心破产，该计划的投资者决定放弃这个项目。

sense.def: If you abandon an idea or way of thinking, you stop having that idea or thinking in that way.

example.ex: Logic had prevailed and he had abandoned the idea.
example.tran: 最终理智占了上风，他打消了那个念头。

sense.def: If you abandon yourself to an emotion, you think about it a lot and feel it strongly, especially when other people might think you are wrong to do so.

example.ex: We are scared to abandon ourselves to our feelings in case we seem weak or out of control.
example.tran: 我们不敢放纵自己的情感，以免显得太过软弱或缺乏自制。

sense.def: If you say that someone does something with abandon, you mean that they behave in a wild, uncontrolled way and do not think or care about how they should behave.

example.ex: He has spent money with gay abandon...
example.tran: 他肆意挥霍钱财。

example.ex: Their permissiveness toward their children reflects the wild abandon of their own lives.
example.tran: 他们对孩子的放任折射出他们自身生活的放浪形骸。

sense.def: If people abandon ship, they get off a ship because it is sinking.

example.ex: The officers and crew prepared to abandon ship in an orderly fashion.
example.tran: 全体船员秩序井然地准备弃船。

sense.def: An abandoned place or building is no longer used or occupied.
sense.tran: (场所或建筑物)舍弃不用的，无人居住的

example.ex: All that digging had left a network of abandoned mines and tunnels.
example.tran: 东挖西掘后留下了一片废弃的矿坑。

example.ex: ...abandoned buildings that become a breeding ground for crime.
example.tran: 沦为了犯罪温床的弃置楼群

sense.def: The abandonment of a place, thing, or person is the act of leaving it permanently or for a long time, especially when you should not do so.

example.ex: ...memories of her father's complete abandonment of her.
example.tran: 对父亲完全弃她不顾的回忆

sense.def: The abandonment of a piece of work or activity is the act of stopping doing it before it is finished.
sense.tran: （工作、活动等的）中途放弃，中止

example.ex: Constant rain forced the abandonment of the next day's competitions.
example.tran: 连绵阴雨致使翌日各项赛事被迫中止。

sense.def: The abandonment of an idea or way of thinking is the act of stopping having the idea or of stopping thinking in that way.

example.ex: ...the government's abandonment of the policy.
example.tran: 政府对这项政策的放弃

sense.def: If you are abashed, you feel embarrassed and ashamed.

example.ex: He looked abashed, uncomfortable.
example.tran: 他看起来有点困窘，很不自在。

sense.def: If something bad or undesirable abates, it becomes much less strong or severe.

example.ex: The storms had abated by the time they rounded Cape Horn.
example.tran: 他们绕过合恩角时，暴风雨已经减弱。

example.ex: ...a crime wave that shows no sign of abating.
example.tran: 丝毫没有减弱迹象的犯罪势头

sense.def: Abatement means a reduction in the strength or power of something or the reduction of it.

example.ex: ...the abatement of carbon dioxide emissions.
example.tran: 二氧化碳排放的减少

example.ex: ...noise abatement.
example.tran: 噪声消退

sense.def: An abattoir is a place where animals are killed in order to provide meat.

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 slaughterhouse

sense.def: An abbess is the nun who is in charge of the other nuns in a convent.
An abbey is a church with buildings attached to it in which monks or nuns live or used to live.
An abbot is the monk who is in charge of the other monks in a monastery or abbey.
sense.tran: 男修道院院长；大寺院男住持

sense.def: If you abbreviate something, especially a word or a piece of writing, you make it shorter.

example.ex: He abbreviated his first name to Alec.
example.tran: 他将自己的名字缩写为亚历克。

example.ex: It was an abbreviated document without detailed proposals.
example.tran: 这是一份省去了建议细节的文件简本。

sense.def: An abbreviation is a short form of a word or phrase, made by leaving out some of the letters or by using only the first letter of each word.

example.ex: The postal abbreviation for Kansas is KS.
example.tran: 堪萨斯州的邮政缩写是KS。

sense.def: The ABC of a subject or activity is the parts of it that you have to learn first because they are the most important and basic.

example.ex: ...the ABC of Marxism.
example.tran: 马克思主义的基本内容

sense.def: Children who have learned their ABC or their ABCs have learned to recognize, write, or say the alphabet.
sense.tran: 字母表（儿童识字、写字、拼词用的全部字母）

sense.def: If a king or queen abdicates, he or she gives up being king or queen.

example.ex: The last French king was Louis Philippe, who abdicated in 1848.
example.tran: 法国末代国王是1848年逊位的路易·菲力普。

example.ex: ...the most serious royal crisis since the abdication of Edward VIII.
example.tran: 自爱德华八世退位以来最为严重的皇室危机

sense.def: If you say that someone has abdicated responsibility for something, you disapprove of them because they have refused to accept responsibility for it any longer.

example.ex: Many parents simply abdicate all responsibility for their children.
example.tran: 许多父母对孩子简直是完全撒手不管。

example.ex: There had been a complete abdication of responsibility.
example.tran: 曾经一度完全无人负责。

sense.def: Your abdomen is the part of your body below your chest where your stomach and intestines are.

example.ex: He was suffering from pains in his abdomen.
example.tran: 他感到腹部剧痛。

sense.def: Abdominal is used to describe something that is situated in the abdomen or forms part of it.

example.ex: ...vomiting, diarrhoea and abdominal pain.
example.tran: 呕吐、腹泻和腹痛

sense.def: You can refer to your abdominal muscles as your abdominals when you are talking about exercise.
If someone is abducted by another person, he or she is taken away illegally, usually using force.

example.ex: His car was held up and he was abducted by four gunmen...
example.tran: 他的车遭遇拦劫，随后他被4名持枪歹徒劫持。

example.ex: She was charged with abducting a six-month-old child.
example.tran: 她被控诱拐一个6个月大的孩子。

example.ex: ...the abduction of four youths.
example.tran: 对4名青年的绑架

example.ex: She co-operated with her abductor.
example.tran: 她顺从绑匪的要求。

sense.def: Aberrant means unusual and not socially acceptable.
sense.tran: 异常的;离经叛道的;为社会不容的

example.ex: Ian's rages and aberrant behavior worsened.
example.tran: 伊恩的怒气越来越大，反常行为也愈发恶劣。

sense.def: An aberration is an incident or way of behaving that is not typical.

example.ex: It became very clear that the incident was not just an aberration, it was not just a single incident.
example.tran: 事实已经很清楚，这件事不是偶发的，它并不是一起孤立的事件。

sense.def: If someone considers a person or their behaviour to be an aberration, they think that they are strange and not socially acceptable.
sense.tran: 不正常的怪人；异常行为

example.ex: Single people are treated as an aberration and made to pay a supplement.
example.tran: 独身者被当成异类，而且要付一笔额外的费用。

example.ex: ...sexual aberration.
example.tran: 性变态

sense.def: If one person abets another, they help or encourage them to do something criminal or wrong. Abet is often used in the legal expression 'aid and abet'.
sense.tran: 教唆，唆使，怂恿，伴同(某人犯罪等）（常用于法律用语aid and abet中）

example.ex: His wife was sentenced to seven years imprisonment for aiding and abetting him...
example.tran: 他的妻子作为他的从犯被判入狱7年。

example.ex: We shall strike hard, without flinching, at terrorists and those who abet them.
example.tran: 我们要毫不退缩地严厉打击恐怖分子及其帮凶。

sense.def: To abet something, especially something bad or undesirable, means to make it possible.
sense.tran: 煽动;促使（坏事等）成为可能

example.ex: The media have also abetted the feeling of unreality.
example.tran: 媒体也在一旁对这种非现实感推波助澜。

sense.def: If something is in abeyance, it is not operating or being used at the present time.
sense.tran: 搁置;悬而未决;暂停使用

example.ex: The threat is likely to remain in abeyance until next year's meeting in Reykjavik.
example.tran: 这一威胁很可能会一直存在下去，直至明年的雷克雅未克会议。

example.ex: The matter was left in abeyance until Haig saw French.
example.tran: 事情被搁置了起来，直到黑格见到法国人。

sense.def: If you abhor something, you hate it very much, especially for moral reasons.
sense.tran: （尤指出于道德原因）憎恨，憎恶

example.ex: He was a man who abhorred violence and was deeply committed to reconciliation...
example.tran: 他是一个憎恶采用暴力而坚决主张和解的人。

example.ex: If nature abhors a vacuum, journalists abhor a transition, when there is little news to cover.
example.tran: 好比自然界拒绝真空一样，新闻工作者则厌恶没有多少新闻可供报道的过渡时期。

sense.hdgr:
usu with supp, oft poss N, N
of n
sense.def: Some-one's abhorrence of something is their strong hatred of it.

example.ex: They are anxious to show their abhorrence of racism.
example.tran: 他们急切地想要表明自己对种族主义的憎恨。

sense.hdgr:
usu v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
to n
sense.def: If something is abhorrent to you, you hate it very much or consider it completely unacceptable.
sense.tran: 令人憎恶的；使人厌恶的

example.ex: Racial discrimination is abhorrent to my council and our staff...
example.tran: 我的顾问班子和全体工作人员都对种族歧视深恶痛绝。

example.ex: There are many people who still find the act of abortion abhorrent.
example.tran: 仍有很多人对堕胎行为表示厌恶。

sense.def: If you can't abide someone or something, you dislike them very much.

example.ex: I can't abide people who can't make up their minds...
example.tran: 我受不了优柔寡断的人。

example.ex: She couldn't abide his success.
example.tran: 她见不得他成功。

sense.def: If you abide by a law, agreement, or decision, you do what it says you should do.

example.ex: They have got to abide by the rules.
example.tran: 他们必须遵守规则。

sense.def: An abiding feeling, memory, or interest is one that you have for a very long time.
sense.tran: （情感、记忆、兴趣等）持久的，长久的

example.ex: He has a genuine and abiding love of the craft...
example.tran: 他对这门手艺有着真挚持久的热爱。

example.ex: One of my abiding memories of him is of his singing to a small private party...
example.tran: 我对他难以忘怀的一幕是他在一次小型私人派对上献歌的情景。

example.ex: The folk-song world was another of his abiding interests.
example.tran: 民歌是他的另一个始终不渝的爱好。

sense.def: Your ability to do something is the fact that you can do it.

example.ex: The public never had faith in his ability to handle the job...
example.tran: 公众从来不相信他有能力胜任这一职位。

example.ex: He has the ability to bring out the best in others.
example.tran: 他能做到扬人之长。

sense.def: Your ability is the quality or skill that you have which makes it possible for you to do something.

example.ex: Her drama teacher spotted her ability...
example.tran: 她的戏剧老师发现了她的才能。

example.ex: I have confidence in the ability of the players...
example.tran: 我对于球员们的能力充满信心。

example.ex: They repeatedly questioned his leadership abilities...
example.tran: 他们一再质疑他的领导才能。

example.ex: Does the school cater for all abilities?
example.tran: 学校能够做到因材施教吗？

sense.def: If you do something to the best of your abilities or to the best of your ability, you do it as well as you can.

example.ex: I take care of them to the best of my abilities...
example.tran: 我尽我所能地照顾他们。

example.ex: They tackled them to the best of their ability.
example.tran: 他们竭尽全力给予解决。

boxu.usage: Do not confuse ability with capability and capacity. You often use ability to say that someone can do something well. He had remarkable ability as a musician. ...the ability to bear hardship. A person's capability is the amount of work they can do and how well they can do it. ...a job that was beyond the capability of one man. ...the director's ideas of the capability of the actor. If someone has a particular capacity, a capacity for something, or a capacity to do something, they have the qualities required to do it. Capacity is a more formal word than ability. ...their capacity for hard work. ...his capacity to see the other person's point of view.
boxu.tran: 不要混淆 ability, capability 和 capacity。ability 常用于表示某人将某件事做好的能力：He had remarkable ability as a musician（他拥有杰出的音乐才华），the ability to bear hardship（承受苦难的能力）。capability 指某人所能完成的工作量以及所能达到的工作质量：a job that was beyond the capability of one man（个人力所不及的工作），the director’s ideas of the capability of the actor（导演对于这个演员演技的看法）。capacity指做成某件事所需的素质, 用法比 ability 更加正式，例如 their capacity for hard work（他们能吃苦耐劳），his capacity to see the other person’s point of view（他领会他人观点的能力）。

sense.def: -ability replaces '-able' at the end of adjectives to form nouns. Nouns formed in this way refer to the state or quality described by the adjectives.
sense.tran: （替代-able加在形容词尾构成名词）表示“状态”，“性质”

example.ex: ...the desirability of global co-operation...
example.tran: 全球合作的可取性

example.ex: No one ever questioned her capability.
example.tran: 从来没有人质疑她的能力。

sense.def: You use abject to emphasize that a situation or quality is extremely bad.

example.ex: Both of them died in abject poverty...
example.tran: 他们两人都于穷困潦倒中死去。

example.ex: This scheme was an abject failure.
example.tran: 这项计划彻底失败了。

example.ex: Both have failed abjectly.
example.tran: 两人都遭遇了惨败。

sense.def: If you describe someone as abject, you think they have no courage or respect for themselves.
sense.tran: 卑躬屈节的；自卑的；怯懦的

example.ex: He sounded abject and eager to please...
example.tran: 他低声下气，急于讨好别人。

example.ex: He looked back at the abject, silent girl and repeated his question.
example.tran: 他转过头看着这个噤若寒蝉的女孩，又重复了一遍他的问题。

sense.def: If you abjure something such as a belief or way of life, you state publicly that you will give it up or that you reject it.
sense.tran: 发誓弃绝，郑重声明放弃(信仰、生活方式等）

example.ex: He abjured the Protestant faith and became King in 1594.
example.tran: 他放弃了新教信仰，于1594年登基为王。

example.ex: ...a formal statement abjuring military action.
example.tran: 表示放弃军事行动的正式声明

sense.def: Something that is ablaze is burning very fiercely.

example.ex: Shops, houses, and vehicles were set ablaze.
example.tran: 店铺、房子和车辆全都陷于火海。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, usu ADJ
with n
sense.def: If a place is ablaze with lights or colours, it is very bright because of them.

example.ex: The chamber was ablaze with light...
example.tran: 会议厅里灯火辉煌。

example.ex: In spring, the valleys are ablaze with colour.
example.tran: 春天，山谷里春色绚烂。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
with n
sense.def: If someone is ablaze, or if their eyes are ablaze, their expression shows that they are feeling a strong emotion, such as great excitement or anger.
sense.tran: （目光、神色等）激动的，兴奋的，愤怒的

example.ex: He was ablaze with enthusiasm...
example.tran: 他热情洋溢。

example.ex: Her voice is passionate. Her eyes are ablaze.
example.tran: 她声音激昂，目光如火。

sense.def: If you are able to do something, you have skills or qualities which make it possible for you to do it.
sense.tran: （因具有品质或技能）能做到…的

example.ex: The older child should be able to prepare a simple meal...
example.tran: 那个年纪稍大的孩子应当会做一顿简单的饭菜。

example.ex: The company say they're able to keep pricing competitive...
example.tran: 该公司说他们能够使定价保持竞争力。

example.ex: They seemed able to work together very efficiently.
example.tran: 他们看来能很有效率地合作。

sense.def: If you are able to do something, you have enough freedom, power, time, or money to do it.
sense.tran: （因有足够的自由、权力、时间、财力等而）可以…的，能够…的

example.ex: You'll be able to read in peace...
example.tran: 你就能安心地读书了。

example.ex: Have you been able to have any kind of contact?...
example.tran: 你联系上了吗？

example.ex: It would be nice to be able to afford to retire earlier.
example.tran: 无后顾之忧而能提早退休当是件幸事。

sense.def: Someone who is able is very clever or very good at doing something.
sense.tran: 聪明能干的；能力出众的

example.ex: ...one of the brightest and ablest members of the government...
example.tran: 政府里最聪明能干的成员之一

example.ex: They are bright, intelligent, able and confident.
example.tran: 他们聪明又智慧，能干又自信。

boxu.usage: Note that able and capable are both used to say that someone can do something. When you say that someone is able to do something, you mean that they can do it either because of their knowledge or skill, or because it is possible. He wondered if he would be able to climb over the rail... They were able to use their profits for new investments. Note that if you use a past tense, you are saying that someone has actually done something. We were able to reduce costs. When you say that someone is capable of doing something, you mean either that they have the knowledge and skill to do it, or that they are likely to do it. The workers are perfectly capable of running the organization themselves... She was quite capable of falling asleep. You can say that someone is capable of a particular feeling or action. He's capable of loyalty... Bowman could not believe him capable of murder. You can also use 'capable of' when talking about what something such as a car or machine can do. The car was capable of 110 miles per hour. If you describe someone as able or capable, you mean that they do things well. He's certainly a capable gardener.
boxu.tran: 注意，able和capable都用来表示某人能做某事。able 既可表示因拥有某种知识或技能而能做某事，也可表示客观可能：He wondered if he would be able to climb over the rail (他不知自己能否攀过栏杆)，They were able to use their profits for new investments (他们得以将利润用于再投资)。要注意的是，如果用过去时，则表示实际做了该事：We were able to reduce costs (我们做到了降低成本)。capable既可表示具有做某事的技能或知识，也可表示做某事有较大的可能性:The workers are perfectly capable of running the organization themselves (工人完全能够自己管理这个机构)，She was quite capable of falling asleep (她很容易睡着)。capable 还可表示具有某种情感或能够做出某一行为：He’s capable of loyalty (他能做到忠心耿耿)，Bowman could not believe him capable of murder (鲍曼无法相信他会杀人)。capable亦用于指汽车、机器等的性能：The car was capable of 110 miles per hour (这辆车时速可达110英里)。able或capable形容人时表示“有能力的”、“能力强的”：He’s certainly a capable gardener (他绝对是一名能干的园丁)。

sense.def: -able combines with verbs to form adjectives. Adjectives formed in this way describe someone or something that can have a particular thing done to them. For example, if something is avoidable, it can be avoided.
sense.tran: （附在动词后构成形容词）表示“可…的”，“值得…的”，“能…的”

example.ex: These injuries were avoidable...
example.tran: 这些伤是可以避免的。

example.ex: He was an admirable chairman.
example.tran: 他是一位令人钦佩的主席。

sense.def: An able-bodied person is physically strong and healthy, rather than weak or disabled.
sense.tran: 体格健全的；身强体壮的

example.ex: The gym can be used by both able-bodied and disabled people.
example.tran: 这家健身房健全和残障人士都可使用。

posc.def: The able-bodied are people who are able-bodied.
posc.tran: 体格健全的人；身强体壮的人

sense.def: Someone's ablutions are all the activities that are involved in washing himself or herself.
Ably means skilfully and successfully.

example.ex: He was ably assisted by a number of other members.
example.tran: 他得到其他一些成员的鼎力相助。

sense.def: Someone or something that is abnormal is unusual, especially in a way that is worrying.
sense.tran: 反常的；异常的；不规则的

example.ex: ...abnormal heart rhythms and high anxiety levels.
example.tran: 心律不齐和高度焦虑

example.ex: ...a child with an abnormal fear of strangers.
example.tran: 过于认生的小孩

rnon.hdgr: usu ADV adj/adv, also ADV with v

example.ex: ...abnormally high levels of glucose...
example.tran: 异常高的葡萄糖水平

example.ex: This stops the cells from growing abnormally.
example.tran: 这阻止了细胞畸形发育。

sense.def: An abnormality in something, especially in a person's body or behaviour, is an unusual part or feature of it that may be worrying or dangerous.
sense.tran: （尤指身体或行为上让人担忧或危险的）反常情况，变态特征

example.ex: Further scans are required to confirm the diagnosis of an abnormality...
example.tran: 需要进一步扫描来确诊是否出现异常病变。

example.ex: Genetic abnormalities are more often associated with faults in paternal DNA than in maternal DNA.
example.tran: 相对于母本DNA,基因畸变往往更多地与父本DNA上的缺陷相关。

sense.def: If you are aboard a ship or plane, you are on it or in it.

example.ex: She invited 750 people aboard the luxury yacht, the Savarona...
example.tran: 她邀请了750人乘坐豪华游艇“萨瓦罗纳”号。

example.ex: They said goodbye to him as he got aboard the train at Union Station.
example.tran: 当他在联合火车站登上火车之际，他们向他道别。

example.ex: It had taken two hours to load all the people aboard...
example.tran: 花了两个小时才让所有乘客都上了船。

example.ex: The United States has a naval task force offshore, with two thousand marines aboard.
example.tran: 美国在近海驻有海军特遣部队，船上共两千名海军陆战队官兵。

sense.def: Your abode is the place where you live.

example.ex: I went round the streets and found his new abode.
example.tran: 我走街串巷找到了他的新住所。

sense.def: If someone has no fixed abode, they are homeless.

example.ex: 30 per cent of psychiatric hospital beds are occupied by people of no fixed abode.
example.tran: 精神病院30%的床位是被无家可归者占据的。

sense.def: If someone is given the right of abode in a particular country, they are legally allowed to live there.

example.ex: Outsiders who wed islanders are given only three years' right of abode at first.
example.tran: 岛外的人和岛民结婚之初只能获得三年的居住权。

sense.def: If someone in authority abolishes a system or practice, they formally put an end to it.

example.ex: The following year Parliament voted to abolish the death penalty for murder...
example.tran: 议会于翌年表决对谋杀罪废除死刑。

example.ex: The whole system should be abolished.
example.tran: 整个制度应该被废除。

sense.hdgr:
also
a N, usu with supp, oft N
of n
sense.def: The abolition of something such as a system or practice is its formal ending.

example.ex: ...the abolition of slavery in Brazil and the Caribbean.
example.tran: 巴西及加勒比地区奴隶制的废除

sense.def: An abolitionist is someone who campaigns for the abolition of a particular system or practice.
sense.tran: 废除主义者;主张废除（某种制度或习俗）的人

example.ex: By 1838, the abolitionists had shamed parliament into ending slavery in British colonies...
example.tran: 到1838年，废奴主义者迫使议会出于道德压力而废除了英国殖民地的奴隶制。

example.ex: As long as most people are happy to have the monarchy, the abolitionist position is an arrogant fantasy.
example.tran: 只要大多数人还乐意保留君主制，废除它的主张就是痴人说梦。

sense.def: An A-bomb is an atomic bomb.
Something that is abominable is very unpleasant or bad.

example.ex: The President described the killings as an abominable crime...
example.tran: 总统称这些血案为令人发指的罪行。

example.ex: English food can be wonderful but the normal English diet is abominable.
example.tran: 英国也有美食，只是一般的日常饮食太过糟糕。

example.ex: Chloe has behaved abominably...
example.tran: 克洛艾行为恶劣。

example.ex: Wallis was often abominably rude.
example.tran: 沃利斯经常粗鲁得让人讨厌。

sense.def: If you say that something is an abomination, you think that it is completely unacceptable.
sense.tran: 令人完全无法接受的事物；令人厌恶的事物

example.ex: What is happening is an abomination.
example.tran: 正在发生的事令人非常反感。

sense.def: An Aboriginal is an Australian Aborigine.

example.ex: He remained fascinated by the Aboriginals' tales.
example.tran: 他一直对澳大利亚土著居民的传说极感兴趣。

sense.def: Aboriginal means belonging or relating to the Australian Aborigines.

example.ex: ...Aboriginal art.
example.tran: 澳大利亚土著艺术

example.ex: ...a protest over Aboriginal land rights.
example.tran: 为争取澳大利亚土著居民土地权的抗议

sense.def: The aboriginal people or animals of a place are ones that have been there from the earliest known times or that were there before people or animals from other countries arrived.

example.ex: Most Canadians acknowledge that the aboriginal people have had a rotten deal.
example.tran: 大多数加拿大人承认土著居民遭受了不公平的待遇。

sense.def: Aborigines are members of the tribes that were living in Australia when Europeans arrived there.
If an unborn baby is aborted, the pregnancy is ended deliberately and the baby is not born alive.

example.ex: Her lover walked out on her after she had aborted their child.
example.tran: 她的情人在她打掉胎儿后甩了她。

example.ex: ...the latest date at which a foetus can be aborted.
example.tran: 能够打胎的最迟日期

example.ex: ...tissue from aborted fetuses.
example.tran: 堕下的胎儿的组织

sense.def: If someone aborts a process, plan, or activity, they stop it before it has been completed.

example.ex: The decision was made to abort the mission...
example.tran: 决定中止这项任务。

example.ex: The take-off was aborted...
example.tran: 起飞取消了。

example.ex: A military guard was injured in the aborted coup.
example.tran: 一位哨兵在这次未遂政变中受伤。

sense.def: If a woman has an abortion, she ends her pregnancy deliberately so that the baby is not born alive.

example.ex: His girlfriend had an abortion.
example.tran: 他的女朋友做了流产。

example.ex: ...anti-abortion groups...
example.tran: 反堕胎团体

example.ex: He and his wife both strongly support abortion rights.
example.tran: 他和妻子都强烈支持堕胎权。

sense.def: An abortionist is someone who performs abortions, usually illegally.
sense.tran: （通常指非法）为他人实施人流手术的人，为人堕胎者

example.ex: She knew who to ask about finding an abortionist.
example.tran: 她知道向谁去打听找一个为人堕胎的。

sense.def: An abortive attempt or action is unsuccessful.
sense.tran: （尝试或行动）失败的，夭折的，无结果的

example.ex: ...an abortive attempt to prevent the current President from taking office.
example.tran: 企图阻止现任总统连任的失败尝试

sense.def: If things abound, or if a place abounds with things, there are very large numbers of them.

example.ex: Stories abound about when he was in charge...
example.tran: 关于他在任时的传闻多不胜数。

example.ex: Venice abounds in famous hotels...
example.tran: 威尼斯有许多知名的酒店。

example.ex: The book abounds with close-up images from space.
example.tran: 这本书里有大量拍自太空的特写照片。

boxx.note: In addition to the uses shown below, about is used after some verbs, nouns, and adjectives to introduce extra information. About is also often used after verbs of movement, such as ‘walk’ and ‘drive’, and in phrasal verbs such as ‘mess about’ and ‘set about’, especially in British English.
boxx.tran: 除下列用法外，about可用在一些动词、名词和形容词后引出附加信息。about还常用在walk, drive等表示动作的动词后或mess about，set about 等短语动词中，这类情况尤见于英国英语。

sense.def: You use about to introduce who or what something relates to or concerns.

example.ex: She came in for a coffee, and told me about her friend Shona...
example.tran: 她进来喝了杯咖啡，并向我谈起了她的朋友肖纳。

example.ex: She knew a lot about food...
example.tran: 她对食物很在行。

example.ex: He never complains about his wife.
example.tran: 他从不抱怨妻子。

example.ex: ...advice about exercise and diet...
example.tran: 关于锻炼和饮食的建议

sense.def: When you mention the things that an activity or institution is about, you are saying what it involves or what its aims are.

example.ex: Leadership is about the ability to implement change.
example.tran: 领导才能就是要有实施变革的能力。

sense.def: You use about after some adjectives to indicate the person or thing that a feeling or state of mind relates to.

example.ex: 'I'm sorry about Patrick,' she said...
example.tran: “我为帕特里克感到难过，”她说。

example.ex: I feel so guilty and angry about the whole issue.
example.tran: 我对整件事深感内疚和气愤。

sense.def: If you do something about a problem, you take action in order to solve it.

example.ex: Rachel was going to do something about Jacob...
example.tran: 蕾切尔将对雅各布有所行动。

example.ex: He said he'd ask Nina for a divorce, but he never did anything about it.
example.tran: 他说会跟尼娜提出离婚，可是他却从未付诸实际。

sense.def: When you say that there is a particular quality about someone or something, you mean that they have this quality.
sense.tran: （某人或某事物）具有（某种特性）

example.ex: There was a warmth and passion about him I never knew existed...
example.tran: 他身上有一股我从不知道的热情和激情。

example.ex: I think there's something a little peculiar about the results of your test.
example.tran: 我认为你的化验结果有点不对劲。

sense.def: About is used in front of a number to show that the number is not exact.

example.ex: In my local health centre there's about forty parking spaces...
example.tran: 我们本地的保健中心约有40个停车位。

example.ex: The rate of inflation is running at about 2.7 percent.
example.tran: 通货膨胀率大约为2.7%。

sense.def: If someone or something moves about, they keep moving in different directions.

example.ex: Everyone was running about.
example.tran: 大家都在跑来跑去。

example.ex: From 1879 to 1888 he wandered about Germany, Switzerland, and Italy...
example.tran: 从1879到1888年，他游历于德国、瑞士和意大利等地。

example.ex: His hair was drifting about his shoulders like dirty snow.
example.tran: 他的头发像脏兮兮的雪一样披散在肩上。

sense.def: If you put something about a person or thing, you put it around them.

example.ex: Helen threw her arms about him...
example.tran: 海伦张开双臂拥抱他。

example.ex: She was elegantly dressed with a double strand of pearls about her neck.
example.tran: 她着装典雅，搭配着一条双层珍珠项链。

sense.def: If someone or something is about, they are present or available.
sense.tran: 在手头的;现成的;能得到的

example.ex: There's lots of money about these days for schemes like this.
example.tran: 近来这类计划资金充足。

sense.def: If you are about to do something, you are going to do it very soon. If something is about to happen, it will happen very soon.

example.ex: I think he's about to leave...
example.tran: 我看他要走了。

example.ex: Argentina has lifted all restrictions on trade and visas are about to be abolished...
example.tran: 阿根廷已经取消所有贸易限制，签证制也将废止。

example.ex: The film was about to start.
example.tran: 电影快开场了。

boxu.usage: When you are talking about movement in no particular direction, you can use around and round as well as about. It's so romantic up there, flying around in a small plane... I spent a couple of hours driving round Richmond... Police constables walk about with guns on their hips. When you are talking about something being generally present or available, you can use around or about, but not round, as adverbs. There is a lot of talent around at the moment... There are not that many jobs about.Round has a lot of other meanings, as a noun, verb, and adjective which you can see at the entry for round. You cannot use about in these cases.
boxu.tran: 表示没有明确方向的移动，可用around, round 和about: It’s so romantic up there, flying around in a small plane（坐着小型飞机在空中翱翔真浪漫），I spent a couple of hours driving round Richmond（我花了几个小时驱车漫游里士满），Police constables walk about with guns on their hips.（警员们胯上别枪四处巡逻）。表示某物就在手头或能够获得，可用around或about作副词, 但不可用round: There is a lot of talent around at the moment（目前有大量现成人才），There are not that many jobs about（可供选择的工作并不多）。round 作名词、动词和形容词有许多其他意思，参见round词条；在这些情况下不可用around。

phrase.hdgr: usu PHR after v, also v-link PHR
phrase.def: If someone is out and about, they are going out and doing things, especially after they have been unable to for a while.
phrase.tran: （尤指一段时间无法自由行动后）四处走动，外出活动

example.ex: Despite considerable pain she has been getting out and about almost as normal...
example.tran: 尽管还很痛，她已经基本上行动如常。

example.ex: The regulations were relaxed and the prisoners could get out and about a bit.
example.tran: 规定有所放宽，犯人可以出去短暂放风。

phrase.hdgr: usu PHR after v, also v-link PHR
phrase.def: If someone is out and about, they are going to a lot of different places, often as part of their job.

example.ex: They often saw me out and about.
example.tran: 他们经常看见我四处奔波。

sense.def: An about-face is a complete change of attitude or opinion.
sense.tran: （态度或观点的）彻底改变，大转变

example.ex: Few observers believe the president will do an about-face and start spending more.
example.tran: 没有几个观察家认为总统会彻底改变态度而增加开支。

sense.def: An about-turn is the same as an about-face .

example.ex: The decision was seen as an about-turn for the Government.
example.tran: 这项决定被视为政府态度的180度大转变。

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 about-face

sense.def: If one thing is above another one, it is directly over it or higher than it.

example.ex: He lifted his hands above his head...
example.tran: 他将双手举过头顶。

example.ex: Apartment 46 was a quiet apartment, unlike the one above it...
example.tran: 和它楼上的那间不同，46号公寓很安静。

example.ex: He was staring into the mirror above him.
example.tran: 他盯着在他上方的镜子。

example.ex: A long scream sounded from somewhere above.
example.tran: 从上面什么地方传来一声长长的尖叫。

example.ex: ...a picture of the new plane as seen from above...
example.tran: 这架新飞机的俯视图

example.ex: There are five bedrooms, a large attic above, and wine cellars below.
example.tran: 有5间卧室，顶层是一个宽敞的阁楼，底下是酒窖。

sense.def: In writing, you use above to refer to something that has already been mentioned or discussed.

example.ex: Several conclusions could be drawn from the results described above...
example.tran: 从上文描述的结果中可以得出几个结论。

example.ex: Full details are in the table above.
example.tran: 详细信息请见上文表格。

example.ex: For additional information, contact any of the above.
example.tran: 如需更多信息，可与以上任何一处联系。

example.ex: For a copy of their brochure, write to the above address.
example.tran: 欲索取其宣传册，请写信至以上地址。

sense.def: If an amount or measurement is above a particular level, it is greater than that level.

example.ex: The temperature crept up to just above 40 degrees...
example.tran: 温度攀升至40度出头。

example.ex: Victoria Falls has had above average levels of rainfall this year...
example.tran: 维多利亚瀑布今年的降雨量超过了平均水平。

example.ex: These plants must be stored in the light at above freezing temperature...
example.tran: 这些植物必须放置于零度以上光照充足的地方。

example.ex: Government spending is planned to rise 3 per cent above inflation.
example.tran: 政府开支拟订高出通货膨胀3个百分点。

example.ex: Banks have been charging 25 percent and above for unsecured loans.
example.tran: 银行对于没有担保的贷款一直收取25%或更高的费用。

sense.def: If you hear one sound above another, it is louder or clearer than the second one.

example.ex: ...trying to talk above the noise...
example.tran: 努力使说话声高过噪音

example.ex: Then there was a woman's voice, rising shrilly above the barking.
example.tran: 接着，一个女人的尖厉声音盖过了犬吠声。

sense.def: If someone is above you, they are in a higher social position than you or in a position of authority over you.

example.ex: I know you're above me socially, but I must say I find your attitude offensive...
example.tran: 我明白你的社会地位比我高，但我得说我觉得你的态度很粗鲁。

example.ex: I married above myself — rich county people...
example.tran: 我高攀了一门亲事，是县里的富有人家。

example.ex: Look at the people above you in the positions of power and see what type of characters they are.
example.tran: 审视一下权位高于你的那些人，看他们具有哪种类型的性格。

example.ex: The policemen admitted beating the student, but said they were acting on orders from above.
example.tran: 警察承认打过这名学生，但说他们只是奉命行事。

sense.def: If you say that someone is getting above themself, you disapprove of them because they think they are better than everyone else.

example.ex: I just think you're getting a little bit above yourself.
example.tran: 我只是觉得你变得有点自视过高。

sense.def: If you say that someone thinks they are above something, you mean that they act as if they are too good or important for it.

example.ex: This was clearly a failure by someone who thought he was above failure...
example.tran: 这显然是认为自己根本不会失败的人所遭遇的一次失败。

example.ex: I'm not above doing my own cleaning.
example.tran: 我很乐意自己做扫除。

sense.def: If someone is above criticism or suspicion, they cannot be criticized or suspected because of their good qualities or their position.
sense.tran: 不会受到（批评或怀疑）；超乎…之所及

example.ex: The Queen remains above criticism, apart from the issue of her tax liability...
example.tran: 抛开她的纳税义务不谈，女王一直无可指摘。

example.ex: He was a respected academic and above suspicion.
example.tran: 他是位受人尊敬的学者，根本没有嫌疑。

sense.def: If you value one person or thing above any other, you value them more or consider that they are more important.

example.ex: ...his tendency to put the team above everything...
example.tran: 他把这个团队看得比什么都重要的倾向

example.ex: I want to be honest, honest above everything else.
example.tran: 我想要做到诚实，一切以诚实为上。

boxu.usage: Above and over are both used to talk about position and height. If something is higher than something else and the two things are imagined as being positioned along a vertical line, you can use either above or over. He opened a cupboard above the sink... She leaned forward until her face was over the basin. However, if something is higher than something else but the two things are regarded as being wide or horizontal rather than tall or vertical, you have to use above. The trees rose above the row of houses. Above and over are both used to talk about measurements, for example, when you are talking about a point that is higher than another point on a scale. Any money earned over that level is taxed. ...everybody above five feet eight inches in height. You use over to say that a distance or period of time is longer than the one mentioned. ...a height of over twelve thousand feet... Our relationship lasted for over a year. Above and over are also both used to talk about people's rank or importance. You use above to talk about people who are more important and in a higher position than other people. ...behaving as if she was in a position above the other staff. If someone is over you, they give orders or instructions to you. ...an officer in authority over him.
boxu.tran: above和over均可表示位置和高度。若一物高于另一物，且两者可设想成处于同一垂直线上，则两词都可用：He opened a cupboard above the sink（他打开水池上方的碗柜），She leaned forward until her face was over the basin（她俯身向前，把脸凑到了脸盆上方）。当一物高于另一物，但两者宽而不高，或存在水平而非垂直关系，则须用above：The trees rose above the row of houses（树木矗立在那排房屋的边上）。above和over都可表示度量，例如表示一点在标度上高于另一点：Any money earned over that level is taxed（超过这一标准的收入都要纳税），everybody above five feet eight inches in height（所有身高超过5英尺8英寸的人）。over可用于距离、时间的比较：a height of over twelve thousand feet（超过1.2万英尺的高度），Our relationship lasted for over a year（我们的关系持续了一年多）。above和over都可指人的级别和重要性。above用于表示比他人重要和地位较高者：behaving as if she was in a position above the other staff（表现得好像她比其他员工职位高似的）。over用于表示某人有权下命令或指令：an officer in authority over him（一位军阶在他之上的军官）。

sense.def: Above-the-line promotion is the use of promotional methods that cannot be directly controlled by the company selling the goods or service, such as television or press advertising.
sense.tran: 大众传媒促销（不受产品或服务提供商直接控制的促销手段，如电视或报刊广告）

example.ex: For all maternity clothing retailers, most above-the-line promotion is conducted through focused sources such as mother and baby magazines.
example.tran: 对于所有销售孕妇装的零售商来说，大多数的大众传媒促销都是通过母婴杂志等有具体受众的渠道进行的。

sense.def: Abracadabra is a word that someone says when they are performing a magic trick in order to make the magic happen.
To abrade something means to scrape or wear down its surface by rubbing it.

example.ex: My skin was abraded and very tender.
example.tran: 我擦破皮了，一碰就疼。

sense.def: An abrasion is an area on a person's body where the skin has been scraped.

example.ex: He had severe abrasions to his right cheek.
example.tran: 他的右脸颊有严重的擦伤。

sense.def: Someone who has an abrasive manner is unkind and rude.

example.ex: His abrasive manner has won him an unenviable notoriety...
example.tran: 他生硬粗暴的态度让他声名狼藉。

example.ex: Pamela was unrepentant about her strong language and abrasive remarks.
example.tran: 对于自己的激烈言辞和恶语相向，帕梅拉并无悔意。

sense.def: An abrasive substance is rough and can be used to clean hard surfaces.
sense.tran: 粗糙可用于擦洗的;有研磨作用的

example.ex: ...a new all-purpose, non-abrasive cleaner.
example.tran: 多用途的非磨砂性新型清洁剂

sense.def: An abrasive is a substance that is rough and can be used to clean hard surfaces.

example.ex: Avoid abrasives, which can damage the tiles.
example.tran: 避免使用磨蚀剂，以免损坏瓷砖。

sense.def: If people or things walk or move abreast, they are next to each other, side by side, and facing in the same direction.

example.ex: The steep pavement was too narrow for them to walk abreast.
example.tran: 陡坡太窄，他们没法并排走。

example.ex: ...a group of youths riding their motorbikes four abreast.
example.tran: 驾着摩托车，四个一排齐头并进的一群年轻人

phrase.def: If you are abreast of someone or something, you are level with them or in line with them.

example.ex: As he drew abreast of the man he pretended to stumble.
example.tran: 当他赶上那个男人时，他装出了要跌倒的样子。

phrase.def: If you keep abreast of a subject, you know all the most recent facts about it.

example.ex: He will be keeping abreast of the news...
example.tran: 他将时刻关注最新消息。

example.ex: We'll keep you abreast of developments.
example.tran: 我们会随时告知你最新进展。

sense.def: An abridged book or play has been made shorter by removing some parts of it.

example.ex: This is an abridged version of her new novel 'The Queen and I'.
example.tran: 这是她的新小说《我与女王》的删节本。

sense.hdgr:
ADV after v, n ADV,
be ADV,
from ADV
sense.def: If you go abroad, you go to a foreign country, usually one which is separated from the country where you live by an ocean or a sea.

example.ex: I would love to go abroad this year, perhaps to the South of France.
example.tran: 我今年很想出国，可能是去法国南部。

example.ex: ...public opposition here and abroad...
example.tran: 国内外公众的反对

example.ex: He will stand in for Mr Goh when he is abroad...
example.tran: 吴先生出国时由他代替。

example.ex: About 65 per cent of its sales come from abroad.
example.tran: 大约65%的销量来自国外。

sense.def: If there is a story or feeling abroad, people generally know about it or feel it.
sense.tran: 在四下流传;广为流传地

example.ex: There'll still be a feeling abroad that this change has to be recognised.
example.tran: 人们还会普遍觉得这项变革早晚得接受。

sense.def: If someone in a position of authority abrogates something such as a law, agreement, or practice, they put an end to it.
sense.tran: 废除，取消（法令、协议、习俗等）

example.ex: The next prime minister could abrogate the treaty.
example.tran: 下一任首相可能会废除这个条约。

example.ex: ...a dereliction of duty and an abrogation of responsibility.
example.tran: 失职和解职

sense.def: An abrupt change or action is very sudden, often in a way which is unpleasant.
sense.tran: 突然的，意外的（常指令人不快的改变或行为）

example.ex: Rosie's idyllic world came to an abrupt end when her parents' marriage broke up...
example.tran: 父母婚姻的破裂使得罗茜田园诗般美好的世界陡然画上了句号。

example.ex: The recession brought an abrupt halt to this happiness...
example.tran: 经济衰退让这幸福戛然而止。

example.ex: His abrupt departure is bound to raise questions.
example.tran: 他的拂袖而去必然会招来很多疑问。

example.ex: He stopped abruptly and looked my way.
example.tran: 他突然停下，朝我看过来。

sense.def: Someone who is abrupt speaks in a rather rude, unfriendly way.

example.ex: He was abrupt to the point of rudeness...
example.tran: 他的唐突已到了无礼的地步。

example.ex: Cross was a little taken aback by her abrupt manner.
example.tran: 她鲁莽的态度让克罗斯感到有点吃惊。

example.ex: 'Good night, then,' she said abruptly.
example.tran: “那么，晚安，”她生硬地说道。

example.ex: I think Simon was hurt by your abruptness this afternoon.
example.tran: 我觉得你下午的粗鲁行为对西蒙造成了伤害。

sense.def: Abs are the same as abdominals .

example.ex: Throughout the exercise, focus on keeping your abs tight.
example.tran: 整个锻炼过程中，注意要紧绷腹肌。

sense.def: An abscess is a painful swelling containing pus.
If someone absconds from somewhere such as a prison, they escape from it or leave it without permission.

example.ex: He was ordered to appear the following day, but absconded...
example.tran: 他被传唤于第二天出庭，可是他逃跑了。

example.ex: A dozen inmates have absconded from Forest Jail in the past year.
example.tran: 去年共有12名犯人从福雷斯特监狱逃脱。

sense.def: If someone absconds with something, they leave and take it with them, although it does not belong to them.

example.ex: Unfortunately, his partners were crooks and absconded with the funds.
example.tran: 不幸的是，他的合伙人都是些骗子，已卷款逃之夭夭了。

sense.def: To abseil down a cliff or rock face means to slide down it in a controlled way using a rope, with your feet against the cliff or rock.
sense.tran: 缘绳索滑下（峭壁、崖面等）；绕绳下降

example.ex: The man and his son Mark had abseiled down the sheer cliffs.
example.tran: 这个男人和他的儿子马克曾沿绳索爬下过这些陡峭的悬崖。

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 rappel

sense.def: Someone's absence from a place is the fact that they are not there.

example.ex: ...a bundle of letters which had arrived for me in my absence...
example.tran: 我不在期间寄给我的一大堆信件

example.ex: Eleanor would later blame her mother-in-law for her husband's frequent absences.
example.tran: 埃莉诺过后会因丈夫经常不在家而责怪婆婆。

sense.def: The absence of something from a place is the fact that it is not there or does not exist.

example.ex: The presence or absence of clouds can have an important impact on heat transfer...
example.tran: 有无云层对热量的传递会产生重要的影响。

example.ex: In the absence of a will the courts decide who the guardian is.
example.tran: 在没有遗嘱的情况下，由法庭指定监护人。

entry.boxr: The adjective and preposition are pronounced /'æbsənt/. The verb is pronounced /æb'sent/. 形容词和介词读作 /'æbsənt/。动词读作 /æb'sent/。

sense.hdgr:
usu v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
from n
sense.def: If someone or something is absent from a place or situation where they should be or where they usually are, they are not there.

example.ex: He has been absent from his desk for two weeks...
example.tran: 他已经有两个星期没有坐在办公桌前了。

example.ex: The pictures, too, were absent from the walls...
example.tran: 那些画也不在墙上了。

example.ex: Any soldier failing to report would be considered absent without leave and punished accordingly.
example.tran: 士兵若未报到将被视为擅离职守而受处分。

sense.def: If someone appears absent, they are not paying attention because they are thinking about something else.

example.ex: 'Nothing,' Rosie said in an absent way.
example.tran: “没什么，”罗茜心不在焉地说。

example.ex: He nodded absently.
example.tran: 他漫不经心地点了点头。

sense.def: An absent parent does not live with his or her children.

example.ex: ...absent fathers who fail to pay towards the costs of looking after their children.
example.tran: 那些不在子女身边、未能支付抚养费的父亲

sense.def: If someone absents themselves from a place where they should be or where they usually are, they do not go there or they do not stay there.
sense.tran: 使不在，使离开（本应在或通常在的地方）

example.ex: She was old enough to absent herself from the lunch table if she chose...
example.tran: 她长大了，可以自己做主不来吃午餐了。

example.ex: He pleaded guilty before a court martial to absenting himself without leave.
example.tran: 在军事法庭上他对自己擅离职守表示服罪。

sense.def: If you say that absent one thing, another thing will happen, you mean that if the first thing does not happen, the second thing will happen.

example.ex: Absent a solution, people like Sue Godfrey will just keep on fighting.
example.tran: 假如得不到解决，像休·戈弗雷这样的人就会一直坚持斗争下去。

sense.def: An absentee is a person who is expected to be in a particular place but who is not there.
sense.tran: （应到而未到的）不在者，缺席者

sense.def: Absentee is used to describe someone who is not there to do a particular job in person.

example.ex: Absentee fathers will be forced to pay child maintenance.
example.tran: 缺席的父亲将会被强制要求支付孩子的抚养费。

example.ex: ...an absentee landlord.
example.tran: 在外业主

sense.def: In elections in the United States, if you vote by absentee ballot or if you are an absentee voter, you vote in advance because you will be away.
sense.tran: 缺席的（指美国因故预先投票的选票或选民）

example.ex: He has already voted by absentee ballot...
example.tran: 他已进行了缺席投票。

example.ex: The deadline for absentee voting in was Saturday.
example.tran: 缺席投票的最后期限是星期六。

sense.def: Absenteeism is the fact or habit of frequently being away from work or school, usually without a good reason.
sense.tran: （通常指无正当理由、经常性的）旷工，旷课

example.ex: ...the high rate of absenteeism.
example.tran: 高旷课率

sense.def: If something is done to you in absentia, it is done to you when you are not present.

example.ex: He was tried in absentia and sentenced to seven years in prison.
example.tran: 他被缺席判处七年监禁。

sense.def: Someone who is absent-minded forgets things or does not pay attention to what they are doing, often because they are thinking about something else.
sense.tran: 漫不经心的;心不在焉的;健忘的

example.ex: In his later life he became even more absent-minded.
example.tran: 他晚年变得愈加健忘了。

example.ex: Elizabeth absent-mindedly picked a thread from his lapel.
example.tran: 伊丽莎白随手从他的翻领上揪下一根线头。

example.ex: You will have to put up with Grace's absent-mindedness.
example.tran: 你须得忍受格蕾丝心不在焉的作风。

sense.def: Absinthe is a very strong alcoholic drink that is green and tastes bitter.
sense.tran: 苦艾酒（一种烈酒，色绿味苦）

sense.def: Absolute means total and complete.

example.ex: It's not really suited to absolute beginners...
example.tran: 它并不真正适合从零开始的初学者。

example.ex: A sick person needs absolute confidence and trust in a doctor.
example.tran: 病人需要对医生有绝对的信心和信任。

sense.def: You use absolute to emphasize something that you are saying.

example.ex: About 12 inches wide is the absolute minimum you should consider...
example.tran: 12英寸左右的宽度绝对是你应考虑的最低值。

example.ex: I think it's absolute nonsense.
example.tran: 我认为那十足是无稽之谈。

sense.def: An absolute ruler has complete power and authority over his or her country.
sense.tran: 专制独裁的；有无上权力的

example.ex: He ruled with absolute power.
example.tran: 他实行独裁统治。

example.ex: ...the doctrine of absolute monarchy based upon divine right.
example.tran: 以神权为基础的君主专制学说

sense.def: Absolute is used to say that something is definite and will not change even if circumstances change.

example.ex: John brought the absolute proof that we needed...
example.tran: 约翰带来了我们所需的确凿证据。

example.ex: They had given an absolute assurance that it would be kept secret.
example.tran: 他们信誓旦旦地保证将对此绝对保密。

sense.def: An amount that is expressed in absolute terms is expressed as a fixed amount rather than referring to variable factors such as what you earn or the effects of inflation.
sense.tran: （数值）不受变量影响的，绝对的

example.ex: In absolute terms British wages remain low by European standards.
example.tran: 根据欧洲标准，英国工资的绝对值依然很低。

sense.def: Absolute rules and principles are believed to be true, right, or relevant in all situations.

example.ex: There are no absolute rules.
example.tran: 世事无绝对。

example.ex: ...certain assumptions which are accepted without question as absolute truths.
example.tran: 某些未经质疑就被作为绝对真理而全盘接受的假设

sense.def: An absolute is a rule or principle that is believed to be true, right, or relevant in all situations.

example.ex: We tend to think in absolutes.
example.tran: 我们思考问题倾向于绝对化。

sense.hdgr: usu ADV adj/adv, also ADV with v
sense.def: Absolutely means totally and completely.

example.ex: Jill is absolutely right...
example.tran: 吉尔完全正确。

example.ex: I absolutely refuse to get married...
example.tran: 我决不结婚。

example.ex: There is absolutely no difference!
example.tran: 这绝对没有任何不同！

sense.def: Some people say absolutely as an emphatic way of saying yes or of agreeing with someone. They say absolutely not as an emphatic way of saying no or of disagreeing with someone.

example.ex: 'It's worrying, isn't it?' – 'Absolutely.'...
example.tran: “这让人担忧，不是吗？”——“确实是。”

example.ex: 'Did they approach you?' – 'No, absolutely not.'
example.tran: “他们找过你了吗？”——“没有，绝对没有。”

sense.def: If a political party wins an absolute majority, they obtain more seats or votes than the total number of seats or votes gained by their opponents in an election.
Absolute zero is a theoretical temperature that is thought to be the lowest possible temperature.
If someone is given absolution, they are forgiven for something wrong that they have done.

example.ex: She felt as if his words had granted her absolution.
example.tran: 她感觉他的那番话好似给她下了道赦令。

sense.def: Absolutism is a political system in which one ruler or leader has complete power and authority over a country.

example.ex: ...royal absolutism.
example.tran: 王权专制

sense.def: You can refer to someone's beliefs as absolutism if they think that their beliefs are true, right, or relevant in all situations, especially if you think they are wrong to behave in this way.
sense.tran: （尤指被认为错误的）绝对主义，绝对论

example.ex: They are saying, with varying degrees of absolutism, that animals should not be exploited at all.
example.tran: 他们都多多少少带有些绝对地说动物根本不该被拿来利用。

example.ex: This absolutist belief is replaced by an appreciation that rules can vary.
example.tran: 这种绝对主义的信念被规则可以变通这一认识所替代。

sense.def: If a report or investigation absolves someone from blame or responsibility, it formally states that he or she is not guilty or is not to blame.
sense.tran: 免除…的过失;解除…的责任

example.ex: A police investigation yesterday absolved the police of all blame in the incident.
example.tran: 警方昨天的调查廓清了其在此事件中的任何责任。

example.ex: ...the inquiry which absolved the soldiers.
example.tran: 宣告士兵们并无任何过失的调查

sense.def: If something absorbs a liquid, gas, or other substance, it soaks it up or takes it in.

example.ex: Plants absorb carbon dioxide from the air and moisture from the soil...
example.tran: 植物从空气中吸收二氧化碳并从土壤中汲取水分。

example.ex: Refined sugars are absorbed into the bloodstream very quickly.
example.tran: 精制糖迅速吸收进血液中。

sense.def: If something absorbs light, heat, or another form of energy, it takes it in.

example.ex: A household radiator absorbs energy in the form of electric current and releases it in the form of heat.
example.tran: 家用取暖器吸收电流能量，再以热量的形式释放出来。

sense.def: If a group is absorbed into a larger group, it becomes part of the larger group.

example.ex: The Colonial Office was absorbed into the Foreign Office.
example.tran: 殖民部被并入了外交部。

example.ex: ...an economy capable of absorbing thousands of immigrants.
example.tran: 能够吸纳数千移民的经济实体

sense.def: If something absorbs a force or shock, it reduces its effect.

example.ex: ...footwear which does not absorb the impact of the foot striking the ground.
example.tran: 不具备减震功能的鞋子

sense.def: If a system or society absorbs changes, effects, or costs, it is able to deal with them.
sense.tran: 经受，承受（变革、影响等）；承担（费用等）

example.ex: The banks would be forced to absorb large losses...
example.tran: 银行将被迫承受巨大的损失。

example.ex: We can't absorb those costs.
example.tran: 我们负担不起那些费用。

sense.def: If something absorbs something valuable such as money, space, or time, it uses up a great deal of it.
sense.tran: 用掉，花掉（大量金钱）；占去（空间、时间）

example.ex: It absorbed vast amounts of capital that could have been used for investment...
example.tran: 它消耗掉了原本可用于投资的大笔资金。

example.ex: It might help if campaigning didn't absorb so much time and money.
example.tran: 如果竞选活动没耗费这么多的时间和金钱，情况或许还不会这么糟。

sense.def: If you absorb information, you learn and understand it.

example.ex: Too often he only absorbs half the information in the manual...
example.tran: 他对于说明书上所说的经常是一知半解。

example.ex: We closed our offices at 2:00 p.m. to give employees time to absorb the bad news.
example.tran: 我们下午两点就放工了，以便给员工时间来慢慢接受这一坏消息。

sense.def: If something absorbs you, it interests you a great deal and takes up all your attention and energy.
sense.tran: 吸引…的注意；使全神贯注

example.ex: ...a second career which absorbed her more completely than her acting ever had.
example.tran: 比演艺生涯更让她投入的又一职业

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, usu ADJ
in/by n
sense.def: If you are absorbed in something or someone, you are very interested in them and they take up all your attention and energy.
sense.tran: 极感兴趣的；专心的；全神贯注的

example.ex: They were completely absorbed in each other...
example.tran: 两人彼此倾心。

example.ex: He had discovered politics and was rapidly becoming absorbed by it...
example.tran: 他接触到了政治并且迅速地对它着了迷。

example.ex: I get so absorbed in doing something that I am unaware of things happening round me.
example.tran: 我做事太过专心以致于对周围发生的事情丝毫未察觉。

sense.def: Absorbent material soaks up liquid easily.

example.ex: The towels are highly absorbent.
example.tran: 这些毛巾很吸水。

example.ex: You can use two nappies for extra absorbency at night.
example.tran: 夜间可以用两块尿布来增强吸水性。

sense.def: An absorbing task or activity interests you a great deal and takes up all your attention and energy.
sense.tran: 非常有趣的；引人入胜的

example.ex: 'Two Sisters' is an absorbing read...
example.tran: 《姊妹花》的故事情节引人入胜。

example.ex: Children will find other exhibits equally absorbing.
example.tran: 孩子们会对其他展品一样感兴趣。

sense.def: The absorption of a liquid, gas, or other substance is the process of it being soaked up or taken in.

example.ex: This controls the absorption of liquids...
example.tran: 这控制着液体的吸收。

example.ex: Vitamin C increases the absorption of iron from food.
example.tran: 维生素C促进食物中铁的吸收。

sense.hdgr:
usu with poss, oft N
into/by n
sense.def: The absorption of a group into a larger group is the process of it becoming part of the larger group.

example.ex: Two new camps were readied for the absorption of refugees.
example.tran: 为收容难民又备好了两个新营地。

sense.def: Someone's absorption in something is the fact that they are very interested in it and that it takes up all their attention and energy.

example.ex: He was struck by the artists' total absorption in their work.
example.tran: 他被艺术家对创作的全身心投入所打动。

sense.def: If you abstain from something, usually something you want to do, you deliberately do not do it.

example.ex: Abstain from sex or use condoms...
example.tran: 禁绝性事或使用安全套。

example.ex: Do you drink alcohol, smoke, or abstain?
example.tran: 你喝酒抽烟吗，还是烟酒不沾？

sense.def: If you abstain during a vote, you do not use your vote.

example.ex: Three Conservative MPs abstained in the vote.
example.tran: 三位保守党下院议员投了弃权票。

sense.def: Someone who is abstemious avoids doing too much of something enjoyable such as eating or drinking.
Abstention is a formal act of not voting either for or against a proposal.

example.ex: ...a vote of sixteen in favor, three against, and one abstention...
example.tran: 16票赞成、3票反对、1票弃权

example.ex: The number of abstentions is likely to be crucial...
example.tran: 弃权票数很可能起决定性作用。

example.ex: Abstention is traditionally high in Colombia.
example.tran: 在哥伦比亚,弃权率历来较高。

sense.def: Abstention is the same as abstinence.

example.ex: The goal is complete abstention from all mind-altering substances.
example.tran: 目标是彻底戒绝所有致幻物质。

sense.def: Abstinence is the practice of abstaining from something such as alcoholic drink or sex, often for health or religious reasons.

example.ex: ...six months of abstinence.
example.tran: 禁欲6个月

example.ex: ...total abstinence from alcohol.
example.tran: 彻底戒酒

entry.boxr: The adjective and noun are pronounced /'æbstrækt/. The verb is pronounced /æb'strækt/. 形容词和名词读作 /'æbstrækt/。动词读作 /æb'strækt/。

sense.def: An abstract idea or way of thinking is based on general ideas rather than on real things and events.

example.ex: ...abstract principles such as justice...
example.tran: 正义等抽象原则

example.ex: It's not a question of some abstract concept.
example.tran: 这不是某个抽象概念的问题。

example.ex: ...the faculty of abstract reasoning.
example.tran: 抽象推理的能力

example.ex: It is hard to think abstractly in these conditions.
example.tran: 在这样的情况下进行抽象思维很困难。

sense.def: When you talk or think about something in the abstract, you talk or think about it in a general way, rather than considering particular things or events.

example.ex: Money was a commodity she never thought about except in the abstract.
example.tran: 钱对她来说就是个抽象的东西，她从不去想钱。

sense.def: In grammar, an abstract noun refers to a quality or idea rather than to a physical object.
sense.tran: （名词)抽象的，表示抽象概念的

example.ex: ...abstract words such as glory, honor, and courage.
example.tran: 抽象名词，如光荣、荣耀和勇气

sense.def: Abstract art makes use of shapes and patterns rather than showing people or things.

example.ex: ...a modern abstract painting.
example.tran: 一幅现代派抽象画

sense.def: An abstract is an abstract work of art.
An abstract of an article, document, or speech is a short piece of writing that gives the main points of it.
If you abstract something from a place, you take it from there.

example.ex: ...a licence to abstract water from the River Axe...
example.tran: 从阿克斯河中抽水的许可证

example.ex: The author has abstracted poems from earlier books.
example.tran: 作者从以前的书中摘取了一些诗作。

sense.def: Someone who is abstracted is thinking so deeply that they are not fully aware of what is happening around them.

example.ex: Meg was so abstracted she scarcely noticed that the train had stopped...
example.tran: 梅格想得出了神，几乎没有注意到火车已经停了。

example.ex: The same abstracted look was still on his face.
example.tran: 他仍是一脸恍惚。

example.ex: She nodded abstractedly.
example.tran: 她若有所思地点点头。

sense.def: An abstraction is a general idea rather than one relating to a particular object, person, or situation.

example.ex: Is it worth fighting a big war, in the name of an abstraction like sovereignty?
example.tran: 在主权之类抽象概念的名义下打一场大战是否值得呢？

sense.def: Abstraction is the state of being very deep in thought.

example.ex: Andrew noticed her abstraction and asked, 'What's bothering you?'
example.tran: 安德鲁注意到她在愣神，便问道：“你怎么啦？”

sense.def: Abstraction is the use of shapes and patterns in art.
You can describe something as abstruse if you find it difficult to understand, especially when you think it could be explained more simply.

example.ex: ...fruitless discussions about abstruse resolutions.
example.tran: 对于令人费解的决议案毫无成果的讨论

sense.def: If you say that something is absurd, you are criticizing it because you think that it is ridiculous or that it does not make sense.
sense.tran: 荒谬的；荒唐的；不合理的

example.ex: It is absurd to be discussing compulsory redundancy policies for teachers...
example.tran: 讨论针对教师的强制裁员政策真是滑稽可笑。

example.ex: I've known clients of mine go to absurd lengths, just to avoid paying me a few pounds...
example.tran: 我知道我的一些客户就为了少付我几英镑，可谓无所不用其极。

example.ex: That's absurd.
example.tran: 那非常荒谬。

posc.def: The absurd is something that is absurd.
posc.tran: 荒诞的事物;悖理的东西

example.ex: Parkinson had a sharp eye for the absurd.
example.tran: 帕金森对于荒诞不经的事一眼即明。

example.ex: Prices were still absurdly low, in his opinion...
example.tran: 在他看来，价格依然低得离谱。

example.ex: Absurdly, it makes shoppers overpay farmers to grow too much food.
example.tran: 荒谬的是，这样会使得购物者支付过多的钱让农民去种太多的粮食。

example.ex: I find myself growing increasingly angry at the absurdity of the situation.
example.tran: 对如此荒谬可笑的情况我感到越来越生气。

example.ex: ...the absurdities of fashionable childcare methods.
example.tran: 时下流行的滑稽可笑的育婴法

sense.def: An absurdist play or other work shows how absurd some aspect of society or human behaviour is.

example.ex: ...'La Peste', the last volume in the absurdist trilogy.
example.tran: 《鼠疫》，荒诞三部曲的最后一部

sense.hdgr:
usu N
of n, also
in N
sense.def: An abundance of something is a large quantity of it.

example.ex: The area has an abundance of wildlife...
example.tran: 这片地区有丰富的野生动植物。

example.ex: Food was in abundance.
example.tran: 食品充足。

sense.def: Something that is abundant is present in large quantities.

example.ex: There is an abundant supply of cheap labour...
example.tran: 廉价劳动力供应充足。

example.ex: Birds are abundant in the tall vegetation.
example.tran: 高大的植被中有着大量的鸟类。

sense.def: If something is abundantly clear, it is extremely obvious.

example.ex: He made it abundantly clear that anybody who disagrees with his policies will not last long.
example.tran: 他非常明确地表示任何不同意他政策的人都坚持不了多久。

sense.hdgr: usu ADV with v, also ADV adj
sense.def: Something that occurs abundantly is present in large quantities.

example.ex: ...a plant that grows abundantly in the United States...
example.tran: 在美国大量生长的一种植物

example.ex: All the pages are abundantly illustrated with colour photographs.
example.tran: 每页都配有丰富的彩色照片。

entry.boxr: The noun is pronounced /ə'bjuːs/. The verb is pronounced /ə'bjuːz/. 名词读作 /ə'bjuːs/。动词读作 /ə'bjuːz/。

sense.hdgr: also N in pl, usu with supp
sense.def: Abuse of someone is cruel and violent treatment of them.

example.ex: ...investigation of alleged child abuse.
example.tran: 对涉嫌虐童案的调查

example.ex: ...victims of sexual and physical abuse.
example.tran: 遭受性虐待及肉体摧残的受害者

example.ex: ...controversy over human rights abuses.
example.tran: 关于践踏人权的争议

sense.def: Abuse is extremely rude and insulting things that people say when they are angry.

example.ex: I was left shouting abuse as the car sped off...
example.tran: 汽车飞驰而去，留下我在那里大声咒骂。

example.ex: Raft repeatedly hurled verbal abuse at his co-star.
example.tran: 拉夫特不断地破口大骂和他联合主演的演员。

sense.def: Abuse of something is the use of it in a wrong way or for a bad purpose.

example.ex: What went on here was an abuse of power.
example.tran: 这里所发生的事是一种滥用职权的行为。

example.ex: ...drug and alcohol abuse.
example.tran: 嗜毒和酗酒

sense.def: If someone is abused, they are treated cruelly and violently.

example.ex: Janet had been abused by her father since she was eleven.
example.tran: 珍妮特从11岁起就遭受父亲虐待。

example.ex: ...parents who feel they cannot cope or might abuse their children.
example.tran: 认为自己应付不来或可能会虐待孩子的父母

example.ex: ...those who work with abused children.
example.tran: 从事帮助受虐儿童的工作的人们

example.ex: ...a convicted child abuser.
example.tran: 已定罪的虐童犯

sense.def: You can say that someone is abused if extremely rude and insulting things are said to them.

example.ex: He alleged that he was verbally abused by other soldiers.
example.tran: 他宣称自己遭到其他士兵的辱骂。

sense.def: If you abuse something, you use it in a wrong way or for a bad purpose.

example.ex: He showed how the rich and powerful can abuse their position.
example.tran: 他让我们看到有钱有势的人是如何滥用其地位的。

example.ex: ...the treatment of alcohol and drug abusers.
example.tran: 对酗酒和嗜毒者的治疗

sense.def: Someone who is abusive behaves in a cruel and violent way towards other people.

example.ex: He became violent and abusive toward Ben's mother...
example.tran: 他对本的妈妈动起粗来。

example.ex: One in eight women lives in an abusive relationship.
example.tran: 每八位女性中就有一位遭受伴侣的虐待。

example.ex: ...her cruel and abusive husband...
example.tran: 她残酷暴虐的丈夫

sense.def: Abusive language is extremely rude and insulting.

example.ex: He was alleged to have used abusive language.
example.tran: 他被指称使用过侮辱性语言。

sense.def: When land or a building abuts something or abuts on something, it is next to it.

example.ex: One edge of the garden abutted on an old entrance to the mine...
example.tran: 花园的一侧紧靠着矿井的旧入口。

example.ex: He was born in 1768 in the house abutting our hotel.
example.tran: 他于1768年出生于我们旅馆旁边的一幢房子里。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, usu ADJ
with n
sense.def: If someone says that a place is abuzz with rumours or plans, they mean that everyone there is excited about them.
sense.tran: 议论纷纷的;嘈杂的;闹哄哄的

example.ex: Washington has been abuzz with stories about disarray inside the White House.
example.tran: 整个华盛顿都对白宫内发生的混乱议论纷纷。

sense.def: If you describe a situation or the condition of something as abysmal, you think that it is very bad or poor in quality.

example.ex: ...our abysmal record at producing a scientifically trained workforce...
example.tran: 我们在培育具有科学素养的专业人才方面惨不忍睹的记录

example.ex: The general standard of racing was abysmal.
example.tran: 竞赛总体水平极糟。

example.ex: The standard of education was abysmally low...
example.tran: 教育水平极低。

example.ex: As the chart shows, it has failed abysmally.
example.tran: 如图表所示，它一败涂地。

sense.def: An abyss is a very deep hole in the ground.
If someone is on the edge or brink of an abyss, they are about to enter into a very frightening or threatening situation.

example.ex: He felt he was on the edge of an abyss; one false move and he was done for...
example.tran: 他觉得如临深渊，一步不慎便会永劫不复。

example.ex: The country was on the brink of an abyss.
example.tran: 国家岌岌可危。

sense.def: A very great difference between two people, things, or groups can be referred to as an abyss .

example.ex: How big is the abyss between what you think you are and what you actually are?
example.tran: 你对自己的认识和真实的你之间差别到底有多大？

sense.def: AC is used to refer to an electric current that continually changes direction as it flows. AC is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'alternating current'.

example.ex: In Europe, AC is usually generated at 50 Hz.
example.tran: 欧洲的交流电输出频率通常为50赫兹。

example.ex: ...a portable AC generator.
example.tran: 便携式交流发电机

sense.def: An acacia or an acacia tree is a tree which grows in warm countries and which usually has small yellow or white flowers.
sense.tran: 金合欢（生长在温暖地区，通常开黄色或白色小花)

sense.def: The academic world of universities is sometimes referred to as academe.

example.ex: The hallowed portals of academe were slowly and grudgingly opening to women.
example.tran: 大学神圣的大门缓慢又勉强地向女性敞开。

sense.def: Academia refers to all the academics in a particular country or region, the institutions they work in, and their work.

example.ex: ...the importance of strong links between industry and academia.
example.tran: 工业界和学术界间紧密联系的重要性

sense.def: Academic is used to describe things that relate to the work done in schools, colleges, and universities, especially work which involves studying and reasoning rather than practical or technical skills.
sense.tran: 教学的，学业的（尤指学识方面而非实践、技能上的）

example.ex: Their academic standards are high...
example.tran: 他们的教学水平很高。

example.ex: I was terrible at school and left with few academic qualifications...
example.tran: 我的学习成绩一塌糊涂，离校时几乎没有学历。

example.ex: He is academically gifted...
example.tran: 他在学习上很有天分。

example.ex: I was only average academically, but was good at sports.
example.tran: 我学习成绩平平，但体育方面很出色。

sense.def: Academic is used to describe things that relate to schools, colleges, and universities.

example.ex: ...the start of the last academic year...
example.tran: 最后一个学年的开始

example.ex: I'd had enough of academic life.
example.tran: 学生生活我已经过够了。

sense.def: Academic is used to describe work, or a school, college, or university, that places emphasis on studying and reasoning rather than on practical or technical skills.
sense.tran: 学术的,重研究与思辨的（与重实践或技能相对）

example.ex: The author has settled for a more academic approach...
example.tran: 那位作者已确定采用更为学术的方法。

example.ex: Different schools teach different types of syllabus, from the highly academic to the broadly vocational.
example.tran: 不同的学校有不同的教学计划，从高度学术的到普通职业教育的，不一而足。

sense.def: Someone who is academic is good at studying.

example.ex: The system is failing most disastrously among less academic children.
example.tran: 这种制度对学习不太好的孩子效果最差。

sense.def: An academic is a member of a university or college who teaches or does research.
sense.tran: 大学教师；高校科研人员

sense.def: You can say that a discussion or situation is academic if you think it is not important because it has no real effect or cannot happen.
sense.tran: 学究式的；空谈的；不切实际的

example.ex: This was not an academic exercise — soldiers' lives were at risk...
example.tran: 这不是纸上演习——士兵的生命受到了威胁。

example.ex: Such is the size of the problem that these arguments are purely academic.
example.tran: 问题的实情在于这些论点纯属空谈。

sense.def: An academician is a member of an academy, usually one which has been formed to improve or maintain standards in a particular field.

sense.hdgr: usu with supp, oft in names
sense.def: Academy is sometimes used in the names of schools and colleges, especially those specializing in particular subjects or skills, or private high schools in the United States.
sense.tran: 专科院校;学院;(美国的)私立中学

example.ex: ...the Royal Academy of Music.
example.tran: 皇家音乐学院

example.ex: ...her experience as a police academy instructor.
example.tran: 她在警校当教官的经历

sense.def: Academy appears in the names of some societies formed to improve or maintain standards in a particular field.

example.ex: ...the American Academy of Psychotherapists...
example.tran: 美国心理治疗师学会

example.ex: The British Academy of Film and Television Arts.
example.tran: 英国电影和电视艺术学院

sense.def: If you accede to someone's request, you do what they ask.

example.ex: Britain would not accede to France's request.
example.tran: 英国不肯同意法国的要求。

example.ex: I never understood why he didn't just accede to our demands at the outset.
example.tran: 我一直搞不懂他为什么不一开始就同意我们的要求。

sense.def: When a member of a royal family accedes to the throne, they become king or queen.

example.ex: ...when Henry VIII acceded to the throne.
example.tran: 当亨利八世即位时

sense.def: If the process or rate of something accelerates or if something accelerates it, it gets faster and faster.

example.ex: Growth will accelerate to 2.9 per cent next year...
example.tran: 明年的增长会加快到2.9%。

example.ex: The government is to accelerate its privatisation programme.
example.tran: 政府将加快其私有化计划的进程。

sense.def: When a moving vehicle accelerates, it goes faster and faster.

example.ex: Suddenly the car accelerated...
example.tran: 汽车突然加速。

example.ex: She accelerated away from the kerb.
example.tran: 她加速驶离了马路牙子。

sense.def: The acceleration of a process or change is the fact that it is getting faster and faster.

example.ex: He has also called for an acceleration of political reforms.
example.tran: 他同时呼吁加快政治改革的步伐。

example.ex: ...the sharp acceleration in job losses.
example.tran: 失业的急速增加

sense.def: Acceleration is the rate at which a car or other vehicle can increase its speed, often seen in terms of the time that it takes to reach a particular speed.
sense.tran: （汽车等的）加速能力，加速幅度

example.ex: Acceleration to 60 mph takes a mere 5.7 seconds.
example.tran: 加速到时速60英里只需要5.7秒。

sense.def: Acceleration is the rate at which the speed of an object increases.
The accelerator in a car or other vehicle is the pedal which you press with your foot in order to make the vehicle go faster.

example.ex: He eased his foot off the accelerator.
example.tran: 他松开了油门。

sense.def: Someone who speaks with a particular accent pronounces the words of a language in a distinctive way that shows which country, region, or social class they come from.

example.ex: He had developed a slight American accent.
example.tran: 他说话带上了一点轻微的美国口音。

sense.def: An accent is a short line or other mark which is written above certain letters in some languages and which indicates the way those letters are pronounced.
sense.tran: （某些语言中标在字母上方的）变音符号

sense.def: If you put the accent on a particular feature of something, you emphasize it or give it special importance.

example.ex: He is putting the accent on military readiness...
example.tran: 他强调要保持备战状态。
