example.ex: There is often a strong accent on material success.
example.tran: 经常大力强调物质成就。

sense.def: Language or speech that is accented is spoken with a particular accent.

example.ex: I spoke rather good, but heavily accented English...
example.tran: 我的英语说得不错，但是口音很重。

example.ex: 'Don't do that,' he says in his soft, accented voice.
example.tran: “别那么做，”他带着口音轻声细气地说道。

sense.def: To accentuate something means to emphasize it or make it more noticeable.

example.ex: His shaven head accentuates his large round face...
example.tran: 光头使他的大圆脸更加突出。

example.ex: The whole air of menace was accentuated by the fact that he was so cordial and soft-voiced.
example.tran: 他如此亲切，说话轻声细语，这更加重了威胁的语气。

sense.def: If you accept something that you have been offered, you say yes to it or agree to take it.

example.ex: Eventually Sam persuaded her to accept an offer of marriage...
example.tran: 最终萨姆说服她接受了求婚。

example.ex: Your old clothes will be gratefully accepted by jumble sale organisers...
example.tran: 旧货义卖的组织者会感激地领受您捐赠的旧衣物。

example.ex: All those invited to next week's peace conference have accepted.
example.tran: 所有受邀参加下星期和平会谈的人都已同意出席。

sense.def: If you accept an idea, statement, or fact, you believe that it is true or valid.
sense.tran: 相信（观点、陈述、事实等）；认为…正确

example.ex: I do not accept that there is any kind of crisis in British science...
example.tran: 我不相信英国科学界有什么危机。

example.ex: I don't think they would accept that view...
example.tran: 我认为他们不会接受那种观点。

example.ex: He did not accept this reply as valid.
example.tran: 他认为这个回答没有根据。

example.ex: ...a workforce generally accepted to have the best conditions in Europe.
example.tran: 被普遍认为拥有欧洲最好的工作条件的劳动人口

sense.def: If you accept a plan or an intended action, you agree to it and allow it to happen.

example.ex: ...Britain's reluctance to accept a proposal for a single European currency...
example.tran: 英国不愿接受单一欧洲货币的建议

example.ex: The Council will meet to decide if it should accept his resignation.
example.tran: 委员会将召开会议决定是否接受他的辞呈。

sense.def: If you accept an unpleasant fact or situation, you get used to it or recognize that it is necessary or cannot be changed.

example.ex: People will accept suffering that can be shown to lead to a greater good...
example.tran: 如果能证明眼前的苦难会带来更大的好处，人们就会愿意承受。

example.ex: Urban dwellers often accept noise as part of city life...
example.tran: 城市居民常将噪音当成城市生活的一部分。

example.ex: I wasn't willing to accept that her leaving was a possibility.
example.tran: 我不愿接受她有可能离开的事实。

sense.def: If a person, company, or organization accepts something such as a document, they recognize that it is genuine, correct, or satisfactory and agree to consider it or handle it.
sense.tran: 承兑，认付（单据等）；认可(文件等)

example.ex: We advised newspapers not to accept the advertising...
example.tran: 我们建议报社不要承接这项广告。

example.ex: Cheques can only be accepted up to the value guaranteed on the card...
example.tran: 支票的承兑金额不可高于卡上所担保的数额。

example.ex: Proof of postage will not be accepted as proof of receipt.
example.tran: 邮资单据不能当作收据。

sense.def: If an organization or person accepts you, you are allowed to join the organization or use the services that are offered.
sense.tran: 招收，接纳（求职者、会员等)

example.ex: All-male groups will not be accepted.
example.tran: 清一色的男性团体将不被接纳。

example.ex: ...incentives to private landlords to accept young people as tenants.
example.tran: 鼓励私人房东租房给年轻人的措施

sense.def: If a person or a group of people accepts you, they begin to be friendly towards you and are happy with who you are or what you do.

example.ex: My grandparents have never had a problem accepting me...
example.tran: 我的祖父母从来都是无条件地接受我。

example.ex: Many men still have difficulty accepting a woman as a business partner...
example.tran: 许多男性仍然无法接受女性商业伙伴。

example.ex: Stephen Smith was accepted into the family like an adopted brother.
example.tran: 这家人把斯蒂芬·史密斯视为养子一样当作一家人。

sense.def: If you accept the responsibility or blame for something, you recognize that you are responsible for it.

example.ex: The company cannot accept responsibility for loss or damage.
example.tran: 公司不承担丢失或损坏的责任。

sense.def: If you accept someone's advice or suggestion, you agree to do what they say.

example.ex: The army refused to accept orders from the political leadership...
example.tran: 军队拒绝接受政界领导层下达的命令。

example.ex: Don't automatically accept the solicitor recommended by the broker.
example.tran: 别想当然地就接受中间人推荐的诉状律师。

sense.def: If someone's body accepts a transplanted organ, the organ becomes part of the body and starts to function normally.
sense.tran: 接受并使（移植器官）发挥正常功能;不排斥

example.ex: ...drugs which will fool the body into accepting transplants.
example.tran: 能使身体顺利接受移植器官的药物

sense.def: If a machine accepts a particular kind of thing, it is designed to take it and deal with it or process it.

example.ex: The telephone booths accept 10 and 20 pence coins.
example.tran: 电话亭可使用10便士和20便士的硬币。

sense.def: Acceptable activities and situations are those that most people approve of or consider to be normal.

example.ex: It is becoming more acceptable for women to drink alcohol...
example.tran: 女性喝酒渐渐被人们接受。

example.ex: The air pollution exceeds most acceptable levels by 10 times or more.
example.tran: 大气污染程度超出了普遍认可的标准10倍或更多。

example.ex: ...an increase in the social acceptability of divorce.
example.tran: 社会对离婚越来越包容的态度

example.ex: The aim of discipline is to teach children to behave acceptably.
example.tran: 纪律的目的是教育儿童举止得体。

sense.def: If something is acceptable to someone, they agree to consider it, use it, or allow it to happen.

example.ex: They have thrashed out a compromise formula acceptable to Moscow...
example.tran: 他们经过讨论达成了一项莫斯科可以接受的折中方案。

example.ex: They recently failed to negotiate a mutually acceptable new contract.
example.tran: 他们最近未能谈成一个双方都满意的新合同。

sense.def: If you describe something as acceptable, you mean that it is good enough or fairly good.

example.ex: On the far side of the street was a restaurant that looked acceptable...
example.tran: 远处街边有一家饭店看起来还可以。

example.ex: We've made an acceptable start, but it could've been better.
example.tran: 我们起了一个好头，但本可以更好一些的。

example.ex: ...a method that provides an acceptably accurate solution to a problem...
example.tran: 能比较准确地解决问题的方法

example.ex: These exercises will result in your being able to hit the ball quite acceptably.
example.tran: 这些训练将会使你能够较好地击中球。

sense.hdgr:
usu with supp, oft poss N, N
of n
sense.def: Acceptance of an offer or a proposal is the act of saying yes to it or agreeing to it.

example.ex: The Party is being degraded by its acceptance of secret donations...
example.tran: 该党因私下接受捐赠而蒙羞。

example.ex: I sent them more than 6,000 cartoons before I had my one and only acceptance by them...
example.tran: 我寄给他们6,000多幅漫画，最后才有1幅得以采用。

example.ex: Several shareholders have withdrawn earlier acceptances of the offer.
example.tran: 几个股东对于先前同意的报价又反悔了。

example.ex: ...a letter of acceptance.
example.tran: 中标函

example.ex: ...his acceptance speech for the Nobel Peace Prize.
example.tran: 他的诺贝尔和平奖获奖感言

sense.def: If there is acceptance of an idea, most people believe or agree that it is true.

example.ex: ...a theory that is steadily gaining acceptance...
example.tran: 逐步得到承认的理论

example.ex: There was a general acceptance that the defence budget would shrink.
example.tran: 人们普遍相信国防预算将会缩减。

sense.def: Your acceptance of a situation, especially an unpleasant or difficult one, is an attitude or feeling that you cannot change it and that you must get used to it.

example.ex: Popular acceptance of authority had been an early aim of the Nationalists.
example.tran: 国家主义者的一个早期目标是推动民众对权威的接受。

example.ex: ...his calm acceptance of whatever comes his way.
example.tran: 他遇事泰然处之的态度

sense.def: If there is acceptance of a new product, people start to like it and get used to it.

example.ex: Car manufacturers are already producing small numbers of electric vehicles to test customer acceptance...
example.tran: 汽车制造商们已经开始生产少量的电动车辆以测试顾客的接受程度。

example.ex: Avant-garde music to this day has not found general public acceptance.
example.tran: 先锋音乐时至今日都没有得到大众的广泛认可。

sense.def: Acceptance of someone into a group means beginning to think of them as part of the group and to act in a friendly way towards them.

example.ex: ...an effort to ensure that the disabled achieve real acceptance.
example.tran: 为确保残疾人真正得到接纳而作出的努力

sense.def: Accepted ideas are agreed by most people to be correct or reasonable.
sense.tran: 为公众所接受的；公认的

example.ex: There is no generally accepted definition of life...
example.tran: 关于生活的定义不一而足。

example.ex: It is accepted wisdom that science has been partly responsible for the decline of religion.
example.tran: 人们普遍认为，科学的兴起是宗教衰落的部分原因。

sense.def: If you have access to a building or other place, you are able or allowed to go into it.

example.ex: The facilities have been adapted to give access to wheelchair users.
example.tran: 这些设施已经改造过以方便轮椅使用者进入。

example.ex: Scientists have only recently been able to gain access to the area...
example.tran: 科学家直到最近才得以进入该地区。

example.ex: The Mortimer Hotel offers easy access to central London.
example.tran: 从莫蒂默旅馆去往伦敦市中心交通近便。

sense.def: If you have access to something such as information or equipment, you have the opportunity or right to see it or use it.
sense.tran: 查阅（或使用）的机会（或权利）

example.ex: ...a Code of Practice that would give patients right of access to their medical records.
example.tran: 允许病人查看自己病历的职业准则

example.ex: ...whether one has access to a dish and the other accoutrements needed to watch satellite TV.
example.tran: 是否能使用碟型卫星天线以及其他观看卫星电视所需要的装备

sense.def: If you have access to a person, you have the opportunity or right to see them or meet them.
sense.tran: 接近（或面见）的机会（或权利）

example.ex: He was not allowed access to a lawyer.
example.tran: 他未被获准见律师。

example.ex: My ex-wife deliberately sabotages my access to the children.
example.tran: 我的前妻蓄意阻挠我见孩子。

sense.def: If you access something, especially information held on a computer, you succeed in finding or obtaining it.

example.ex: You've illegally accessed and misused confidential security files.
example.tran: 你已经非法访问并盗用了机密的安全文件。

sense.def: An access course is an educational course which prepares adults with few or no qualifications for study at a university or other place of higher education.
sense.tran: （为没有所需学历者而设的）高校入学补习课程

sense.def: If a place or building is accessible to people, it is easy for them to reach it or get into it. If an object is accessible, it is easy to reach.
sense.tran: 易到达的;易进入的;易够到的

example.ex: The Centre is easily accessible to the general public...
example.tran: 该中心普通大众可随意进入。

example.ex: The premises are wheelchair accessible...
example.tran: 该场所轮椅可以自由出入。

example.ex: I had to keep the video camera readily accessible in case I saw something that needed to be filmed.
example.tran: 我必须将摄像机放在触手可及的地方，以便需要拍摄时用得上。

example.ex: ...the easy accessibility of the area.
example.tran: 这个地区的交通便利性

sense.def: If something is accessible to people, they can easily use it or obtain it.

example.ex: The legal aid system should be accessible to more people...
example.tran: 法律援助制度应该面向更多人。

example.ex: This device helps make virtual reality a more usable and accessible technology.
example.tran: 这一装置有助于使虚拟现实成为更可用、更便利的技术。

example.ex: ...the quality and accessibility of health care.
example.tran: 医疗保健的质量和便利性

sense.def: If you describe a book, painting, or other work of art as accessible, you think it is good because it is simple enough for people to understand and appreciate easily.

example.ex: ...literary books that are accessible to a general audience.
example.tran: 一般读者都能欣赏的文学作品

example.ex: ...their reputation for providing exciting and accessible theatre for young people.
example.tran: 他们在为年轻人奉献喜闻乐见的精彩戏剧方面是出了名的

example.ex: Seminar topics are chosen for their accessibility to a general audience.
example.tran: 研讨会内容是以普通听众容易理解为依据作出选择的。

sense.hdgr:
with poss, oft N
to n
sense.def: Accession is the act of taking up a position as the ruler of a country.
sense.tran: （君主、帝王的）登基，即位；（国家统治者的）就职，就任

example.ex: ...the 50th anniversary of the Queen's accession to the throne.
example.tran: 女王登基50周年庆典

sense.hdgr:
oft with poss, N
to n
sense.def: A country's accession to a group of countries or to an association is its joining that group of countries or association.

example.ex: ...Namibia's accession to the Lome convention.
example.tran: 纳米比亚正式加入《洛美协定》

example.ex: ...a ballot over the issue of Kashmir's accession to India.
example.tran: 对克什米尔是否并入印度的表决

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 accessorise

sense.def: To accessorize something such as a set of furniture or clothing means to add other things to it in order to make it look more attractive.
sense.tran: （以配件、装饰品等）补充，附加；给…装配附件

example.ex: Use a belt to accessorise a plain dress.
example.tran: 用腰带来装点一件素裙。

sense.def: Accessories are items of equipment that are not usually essential, but which can be used with or added to something else in order to make it more efficient, useful, or decorative.

example.ex: ...an exclusive range of hand-made bedroom and bathroom accessories.
example.tran: 独家经营的一系列手工卧室和浴室配件

sense.def: Accessories are articles such as belts and scarves which you wear or carry but which are not part of your main clothing.
If someone is guilty of being an accessory to a crime, they helped the person who committed it, or knew it was being committed but did not tell the police.

example.ex: She was charged with being an accessory to the embezzlement of funds.
example.tran: 她被指控为这起挪用公款案的从犯。

sense.def: You can use accessory to describe something which is part of an activity or process, but not the most essential or important part of it.
sense.tran: 附属的；辅助的；非主要的

example.ex: Forster established the essentiality of minerals as accessory food factors required for maintaining life.
example.tran: 福斯特证实了矿物质作为辅助食物因子在维持生命方面的重要性。

sense.def: An access road is a road which enables traffic to reach a particular place or area.

example.ex: ...the access road to the airport.
example.tran: 机场路

sense.def: Access time is the time that is needed to get information that is stored in a computer.
sense.tran: 存取时间，访问时间（指读取出计算机中存储资料所需的时间）

example.ex: This system helps speed up access times.
example.tran: 这个系统有助于加快存取时间。

sense.def: An accident happens when a vehicle hits a person, an object, or another vehicle, causing injury or damage.

example.ex: She was involved in a serious car accident last week...
example.tran: 上星期她卷入了一场严重的车祸。

example.ex: Six passengers were killed in the accident.
example.tran: 六名乘客在车祸中丧生。

sense.def: If someone has an accident, something unpleasant happens to them that was not intended, sometimes causing injury or death.
sense.tran: （不幸的）意外遭遇，不测事件;事故

example.ex: 5,000 people die every year because of accidents in the home...
example.tran: 每年有5,000人死于家中的意外事故。

example.ex: The police say the killing of the young man was an accident.
example.tran: 警方说这个年轻人被杀是一个意外。

sense.def: If something happens by accident, it happens completely by chance.

example.ex: She discovered the problem by accident...
example.tran: 她碰巧发现了这个问题。

example.ex: Almost like an accident of nature, this family has produced more talent than seems possible.
example.tran: 就像是天缘巧合，这个家族不可思议地人才辈出。

sense.def: If you describe something or someone as an accident waiting to happen, you mean that they are likely to be a cause of danger in the future, for example because they are in poor condition or behave in an unpredictable way.
sense.tran: 可能发生意外的事物（或人）

example.ex: A lot of the city's buildings are accidents waiting to happen.
example.tran: 该城市中许多楼房都存在事故隐患。

sense.def: You begin a sentence with 'it's no accident' if you want to suggest that something was done deliberately or has a logical explanation, although it might give the impression of having happened by chance.

example.ex: It's no accident that the boom in police series on TV coincided with the decline of the Western.
example.tran: 警匪剧在电视上盛行之时恰好是西部片衰退之际，这并非偶然。

sense.def: An accidental event happens by chance or as the result of an accident, and is not deliberately intended.

example.ex: The jury returned a verdict of accidental death...
example.tran: 陪审团作出意外死亡的正式裁决。

example.ex: His hand brushed against hers; it could have been either accidental or deliberate.
example.tran: 就在有意无意间，他的手轻轻拂过她的手。

example.ex: A policeman accidentally killed his two best friends with a single bullet...
example.tran: 一名警察不慎一枪打死了他的两个挚友。

example.ex: A special locking system means the door cannot be opened accidentally.
example.tran: 特殊的锁定系统使门不会被意外打开。

sense.def: The accident and emergency is the room or department in a hospital where people who have severe injuries or sudden illness are taken for emergency treatment. The abbreviation A & E is also used.
sense.tran: （医院的）急诊科，急诊室（缩略形式为A&E）

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 emergency room

sense.def: If you describe someone or something as accident prone, you mean that a lot of accidents or other unpleasant things happen to them.
sense.tran: 易出事故的；易遭遇意外的

sense.def: If someone or something is acclaimed, they are praised enthusiastically.

example.ex: She has been acclaimed for the TV drama 'Prime Suspect'...
example.tran: 她凭借电视剧《头号嫌疑犯》而受到好评。

example.ex: He was acclaimed as England's greatest modern painter...
example.tran: 他被誉为英格兰现代最伟大的油画家。

example.ex: The group's debut album was immediately acclaimed a hip hop classic.
example.tran: 这个组合的首张专辑一经推出便被盛赞为嘻哈乐的经典之作。

example.ex: She has published six highly acclaimed novels.
example.tran: 她出版了六本备受赞誉的小说。

sense.hdgr: usu with supp, oft adj N
sense.def: Acclaim is public praise for someone or something.

example.ex: Angela Bassett has won critical acclaim for her excellent performance...
example.tran: 安吉拉·贝塞特凭借其出色的表演赢得了评论界的好评。

example.ex: All this equipment has received international acclaim from the specialist hi-fi press.
example.tran: 这套设备受到全球高保真音响专业报刊的赞誉。

sense.def: Acclamation is a noisy or enthusiastic expression of approval for someone or something.

example.ex: The news was greeted with considerable popular acclamation.
example.tran: 消息赢得了相当普遍的欢呼。

sense.def: If someone is chosen or elected by acclamation, they are elected without a written vote.

example.ex: At first it looked like I was going to win by acclamation.
example.tran: 起初看起来我会以口头表决的方式获胜。

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 acclimatise

sense.def: When you acclimatize or are acclimatized to a new situation, place, or climate, you become used to it.
sense.tran: （使）适应；（使）服水土；（使）习惯于（新情况、新地方或新气候）

example.ex: The athletes are acclimatising to the heat by staying in Monte Carlo...
example.tran: 运动员通过留驻蒙特卡洛来适应酷热。

example.ex: This year he has left for St Louis early to acclimatise himself...
example.tran: 今年他早早地前往圣路易斯以便适应新环境。

example.ex: They have been travelling for two days and will need some time to acclimatise.
example.tran: 他们在旅途中奔波了两天，需要时间调整。

example.ex: Acclimatization to higher altitudes may take several weeks.
example.tran: 适应较高的海拔可能需要几周时间。

rnon.hdgr:
usu v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
to n

example.ex: It took her a while to get acclimatized to her new surroundings...
example.tran: 她花了一段时间才适应了新的环境。

sense.def: If someone is given an accolade, something is done or said about them which shows how much people admire them.

example.ex: The Nobel prize has become the ultimate accolade in the sciences...
example.tran: 诺贝尔奖已成为科学界的最高荣誉。

example.ex: Ari Hart recently received the accolade of being represented in the Museum of Modern Art.
example.tran: 阿里·哈特的作品最近有幸获选在现代艺术馆展出。

sense.def: If a building or space can accommodate someone or something, it has enough room for them.

example.ex: The school in Poldown was not big enough to accommodate all the children...
example.tran: 波尔登的学校不够大，容不下所有的孩子。

example.ex: The CD-ROMs will accommodate the works of all English poets from 600 to 1900.
example.tran: 这些光盘能存下从公元600年到1900年所有英国诗人的作品。

sense.def: To accommodate someone means to provide them with a place to live or stay.

example.ex: ...a hotel built to accommodate guests for the wedding of King Alfonso...
example.tran: 一家为接待前来参加阿方索国王婚礼的来宾而建的宾馆

example.ex: Students are accommodated in homes nearby.
example.tran: 学生被安置在附近的住家中。

sense.def: If something is planned or changed to accommodate a particular situation, it is planned or changed so that it takes this situation into account.

example.ex: The roads are built to accommodate gradual temperature changes...
example.tran: 修建这些道路时考虑到了温度的逐渐变化。

example.ex: The way that American history is taught may change in order to accommodate some more of those cultures.
example.tran: 美国历史的授课方式可能会为了照顾到更多的文化而作改变。

sense.def: If you do something to accommodate someone, you do it with the main purpose of pleasing or satisfying them.

example.ex: He has never put an arm around his wife to accommodate photographers...
example.tran: 他从未为了迎合摄影师而搂住妻子。

example.ex: He's already altered several of the proposals in his economic plan to accommodate demands of special interests.
example.tran: 他已经改动了经济计划中的几项提议以迁就特殊利益集团的要求。

sense.def: If you accommodate to something new, you change your behaviour or ideas so that you are able to deal with it.

example.ex: Some animal and plant species cannot accommodate to the rapidly changing conditions...
example.tran: 某些种类的动植物不能适应迅速变化的环境。

example.ex: She walked slowly to accommodate herself to his pace.
example.tran: 她走得很慢，以便与他保持一致的步伐。

sense.def: If you describe someone as accommodating, you like the fact that they are willing to do things in order to please you or help you.
sense.tran: 乐于帮助的；与人方便的；肯通融的

sense.def: Accommodation is used to refer to buildings or rooms where people live or stay.

example.ex: The government will provide temporary accommodation for up to three thousand people...
example.tran: 政府将给多达3,000人提供临时住处。

example.ex: Prices start at £1,095 per person, including flights, hotel accommodation and various excursions...
example.tran: 起价为单人1,095英镑，包括机票、旅店住宿和各种出游费用。

example.ex: Rates are higher for deluxe accommodations.
example.tran: 豪华间收费较高。

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 accommodations

sense.def: Accommodation is space in buildings or vehicles that is available for certain things, people, or activities.
sense.tran: （楼房或交通工具内的）空间，座位，铺位

example.ex: The school occupies split-site accommodation on the main campus...
example.tran: 该学院分散在主校区不同地点。

example.ex: Some trains carry bicycles, but accommodation is restricted so a reservation is essential.
example.tran: 有些火车可以运载自行车，但因空间有限需要提前预订。

boxu.usage: Be careful with the spelling of this word.
boxu.tran: 注意该词的拼写。

sense.hdgr:
oft N
with n, N
between pl-n
sense.def: An accommodation is an agreement between different people which enables them to exist together without trouble.

example.ex: His instinct would be to seek a new accommodation with the nationalists...
example.tran: 他本能的反应会是寻求与民族主义者取得新的和解。

example.ex: Religions, to survive, must make accommodations with the larger political structures that nurture them.
example.tran: 为了生存，宗教必须同其赖以存在的更大的政治体系相调和。

sense.def: The accompaniment to a song or tune is the music that is played at the same time as it and forms a background to it.

example.ex: He sang 'My Funny Valentine' to a piano accompaniment.
example.tran: 他在钢琴的伴奏下演唱了《我可爱的情人》。

sense.def: An accompaniment is something which goes with another thing.
sense.tran: 伴随物；伴随发生（或存在）的事物

example.ex: This recipe makes a good accompaniment to ice-cream.
example.tran: 这道食谱适合搭配冰激凌。

defx.def: If one thing happens to the accompaniment of another, they happen at the same time.

example.ex: The team came out to the accompaniment of fireworks.
example.tran: 在烟花的映照下，队伍出场了。

sense.def: An accompanist is a musician, especially a pianist, who plays one part of a piece of music while someone else sings or plays the main tune.
If you accompany someone, you go somewhere with them.

example.ex: Ken agreed to accompany me on a trip to Africa...
example.tran: 肯答应陪我一起去非洲。

example.ex: She was accompanied by her younger brother...
example.tran: 她由弟弟陪着。

example.ex: The Prime Minister, accompanied by the governor, led the President up to the house.
example.tran: 首相在州长陪同下带领总统前往那座房子。

sense.def: If one thing accompanies another, it happens or exists at the same time, or as a result of it.
sense.tran: 伴随；和…一起发生（或同时存在）

example.ex: This volume of essays was designed to accompany an exhibition in Cologne...
example.tran: 这本文集是为配合在科隆举办的一场展览而出的。

example.ex: The proposal was instantly voted through with two to one in favour, accompanied by enthusiastic applause...
example.tran: 在热烈的掌声中，提案以2比1的优势很快通过了表决。

example.ex: Perhaps the accompanying illustration will explain it.
example.tran: 可能所附的图表能对此作出解释。

sense.def: If you accompany a singer or a musician, you play one part of a piece of music while they sing or play the main tune.

example.ex: He sang and Alice accompanied him on the piano...
example.tran: 他一边唱，艾丽斯一边为他钢琴伴奏。

example.ex: We ended with Blake's Jerusalem, accompanied on the organ by Herbert Wiseman.
example.tran: 在赫伯特·怀斯曼的风琴伴奏下，我们演唱了布莱克的《耶路撒冷》作为终曲。

sense.def: Someone's accomplice is a person who helps them to commit a crime.

example.ex: The gunman escaped on a motorcycle being ridden by an accomplice.
example.tran: 持枪歹徒坐上一辆由同伙驾驶的摩托车逃逸。

example.ex: His accomplice was arrested after a high-speed police chase.
example.tran: 经过警方的一番飞车追逐，他的同伙遭到逮捕。

sense.def: If you accomplish something, you succeed in doing it.

example.ex: If we'd all work together, I think we could accomplish our goal...
example.tran: 只要大家齐心协力，我想我们就能实现目标。

example.ex: They are skeptical about how much will be accomplished by legislation.
example.tran: 他们对于立法成效心存疑虑。

sense.def: If someone is accomplished at something, they are very good at it.
sense.tran: 熟练的;才华高的;有造诣的

example.ex: She is an accomplished painter.
example.tran: 她是位颇有建树的画家。

example.ex: ...one of the most accomplished composers of our time.
example.tran: 我们这个时代最杰出的作曲家之一

sense.def: An accomplishment is something remarkable that has been done or achieved.

example.ex: For a novelist, that's quite an accomplishment...
example.tran: 对于一位小说家来说，那是相当了不起的成就。

example.ex: By any standards, the accomplishments of the past year are extraordinary.
example.tran: 不管以哪种标准来衡量，过去一年都成果斐然。

sense.def: Your accomplishments are the things that you can do well or the important things that you have done.
The accomplishment of something is the fact of achieving or finishing it.

example.ex: His function is vital to the accomplishment of the agency's mission.
example.tran: 要完成该机构的使命，他的作用至关重要。

sense.hdgr: usu with supp, oft n N
sense.def: An accord between countries or groups of people is a formal agreement, for example to end a war.
sense.tran: （国家、团体之间的正式）协定，协议，条约

example.ex: ...a fitting way to celebrate the peace accord.
example.tran: 庆祝和平协定的恰当的方式

sense.def: If you are accorded a particular kind of treatment, people act towards you or treat you in that way.

example.ex: His predecessor was accorded an equally tumultuous welcome...
example.tran: 他的前任受到了同样热烈的欢迎。

example.ex: The government accorded him the rank of Colonel...
example.tran: 政府授予他上校军衔。

example.ex: The treatment accorded to a United Nations official was little short of insulting.
example.tran: 联合国官员所受到的这种待遇几近羞辱。

sense.def: If one fact, idea, or condition accords with another, they are in agreement and there is no conflict between them.

example.ex: Such an approach accords with the principles of socialist ideology.
example.tran: 这种方法与社会主义意识形态的原则相符。

example.ex: ...scientific evidence that did not fully accord with the facts uncovered by the police.
example.tran: 与警方所掌握的情况不完全一致的科学证据

phrase.hdgr:
v-link PHR, PHR after v, oft PHR
with n
phrase.def: If one person, action, or fact is in accord with another, they are in agreement and there is no conflict between them. You can also say that two people or things are in accord.

example.ex: ...this military action, taken in accord with United Nations resolutions...
example.tran: 依据联合国决议而采取的本次军事行动

example.ex: Old enemies can become new friends even if all their national interests are not in complete accord.
example.tran: 即使国家利益不尽相同，他们也可以化敌为友。

phrase.def: If something happens of its own accord, it seems to happen by itself, without anyone making it happen.

example.ex: In many cases the disease will clear up of its own accord.
example.tran: 这种病很多情况下会自愈。

phrase.def: If you do something of your own accord, you do it because you want to, without being asked or forced.

example.ex: He did not quit as France's prime minister of his own accord.
example.tran: 他辞去法国总理职务并非出于自愿。

phrase.def: If a number of people do something with one accord, they do it together or at the same time, because they agree about what should be done.

example.ex: With one accord they turned and walked back over the grass.
example.tran: 他们步调一致地转身走过草坪。

sense.def: If something is done in accordance with a particular rule or system, it is done in the way that the rule or system says that it should be done.

example.ex: Entries which are not in accordance with the rules will be disqualified.
example.tran: 不符合规定的参赛作品将被取消资格。

sense.hdgr: usu ADV with cl, also ADV with v
sense.def: You use accordingly to introduce a fact or situation which is a result or consequence of something that you have just referred to.

example.ex: We have a different background, a different history. Accordingly, we have the right to different futures...
example.tran: 我们有不同的背景和不同的历史。因此，我们有权拥有不同的未来。

example.ex: The workforce have recently been calling for their working hours to be reduced. Many companies have accordingly switched to a five-day week.
example.tran: 工人们最近一直在呼吁缩短工作时间。许多公司于是转成了一周五天工作制。

sense.def: If you consider a situation and then act accordingly, the way you act depends on the nature of the situation.

example.ex: It is a difficult job and they should be paid accordingly...
example.tran: 这是份棘手的工作，他们应得到相应的报酬。

example.ex: The new government will make a judgment about its interests and act accordingly.
example.tran: 新政府将对其利害得失作出判断，并采取相应的行动。

sense.def: If someone says that something is true according to a particular person, book, or other source of information, they are indicating where they got their information.

example.ex: Philip stayed at the hotel, according to Mr Hemming...
example.tran: 据亨明先生所说，菲利普住在旅馆里。

example.ex: He and his father, according to local gossip, haven't been in touch for years.
example.tran: 当地风传，他和父亲已多年未联系了。

sense.def: If something is done according to a particular set of principles, these principles are used as a basis for the way it is done.

example.ex: They both played the game according to the rules...
example.tran: 他们俩都依章行事。

example.ex: They must take their own decision according to their own legal advice.
example.tran: 他们必须根据各自律师的意见自行决定。

sense.def: If something varies according to a changing factor, it varies in a way that is determined by this factor.

example.ex: Prices vary according to the quantity ordered...
example.tran: 价格随订购数量不同而有所变化。

example.ex: The route that the boatmen choose varies according to the water level.
example.tran: 船夫选择的路线会随水位的变化而有所不同。

sense.def: If something happens according to plan, it happens in exactly the way that it was intended to happen.
sense.tran: 按照计划；如同料想的那样

example.ex: If all goes according to plan, the first concert will be Tuesday evening.
example.tran: 如果一切都按计划进行的话，第一场音乐会将在星期二晚上举行。

sense.def: An accordion is a musical instrument in the shape of a fairly large box which you hold in your hands. You play the accordion by pressing keys or buttons on either side while moving the two sides together and apart. Accordions are used especially to play traditional popular music.
If someone accosts another person, especially a stranger, they stop them or go up to them and speak to them in a way that seems rude or threatening.
sense.tran: （唐突地或带有威胁性地）走近跟…攀谈，上前与…搭讪

example.ex: A man had accosted me in the street.
example.tran: 一个男的在街上和我搭讪。

sense.def: If you have an account with a bank or a similar organization, you have an arrangement to leave your money there and take some out when you need it.

example.ex: Some banks make it difficult to open an account...
example.tran: 一些银行把开户弄得很麻烦。

example.ex: I had two accounts with Natwest, a savings account and a current account.
example.tran: 我在国民威斯敏斯特银行有两个账户，一个储蓄账户和一个活期存款账户。

sense.def: In business, a regular customer of a company can be referred to as an account, especially when the customer is another company.
sense.tran: 固定客户，老主顾（尤指公司）

example.ex: Biggart Donald, the Glasgow-based marketing agency, has won two Edinburgh accounts.
example.tran: 比加特·唐纳德，这家驻格拉斯哥的营销代理公司已赢得了两个爱丁堡的客户。

sense.def: Accounts are detailed records of all the money that a person or business receives and spends.

example.ex: He kept detailed accounts.
example.tran: 他记明细账。

example.ex: ...an account book.
example.tran: 账本

sense.hdgr:
with supp, usu N
of n
sense.def: An account is a written or spoken report of something that has happened.
sense.tran: （书面或口头的）记述，描述，陈述，报告

example.ex: He gave a detailed account of what happened on the fateful night...
example.tran: 他详细描述了那个灾难性夜晚所发生的事。

example.ex: According to police accounts, Mr and Mrs Hunt were found dead on the floor of their kitchen.
example.tran: 据警方称，亨特夫妇被发现死在家里厨房的地板上。

sense.hdgr:
usu N
of n, oft poss N
sense.def: An account of something is a theory which is intended to explain or describe it.

example.ex: This basic utilitarian model gives a relatively unsophisticated account of human behaviour...
example.tran: 这个实用的基础模型较为简略地解释了人类的行为。

example.ex: Science, on Weber's account, is an essentially value-free activity.
example.tran: 按照韦伯的说法，科学在本质上是一种价值无涉的活动。

sense.def: If you say that something is accounted a particular thing, you are reporting someone's judgment or opinion that it is that thing.

example.ex: The opening day of the battle was, nevertheless, accounted a success.
example.tran: 不过，开战的首日仍被认为是成功的。

example.ex: ...homosexuals, whose sexual behaviour is still accounted sinful by the church.
example.tran: 其性行为仍然被教会认为是罪孽深重的同性恋者

boxu.usage: Do not confuse account and bill. When you have an account with a bank, you leave your money in the bank and take it out when you need it. When you have to pay for things such as electricity or a meal in a restaurant, you get a bill.
boxu.tran: 不要混淆 account 和 bill。account 指可存钱、取钱的银行账户。bill 指账单，如电费或餐费账单。

phrase.def: If you say that something is true by all accounts or from all accounts, you believe it is true because other people say so.

example.ex: He is, by all accounts, a superb teacher.
example.tran: 他是位有口皆碑的好老师。

phrase.def: If you say that someone gave a good account of themselves in a particular situation, you mean that they performed well, although they may not have been completely successful.
phrase.tran: （尽管未必大获全胜但）出色地表现（自己）

example.ex: The team fought hard and gave a good account of themselves.
example.tran: 这支队伍奋力拼搏，表现出色。

phrase.def: If you say that something is of no account or of little account, you mean that it is very unimportant and is not worth considering.

example.ex: These obscure groups were of little account in national politics.
example.tran: 这些名不见经传的团体在国内政界无足轻重。

phrase.def: If you buy or pay for something on account, you pay nothing or only part of the cost at first, and pay the rest later.
phrase.tran: 以赊账方式;以分期付款方式

example.ex: He bought two bottles of vodka on account.
example.tran: 他挂账买了两瓶伏特加酒。

phrase.def: You use on account of to introduce the reason or explanation for something.

example.ex: The President declined to deliver the speech himself, on account of a sore throat...
example.tran: 总统因嗓子不适而婉拒了亲自讲话。

example.ex: A newly-married couple, he thought, on account of their walking so close together.
example.tran: 看俩人走路时挨得这么近，他觉得他们是新婚夫妇。

phrase.def: Your feelings on someone's account are the feelings you have about what they have experienced or might experience, especially when you imagine yourself to be in their situation.
phrase.tran: 从（某人的）角度；（尤指）设想处于（某人的）情况

example.ex: Mollie told me what she'd done and I was really scared on her account.
example.tran: 莫莉告诉我她的所作所为，我真是替她感到后怕。

phrase.def: If you tell someone not to do something on your account, you mean that they should do it only if they want to, and not because they think it will please you.

example.ex: Don't leave on my account.
example.tran: 别因为我就走了。

phrase.def: If you say that something should on no account be done, you are emphasizing that it should not be done under any circumstances.

example.ex: On no account should the mixture boil.
example.tran: 切勿让这种混合物沸腾。

phrase.hdgr: usu PHR after v, PHR with cl
phrase.def: You can use on that account or on this account when you want to say that something happens for the reason you have just mentioned.

example.ex: Wine is radioactive but few people stop drinking it on that account.
example.tran: 酒是有放射性的，可是很少有人因此而戒酒。

phrase.def: If you say that something concerning a particular person is true by his or her own account, you mean that you believe it because that person has said it is true.

example.ex: He was by his own account an ambitious workaholic.
example.tran: 据他自己所言，他是个雄心勃勃的工作狂。

phrase.def: If you take part in a business activity on your own account, you do it for yourself, and not as a representative or employee of a company.
phrase.tran: 作为个人地；为自身利益地

example.ex: She had plans to set up in business on her own account.
example.tran: 她计划自己创业。

phrase.def: If you do something on your own account, you do it because you want to and without being asked, and you take responsibility for your own action.
phrase.tran: 自主自愿地;责任自负地

example.ex: I told him if he withdrew it was on his own account.
example.tran: 我告诉他，如果他退出，责任自负。

phrase.hdgr:
V inflects, PHR
with n, pl-n PHR
phrase.def: To settle accounts with an enemy or opponent means to bring your fight or quarrel to an end by defeating them.
phrase.tran: （与敌人或对手）决战，算账，了结恩怨

example.ex: ...until the great day came when the Germans could finally settle accounts with the British...
example.tran: 直到德国人最终能和英国人清算旧账的重大日子的来临

example.ex: Their sleep is regularly disturbed by the sound of gunfire as criminal gangs settle their nightly accounts.
example.tran: 他们经常被黑帮每晚火拼的枪声所吵醒。

phrase.def: If you take something into account, or take account of something, you consider it when you are thinking about a situation or deciding what to do.

example.ex: The defendant asked for 21 similar offences to be taken into account...
example.tran: 被告要求考虑到类似的21起违法行为的情况。

example.ex: Urban planners in practice have to take account of many interest groups in society.
example.tran: 城市规划人员在实际工作中必须把社会各利益集团都考虑在内。

phrase.hdgr:
V inflects, oft PHR
for n
phrase.def: If someone is called, held, or brought to account for something they have done wrong, they are made to explain why they did it, and are often criticized or punished for it.
phrase.tran: （对所做的错事）被要求解释并遭斥责，被问责

example.ex: Ministers should be called to account for their actions.
example.tran: 部长们应该对他们的行为作出解释。

sense.def: If a particular thing accounts for a part or proportion of something, that part or proportion consists of that thing, or is used or produced by it.

example.ex: Computers account for 5% of the country's commercial electricity consumption.
example.tran: 计算机占去该国商业用电的5%。

sense.def: If something accounts for a particular fact or situation, it causes or explains it.

example.ex: Now, the gene they discovered today doesn't account for all those cases.
example.tran: 不过，他们现在发现的基因无法解释所有的病例。

sense.def: If you can account for something, you can explain it or give the necessary information about it.
sense.tran: 为…提出理由;对…作出说明

example.ex: How do you account for the company's alarmingly high staff turnover?...
example.tran: 你怎么解释这家公司高得令人忧虑的人员流动率？

example.ex: He said only 200 of the train's 600 passengers had been accounted for.
example.tran: 他说火车上的600名乘客中仅有200名乘客的信息得已查明。

sense.def: If someone has to account for an action or policy, they are responsible for it, and may be required to explain it to other people or be punished if it fails.
sense.tran: 对（行动、政策等）负有责任

example.ex: The President and the President alone must account for his government's reforms.
example.tran: 总统必须为他的政府改革负责，而且是负全责。

sense.def: If a sum of money is accounted for in a budget, it has been included in that budget for a particular purpose.

example.ex: The really heavy redundancy costs have been accounted for.
example.tran: 非常庞大的裁员开支已被列入预算。

sense.def: If you account for an enemy or opponent, you kill, destroy, or beat them.

example.ex: In the first ten days of May our squadron accounted for at least seven enemy aircraft...
example.tran: 5月的头10天里我们中队至少报销了7架敌机。

example.ex: In the final they accounted for Brentford by three goals to two.
example.tran: 决赛时他们以3比2击败了布伦特福德队。

sense.hdgr:
usu v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
to/for n
sense.def: If you are accountable to someone for something that you do, you are responsible for it and must be prepared to justify your actions to that person.

example.ex: Public officials can finally be held accountable for their actions...
example.tran: 终于要对政府官员实行问责了。

example.ex: The major service industries should be accountable to their customers.
example.tran: 主要的服务行业应该对它们的顾客负责。

example.ex: ...an impetus towards democracy and greater accountability.
example.tran: 促进民主及更强责任感

sense.def: Accountancy is the theory or practice of keeping financial accounts.

example.ex: He's sitting his final exams in accountancy.
example.tran: 他正参加会计学的期末考试。

sense.def: An accountant is a person whose job is to keep financial accounts.
Accounting is the activity of keeping detailed records of the amounts of money a business or person receives and spends.

example.ex: ...allegations of theft, forgery and false accounting.
example.tran: 盗窃、伪造和做假账的指控

example.ex: ...the accounting firm of Leventhal & Horwath.
example.tran: 利文撒尔-霍瓦特会计师事务所

entry.boxr: in AM, also use 美国英语亦用 accouterment

sense.hdgr:
usu pl, usu with supp, oft N
of n
sense.def: Accoutrements are all the things you have with you when you travel or when you take part in a particular activity.

example.ex: I loved stationery and all the accoutrements of writing.
example.tran: 我喜爱信笺信封和所有文房用具。

sense.def: If an educational qualification or institution is accredited, it is officially declared to be of an approved standard.
sense.tran: 鉴定…为合格;确认…达到标准

example.ex: This degree programme is fully accredited by the Institution of Electrical Engineers.
example.tran: 这门学位课程经电气工程师学院鉴定完全合格。

example.ex: ...an accredited college of Brunel University.
example.tran: 布鲁内尔大学的一所正式学院

example.ex: ...the Council for the Accreditation of Teacher Education.
example.tran: 师资教育鉴定委员会

sense.def: If someone such as a diplomat or journalist is accredited to a particular job or place, they are officially recognized as having that job, or the right to be in that place.

example.ex: The President proposed that Russian diplomats could be accredited to NATO headquarters...
example.tran: 总统提议俄罗斯外交官可被派驻北约总部。

example.ex: Some of the organisations taking part protested that the delegates they had chosen were not being accredited.
example.tran: 一些参加的组织抗议他们所选出的代表未获委任。

example.ex: ...fully accredited diplomats.
example.tran: 特命全权外交官

example.ex: Media representatives should arrive at the Press Centre by 11:40 to obtain accreditation.
example.tran: 媒体代表应在11:40之前抵达新闻中心进行报到确认。

sense.def: An accretion is an addition to something, usually one that has been added over a period of time.

example.ex: The script has been gathering editorial accretions for years.
example.tran: 多年来该剧本一直在修改。

sense.def: Accretion is the process of new layers or parts being added to something so that it increases in size.

example.ex: A coral reef is built by the accretion of tiny, identical organisms.
example.tran: 珊瑚礁是由许多相同的微生物不断堆积而成。

sense.def: In finance, the accrual of something such as interest or investments is the adding together of interest or different investments over a period of time.
sense.tran: （利息的）自然累积；（投资的）累加

example.ex: ...the accrual of funds used during construction.
example.tran: 建设过程中资金的累积

example.ex: ...an accrual method of accounting.
example.tran: 会计学中的应计法

sense.def: If money or interest accrues or if you accrue it, it gradually increases in amount over a period of time.

example.ex: I owed £5,000 — part of this was accrued interest...
example.tran: 我欠款5,000英镑，其中一部分是累计的利息。

example.ex: If you do not pay within 28 days, interest will accrue...
example.tran: 如果28天之内不付款，就会自然生息。

example.ex: Officials say the options will offer investors a longer time in which to accrue profits.
example.tran: 官员说这些期权会给投资者提供更长的利润积累期。

sense.def: If things such as profits or benefits accrue to someone, they are added to over a period of time.

example.ex: ...the expectation that profits will accrue.
example.tran: 希望利润会增加的期待

example.ex: ...a project from which considerable benefit will accrue to the community...
example.tran: 使社区持续受益的项目

example.gram:
Also V n, V
to n
example.ex: In many cases, the fee structure alone will exceed the tax benefits accrued.
example.tran: 很多情况下，单是费用结构一项就会超过累积的税惠。

sense.def: When you accumulate things or when they accumulate, they collect or are gathered over a period of time.

example.ex: Households accumulate wealth across a broad spectrum of assets...
example.tran: 家庭在以各种各样的资产形式积累财富。

example.ex: Lead can accumulate in the body until toxic levels are reached.
example.tran: 铅会在体内积聚直至造成铅中毒。

sense.def: An accumulation of something is a large number of things which have been collected together or acquired over a period of time.

example.ex: ...an accumulation of experience and knowledge.
example.tran: 经验和知识的积累

example.ex: ...accumulations of dirt.
example.tran: 积尘

sense.def: Accumulation is the collecting together of things over a period of time.

example.ex: ...the accumulation of capital and the distribution of income...
example.tran: 资本的积累和收入的分配

example.ex: The rate of accumulation decreases with time.
example.tran: 积累的速度随着时间变慢。

sense.def: If something is accumulative, it becomes greater in amount, number, or intensity over a period of time.

example.ex: The consensus is that risk factors have an accumulative effect.
example.tran: 危险因素会与日俱增已成为共识。

sense.def: The accuracy of information or measurements is their quality of being true or correct, even in small details.

example.ex: We cannot guarantee the accuracy of these figures.
example.tran: 我们不能保证这些数据的准确性。

sense.def: If someone or something performs a task, for example hitting a target, with accuracy, they do it in an exact way without making a mistake.

example.ex: ...weapons that could fire with accuracy at targets 3,000 yards away...
example.tran: 能准确无误地击中3,000码以外目标的武器

example.ex: Every bank pays close attention to the speed and accuracy of its staff.
example.tran: 每家银行都非常关注雇员的工作速度和无差错率。

sense.def: Accurate information, measurements, and statistics are correct to a very detailed level. An accurate instrument is able to give you information of this kind.
sense.tran: （信息、测量、数据或仪器等）精确的，准确的

example.ex: Police have stressed that this is the most accurate description of the killer to date...
example.tran: 警方强调这是迄今对凶手最精确的描述。

example.ex: This may provide a quick and accurate way of monitoring the amount of carbon dioxide in the air...
example.tran: 这也许能提供一个监测空气中二氧化碳含量的既快又准的方法。

example.ex: Quartz timepieces are very accurate, to a minute or two per year.
example.tran: 石英钟表走时非常准，年误差仅为一两分钟。

example.ex: The test can accurately predict what a bigger explosion would do.
example.tran: 该试验能准确地预测一次更大爆炸的威力。

sense.def: An accurate statement or account gives a true or fair judgment of something.

example.ex: I think it may take sometime before we can have an accurate assessment of the damage...
example.tran: 我认为我们对损失作出准确的估算可能需要一段时间。

example.ex: They were accurate in their prediction that he would change her life drastically.
example.tran: 他们预测得没错，他使她的生活发生了翻天覆地的变化。

example.ex: What many people mean by the word 'power' could be more accurately described as 'control'.
example.tran: 多数人所谓的“权力”，其实更确切地说是“控制”。

sense.def: You can use accurate to describe the results of someone's actions when they do or copy something correctly or exactly.

example.ex: Marks were given for accurate spelling and punctuation.
example.tran: 因拼写及标点正确而得分。

example.ex: ...his maliciously accurate imitation of Hubert de Burgh.
example.tran: 他对休伯特·德伯格到位的恶搞模仿

sense.def: An accurate weapon or throw reaches the exact point or target that it was intended to reach. You can also describe a person as accurate if they fire a weapon or throw something in this way.
sense.tran: （武器、投掷）精准的；（人）射击（或投掷）准的

example.ex: The rifle was extremely accurate...
example.tran: 这把步枪准头极高。

example.ex: The pilots, however, were not as accurate as they should be.
example.tran: 然而飞行员并不像他们该达到的水平那样精准。

example.ex: ...the technology to aim bombs accurately from aircraft.
example.tran: 高空精确投弹的技术

sense.def: Some people use accursed to describe something which they are very annoyed about.

example.ex: He commented that it was about time he left that accursed woman.
example.tran: 他说自己是时候离开那个恶女人了。

sense.def: If a person is accursed, they have been cursed.

sense.hdgr:
oft N that, N
of n/-ing
sense.def: If you make an accusation against someone, you criticize them or express the belief that they have done something wrong.

example.ex: Kim rejects accusations that Country music is over-sentimental...
example.tran: 对于乡村音乐过于感伤的指责，金表示反对。

example.ex: Another accusation levelled at the Minister is that he does not understand ordinary people...
example.tran: 另一个矛头则直指部长不懂得体恤百姓。

example.ex: She was surprised that he had no words of blame or accusation for her.
example.tran: 使她惊讶的是，他竟然没有对她说任何怪罪或指责的话。

sense.hdgr:
oft N
of n, N that
sense.def: An accusation is a statement or claim by a witness or someone in authority that a particular person has committed a crime, although this has not yet been proved.
sense.tran: （尚未证实的被控告的）罪名，罪状

example.ex: ...people who have made public accusations of rape...
example.tran: 公开指控强奸罪名的人们

example.ex: The government denied the accusation that it was involved in the murders.
example.tran: 政府否认了参与谋杀案的指控。

sense.def: In the grammar of some languages, the accusative, or the accusative case, is the case used for a noun when it is the direct object of a verb, or the object of some prepositions. In English, only the pronouns 'me', 'him', 'her', 'us', and 'them' are in the accusative.
An accusatory look, remark, or tone of voice suggests blame or criticism.
sense.tran: （眼神、话语、语气等）谴责的，指责的，非难的

example.ex: ...the accusatory tone of the questions.
example.tran: 提问中带刺

sense.def: If you accuse someone of doing something wrong or dishonest, you say or tell them that you believe that they did it.

example.ex: He was accusing my mum of having an affair with another man...
example.tran: 他指责我妈妈与另一个男人有染。

example.ex: Talk things through in stages. Do not accuse or apportion blame.
example.tran: 把事情按部就班地讲清楚。不要责难或归罪于人。

sense.def: If you are accused of a crime, a witness or someone in authority states or claims that you did it, and you may be formally charged with it and put on trial.

example.ex: Her assistant was accused of theft and fraud by the police...
example.tran: 她的助手被警方指控犯有盗窃和欺诈罪。

example.ex: All seven charges accused him of lying in his testimony...
example.tran: 七项罪名都指控他作伪证。

example.ex: The accused men have been given relatively light sentences.
example.tran: 被控告的这些男子受到相对较轻的判决。

sense.def: If someone stands accused of something, they have been accused of it.

example.ex: The candidate stands accused of breaking promises even before he's in office...
example.tran: 该候选人还未上任就遭指责违背诺言。

example.ex: Today, Rostov stands accused of extortion and racketeering.
example.tran: 今天罗斯托夫被控勒索和诈骗。

sense.def: You can use the accused to refer to a person or a group of people charged with a crime or on trial for it.

example.ex: The accused is alleged to be a member of a right-wing gang...
example.tran: 据称被告是某右翼组织的成员。

example.ex: The fifteen accused, young men from different parts of England, denied the charges.
example.tran: 被告是15名来自英格兰各地的年轻男子，他们对指控矢口否认。

sense.def: An accuser is a person who says that another person has done something wrong, especially that he or she has committed a crime.

example.ex: ...a criminal proceeding where defendants have the right to confront their accusers.
example.tran: 被告有权与原告对质的一种刑事诉讼

sense.def: If you look at someone with an accusing expression or speak to them in an accusing tone of voice, you are showing that you think they have done something wrong.

example.ex: The accusing look in her eyes conveyed her sense of betrayal.
example.tran: 她责备的眼神中流露出一种被骗的神情。

example.ex: 'Where have you been?' he asked Blake accusingly.
example.tran: “你去哪儿了？”他责问布莱克。

sense.def: If you accustom yourself or another person to something, you make yourself or them become used to it.

example.ex: The team has accustomed itself to the pace of first division rugby...
example.tran: 球队适应了英式橄榄球甲级联赛的节奏。

example.ex: Shakespeare has accustomed us to a mixture of humor and tragedy in the same play.
example.tran: 莎士比亚让我们习见了同一场戏目中的悲喜交错。

sense.def: If you are accustomed to something, you know it so well or have experienced it so often that it seems natural, unsurprising, or easy to deal with.

example.ex: I was accustomed to being the only child at a table full of adults...
example.tran: 我已经习惯了作为唯一一个小不点坐在一桌大人中间。

example.ex: She had not yet become accustomed to the fact that she was a rich woman.
example.tran: 她还不太适应已经是一个富婆的事实。

sense.def: When your eyes become accustomed to darkness or bright light, they adjust so that you start to be able to see things, after not being able to see properly at first.
sense.tran: （眼睛对光线变化）习惯了的,适应了的

example.ex: My eyes were becoming accustomed to the gloom.
example.tran: 我的眼睛渐渐适应了黑暗。

sense.def: You can use accustomed to describe an action that someone usually does, a quality that they usually show, or an object that they usually use.

example.ex: He took up his accustomed position with his back to the fire...
example.tran: 他背对着炉火在通常的位子上坐了下来。

example.ex: Freed acted with his accustomed shrewdness.
example.tran: 弗里德以他一贯的精明风范行动起来。

example.ex: ...his accustomed glass of whisky.
example.tran: 他惯喝的一杯威士忌

sense.def: An ace is a playing card with a single symbol on it. In most card games, the ace of a particular suit has either the highest or the lowest value of the cards in that suit.

example.ex: ...the ace of hearts.
example.tran: 红桃A

sense.hdgr: usu with supp, oft n N
sense.def: If you describe someone such as a sports player as an ace, you mean that they are very good at what they do.
sense.tran: （在运动等方面）成绩超群的人，佼佼者

example.ex: ...former motor-racing ace Stirling Moss.
example.tran: 前一流赛车手斯特林·莫斯

example.ex: ...ace horror-film producer Lawrence Woolsey.
example.tran: 王牌恐怖片制片人劳伦斯·伍尔西

sense.def: If you say that something is ace, you think that it is good and you like it a lot.

example.ex: ...a really ace film.
example.tran: 精彩绝伦的电影

sense.def: In tennis, an ace is a serve which is so fast that the other player cannot reach the ball.

example.ex: The American served three aces in the opening game of the set.
example.tran: 这位美国选手在该盘首局有三次发球直得。

sense.def: If you say that someone holds all the aces, you mean that they have all the advantages in a contest or situation.
sense.tran: 占绝对优势；占尽天时地利人和

example.ex: 'When I was an adolescent,' says a thirty-one-year-old man, 'I thought girls held all the aces.'
example.tran: “当我还是个毛头小伙儿时，”一个31岁的男人说，“我觉得完全是女孩子说了算。”

sense.def: Something that is an ace in the hole is an advantage which you have over an opponent or rival, and which you can use if necessary.
sense.tran: 秘藏的王牌;应急的绝招;锦囊妙计

example.ex: Our superior technology is our ace in the hole.
example.tran: 我们超众的技术是我们的法宝。

sense.def: If you come within an ace of doing something, or you are within an ace of doing something, you very nearly do or experience it.

example.ex: He was intent on murder and he came within an ace of succeeding.
example.tran: 他一心想杀人并且差点就得逞了。

sense.def: Acerbic humour is critical and direct.

example.ex: He was acclaimed for his acerbic wit and repartee...
example.tran: 他以一针见血的妙语巧辩而备受好评。

example.ex: His lyrics are as acerbic and poignant as they ever have been.
example.tran: 他的歌词一如既往的犀利辛辣。

sense.def: Acerbity is a kind of bitter, critical humour.
Acetate is a shiny artificial material, sometimes used for making clothes or records.
Acetic acid is a colourless acid. It is the main substance in vinegar.
Acetone is a type of solvent.
Acetylene is a colourless gas which burns with a very hot bright flame. It is often used in lamps and for cutting and welding metal.
sense.tran: 乙炔，电石气（一种无色可燃气体，有高热烈焰，常用于灯具照明、切割和焊接金属等）

sense.def: If you ache or a part of your body aches, you feel a steady, fairly strong pain.

example.ex: Her head was throbbing and she ached all over...
example.tran: 她的脑袋嗡嗡作响并且浑身疼痛。

example.ex: My leg still aches when I sit down...
example.tran: 坐下时我的腿还会痛。

example.ex: The weary walkers soothed their aching feet in the sea.
example.tran: 走累了的人们把脚伸进海水中浸泡以缓解疼痛。

sense.hdgr:
usu with supp, oft N
in n, n N
sense.def: An ache is a steady, fairly strong pain in a part of your body.
sense.tran: （身体某部位持续且较强烈的)疼痛

example.ex: You feel nausea and aches in your muscles...
example.tran: 症状为恶心和肌肉疼痛。

example.ex: Poor posture can cause neck ache, headaches and breathing problems.
example.tran: 姿势不当会导致颈部疼痛、头痛和呼吸困难。

sense.def: If you ache for something or your heart aches, you want something very much, and feel very unhappy because you cannot have it.
sense.tran: 渴望（且因得不到而痛苦）

example.ex: She still ached for the lost intimacy and sexual contact of marriage...
example.tran: 她仍旧渴望拥有婚姻中逝去的那份缱绻和肌肤之亲。

example.ex: But Spain was a country aching to get away from its past...
example.tran: 但西班牙是一个渴望摆脱以往形象的国家。

example.ex: It was quite an achievement to keep smiling when his heart must have been aching.
example.tran: 虽然经受着内心的煎熬，但他仍强作欢颜，这实属不易。

example.ex: You also feel an overwhelming ache for support from others which you cannot put into words.
example.tran: 你还会感受到一种无以言表的想要获得他人支持的渴望。

sense.def: You can use aches and pains to refer in a general way to any minor pains that you feel in your body.

example.ex: It seems to ease all the aches and pains of a hectic and tiring day.
example.tran: 繁忙劳碌了一天所带来的周身酸痛似乎被一扫而空。

sense.def: If you say that something you are trying to do is achievable, you mean that it is possible for you to succeed in doing it.

example.ex: A 50% market share is achievable...
example.tran: 50%的市场份额是可以实现的。

example.ex: It is often a good idea to start with smaller, easily achievable goals.
example.tran: 一开始把目标定得低一点、容易实现一点，总不失为一个好主意。

sense.def: If you achieve a particular aim or effect, you succeed in doing it or causing it to happen, usually after a lot of effort.

example.ex: There are many who will work hard to achieve these goals...
example.tran: 有志之士将会共同为实现这些目标而努力。

example.ex: We have achieved what we set out to do.
example.tran: 我们已经达成了原初的目标。

sense.def: An achievement is something which someone has succeeded in doing, especially after a lot of effort.

example.ex: Reaching this agreement so quickly was a great achievement...
example.tran: 如此快速达成这项协定是一大伟绩。

example.ex: The Conference will be a celebration of women's achievements.
example.tran: 该会议将成为对女性成就的一曲赞歌。

sense.def: Achievement is the process of achieving something.

example.ex: Only the achievement of these goals will bring lasting peace.
example.tran: 只有达成这些目标才会带来持久的和平。

sense.def: A high achiever is someone who is successful in their studies or their work, usually as a result of their efforts. A low achiever is someone who achieves less than those around them.
sense.tran: （学业或事业上）达到（特定程度）成就（或成绩）的人

example.ex: High achievers will receive cash bonuses...
example.tran: 业绩出众的人会获得现金奖励。

example.ex: In school, he was not one of the achievers.
example.tran: 上学时他不属于拔尖的那类。

example.ex: ...a way to keep low achievers from dropping out.
example.tran: 防止落后生放弃学业的方法

sense.def: Someone's Achilles heel is the weakest point in their character or nature, where it is easiest for other people to attack or criticize them.
sense.tran: 阿喀琉斯的脚踵；致命弱点

example.ex: Horton's Achilles heel was that he could not delegate.
example.tran: 霍顿的软肋在于他不懂得放权。

sense.def: Your Achilles tendon or your Achilles is the tendon inside the back of your leg just above your heel.
You can use achingly for emphasis when you are referring to things that create feelings of wanting something very much, but of not being able to have it.

example.ex: ...three achingly beautiful ballads.
example.tran: 3首凄美的民谣

sense.def: If you feel achy, your body hurts.

example.ex: I feel achy all over.
example.tran: 我浑身疼痛。

sense.def: An acid is a chemical substance, usually a liquid, which contains hydrogen and can react with other substances to form salts. Some acids burn or dissolve other substances that they come into contact with.

example.ex: ...citric acid...
example.tran: 柠檬酸

example.ex: Acids in the stomach destroy the virus.
example.tran: 胃酸能杀死病毒。

sense.def: An acid substance contains acid.

example.ex: These shrubs must have an acid, lime-free soil.
example.tran: 这些灌木必须生长在不含石灰的酸性土壤环境。

example.ex: ...the acidity of rainwater.
example.tran: 雨水的酸性

sense.def: An acid fruit or drink has a sour or sharp taste.

example.ex: These wines may taste rather hard and somewhat acid.
example.tran: 这些酒可能喝着比较冲并且有股酸味。

example.ex: ...a finely balanced wine with ripe acidity and soft fruit flavours.
example.tran: 融合了芳醇的酸味和柔和的水果口味的调味精致的酒

sense.def: An acid remark, or acid humour, is very unkind or critical.

example.ex: This comedy of contemporary manners is told with compassion and acid humour.
example.tran: 这部当代风尚喜剧杂糅了悲悯的情怀和尖酸的幽默。

rnon.hdgr: usu ADV with v, also ADV adj

example.ex: 'You don't know how to be a mother and you never did,' she said acidly.
example.tran: “你不知道怎样做一位母亲，而且你从来就没有知道过，”她刻薄地说。

sense.def: The drug LSD is sometimes referred to as acid .
Acid house is a type of electronic dance music with a strong, repeated rhythm.
sense.tran: 迷幻浩室音乐（一种节奏反复有力的电子舞曲）

sense.def: Acidic substances contain acid.

example.ex: Dissolved carbon dioxide makes the water more acidic.
example.tran: 二氧化碳溶解后能使水的酸性增加。

sense.def: An acidic taste is sour and sharp.

example.ex: If the sprouts smell, or taste, mouldy or acidic do not eat them.
example.tran: 如果甘蓝闻着或吃着有霉味或酸味，请勿食用。

sense.def: Acid rain is rain polluted by acid that has been released into the atmosphere from factories and other industrial processes. Acid rain is harmful to the environment.
The acid test of something is an important aspect or result that it might have, which allows you to decide whether it is true or successful.
sense.tran: 决定性的试验；严峻的考验

example.ex: The acid test of a school is 'would you send your own children there?'
example.tran: “你会将自己的孩子送去那里吗？”这一问题是衡量一所学校的试金石。

sense.def: If you acknowledge a fact or a situation, you accept or admit that it is true or that it exists.

example.ex: Naylor acknowledged, in a letter to the judge, that he was a drug addict...
example.tran: 内勒在给法官的信中承认自己吸毒。

example.ex: Belatedly, the government has acknowledged the problem...
example.tran: 政府迟迟才承认了该问题。

example.gram:
Also V n to-inf, V n
as n/adj
example.ex: There is an acknowledged risk of lung cancer from radon.
example.tran: 氡被认为有诱发肺癌的危险。

sense.def: If someone's achievements, status, or qualities are acknowledged, they are known about and recognized by a lot of people, or by a particular group of people.
sense.tran: 公认，认可（某人的成就、地位、品质等）

example.ex: He is also acknowledged as an excellent goalkeeper...
example.tran: 他也被公认为是一名出色的守门员。

example.ex: Some of the clergy refused to acknowledge the new king's legitimacy.
example.tran: 一部分神职人员拒绝承认新国王的合法地位。

sense.def: If you acknowledge a message or letter, you write to the person who sent it in order to say that you have received it.
sense.tran: 告知（信函等）的收到;确认…收悉

example.ex: The army sent me a postcard acknowledging my request.
example.tran: 军队寄给我一张明信片告知我的申请书已收到。

sense.def: If you acknowledge someone, for example by moving your head or smiling, you show that you have seen and recognized them.
sense.tran: （以点头、微笑等）向…打招呼，理会

example.ex: He saw her but refused to even acknowledge her.
example.tran: 他看见了她，却连招呼也不打。

sense.def: If you acknowledge someone's applause, compliments, or kindness you make a gesture in order to thank them or show your appreciation.
sense.tran: （对掌声、赞扬、好意等作出姿态表示）感谢

example.ex: Doran stuck his head out of the window to acknowledge the cheering...
example.tran: 多兰将头探出窗户向欢呼的人们致谢。

example.ex: She never even acknowledged the man who opened the door for her...
example.tran: 她对为自己开门的男士甚至连一点表示都没有。

example.ex: He acknowledged the applause with a small bow.
example.tran: 他微微地鞠了一躬表示对掌声的感谢。

sense.hdgr:
also no det, usu with supp, oft N that, N
of n
sense.def: An acknowledgement is a statement or action which recognizes that something exists or is true.

example.ex: The President's resignation appears to be an acknowledgment that he has lost all hope of keeping the country together...
example.tran: 总统的辞职似乎表明他对维护国家稳定已不抱任何希望。

example.ex: He appreciated her acknowledgement of his maturity.
example.tran: 她承认他的成熟，他对此心怀感激。

sense.def: The acknowledgements in a book are the section in which the author thanks all the people who have helped him or her.
A gesture of acknowledgement, such as a smile, shows someone that you have seen and recognized them.
sense.tran: 打招呼的表示（如微笑等）

example.ex: Farling smiled in acknowledgement and gave a bow...
example.tran: 法林微笑示意，又躬身行了个礼。

example.ex: Mitzi nodded a perfunctory acknowledgement as her glass was filled.
example.tran: 杯子被倒满时米芝敷衍性地点头示意。

sense.def: An acknowledgement is a published statement in which you express your gratitude for or appreciation of something.

example.ex: The benefit to the donor was an acknowledgment of the donation in a printed bulletin...
example.tran: 捐赠者被印入捐赠公示榜以示感谢。

example.ex: Grateful acknowledgment is made for permission to reprint.
example.tran: 为获准重印致以深切感谢。

sense.def: An acknowledgement is a letter or message that you receive from someone, telling you that something you have sent to them has arrived.
sense.tran: （表示已收到信函等的）确认通知，收件复函

example.ex: I have received neither an acknowledgment nor a reply.
example.tran: 我未收到任何复函或答复。

sense.def: The acme of something is its highest point of achievement or excellence.
sense.tran: 最高点；顶点；顶峰时刻；顶峰阶段

example.ex: His work is considered the acme of cinematic art.
example.tran: 他的作品被认为是电影艺术的巅峰之作。

sense.def: If someone has acne, they have a skin condition which causes a lot of spots on their face and neck.
An acolyte is a follower or assistant of an important person.

example.ex: Richard Brome, an acolyte of Ben Jonson's, wrote 'The Jovial Crew' in 1641...
example.tran: 本·琼森的仆人理查德·布罗姆在1641年写了《一伙快活人》。

example.ex: To his acolytes, he is known simply as 'the Boss'.
example.tran: 他被手下人简称为“老板”。

sense.def: An acolyte is someone who assists a priest in performing certain religious services.

example.ex: When the barge reached the shrine, acolytes removed the pall.
example.tran: 当驳船抵达圣地时，辅祭除去了柩衣。

sense.def: An acorn is a pale oval nut that is the fruit of an oak tree.
An acoustic guitar or other instrument is one whose sound is produced without any electrical equipment.
sense.tran: （吉他等乐器）原声的，自然声的，不用电传音的

example.ex: ...acoustically based music.
example.tran: 以原声为基调的音乐

sense.def: If you refer to the acoustics or the acoustic of a space, you are referring to the structural features which determine how well you can hear music or speech in it.

example.ex: In this performance, Rattle had the acoustic of the Symphony Hall on his side.
example.tran: 这场演出中，拉特尔有交响乐大厅出色的音响效果做他的后盾。

example.ex: The church is acoustically perfect.
example.tran: 这座教堂收音效果极佳。

sense.def: Acoustics is the scientific study of sound.
Acoustic means relating to sound or hearing.

example.ex: ...acoustic signals.
example.tran: 声音信号

sense.def: If you acquaint someone with something, you tell them about it so that they know it. If you acquaint yourself with something, you learn about it.

example.ex: ...efforts to acquaint the public with their rights under the new law...
example.tran: 为使公众熟悉新法律所赋予的权利而作出的努力

example.ex: I want to acquaint myself with your strengths and weaknesses.
example.tran: 我想知道你有哪些长处以及不足。

sense.def: An acquaintance is someone who you have met and know slightly, but not well.

example.ex: The proprietor was an old acquaintance of his...
example.tran: 业主是他的一位旧相识。

example.ex: I have a large circle of friends and acquaintances engaged in photography.
example.tran: 我在摄影界交游甚广。

sense.hdgr:
oft poss N, N
with n,
on N
sense.def: If you have an acquaintance with someone, you have met them and you know them.

example.ex: ...a writer who becomes involved in a real murder mystery through his acquaintance with a police officer...
example.tran: 因为认识一位警官而参与到一件真实谋杀悬案调查的作家

example.ex: On first acquaintance she is cool and slightly distant.
example.tran: 初次相见时她表现冷淡并有点爱搭不理。

sense.hdgr:
usu with supp, oft N
with n
sense.def: Your acquaintance with a subject is your knowledge or experience of it.

example.ex: They had little or no acquaintance with philosophy or history...
example.tran: 他们在哲学或是历史方面几乎一无所知。

sense.def: When you make someone's acquaintance, you meet them for the first time and get to know them a little.
sense.tran: 与（某人）初次相识;结识(某人)

example.ex: I first made his acquaintance in the early 1960s...
example.tran: 我与他初次相识是在20世纪60年代早期。

example.ex: I am so pleased to make your acquaintance, Mr Tweed.
example.tran: 很高兴认识您，特威德先生。

sense.def: A person of your acquaintance is someone who you have met and know.

example.ex: ...a highly cultivated woman of our acquaintance.
example.tran: 我们认识的一位很有修养的女性

sense.def: If you are acquainted with something, you know about it because you have learned it or experienced it.

example.ex: He was well acquainted with the literature of France, Germany and Holland...
example.tran: 他对于法国、德国和荷兰的文学了如指掌。

example.ex: I am also looking forward to getting more acquainted with immigration law.
example.tran: 我也期待能对移民法有更多的了解。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, usu ADJ
with n
sense.def: If you are acquainted with someone, you have met them and you know them. You can also say that two people are acquainted.

example.ex: No-one personally acquainted with the couple was permitted to talk to the Press...
example.tran: 任何与这对夫妇有私交的人都不准和新闻界谈话。

example.ex: It's true we were acquainted, but no more than that.
example.tran: 我们的确认识，但仅此而已。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
with n
sense.def: If you get or become acquainted with someone that you do not know, you talk to each other or do something together so that you get to know each other. You can also say that two people get or become acquainted .

example.ex: The meetings were a way to get acquainted with each other.
example.tran: 这些会议是一种相互结交的途径。

example.ex: ...an opportunity for the leaders to become better acquainted.
example.tran: 增进领导人之间相互了解的机会

sense.def: If you acquiesce in something, you agree to do what someone wants or to accept what they do.

example.ex: Steve seemed to acquiesce in the decision...
example.tran: 史蒂夫好像默认了这个决定。

example.ex: He has gradually acquiesced to the demands of the opposition...
example.tran: 他渐渐顺从了反对派的要求。

example.ex: When her mother suggested that she stay, Alice willingly acquiesced.
example.tran: 当母亲建议她留下时，艾丽斯欣然允之。

sense.hdgr:
with supp, oft N
in/to n
sense.def: Acquiescence is agreement to do what someone wants, or acceptance of what they do even though you do not agree with it.

example.ex: Deirdre smiled her acquiescence...
example.tran: 戴尔德丽微笑着表示同意。

example.ex: Fear of rapid social change made temporary acquiescence in slavery tolerable in the South.
example.tran: 对飞速的社会变革的恐惧使得南部对奴隶制暂时的默许变得可以忍受。

sense.def: Someone who is acquiescent is ready to agree to do what someone wants, or to accept what they do.

example.ex: Perhaps you are too acquiescent.
example.tran: 可能你太顺从了。

sense.def: If you acquire something, you buy or obtain it for yourself, or someone gives it to you.

example.ex: General Motors acquired a 50% stake in Saab for about $400m...
example.tran: 通用汽车公司以大约4亿美元的价格购得了萨博汽车公司50%的股份。

example.ex: I recently acquired some wood from a holly tree...
example.tran: 最近我从一棵冬青树上弄了些木料。

example.ex: She was sitting in her newly-acquired wheelchair.
example.tran: 她正坐在新买的轮椅上。

sense.def: If you acquire something such as a skill or a habit, you learn it, or develop it through your daily life or experience.

example.ex: I've never acquired a taste for wine...
example.tran: 我一向喝不惯葡萄酒。

example.ex: Having read the book, she will be able to pass on the acquired knowledge to trainee teachers.
example.tran: 读完此书，她便能将从书中所得传授给实习教师。

sense.def: If someone or something acquires a certain reputation, they start to have that reputation.

example.ex: He has acquired a reputation as this country's premier solo violinist.
example.tran: 他已经赢得了该国首席小提琴独奏家的名誉。

sense.def: If you describe something as an acquired taste, you mean that a lot of people do not like it when they first experience it, but often start to like it more when they get to know it better.
sense.tran: 后天养成的爱好;培养出来的兴趣

example.ex: Broad beans are very much an acquired taste...
example.tran: 要慢慢适应才能吃得惯蚕豆。

example.ex: Living alone is an acquired taste.
example.tran: 独处是一种修得的境界。

sense.def: Acquired immune deficiency syndrome is the same as AIDS .
In business, an acquirer is a company or person who buys another company.

example.ex: ...the ability of corporate acquirers to finance large takeovers.
example.tran: 公司收购者们为大规模并购融资的能力

sense.def: If a company or business person makes an acquisition, they buy another company or part of a company.

example.ex: ...the acquisition of a profitable paper recycling company.
example.tran: 对一家效益好的纸张回收公司的收购

example.ex: ...the number of mergers and acquisitions made by Europe's 1,000 leading firms.
example.tran: 欧洲1,000家龙头企业的合并和收购案例的数目

sense.def: If you make an acquisition, you buy or obtain something, often to add to things that you already have.

example.ex: How did you go about making this marvellous acquisition then?
example.tran: 那么你是怎么买到这一绝品的？

example.ex: ...the President's recent acquisition of a helicopter.
example.tran: 总统最近添置的直升机

sense.def: You can use acquisition to refer to an object that you buy or obtain, often to add to things that you already have.

example.ex: From her wardrobe Laura took her latest acquisition, a bright red dress.
example.tran: 劳拉从衣柜里拿出了她最近的购物战果，一件鲜红色连衣裙。

sense.def: The acquisition of a skill or a particular type of knowledge is the process of learning it or developing it.

example.ex: ...language acquisition.
example.tran: 语言习得

sense.def: If you describe a person or an organization as acquisitive, you do not approve of them because you think they are too concerned with getting new possessions.
sense.tran: 渴望得到的;迫切求取的;贪婪的

example.ex: We live in an acquisitive society...
example.tran: 我们生活在一个物欲横流的社会。

example.ex: The most acquisitive firms tend to be engineering groups.
example.tran: 最贪得无厌的公司往往是工程队。

example.ex: His villa is filled with evidence of his acquisitiveness.
example.tran: 他的别墅里满是他贪婪成性的证据。

sense.def: If someone is acquitted of a crime in a court of law, they are formally declared not to have committed the crime.

example.ex: Mr Ling was acquitted of disorderly behaviour by magistrates.
example.tran: 地方法官宣判林先生扰乱治安罪名不成立。

sense.def: If you acquit yourself well or admirably in a particular situation, other people feel that you have behaved well or admirably.

example.ex: Most officers and men acquitted themselves well throughout the action.
example.tran: 大多数军官及士兵在整个战斗中表现出色。

sense.def: Acquittal is a formal declaration in a court of law that someone who has been accused of a crime is innocent.

example.ex: ...the acquittal of six police officers charged with beating a suspect...
example.tran: 对6名被控殴打嫌犯的警官作出的无罪判决

example.ex: The jury voted 8-to-4 in favor of acquittal...
example.tran: 陪审团以8比4的投票结果赞成无罪判决。

example.ex: The trial resulted in acquittals on all but one count.
example.tran: 审判结果是除一项罪名之外其他罪名都不成立。

sense.def: An acre is an area of land measuring 4840 square yards or 4047 square metres.
sense.tran: 英亩（等于4,840平方码或4,047平方米）

example.ex: The property is set in two acres of land.
example.tran: 这座房产占地两英亩。

sense.def: Acreage is a large area of farm land.
sense.tran: （一大片）耕地;（以英亩计的）土地面积

example.ex: He has sown coffee on part of his acreage...
example.tran: 他在自家的部分耕地里种上了咖啡。

example.ex: Enormous acreages of soya beans are grown in the United States.
example.tran: 美国种植着大片的大豆。

sense.def: An acrid smell or taste is strong and sharp, and usually unpleasant.
sense.tran: （气味或味道）辛辣的，苦的，刺激的

example.ex: The room filled with the acrid smell of tobacco...
example.tran: 房间里弥漫着刺鼻的烟草味。

example.ex: The plant has an unpleasant odour and an acrid taste.
example.tran: 这种植物闻着刺鼻，吃着辣口。

sense.def: Acrimonious words or quarrels are bitter and angry.

example.ex: There followed an acrimonious debate.
example.tran: 接着是一场唇枪舌剑的争辩。

example.ex: Our relationship ended acrimoniously.
example.tran: 我们愤然绝交。

sense.def: Acrimony is bitter and angry words or quarrels.
sense.tran: 尖刻的言辞；激烈的争吵

example.ex: The council's first meeting ended in acrimony.
example.tran: 委员会的首次会议以激烈的争吵而告结束。

sense.def: An acrobat is an entertainer who performs difficult physical acts such as jumping and balancing, especially in a circus.
An acrobatic movement or display involves difficult physical acts such as jumping and balancing, especially in a circus.

example.ex: He performed a sensational acrobatic feat.
example.tran: 他表演了一套惊人的杂技功夫。

sense.def: Acrobatics are acrobatic movements.
sense.tran: 杂技；杂技表演；杂技技艺

sense.def: An acronym is a word composed of the first letters of the words in a phrase, especially when this is used as a name. An example of an acronym is NATO which is made up of the first letters of the 'North Atlantic Treaty Organization'.
sense.tran: （尤用作名称）首字母缩拼词，首字母缩略词

boxx.note: In addition to the uses shown below, across is used in phrasal verbs such as ‘come across’, ‘get across’, and ‘put across’.
boxx.tran: 除下列用法外，across还可用于come across, get across和put across等短语动词中。

sense.def: If someone or something goes across a place or a boundary, they go from one side of it to the other.

example.ex: She walked across the floor and lay down on the bed...
example.tran: 她走过地板躺在了床上。

example.ex: He watched Karl run across the street to Tommy.
example.tran: 他看着卡尔向街对面的汤米跑去。

example.ex: ...an expedition across Africa.
example.tran: 横穿非洲的探险

posc.hdgr:
ADV after v, usu ADV
from n

example.ex: Richard stood up and walked across to the window.
example.tran: 理查德站起身走到了窗边。

sense.def: If something is situated or stretched across something else, it is situated or stretched from one side of it to the other.

example.ex: ...the floating bridge across Lake Washington in Seattle...
example.tran: 横跨在西雅图华盛顿湖上的浮桥

example.ex: He scrawled his name across the bill...
example.tran: 他在账单上草草地签了名。

example.ex: Lucy had strung a banner across the wall saying 'Welcome Home Daddy'.
example.tran: 露西在墙上挂了一条横幅，上面写着“欢迎爸爸回家”。

example.ex: Trim toenails straight across using nail clippers.
example.tran: 用指甲刀逐个修剪脚趾甲。

sense.def: If something is lying across an object or place, it is resting on it and partly covering it.

example.ex: She found her clothes lying across the chair...
example.tran: 她发现自己的衣服堆放在椅子上。

example.ex: The wind pushed his hair across his face.
example.tran: 他的发丝随风拂面。

sense.def: Something that is across something such as a street, river, or area is on the other side of it.

example.ex: Anyone from the houses across the road could see him...
example.tran: 马路对面房子里的任何一个人都能看见他。

example.ex: When I saw you across the room I knew I'd met you before.
example.tran: 我在房间那头看见你时就知道我曾见过你。

example.ex: They parked across from the Castro Theatre...
example.tran: 他们将车停在了卡斯特罗剧院对面。

example.ex: He pulled up a chair and sat down across from Michael.
example.tran: 他拉过一把椅子，坐在了迈克尔的对面。

sense.hdgr: ADV after v, oft ADV prep
sense.def: If you look across at a place, person, or thing, you look towards them.

example.ex: He glanced across at his sleeping wife...
example.tran: 他朝熟睡的妻子看了一眼。

example.ex: She rose from the chair and gazed across at him.
