example.tran: 她从椅子上站起身，远远地看着他。

example.ex: ...breathtaking views across to the hills.
example.tran: 山那边令人叹为观止的美景

sense.def: You use across to say that a particular expression is shown on someone's face.

example.ex: An enormous grin spread across his face...
example.tran: 他咧着大嘴笑了。

example.ex: For a moment a shadow seemed to pass across Roy's face.
example.tran: 一瞬间罗伊脸上似乎闪过一丝忧伤。

sense.def: If someone hits you across the face or head, they hit you on that part.

example.ex: Graham hit him across the face with the gun.
example.tran: 格雷厄姆用枪击打他的脸部。

sense.def: When something happens across a place or organization, it happens equally everywhere within it.

example.ex: The film 'Hook' opens across America on December 11...
example.tran: 电影《铁钩船长》12月11日在美国全线上映。

example.ex: Thousands of farmers from across Europe have held a huge demonstration in the centre of Brussels...
example.tran: 来自欧洲各地的数千农民在布鲁塞尔市中心举行了大规模的示威游行。

example.ex: 2,000 workers across all state agencies are to be fired by March 31st.
example.tran: 2,000名分属各个国家机关的工作人员将在3月31日前被解雇。

sense.def: When something happens across a political, religious, or social barrier, it involves people in different groups.
sense.tran: 超越，跨越（政治、宗教、社会隔阂等）

example.ex: ...parties competing across the political spectrum...
example.tran: 政治纷争中的各党派

example.ex: We want to promote cosmetics that appeal across the colour barrier.
example.tran: 我们想推销各种肤色的人都喜欢的化妆品。

sense.def: Across is used in measurements to show the width of something.

example.ex: This hand-decorated plate measures 30cm across...
example.tran: 这个手绘盘子直径为30厘米。

example.ex: The snails are no larger than one centimetre across.
example.tran: 这些蜗牛体宽不超过1厘米。

sense.def: Acrylic material is artificial and is manufactured by a chemical process.
Acrylics or acrylic paint is a type of paint used by artists.

example.ex: I use watercolours much less than I do oils or acrylics.
example.tran: 我用水彩比用油画颜料或丙烯酸颜料要少得多。

sense.def: When you act, you do something for a particular purpose.

example.ex: The deaths occurred when police acted to stop widespread looting and vandalism...
example.tran: 警方采取行动制止猖狂的打砸抢行为时有多人丧生。

example.ex: I do not doubt that the bank acted properly.
example.tran: 我毫不怀疑银行的处理方式是妥当的。

sense.def: If you act on advice or information, you do what has been advised or suggested.

example.ex: A patient will usually listen to the doctor's advice and act on it.
example.tran: 患者通常都会遵照医嘱行事。

sense.def: If someone acts in a particular way, they behave in that way.

example.ex: ...a gang of youths who were acting suspiciously...
example.tran: 一伙形迹可疑的年轻人

example.ex: He acted as if he hadn't heard any of it...
example.tran: 他表现得好像对此毫不知情。

example.ex: Open wounds act like a magnet to flies.
example.tran: 裸露的伤口很招苍蝇。

sense.def: If someone or something acts as a particular thing, they have that role or function.

example.ex: He acted both as the ship's surgeon and as chaplain for the men.
example.tran: 他在船上为水手们兼作外科医生和牧师。

example.ex: ...the Cunard Princess, which acted as a support ship for American forces.
example.tran: 用作美军支援船的公主号冠达邮轮

sense.def: If someone acts in a particular way, they pretend to be something that they are not.

example.ex: Chris acted astonished as he examined the note...
example.tran: 克里斯检查记录时故作震惊状。

example.ex: Kenworthy had tried not to act the policeman.
example.tran: 肯沃西努力表现得不像个警察。

sense.def: When professionals such as lawyers act for you, or act on your behalf, they are employed by you to deal with a particular matter.

example.ex: ...the law firm that acted for Diana during her marriage split...
example.tran: 在戴安娜婚姻破裂期间为她做代理的法律事务所

example.ex: Because we travelled so much, Sam and I asked a broker to act on our behalf.
example.tran: 由于我们经常游历在外，我和萨姆便请了一位经纪人代表我们处理事务。

sense.def: If a force or substance acts on someone or something, it has a certain effect on them.

example.ex: He's taking a dangerous drug: it acts very fast on the central nervous system...
example.tran: 他正在服用一种危险的药物：这种药物能很快影响到中枢神经系统。

example.ex: A hypnotist can act upon the unconscious mind directly.
example.tran: 催眠师能直接作用于无意识思维。

sense.def: If you act, or act a part in a play or film, you have a part in it.

example.ex: She confessed to her parents her desire to act...
example.tran: 她向父母坦言了自己想演戏的愿望。

example.ex: She acted in her first film when she was 13 years old.
example.tran: 13岁时她出演了她的电影处女作。

sense.def: An act is a single thing that someone does.

example.ex: Language interpretation is the whole point of the act of reading...
example.tran: 阅读行为中关键在于对语言的理解。

example.ex: My insurance excludes acts of sabotage and damage done by weapons of war.
example.tran: 我购买的保险对于蓄意损坏以及战争中武器造成的损坏不予赔偿。

sense.def: If you say that someone's behaviour is an act, you mean that it does not express their real feelings.

example.ex: There were moments when I wondered: did she do this on purpose, was it all just a game, an act?...
example.tran: 有时我很困惑：她这么做是故意的吗？难道一切都只是一场游戏，是逢场作戏？

example.ex: His anger was real. It wasn't an act.
example.tran: 他是真的生气了，不是在摆样子。

sense.def: An Act is a law passed by the government.

example.ex: ...an Act of Parliament.
example.tran: 议会法案

sense.def: An act in a play, opera, or ballet is one of the main parts into which it is divided.

example.ex: Act II contained one of the funniest scenes I have ever witnessed...
example.tran: 第二幕里有我看过的最搞笑的场面之一。

sense.def: An act in a show is a short performance which is one of several in the show.

example.ex: This year numerous bands are playing, as well as comedy acts...
example.tran: 今年除了那些搞笑短剧外，还会有众多乐队登台献艺。

phrase.def: If you catch someone in the act, you discover them doing something wrong or committing a crime.

example.ex: The men were caught in the act of digging up buried explosives.
example.tran: 那些人在挖掘掩埋的爆炸物时被逮个正着。

phrase.def: If someone who has been behaving badly cleans up their act, they start to behave in a more acceptable or responsible way.

example.ex: The nation's advertisers need to clean up their act.
example.tran: 该国的广告商需要规范自己的行为。

phrase.def: If you get in on the act, you take part in or take advantage of something that was started by someone else.
phrase.tran: （为了得到好处等）参与，插一手

example.ex: In the 1970s Kodak, anxious to get in on the act, launched its own instant camera.
example.tran: 20世纪70年代，急于分一杯羹的柯达公司推出了自己的拍立得相机。

phrase.def: You say that someone was in the act of doing something to indicate what they were doing when they were seen or interrupted.

example.ex: Ken was in the act of paying his bill when Neil came up behind him.
example.tran: 当尼尔从后面走过来时，肯正在付账。

phrase.def: If you get your act together, you organize your life or your affairs so that you are able to achieve what you want or to deal with something effectively.
phrase.tran: 全力以赴；集中精力；劲儿往一处使

example.ex: The Government should get its act together...
example.tran: 政府应该集中力量。

example.ex: We have to get our act together — we have to organize ourselves.
example.tran: 我们必须把劲儿往一处使——我们得组织起来。

sense.def: If you act out an event which has happened, you copy the actions which took place and make them into a play.

example.ex: I used to come home and act out the movie for the kids.
example.tran: 以前到家后，我会把电影内容再表演给孩子们看。

sense.def: If something is acting up, it is not working properly.

example.ex: She was messing with the coffee pot, which was acting up again.
example.tran: 她正在鼓捣咖啡壶，那壶又坏了。

sense.def: If a child is acting up, they are behaving badly.

example.ex: I could hear Jonathan acting up downstairs.
example.tran: 我能听见乔纳森在楼下撒泼。

sense.def: Acting is the activity or profession of performing in plays or films.

example.ex: She pursued an acting career after four years of modelling.
example.tran: 当了4年的模特之后她踏上了演艺之路。

sense.def: You use acting before the title of a job to indicate that someone is doing that job temporarily.

example.ex: ...the new acting President.
example.tran: 新任代总统

sense.def: Action is doing something for a particular purpose.

example.ex: The government is taking emergency action to deal with a housing crisis...
example.tran: 政府正采取紧急措施解决住房危机。

example.ex: What was needed, he said, was decisive action to halt what he called these savage crimes.
example.tran: 他说，当务之急就是采取果断行动制止他所称的“这些野蛮罪行”。

sense.def: An action is something that you do on a particular occasion.

example.ex: As always, Peter had a reason for his action...
example.tran: 一如往常，彼得对自己的行为总有说辞。

example.ex: Jack was the sort of man who did not like his actions questioned.
example.tran: 杰克是那种不喜欢别人质疑自己行为的人。

sense.def: To bring a legal action against someone means to bring a case against them in a court of law.

example.ex: Two leading law firms are to prepare legal actions against tobacco companies.
example.tran: 两家很有名的律师事务所准备向烟草公司提起诉讼。

example.ex: ...a libel action brought by one of France's bureaucrats.
example.tran: 由法国的一名官员提起的诽谤诉讼

sense.def: The action of a chemical is the way in which it works, or the effects that it has.

example.ex: Her description of the nature and action of poisons is amazingly accurate.
example.tran: 他对一些毒药的性质和作用的描述惊人地准确。

sense.def: The action is all the important and exciting things that are happening in a situation.
sense.tran: 激动人心（或重要）的大事

example.ex: Hollywood is where the action is now.
example.tran: 好莱坞如今风头正盛。

sense.def: The fighting which takes place in a war can be referred to as action .

example.ex: Leaders in America have generally supported military action...
example.tran: 美国领导人普遍支持采取军事行动。

example.ex: 13 soldiers were killed and 10 wounded in action.
example.tran: 战斗中有13名士兵阵亡，10名士兵受伤。

sense.def: An action movie is a film in which a lot of dangerous and exciting things happen. An action hero is the main character in one of these films.
sense.tran: （电影）情节惊险刺激的；动作（片）的；动作片中的

example.ex: Stallone wants to break away from his action-hero image.
example.tran: 史泰龙想要摆脱动作明星的形象。

sense.def: If you action something that needs to be done, you deal with it.

example.ex: Documents can be actioned, or filed immediately.
example.tran: 文件可被立即处理或归档。

sense.def: If someone or something is out of action, they are injured or damaged and cannot work or be used.
sense.tran: （因受伤或损坏）不能工作，失去作用，无法运转

example.ex: He's been out of action for 16 months with a serious knee injury...
example.tran: 由于膝部严重受伤，他已停工16个月。

example.ex: They were trapped after the lifts went out of action.
example.tran: 电梯出现故障，他们被困在里面了。

sense.def: If someone wants to have a piece of the action or a slice of the action, they want to take part in an exciting activity or situation, usually in order to make money or become more important.
sense.tran: （通常为了赚钱或提高影响力）插手，参与

example.ex: Holiday spots have seen a dramatic revival and tourist chiefs are competing for a slice of the action.
example.tran: 各个度假点重又呈现出一派兴旺景象，旅游业的龙头老大们都在争着分一杯羹。

sense.def: If you put an idea or policy into action, you begin to use it or cause it to operate.

example.ex: They have learned the lessons of business management theory, and put them into action.
example.tran: 他们不仅学习了商业管理理论方面的课程，并且学以致用。

sense.def: If something that you do or say to someone is actionable, it gives them a valid reason for bringing a legal case against you.
sense.tran: 可以起诉的；可提起诉讼的

sense.def: An action replay is a repeated showing, usually in slow motion, of an event that has just been on television.
sense.tran: （电视画面等的）即时重放，重放慢镜头

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 instant replay

sense.def: If a device or process is activated, something causes it to start working.

example.ex: Video cameras with night vision can be activated by movement.
example.tran: 带夜视镜的摄像机一有动静就会启动。

example.ex: ...a voice-activated computer.
example.tran: 声控电脑

example.ex: A computer controls the activation of an air bag.
example.tran: 电脑控制着气囊的启动。

sense.def: Someone who is active moves around a lot or does a lot of things.

example.ex: Having an active youngster about the house can be quite wearing.
example.tran: 家里有个好动的小孩会是相当累人的。

example.ex: ...a long and active life.
example.tran: 漫长而忙碌的一生

sense.def: If you have an active mind or imagination, you are always thinking of new things.

example.ex: ...the tragedy of an active mind trapped by failing physical health.
example.tran: 因为健康状况衰退而思维受阻的悲剧

sense.def: If someone is active in an organization, cause, or campaign, they do things for it rather than just giving it their support.

example.ex: ...a chance for fathers to play a more active role in childcare...
example.tran: 让父亲们更积极地参与育婴的机会

example.ex: I am an active member of the Conservative Party...
example.tran: 我是保守党的积极分子。

example.ex: He is active on Tyler's behalf.
example.tran: 他为泰勒积极奔忙。

example.ex: They actively campaigned for the vote.
example.tran: 他们积极参加竞选运动。

sense.def: Active is used to emphasize that someone is taking action in order to achieve something, rather than just hoping for it or achieving it in an indirect way.

example.ex: Companies need to take active steps to increase exports.
example.tran: 各公司需要采取积极措施增加出口。

example.ex: ...active discouragement from teachers.
example.tran: 教师们的竭力阻挠

example.ex: They have never been actively encouraged to take such risks.
example.tran: 他们从未被撺掇去冒这样的风险。

example.ex: ...the White House says the president is not actively considering such a move.
example.tran: 白宫说总统对这样的举措并不作积极考虑。

sense.hdgr: usu v-link ADJ, usu ADJ prep
sense.def: If you say that a person or animal is active in a particular place or at a particular time, you mean that they are performing their usual activities or performing a particular activity.

example.ex: Guerrilla groups are active in the province.
example.tran: 游击队在该省很活跃。

example.ex: ...animals which are active at night.
example.tran: 夜行动物

example.ex: ...men who are sexually active.
example.tran: 性欲旺盛的男人们

sense.def: An active volcano has erupted recently or is expected to erupt quite soon.

example.ex: ...molten lava from an active volcano.
example.tran: 活火山喷出的熔岩

sense.def: An active substance has a chemical or biological effect on things.
sense.tran: 起化学(或生物)作用的;活性的;有效的

example.ex: The active ingredient in some of the mouthwashes was simply detergent.
example.tran: 某些漱口剂中的有效成分只不过是洗涤剂而已。

sense.def: In grammar, the active or the active voice means the forms of a verb which are used when the subject refers to a person or thing that does something. For example, in 'I saw her yesterday', the verb is in the active.
Active duty means the same as active service .
Someone who is on active service is taking part in a war as a member of the armed forces.

example.ex: In April 1944 he was killed on active service...
example.tran: 1944年4月他在战时服役中阵亡。

example.ex: The colonel saw active service in Borneo and was awarded the General Service Medal.
example.tran: 战争期间上校在婆罗洲服役并被授予一般服役奖章。

sense.def: Activism is the process of campaigning in public or working for an organization in order to bring about political or social change.

example.ex: He believed in political activism to achieve justice.
example.tran: 他相信通过政治激进主义可以赢得正义。

sense.def: An activist is a person who works to bring about political or social changes by campaigning in public or working for an organization.

example.ex: The police say they suspect the attack was carried out by animal rights activists.
example.tran: 警方说他们怀疑袭击是由动物权益保护的积极分子们发动的。

sense.def: Activity is a situation in which a lot of things are happening or being done.

example.ex: ...an extraordinary level of activity in the government bonds market.
example.tran: 政府公债市场异常活跃

example.ex: ...the electrical activity of the brain.
example.tran: 脑电波的活动

sense.def: An activity is something that you spend time doing.

example.ex: You can take part in activities from canoeing to bird watching.
example.tran: 你可以参与从划独木舟到观鸟等各种活动。

sense.def: The activities of a group are the things that they do in order to achieve their aims.
sense.tran: （团体为达到某种目的而采取的）活动，行动

example.ex: ...a jail term for terrorist activities...
example.tran: 因参与恐怖活动而被判的刑期

example.ex: On April 29, the activities of the company were suspended on the orders of the Bank of England.
example.tran: 4月29日，奉英国银行之命，该公司的各项活动被暂停。

sense.def: An act of God is an event that is beyond human control, especially one in which something is damaged or someone is hurt.

example.ex: The President described the disaster as an act of God.
example.tran: 总统将这场灾难说成是天灾。

sense.def: An actor is someone whose job is acting in plays or films. 'Actor' in the singular usually refers to a man, but some women who act prefer to be called 'actors' rather than 'actresses'.
sense.tran: 演员（单数形式的actor通常指男演员，但有些女演员喜欢被称为actor而不是actress)

example.ex: His father was an actor in the Cantonese Opera Company...
example.tran: 他的父亲是粤剧团的演员。

example.ex: You have to be a very good actor to play that part.
example.tran: 要想演那个角色，你必须是个非常出色的演员。

sense.def: An actress is a woman whose job is acting in plays or films.

example.ex: She's a very great dramatic actress.
example.tran: 她是一个非常了不起的戏剧演员。

sense.def: You use actual to emphasize that you are referring to something real or genuine.

example.ex: The segments are filmed using either local actors or the actual people involved...
example.tran: 这些片断是由当地的演员或真实的当事人参与拍摄的。

example.ex: Officials admit the actual number of AIDS victims is much higher than statistics reflect.
example.tran: 官员们承认艾滋病患者的实际数量比统计所显示的数字要大得多。

sense.def: You use actual to contrast the important aspect of something with a less important aspect.
sense.tran: （用于对比主次方面）真正的，实际的

example.ex: She had compiled pages of notes, but she had not yet gotten down to doing the actual writing...
example.tran: 她已编写了数页注释，但还未开始真正意义上的写作。

example.ex: The exercises in this chapter can guide you, but it will be up to you to do the actual work.
example.tran: 这一章的练习能给你指导，但实际的工作还得靠你自己完成。

boxu.usage: Do not confuse actual and real. You use actual to emphasize that what you are referring to is real or genuine, or to contrast different aspects of something. You use real to describe things that exist rather than being imagined or theoretical. Robert squealed in mock terror, then in real pain. Note that you only use actual in front of a noun. You do not say that something 'is actual'. Note also that actual is not used to refer to something which is happening now, at the present time. For this meaning, you need to use adjectives such as current or present.
boxu.tran: 请勿混淆actual和real。actual用于强调所指事物为真实的、实际的，或用于对比事物的不同方面。real表示事物的确存在，非想象的或理论上的：Robert squealed in mock terror, then in real pain（罗伯特起初假装害怕而尖叫，接着却真的疼得叫起来）。注意，actual只用于名词前，不能说某事物is actual。另请注意，actual不用于指正在发生的事情。表示某事正在发生时用current或present这样的形容词。

sense.def: Actual bodily harm is a criminal offence in which someone gives another person a minor injury.
You can use in actuality to emphasize that what you are saying is true, when it contradicts or contrasts with what you have previously said.

example.ex: In actuality, Teddie did not have a disorder but merely a difficult temperament...
example.tran: 实际上，小特迪并非哪不正常，而仅仅是属于困难型气质。

example.ex: The woman he had seen performing on stage was in actuality quite older than she had seemed.
example.tran: 他所见的那个在舞台上表演的女人实际年龄比看上去要大很多。

sense.def: Actuality is the state of really existing rather than being imagined.

example.ex: It exists in dreams rather than actuality.
example.tran: 它存在于梦境而非现实中。

sense.def: An actuality is a fact or condition that really exists.
sense.tran: 真实情况;实际情况;事实

example.ex: To stop the fighting there requires the threat and probably the actuality of military force...
example.tran: 要平息那里的战火就要威胁采用甚至真正动用军事力量。

example.ex: While economists are free to theorise, company chairmen are concerned with actualities.
example.tran: 经济学家们可自由创建理论，公司总裁们则关心现实情况。

sense.def: You use actually to indicate that a situation exists or happened, or to emphasize that it is true.

example.ex: One afternoon, I grew bored and actually fell asleep for a few minutes...
example.tran: 一天下午，我觉得有些无聊，还真的睡着了一小会儿。

example.ex: Interest is only payable on the amount actually borrowed.
example.tran: 利息只能根据实际借款数目给付。

sense.def: You use actually when you are correcting or contradicting someone.
sense.tran: （用于纠正他人或表示反对）实际上，事实上

example.ex: No, I'm not a student. I'm a doctor, actually...
example.tran: 不，我不是学生。实际上我是医生。

example.ex: 'So it's not a family show then?' —'Well, actually, I think that's exactly what it is.'
example.tran: “那么这并不是一次家庭才艺表演了？”——“嗯，事实上我觉得这恰恰就是一次家庭才艺表演。”

sense.def: You can use actually when you are politely expressing an opinion that other people might not have expected from you.
sense.tran: (礼貌地表达与他人的期待所不同的观点)说实在的，说真的

example.ex: 'Do you think it's a good idea to socialize with one's patients?' — 'Actually, I do, I think it's a great idea.'
example.tran: “你认为和自己的病人交朋友的想法好吗？”——“说实在的，我认为很好，这个想法很棒。”

example.ex: I would be surprised, actually, if he left Birmingham.
example.tran: 如果他要离开伯明翰，说真的，我会很惊讶。

sense.def: You use actually to introduce a new topic into a conversation.

example.ex: Well actually, John, I rang you for some advice...
example.tran: 这么说吧，约翰，我给你打电话是想得到些建议。

example.ex: Actually, let's just read this little bit where you've made them bump into each other.
example.tran: 这样吧，我们就只读你让他们偶遇这一小段吧。

boxu.usage: Note that actually and really are both used to emphasize statements. Actually is used to emphasize what is true or genuine in a situation, often when this is surprising, or a contrast with what has just been said. All the characters in the novel actually existed... He actually began to cry. It can also be used to be precise or to correct someone. No one was actually drunk... We couldn't actually see the garden. You use really in conversation to emphasize something that you are saying. I really think he's sick. When you use really in front of an adjective or adverb, it has a similar meaning to 'very'. This is really serious.
boxu.tran: 注意，actually和really都用于强调。actually用于强调情况的真实性，往往是在出人意料或跟刚刚所说的话形成对照的情况下使用。例如：All the characters in the novel actually existed（这部小说中所有人物都确有其人），He actually began to cry（他真的哭了起来）。actually也可用于加强准确性或纠正别人。例如：No one was actually drunk（没有人真的喝醉了），We couldn’t actually see the garden（我们其实看不到花园）。really可用于对话中强调说话内容：I really think he’s sick（我确实认为他生病了）。really用于形容词和副词之前时，意思与very相近：This is really serious (这非常严重）。

sense.def: Actuarial means relating to the work of an actuary.
sense.tran: 保险精算师的;保险计算的

example.ex: The company's actuarial report is available on demand.
example.tran: 该公司的精算报告可随时索取。

sense.def: An actuary is a person who is employed by insurance companies to calculate how much they should charge their clients for insurance.
sense.tran: 保险精算师;保险业务计算员

sense.def: If a person is actuated by an emotion, that emotion makes them act in a certain way. If something actuates a device, the device starts working.

example.ex: They were actuated by desire...
example.tran: 他们受到欲望的驱使。

example.ex: The flow of current actuates the signal.
example.tran: 电流发出了信号。

sense.def: Acuity is sharpness of vision or hearing, or quickness of thought.
sense.tran: （视力、听力、思维的）敏锐，敏锐度

example.ex: We work on improving visual acuity.
example.tran: 我们致力于提高视觉的敏锐度。

sense.def: Acumen is the ability to make good judgments and quick decisions.

example.ex: His sharp business acumen meant he quickly rose to the top.
example.tran: 他精明的商业头脑令其青云直上。

sense.def: Acupressure is the treatment of pain by a type of massage in which pressure is put on certain areas of a person's body.

example.ex: Acupressure is used to release tension spots in the shoulders and neck.
example.tran: 指压按摩用于缓解肩部和颈部的紧张。

sense.def: Acupuncture is the treatment of a person's illness or pain by sticking small needles into their body at certain places.

example.ex: All of those who received the true acupuncture experienced pain relief.
example.tran: 所有接受了针刺治疗的人都感到疼痛减轻了。

sense.def: An acupuncturist is a person who performs acupuncture.
You can use acute to indicate that an undesirable situation or feeling is very severe or intense.

example.ex: The war has aggravated an acute economic crisis...
example.tran: 战争加剧了原本已很严重的经济危机。

example.ex: The report has caused acute embarrassment to the government...
example.tran: 报告将政府置于窘境。

example.ex: The labour shortage is becoming acute.
example.tran: 劳动力匮乏愈演愈烈。

sense.def: An acute illness is one that becomes severe very quickly but does not last very long.

example.ex: ...a patient with acute rheumatoid arthritis.
example.tran: 患急性风湿性关节炎的病人

example.ex: ...an acute case of dysentery.
example.tran: 急性痢疾病例

sense.def: If a person's or animal's sight, hearing, or sense of smell is acute, it is sensitive and powerful.

example.ex: In the dark my sense of hearing becomes so acute.
example.tran: 黑暗中我的听觉变得异常灵敏。

sense.def: If you say that someone is acute or has an acute mind, you mean that they are quick to notice things and are able to understand them clearly.

example.ex: Into her nineties, her thinking remained acute and her character forceful...
example.tran: 虽已年届九旬，她依然头脑敏锐，个性很强。

example.ex: His relaxed exterior hides an extremely acute mind.
example.tran: 他表面上大大咧咧，内心却无比敏锐。

example.ex: Everything he writes demonstrates the acuteness of his intelligence.
example.tran: 从他的文笔可以看出他思维敏捷。

sense.def: An acute angle is less than 90°.

An acute accent is a symbol that is placed over vowels in some languages in order to indicate how that vowel is pronounced or over one letter in a word to indicate where it is stressed. You refer to a letter with this accent as, for example, e acute. For example, there is an acute accent over the letter 'e' in the French word 'café'.
sense.tran: （标在元音等上面的符号）尖音的，重音的

sense.def: If you feel or notice something acutely, you feel or notice it very strongly.
sense.tran: 深深地（感觉到），强烈地(意识到)

example.ex: He was acutely aware of the odour of cooking oil...
example.tran: 他闻到一股浓浓的油烟味。

example.ex: Those tensions have been felt most acutely by women.
example.tran: 最能深切感受到这种紧张氛围的是女性。

sense.def: If a feeling or quality is acutely unpleasant, it is extremely unpleasant.

example.ex: It was an acutely uncomfortable journey back to London.
example.tran: 那是一次极其痛苦的返回伦敦的旅行。

sense.def: An ad is an advertisement.

example.ex: She replied to a lonely hearts ad.
example.tran: 她回应了一则征友广告。

sense.def: You use AD in dates to indicate the number of years or centuries that have passed since the year in which Jesus Christ is believed to have been born.

example.ex: The cathedral was destroyed by the Great Fire of 1136 AD...
example.tran: 大教堂在公元1136年的大火中被付之一炬。

example.ex: The original castle was probably built about AD 860...
example.tran: 最初的城堡可能建于公元860年左右。

example.ex: The Roman Empire was divided in the fourth century AD.
example.tran: 罗马帝国于公元4世纪分裂。

sense.def: An adage is something which people often say and which expresses a general truth about some aspect of life.

example.ex: ...the old adage, 'Every baby brings its own love'.
example.tran: 那句古老的谚语，“每个婴儿生来就带着爱”

sense.def: Adagio written above a piece of music means that it should be played slowly.
sense.tran: 缓慢地（用作音乐中的指示）

sense.def: An adagio is a piece of music that is played slowly.

example.ex: ...Samuel Barber's Adagio For Strings.
example.tran: 塞缪尔·巴伯的《弦乐慢板》

example.ex: ...the Adagio movement of his Sixth Symphony.
example.tran: 他的《第六交响乐》的慢板乐章

sense.hdgr:
usu v-link ADJ, oft ADJ that, ADJ
about n/-ing
sense.def: If someone is adamant about something, they are determined not to change their mind about it.

example.ex: The prime minister is adamant that he will not resign...
example.tran: 首相坚决不辞职。

example.ex: Sue was adamant about that job in Australia.
example.tran: 对澳大利亚的那份工作，休的态度很坚决。

rnon.hdgr: usu ADV with v, also ADV adj

example.ex: She was adamantly opposed to her husband travelling to Brussels.
example.tran: 她坚决反对丈夫前往布鲁塞尔。

sense.def: Your Adam's apple is the lump that sticks out of the front of your neck below your throat.
If you adapt to a new situation or adapt yourself to it, you change your ideas or behaviour in order to deal with it successfully.

example.ex: The world will be different, and we will have to be prepared to adapt to the change...
example.tran: 世界会变得不同，我们必须做好准备以适应其变化。

example.ex: They have had to adapt themselves to a war economy.
example.tran: 他们不得不适应战时经济。

sense.def: If you adapt something, you change it to make it suitable for a new purpose or situation.
sense.tran: 使适合，使适应（新用途或新情况）

example.ex: Shelves were built to adapt the library for use as an office.
example.tran: 为将图书馆改作办公室而做了一些架子。

sense.def: If you adapt a book or play, you change it so that it can be made into a film or a television programme.

example.ex: The scriptwriter helped him to adapt his novel for the screen...
example.tran: 编剧帮助他将其所著小说改编成电影。

example.ex: The film has been adapted from a play of the same title.
example.tran: 电影改编自一部同名戏剧。

sense.def: If you describe a person or animal as adaptable, you mean that they are able to change their ideas or behaviour in order to deal with new situations.
sense.tran: 有适应能力的;能适应的;适应性强的

example.ex: ...a more adaptable and skilled workforce...
example.tran: 一支适应能力及技能更强的劳动大军

example.ex: They are adaptable foragers that learn to survive on a wide range of food sources.
example.tran: 它们是适应能力很强的觅食者，赖以生存的食物来源很广。

example.ex: The adaptability of wool is one of its great attractions.
example.tran: 用途广泛是羊毛最具吸引力的特点之一。

sense.def: An adaptation of a book or play is a film or a television programme that is based on it.
sense.tran: （电影或电视的）改写本，改编本

example.ex: ...Branagh's screen adaptation of Shakespeare's Henry the Fifth.
example.tran: 布拉纳改编自莎士比亚的《亨利五世》的影片

sense.def: Adaptation is the act of changing something or changing your behaviour to make it suitable for a new purpose or situation.

example.ex: Most living creatures are capable of adaptation when compelled to do so.
example.tran: 大多数生物都能在迫于压力的情况下适应新环境。

sense.def: If something is adapted to a particular situation or purpose, it is especially suitable for it.

example.ex: The camel's feet, well adapted for dry sand, are useless on mud.
example.tran: 骆驼的蹄子虽然非常适合于在干沙上行走，碰到泥泞时却无计可施。

sense.def: Adaption means the same as adaptation .
Adaptive means having the ability or tendency to adapt to different situations.

example.ex: Societies need to develop highly adaptive behavioural rules for survival.
example.tran: 社会需要发展具有高度适应性的生存行为规则。

sense.def: An adaptor is a special device for connecting electrical equipment to a power supply, or for connecting different pieces of electrical or electronic equipment together.
The adaptor of a book or play is the person who rewrites it for a film or a television programme.
If you add one thing to another, you put it in or on the other thing, to increase, complete, or improve it.

example.ex: Add the grated cheese to the sauce...
example.tran: 把磨碎的干酪加到调味汁里。

example.ex: Since 1908, chlorine has been added to drinking water...
example.tran: 自1908年以来氯就被添加进饮用水当中。

example.ex: He wants to add a huge sports complex to Binfield Manor.
example.tran: 他想给宾菲尔德庄园加盖一个大型综合体育场。

sense.def: If you add numbers or amounts together, you calculate their total.

example.ex: Banks add all the interest and other charges together...
example.tran: 银行合计所有利息和其他费用。

example.ex: Two and three added together are five.
example.tran: 2加3等于5。

posc.def: Add up means the same as add .

example.ex: More than a quarter of seven year-olds cannot add up properly...
example.tran: 7岁的孩子中1/4以上都不会正确地做加法运算。

example.ex: We just added all the numbers up and divided one by the other...
example.tran: 我们只是将所有的数字相加并用一个除以另一个。

example.ex: He said the numbers simply did not add up.
example.tran: 他说这些数字根本对不上。

sense.def: If one thing adds to another, it makes the other thing greater in degree or amount.

example.ex: This latest incident will add to the pressure on the government...
example.tran: 最近的这次事件将会给政府增加压力。

example.ex: Smiles, nods, and cheerful faces added to the general gaiety.
example.tran: 微笑、点头和喜洋洋的脸庞使喜庆的气氛变得更浓了。

sense.def: To add a particular quality to something means to cause it to have that quality.

example.ex: The generous amount of garlic adds flavour...
example.tran: 蒜多了能提味。

example.ex: Pictures add interest to plain painted walls.
example.tran: 相片给素色的墙面增添了一抹情趣。

sense.def: If you add something when you are speaking, you say something more.

example.ex: 'You can tell that he is extremely embarrassed,' Mr Brigden added...
example.tran: “你能看出他尴尬极了，”布里格登先生补充道。

example.ex: The President agreed, adding that he hoped for a peaceful solution.
example.tran: 总统表示赞同并补充说他希望和平解决。

example.ex: Hunt added his congratulations, saying 'Nigel has made a cracking job of it'.
example.tran: 亨特在致完贺词后又补了一句：“奈杰尔干得棒极了。”

sense.def: You use added to this or added to that to introduce a fact that supports or widens what you are saying.

example.ex: More than 750 commercial airliners were involved in fatal accidents last year. Added to that were the 1,550 smaller aircraft.
example.tran: 去年750多家商业航空公司遭遇过人员死亡的事故。另外还有1,550架小型飞机也出过同样的事故。

sense.def: If you add in something, you include it as a part of something else.

example.ex: Once the vegetables start to cook add in a couple of tablespoons of water.
example.tran: 开始烹调蔬菜时，加入几调羹水。

sense.def: If one thing is added on to another, it is attached to the other thing, or is made a part of it.

example.ex: Holiday-makers can also add on a week in Majorca before or after the cruise...
example.tran: 度假者们可以在乘游轮游览之前或之后再在马略卡岛呆上一星期。

example.ex: To the rear is a large dining room — added on early this century.
example.tran: 后边是一个大餐厅——本世纪早期增建的。

sense.def: If you add on an extra amount or item to a list or total, you include it.

example.ex: Many loan application forms automatically add on insurance.
example.tran: 许多贷款申请表自动附加保险。

sense.def: If facts or events do not add up, they make you confused about a situation because they do not seem to be consistent. If something that someone has said or done adds up, it is reasonable and sensible.

example.ex: Police said they arrested Olivia because her statements did not add up...
example.tran: 警方说他们之所以逮捕奥利维娅是因为她无法自圆其说。

example.ex: Well, I could be wrong, but it all seems to add up.
example.tran: 嗯，我也不一定对，但是一切似乎都讲得通。

sense.def: If small amounts of something add up, they gradually increase.

example.ex: Even small savings can add up...
example.tran: 甚至从小处节省下来的钱也能积少成多。

example.ex: It's the little minor problems that add up.
example.tran: 就是小问题才会累积。

sense.def: If amounts add up to a particular total, they result in that total when they are put together.

example.ex: For a hit show, profits can add up to millions of dollars.
example.tran: 一场热门演出的利润可达数百万美元。

sense.def: ADD is an abbreviation for (缩略 =) attention deficit disorder.
You use added to say that something has more of a particular thing or quality.

example.ex: For added protection choose a lipstick with a sun screen.
example.tran: 选择防晒护唇膏来增强保护。

sense.def: In marketing, added value is something which makes a product more appealing to customers.
An addendum is an additional section at the end of a book or document.
In Europe and Asia, an adder is a small poisonous snake that has a black pattern on its back. In North America, a number of different poisonous and non-poisonous snakes are called adders .
sense.tran: （见于欧洲、亚洲的）蝰蛇，小毒蛇；（见于北美，毒性各异的）猪鼻蛇，乳蛇

sense.def: An addict is someone who takes harmful drugs and cannot stop taking them.

example.ex: He's only 24 years old and a drug addict.
example.tran: 他只有24岁，却是个瘾君子。

sense.def: If you say that someone is an addict, you mean that they like a particular activity very much and spend as much time doing it as they can.

example.ex: She is a TV addict and watches as much as she can.
example.tran: 她是个电视迷，看起电视来没完没了。

sense.hdgr:
usu v-link ADJ, usu ADJ
to n
sense.def: Someone who is addicted to a harmful drug cannot stop taking it.

example.ex: Many of the women are addicted to heroin and cocaine...
example.tran: 这些女人中很多人都吸食海洛因和可卡因成瘾了。

example.ex: After about three months, I was no longer addicted to nicotine.
example.tran: 大约3个月后，我就不再对尼古丁上瘾了。

sense.hdgr:
usu v-link ADJ, usu ADJ
to n
sense.def: If you say that someone is addicted to something, you mean that they like it very much and want to spend as much time doing it as possible.

example.ex: I went through about four years of being addicted to video games...
example.tran: 我大约有4年时间沉迷在电子游戏中。

example.ex: She had become addicted to golf.
example.tran: 她已经迷上高尔夫球了。

sense.hdgr:
oft n N, N
to n
sense.def: Addiction is the condition of taking harmful drugs and being unable to stop taking them.

example.ex: She helped him fight his drug addiction.
example.tran: 她帮助他戒毒。

example.ex: ...long-term addiction to nicotine.
example.tran: 对尼古丁成瘾已久

sense.def: An addiction to something is a very strong desire or need for it.

example.ex: He needed money to feed his addiction to gambling...
example.tran: 他需要钱来满足他的赌瘾。

example.ex: I discovered an addiction to housework which I had never felt before.
example.tran: 我发现自己迷上了做家务，之前我从没有这种感觉。

sense.def: If a drug is addictive, people who take it cannot stop taking it.

example.ex: Cigarettes are highly addictive...
example.tran: 香烟很容易使人上瘾。

example.ex: Crack is the most addictive drug on the market.
example.tran: 强效纯可卡因是市面上最容易让人上瘾的毒品。

sense.def: Something that is addictive is so enjoyable that it makes you want to do it or have it a lot.

example.ex: Video movie-making can quickly become addictive.
example.tran: 制作视频电影能很快让人入迷。

sense.def: If someone has an addictive personality, they easily become addicted to something.

example.ex: I have an eating disorder and an addictive personality.
example.tran: 我饮食没有规律，而且性格上容易沉迷某事。

sense.hdgr:
PHR with cl, oft PHR
to n
sense.def: You use in addition when you want to mention another item connected with the subject you are discussing.

example.ex: Part-time English classes are offered. In addition, students can take classes in word-processing and computing...
example.tran: 开设了非全日制的英语班。另外，学生可以修读文字处理和计算机课程。

example.ex: There's a postage and packing fee in addition to the repair charge.
example.tran: 除修理费之外还有邮寄和包装费。

sense.hdgr:
usu with supp, oft N
to n
sense.def: An addition to something is a thing which is added to it.

example.ex: This is a fine book; a worthy addition to the Cambridge Encyclopedia series...
example.tran: 这是一本好书，对剑桥百科全书系列是一个很好的补充。

example.ex: This plywood addition helps to strengthen the structure.
example.tran: 多层胶合板有助于加固结构。

sense.def: The addition of something is the fact that it is added to something else.

example.ex: It was completely refurbished in 1987, with the addition of a picnic site.
example.tran: 它在1987年经过了彻底翻修，加盖了一个野餐点。

sense.def: Addition is the process of calculating the total of two or more numbers.

example.ex: ...simple addition and subtraction problems.
example.tran: 简单的加减题

sense.def: Additional things are extra things apart from the ones already present.

example.ex: The US is sending additional troops to the region...
example.tran: 美国正向该地区增兵。

example.ex: The insurer will also have to pay the additional costs of the trial.
example.tran: 保险公司将不得不支付审判的额外费用。

sense.def: You use additionally to introduce something extra such as an extra fact or reason.

example.ex: You can pay bills over the Internet. Additionally, you can check your balance or order statements...
example.tran: 可以在网上支付账单。此外，还能查对余额或订货结算单。

example.ex: The maintenance programme will additionally seek to keep the sites free of graffiti.
example.tran: 这个维护方案还会试图保护这些地点不被涂鸦。

sense.def: Additionally is used to say that something happens to a greater extent than before.

example.ex: The birds are additionally protected in the reserves at Birsay...
example.tran: 鸟类在伯赛的保护区尤其受到保护。

example.ex: He will sign a personal guarantee to additionally secure the loan.
example.tran: 他将签订一个个人担保，以此为贷款多加一层保障。

sense.def: An additive is a substance which is added in small amounts to foods or other things in order to improve them or to make them last longer.

example.ex: Strict safety tests are carried out on food additives.
example.tran: 对食品添加剂进行了严格的安全检测。

example.ex: ...additive-free baby foods.
example.tran: 不含添加剂的婴儿食品

sense.def: If something addles someone's mind or brain, they become confused and unable to think properly.

example.ex: I suppose the shock had addled his poor old brain.
example.tran: 我估摸这个打击已经把他那可怜的脑袋瓜搞糊涂了。

sense.def: If you describe someone as addled, you mean that they are confused or unable to think properly.

example.ex: She wore a sweet and slightly addled expression...
example.tran: 她一脸小迷糊的可爱样儿。

example.ex: You're talking like an addled romantic.
example.tran: 你说话像个糊里糊涂耽于幻想的人。

sense.def: An add-on is an extra piece of equipment, especially computer equipment, that can be added to a larger one which you already own in order to improve its performance or its usefulness.
sense.tran: （尤指计算机的）附加装置，外挂，插件

example.ex: Speakers are sold as add-ons for personal stereos...
example.tran: 扬声器作为随身听的附加装置出售。

example.ex: Nintendo hopes to price the add-on modem at less than $200.
example.tran: 任天堂希望将该外挂调制解调器的价格定在200美元以下。

sense.def: Your address is the number of the house, flat, or apartment and the name of the street and the town where you live or work.

example.ex: The address is 2025 M Street, Northwest, Washington, DC, 20036...
example.tran: 地址为华盛顿特区，西北区，M大街2025号，邮政编码20036。

example.ex: We require details of your name and address.
example.tran: 我们需要你的姓名和地址的详细信息。

sense.def: If a letter, envelope, or parcel is addressed to you, your name and address have been written on it.

example.ex: Applications should be addressed to: The business affairs editor.
example.tran: 申请表应寄给;商务编辑。

sense.def: The address of a website is its location on the Internet, for example http://www.cobuild.collins.co.uk.

example.ex: Internet addresses are also known as URLs.
example.tran: 网址也被称作URL。

sense.def: The address of a cell on a computer spreadsheet refers to the particular row and column number where it is located, for example 'C2' or 'N63'.
sense.tran: （电子表格中某个单元格的）位置

sense.def: If you address a group of people, you give a speech to them.
sense.tran: 向…作正式讲话;对…发表演说

example.ex: He is due to address a conference on human rights next week.
example.tran: 他下星期将在一个大会上发表关于人权的演说。

example.ex: The President gave an address to the American people.
example.tran: 总统向美国民众发表了演说。

sense.def: If you address someone or address a remark to them, you say something to them.

example.ex: The two foreign ministers did not address each other directly when they last met...
example.tran: 这两位外交部长在上次会面时并没有直接的言语交流。

example.ex: He addressed his remarks to Eleanor, ignoring Maria.
example.tran: 他和埃莉诺聊了聊，而没搭理玛丽亚。

sense.def: If you address someone by a name or a title such as 'sir', you call them that name or title when you talk or write to them.
sense.tran: 称呼（某人）；给…冠以（某种称呼）

example.ex: I heard him address her as darling...
example.tran: 我听见他称她为“亲爱的”。

example.ex: The Duchess should be addressed as Your Grace.
example.tran: 公爵夫人应被称为“大人”。

sense.def: If you address a problem or task or if you address yourself to it, you try to understand it or deal with it.
sense.tran: 对付；处理；设法了解并解决

example.ex: Mr King sought to address those fears when he spoke at the meeting...
example.tran: 金先生在会上讲话时试图消除那些恐惧。

example.ex: Throughout the book we have addressed ourselves to the problem of ethics.
example.tran: 整本书中我们都在探讨伦理观的问题。

boxu.usage: Be careful with the spelling of this word.
boxu.tran: 注意该词拼写。

sense.def: An address book is a book in which you write people's names and addresses.
An address book is a computer file which contains a list of e-mail addresses.
The addressee of a letter or parcel is the person or company that it is addressed to.
If you adduce something such as a fact or reason, you mention it in order to support an argument.
sense.tran: 引证,援引,举出（事实、理由等）

example.ex: We can adduce evidence to support the claim.
example.tran: 我们能举出证据支持该说法。

sense.def: Adenoids are soft lumps of flesh at the back and top of a person's throat that sometimes become swollen and have to be removed.

entry.boxr: The adjective is pronounced /æ'dept/. The noun is pronounced /'ædept/. 形容词读作 /æ'dept/。名词读作 /'ædept/。

sense.hdgr:
usu v-link ADJ, usu ADJ
at -ing/n
sense.def: Someone who is adept at something can do it skilfully.

example.ex: He's usually very adept at keeping his private life out of the media...
example.tran: 他通常很善于使自己的私生活避开媒体的关注。

example.ex: He is an adept guitar player.
example.tran: 他是个吉他高手。

posc.def: An adept is someone who is adept at something.

example.ex: Kitzi was an adept at getting people to talk confidentially to him.
example.tran: 基齐很善于引导别人与其谈心。

example.ex: Mrs Marcos' lawyer adeptly exploited the prosecution's weakness.
example.tran: 马科斯夫人的律师巧妙地利用了起诉中的弱点。

sense.def: Adequacy is the quality of being good enough or great enough in amount to be acceptable.

example.ex: I am very critical of the adequacy of Britain's race laws...
example.tran: 我对英国种族法律的适当性颇有微词。

example.ex: Several studies point to a real cause for concern over the adequacy of the diet eaten by British children.
example.tran: 针对英国儿童膳食质量的担忧，数份研究将矛头指向了同一根源。

sense.hdgr:
oft ADJ to-inf, ADJ
for n
sense.def: If something is adequate, there is enough of it or it is good enough to be used or accepted.

example.ex: One in four people worldwide are without adequate homes...
example.tran: 全世界有1/4的人没有个像样的家。

example.ex: The old methods weren't adequate to meet current needs...
example.tran: 老一套方法已不足以满足当前的需要。

example.ex: The western diet should be perfectly adequate for most people.
example.tran: 西方的日常饮食应该完全适合于大多数人。

example.ex: Many students are not adequately prepared for higher education...
example.tran: 许多学生并未做好接受高等教育的充分准备。

example.ex: I speak the language adequately.
example.tran: 我这门语言说得不错。

sense.def: ADHD is an abbreviation for (缩略=) attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.
If you adhere to a rule or agreement, you act in the way that it says you should.

example.ex: All members of the association adhere to a strict code of practice...
example.tran: 协会的所有成员都遵守一套严格的行为规范。

example.ex: She adhered to the strict Islamic dress code.
example.tran: 她恪守伊斯兰教严格的着装规定。

sense.def: If you adhere to an opinion or belief, you support or hold it.
sense.tran: 支持，拥护，持有（观点或信仰）

example.ex: He urged them to adhere to the values of Islam which defend the dignity of man.
example.tran: 他鼓励他们坚守伊斯兰教维护人类尊严的价值观。

sense.def: If something adheres to something else, it sticks firmly to it.

example.ex: Small particles adhere to the seed...
example.tran: 小颗粒牢牢附着在种子上。

example.ex: This sticky compound adheres well on this surface.
example.tran: 这种黏性的化合物能牢牢地粘在这个表面上。

sense.def: Adherence is the fact of adhering to a particular rule, agreement, or belief.

example.ex: ...strict adherence to the constitution.
example.tran: 严格遵守宪法

sense.def: An adherent is someone who holds a particular belief or supports a particular person or group.

example.ex: This idea is gaining adherents.
example.tran: 这种观念正在赢得更多的拥护者。

sense.def: Adhesion is the ability of one thing to stick firmly to another.

example.ex: Better driving equipment will improve track adhesion in slippery conditions.
example.tran: 较好的驾驶设备能够提升在湿滑路面上的抓地力。

sense.def: An adhesive is a substance such as glue, which is used to make things stick firmly together.

example.ex: Glue the mirror in with a strong adhesive.
example.tran: 用强力胶将镜子固定到位。

sense.def: An adhesive substance is able to stick firmly to something else.
sense.tran: 黏合的；黏着的；有附着力的

example.ex: ...adhesive tape.
example.tran: 胶带

sense.def: An ad hoc activity or organization is done or formed only because a situation has made it necessary and is not planned in advance.
sense.tran: （形势所需而）临时安排的，特别的，专门的

example.ex: The Council meets on an ad hoc basis to discuss problems.
example.tran: 议会临时安排会议讨论问题。

example.ex: ...ad hoc committees to examine specific problems.
example.tran: 研究具体问题的专门委员会

sense.def: Adieu means the same as goodbye .

example.ex: 'Gentlemen, I bid you adieu.'
example.tran: “先生们，告辞了。”

sense.def: If something happens ad infinitum, it is repeated again and again in the same way.

example.ex: This cycle repeats itself ad infinitum.
example.tran: 该循环周而复始，永无止境。

sense.def: Adj. is a written abbreviation for (书面缩略=) adjective.
If one thing is adjacent to another, the two things are next to each other.

example.ex: He sat in an adjacent room and waited...
example.tran: 他坐在隔壁房间里等候。

example.ex: The schools were adjacent but there were separate doors.
example.tran: 这些学校紧挨着，但各自独门独户。

example.ex: ...offices adjacent to the museum.
example.tran: 紧靠着博物馆的办公室

sense.def: Adjectival means relating to adjectives or like an adjective.

example.ex: ...an adjectival phrase.
example.tran: 形容词短语

sense.def: An adjective is a word such as 'big', 'dead', or 'financial' that describes a person or thing, or gives extra information about them. Adjectives usually come before nouns or after link verbs.
An adjective group or adjectival group is a group of words based on an adjective, such as 'very nice' or 'interested in football'. An adjective group can also consist simply of an adjective.
sense.tran: 形容词词组（如very nice，interested in football，也可为单个形容词）

sense.def: If one room, place, or object adjoins another, they are next to each other.

example.ex: Fields adjoined the garden and there were no neighbours...
example.tran: 田园相连，四下无邻。

example.ex: We waited in an adjoining office.
example.tran: 我们在旁边的办公室里等候。

sense.def: If a meeting or trial is adjourned or if it adjourns, it is stopped for a short time.

example.ex: The proceedings have now been adjourned until next week...
example.tran: 会议休会至下周重开。

example.ex: I am afraid the court may not adjourn until three or even later.
example.tran: 我担心法庭要到3点或更晚时才会休庭。

sense.def: An adjournment is a temporary stopping of a trial, enquiry, or other meeting.

example.ex: The court ordered a four month adjournment.
example.tran: 法庭决定休庭4个月。

sense.def: If someone is adjudged to be something, they are judged or considered to be that thing.

example.ex: He was adjudged to be guilty...
example.tran: 他被判有罪。

example.ex: He was adjudged the winner by 54 votes to 3.
example.tran: 他被裁定以54票对3票获胜。

sense.def: If you adjudicate on a dispute or problem, you make an official judgment or decision about it.

example.ex: ...a commissioner to adjudicate on legal rights...
example.tran: 裁决合法权益的专员

example.ex: The international court of justice might be a suitable place to adjudicate claims.
example.tran: 国际法庭或许是对所有权作出裁决的合适之地。

example.ex: ...unbiased adjudication of cases of unfair dismissal.
example.tran: 对不公正解雇案例的不带偏见的裁决

example.ex: ...an independent adjudicator.
example.tran: 独立裁决者

sense.def: Something that is an adjunct to something larger or more important is connected with it or helps to perform the same task.

example.ex: Physical therapy is an important adjunct to drug treatments...
example.tran: 物理疗法是戒毒治疗中的一种重要辅助性疗法。

example.ex: The Party was certainly not an official adjunct of the police department.
example.tran: 该党派肯定不是公安部门的官方附属机构。

sense.def: In grammar, an adjunct is a word or group of words which indicates the circumstances of an action, event, or situation. An adjunct is usually a prepositional phrase or an adverb group.
When you adjust to a new situation, you get used to it by changing your behaviour or your ideas.
sense.tran: 改变（行为或观点）以适应;调节;习惯

example.ex: We have been preparing our fighters to adjust themselves to civil society...
example.tran: 我们一直在培训我们的战士，以使他们适应普通的社会生活。

example.ex: I felt I had adjusted to the idea of being a mother very well...
example.tran: 我感到自己已经完全接受了当妈妈的想法。

example.ex: It has been hard to adjust but now I'm getting satisfaction from my work.
example.tran: 适应虽然艰难，但是现在我已逐渐从工作中获得了满足。

sense.def: If you adjust something, you change it so that it is more effective or appropriate.

example.ex: To attract investors, Panama has adjusted its tax and labour laws.
example.tran: 为吸引投资者，巴拿马调整了税法和劳动法。

sense.def: If you adjust something such as your clothing or a machine, you correct or alter its position or setting.
sense.tran: 整理（衣服）；校正，校准（机器）

example.ex: She adjusted her head scarf fussily...
example.tran: 她小题大做地整了整头巾。

example.ex: Liz adjusted her mirror and then edged the car out of its parking bay.
example.tran: 莉兹调了调后视镜，将车子挪出了停车位。

sense.def: If you adjust your vision or if your vision adjusts, the muscles of your eye or the pupils alter to cope with changes in light or distance.

example.ex: He stopped to try to adjust his vision to the faint starlight...
example.tran: 他停下脚步试着让眼睛适应微弱的星光。

example.ex: We stood in the doorway until our eyes adjusted...
example.tran: 我们站在门口直到眼睛适应了光线的变化。

example.ex: It was a few moments before his eyes became adjusted to the bright glare of the sun.
example.tran: 过了一会儿，他的眼睛才适应了刺眼的阳光。

sense.def: If something is adjustable, it can be changed to different positions or sizes.

example.ex: The bags have adjustable shoulder straps...
example.tran: 这些包的肩带可以调整。

example.ex: The seats are fully adjustable.
example.tran: 座位可以全方位调节。

sense.def: An adjuster is a device which allows you to alter a piece of equipment's position or setting.

example.ex: ...a seat belt adjuster.
example.tran: 安全带调节器

sense.def: An adjustment is a small change that is made to something such as a machine or a way of doing something.

example.ex: Compensation could be made by adjustments to taxation...
example.tran: 通过调整税收可以作出补偿。

example.ex: Investment is up by 5.7% after adjustment for inflation.
example.tran: 针对通货膨胀作出调整之后投资上升了5.7%。

example.ex: ...a technician made an adjustment to a smoke machine at the back of the auditorium.
example.tran: 技工在礼堂后部对烟雾机作了调整。

sense.def: An adjustment is a change in a person's behaviour or thinking.

example.ex: He will have to make major adjustments to his thinking if he is to survive in office.
example.tran: 要想保住这份工作，他就必须在观念上作出重大的转变。

sense.def: An adjutant is an officer in the army who deals with administrative work.
If you ad-lib something in a play or a speech, you say something which has not been planned or written beforehand.
sense.tran: 即兴演出，临时插入（脚本或讲稿中没有的台词）

example.ex: He began comically ad-libbing a script...
example.tran: 他即兴调侃起了一段剧本。

example.ex: He's good at ad-libbing his way out of trouble...
example.tran: 他善于为自己妙语解围。

example.ex: He is rather disjointed when he ad-libs.
example.tran: 他即兴表演时，有些语无伦次。

example.ex: ...ad-libbed phrases.
example.tran: 临时插入的话

sense.def: An ad-lib is something which is said without having been planned or written beforehand.
sense.tran: 即兴（或临时插入）的台词

example.ex: Every time I fluffed a line Lenny got me out of trouble with a brilliant ad-lib.
example.tran: 每次我台词出错时，伦尼都通过机智的临场发挥帮我解围。

posc.def: Ad lib is also an adverb.

example.ex: I spoke from the pulpit ad lib.
example.tran: 我在讲坛上发表即兴演说。

sense.def: An adman is someone who works in advertising.

example.ex: He was the most brilliant adman that any of us knew.
example.tran: 他是我们认识的最有才华的广告人。

sense.def: Admin is the activity or process of organizing an institution or organization.

example.ex: I have two assistants who help with the admin.
example.tran: 我有两个助手协助经营。

example.ex: ...the prison's admin staff.
example.tran: 监狱的管理人员

sense.def: If someone administers something such as a country, the law, or a test, they take responsibility for organizing and supervising it.
sense.tran: 治理，管理（国家等）；施行，实施（法律、考核等）

example.ex: The plan calls for the UN to administer the country until elections can be held...
example.tran: 该方案呼吁联合国来管理该国，直到能进行选举为止。

example.ex: We hope that they're going to administer justice impartially...
example.tran: 我们希望他们能主持正义，不偏不倚。

example.ex: Next summer's exams would be straightforward to administer and mark.
example.tran: 明年夏天的考试在执行和评分上都将很简单。

sense.def: If a doctor or a nurse administers a drug, they give it to a patient.

example.ex: Paramedics are trained to administer certain drugs.
example.tran: 护理人员们接受了配发某些药物的培训。

sense.def: If someone administers a punch or a kick, they punch or kick someone.

example.ex: He is shown in the tape of the beating as administering most of the blows.
example.tran: 录像显示在斗殴中他打得最凶。

sense.def: Administration is the range of activities connected with organizing and supervising the way that an organization or institution functions.

example.ex: Too much time is spent on administration.
example.tran: 在管理上花费了太多时间。

example.ex: ...a master's degree in business administration.
example.tran: 工商管理的硕士学位

sense.def: The administration of something is the process of organizing and supervising it.

example.ex: Standards in the administration of justice have degenerated...
example.tran: 执法标准下降了。

example.ex: The cost of administration is around £500.
example.tran: 监管费约为500英镑。

sense.def: The administration of a company or institution is the group of people who organize and supervise it.
sense.tran: （公司或机构的）管理部门，行政部门

example.ex: ... a member of the college administration.
example.tran: 学院行政部门的成员

sense.def: You can refer to a country's government as the administration; used especially in the United States.

example.ex: O'Leary served in federal energy posts in both the Ford and Carter administrations...
example.tran: 在福特和卡特两届政府执政期间，奥利里都在联邦能源机构中任职。

example.ex: He urged the administration and Congress to come up with a credible package to reduce the budget deficit.
example.tran: 他敦促政府和国会出台一整套切实可行的方案，以缩减预算赤字。

sense.def: Administrative work involves organizing and supervising an organization or institution.

example.ex: Other industries have had to sack managers to reduce administrative costs...
example.tran: 其他行业只得精简管理人员以减少行政开支。

example.ex: The project will have an administrative staff of 12.
example.tran: 项目将包括一个12人组成的管理小组。

rnon.hdgr: ADV with v, ADV adj, ADV with cl

example.ex: Cuba is politically and administratively divided into 14 provinces.
example.tran: 古巴从政治上和行政上被分为14个省。

sense.def: An administrator is a person whose job involves helping to organize and supervise the way that an organization or institution functions.
An admirable quality or action is one that deserves to be praised and admired.
sense.tran: 令人钦佩的；值得赞赏的

example.ex: Beyton is an admirable character...
example.tran: 贝顿是个令人钦佩的人物。

example.ex: The film tells its story with admirable economy.
example.tran: 这部电影叙事简练，令人叹服。

example.ex: Peter had dealt admirably with the sudden questions about Keith...
example.tran: 彼得对突如其来的有关基思的问题应答自如，令人叹服。

example.ex: Johnstone's research is admirably wide-ranging.
example.tran: 约翰斯通的研究涉猎很广，让人钦佩。

sense.def: An admiral is a very senior officer who commands a navy.
sense.tran: 海军上将;海军将军;舰队司令

example.ex: ...Admiral Hodges.
example.tran: 海军上将霍奇斯

sense.def: In Britain, the Admiralty is the government department that is in charge of the navy.

example.ex: The loss of the biggest ship in the Royal Navy shocked the Admiralty.
example.tran: 皇家海军损失最大舰艇一事震惊了英国海军部。

sense.def: Admiration is a feeling of great liking and respect for a person or thing.

example.ex: I have always had the greatest admiration for him...
example.tran: 我始终对他最为钦佩。

example.ex: Meg's eyes widened in admiration.
example.tran: 梅格羡慕地睁大了双眼。

sense.def: If you admire someone or something, you like and respect them very much.

example.ex: I admired her when I first met her and I still think she's marvellous...
example.tran: 初次见面时，我就非常佩服她，时至今日我仍然认为她很出色。

example.ex: He admired the way she had coped with life...
example.tran: 他欣赏她处世的方式。

example.ex: All those who knew him will admire him for his work.
example.tran: 所有认识他的人都敬佩他所做的工作。

sense.def: If you admire someone or something, you look at them with pleasure.

example.ex: We took time to stop and admire the view.
example.tran: 我们特意驻足欣赏风景。

sense.def: If you are an admirer of someone, you like and respect them or their work very much.

example.ex: He was an admirer of her grandfather's paintings.
example.tran: 他非常欣赏她祖父的画作。

sense.def: A woman's admirers are the men who are attracted to her.

example.ex: Johnny was the most persistent and most harmless of her admirers.
example.tran: 约翰尼是追她的人中最痴心、最没有心机的一个。

sense.def: An admiring expression shows that you like or respect someone or something.

example.ex: He cast her an admiring glance...
example.tran: 他向她投以钦慕的目光。

example.ex: Within moments, he'd attracted an admiring audience.
example.tran: 不出片刻，他就赢得了全场观众的倾心。

example.ex: He glanced admiringly at the design.
example.tran: 他钦佩地看了看那个设计。

sense.def: If evidence is admissible, it is allowed in a court of law.

example.ex: Convictions will rise steeply now photographic evidence is admissible.
example.tran: 既然照片证据可以接受，有罪判决将大幅增加。

sense.def: Admission is permission given to a person to enter a place, or permission given to a country to enter an organization. Admission is also the act of entering a place.
sense.tran: 准许进入；准许加入；进入；加入

example.ex: Students apply for admission to a particular college...
example.tran: 学生们申请上某所大学。

example.ex: Poland and Czechoslovakia have vigorously pursued admission to the European Community...
example.tran: 波兰和捷克斯洛伐克已经积极寻求加入欧共体。

example.ex: ...an increase in hospital admissions of children.
example.tran: 入院儿童数量的增加

sense.def: Admissions to a place such as a school or university are the people who are allowed to enter or join it.

example.ex: Each school sets its own admissions policy.
example.tran: 每所学校制定各自的录取政策。

sense.def: Admission at a park, museum, or other place is the amount of money that you pay to enter it.

example.ex: Gates open at 10.30am and admission is free.
example.tran: 早上10:30开门，免费入场。

posc.def: Admission is also used before a noun.

example.ex: The admission price is $8 for adults.
example.tran: 成人门票8美元。

sense.hdgr:
oft N
of n, N that
sense.def: An admission is a statement that something bad, unpleasant, or embarrassing is true.

example.ex: By his own admission, he is not playing well...
example.tran: 他自己承认表现欠佳。

example.ex: She wanted some admission of guilt from her father.
example.tran: 她期待她父亲能够认罪。

sense.def: If you admit that something bad, unpleasant, or embarrassing is true, you agree, often unwillingly, that it is true.

example.ex: I am willing to admit that I do make mistakes...
example.tran: 我愿意承认我确实会犯错。

example.ex: Up to two thirds of 14 to 16 year olds admit to buying drink illegally...
example.tran: 14到16岁的青少年中多达2/3的人承认非法买过酒。

example.ex: I'd be ashamed to admit feeling jealous...
example.tran: 我不好意思承认自己的嫉妒之心。

example.ex: None of these people will admit responsibility for their actions...
example.tran: 这些人都不会愿意为自己的行为负责。

example.ex: 'Actually, most of my tennis is at club level,' he admitted.
example.tran: “说实话，我的网球基本上属于业余水平，”他承认说。

sense.def: If someone is admitted to hospital, they are taken into hospital for treatment and kept there until they are well enough to go home.

example.ex: She was admitted to hospital with a soaring temperature...
example.tran: 她因发高烧被送进医院。

example.ex: He was admitted yesterday for treatment of blood clots in his lungs.
example.tran: 他昨天入院治疗肺部的血块。

sense.def: If someone is admitted to an organization or group, they are allowed to join it.

example.ex: He was admitted to the Academie Culinaire de France...
example.tran: 他获准加入法兰西厨艺学会。

example.ex: The Parachute Regiment could be forced to admit women.
example.tran: 伞兵团可能会被迫招收女性。

sense.def: To admit someone to a place means to allow them to enter it.

example.ex: Embassy security personnel refused to admit him or his wife...
example.tran: 使馆保安人员不允许他和夫人进入。

example.ex: Journalists are rarely admitted to the region.
example.tran: 新闻记者很少获准进入该地区。

sense.def: Admittance is the act of entering a place or institution or the right to enter it.

example.ex: We had not been able to gain admittance to the flat.
example.tran: 我们未能获准进入公寓。

sense.def: You use admittedly when you are saying something which weakens the importance or force of your statement.

example.ex: It's only a theory, admittedly, but the pieces fit together...
example.tran: 诚然，这只是一种理论，但各部分互相吻合。

example.ex: Sometimes, avoidance of one particular food will have this beneficial effect, though admittedly rarely.
example.tran: 有时，对某一食物的忌口能带来这种好处，尽管不可否认这种情况极为少见。

sense.def: Admixture means the same as mixture .

example.ex: ...an admixture of fact and fantasy.
example.tran: 虚实结合

sense.def: If you admonish someone, you tell them very seriously that they have done something wrong.

example.ex: They admonished me for taking risks with my health...
example.tran: 他们责备我不应拿自己的健康冒险。

example.gram: Also V n, V n to-inf
example.ex: She admonished him gently, 'You should rest, not talk so much.'
example.tran: 她温柔地责备他：“你要多休息，少说话。”

example.ex: Sometimes he gave them a severe admonishment.
example.tran: 有时他会给予他们严厉的警告。

sense.def: An admonition is a warning or criticism about someone's behaviour.

example.ex: She ignored the admonitions of her mother.
example.tran: 她对母亲的告诫置若罔闻。

sense.def: If someone does something ad nauseam, they do it repeatedly and over a long period of time so that it becomes annoying or boring.
sense.tran: 没完没了地;令人厌烦地

example.ex: We discussed it ad nauseam.
example.tran: 我们讨论个没完没了，很无趣。

sense.def: If you do something without further ado or without more ado, you do it at once and do not discuss or delay it any longer.

example.ex: 'And now, without further ado, let me introduce our benefactor.'
example.tran: “下面，闲话少说，让我来介绍一下我们的赞助人。”

sense.def: Adobe is a mixture of mud and straw that is dried into bricks in the sun and used for building, especially in hot countries.
sense.tran: （尤指热带国家建筑用的）砖坯;土坯

example.ex: ...a few blocks of adobe houses.
example.tran: 几个街区的土坯房

sense.def: Adolescence is the period of your life in which you develop from being a child into being an adult.

example.ex: Some people become very self-conscious in adolescence.
example.tran: 有些人在青春期会变得异常害羞。

sense.def: Adolescent is used to describe young people who are no longer children but who have not yet become adults. It also refers to their behaviour.

example.ex: It is important that an adolescent boy should have an adult in whom he can confide...
example.tran: 关键是，青春期的男孩身边应该有一个可以交心的成年人。

example.ex: He spent his adolescent years playing guitar in the church band.
example.tran: 他在教堂的乐队里弹吉他，度过了他的青少年时期。

example.ex: ...adolescent rebellion.
example.tran: 青春期的叛逆

posc.def: An adolescent is an adolescent boy or girl.

example.ex: Young adolescents are happiest with small groups of close friends.
example.tran: 青少年在和自己小圈子里的好友呆在一起时最为开心。

sense.def: If you adopt a new attitude, plan, or way of behaving, you begin to have it.

example.ex: Parliament adopted a resolution calling for the complete withdrawal of troops...
example.tran: 议会采纳了要求全部撤军的决议。

example.ex: Pupils should be helped to adopt a positive approach to the environment.
example.tran: 应帮助学生对环境采取积极的态度。

example.ex: ...the adoption of Japanese management practices by British manufacturing.
example.tran: 英国制造业采取日本的管理方法

sense.def: If you adopt someone else's child, you take it into your own family and make it legally your son or daughter.

example.ex: There are hundreds of people desperate to adopt a child...
example.tran: 有数以百计的人渴望领养孩子。

example.ex: The adopted child has the right to see his birth certificate.
example.tran: 被收养的孩子有权看自己的出生证明。

example.ex: A social worker is appointed to interview the prospective adopters.
example.tran: 一名社工被任命对有意收养者进行面试。

example.ex: They gave their babies up for adoption...
example.tran: 他们放弃自己的婴儿，让别人领养。

example.ex: The majority of adoptions are successful.
example.tran: 大多数的收养都是成功的。

sense.def: If you adopt a physical position, you move yourself into it.

example.ex: I tried to adopt a curled-up position to avoid damaging my limbs.
example.tran: 我努力保持蜷曲的姿势以免四肢受伤。

sense.def: If you adopt a country, you choose it as a place to live.
sense.tran: 移居（某国）;选择（某国）定居

example.ex: Podulski had joined the U.S. Navy as an aviator, adopting a new country and a new profession.
example.tran: 波度尔斯基加入美国海军当上了飞行员，不仅改了国籍还换了行当。

example.ex: ...their adopted home in England.
example.tran: 他们移居英国的家

sense.def: If you adopt an accent or a particular tone of voice, you speak differently from normal, especially to create an effect in a particular situation.

example.ex: He has adopted the accent of a Second World War newscaster...
example.tran: 他承袭了二战时期播音员的口音。

example.ex: The girl was uncertain what to do, or what tone of voice to adopt.
example.tran: 女孩不知道该做什么，也不知道该用什么口气说。

sense.def: Someone's adoptive family is the family that adopted them.

example.ex: He was brought up by adoptive parents in London.
example.tran: 他由养父母在伦敦抚养长大。

example.ex: ...her adoptive mother.
example.tran: 她的养母

sense.def: Some-one's adoptive country or city is the one that they choose for their home, although they were not born there.

example.ex: They threatened to expel him from his adoptive country...
example.tran: 他们威胁将他驱逐出他的移居国。

example.ex: Galway in Ireland is my adoptive home.
example.tran: 爱尔兰的戈尔韦是我的第二故乡。

sense.def: If you say that someone or something is adorable, you are emphasizing that they are very attractive and you feel great affection for them.

example.ex: We have three adorable children.
example.tran: 我们有3个可爱的孩子。

sense.def: Adoration is a feeling of great admiration and love for someone or something.

example.ex: She needs and wants to be loved with overwhelming passion and adoration...
example.tran: 她需要并想要被爱的滔滔激情和倾慕所包围。

example.ex: He had been used to female adoration all his life.
example.tran: 他一生中已经对女性的爱慕习以为常了。

sense.def: If you adore someone, you feel great love and admiration for them.

example.ex: She adored her parents and would do anything to please them.
example.tran: 她很爱自己的父母，为让他们高兴愿意做任何事。

sense.def: If you adore something, you like it very much.

example.ex: My mother adores bananas and eats two a day...
example.tran: 我妈妈非常喜欢吃香蕉，每天要吃两根。

example.ex: I adore good books and the theatre.
example.tran: 我爱读好书，也喜欢看戏。

sense.def: An adoring person is someone who loves and admires another person very much.
sense.tran: 热爱的；爱慕的；敬慕的；崇拜的

example.ex: She can still pull in adoring audiences.
example.tran: 她仍然能吸引爱慕的观众。

example.ex: ...gazing adoringly at him.
example.tran: 含情脉脉地看着他

sense.def: If something adorns a place or an object, it makes it look more beautiful.

example.ex: His watercolour designs adorn a wide range of books...
example.tran: 他的水彩设计使许多图书大为生色。

example.ex: Several magnificent oil paintings adorn the walls.
example.tran: 几幅恢宏的油画装点着墙面。

sense.def: An adornment is something that is used to make a person or thing more beautiful.

example.ex: It was a building without any adornment or decoration.
example.tran: 这是一幢没有任何装潢或粉饰的大楼。

sense.def: Adornment is the process of making something more beautiful by adding something to it.

example.ex: Cosmetics are used for adornment.
example.tran: 化妆品是用来打扮的。

sense.def: Adrenalin is a substance which your body produces when you are angry, scared, or excited. It makes your heart beat faster and gives you more energy.
sense.tran: 肾上腺素（情绪激动时肾上腺分泌的一种化学物质，能加快心跳及产生更多能量）

example.ex: Seeing the crowd really got my adrenalin pumping.
example.tran: 看见这么多人确实让我热血沸腾。

sense.def: If a boat is adrift, it is floating on the water and is not tied to anything or controlled by anyone.

example.ex: They were spotted after three hours adrift in a dinghy.
example.tran: 他们在小舢板上漂浮了3个小时后才被发现。

sense.def: If someone is adrift, they feel alone with no clear idea of what they should do.

example.ex: Amy had the growing sense that she was adrift and isolated.
example.tran: 埃米愈发感到自己孤立无援，孑然一身。

sense.def: If something comes adrift, it is no longer attached to an object that it should be part of.

example.ex: Three insulating panels had come adrift from the base of the vehicle.
example.tran: 车子底盘的3块隔热板已经脱落了。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, usu ADJ
of n
sense.def: In sporting competitions, if a team or a player is adrift of their rivals, they are behind them, usually by a specified number of points or by a specified distance.
sense.tran: 分数落后的;排名在后的

example.ex: Aberdeen are nine points adrift of Rangers at the top of the Scottish League.
example.tran: 在苏格兰足球联赛中，亚伯丁队比排在首位的流浪者队落后9分。

sense.def: If something has gone adrift, it is no longer happening in the way that was intended.

example.ex: We have seen this as an attempt to place the blame for a policy that has gone adrift.
example.tran: 我们已经认识到，这是把责任归咎于一项已偏离方向的政策的一种企图。

sense.def: Someone who is adroit is quick and skilful in their thoughts, behaviour, or actions.

example.ex: She is a remarkably adroit and determined politician.
example.tran: 她是一位异常精明果断的政治家。

example.ex: He drove adroitly.
example.tran: 他车技娴熟。

example.ex: He governed with an adroitness that gained him the nickname 'the old fox'.
example.tran: 他因管理有方而为自己赢得了“老狐狸”的绰号。

sense.def: ADSL is a method of transmitting digital information at high speed over telephone lines. ADSL is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'asymmetric digital subscriber line'.
sense.tran: 非对称数字用户线路（通过普通电话线提供宽带数据业务的技术）

example.ex: ADSL is always on, which makes your PC much more vulnerable to hacking.
example.tran: 一直挂在线上会使你的个人电脑更容易被黑客攻击。

sense.def: Adulation is uncritical admiration and praise of someone or something.

example.ex: The book was received with adulation by critics.
example.tran: 这本书受到了评论人士的吹捧。

sense.def: If someone makes an adulatory comment about someone, they praise them and show their admiration of them.

example.ex: ...adulatory reviews.
example.tran: 奉承话

sense.def: An adult is a mature, fully developed person. An adult has reached the age when they are legally responsible for their actions.

example.ex: Becoming a father signified that he was now an adult...
example.tran: 当了父亲意味着他已是个成年人了。

example.ex: Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult.
example.tran: 14岁以下的儿童必须由成人陪同。

sense.def: An adult is a fully developed animal.

example.ex: ...a pair of adult birds.
example.tran: 一对成年鸟

sense.def: Adult means relating to the time when you are an adult, or typical of adult people.

example.ex: I've lived most of my adult life in London.
example.tran: 我成年之后的大部分时间都是在伦敦度过的。

sense.def: If you say that someone is adult about something, you think that they act in a mature, intelligent way, especially when faced with a difficult situation.

example.ex: We were very adult about it. We discussed it rationally over a drink.
example.tran: 在这件事上我们表现得很成熟。我们一边喝酒一边心平气和地谈了谈。

example.ex: ...dealing with emerging sexuality in an adult way.
example.tran: 平静对待出现的性征

sense.def: You can describe things such as films or books as adult when they deal with sex in a very clear and open way.
sense.tran: （涉及性内容的电影或书籍）仅限于成人的

example.ex: ...an adult movie.
example.tran: 成人电影

sense.def: Adult education is education for adults in a variety of subjects, most of which are practical, not academic. Classes are often held in the evenings.

example.ex: Most adult education centres offer computing courses.
example.tran: 大多数成教中心都设有计算机课程。

sense.def: If something such as food or drink is adulterated, someone has made its quality worse by adding water or cheaper products to it.
sense.tran: 在（饮食中）掺入杂质;掺假

example.ex: The food had been adulterated to increase its weight...
example.tran: 食物被掺了杂质以增加分量。

example.ex: There is a regulation against adulterated cosmetics.
example.tran: 规定禁止出售假冒化妆品。

example.ex: ...the adulteration of tobacco.
example.tran: 假烟

sense.def: An adulterer is someone who commits adultery.
An adulteress is a woman who commits adultery.
An adulterous relationship is a sexual relationship between a married person and someone they are not married to. An adulterous person is someone who commits adultery.
If a married person commits adultery, they have sex with someone that they are not married to.

example.ex: She is going to divorce him on the grounds of adultery.
example.tran: 她以丈夫搞婚外情为由要求离婚。

sense.def: Adulthood is the state of being an adult.

example.ex: Few people nowadays are able to maintain friendships into adulthood.
example.tran: 如今很少有人能将友谊维持到成年。

sense.def: Adv. is a written abbreviation for (书面缩略=) adverb.
To advance means to move forward, often in order to attack someone.

example.ex: Reports from Chad suggest that rebel forces are advancing on the capital...
example.tran: 来自乍得的报告显示叛军正向首都推进。

example.ex: The water is advancing at a rate of 5cm a day...
example.tran: 水位正以每天5厘米的速度上升。

example.ex: ...a picture of a man throwing himself before an advancing tank.
example.tran: 一名男子冲向迎面开来的坦克的一幅照片

sense.def: To advance means to make progress, especially in your knowledge of something.

example.ex: Medical technology has advanced considerably...
example.tran: 医学技术突飞猛进。

example.ex: Japan has advanced from a rural, feudal society to an urban, industrial power.
example.tran: 日本已从封建农业社会发展成一个城市化工业强国。

sense.def: If you advance someone a sum of money, you lend it to them, or pay it to them earlier than arranged.

example.ex: I advanced him some money, which he would repay on our way home...
example.tran: 我先借给他一些钱，在我们回家的路上他会还给我的。

example.ex: The bank advanced $1.2 billion to help the country with debt repayments.
example.tran: 银行预支12亿美元帮助该国偿还债务。

sense.def: An advance is money which is lent or paid to someone before they would normally receive it.

example.ex: She was paid a £100,000 advance for her next two novels.
example.tran: 她接下来的两部小说得到了10万英镑的预付稿费。

sense.def: To advance an event, or the time or date of an event, means to bring it forward to an earlier time or date.
sense.tran: 提前（未来事件的日期）；使（未来事件）提前发生

example.ex: Too much protein in the diet may advance the ageing process...
example.tran: 饮食中摄入过量蛋白质可能会加速衰老。

example.ex: The country's election commission has advanced the date of parliamentary elections by three days.
example.tran: 该国的选举委员会将议会选举日期提前了3天。

sense.def: If you advance a cause, interest, or claim, you support it and help to make it successful.
sense.tran: 促进，推动（事业、利益或主张）；使加速

example.ex: When not producing art of his own, Oliver was busy advancing the work of others.
example.tran: 奥利弗在不搞自己的艺术创作时，就会忙着帮助别人完成作品。

sense.def: When a theory or argument is advanced, it is put forward for discussion.

example.ex: Many theories have been advanced as to why some women suffer from depression...
example.tran: 就一些女性患抑郁症的原因，各种说法纷至沓来。

example.ex: An important set of ideas have been advanced by the biologist Rupert Sheldrake.
example.tran: 生物学家鲁珀特·谢尔德雷克已提出了一整套重要的观点。

sense.def: An advance is a forward movement of people or vehicles, usually as part of a military operation.
sense.tran: （常指军事行动中的）前进，行进，推进

example.ex: ...an advance on enemy positions...
example.tran: 向敌方阵地推进

example.ex: The defences are intended to obstruct any advance by tanks and other vehicles.
example.tran: 这些防御工事用于阻止坦克等车辆前进。

sense.def: If you make advances to someone, you try to start a sexual relationship with them.

example.ex: Mark had for some time been making advances towards her...
example.tran: 马克追她已经有一段时间了。

example.ex: She rejected his advances during the trip to Cannes.
example.tran: 在去往戛纳的途中，她拒绝了他的挑逗。

sense.def: An advance in a particular subject or activity is progress in understanding it or in doing it well.

example.ex: Air safety has not improved since the dramatic advances of the 1970s...
example.tran: 航空安全自从20世纪70年代得到显著提高之后，至今再没有任何改善。

example.ex: Their progress at work was mirrored by their children's educational advance.
example.tran: 子女在学业上有所进步，他们在工作上也就会有所起色。

sense.def: If something is an advance on what was previously available or done, it is better in some way.

example.ex: This could be an advance on the present situation.
example.tran: 这样可能会改善当前状况。

sense.def: Advance booking, notice, or warning is done or given before an event happens.

example.ex: They don't normally give any advance notice about which building they're going to inspect...
example.tran: 他们一般不会预先通知检查哪座大楼。

example.ex: The event received little advance publicity.
example.tran: 关于该事件事先几乎没有报道。

sense.def: An advance party or group is a small group of people who go on ahead of the main group.

example.ex: The 20-strong advance party will be followed by another 600 soldiers as part of UN relief efforts.
example.tran: 作为联合国救援行动的一部分，在这支由20多人组成的先头部队之后还将增派600名士兵。

phrase.def: If one thing happens or is done in advance of another, it happens or is done before the other thing.

example.ex: I had asked everyone to submit questions in advance of the meeting.
example.tran: 我已请每个人在会议之前提交问题。

phrase.def: If you do something in advance, you do it before a particular date or event.

example.ex: The subject of the talk is announced a week in advance.
example.tran: 会谈的主题已提前一周宣布。
