sense.def: An advanced system, method, or design is modern and has been developed from an earlier version of the same thing.

example.ex: Without more training or advanced technical skills, they'll lose their jobs.
example.tran: 没有进一步的培训或高级技能的话，他们就会丢掉工作。

example.ex: ...the most advanced optical telescope in the world.
example.tran: 世界上最先进的光学望远镜

sense.def: A country that is advanced has reached a high level of industrial or technological development.

example.ex: ...a technologically advanced society.
example.tran: 科技发达的社会

sense.def: An advanced student has already learned the basic facts of a subject and is doing more difficult work. An advanced course of study is designed for such students.
sense.tran: （学生）程度高的；（课程）高级的，高等的

example.ex: The course is suitable for beginners and advanced students...
example.tran: 本课程适合初学者及程度较高者。

example.ex: The lab has recently been updated to allow for more advanced courses.
example.tran: 实验室最近经过更新，可以上更高阶的课程了。

sense.def: Something that is at an advanced stage or level is at a late stage of development.

example.ex: 'Medicare' is available to victims of advanced kidney disease...
example.tran: 老年医疗保险也适用于肾病晚期患者。

example.ex: His ideas should be more advanced by the time the Committee meets in Edinburgh in October.
example.tran: 到委员会10月份在爱丁堡开会时，他的观点应该更为成熟了。

sense.def: If you say that someone is of advanced years or is advanced in age, you are saying in a polite way that they are old.

example.ex: The gentleman, despite his advanced years, helped Kathryn back to her seat.
example.tran: 这位绅士，尽管年事已高，仍然帮着凯瑟琳回到座位上。

sense.def: Advancement is progress in your job or in your social position.

example.ex: He cared little for social advancement.
example.tran: 他不太在意社会地位的提升。

sense.def: The advancement of something is the process of helping it to progress or the result of its progress.

example.ex: ..her work for the advancement of the status of women.
example.tran: 她为提高妇女地位所作的工作

sense.def: An advantage is something that puts you in a better position than other people.
sense.tran: 有利条件；有利因素；优势

example.ex: They are deliberately flouting the law in order to obtain an advantage over their competitors...
example.tran: 他们为了和竞争对手抢夺先机而公然无视法律。

example.ex: A good crowd will be a definite advantage to me and the rest of the team.
example.tran: 大批观众无疑将成为我和其他队员的一大优势。

sense.def: Advantage is the state of being in a better position than others who are competing against you.

example.ex: Men have created a social and economic position of advantage for themselves over women.
example.tran: 男性已经为自己创造了优于女性的社会和经济上的有利地位。

sense.def: An advantage is a way in which one thing is better than another.

example.ex: The great advantage of home-grown oranges is their magnificent flavour...
example.tran: 家产柑橘的一大好处是口感极佳。

example.ex: This custom-built kitchen has many advantages over a standard one.
example.tran: 这间定制的厨房与标准厨房相比存在诸多优点。

phrase.def: If you take advantage of something, you make good use of it while you can.

example.ex: I intend to take full advantage of this trip to buy the things we need.
example.tran: 我打算充分利用这次旅行来购买我们所需的物品。

phrase.def: If someone takes advantage of you, they treat you unfairly for their own benefit, especially when you are trying to be kind or to help them.

example.ex: She took advantage of him even after they were divorced.
example.tran: 甚至在他们离婚后，她还在占他的便宜。

phrase.def: If you use or turn something to your advantage, you use it in order to benefit from it, especially when it might be expected to harm or damage you.
phrase.tran: （尤指转变不利情况使之）对…有利

example.ex: The government have not been able to turn today's demonstration to their advantage.
example.tran: 政府未能把今天的游行示威转为己用。

phrase.def: If something is shown to good advantage or to best advantage, it is shown in a way that reveals its best features.
phrase.tran: 最有利地；最有效地；使优点突出

example.ex: The walls were painted in muted tones to show the pictures to good advantage.
example.tran: 墙面被漆成了淡色调，以突出照片。

sense.def: A person or place that is advantaged is in a better social or financial position than other people or places.
sense.tran: （在社会地位或经济条件上）处于优势的，占有利位置的

example.ex: Some cities are always going to be more advantaged.
example.tran: 一些城市总会有一些得天独厚的优势。

sense.def: If something is advantageous to you, it is likely to benefit you.

example.ex: Free exchange of goods was advantageous to all.
example.tran: 商品自由交换惠泽八方。

example.ex: ...an opportunity to purchase a set of tools at very advantageous prices.
example.tran: 以非常优惠的价格购买一套工具的机会

example.ex: They acquire the land in order to be able to sell it advantageously to the government.
example.tran: 他们购下这块土地，目的是在转手给政府时能够从中渔利。

sense.def: The advent of an important event, invention, or situation is the fact of it starting or coming into existence.
sense.tran: （重大事件、发明或情况的）出现，问世，到来

example.ex: ...the leap forward in communication made possible by the advent of the mobile phone.
example.tran: 手机的问世带来了通讯业的迅猛发展

example.ex: The advent of war led to a greater austerity.
example.tran: 战争的到来使形势更为严峻。

sense.def: The advent of a person at a place is their arrival there.

example.ex: Deptford had come alive with the advent of the new priest at St Paul's.
example.tran: 圣保罗教堂新牧师的到来使德特福德变得生机勃勃。

sense.def: In the Christian church, Advent is the period between Advent Sunday, the Sunday closest to the 30th of November, and Christmas Day.
sense.tran: 降临节（在最靠近11月30日的星期日和圣诞节之间的节期）

sense.def: If someone has an adventure, they become involved in an unusual, exciting, and rather dangerous journey or series of events.

example.ex: I set off for a new adventure in the United States on the first day of the new year.
example.tran: 新年第一天，我在美国开始了一次新的冒险。

sense.def: Adventure is excitement and willingness to do new, unusual, or rather dangerous things.
sense.tran: 冒险的刺激；大胆的开拓；勇敢的闯荡

example.ex: Their cultural backgrounds gave them a spirit of adventure.
example.tran: 他们的文化背景赋予了他们一种冒险精神。

example.ex: ...a feeling of adventure and excitement.
example.tran: 惊险刺激的感觉

sense.def: If you adventure somewhere, you go somewhere new, unusual, and exciting.

example.ex: The group has adventured as far as the Austrian alps.
example.tran: 该队伍的探险之旅远至奥地利的阿尔卑斯山。

sense.def: An adventure playground is an area of land for children to play in, usually in cities or in a park. It has wooden structures and equipment such as ropes, nets, and rubber tyres.
sense.tran: （供儿童玩耍的）奇遇游乐场，冒险乐园

sense.def: An adventurer is a person who enjoys going to new, unusual, and exciting places.
If you describe someone as an adventurer, you disapprove of them because they are using dishonest or immoral methods to gain money or power.
sense.tran: 投机取巧者；用不正当手段谋求钱财（或权利）者

example.ex: ...unprincipled opportunists and ambitious political adventurers.
example.tran: 不择手段的机会主义者和野心勃勃的政治投机者

sense.def: Adventuresome means the same as adventurous .

example.ex: Every day was exciting and adventuresome.
example.tran: 每天都充满刺激和新奇。

sense.def: Adventurism is a willingness to take risks, especially in order to obtain an unfair advantage in politics or business.
sense.tran: （尤指在商业、政治方面为获得不当利益而甘冒风险的）冒险主义

example.ex: He dismissed guerrilla warfare as 'adventurism.'
example.tran: 他对游击战嗤之以鼻，认为那是一种“冒险主义”。

sense.def: If you describe someone or something as adventurist, you disapprove of them because they are willing to take risks in order to gain an unfair advantage in business or politics.

example.ex: ...aggressive and adventurist foreign policy.
example.tran: 激进冒险的外交政策

posc.def: An adventurist is someone who behaves in an adventurist way.

example.ex: ...political adventurists.
example.tran: 政治冒险主义者

sense.def: Someone who is adventurous is willing to take risks and to try new methods. Something that is adventurous involves new things or ideas.
sense.tran: 勇于冒险的；敢于创新的；新奇的

example.ex: Warren was an adventurous businessman...
example.tran: 沃伦是个敢于冒险的商人。

example.ex: The menu could have been more adventurous.
example.tran: 菜单本可以做得更有新意。

sense.def: Someone who is adventurous is eager to visit new places and have new experiences.

example.ex: He had always wanted an adventurous life in the tropics.
example.tran: 他一直想到热带地区过冒险的生活。

sense.def: An adverb is a word such as 'slowly', 'now', 'very', 'politically', or 'fortunately' which adds information about the action, event, or situation mentioned in a clause.
An adverb group or adverbial group is a group of words based on an adverb, such as 'very slowly' or 'fortunately for us'. An adverb group can also consist simply of an adverb.
Adverbial means relating to adverbs or like an adverb.

example.ex: ...an adverbial expression.
example.tran: 副词性表达方式

sense.def: If you describe something as adversarial, you mean that it involves two or more people or organizations who are opposing each other.

example.ex: In our country there is an adversarial relationship between government and business.
example.tran: 在我国，官商之间存在一种对立关系。

example.ex: ...an adversarial legal system.
example.tran: 两派对立的法律制度

sense.def: Your adversary is someone you are competing with, or arguing or fighting against.

example.ex: Elliott crossed the finish line just half a second behind his adversary...
example.tran: 埃利奥特跨过终点线时仅比对手落后半秒钟。

example.ex: His political adversaries were creating a certain amount of trouble for him.
example.tran: 他的政敌正在给他制造一些麻烦。

sense.def: Adverse decisions, conditions, or effects are unfavourable to you.

example.ex: The police said Mr Hadfield's decision would have no adverse effect on the progress of the investigation...
example.tran: 警方称哈德菲尔德先生的决定将不会对调查的进展造成不利影响。

example.ex: Despite the adverse conditions, the road was finished in just eight months.
example.tran: 尽管存在种种不利情况，公路还是仅用8个月就完工了。

example.ex: Price changes must not adversely affect the living standards of the people.
example.tran: 物价变化一定不能给人们的生活水准带来负面影响。

sense.def: Adversity is a very difficult or unfavourable situation.

example.ex: He showed courage in adversity.
example.tran: 他在逆境中表现出了勇气。

sense.def: An advert is an announcement in a newspaper, on television, or on a poster about something such as a product, event, or job.

example.ex: I saw an advert for a job with a large engineering company...
example.tran: 我看见一家大型工程公司的招聘广告。

example.ex: Many caravans are let by private individuals through adverts in papers or shop windows.
example.tran: 许多旅行拖车由私人通过在报纸或商店橱窗上做广告出租。

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 ad

sense.def: If you say that an example of something is an advert for that thing in general, you mean that it shows how good that thing is.

example.ex: This courtroom battle has been a poor advert for English justice.
example.tran: 这场法庭上的争论为英格兰的司法制度做了一次拙劣的广告。

sense.def: You can use the adverts to refer to the interval in a commercial television programme, or between programmes, during which advertisements are shown.

example.ex: After the adverts, the presenter tried to pretend that everything was back to normal.
example.tran: 广告过后，主持人努力假装一切恢复正常。

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 commercial break

sense.def: If you advertise something such as a product, an event, or a job, you tell people about it in newspapers, on television, or on posters in order to encourage them to buy the product, go to the event, or apply for the job.

example.ex: The players can advertise baked beans, but not rugby boots...
example.tran: 球员可以给烤菜豆做广告，但不能代言橄榄球靴。

example.ex: In 1991, the house was advertised for sale at $49,000...
example.tran: 1991年，这座房子登广告出售，售价为49,000美元。

example.ex: Religious groups are currently not allowed to advertise on television.
example.tran: 目前禁止宗教团体在电视上做广告。

sense.def: If you advertise for someone to do something for you, for example to work for you or share your accommodation, you announce it in a newspaper, on television, or on a notice board.
sense.tran: （在报纸、电视、公告栏上）登广告招募，登广告征求

example.ex: We advertised for staff in a local newspaper...
example.tran: 我们在一家地方报纸上刊登了招聘广告。

example.ex: I shall advertise for someone to go with me.
example.tran: 我将登广告寻人和我同去。

sense.def: If someone or something advertises a particular quality, they show it in their appearance or behaviour.
sense.tran: （通过外表或行为）显示（某种特质）；使变得显眼

example.ex: His hard sinewy body advertised his ruthlessness of purpose.
example.tran: 他健硕的身体使他显得意志尤为坚强。

sense.def: If you do not advertise the fact that something is the case, you try not to let other people know about it.
sense.tran: 宣扬；张扬；引起对…的注意

example.ex: There is no need to advertise the fact that you are a single woman...
example.tran: 没有必要张扬你是一个单身女性。

example.ex: I didn't want to advertise the fact that he hadn't driven me to the airport.
example.tran: 我不想宣扬他没有开车送我去机场的事。

sense.def: An advertisement is an announcement in a newspaper, on television, or on a poster about something such as a product, event, or job.

example.ex: Miss Parrish recently placed an advertisement in the local newspaper.
example.tran: 帕里什小姐最近在本埠报纸上登了一则广告。

sense.def: If you say that an example of something is an advertisement for that thing in general, you mean that it shows how good that thing is.

example.ex: The England team were a poor advertisement for European football tonight...
example.tran: 英格兰队今晚为欧洲足球做了一次糟糕的宣传。

example.ex: That would not be a good advertisement for Hungary's emerging democracy.
example.tran: 那并不能有效地体现匈牙利新兴的民主意识。

sense.def: An advertiser is a person or company that pays for a product, event, or job to be advertised in a newspaper, on television, or on a poster.
Advertiser is used in the name of some local newspapers.
sense.tran: (用于某些地方报纸的名称中)

example.ex: ...the Croydon Advertiser.
example.tran: 《克罗伊登广告报》

sense.def: Advertising is the activity of creating advertisements and making sure people see them.
An advertising agency is a company whose business is to create advertisements for other companies or organizations.

example.ex: Advertising agencies are losing their once-powerful grip on brand marketing.
example.tran: 广告代理公司正逐渐丧失曾经对品牌营销的有力控制。

sense.def: An advertising campaign is a planned series of advertisements.
sense.tran: 有计划的系列广告；广告宣传活动

example.ex: The Government has launched an advertising campaign to encourage people to vote.
example.tran: 政府已发起一系列广告宣传攻势鼓励民众参加选举。

sense.def: An advertorial is an advertisement that uses the style of newspaper or magazine articles or television documentary programmes, so that it appears to be giving facts and not trying to sell a product.
sense.tran: 社论式广告（采用报刊文体形式或电视纪录片模式呈现出的广告，使其看起来更像是事实的陈述而非产品的宣传）

sense.def: If you give someone advice, you tell them what you think they should do in a particular situation.

example.ex: Don't be afraid to ask for advice about ordering the meal...
example.tran: 点餐时可以大胆征求意见。

example.ex: Your community officer can give you advice on how to prevent crime in your area...
example.tran: 社区工作人员能就如何预防社区内犯罪提供一些忠告。

example.ex: Take my advice and stay away from him!...
example.tran: 听我的，离他远远的！

example.ex: Most foreign nationals have now left the country on the advice of their governments.
example.tran: 大多数外国人听从本国政府的建议离开了该国。

sense.def: If you take advice or take legal advice, you ask a lawyer for his or her professional opinion on a situation.
sense.tran: 听取律师的意见;咨询律师

example.ex: We are taking advice on legal steps to recover the money...
example.tran: 我们正在就追回该款项所需的法律程序咨询律师。

example.ex: If you are prosecuted by the police, then it is essential that you take specialist legal advice.
example.tran: 如果你受到警方起诉，至关重要的是你要听取专业律师的意见。

boxu.usage: Note that advice is an uncount noun. You can say a piece of advice or some advice, but you cannot say 'an advice' or 'advices'. Do not confuse advice and advise. Advise is the verb that is connected with advice.
boxu.tran: 注意，advice为不可数名词。可以说 a piece of advice 或 some advice，但不能说 an advice 或 advices。请勿混淆 advice 和 advise。advise 是 advice 的动词形式。

sense.def: In a newspaper or magazine, the advice column contains letters from readers about their personal problems, and advice on what to do about them.
sense.tran: （报刊上的）答读者问专栏，答疑解惑专栏

entry.boxr: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 agony column

sense.def: An advice columnist is a person who writes a column in a newspaper or magazine in which they reply to readers who have written to them for advice on their personal problems.
sense.tran: 答读者问专栏作家，答疑解惑专栏作家

entry.boxr: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 agony aunt

sense.def: An advice line is a service that you can telephone in order to get advice about something.

example.ex: For help on crime prevention, call our 24-hour advice line.
example.tran: 若想获得预防犯罪方面的帮助，请拨打我们的24小时咨询热线。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, oft
it v-link ADJ to-inf
sense.def: If you tell someone that it is advisable to do something, you are suggesting that they should do it, because it is sensible or is likely to achieve the result they want.

example.ex: Because of the popularity of the region, it is advisable to book hotels or camp sites in advance...
example.tran: 鉴于该地区很受人们青睐，最好提前预订旅馆或宿营地。

example.ex: It is generally not advisable for expectant mothers to travel by air after the 28th week of pregnancy.
example.tran: 怀孕28周以后的准妈妈一般不宜乘坐飞机出行。

example.ex: I have doubts about the advisability of surgery in this case.
example.tran: 关于该病例做手术的可行性，我持有疑问。

sense.def: If you advise someone to do something, you tell them what you think they should do.

example.ex: The minister advised him to leave as soon as possible...
example.tran: 部长建议他尽快离开。

example.ex: Herbert would surely advise her how to approach the bank...
example.tran: 赫伯特一定会就如何与银行接洽向她提供意见。

example.ex: I would strongly advise against it...
example.tran: 我强烈建议反对此事。

example.ex: Doctors advised that he should be transferred to a private room.
example.tran: 医生们建议将他转到单人病房。

sense.def: If an expert advises people on a particular subject, he or she gives them help and information on that subject.

example.ex: ...an officer who advises undergraduates on money matters...
example.tran: 为本科生们提供理财建议的高级职员

example.ex: A family doctor will be able to advise on suitable birth control.
example.tran: 家庭医生能够就合适的节育措施提出建议。

sense.def: If you advise someone of a fact or situation, you tell them the fact or explain what the situation is.
sense.tran: 通知，告知（某人事实或情况）

example.ex: ...the decision requiring police to advise suspects of their rights...
example.tran: 要求警方告知疑犯他们所享权利的决定

example.ex: I think it best that I advise you of my decision to retire.
example.tran: 我想我最好告诉你我决定退役。

sense.def: If an official document states that you are advised to do something, it is telling you the correct or appropriate thing to do.

example.ex: Candidates in India are advised to submit their applications through the overseas student office in London...
example.tran: 印度的申请人被告知通过驻伦敦的海外学生办公室递交申请表。

example.ex: Residents are advised not to put their rubbish bags on the pavement outside their houses.
example.tran: 居民被告知不要将垃圾袋放在门外的人行道上。

boxu.usage: Do not confuse advise and advice. Advice is the noun that is connected with the verb advise. If you advise someone to do something, you tell them what you think they should do. If you suggest something, however, you mention it as an idea or plan for someone to think about, perhaps together with other ideas or plans. You can also suggest doing something, or suggest that someone does something. Your bank manager will probably suggest a loan... I suggested inviting Jim... I suggest that you leave this to me.
boxu.tran: 请勿混淆advise和advice。advice是advise的名词形式。advise用于告诉别人应该怎样做。suggest用于提出想法或计划以供对方考虑，有可能和其他想法或计划一起提出。可以说suggest doing something或suggest that someone does something。例如：Your bank manager will probably suggest a loan（银行经理可能会建议你贷款），I suggested inviting Jim（我建议邀请吉姆），I suggest that you leave this to me（我建议你将此事交给我处理）。

sense.def: If you say that you are using a word or expression advisedly, you mean that you have deliberately chosen to use it, even though it may sound unusual, wrong, or offensive, because it draws attention to what you are saying.
sense.tran: 经慎重考虑后；深思熟虑地；特意地

example.ex: I say 'boys' advisedly because we are talking almost entirely about male behaviour...
example.tran: 我特意说成“男孩们”因为我们几乎一直在讨论男性的行为。

example.ex: What a crazy scheme, and I use that term advisedly.
example.tran: 这是个多么疯狂的计划，我用了那个词是斟酌过的。

sense.def: If someone in authority takes a matter under advisement, they decide that the matter needs to be considered more carefully, often by experts.

example.ex: I will take the suggestion under advisement, and refer it to the board.
example.tran: 对于这项建议，我将咨询专家意见作周密考虑并且提交给董事会处理。

sense.hdgr:
usu with supp, oft N
to n
sense.def: An adviser is an expert whose job is to give advice to another person or to a group of people.

example.ex: In Washington, the President and his advisers spent the day in meetings.
example.tran: 在华盛顿，总统和他的顾问们一整天都在开会。

example.ex: ...a careers adviser.
example.tran: 职业顾问

sense.def: An advisory group regularly gives suggestions and help to people or organizations, especially about a particular subject or area of activity.

example.ex: ...members of the advisory committee on the safety of nuclear installations...
example.tran: 核设施安全顾问委员会的成员

example.ex: Now my role is strictly advisory.
example.tran: 现在我的角色仅限于顾问。

sense.def: An advisory is an official announcement or report that warns people about bad weather, diseases, or other dangers or problems.
sense.tran: （关于天气、疾病或其他危险、问题的）公告，警告

example.ex: 26 states have issued health advisories.
example.tran: 26个州已经发布了健康警告。

sense.def: Someone's advocacy of a particular action or plan is their act of recommending it publicly.

example.ex: I support your advocacy of free trade.
example.tran: 我支持你自由贸易的主张。

sense.def: Advocacy is the way in which lawyers deal with cases in court.

example.ex: Sir Peter would also like to see the current adversarial system of advocacy examined by the royal commission.
example.tran: 彼得爵士也乐于见到王室委员会审查当前对抗式的辩护制度。

sense.def: An advocacy group or organization is one that tries to influence the decisions of a government or other authority.
sense.tran: （试图影响政府或其他权力机构决策的）游说（团体或组织）

example.ex: Consumer advocacy groups are not so enthusiastic about removing restrictions on the telephone companies.
example.tran: 保护消费者团体并不热衷于取消对电话公司的限制。

entry.boxr: The verb is pronounced /'ædvəkeɪt/. The noun is pronounced /'ædvəkət/. 动词读作 /'ædvəkeɪt/，名词读作 /'ædvəkət/。

sense.def: If you advocate a particular action or plan, you recommend it publicly.

example.ex: Mr Williams is a conservative who advocates fewer government controls on business.
example.tran: 威廉斯先生是个保守派，主张政府应减少对商业的控制。

example.ex: ...the tax policy advocated by the Opposition.
example.tran: 反对党提倡的税收政策

sense.def: An advocate of a particular action or plan is someone who recommends it publicly.

example.ex: He was a strong advocate of free market policies and a multi-party system.
example.tran: 他是自由市场政策和多党派制度的坚决拥护者。

sense.def: An advocate is a lawyer who speaks in favour of someone or defends them in a court of law.
An advocate for a particular group is a person who works for the interests of that group.

example.ex: ...advocates for the homeless...
example.tran: 为无家可归的人谋利益者

example.ex: Animal rights advocates argue that zoos are really animal prisons and very often cruel.
example.tran: 动物权利保护者指出动物园实际上是动物的牢笼，经常很残酷地对待动物。

sense.def: Something that is done under the aegis of a person or organization is done with their official support and backing.
sense.tran: 在…的支持下；在…的保护下；以…作后盾

example.ex: The space programme will continue under the aegis of the armed forces...
example.tran: 这项太空计划将以武装部队作后盾继续进行。

example.ex: She went to Sheffield University as a lecturer, under the aegis of Boris Ford.
example.tran: 在鲍里斯·福特的支持下，她去了谢菲尔德大学讲课。

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 eon

sense.def: An aeon is an extremely long period of time.
sense.tran: 极漫长的时期；万古；千万年

example.ex: Aeons ago, there were deserts where there is now fertile land.
example.tran: 现在是肥沃土地的地方在很久很久以前曾是一片片沙漠。

sense.def: To aerate a substance means to cause air or gas to pass through it.

example.ex: Aerate the soil by spiking with a fork.
example.tran: 用耙刨地使土壤透气。

example.ex: ...fresh crab and lobster, transported south in tanker loads of aerated salted water.
example.tran: 新鲜的螃蟹和龙虾被装在灌满充气盐水的罐车里运往南方

sense.def: You talk about aerial attacks and aerial photographs to indicate that people or things on the ground are attacked or photographed by people in aeroplanes.
sense.tran: 航空的；飞机的；由飞机进行的；空中的

example.ex: Weeks of aerial bombardment had destroyed factories and highways...
example.tran: 数周的空中轰炸已经摧毁了许多工厂和公路。

example.ex: Patterns that are invisible on the ground can be the most striking part of an aerial photograph...
example.tran: 地面上看不出来的图案可能会成为航拍照片中最引人注目的东西。

example.ex: The film begins with an aerial view of the Great Basin of Nevada.
example.tran: 影片以空中鸟瞰内华达大盆地的镜头开始。

sense.def: You can use aerial to describe things that exist or happen above the ground or in the air.

example.ex: The seagulls swirled in aerial combat over the barges.
example.tran: 海鸥盘旋在驳船上方，展开空中的搏斗。

sense.def: An aerial is a device or a piece of wire that receives television or radio signals and is usually attached to a radio, television, car, or building.

xrse.see: See pictures on pages A1 and A3. A1和A3页图

example.ex: ...a saucer-shaped satellite television aerial.
example.tran: 碟状的卫星电视天线

example.ex: ...the radio aerials of taxis and cars.
example.tran: 出租车和轿车的无线电天线

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 antenna

sense.def: aero- is used at the beginning of words, especially nouns, that refer to things or activities connected with air or movement through the air.
sense.tran: （用于词首，尤用于名词）表示“空中的”，“空气中的”

sense.def: aero- combines with nouns to form nouns relating to aeroplanes.
sense.tran: （与名词结合构成新的名词）表示“与飞机相关的”

example.ex: ...the British aero-engine maker, Rolls-Royce.
example.tran: 英国飞机引擎制造商，罗尔斯-罗伊斯

sense.def: The form aerobatic is used as a modifier. Aerobatics are skilful displays of flying, usually to entertain people watching from the ground.
Aerobic activity exercises and strengthens your heart and lungs.

example.ex: Aerobic exercise gets the heart pumping and helps you to burn up the fat.
example.tran: 有氧运动加速心脏跳动，有助于消耗更多脂肪。

sense.def: Aerobics is a form of exercise which increases the amount of oxygen in your blood, and strengthens your heart and lungs. The verb that follows aerobics may be either singular or plural.

example.ex: I'd like to join an aerobics class to improve my fitness.
example.tran: 我想参加有氧运动训练班来增强体质。

sense.def: An aerodrome is a place or area where small aircraft can land and take off.

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 airdrome

sense.def: If something such as a car has an aerodynamic shape or design, it goes faster and uses less fuel than other cars because the air passes over it more easily.

example.ex: The secret of the machine lies in the aerodynamic shape of the frame.
example.tran: 该机器的精妙之处在于其构架呈流线型。

example.ex: Cars are becoming so aerodynamically efficient.
example.tran: 汽车越来越向流线型节能方向发展。

entry.boxr: The form aerodynamic is used as a modifier. In British English, aerodynamics is sometimes used as a plural noun, with a plural verb. aerodynamic 用作定语。在英国英语中，aerodynamics 有时用作复数名词，后接动词复数形式。

sense.def: Aerodynamics is the study of the way in which objects move through the air.
Aeronautical means involving or relating to the design and construction of aeroplanes.
sense.tran: 航空（学）的；飞机制造学的

example.ex: ...the biggest aeronautical research laboratory in Europe.
example.tran: 欧洲最大的航空研究实验室

sense.def: Aeronautics is the science of designing and building aeroplanes.
An aeroplane is a vehicle with wings and one or more engines that enable it to fly through the air.

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 airplane

sense.def: An aerosol is a small container in which a liquid such as paint or deodorant is kept under pressure. When you press a button, the liquid is forced out as a fine spray or foam.
sense.tran: （装涂料、除臭剂等的）小型喷雾器

sense.def: Aerospace companies are involved in developing and making rockets, missiles, space vehicles, and related equipment.

example.ex: ...the US aerospace industry.
example.tran: 美国的航天工业

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语亦用 esthete

sense.def: An aesthete is someone who loves and appreciates works of art and beautiful things.

entry.boxr: in AM, also use 美国英语亦用 esthetic

sense.def: Aesthetic is used to talk about beauty or art, and people's appreciation of beautiful things.
sense.tran: 美的；艺术的；美感的；审美的

example.ex: ...products chosen for their aesthetic appeal as well as their durability and quality.
example.tran: 因其外形美观且经久耐用、质量上乘而被选定的产品

posc.def: The aesthetic of a work of art is its aesthetic quality.

example.ex: He responded very strongly to the aesthetic of this particular work.
example.tran: 他强烈地感受到这件作品的美学价值。

example.ex: There is nothing aesthetically pleasing about this bridge.
example.tran: 这座桥无法给人以美的享受。

entry.boxr: in AM, also use 美国英语亦用 esthetics

sense.def: Aesthetics is a branch of philosophy concerned with the study of the idea of beauty.

sense.hdgr:
usu
from ADV, also ADV after v
sense.def: Afar means a long way away.

example.ex: Seen from afar, its towering buildings beckon the visitor in.
example.tran: 从远处看，它高耸的大楼召唤着拜访者进去。

example.ex: ...a stranger who has loved her from afar for 23 years.
example.tran: 一个暗恋了她23年的陌生人

sense.def: Someone who is affable is pleasant and friendly.

example.ex: Mr Brooke is an extremely affable and approachable man.
example.tran: 布鲁克先生极为谦和，平易近人。

example.ex: Beneath the surface affability there was a sort of struggle for power.
example.tran: 表面上一派祥和，暗地里争权夺利。

rnon.hdgr: usu ADV with v, also ADV adj

example.ex: 'Ah, Captain Fox,' Martin McGuinness said affably. 'Nice to see you again.'
example.tran: “啊，福克斯上尉，”马丁·麦吉尼斯亲切地说，“很高兴再次见到您。”

sense.def: If an event or a series of events has been mentioned and you want to talk about it again, you can refer to it as the affair .

example.ex: The government has mishandled the whole affair...
example.tran: 政府对整个事件处理不当。

example.ex: The affair began when customs officials inspected a convoy of 60 tankers...
example.tran: 就在海关关员检查一个60艘油轮的船队时，事情发生了。

example.ex: The industry minister described the affair as 'an absolute scandal'.
example.tran: 工业部长将此事件形容为“绝对的丑闻”。

sense.def: You can refer to an important or interesting event or situation as 'the ... affair'.
sense.tran: …事件（指重要或有趣的事件或情况）

example.ex: ...the damage caused to the CIA and FBI in the aftermath of the Watergate affair.
example.tran: 水门事件发生后给美国中央情报局和联邦调查局造成的不良影响

example.ex: ...confidential Bank of England documents relating to the BCCI affair.
example.tran: 与国际信贷商业银行事务相关的英格兰银行的机密文件

sense.def: You can describe the main quality of an event by saying that it is a particular kind of affair .

example.ex: Michael said that his planned 10-day visit would be a purely private affair...
example.tran: 迈克尔说他所计划的10天访问纯属个人私事。

example.ex: Breakfast will be a cheerless affair for the Prime Minister this morning.
example.tran: 今天的早餐会让首相感觉全然无味。

sense.def: You can describe an object as a particular kind of affair when you want to draw attention to a particular feature, or indicate that it is unusual.
sense.tran: （不寻常的或具有某种特点的）东西

example.ex: All their beds were distinctive; Mac's was an iron affair with brass knobs...
example.tran: 他们的床都各具特色；马克的床是张带球形黄铜柱头的铁家伙。

example.ex: He tried dividing it into two bundles, tying them to his walking stick, and slinging the whole affair across his back.
example.tran: 他试着将它分成两包绑在他的拐棍上，然后把所有东西都挂在后背上。

sense.def: If two people who are not married to each other have an affair, they have a sexual relationship.

example.ex: She was having an affair with someone at work.
example.tran: 她跟某一同事有染。

sense.def: You can use affairs to refer to all the important facts or activities that are connected with a particular subject.

example.ex: He does not want to interfere in the internal affairs of another country...
example.tran: 他不想干涉别国内政。

example.ex: With more details, here's our foreign affairs correspondent.
example.tran: 详细情况，请听我们外交事务记者的报道。

sense.def: Your affairs are all the matters connected with your life which you consider to be private and normally deal with yourself.

example.ex: He was rational and consistent in the conduct of his affairs...
example.tran: 他处理私事时头脑清楚，始终如一。

example.ex: The unexpectedness of my father's death meant that his affairs were not entirely in order.
example.tran: 家父的猝然离世留下了尚未完全安排妥当的身后事。

sense.def: If you say that a decision or situation is someone's affair, you mean that it is their responsibility, and other people should not interfere.

example.ex: If you wish to make a fool of yourself, that is your affair...
example.tran: 如果你想让自己出丑，那是你自己的事。

example.ex: If they want to stay and fight, then I guess that's their affair.
example.tran: 如果他们想留下来打架，我想那是他们自己的事。

sense.def: If something affects a person or thing, it influences them or causes them to change in some way.

example.ex: Nicotine adversely affects the functioning of the heart and arteries...
example.tran: 尼古丁会对心脏及动脉功能造成损害。

example.ex: More than seven million people have been affected by drought.
example.tran: 已有超过700万的民众受到旱灾的影响。

example.ex: ...the worst-affected areas of Somalia.
example.tran: 索马里受影响最为严重的地区

sense.def: If a disease affects someone, it causes them to become ill.

example.ex: Arthritis is a crippling disease which affects people all over the world.
example.tran: 关节炎是一种会危害全人类健康的致残性疾病。

sense.def: If something or someone affects you, they make you feel a strong emotion, especially sadness or pity.
sense.tran: （感情上）打动，震动，使悲伤（或怜悯）

example.ex: The divorce affected Jim deeply...
example.tran: 离婚对吉姆打击很大。

example.ex: Gregor loved his sister, and her loss clearly still affects him.
example.tran: 格雷戈尔爱他的姐姐，她的去世显然仍令他悲伤不已。

sense.def: If you affect a particular characteristic or way of behaving, you pretend that it is genuine, or natural for you.

example.ex: He listened to them, affecting an amused interest...
example.tran: 他装作饶有兴致地听他们说话。

example.ex: Ms. Redgrave affects a heavy Italian accent.
example.tran: 雷德格雷夫女士假装带有浓重的意大利口音。

boxu.usage: Note that the noun that comes from affect is effect. You can say that something affects you, or that is has an effect on you. ...the effect that noise has on people in factories. You can also talk about the effect of something. ...the effect of the anaesthetic. Effect can also be a verb. If you effect something such as a change or a repair, you make it happen or do it. This is a fairly formal word. She had effected a few hasty repairs.
boxu.tran: 注意，与affect相对应的名词是effect。可以说something affects you，也可以说it has an effect on you。例如：the effect that noise has on people in factories (噪音对工厂里的人们产生的影响）。谈论某事物的效果也可用 effect: the effect of the anaesthetic（麻醉药的作用）。effect也可用作动词，后接 change, repair 等词, 意为使发生或进行，该用法较为正式。例如：She had effected a few hasty repairs（她已经做了一些匆忙的修补）。

sense.def: If you say that someone's attitude or behaviour is an affectation, you disapprove of the fact that it is not genuine or natural, but is intended to impress other people.

example.ex: I wore sunglasses all the time and people thought it was an affectation...
example.tran: 我成天戴着墨镜，大家都觉得我在装酷。

example.ex: Lawson writes so well: in plain English, without fuss or affectation.
example.tran: 劳森写得很好：英文通俗易懂，朴实无华又不矫揉造作。

sense.def: If you describe someone's behaviour as affected, you disapprove of the fact that they behave in an unnatural way that is intended to impress other people.

example.ex: She had an affected air and a disdainful look.
example.tran: 她举止做作，神情倨傲。

sense.def: If you describe something such as a story or a piece of music as affecting, you think it is good because it makes you feel a strong emotion, especially sadness or pity.
sense.tran: 令人感动的；动人的；激起怜悯（或悲伤）的

example.ex: ...an affecting drama about a woman with a terminal illness.
example.tran: 关于一位身患绝症的女人的感人戏剧

sense.def: If you regard someone or something with affection, you like them and are fond of them.

example.ex: She thought of him with affection...
example.tran: 她很想念他。

example.ex: She had developed quite an affection for the place.
example.tran: 她逐渐对这个地方钟爱有加。

example.ex: ...trying to win their affection.
example.tran: 试图赢得他们的好感

sense.def: Your affections are your feelings of love or fondness for someone.

example.ex: The distant object of his affections is Caroline...
example.tran: 他一厢情愿地爱慕卡罗琳。

example.ex: Jack Russell has a special place in the affections of the cricketing public.
example.tran: 杰克·拉塞尔在打板球的人心中有着特殊的地位。

example.ex: ...her fear of being replaced in his affections.
example.tran: 她害怕他会移情别恋

sense.def: If you are affectionate, you show your love or fondness for another person in the way that you behave towards them.
sense.tran: 充满深情的；满怀柔情的；表示爱的

example.ex: They seemed devoted to each other and were openly affectionate...
example.tran: 他们看起来非常恩爱，柔情蜜意溢于言表。

example.ex: She gave me a very long and affectionate hug.
example.tran: 她满怀深情地久久拥抱了我。

example.ex: He looked affectionately at his niece.
example.tran: 他慈爱地看着他的侄女。

sense.def: An affidavit is a written statement which you swear is true and which may be used as evidence in a court of law.
sense.tran: 宣誓书；（经陈述者宣誓在法庭上可作为证据采纳的）书面陈述

entry.boxr: The noun is pronounced /ə'fɪliət/. The verb is pronounced /əˌfɪli'eɪt/. 名词读作/ə'fɪliət/，动词读作 /əˌfɪli'eɪt/。

sense.def: An affiliate is an organization which is officially connected with another, larger organization or is a member of it.
sense.tran: 成员组织；附属机构；分会

example.ex: ...twelve companies, including three affiliates of a Texas oil firm...
example.tran: 12家公司，包括得克萨斯一家石油公司的3家分公司

example.ex: The World Chess Federation has affiliates in around 120 countries.
example.tran: 国际象棋联合会在大约120个国家设有分支机构。

sense.def: If an organization affiliates to or with another larger organization, it forms a close connection with the larger organization or becomes a member of it.

example.ex: All youth groups will have to affiliate to the National Youth Agency...
example.tran: 所有青年团体必须并入全国青年事务处。

example.ex: The Government will not allow the staff association to affiliate with outside unions.
example.tran: 政府不会允许其公务员协会与外部工会有紧密联系。

sense.def: If a professional person such as a lawyer or doctor affiliates with an organization, they become officially connected with that organization.
sense.tran: （医生或律师等专业人士）与…有正式关系

example.ex: He said he wanted to affiliate with a U.S. firm because he needed 'expert advice and counsel in legal affairs'.
example.tran: 他说他因为需要“在法律事务上得到专家的意见和建议”，所以想与一家美国律师事务所建立合作关系。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ
to/with n, ADJ n
sense.def: If an organization is affiliated with another larger organization, it is officially connected with the larger organization or is a member of it.

example.ex: There are 73 unions affiliated to the Trades Union Congress.
example.tran: 共有73家工会隶属于英国职工大会。

example.ex: ...the United Nations and its affiliated organisations.
example.tran: 联合国及其附属机构

posc.def: -affiliated combines with nouns to form adjectives that describe which organization something or someone is affiliated to.
posc.tran: （与名词连用构成形容词，表示某物或某人所隶属的组织）

example.ex: ...church-affiliated schools in Oregon.
example.tran: 俄勒冈隶属于教会的学校

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ
with/to n, ADJ n
sense.def: If a professional person, such as a lawyer or doctor, is affiliated with an organization, they are officially connected with that organization or do some official work for it.
sense.tran: （专业人员如医生或律师）与…有正式关系的，为…工作的

example.ex: He will remain affiliated with the firm as a special associate director.
example.tran: 他将作为特别副经理继续为该公司工作。

example.ex: ...our affiliated members.
example.tran: 我们所有的正式成员

sense.def: If one group has an affiliation with another group, it has a close or official connection with it.
sense.tran: （组织之间的）密切联系，隶属关系

example.ex: The group has no affiliation to any political party...
example.tran: 该团体不隶属于任何政党。

example.ex: The officer cited the federation's rule on affiliation.
example.tran: 该官员引用了联邦政府对于隶属关系的规定。

sense.def: If you have an affiliation with a group or another person, you have a close or official connection with them.
sense.tran: （个人之间或个人与组织之间的）联系，从属关系

example.ex: ...Johnson's affiliation with shoe company Nike...
example.tran: 约翰逊就职于耐克鞋业公司

example.ex: They asked what her political affiliations were.
example.tran: 他们询问她属于哪个政党。

sense.def: If you have an affinity with someone or something, you feel that you are similar to them or that you know and understand them very well.

example.ex: He has a close affinity with the landscape he knew when he was growing up...
example.tran: 他对这片从小就了解的土地有着一种归属感。

example.ex: There is a natural affinity between British and Asian women.
example.tran: 英国女性和亚洲女性之间有一种自然的亲近感。

sense.def: If people or things have an affinity with each other, they are similar in some ways.

example.ex: The two plots share certain obvious affinities.
example.tran: 这两个情节有某种明显的相似。

sense.def: An affinity card is a type of credit card. The bank which issues the card gives a small amount of money to a charity or institution each time the customer spends a certain amount with their card.
sense.tran: 认同卡（持卡人刷卡消费后银行就会向某慈善机构或组织拨付少量钱款的一种信用卡）

sense.def: If you affirm that something is true or that something exists, you state firmly and publicly that it is true or exists.

example.ex: The House of Lords affirmed that the terms of a contract cannot be rewritten retrospectively.
example.tran: 上议院申明合同条款改写后不具备追溯效力。

example.ex: ...a speech in which he affirmed a commitment to lower taxes...
example.tran: 他作出减税承诺的演讲

example.ex: 'This place is a dump,' affirmed Miss T.
example.tran: “这地方简直像个垃圾堆，”T小姐声称。

example.ex: The ministers issued an affirmation of their faith in the system.
example.tran: 部长们表示了对该体制坚定的信心。

sense.def: If an event affirms something, it shows that it is true or exists.

example.ex: Everything I had accomplished seemed to affirm that opinion.
example.tran: 我所取得的一切似乎都证明那个观点是对的。

example.ex: The high turnout was an affirmation of the importance that the voters attached to the election.
example.tran: 高投票率清楚地显示出选民们对选举的重视。

sense.def: An affirmative word or gesture indicates that you agree with what someone has said or that the answer to a question is 'yes'.

example.ex: Haig was desperately eager for an affirmative answer...
example.tran: 黑格非常渴望得到一个肯定的回答。

example.ex: Dr Sinclair's affirmative nod seemed a shade reluctant.
example.tran: 辛克莱博士虽然点头表示了同意，但还显得有点不情愿。

example.ex: 'Is that clear?' Bob nodded his head affirmatively.
example.tran: “清楚了吗？”鲍勃肯定地点点头。

sense.def: If you reply to a question in the affirmative, you say 'yes' or make a gesture that means 'yes'.

example.ex: He asked me if I was ready. I answered in the affirmative.
example.tran: 他问我是否准备好了，我给出肯定的回答。

sense.def: In grammar, an affirmative clause is positive and does not contain a negative word.
Affirmative action is the policy of giving jobs and other opportunities to members of groups such as racial minorities or women who might not otherwise have them.
sense.tran: （鼓励雇用少数民族成员、妇女等的）反歧视行动，积极措施

entry.boxr: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 positive discrimination
The verb is pronounced /ə'fɪks/. The noun is pronounced /'æfɪks/. 动词读作 /ə'fɪks/，名词读作 /'æfɪks/。

sense.def: If you affix one thing to another, you stick it or attach it to the other thing.

example.ex: Complete the form and affix four tokens to its back...
example.tran: 填完该表，在背面贴上4张凭券。

example.ex: I covered the scroll in sealing wax, and affixed a red ribbon.
example.tran: 我用封蜡将卷轴封好，并系上一根红丝带。

example.ex: ...special storage racks affixed to the sides of buses.
example.tran: 专门固定在公共汽车两侧的储物架

sense.def: An affix is a letter or group of letters, for example 'un-' or '-y', which is added to either the beginning or the end of a word to form a different word with a different meaning. For example, 'un-' is added to 'kind' to form 'unkind'.
If you are afflicted by pain, illness, or disaster, it affects you badly and makes you suffer.

example.ex: Italy has been afflicted by political corruption for decades...
example.tran: 几十年来意大利一直饱受政治腐败之苦。

example.ex: There are two main problems which afflict people with hearing impairments...
example.tran: 听力有障碍的人们主要受到两大问题的困扰。

example.ex: The afflicted person should keep off solid foods and drink plenty of fluids.
example.tran: 病人不应吃固体食物而要多喝流质食物。

posc.def: The afflicted are people who are afflicted.

example.ex: It is food that the afflicted want now.
example.tran: 受苦的人们现在需要的是食物。

sense.def: An affliction is something which causes physical or mental suffering.

example.ex: Hay fever is an affliction which arrives at an early age.
example.tran: 枯草热是年纪较小时会患的一种病。

example.ex: ...the afflictions of modern society.
example.tran: 现代社会的烦恼

sense.def: Affluence is the state of having a lot of money or a high standard of living.

example.ex: The postwar era was one of new affluence for the working class.
example.tran: 战后是工人阶级富裕起来的全新时期。

sense.def: If you are affluent, you have a lot of money.

example.ex: Cigarette smoking used to be commoner among affluent people.
example.tran: 吸烟曾经在富人中间更为普遍。

example.ex: ...the affluent neighborhoods of Malibu.
example.tran: 马利布的富人区

posc.def: The affluent are people who are affluent.

example.ex: The diet of the affluent has not changed much over the decades.
example.tran: 几十年来富人们的饮食习惯并未发生太大的变化。

sense.def: If you cannot afford something, you do not have enough money to pay for it.

example.ex: My parents can't even afford a new refrigerator...
example.tran: 我父母甚至买不起一台新冰箱。

example.ex: The arts should be available to more people at prices they can afford...
example.tran: 艺术品应该以人们能够承受的价格面向更多的人出售。

example.ex: We couldn't afford to buy a new rug.
example.tran: 我们买不起新的小地毯。

sense.def: If you say that you cannot afford to do something or allow it to happen, you mean that you must not do it or must prevent it from happening because it would be harmful or embarrassing to you.

example.ex: We can't afford to wait...
example.tran: 我们等不起。

example.ex: The country could not afford the luxury of an election.
example.tran: 该国负担不起选举这样奢侈的事。

sense.def: If someone or something affords you an opportunity or protection, they give it to you.

example.ex: This affords us the opportunity to ask questions about how the systems might change...
example.tran: 这给我们提供了就系统可能如何改变进行提问的机会。

example.ex: It was a cold room, but it afforded a fine view of the Old City.
example.tran: 这房间虽然很冷，但是它能让人将古城的景致尽收眼底。

example.ex: ...the protection afforded by the police.
example.tran: 警方提供的保护

sense.def: If something is affordable, most people have enough money to buy it.
sense.tran: 价格合理的;多数人买得起的

example.ex: ...the availability of affordable housing...
example.tran: 买得到价格合理的住房

example.ex: The company makes wearable, beautifully cut clothes at affordable prices.
example.tran: 这家公司生产经久耐穿、外形美观且价格合理的服装。

example.ex: ...research into homelessness and housing affordability.
example.tran: 对无家可归现象和住房购买能力的调查

example.ex: ...the affordability of highly sophisticated weapons.
example.tran: 对高精密度武器的购买力

sense.def: Afforestation is the process of planting large numbers of trees on land which has few or no trees on it.

example.ex: Since the Sixties, afforestation has changed the Welsh countryside.
example.tran: 60年代以来，植树造林已经改变了威尔士的乡村面貌。

sense.def: An affray is a noisy and violent fight, especially in a public place.
sense.tran: （尤指在公共场所的）打架滋事，大吵大闹

example.ex: Barnstaple crown court was told he caused an affray at a pub in Braunton, Devon...
example.tran: 有人向巴恩斯特珀尔刑事法院告发他在德文郡布朗顿的一家酒馆打架滋事。

example.ex: They were convicted of affray and received community service sentences.
example.tran: 他们因殴斗滋事被判决为社区义务服务。

sense.def: If something affronts you, you feel insulted and hurt because of it.

example.ex: ...an incident which particularly affronted Kasparov.
example.tran: 让卡斯帕罗夫感到特别受辱的一件事

example.ex: He pretended to be affronted, but inwardly he was pleased...
example.tran: 他假装受到了冒犯，但其实内心很高兴。

example.ex: Reggie reacted with the same affronted horror Midge had felt.
example.tran: 雷吉的反应是又羞愤又害怕，和米奇的感觉一样。

sense.hdgr:
usu sing, usu N
to n
sense.def: If something is an affront to you, it is an obvious insult to you.

example.ex: It's an affront to human dignity to keep someone alive like this...
example.tran: 如此维持一个人的生命是对人类尊严的冒犯。

example.ex: She has taken my enquiry as a personal affront.
example.tran: 她将我的询问当成了人身侮辱。

sense.def: Afghan means belonging or relating to Afghanistan, or to its people or language.
sense.tran: 阿富汗的；阿富汗人的；阿富汗语的

example.ex: ...the Afghan capital, Kabul.
example.tran: 阿富汗首都喀布尔

posc.def: An Afghan is a person who comes from Afghanistan.

sense.hdgr:
usu with supp, oft N
of n
sense.def: If someone is an aficionado of something, they like it and know a lot about it.

example.ex: I happen to be an aficionado of the opera, and I love art museums...
example.tran: 碰巧我是个歌剧迷，而且我爱去艺术博物馆。

example.ex: ...a jazz aficionado.
example.tran: 爵士乐迷

sense.def: Further afield or farther afield means in places or areas other than the nearest or most obvious one.

example.ex: They enjoy participating in a wide variety of activities, both locally and further afield...
example.tran: 他们乐于参与本地及外地的各种活动。

example.ex: You are not allowed to bring plants in from further afield without a licence.
example.tran: 未经许可不得从外地带入植物。

sense.def: If someone comes from far afield, they come from a long way away.

example.ex: Many of those arrested came from far afield.
example.tran: 那些被捕者有许多来自很远的地方。

sense.def: If something is afire or is set afire, it is on fire or looks as if it is on fire.
sense.tran: 着火的；燃烧着的；看似着火的

example.ex: The houses were set afire but there were only minor injuries to seven personnel...
example.tran: 房子着火了，但是只有7位职员受轻伤。

example.ex: The sun has already set, leaving the sky afire with orange and green light.
example.tran: 太阳已经落山，但天空中还映照着如火般橙绿相间的余晖。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
with n
sense.def: If someone is afire with emotion, they are extremely enthusiastic and excited about something.
sense.tran: 热情洋溢的；极其热衷的

example.ex: All Dan's senses were afire...
example.tran: 丹所有的感官都燃烧着激情。

example.ex: Sydney is afire with Olympic enthusiasm.
example.tran: 悉尼全城燃烧着奥林匹克的热情。

sense.def: If something is on fire, you can say it is aflame .

example.ex: Hundreds of tightly rolled newspapers were set aflame among the 50,000 crowd.
example.tran: 几百张卷紧的报纸在为数5万的人群中被点燃。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
with n
sense.def: If you say that something is aflame, you mean it is filled with light or colour.
sense.tran: （因光或颜色）灯火辉煌的，明亮的

example.ex: The shop windows were aflame with Christmas lights.
example.tran: 商店橱窗装饰着圣诞节彩灯，显得灯火辉煌。

sense.hdgr: usu ADV after v, also v-link ADV, n ADV
sense.def: If someone or something is afloat, they remain partly above the surface of water and do not sink.

example.ex: They talked modestly of their valiant efforts to keep the tanker afloat...
example.tran: 他们说起自己设法使油轮漂浮的英勇之举时非常谦虚。

example.ex: Three hours is a long time to try to stay afloat in these conditions.
example.tran: 在这样的条件下漂浮3个小时是够久的。

sense.hdgr: usu ADV after v, also v-link ADV, n ADV
sense.def: If a person, business, or country stays afloat or is kept afloat, they have just enough money to pay their debts and continue operating.

example.ex: A number of efforts were being made to keep the company afloat...
example.tran: 正采取各种措施来维持公司的正常资金周转。

example.ex: They are borrowing just to stay afloat, not for investment.
example.tran: 他们借钱只为了周转，而不是投资。

sense.def: If you say that a plan or scheme is afoot, it is already happening or being planned, but you do not know much about it.
sense.tran: 进行中的；正在发生的；酝酿中的

example.ex: Everybody knew that something awful was afoot.
example.tran: 大家都知道可怕的事近在眼前。

sense.hdgr:
det ADJ, usu
the ADJ n
sense.def: If you refer to the aforementioned person or subject, you mean the person or subject that has already been mentioned.

example.ex: A declaration will be issued at the end of the aforementioned UN conference.
example.tran: 前面提到的那次联合国会议将于闭幕之际发表一份宣言。

sense.hdgr:
det ADJ, usu
the ADJ n
sense.def: Aforesaid means the same as aforementioned .

example.ex: ...the aforesaid organizations and institutions.
example.tran: 上述的组织和机构

sense.def: If you run afoul of someone or something, you do something which causes problems with them.

example.ex: All of them had run afoul of the law at some time or other.
example.tran: 他们所有人都曾触犯过法律。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
of n, ADJ to-inf
sense.def: If you are afraid of someone or afraid to do something, you are frightened because you think that something very unpleasant is going to happen to you.

example.ex: She did not seem at all afraid...
example.tran: 她毫无惧色。

example.ex: I was afraid of the other boys...
example.tran: 我害怕其他的男孩们。

example.ex: I'm still afraid to sleep in my own bedroom.
example.tran: 我还是不敢在自己的卧室里睡觉。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, usu ADJ
for n
sense.def: If you are afraid for someone else, you are worried that something horrible is going to happen to them.

example.ex: She's afraid for her family in Somalia.
example.tran: 她为身在索马里的家人担心。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, ADJ that, ADJ
of -ing, ADJ to-inf
sense.def: If you are afraid that something unpleasant will happen, you are worried that it may happen and you want to avoid it.

example.ex: I was afraid that nobody would believe me...
example.tran: 我担心没有人会相信我。

example.ex: The Government is afraid of losing the election...
example.tran: 现届政府担心会在选举中落败。

sense.def: If you want to apologize to someone or to disagree with them in a polite way, you can say I'm afraid.
sense.tran: （用以道歉或婉转地提出异议）很抱歉，很遗憾，恐怕

example.ex: We don't have anything like that, I'm afraid...
example.tran: 我们恐怕没有那样的东西。

example.ex: I'm afraid I can't help you...
example.tran: 恐怕我帮不了你。

example.ex: 'Bad news?' — 'I'm afraid so.'
example.tran: “坏消息吗？”——“恐怕是。”

sense.def: If you do something afresh, you do it again in a different way.

example.ex: They believe that the only hope for the French left is to start afresh...
example.tran: 他们相信对剩下的法国人来说，唯一的希望就是重新开始。

example.ex: Only one expert source seemed prepared to analyse the problem afresh, from first principles.
example.tran: 只有一位专家似乎已准备要从根本原理着手重新研究这个问题。

sense.def: African means belonging or relating to the continent of Africa, or to its countries or people.

example.ex: ...the African continent.
example.tran: 非洲大陆

example.ex: ...African countries.
example.tran: 非洲国家

sense.def: African means belonging or relating to black people who come from Africa.

example.ex: ...traditional African culture.
example.tran: 传统的非洲黑人文化

example.ex: ...dance music with African roots.
example.tran: 源自非洲黑人的舞蹈音乐

sense.def: African is used to describe someone, usually a black person, who comes from Africa.
sense.tran: 来自非洲的；（通常指）非洲黑人的

example.ex: ...African women.
example.tran: 非洲妇女

posc.def: An African is someone who is African.

example.ex: Fish is a staple in the diet of many Africans.
example.tran: 鱼类是许多非洲人的主食。

sense.def: African-Americans are black people living in the United States who are descended from families that originally came from Africa.

example.ex: Today African-Americans are 12 percent of the population.
example.tran: 如今非裔美国人占总人口的12%。

example.ex: ...a group of African-American community leaders.
example.tran: 一群非裔美国人团体领袖

sense.def: African-Caribbean refers to people from the Caribbean whose ancestors came from Africa.

example.ex: ...modern African-Caribbean culture.
example.tran: 现代非裔加勒比人的文化

posc.def: An African-Caribbean is someone who is African-Caribbean.

sense.def: Afrikaans is one of the official languages of South Africa.
sense.tran: 南非荷兰语（南非的官方语言之一）

example.ex: ...a radical Afrikaans newspaper.
example.tran: 一份激进的南非荷兰语报纸

sense.def: Afrikaner means belonging or relating to the white people in South Africa whose ancestors were Dutch.
sense.tran: 荷兰裔南非白人的；布尔人的

example.ex: They called him a traitor to his Afrikaner people.
example.tran: 他们称他背叛了自己的族人南非白人。

posc.def: An Afrikaner is someone who is Afrikaner.
posc.tran: 荷兰裔南非白人；布尔人

sense.def: Afro hair is very tightly curled and sticks out all around your head.
sense.tran: （发型）非洲式的，埃弗罗发式的

sense.def: An Afro is an Afro hairstyle.
sense.tran: 非洲式发型，埃弗罗发式（一种圆形紧密鬈发）

sense.def: Afro- is used to form adjectives and nouns that describe something that is connected with Africa.
sense.tran: （用以构成形容词和名词）表示“非洲的”

example.ex: ...very well known Afro-American family.
example.tran: 很有名望的非裔美国人家庭

example.ex: ...an Afro-centric fashion show.
example.tran: 以非洲为中心的时装表演

sense.def: Afro-Caribbean refers to people from the Caribbean whose ancestors came from Africa.

example.ex: ...Britain's Afro-Caribbean community.
example.tran: 英国的非裔加勒比人社团

posc.def: An Afro-Caribbean is someone who is Afro-Caribbean.

sense.hdgr:
ADV after v,
be ADV, oft ADV
of n
sense.def: If you go aft in a boat or plane, you go to the back of it. If you are aft, you are in the back.
sense.tran: 向艉部（或机尾）；在艉部（或机尾）

example.ex: Clark shook hands with the pilot and walked aft to find his way off the ship.
example.tran: 克拉克与舵手握手后向艉部走去，打算下船。

sense.def: The aft end on a boat or plane is towards the back of it.

example.ex: Getting into the aft cabin involves a slight step down from saloon level.
example.tran: 去后舱需要从餐厅的位置略微往下迈一小步。

boxx.note: In addition to the uses shown below, after is used in phrasal verbs such as ‘ask after’, ‘look after’, and ‘take after’.
boxx.tran: 除下列用法外，after还可用于ask after，look after, take after等短语动词中。

sense.def: If something happens after a particular date or event, it happens during the period of time that follows that date or event.

example.ex: After 19 May, strikes were occurring on a daily basis...
example.tran: 5月19日之后，每天都会发生罢工。

example.ex: After breakfast Amy ordered a taxi...
example.tran: 早饭后，埃米预订了一辆出租车。

example.ex: It wasn't until after Christmas that I met Paul.
example.tran: 直到圣诞节之后我才见到保罗。

example.ex: After Don told me this, he spoke of his mother...
example.tran: 唐告诉我这件事后，就谈起了他的母亲。

example.ex: Marina cared for him after he seriously injured his eye several years ago.
example.tran: 自从几年前他眼睛严重受伤之后，玛丽娜就一直照顾他。

sense.def: If you do one thing after doing another, you do it during the period of time that follows the other thing.

example.ex: After completing and signing it, please return the form to us in the envelope provided.
example.tran: 填完表格并签名后，请装进所提供的信封里寄还给我们。

example.ex: ...women who have changed their mind after deciding not to have children...
example.tran: 决定不生孩子后又改变主意的女性

example.ex: After flying from Los Angeles to London, allow four full days to adjust.
example.tran: 从洛杉矶飞往伦敦之后，留出4整天时间适应环境。

sense.def: You use after when you are talking about time. For example, if something is going to happen during the day after or the weekend after a particular time, it is going to happen during the following day or during the following weekend.

example.ex: She's leaving the day after tomorrow.
example.tran: 她打算后天离开。

example.ex: ...the party's annual conference, to be held the week after next.
example.tran: 将在下下周举行的该党的年会

example.ex: Tomorrow. Or the day after.
example.tran: 明天。或者是后天。

sense.def: If you go after someone, you follow or chase them.

example.ex: He walked out, and Louise went after him.
example.tran: 他走了出去，路易丝也跟着出去了。

example.ex: ...people who were after him for large amounts of money.
example.tran: 为了大笔钱而追随他的人们

sense.def: If you are after something, you are trying to get it.

example.ex: They were after the money...
example.tran: 他们想得到这笔钱。

example.ex: I did eventually find what I was after.
example.tran: 我最终找到了我想要的东西。

sense.def: If you call, shout, or stare after someone, you call, shout, or stare at them as they move away from you.
sense.tran: 朝着（正离去之人喊叫或注视）

example.ex: 'Come back!' he called after me...
example.tran: “回来！”他朝我喊道。

example.ex: Claire stared after him until he disappeared around a corner.
example.tran: 克莱尔一直注视着他，直到他消失在拐角。

sense.def: If you do something after someone, you do it for them, because they cannot or will not do it for themselves.

example.ex: She used to mess up the floor and I had to clean up after her.
example.tran: 她过去常常把地板弄得很脏乱，而我不得不为她清理干净。

sense.def: If you tell someone that one place is a particular distance after another, you mean that it is situated beyond the other place and further away from you.

example.ex: A few kilometres after the village, turn right to Montelabate.
example.tran: 过了村庄之后再前行几公里，向右转前往蒙特拉贝特。

sense.def: If one thing is written after another thing on a page, it is written following it or underneath it.

example.ex: I wrote my name after Penny's.
example.tran: 我把自己的名字写在彭尼的下面。

sense.def: You use after in order to give the most important aspect of something when comparing it with another aspect.

example.ex: After Germany, America is Britain's second-biggest customer...
example.tran: 对于英国来说，美国是仅次于德国的第二大客户。

example.ex: Methane is often regarded as the second most important greenhouse gas after carbon dioxide.
example.tran: 甲烷常被认为是仅次于二氧化碳的重要温室气体。

sense.def: To be named after someone means to be given the same name as them.
sense.tran: 依照，按照（某人的名字命名）

example.ex: Phillimore Island is named after Sir Robert Phillimore...
example.tran: 菲利莫尔岛以罗伯特·菲利莫尔爵士的名字命名。

example.ex: He persuaded Virginia to name the baby after him.
example.tran: 他说服弗吉尼娅以他的名字为婴儿取名。

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 for

sense.def: If you say 'after you' to someone, you are being polite and allowing them to go in front of you or through a doorway before you do.
sense.tran: （走路或出入门口时的礼貌用语）您先请

example.ex: 'After you.' — 'Not at all, Mr Bird, after you.'
example.tran: “您先请。”——“别客气，伯德先生，您先请。”

sense.def: After is used when telling the time. If it is, for example, ten after six, the time is ten minutes past six.

boxu.usage: You use after, afterwards, and later to talk about things that happen following the time when you are speaking, or following a particular event. Expressions such as 'not long' and 'shortly' can also be used with after. After dinner she spoke to him... I returned to England after visiting India... Shortly after, she called me. Afterwards can be used when you do not need to mention the particular time or event. Afterwards we went to a night club. You can also use words such as 'soon' and 'shortly' with afterwards. Soon afterwards, he came to the clinic. You can use later to refer to a time or situation that follows the time when you are speaking. I'll go and see her later. 'A little', 'much', and 'not much' can also be used with later. A little later, the lights went out... I learned all this much later. You can use after, afterwards, or later following a phrase that mentions a period of time, in order to say when something happens. five years after his death ... She wrote about it six years afterwards ... Ten minutes later he left the house.
boxu.tran: after, afterwards和later都用于谈论晚于说话时间或某事之后发生的事情。not long，shortly等表达方式也可与after连用。例如：After dinner she spoke to him（饭后她对他说话了），I returned to England after visiting India（印度之行结束后我回到了英格兰），Shortly after, she called me（之后不久，她给我打了电话）。无需提及具体时间或事件时，可用afterwards：Afterwards we went to a night club（后来我们去了一家夜总会）。afterwards也可与soon，shortly等词连用：Soon afterwards, he came to the clinic（过了不久，他来到了诊所）。later可用于指说话时间之后的时间或情况。例如，I’ll go and see her later（我过阵子会去看她）。a little, much和not much也可与later连用。例如，A little later, the lights went out（过了一会儿，灯灭了），I learned all this much later（很久以后我才得知了这一切）。after, afterwards和later可用于表示一段时间的短语后面，指某事发生的时间：five years after his death（他去世5年之后），She wrote about it six years afterwards（6年之后她撰文谈起了此事），Ten minutes later he left the house（10分钟之后他离开了那座房子）。

phrase.def: If you do something to several things one after the other or one after another, you do it to one, then the next, and so on, with no break between your actions.

example.ex: Sybil ate three biscuits, one after the other...
example.tran: 西比尔接连吃了3块饼干。

example.ex: Caroline was trying on one outfit after another.
example.tran: 卡罗琳一套接一套地试穿衣服。

phrase.def: If something happens day after day or year after year, it happens every day or every year, for a long time.

example.ex: I waited for news, day after day, expecting to hear.
example.tran: 我日复一日地等着，期待能听到消息。

example.ex: ...people who'd been coming here year after year.
example.tran: 年复一年到这里来的人们

sense.def: After- is added to nouns to form adjectives which indicate that something takes place or exists after an event or process.
sense.tran: （用于名词之后构成形容词）在…之后

example.ex: ...an after-dinner speech...
example.tran: 餐后演说

example.ex: ...a delicious after-show supper at a restaurant in Gerard Street...
example.tran: 表演结束后在芝兰街一家餐馆吃到的一顿美味晚餐

example.ex: After-tax profit fell by 28 percent.
example.tran: 税后利润减少了28%。

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 aftercare

sense.def: Aftercare is the nursing and care of people who have been treated in hospital, and who are now recovering.

example.ex: As part of the treatment, he attended 15 weeks of aftercare...
example.tran: 作为治疗的一部分，他接受了15个星期的病后护理。

example.ex: Mr Lloyd specialised in aftercare services.
example.tran: 劳埃德先生专门从事病后护理。

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 aftereffect

sense.def: The after-effects of an event, experience, or substance are the conditions which result from it.
sense.tran: 后效；事后影响；副作用；后遗症

example.ex: ...people still suffering from the after-effects of the world's worst nuclear accident...
example.tran: 仍然因世界上最严重的核事故留下的种种后果而饱受折磨的人们

example.ex: He was suffering from shock as well as the after-effects of drugs.
example.tran: 他在受着毒品毒副作用影响的同时还出现了休克。

sense.def: The afterglow is the glow that remains after a light has gone, for example after the sun has gone down.

example.ex: ...the light of the sunset's afterglow.
example.tran: 落日的余晖

sense.def: You can refer to the good feeling or effects that remain after an event as the afterglow .

example.ex: ...basking in the afterglow of their Champions League victory.
example.tran: 沉浸在他们赢得冠军联赛的美好回忆当中

sense.def: You use after-hours to describe activities which happen after the end of the usual time for them.
sense.tran: 业余时间的；工余时间的；营业（或规定）时间以后的

example.ex: The school offers after-hours childcare...
example.tran: 学校提供课后托管孩子的服务。

example.ex: In after-hours trading, shares surged by another estimated 30 points or more.
example.tran: 在盘后交易当中，股价估计又上涨了30点或更多。

sense.def: The afterlife is a life that some people believe begins when you die, for example a life in heaven or as another person or animal.
The aftermarket is all the related products that are sold after an item, especially a car, has been bought.
sense.tran: 售后市场；（尤指汽车的）零配件市场

example.ex: The company serves the national automotive aftermarket with a broad range of accessory and recreational-vehicle products.
example.tran: 该公司为全国汽车零配件市场提供各种零配件和休闲旅游车产品。

sense.def: The aftermarket in shares and bonds is the buying and selling of them after they have been issued.
sense.tran: 后市，二级市场（指股票发行之后的交易）

example.ex: It's illegal to get into a formal agreement with investors that they'll buy in the aftermarket.
example.tran: 与投资者达成正式协议、允许他们在后市上买入的做法是非法的。

sense.hdgr:
with supp, oft
the N
of n
sense.def: The aftermath of an important event, especially a harmful one, is the situation that results from it.

example.ex: In the aftermath of the coup, the troops opened fire on the demonstrators...
example.tran: 政变结果是军队向游行示威者开火了。

example.ex: During the Soviet era and its immediate aftermath, the region was officially known as 'Middle Asia and Kazakhstan'.
example.tran: 在苏联时代和紧随其后的一段时期，该地区的官方名称为“中亚和哈萨克斯坦”。

sense.def: The afternoon is the part of each day which begins at lunchtime and ends at about six o'clock.

example.ex: He's arriving in the afternoon...
example.tran: 他下午会到。

example.ex: He had stayed in his room all afternoon.
example.tran: 他整个下午都呆在房间里。

example.ex: ...an afternoon news conference.
example.tran: 午后的新闻发布会

sense.def: Afternoon tea is a small meal you can have in the afternoon. It includes a cup of tea and food such as sandwiches and cakes.
sense.tran: 午后茶点（包括茶及三明治、蛋糕等）

sense.def: A company's after-sales service is all the help and information that it provides to customers after they have bought a particular product.

example.ex: ...a local retailer who offers a good after-sales service...
example.tran: 提供高质量售后服务的当地零售商

example.ex: They are also attempting to keep the car buyer as a long-term customer by offering after-sales service.
example.tran: 他们也正试图通过提供售后服务来使该汽车采购商成为长期客户。

sense.def: After-school activities are those that are organized for children in the afternoon or evening after they have finished school.

example.ex: ...an after-school childcare scheme.
example.tran: 一项课后托管孩子的计划

sense.def: Aftershave is a liquid with a pleasant smell that men sometimes put on their faces after shaving.
Aftershocks are smaller earthquakes which occur after a large earthquake.
People sometimes refer to the effects of an important event, especially a bad one, as the aftershock .

example.ex: They were already under stress, thanks to the aftershock of last year's drought.
example.tran: 去年遭受的旱灾让他们心有余悸、倍感忧虑。

sense.def: An aftertaste is a taste that remains in your mouth after you have finished eating or drinking something.
If you do or say something as an afterthought, you do or say it after something else as an addition, perhaps without careful thought.
sense.tran: 事后的想法;追加的事物

example.ex: Almost as an afterthought he added that he missed her.
example.tran: 他又几乎不假思索地补充说他想念她。

entry.boxr: The form afterward is also used, mainly in American English. 亦使用afterward，主要见于美国英语。

sense.def: If you do something or if something happens afterwards, you do it or it happens after a particular event or time that has already been mentioned.
sense.tran: （某个事件或已提及的时间）之后

example.ex: Shortly afterwards, police arrested four suspects...
example.tran: 之后不久，警方逮捕了4名嫌犯。

example.ex: James was taken to hospital but died soon afterwards...
example.tran: 詹姆斯被送往医院，但随后不久就死了。

example.ex: Not long afterward she received five calls in one day.
example.tran: 不久之后，她一天内就接到了5个电话。

sense.def: An afterword is a short essay at the end of a book, usually written by the author.

sense.hdgr: ADV with v, ADV with cl
sense.def: You use again to indicate that something happens a second time, or after it has already happened before.

example.ex: He kissed her again...
example.tran: 他再一次吻了她。

example.ex: Again there was a short silence...
example.tran: 接着又是一阵短暂的沉寂。

example.ex: I don't ever want to go through anything like that again.
example.tran: 我不想再经历那样的事了。

sense.def: You use again to indicate that something is now in a particular state or place that it used to be in.

example.ex: He opened his attaché-case, removed a folder, then closed it again...
example.tran: 他打开公文包，拿出一个文件夹后又把它合上了。

example.ex: I started to feel good about myself again.
example.tran: 我又开始感觉良好了。

sense.def: You can use again when you want to point out that there is a similarity between the subject that you are talking about now and a previous subject.

example.ex: Again the pregnancy was very similar to my previous two...
example.tran: 同样，这次怀孕和我前两次的情形非常相似。

example.ex: With the new artists, you see a more dynamic stage show than you used to see. And again, that's probably part of the progress of technology.
example.tran: 有了这些新艺术家，你看到的舞台剧会比你以前看的更富有活力。同样，那也可能是科技进步的一部分。

sense.def: You can use again in expressions such as but again ,then again, and there again when you want to introduce a remark which contrasts with or weakens something that you have just said.
sense.tran: （用于对比或语气的削弱）不过，然而

example.ex: It's easier to take a taxi. But then again you can't always get one...
example.tran: 打出租车要容易些，但也并不总是能打到的。

example.ex: They may, but there again they may not.
example.tran: 他们可能会，但也可能不会。

sense.def: You can add again to the end of your question when you are asking someone to tell you something that you have forgotten or that they have already told you.

example.ex: Sorry, what's your name again?
example.tran: 对不起，再问一次，你叫什么名字?

sense.def: You use again in expressions such as half as much again when you are indicating how much greater one amount is than another amount that you have just mentioned or are about to mention.

example.ex: A similar wine from France would cost you half as much again.
example.tran: 法国类似的一种葡萄酒的价格比这高一半。

example.ex: Sherry is half as strong again as table wine.
example.tran: 雪利酒比佐餐酒酒劲强一半。

sense.def: You can use again and again or time and again to emphasize that something happens many times.

example.ex: He would go over his work again and again until he felt he had it right...
example.tran: 他会反复检查自己的工作直到他认为正确为止。

example.ex: Time and again political parties have failed to tackle this issue.
example.tran: 各个政党处理这个问题时都屡屡失败。

boxx.note: In addition to the uses shown below, against is used in phrasal verbs such as ‘come up against’, ‘guard against’, and ‘hold against’.
boxx.tran: 除下列用法外，against还可用于come up against, guard against, hold against等短语动词中。

sense.def: If one thing is leaning or pressing against another, it is touching it.

example.ex: She leaned against him...
example.tran: 她紧靠着他。

example.ex: On a table pushed against a wall there were bottles of beer and wine.
example.tran: 在一张靠墙的餐桌上有啤酒和葡萄酒。

example.ex: ...the rain beating against the window panes.
example.tran: 雨敲打着窗玻璃

sense.def: If you are against something such as a plan, policy, or system, you think it is wrong, bad, or stupid.

example.ex: Taxes are unpopular — it is understandable that voters are against them...
example.tran: 税收不受欢迎——选民们反对是可以理解的。

example.ex: Joan was very much against commencing drug treatment.
example.tran: 琼极力反对进行药物治疗。

example.ex: ...a march to protest against job losses.
example.tran: 反对失业的游行

example.ex: The vote for the suspension of the party was 283 in favour with 29 against.
example.tran: 关于暂时取缔该党的投票结果为283票赞成，29票反对。

sense.def: If you compete against someone in a game, you try to beat them.

example.ex: The tour will include games against the Australian Barbarians...
example.tran: 这次巡回赛将包括和澳大利亚野人队的比赛。

example.ex: Billy Hardy has pulled out of his second fight against Noel Carroll after a training accident.
example.tran: 一次训练事故之后，比利·哈迪退出了和诺埃尔·卡罗尔的第二次比赛。

sense.def: If you take action against someone or something, you try to harm them.

example.ex: Security forces are still using violence against opponents of the government.
example.tran: 安全部队仍然在使用武力镇压反对政府的人。

example.ex: ...an upsurge in racism against immigrants...
example.tran: 对移民的种族歧视的高涨

example.ex: The demonstration itself was against the Government's new Community Charge.
example.tran: 游行本身反对的是政府新出台的“人头税”。

sense.def: If you take action against a possible future event, you try to prevent it.

example.ex: ...the fight against crime...
example.tran: 打击犯罪

example.ex: They are arguing against hospital closures...
example.tran: 他们据理反对关闭医院。

example.ex: I must warn you against raising your hopes.
example.tran: 我必须警告你不要期望过高。

sense.def: If you do something against someone's wishes, advice, or orders, you do not do what they want you to do or tell you to do.
sense.tran: 违背，违抗（愿望、劝告或命令）

example.ex: He didn't want to go against the wishes of the German government...
example.tran: 他不想违抗德国政府的意愿。

example.ex: He discharged himself from hospital against the advice of doctors.
example.tran: 他不顾医生的劝告自行出院了。

sense.def: If you do something in order to protect yourself against something unpleasant or harmful, you do something which will make its effects on you less serious if it happens.

example.ex: A business needs insurance against risks such as fire and flood...
example.tran: 公司需要上保险以防备火灾、洪灾等风险。

example.ex: It has been claimed that wine helps protect against heart disease.
example.tran: 有人声称葡萄酒有助于预防心脏病。

sense.def: If you have something against someone or something, you dislike them.

example.ex: Have you got something against women, Les?...
example.tran: 你对女性存有芥蒂吗，莱斯？

example.ex: I have nothing against foreigners.
example.tran: 我对外国人并无芥蒂。

sense.def: If something is against the law or against the rules, there is a law or a rule which says that you must not do it.

example.ex: It is against the law to detain you against your will for any length of time...
example.tran: 无论强制扣押多长时间都属违法。

example.ex: We thought cheating was against the rules.
example.tran: 我们认为作弊是违反规定的。

sense.def: If you are moving against a current, tide, or wind, you are moving in the opposite direction to it.

example.ex: ...swimming upstream against the current...
example.tran: 逆流往上游泳

example.ex: They were going to sail around the little island, against the tide.
example.tran: 他们打算绕着小岛逆潮航行。

sense.def: If something happens or is considered against a particular background of events, it is considered in relation to those events, because those events are relevant to it.

example.ex: The Pope has sent a message appealing for unity in his homeland, against a background of divisions in the Solidarity movement...
example.tran: 团结运动中各派搞分裂，在此情况下教皇发出号召，呼吁祖国保持团结。

example.ex: The profits rise was achieved against a backdrop of falling metal prices.
example.tran: 在金属价格下跌的背景下，利润提高了。

sense.def: If something is measured or valued against something else, it is measured or valued by comparing it with the other thing.

example.ex: Our policy has to be judged against a clear test: will it improve the standard of education?...
example.tran: 对我们的政策作出评判必须根据一条明确的准则：它是否会提高教育的水准？

example.ex: Check the operator's productivity against agreed targets...
example.tran: 根据既定目标检验操作员的效率。

example.ex: The US dollar is down against most foreign currencies today.
example.tran: 今天美元对大多数外汇的比价都有所下降。

sense.def: If you discuss a particular set of facts or figures as against another set, you are comparing or contrasting the two sets of facts or figures.

example.ex: Over 50% of divorced men regretted their divorce, as against 25% of women.
example.tran: 离婚男性中有50%以上后悔离婚，与此相对，女性只有25%。

sense.def: The odds against something happening are the chances or odds that it will not happen.

example.ex: The odds against him surviving are incredible.
example.tran: 他活下来的概率非常小。

example.ex: What were the odds against?
example.tran: 不利情况有哪些呢？

sense.def: If you describe someone as having their mouth agape, their mouth is open very wide, often because they are very surprised by something.

example.ex: She stood looking at Carmen with her mouth agape.
example.tran: 她站着，张大了嘴看着卡门。

sense.def: Agate is a very hard stone which is used to make jewellery.

entry.boxr: The spelling aging is also used, mainly in American English. 亦拼作aging，主要用于美国英语。

sense.def: Your age is the number of years that you have lived.

example.ex: She has a nephew who is just ten years of age...
example.tran: 她有一个才10岁的侄子。

example.ex: At the age of sixteen he qualified for a place at the University of Hamburg...
example.tran: 16岁时，他就有资格进入汉堡大学。

example.ex: I admired him for being so confident at his age.
example.tran: 我钦佩他这般年纪就如此自信。

sense.def: The age of a thing is the number of years since it was made.

example.ex: Everything in the room looks in keeping with the age of the building.
example.tran: 房间里的一切看起来都与这栋建筑物的存在年头很相称。

sense.def: Age is the state of being old or the process of becoming older.

example.ex: Perhaps he has grown wiser with age...
example.tran: 可能随着年纪增长，他变聪明了。

example.ex: The fabric was showing signs of age...
example.tran: 这块衣料可以看出岁月留下的痕迹。

example.ex: The worst sign of age was in the fabric which looked decidedly ancient.
example.tran: 岁月最无情的痕迹留在了那块看起来明显很古老的织物上。

sense.def: When someone ages, or when something ages them, they seem much older and less strong or less alert.

example.ex: He had always looked so young, but he seemed to have aged in the last few months...
example.tran: 他原来一直看起来很年轻，但最近几个月他显得老了。

example.ex: He was only in his mid-thirties, but already worry had aged him.
example.tran: 他虽然只有三十五六岁，但忧虑让他很显老。

sense.def: When food or alcohol is aged or when it ages, it is left to get older before being eaten or drunk, so that it develops a better flavour.

example.ex: Balsamic vinegar is aged in wood for at least 10 years and the flavour is wonderful...
example.tran: 意大利香醋在木桶中就经历了至少10年的酝酿期，所以口味极佳。

example.ex: Whisky loses strength as it ages.
example.tran: 存放时间越久，威士忌的口味越淡。

sense.def: An age is a period in history.

example.ex: ...the age of steam and steel.
example.tran: 蒸汽和钢铁时代

example.ex: ...items of Bronze Age pottery.
example.tran: 青铜器时代的陶器

sense.def: You can say an age or ages to mean a very long time.

example.ex: He waited what seemed an age...
example.tran: 他等了似乎很长时间。

example.ex: The bus took absolutely ages to arrive.
example.tran: 公共汽车过了很长时间才来。
