phrase.def: If someone tells you to act your age, they are telling you to behave in a way that is suitable for someone your age, because they think you are behaving in a childish way.
If something comes of age, it reaches an important stage of development and is accepted by a large number of people.

example.ex: Recycling is an issue that has come of age in Britain in the last decade.
example.tran: 回收利用是上个十年中被英国民众广泛认可的观念。

phrase.def: When someone comes of age, they become legally an adult.

example.ex: The company was to be held in trust for Eddie until he came of age.
example.tran: 在埃迪达到法定年龄之前，该公司将委托他人代为经营。

phrase.def: Someone who is under age is not legally old enough to do something, for example to buy an alcoholic drink.
phrase.tran: 未到合法年龄的;未成年的

example.ex: Because she was under age, her parents were still responsible for her.
example.tran: 因为她还未成年，她的父母仍然应为她负责。

example.ex: ...under age smoking.
example.tran: 未成年吸烟

entry.boxr: Pronounced /eɪdʒd/ for meaning 1, and /'eɪdʒɪd/ for meanings 2 and 3. 义项1读作 /eɪdʒd/，义项2和3读作 /'eɪdʒɪd/。

sense.def: You use aged followed by a number to say how old someone is.

example.ex: Alan has two children, aged eleven and nine.
example.tran: 艾伦有两个孩子，分别为11岁和9岁。

sense.def: Aged means very old.

example.ex: She has an aged parent who's capable of being very difficult.
example.tran: 她有一个年迈的父亲，可能会很不好相处。

sense.def: You can refer to all people who are very old as the aged .

example.ex: ...people who work with the aged.
example.tran: 为老年人服务的人们

sense.def: An age group is the people in a place or organization who were born during a particular period of time, for example all the people aged between 18 and 25.
sense.tran: 年龄层，年龄组（指某地或某团体中所有生于某一时期的人）

example.ex: ...a style that would appeal to all age groups.
example.tran: 各年龄段人士都会喜欢的一种风格

sense.def: Someone or something that is ageing is becoming older and less healthy or efficient.

example.ex: John lives with his ageing mother...
example.tran: 约翰和他年迈的母亲一起生活。

example.ex: Ageing aircraft need more frequent safety inspections.
example.tran: 老化的飞机需要更加频繁地进行安全检查。

sense.def: Ageing is the process of becoming old or becoming worn out.
Ageism is unacceptable behaviour that occurs as a result of the belief that older people are of less value than younger people.
sense.tran: 对老年人的歧视;年龄歧视

sense.def: Ageist behaviour is unacceptable behaviour based on the belief that older people are of less value than younger people.
sense.tran: 歧视老年人的;有年龄歧视的

example.ex: ...ageist bias from employers.
example.tran: 雇用方的年龄偏见

sense.def: If you describe someone as ageless, you mean that they never seem to look any older.

example.ex: She was rich, beautiful and seemingly ageless.
example.tran: 她富有而美丽，永远显得那么年轻。

sense.def: If you describe something as ageless, you mean that it is impossible to tell how old it is, or that it seems to have existed for ever.

example.ex: ...the ageless oceans.
example.tran: 古老的海洋

sense.def: An age limit is the oldest or youngest age at which you are allowed under particular regulations to do something.

example.ex: In some cases there is a minimum age limit.
example.tran: 有些情况下有最低年龄限制。

sense.def: An agency is a business which provides a service on behalf of other businesses.
sense.tran: 经销；代理；经销店；代理公司

example.ex: We had to hire maids through an agency.
example.tran: 我们得通过中介雇用女佣。

example.ex: ...a successful advertising agency.
example.tran: 一家成功的广告代理公司

sense.def: An agency is a government organization responsible for a certain area of administration.
sense.tran: （政府的）局，处，署，专业行政部门

example.ex: ...the government agency which monitors health and safety at work in Britain...
example.tran: 英国负责劳工医疗和安全的部门

example.ex: Webster is retiring as head of the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA).
example.tran: 韦伯斯特即将从中央情报局局长的位子上退职。

sense.def: You can refer to the political issues which are important at a particular time as an agenda.

example.ex: Does television set the agenda on foreign policy?...
example.tran: 电视舆论对外交政策有影响吗？

example.ex: Many of the coalition members could have their own political agendas...
example.tran: 许多联盟成员可能会有他们自己的政治议题。

example.ex: The Danish president will put environmental issues high on the agenda.
example.tran: 丹麦总统将试图把环境问题摆到重要位置上。

sense.def: An agenda is a list of the items that have to be discussed at a meeting.

example.ex: This is sure to be an item on the agenda next week...
example.tran: 这一定会成为下星期议事日程上的一项议题。

example.ex: High on the agenda of tomorrow's meeting will be the turmoil in Japan.
example.tran: 日本发生的骚乱将是明天会议的首要议题。

sense.def: An agent is a person who looks after someone else's business affairs or does business on their behalf.

example.ex: You are buying direct, rather than through an agent.
example.tran: 你这是直接购买，而不是通过代理人。

example.ex: ...a written declaration by someone, authorizing another person to act as his agent.
example.tran: 一份某人授权他人为其代理人的书面申明

sense.def: An agent in the arts world is a person who gets work for an actor or musician, or who sells the work of a writer to publishers.
An agent is a person who works for a country's secret service.

example.ex: All these years he's been an agent for the East.
example.tran: 这些年来他一直是为东方国家效力的一位间谍。

sense.def: If you refer to someone or something as the agent of a particular effect, you mean that they cause this effect.

example.ex: In many societies young men regard themselves as highly active, the agents of change, shapers of the world.
example.tran: 在许多社会中，年轻人将自己看成是高度活跃的分子，是变革的推动者和世界的塑造者。

sense.def: A chemical that has a particular effect or is used for a particular purpose can be referred to as a particular kind of agent.

example.ex: ...the bleaching agent in white flour.
example.tran: 白面粉中的漂白剂

example.ex: ...fibrinogen, a blood clotting agent.
example.tran: 血纤维蛋白原，一种凝血剂

sense.def: An agent provocateur is a person who is employed by the government or the police to encourage certain groups of people to break the law, so they can arrest them or make them lose public support.
sense.tran: （受雇于政府或警方，怂恿某些团体犯法以趁机逮捕或打压他们的）密探，坐探，卧底

example.ex: Agents provocateurs may seek to discredit the opposition.
example.tran: 密探可能会力求败坏反对派的名声。

sense.def: The age of consent is the age at which a person can legally agree to having a sexual relationship.
sense.tran: 同意年龄，承诺年龄（可以与人发生性关系的法定年龄）

example.ex: He was under the age of consent.
example.tran: 他还未到可以与人发生性关系的法定年龄。

sense.def: An age-old story, tradition, or problem has existed for many generations or centuries.
sense.tran: （故事、传统或问题）古老的，已存在很久的

example.ex: This age-old struggle for control had led to untold bloody wars.
example.tran: 这场由来已久的对控制权的争夺已经引发了无数流血的战争。

sense.def: An agglomeration of things is a lot of different things gathered together, often in no particular order or arrangement.

example.ex: The towns are on the way to becoming agglomerations of desperately poor people...
example.tran: 这些城市正逐渐变为极度贫穷之人的聚居地。

example.ex: The album is a bizarre agglomeration of styles.
example.tran: 这张专辑不同寻常地集各种风格于一体。

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 aggrandise

sense.def: To aggrandize someone means to make them seem richer, more powerful, and more important than they really are. To aggrandize a building means to make it more impressive.
sense.tran: 吹捧;抬高（地位）；使…更辉煌

example.ex: At the dinner table, my father would go on and on, showing off, aggrandising himself...
example.tran: 我父亲在餐桌上总是滔滔不绝地炫耀并吹嘘自己。

example.ex: ...plans to aggrandise the building.
example.tran: 扩充该大楼的计划

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 aggrandisement

sense.def: If someone does something for aggrandizement, they do it in order to get power, wealth, and importance for themselves.
sense.tran: （权势、财富、地位的）扩大，增加，提高

example.ex: It would be the first time in human history that economic necessity has prevailed over military aggrandizement.
example.tran: 那应该是人类历史上首次经济需要高于军事扩张。

sense.def: If someone or something aggravates a situation, they make it worse.

example.ex: Stress and lack of sleep can aggravate the situation...
example.tran: 压力和睡眠不足会使情况恶化。

example.ex: He would only aggravate the injury by rubbing it.
example.tran: 他揉擦伤口只会使伤势加重。

sense.def: If someone or something aggravates you, they make you annoyed.

example.ex: What aggravates you most about this country?
example.tran: 该国的哪一点让你最恼火？

example.ex: You don't realise how aggravating you can be.
example.tran: 你没有意识到自己有多么气人。

example.ex: I just couldn't take the aggravation.
example.tran: 我就是咽不下这口气。

sense.def: Aggravated is used to describe a serious crime which involves violence.

example.ex: He was jailed for aggravated assault.
example.tran: 他因犯严重伤害罪而被判入狱。

entry.boxr: The adjective and noun are pronounced /'ægrɪgət/. The verb is pronounced /'ægrɪgeɪt/. 形容词和名词读作 /'ægrɪgət/。 动词读作 /'ægrɪgeɪt/。

sense.def: An aggregate amount or score is made up of several smaller amounts or scores added together.

example.ex: The rate of growth of GNP will depend upon the rate of growth of aggregate demand...
example.tran: 国民生产总值的增长率将取决于总需求的增长率。

example.ex: England have beaten the Welsh three times in succession with an aggregate score of 83-12.
example.tran: 英格兰队已经连续3次打败威尔士队，总比分为83比12。

example.ex: The highest aggregate came in the third round where Leeds and Middlesbrough drew 4-4.
example.tran: 第三局时出现了最高比分，利兹队和米德尔斯伯勒队打成4比4平。

sense.def: An aggregate is a number of people or things that are being considered as a single thing.

example.ex: ...society viewed as an aggregate of individuals.
example.tran: 被看成个体集合的社会

sense.def: If amounts or things are aggregated, they are added together and considered as a single amount or thing.

example.ex: Different economies, with different currencies, should not be aggregated to produce uniform policies...
example.tran: 不同的经济有着不同的货币，不应该视为一体以制定出统一的政策。

example.ex: We should never aggregate votes to predict results under another system.
example.tran: 我们绝对不可将选票相加来预测另一种制度下的选举结果。

example.ex: A bigger objection is that aggregation of the results invites distortion.
example.tran: 一种更大的异议是把各种结果集中考虑容易导致曲解。

sense.def: If a number of different things or amounts are considered in aggregate, or in the aggregate, they are considered as a single thing or amount.

example.ex: Expenses are deductible only to the extent that in aggregate they exceed 7 percent of gross income.
example.tran: 只有在消费总额超过总收入的7%时才可免税。

sense.def: If one team beats another on aggregate, it wins because it has a higher total score than the other team after a series of games.

example.ex: United won 5-3 on aggregate.
example.tran: 联队以总比分5比3胜出。

sense.def: Aggression is a quality of anger and determination that makes you ready to attack other people.

example.ex: Aggression is by no means a male-only trait.
example.tran: 好斗性绝非男性才具有的特征。

sense.def: Aggression is violent and attacking behaviour.

example.ex: The raid was an unjustifiable act of aggression.
example.tran: 那次偷袭是一种不正当的侵略行径。

example.ex: ...the threat of massive military aggression.
example.tran: 大规模军事侵略的威胁

sense.def: An aggressive person or animal has a quality of anger and determination that makes them ready to attack other people.

example.ex: Some children are much more aggressive than others...
example.tran: 一些孩子比其他孩子更好斗。

example.ex: These fish are very aggressive...
example.tran: 这些鱼极具攻击性。

example.ex: Aggressive behaviour is a sign of emotional distress.
example.tran: 好斗行为是情感苦闷的一种表现。

example.ex: They'll react aggressively.
example.tran: 他们会作出挑衅性的反应。

example.ex: Her aggressiveness made it difficult for him to explain his own feelings.
example.tran: 她咄咄逼人的态度让他难以解释自己的感情。

sense.def: People who are aggressive in their work or other activities behave in a forceful way because they are very eager to succeed.

example.ex: He is respected as a very aggressive and competitive executive...
example.tran: 他是一位锐意进取、竞争意识很强的主管，颇受尊敬。

example.ex: The Zambian game is much more aggressive than European soccer.
example.tran: 赞比亚的这种运动比欧式足球要激烈得多。

example.ex: ...countries noted for aggressively pursuing energy efficiency.
example.tran: 以积极追求能源效率而著称的国家

sense.def: The aggressor in a fight or battle is the person, group, or country that starts it.

example.ex: They have been the aggressors in this conflict.
example.tran: 他们一直是这次冲突中的挑衅方。

sense.def: If you feel aggrieved, you feel upset and angry because of the way in which you have been treated.

example.ex: I really feel aggrieved at this sort of thing.
example.tran: 我真为这种事感到委屈。

sense.def: Aggro is the difficulties and problems that are involved in something.

example.ex: Simply phone the ticket hot-line and all that aggro will be a thing of the past.
example.tran: 只要拨打订票热线，所有难题都将成为过去式。

sense.def: Aggro is aggressive or violent behaviour.

example.ex: They could see there wasn't going to be any aggro and they left us to it.
example.tran: 他们知道不会再有暴力行为发生，于是就留给我们处理。

sense.hdgr:
ADJ after v, v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
at n, ADJ n
sense.def: If you are aghast, you are filled with horror and surprise.

example.ex: She watched aghast as his life flowed away...
example.tran: 看着他的生命逐渐消逝，她惊骇万分。

example.ex: His colleagues were aghast at the sackings...
example.tran: 他的同事们对于这些解雇感到很吃惊。

example.ex: Tania stared at him aghast, unable to speak.
example.tran: 塔妮娅吃惊地看着他，说不出话来。

sense.def: Someone who is agile can move quickly and easily.

example.ex: At 20 years old he was not as agile as he is now.
example.tran: 20岁时他并不如现在这般矫健。

example.ex: She blinked in surprise at his agility.
example.tran: 他敏捷的身手让她惊奇地直眨眼睛。

sense.def: If you have an agile mind, you think quickly and intelligently.

example.ex: She was quick-witted and had an extraordinarily agile mind.
example.tran: 她机智聪慧，思维极为敏捷。

example.ex: His intellect and mental agility have never been in doubt.
example.tran: 他的才智和机敏从未受到怀疑。

sense.def: If people agitate for something, they protest or take part in political activity in order to get it.

example.gram:
Also V, V
for n to-inf
example.ex: The women who worked in these mills had begun to agitate for better conditions.
example.tran: 在这些工厂里做工的妇女们开始抗议要求改善工作条件。

example.ex: At least seventy students were injured in the continuing agitation against the decision.
example.tran: 至少有70名学生在反对该决定的持续抗争中受伤。

sense.def: If you agitate something, you shake it so that it moves about.

example.ex: All you need to do is gently agitate the water with a finger or paintbrush...
example.tran: 你只需要用手指或刷子轻轻地搅动水。

example.ex: Its molecules can be agitated by microwave energy.
example.tran: 微波能量可以使其分子随之运动。

example.ex: Temperature is a measure of the agitation of the molecules of matter.
example.tran: 温度是物质分子运动的一个计量单位。

sense.def: If something agitates you, it worries you and makes you unable to think clearly or calmly.

example.ex: The thought of them getting her possessions when she dies agitates her.
example.tran: 一想到他们可能会在她死后得到她的财产，她就心绪不安。

sense.def: If someone is agitated, they are very worried or upset, and show this in their behaviour, movements, or voice.

example.ex: Susan seemed agitated about something...
example.tran: 苏珊似乎因为什么事而烦躁不安。

example.ex: The man in the house was in a very excited and agitated state.
example.tran: 房子里的那名男子情绪非常激动且焦灼不安。

sense.def: If someone is in a state of agitation, they are very worried or upset, and show this in their behaviour, movements, or voice.

example.ex: Danny returned to Father's house in a state of intense agitation...
example.tran: 丹尼回到神父的房子时显得极为焦虑不安。

example.ex: Diane lit a cigarette, trying to mask her agitation.
example.tran: 黛安娜点燃一根香烟，试图掩饰她的焦躁不安。

sense.def: If you describe someone involved in politics as an agitator, you disapprove of them because of the trouble they cause in organizing campaigns and protests.

example.ex: ...a famous actress who was accused of being a political agitator.
example.tran: 被指控为政治煽动者的著名女演员

sense.def: Agit-prop is the use of artistic forms such as drama or posters to further political aims.
sense.tran: （采取戏剧、海报等艺术形式以进一步达到政治目的的）宣传鼓动

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
with n
sense.def: If something is aglow, it is shining and bright with a soft, warm light.

example.ex: The night skies will be aglow with fireworks.
example.tran: 焰火将点亮夜空。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
with n
sense.def: If someone is aglow or if their face is aglow, they look excited.
sense.tran: （因兴奋而）红光满面的，面色发红的

example.ex: 'It was incredible,' Kurt says, suddenly aglow.
example.tran: “简直难以置信，”库尔特突然满面红光地说。

sense.def: The AGM of a company or organization is a meeting which it holds once a year in order to discuss the previous year's activities and accounts. AGM is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'Annual General Meeting'.
An agnostic believes that it is not possible to know whether God exists or not.
sense.tran: 不可知论者（Compare 比较 atheist.)

example.ex: Vasari claimed with horror that he was, if not an atheist, then an agnostic.
example.tran: 瓦萨里惊恐地说他若非无神论者，就是不可知论者。

sense.def: Agnostic means relating to agnostics or to their beliefs.

example.ex: You grew up in an agnostic household and have never been able to bring yourself to believe in God.
example.tran: 你在一个信奉不可知论的家庭里长大，一直都无法信仰上帝。

sense.def: Agnosticism is the belief that it is not possible to say definitely whether or not there is a God.

sense.hdgr:
ADV with v, n ADV,
long ADV
sense.def: You use ago when you are referring to past time. For example, if something happened one year ago, it is one year since it happened. If it happened a long time ago, it is a long time since it happened.

example.ex: He was killed a few days ago in a skiing accident...
example.tran: 几天前他在一场滑雪事故中丧生。

example.ex: The meeting is the first since the war began 14 years ago...
example.tran: 这是自14年前爆发战争以来的第一次会晤。

example.ex: Harry's daughter is dead. She died long ago.
example.tran: 哈里的女儿已不在人世，很久以前就死了。

boxu.usage: You only use ago when you are talking about a period of time measured back from the present. If you are talking about a period measured back from some earlier time, you use before or previously. He had died a month before... She had rented the flat some fourteen months previously. You use for to say how long a period lasts in the past, present, or future, or how much time passes without something happening. She slept for eight hours... He will be away for three weeks... I hadn't seen him for four years. You use since to say when a period of time started. She has been with the group since it began. ...the first civilian president since the coup 17 years ago. You also use since to refer to the last time that something happened, or to how much time passes without something happening. She hadn't eaten since breakfast... It was a long time since she had been to church.
boxu.tran: ago仅用于谈及现在某个时间以前的时间。如果谈论过去某时间之前的时间，则用before或previously：He had died a month before（他一个月之前就死了），She had rented the flat some fourteen months previously（她大约14个月前租下了该公寓）。for用于表示过去、现在或将来持续的某段时间，或表示某事多长时间没有发生：She slept for eight hours (她睡了8个小时），He will be away for three weeks（他将离开3个星期），I hadn’t seen him for four years (我有4年没见过他了）。表示某段时间开始用since：She has been with the group since it began（该集团创立之初她就在那儿工作），the first civilian president since the coup 17 years ago（自17年前发生政变以来的第一任平民总统）。since也可表示某事最后一次发生的时间或某事多长时间没有发生：She hadn’teaten since breakfast（她早饭后就一直没吃过东西），It was a long time since she had been to church（她已经有很长时间没去教堂了）。

sense.hdgr: usu v-link ADJ, oft ADJ prep
sense.def: If you are agog, you are excited about something, and eager to know more about it.
sense.tran: 渴望的；急切的；热切期待的

example.ex: The city was agog with rumours last night that the two had been executed.
example.tran: 那两人已被处决的传言昨晚搞得全城沸沸扬扬。

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 agonise

sense.def: If you agonize over something, you feel very anxious about it and spend a long time thinking about it.
sense.tran: 感到极度焦虑；苦苦思索

example.ex: Perhaps he was agonizing over the moral issues involved...
example.tran: 也许他正在为其中牵扯的道德问题而伤脑筋。

example.ex: She only made the decision to apply for training after years of agonizing.
example.tran: 多年的苦苦思索之后，她才作出了申请培训的决定。

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 agonised

sense.def: Agonized describes something that you say or do when you are in great physical or mental pain.

example.ex: ...the agonised look on his face.
example.tran: 他脸上极其痛苦的表情

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 agonising

sense.def: Something that is agonizing causes you to feel great physical or mental pain.

example.ex: He did not wish to die the agonizing death of his mother and brother...
example.tran: 他不想像母亲和兄弟那样痛苦地死去。

example.ex: In the heat of Rome, the wait was agonizing.
example.tran: 在罗马的高温下，等待是一种折磨。

example.ex: Progress was agonizingly slow.
example.tran: 进展的缓慢让人备受煎熬。

sense.def: Agonizing decisions and choices are very difficult to make.

example.ex: He now faced an agonizing decision about his immediate future.
example.tran: 他这时候面临着一个关系到他不久的将来的痛苦抉择。

sense.def: Agony is great physical or mental pain.
sense.tran: （肉体或精神的）极度痛苦，创痛

example.ex: A new machine may save thousands of animals from the agony of drug tests...
example.tran: 一种新型机器也许可以将成千上万的动物从药物试验的痛苦中解脱出来。

example.ex: She called out in agony...
example.tran: 她疼得叫出声来。

example.ex: As a young man he suffered agonies of religious doubt.
example.tran: 年轻时，他因为对宗教的怀疑而饱受折磨。

sense.def: An agony aunt is a person who writes a column in a newspaper or magazine in which they reply to readers who have written to them for advice on their personal problems.
sense.tran: （报刊上的）答读者问专栏作家，答疑解惑专栏作家

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 advice columnist

sense.def: In a British newspaper or magazine, the agony column contains letters from readers about their personal problems, and advice on what to do about them.
sense.tran: （报刊上的）读者问答专栏，解忧专栏

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 advice column

sense.def: Agoraphobia is the fear of open or public places.
sense.tran: 广场（或旷野）恐怖（症）；恐旷症;公共场所恐惧症

sense.def: Someone who is agoraphobic suffers from agoraphobia.
sense.tran: 恐旷症的;患公共场所恐惧症的

posc.def: An agoraphobic is someone who suffers from agoraphobia.
posc.tran: 恐旷症患者;公共场所恐惧症患者

sense.def: Agrarian means relating to the ownership and use of land, especially farmland, or relating to the part of a society or economy that is concerned with agriculture.
sense.tran: 土地的；（尤指）耕地的；土地所有制的；农业的；农村的

example.ex: ...a rich area with a highly developed agrarian economy.
example.tran: 农耕经济高度发达的富饶地区

sense.def: If people agree with each other about something, they have the same opinion about it or say that they have the same opinion.

example.ex: If we agreed all the time it would be a bit boring, wouldn't it?...
example.tran: 如果我们总是意见一致，就会有点无趣，对吗？

example.ex: Both have agreed on the need for the money...
example.tran: 两个人一致表示需要那笔钱。

example.ex: So we both agree there's a problem?...
example.tran: 那么我们两个人都认为存在问题，对吧？

example.ex: I see your point but I'm not sure I agree with you...
example.tran: 我明白你的观点，但恐怕我不能苟同。

example.ex: I agree with you that the open system is by far the best...
example.tran: 我同意你的观点，开放的系统显然是最佳的。

example.ex: 'It's appalling.' — 'It is. I agree.'...
example.tran: “真是骇人听闻。”——“嗯，我同意。”

example.ex: I agree that the demise of London zoo would be terrible...
example.tran: 我也认为如果伦敦动物园不复存在的话那真是太糟糕了。

example.ex: I agree with every word you've just said...
example.tran: 我同意你刚说的每句话。

example.ex: 'Frankly I found it rather frightening.' — 'A little startling,' Mark agreed.
example.tran: “坦白说我觉得这相当可怕。”——“是有点吓人，”马克表示同意。

sense.def: If you agree to do something, you say that you will do it. If you agree to a proposal, you accept it.

example.ex: He agreed to pay me for the drawings...
example.tran: 他答应向我支付这些画的钱。

example.ex: Donna agreed to both requests...
example.tran: 两个请求唐纳都同意了。

example.ex: All 100 senators agree to a postponement.
example.tran: 100位议员全都同意延期。

sense.def: If people agree on something, or in British English if they agree something, they all decide to accept or do something.

example.ex: The warring sides have agreed on an unconditional ceasefire...
example.tran: 交战各方已经同意无条件休战。

example.ex: We never agreed a date...
example.tran: 我们从未商定好日期。

example.ex: The court had given the unions until September to agree terms with a buyer.
example.tran: 法庭已指定工会在9月之前与一个买家谈成条件。

sense.def: If two people who are arguing about something agree to disagree or agree to differ, they decide to stop arguing because neither of them is going to change their opinion.
sense.tran: 搁置争议;同意各自保留不同意见

example.ex: You and I are going to have to agree to disagree then.
example.tran: 那你我只能各自保留不同意见了。

sense.def: If you agree with an action or suggestion, you approve of it.

example.ex: I don't agree with what they're doing...
example.tran: 我不赞同他们正在做的事情。

example.ex: In his heart he knew they'd agree with his stand.
example.tran: 他内心明白他们会赞成他的立场。

sense.def: If one account of an event or one set of figures agrees with another, the two accounts or sets of figures are the same or are consistent with each other.

example.ex: His second statement agrees with facts as stated by the other witnesses.
example.tran: 他的第二份供述与其他目击证人所陈述的事实相符。

sense.def: If some food that you eat does not agree with you, it makes you feel ill.

example.ex: I don't think the food here agrees with me.
example.tran: 我觉得这里的食物不对我的胃口。

sense.def: If a place or experience agrees with you, it makes you feel healthy and happy.

example.ex: You look great, Brian. The Bahamas certainly agree with you.
example.tran: 你看上去气色好极了，布赖恩。巴哈马显然很适合你。

sense.def: In grammar, if a word agrees with a noun or pronoun, it has a form that is appropriate to the number or gender of the noun or pronoun. For example, in 'He hates it', the singular verb agrees with the singular pronoun 'he'.
If something is agreeable, it is pleasant and you enjoy it.

example.ex: ...workers in more agreeable and better paid occupations.
example.tran: 在条件更惬意、报酬更丰厚的行业工作的人

example.ex: ...an agreeable surprise.
example.tran: 一个惊喜

example.ex: At first we chatted agreeably about his trips to London and Paris...
example.tran: 一开始，我们愉快地聊起他的伦敦和巴黎之行。

example.ex: The sisters were agreeably surprised to find out that the King of Spain had been their rescuer.
example.tran: 姐妹们惊喜地发现西班牙国王曾经救过她们。

sense.def: If someone is agreeable, they are pleasant and try to please people.
sense.tran: 亲切的;友善的;讨人喜欢的

example.ex: ...sharing a bottle of wine with an agreeable companion...
example.tran: 与友善的同伴共饮一瓶酒

example.ex: I've gone out of my way to be agreeable to his friends.
example.tran: 我已然特意地去讨好他的朋友们。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
to n
sense.def: If you are agreeable to something or if it is agreeable to you, you are willing to do it or to allow it to happen.
sense.tran: 欣然同意的;令人赞同的

example.ex: She was agreeable to the project...
example.tran: 她对这个项目表示欣然同意。

example.ex: If you are agreeable, my husband's office will make all the necessary arrangements.
example.tran: 如果你同意，我丈夫的事务所将作出所有必要的安排。

example.ex: ...a solution that would be agreeable to all.
example.tran: 一个大家都会同意的解决方法

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
on n, ADJ that
sense.def: If people are agreed on something, they have reached a joint decision on it or have the same opinion about it.
sense.tran: 达成协议的;商定的;意见一致的

example.ex: Okay, so are we agreed on going north?...
example.tran: 好，那么我们已经一致同意向北走了？

example.ex: Everyone is agreed that something needs to be done about the situation.
example.tran: 所有人一致认为需要采取措施改变这种局面。

sense.def: When you are discussing something, you can say 'Agreed?' to check whether the other people agree with what you have just said. You can say 'Agreed' if you agree with what someone has just said.
sense.tran: 同意吗（用于征求他人意见）/ 同意（用于赞同他人意见）

example.ex: 'That means we move out today. Agreed?'—'Agreed.'
example.tran: “那就意味着我们要今天搬出去，同意吗？”——“同意。”

example.ex: 'One thing you can never insure against is corruption among your staff.'—'Agreed.'
example.tran: “永远也防不胜防的就是员工内部的贪污腐败。”——“同意。”

sense.def: An agreement is a formal decision about future action which is made by two or more countries, groups, or people.

example.ex: It looks as though a compromise agreement has now been reached...
example.tran: 看起来好像现已达成一个妥协协定。

example.ex: The two countries signed an agreement to jointly launch satellites.
example.tran: 两国曾签订了联合发射人造卫星的协议。

example.ex: ...a new defence agreement between Greece and the United States.
example.tran: 希腊和美国最新达成的一项国防协议

sense.def: Agreement on something is a joint decision that a particular course of action should be taken.

example.ex: The two men had not reached agreement on any issues...
example.tran: 两人还未就任何议题达成协议。

example.ex: But instead of ending in agreement, the talks broke up in acrimony at the end of the week.
example.tran: 但是到这个周末，谈判非但没有达成协议反而在唇枪舌剑中不欢而散。

sense.def: Agreement with someone means having the same opinion as they have.

example.ex: The judge kept nodding in agreement...
example.tran: 法官不停地点头表示同意。

example.ex: There was general agreement that every effort should be made to prevent the war from spreading.
example.tran: 人们一致认为应该竭尽全力阻止战事扩大。

defx.hdgr:
usu v-link PHR, v PHR, oft PHR
with n
defx.def: If you are in agreement with someone, you have the same opinion as they have.

example.ex: Not all scholars are in agreement with her, however...
example.tran: 然而，不是所有的学者都与她意见一致。

example.ex: We were in basic agreement on this point.
example.tran: 在这点上我们的意见基本一致。

sense.def: Agreement to a course of action means allowing it to happen or giving it your approval.

example.ex: The clinic doctor will then write to your GP to get his agreement.
example.tran: 然后门诊医生将会写信给你的全科医生以取得他的同意。

defx.hdgr:
v-link PHR, usu PHR
with n
defx.def: If you are in agreement with a plan or proposal, you approve of it.

example.ex: The president was in full agreement with the proposal.
example.tran: 总统完全赞同该提议。

sense.def: If there is agreement between two accounts of an event or two sets of figures, they are the same or are consistent with each other.

example.ex: Many other surveys have produced results essentially in agreement with these figures.
example.tran: 许多其他调查已经得出了与这些数据基本一致的结果。

sense.def: In grammar, agreement refers to the way that a word has a form appropriate to the number or gender of the noun or pronoun it relates to.
sense.tran: （与搭配名词或代词在数或性上的）一致，呼应

sense.hdgr: also N in pl, oft N n
sense.def: Agribusiness is the various businesses that produce, sell, and distribute farm products, especially on a large scale.
sense.tran: 农业综合经营;（尤指）大农场经营

example.ex: Many of the old agricultural collectives are now being turned into agribusiness corporations.
example.tran: 许多老式的农业合作群体现在正在转型为农业综合经营公司。

sense.def: Agricultural means involving or relating to agriculture.

example.ex: ...agricultural land.
example.tran: 农田

example.ex: ...corn and other agricultural products.
example.tran: 玉米和其他农产品

sense.def: An agricultural place or society is one in which agriculture is important or highly developed.
sense.tran: （地区、社会）以农业为主的，农业高度发达的

example.ex: ...traditional agricultural societies.
example.tran: 传统的农耕社会

sense.def: An agriculturalist is someone who is an expert on agriculture and who advises farmers.
Agriculture is farming and the methods that are used to raise and look after crops and animals.

example.ex: The Ukraine is strong both in industry and agriculture.
example.tran: 乌克兰的工业和农业都很发达。

example.ex: The monsoon has now covered almost all of the agriculturally important north-west of India.
example.tran: 雨季现在几乎已经覆盖了印度西北部所有重要的农业区。

sense.def: Agro- is used to form nouns and adjectives which refer to things relating to agriculture, or to agriculture combined with another activity.
sense.tran: （用于构成形容词和名词）表示“农业”，“农业的”，“农…（的）”

example.ex: ...agro-chemical residues.
example.tran: 农药的残留物

sense.def: An agronomist is someone who studies the growing and harvesting of crops.
If a ship runs aground, it touches the ground in a shallow part of a river, lake, or the sea, and gets stuck.

example.ex: The ship ran aground where there should have been a depth of 35ft.
example.tran: 船搁浅在水深本应为35英尺的地方。

sense.def: Ah is used in writing to represent a noise that people make in conversation, for example to acknowledge or draw attention to something, or to express surprise or disappointment.
sense.tran: （书面语中用于表示在交谈时作出回应或引起他人注意或表示惊讶、失望）啊

example.ex: I'm meeting Anna Langenbach. Ah, this seems to be the train now...
example.tran: 我要去见安娜·朗根巴赫。啊，这像是我要乘坐的火车了。

example.ex: Ah, so many questions, so little time.
example.tran: 啊，这么多问题，这么短的时间。

sense.def: Aha is used in writing to represent a noise that people make in conversation, for example to express satisfaction or surprise.
sense.tran: 啊哈（书面语中用于表示满意、惊讶等）

example.ex: Aha! Here at last, the answer to my question.
example.tran: 啊哈，我的问题到这儿终于有了答案。

boxx.note: In addition to the uses shown below, ahead is used in phrasal verbs such as ‘get ahead’, ‘go ahead’, and ‘press ahead’.
boxx.tran: 除下列用法外，ahead还可用于get ahead，go ahead，press ahead等短语动词中。

sense.hdgr: ADV after v, n ADV, ADV with cl
sense.def: Something that is ahead is in front of you. If you look ahead, you look directly in front of you.

example.ex: Brett looked straight ahead...
example.tran: 布雷特直视前方。

example.ex: I peered ahead through the front screen...
example.tran: 我透过面前的挡风玻璃凝视前方。

example.ex: The road ahead was now blocked solid...
example.tran: 前面的路现已被堵得严严实实。

example.ex: Ahead, he saw the side railings of First Bridge over Crooked Brook.
example.tran: 他看见了克鲁克德河上第一大桥的桥栏就在前面。

sense.def: You use ahead with verbs such as 'push', 'move', and 'forge' to indicate that a plan, scheme, or organization is making fast progress.
sense.tran: （与push，move和forge等动词连用表示计划或组织等）进展迅速地

example.ex: We are moving ahead with plans to send financial aid...
example.tran: 我们提供财政援助的计划进展顺利。

example.ex: Now BBC World Television is forging ahead on its own.
example.tran: 现在英国广播公司的全球电视节目正靠自己的力量稳步推进。

sense.hdgr: be ADV, ADV after v, oft amount ADV
sense.def: If you are ahead in your work or achievements, you have made more progress than you expected to and are performing well.

example.ex: The North Korean economy was pretty strong in its time, and was ahead until maybe 1970...
example.tran: 朝鲜的经济曾经相当强大，大约在1970年之前都是超前发展。

example.ex: First half profits have charged ahead from £127.6m to £134.2m...
example.tran: 上半年的利润已超过预计的1.276亿英镑达到1.342亿英镑。

example.ex: Children in small classes are several months ahead in reading.
example.tran: 小班的孩子们提前几个月就开始阅读。

sense.hdgr: be ADV, ADV after v, oft amount ADV
sense.def: If a person or a team is ahead in a competition, they are winning.

example.ex: Australia were ahead throughout the game...
example.tran: 澳大利亚队在整场比赛都处于领先地位。

example.ex: Scotland were ahead in their European championship qualifier in Iceland...
example.tran: 苏格兰队在冰岛举行的欧洲杯预选赛中处于领先位置。

example.ex: A goal would have put Dublin 6-1 ahead.
example.tran: 只要再进一球，都柏林队将以6比1领先。

sense.hdgr: v-link ADV, ADV after v, n ADV
sense.def: Ahead also means in the future.

example.ex: A much bigger battle is ahead for the president...
example.tran: 一场更为艰巨的战斗正等待着总统。

example.ex: Anne Garrels reports there are still difficult times ahead for Poland...
example.tran: 安妮·加雷尔斯报道说波兰仍然将面临一段艰苦的时期。

example.ex: Now I can remember without mourning, and begin to look ahead...
example.tran: 如今回首往事我已不再感到悲痛，并且开始展望将来。

example.ex: There will be many difficult and challenging days ahead.
example.tran: 今后将会有很多艰苦和充满挑战性的日子。

example.ex: The task ahead is huge.
example.tran: 眼前的任务很艰巨。

sense.def: If you prepare or plan something ahead, you do it some time before a future event so that everything is ready for that event to take place.

example.ex: The government wants figures that help it to plan ahead...
example.tran: 政府需要一些有助于其提前制订计划的数据。

example.ex: Do book ahead as the restaurant is very popular...
example.tran: 该饭店非常受欢迎，请务必提前预订。

example.ex: Summer weddings need to be arranged months ahead.
example.tran: 在夏季举行婚礼需要提前几个月作安排。

sense.def: If you go ahead, or if you go on ahead, you go in front of someone who is going to the same place so that you arrive there some time before they do.

example.ex: I went ahead and waited with Sean...
example.tran: 我先走的，和肖恩一起在那儿等。

example.ex: You just go on ahead. I'll come by later...
example.tran: 你只管先往前走。我随后就来。

example.ex: I'd have to send Tina on ahead with Rachael.
example.tran: 我只有让蒂娜和雷切尔一起先行一步。

xrxr.def: Please look at category 8 to see if the expression you are looking for is shown under another headword.
xrxr.tran: 以下义项中未列出的表达方式请参见第8项。

sense.def: If someone is ahead of you, they are directly in front of you. If someone is moving ahead of you, they are in front of you and moving in the same direction.

example.ex: I saw a man in a blue jacket thirty metres ahead of me...
example.tran: 我看见在我前面30米处有一个身穿蓝色夹克的男人。

example.ex: She walked ahead of Helene up the steps into the hotel.
example.tran: 她在海伦妮前面迈上台阶，进了旅馆。

sense.def: If an event or period of time lies ahead of you, it is going to happen or take place soon or in the future.

example.ex: I tried to think about all the problems that were ahead of me tomorrow...
example.tran: 我试图考虑明天我将面临的所有问题。

example.ex: She spent all night thinking about the future that lay ahead of her...
example.tran: 她整夜未睡，满脑子都想着她未来的前途。

example.ex: We have a very busy day ahead of us today.
example.tran: 今天迎接我们的将是非常忙碌的一天。

sense.def: In a competition, if a person or team does something ahead of someone else, they do it before the second person or team.

example.ex: Millar finished 1 minute and 35 seconds ahead of Thierry Claveyrolat.
example.tran: 米勒领先蒂埃里·克拉韦罗拉1分35秒完成比赛。

sense.def: If something happens ahead of an event or time, it happens before that event or time.

example.ex: The Prime Minister was speaking ahead of today's meeting.
example.tran: 首相在今天的会议开始之前作了发言。

sense.def: If something happens ahead of schedule or ahead of time, it happens earlier than was planned.

example.ex: The election was held six months ahead of schedule...
example.tran: 选举提前了6个月举行。

example.ex: This dish may be prepared a day ahead of time and refrigerated.
example.tran: 这道菜可以提前一天准备好并冷藏起来。

sense.def: If someone is ahead of someone else, they have made more progress and are more advanced in what they are doing.

example.ex: Henry generally stayed ahead of the others in the academic subjects.
example.tran: 亨利的文化课成绩通常都优于其他学生。

xrse.def: one step ahead of someone or something

sense.def: In writing, ahem is used to show that someone is being ironic. Ahem is also used to show that someone wants to get another person's attention.
sense.tran: 呃哼（用于书面语中表示讽刺意味或用于引起注意）

example.ex: It can be a dangerous course of action which might be sound in theory but — ahem — perhaps a trifle risky in practice...
example.tran: 这可能是一次危险的行动，在理论上听着无缝可击，但——呃哼——真做起来却可能有点冒险。

example.ex: It is not unknown for valuable display items to go, ahem, missing.
example.tran: 贵重的展品，呃哼，丢失的话，会众人皆知。

sense.def: If you get ahold of someone or something, you manage to contact, find, or get them.

example.ex: I tried again to get ahold of my cousin Joan.
example.tran: 我再次尝试联系我的表妹琼。

sense.def: If you get ahold of yourself, you force yourself to become calm and sensible after a shock or in a difficult situation.
sense.tran: （受惊吓或遇到困难之后）保持镇静，保持理智

example.ex: I'm going to have to get ahold of myself.
example.tran: 我一定要保持头脑冷静。

sense.def: Ahoy is something that people in boats shout in order to attract attention.
sense.tran: 喂，啊嗬（船上的人为引起别人注意而发出的喊声）

example.ex: Ahoy there!...
example.tran: 喂，那边！

example.ex: Ship ahoy!
example.tran: 啊，船！

sense.def: AI is an abbreviation for (缩略=) artificial intelligence, or artificial insemination.

sense.hdgr:
oft supp N, N
to n
sense.def: Aid is money, equipment, or services that are provided for people, countries, or organizations who need them but cannot provide them for themselves.

example.ex: ...regular flights carrying humanitarian aid to Cambodia...
example.tran: 向柬埔寨运送人道援助物资的定期航班

example.ex: They have already pledged billions of dollars in aid.
example.tran: 他们已经许诺援助几十亿美元。

example.ex: ...food aid convoys.
example.tran: 救援食品护送车队

sense.def: To aid a country, organization, or person means to provide them with money, equipment, or services that they need.

example.ex: ...US efforts to aid Kurdish refugees.
example.tran: 美国对库尔德难民的援助行动

example.ex: ...a charitable organization that has spent millions aiding pharmaceutical research.
example.tran: 已投入巨资资助药物研究的一家慈善机构

example.ex: ...grant-aided factories.
example.tran: 政府资助的工厂

example.ex: ...state-aided schools.
example.tran: 享受国家补助的学校

sense.def: To aid someone means to help or assist them.

example.ex: ...a software system to aid managers in advanced decision-making...
example.tran: 帮助经理作出高级决策的软件系统

example.ex: The hunt for her killer will continue, with police aided by the army and air force.
example.tran: 警方将在陆军和空军的帮助下，继续追踪谋杀她的凶手。

example.ex: He was forced to turn for aid to his former enemy.
example.tran: 他曾被迫向以前的敌人求助。

sense.hdgr:
usu
with/without the N
of n
sense.def: If you perform a task with the aid of something, you need or use that thing to perform that task.

example.ex: He succeeded with the aid of a completely new method he discovered...
example.tran: 借助于自己发现的一种全新的方法，他获得了成功。

example.ex: Gently raise your upper body to a sitting position, without the aid of your hands.
example.tran: 在不用手扶的前提下，慢慢抬起上身直到坐起。

sense.def: An aid is an object, device, or technique that makes something easier to do.
sense.tran: 辅助物;辅助用具;辅助性技术

example.ex: The new law gives authorities a responsibility to provide aids to the disabled...
example.tran: 新法律规定当局有责任为残疾人提供帮助。

example.ex: The book is an invaluable aid to teachers of literature...
example.tran: 这本书对于教授文学的老师来说帮助非常大。

example.ex: Colonel Hardy would like to see every tank with a computerized aid.
example.tran: 哈迪上校希望看到每辆坦克都配有电脑化辅助装置。

sense.def: If something aids a process, it makes it easier or more likely to happen.

example.ex: The export sector will aid the economic recovery...
example.tran: 出口产业将促进经济复苏。

example.ex: Calcium may aid in the prevention of colon cancer.
example.tran: 钙可能有助于预防结肠癌。

phrase.def: An activity or event in aid of a particular cause or charity is intended to raise money for that cause or charity.

example.ex: ...a charity performance in aid of Great Ormond Street Children's Hospital.
example.tran: 为给大奥蒙德街儿童医院筹资而举办的慈善演出

phrase.def: If you come or go to someone's aid, you try to help them when they are in danger or difficulty.

example.ex: We're coming to the aid of the people of Somalia at the request of the United Nations...
example.tran: 我们应联合国的要求前去救援索马里的民众。

example.ex: Horrified neighbours rushed to his aid as he fell.
example.tran: 他摔下来时，惊恐的邻居们赶忙冲过去救他。

sense.def: An aide is an assistant to someone who has an important job, especially in government or in the armed forces.
sense.tran: （尤指在政府或军队中身居要职者的）助手，副手

example.ex: ...a close aide to the Prime Minister.
example.tran: 首相的亲密助手

sense.def: An aide-de-camp is an officer in the armed forces who helps an officer of higher rank.

example.ex: ...a colonel who had been aide-de-camp to the king.
example.tran: 曾经担任国王副官的一名上校

sense.def: An aide-memoire is something such as a list that you use to remind you of something.
sense.tran: 帮助记忆的东西；备忘录

sense.def: AIDS is a disease which destroys the natural system of protection that the body has against other diseases. AIDS is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'acquired immune deficiency syndrome'.
sense.tran: 艾滋病；获得性免疫缺陷综合征

sense.def: If something ails a group or area of activity, it is a problem or source of trouble for that group or for people involved in that activity.

example.ex: A full-scale debate is under way on what ails the industry.
example.tran: 关于工业为何陷入困境正在展开一场全面的讨论。

sense.def: If something ails someone, they are ill.

example.ex: 'What ails you?' he asked.
example.tran: “你哪里不舒服？”他问道。

sense.def: An aileron is a section on the back edge of the wing of an aircraft that can be raised or lowered in order to control the aircraft's movement.
An ailing organization or society is in difficulty and is becoming weaker.
sense.tran: 处境困难的;境况不佳的;衰退的

example.ex: The rise in overseas sales is good news for the ailing American economy.
example.tran: 海外销售额的上升对于不景气的美国经济来说是个好消息。

sense.def: If someone is ailing, they are ill and are not getting better.

example.ex: He is said to be ailing at his home in Washington.
example.tran: 据说他身体欠佳，正呆在华盛顿的家中。

sense.def: An ailment is an illness, especially one that is not very serious.

example.ex: The pharmacist can assist you with the treatment of common ailments.
example.tran: 药剂师能帮你治疗一般的病痛。

sense.def: If you aim for something or aim to do something, you plan or hope to achieve it.

example.ex: He is aiming for the 100 metres world record...
example.tran: 他志在打破100米世界纪录。

example.ex: Businesses will have to aim at long-term growth.
example.tran: 企业必须以长期增长为目标。

example.ex: ...an appeal which aims to raise funds for children with special needs.
example.tran: 旨在为有特殊需要的孩子筹集资金而发出的呼吁

sense.def: The aim of something that you do is the purpose for which you do it or the result that it is intended to achieve.

example.ex: The aim of the festival is to increase awareness of Hindu culture and traditions.
example.tran: 该节庆日的目的在于增强人们对印度文化和传统的认识。

example.ex: ...a research programme that has largely failed to achieve its principal aims.
example.tran: 在较大程度上未能实现其主要目标的研究项目

sense.def: If an action or plan is aimed at achieving something, it is intended or planned to achieve it.

example.ex: The new measures are aimed at tightening existing sanctions.
example.tran: 新措施旨在加强现行的制裁。

example.ex: ...talks aimed at ending the war.
example.tran: 旨在结束战争的谈判

sense.def: If you aim to do something, you decide or want to do it.

example.ex: Are you aiming to visit the gardens?...
example.tran: 你想去逛公园吗？

example.ex: I didn't aim to get caught.
example.tran: 我并不想被抓住。

sense.def: If your actions or remarks are aimed at a particular person or group, you intend that the person or group should notice them and be influenced by them.

example.ex: His message was aimed at the undecided middle ground of Israeli politics...
example.tran: 他所传达的信息针对的是以色列政局中尚未表态的中间派。

example.ex: Advertising aimed at children should be curbed.
example.tran: 针对儿童的广告应受到限制。

sense.def: If you aim a weapon or object at something or someone, you point it towards them before firing or throwing it.

example.ex: He was aiming the rifle at Wade.
example.tran: 他将步枪瞄准了韦德。

example.ex: ...a missile aimed at the arms factory...
example.tran: 瞄准军工厂的导弹

example.ex: I didn't know I was supposed to aim at the same spot all the time.
example.tran: 我不知道自己应该一直瞄准同一目标。

sense.def: Your aim is your skill or action in pointing a weapon or other object at its target.
sense.tran: 瞄准，对准（指技巧或动作）

example.ex: He stood with the gun in his right hand and his left hand steadying his aim.
example.tran: 他站立着，右手举枪，左手稳住枪对准目标。

sense.def: If you aim a kick or punch at someone, you try to kick or punch them.

example.ex: They aimed kicks at his shins.
example.tran: 他们踢向他的小腿。

phrase.def: When you take aim, you point a weapon or object at someone or something, before firing or throwing it.

example.ex: She had spotted a man with a shotgun taking aim.
example.tran: 她发现一个正持猎枪瞄准的男子。

phrase.def: If you take aim at someone or something, you criticize them strongly.

example.ex: Republican strategists are taking particular aim at Democratic senators.
example.tran: 共和党的战略家正尖锐地攻击民主党的参议员。

sense.def: A person or activity that is aimless has no clear purpose or plan.

example.ex: Peters had been adrift and aimless...
example.tran: 彼得斯曾经漫无目的地四处漂泊。

example.ex: After several hours of aimless searching they were getting low on fuel.
example.tran: 在几个小时漫无目的的搜寻之后，他们快没燃料了。

example.ex: I wandered around aimlessly.
example.tran: 我漫无目的地到处游逛。

example.ex: His sense of aimlessness increased.
example.tran: 他越来越感到自己毫无斗志。

sense.def: People sometimes use ain't instead of 'am not', 'aren't', 'isn't', 'haven't', and 'hasn't'. Some people consider this use to be incorrect.
sense.tran: （有时用于代替 am not，aren’t，isn’t，haven’t 和 hasn’t; 有人认为该用法不正确）

example.ex: Well, it's obvious, ain't it?...
example.tran: 嗯，这很明显，不是吗？

example.ex: I ain't got kids, but I have to pay towards the schools.
example.tran: 我没有孩子，但是我必须向学校交钱。

sense.def: Air is the mixture of gases which forms the earth's atmosphere and which we breathe.

example.ex: Draughts help to circulate air...
example.tran: 穿堂风有助于空气流通。

example.ex: Keith opened the window and leaned out into the cold air.
example.tran: 基思打开窗户，探出身到冷风中。

example.ex: ...water and air pollutants.
example.tran: 水污染物和空气污染物

sense.def: The air is the space around things or above the ground.

example.ex: Government troops broke up the protest by firing their guns in the air...
example.tran: 政府军队朝天鸣枪驱散了抗议人群。

example.ex: People's cigarette smoke seemed to hang in the air.
example.tran: 人们吸烟的烟雾似乎会长时间滞留在空气中。

sense.def: Air is used to refer to travel in aircraft.

example.ex: Air travel will continue to grow at about 6% per year...
example.tran: 乘飞机旅行的人数将以每年大约6%的速度持续增加。

example.ex: Casualties had to be brought to hospital by air.
example.tran: 伤者不得不用飞机送往医院。

sense.def: An air is a simple tune which can be easily recognized and remembered.

sense.hdgr:
with supp, oft N
of n
sense.def: If you say that someone or something has a particular air, you mean that they give this general impression.
sense.tran: 神态;感觉;总体印象;氛围

example.ex: Jennifer regarded him with an air of amusement...
example.tran: 珍妮弗觉得他很风趣。

example.ex: The meal gave the occasion an almost festive air.
example.tran: 这一餐使整个场合有了近乎节日般的喜庆氛围。

sense.def: If you say that someone is putting on airs or giving themselves airs, you are criticizing them for behaving as if they are better than other people.
sense.tran: 矫揉造作；装腔作势；做作

example.ex: We're poor and we never put on airs.
example.tran: 我们贫穷但从不装腔作势。

sense.def: If a broadcasting company airs a television or radio programme, they show it on television or broadcast it on the radio.
sense.tran: （通过电视或无线电）播送，播放

example.ex: Tonight PBS will air a documentary called 'Democracy In Action'.
example.tran: 今晚公共广播公司将播放一部名为《民主进行时》的纪录片。

example.ex: ...the airing of offensive material.
example.tran: 冒犯性音像资料的播放

sense.def: If you air your opinions, you make them known to people.

example.ex: They sat for more than six hours, and both sides agreed they had aired all their differences...
example.tran: 他们一起坐了六个多小时，而且双方都认为他们已经表达了所有的不同意见。

example.ex: The whole issue was thoroughly aired at the meeting.
example.tran: 在会上完全公开了整个问题。

example.ex: While we're able to broach the subject of sex, money rarely gets an airing.
example.tran: 虽然我们能公开讨论性的话题，但却很少谈及金钱的问题。

sense.def: If you air a room or building, you let fresh air into it.

example.ex: One day a week her mother systematically cleaned and aired each room.
example.tran: 她母亲按部就班地每周一次清扫所有的房间并开窗通风。

example.ex: Open all the windows of the bedroom and give it a good airing.
example.tran: 打开卧室的所有窗户，让它好好通通风。

sense.def: If you air clothing or bedding, you put it somewhere warm to make sure that it is completely dry.

example.ex: When the shirts were clean, I ironed them myself, aired them and placed them in drawers in his room.
example.tran: 衬衫洗干净之后，我自己将它们熨好、烘干并放在他房间的抽屉里。

phrase.def: If you do something to clear the air, you do it in order to resolve any problems or disagreements that there might be.

example.ex: ...an inquiry just to clear the air and settle the facts of the case.
example.tran: 一项只为消除疑团并弄清案件事实而进行的调查

phrase.def: If you refer to someone's airs and graces, you mean that they behave in a way that shows that they think they are more important than other people.
phrase.tran: 大模大样;摆架子;装腔作势

example.ex: The old cliché of the customer being always right is what gives them airs and graces.
example.tran: “顾客总是对的”这种陈词滥调让他们变得趾高气扬。

phrase.def: If something is in the air it is felt to be present, but it is not talked about.

example.ex: There was great excitement in the air...
example.tran: 人人都感到无比激动。

example.ex: She walked away and left the question hanging in the air.
example.tran: 她走开了，将疑问留在人们心里。

phrase.def: If someone is on the air, they are broadcasting on radio or television. If a programme is on the air, it is being broadcast on radio or television. If it is off the air, it is not being broadcast.
phrase.tran: 播送（广播、电视节目）；（广播、电视节目）播放/停止播放

example.ex: She is going on the air as presenter of a new show...
example.tran: 她即将上电视主持一档新节目。

example.ex: Rockwell hopes the program can be on the air within a year...
example.tran: 罗克韦尔希望该节目能在一年内播出。

example.ex: This message did not reach me until after the programme went off the air.
example.tran: 直到节目播出后，我才获知这条消息。

phrase.def: If someone or something disappears into thin air, they disappear completely. If someone or something appears out of thin air, they appear suddenly and mysteriously.
phrase.tran: （消失得）无影无踪/突然神秘地（出现）

example.ex: 'But where could they have gone?' he demanded. 'They can't just vanish into thin air!'...
example.tran: “但是他们可能去哪里呢？”他追问道，“他们不可能就神秘消失了!”

example.ex: He had materialized out of thin air; I had not seen or heard him coming.
example.tran: 他突然间神秘地出现了；我既没看见他来，也没听见他的脚步声。

phrase.def: If you say that a decision or a situation is up in the air, you mean that it has not yet been completely settled or planned.

example.ex: He told reporters today that the president's trip to Moscow is up in the air.
example.tran: 今天他告诉记者们总统是否前往莫斯科尚未确定。

phrase.def: If you say that you are walking on air or floating on air, you mean that you feel extremely happy about something.

example.ex: As soon as I know I'm in the team it's like I'm walking on air.
example.tran: 一得知我加入了这个队，我高兴得像飞上了天。

sense.def: An air ambulance is a helicopter or plane that is used for taking people to hospital.
An airbag is a safety device in a car which automatically fills with air if the car crashes, and is designed to protect the people in the car when they are thrown forward in the crash.
An air base is a centre where military aircraft take off or land and are serviced, and where many of the centre's staff live.
An airbed is a plastic or rubber mattress which can be folded or stored flat and which you fill with air before you use it.
If an aircraft is airborne, it is in the air and flying.
sense.tran: （飞机）升空的，空中的，在飞行中的

example.ex: The pilot did manage to get airborne.
example.tran: 飞行员的确设法使飞机升空了。

sense.def: Airborne troops use parachutes to get into enemy territory.

example.ex: The allies landed thousands of airborne troops.
example.tran: 盟军空投了数千人的空降部队。

sense.def: Airborne means in the air or carried in the air.

example.ex: Many people are allergic to airborne pollutants such as pollen.
example.tran: 许多人对空气传播的污染物过敏，比如花粉。

sense.def: Air brakes are brakes which are used on heavy vehicles such as buses and trains and which are operated by means of compressed air.
sense.tran: （大型车辆的）气闸，气动刹车，空气制动器

sense.def: An airbrush is an artist's tool which sprays paint onto a surface.
To airbrush a photograph or other image means to change it using an airbrush, especially to make it more beautiful or perfect.
sense.tran: 用喷枪修饰，用气笔修改（相片等）

example.ex: ...perfect airbrushed bodies.
example.tran: 用喷枪修饰过的完美躯体

example.ex: ...bits of photographs cut, pasted and then airbrushed to create a convincing whole.
example.tran: 把照片的碎片裁剪好后粘贴在一起，然后用气笔修成一个令人信以为真的整体图片

sense.def: An Airbus is an aeroplane which is designed to carry a large number of passengers for fairly short distances.
Air-con is the same as air conditioning .

example.ex: The bus is a 45-seater with air-con and videos.
example.tran: 这辆大巴能坐45人，内有空调和影像设备。

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 air-conditioned

sense.def: If a room or vehicle is air conditioned, the air in it is kept cool and dry by means of a special machine.
sense.tran: （房间或车辆）有空调设备的，安有空调的

example.ex: ...our new air conditioned trains.
example.tran: 我们的新空调列车

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 air-conditioner

sense.def: An air conditioner is a machine which keeps the air in a building cool and dry.

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 air-conditioning

sense.def: Air conditioning is a method of providing buildings and vehicles with cool dry air.
An air-cooled engine is prevented from getting too hot when it is running by cool air that passes over it, rather than being cooled by a liquid.
sense.tran: （引擎等）用空气冷却的，气冷的

example.ex: The car was powered by a four cylinder air-cooled engine.
example.tran: 该汽车由一个四缸气冷发动机驱动。

sense.def: An aircraft is a vehicle which can fly, for example an aeroplane or a helicopter.

example.ex: The return flight of the aircraft was delayed...
example.tran: 回程航班被延误了。

example.ex: At least three military aircraft were destroyed.
example.tran: 至少3架军用飞机被毁。

sense.def: An aircraft carrier is a warship with a long, flat deck where aircraft can take off and land.
The aircrew on a plane are the pilot and other people who are responsible for flying it and for looking after any passengers who are on it.
An airdrome is a place or area where small aircraft can land and take off.

entry.boxr: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 aerodrome

sense.def: An air drop is a delivery of supplies by aircraft to an area that is hard to get to. The supplies are dropped from the aircraft on parachutes.
If a country or organization air drops supplies to a place, it drops supplies there from aircraft.

example.ex: Meanwhile, United Nations plans to start air dropping food to rural villages are being held up.
example.tran: 与此同时，联合国向乡村空投食物的计划被搁置。

sense.def: The airfare to a place is the amount it costs to fly there.
An airfield is an area of ground where aircraft take off and land. It is smaller than an airport.
The airflow around an object or vehicle is the way that the air flows around it.
An airflow is a wind, especially one that blows very high above the earth.
An air force is the part of a country's armed forces that is concerned with fighting in the air.

example.ex: ...the United States Air Force...
example.tran: 美国空军

example.ex: Jack Mann was a Royal Air Force fighter pilot during World War II.
example.tran: 杰克·曼在第二次世界大战时期是英国皇家空军的战斗机飞行员。

sense.def: An air fresh-ener is a product people can buy which is meant to make rooms smell pleasant.
An airgun is a gun which is fired by means of air pressure.
If you describe someone, especially a young woman, as an airhead, you are critical of them because you think they are not at all clever and are interested only in unimportant things.
sense.tran: 没头脑的人，傻瓜，愚蠢的人（尤指只关心无关紧要之事的年轻女人）

sense.def: An air hostess is a woman whose job is to look after the passengers in an aircraft.
sense.tran: 客机女服务员；空中小姐

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 stewardess

sense.def: In British houses, an airing cupboard is a warm cupboard where you put clothes and other things that have been washed and partly dried, to make sure they are completely dry.
If a place is airless, there is no fresh air in it.
sense.tran: 无新鲜空气的；空气不流通的

example.ex: ...a dark, airless room...
example.tran: 黑暗、沉闷的屋子

example.ex: The afternoon was hot, sticky and airless.
example.tran: 那个下午闷热潮湿。

sense.def: An airlift is an operation to move people, troops, or goods by air, especially in a war or when land routes are closed.
sense.tran: （尤指战争期间或陆上交通中断时的）空运

example.ex: President Garcia has ordered an airlift of food, medicines and blankets.
example.tran: 加西亚总统已经下令空运食品、药物和毛毯。

sense.def: If people, troops, or goods are airlifted somewhere, they are carried by air, especially in a war or when land routes are closed.

example.ex: The injured were airlifted to hospital in Prestwick...
example.tran: 伤者被空运送往普雷斯特维克的医院。

example.ex: Other nationalities, such as Pakistanis, were being airlifted out by their governments...
example.tran: 其他国家的人，例如巴基斯坦人，正由本国政府空运出境。

example.ex: The government is trying to replenish supplies by airlifting food.
example.tran: 政府正试图通过空投食品补充供应。

sense.def: An airline is a company which provides regular services carrying people or goods in aeroplanes.

example.ex: ...the Dutch national airline KLM.
example.tran: 荷兰国家航空公司KLM

sense.def: An airliner is a large aeroplane that is used for carrying passengers.
An airlock is a small room that is used to move between areas which do not have the same air pressure, for example in a spacecraft or submarine.
An airlock is a bubble of air in a pipe that prevents liquid from flowing through.
Airmail is the system of sending letters, parcels, and goods by air.

example.ex: ...an airmail letter...
example.tran: 航空信

example.ex: Goods are generally shipped by airmail.
example.tran: 货物一般通过航空运输。

sense.def: An airman is a man who flies aircraft, especially one who serves in his country's air force.

example.ex: ...an English airman.
example.tran: 英国飞行员

sense.def: Air miles are points that you collect when you buy certain goods or services and which you can use to pay for air travel.
An air pistol is a small gun which is fired by means of air pressure.
An airplane is a vehicle with wings and one or more engines that enable it to fly through the air.

entry.boxr: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 aeroplane

sense.def: The airplay which a piece of popular music receives is the number of times it is played on the radio.
sense.tran: （无线电台上）乐曲的播放次数

example.ex: Our first single got a lot of airplay.
example.tran: 我们的第一首单曲在电台播放过很多次。

sense.def: An airport is a place where aircraft land and take off, which has buildings and facilities for passengers.

example.ex: ...Heathrow Airport, the busiest international airport in the world.
example.tran: 希思罗机场，世界上最繁忙的国际机场

sense.def: People sometimes refer to long novels such as thrillers and romances that are written in a popular style as airport novels .
sense.tran: 机场小说（指惊险刺激或浪漫的长篇流行小说）

sense.def: Airport tax is a tax that airline passengers have to pay in order to use an airport.

example.ex: Overnight return flights cost from £349 including airport taxes.
example.tran: 当夜返程的航班至少需要349英镑，包括机场税。

sense.def: A nation's air power is the strength of its air force.

example.ex: We will use air power to protect UN peacekeepers if necessary.
example.tran: 必要的话我们会动用空军保护联合国维和人员。

sense.def: Air rage is aggressive or violent behaviour by airline passengers.
sense.tran: 空中愤怒（飞机上的乘客出现的攻击或暴力行为）

example.ex: Most air rage incidents involve heavy drinking.
example.tran: 大多数的空中暴力事件与酗酒有关。

sense.hdgr:
oft N
on n, N n
sense.def: An air raid is an attack by military aircraft in which bombs are dropped. This expression is usually used by the country or group that is suffering the attack.
sense.tran: 空袭（该词通常为受袭方所使用）

example.ex: The war began with overnight air raids on Baghdad and Kuwait.
example.tran: 战争以对巴格达和科威特的夜间空袭开始。

example.ex: ...an underground air raid shelter.
example.tran: 地下防空洞

sense.def: An air rifle is a rifle which is fired by means of air pressure.
An airship is an aircraft that consists of a large balloon which is filled with gas and is powered by an engine. It has a section underneath for passengers.
An airshow is an event at which aeroplane pilots entertain the public by performing very skilful and complicated movements with the aircraft in the sky.
A country's airspace is the part of the sky that is over that country and is considered to belong to it.

example.ex: The plane left British airspace.
example.tran: 飞机飞离了英国领空。

sense.def: An aircraft's airspeed is the speed at which it travels through the air.
An air strike is an attack by military aircraft in which bombs are dropped. This expression is usually used by the country or group that is carrying out the attack.
sense.tran: 空中袭击，空中打击（该词通常为袭击方所使用）

example.ex: A senior defence official said last night that they would continue the air strikes.
example.tran: 一位高级国防官员昨晚说他们将继续实施空中打击。

sense.def: An airstrip is a stretch of land which has been cleared so that aircraft can take off and land.

example.ex: We landed on a grass airstrip, fifteen minutes after leaving Mahe.
example.tran: 离开马埃15分钟后，我们降落在一个临时草地机场上。

sense.def: An air terminal is a building in which passengers wait before they get on to an aeroplane.
If a container is airtight, its lid fits so tightly that no air can get in or out.
sense.tran: 不透气的；气密的；密封的

example.ex: Store the cookies in an airtight tin.
example.tran: 将曲奇饼干存放于密封罐中。

sense.def: An airtight alibi, case, argument, or agreement is one that has been so carefully put together that nobody will be able to find a fault in it.
sense.tran: （不在场证据或案件、契约、论据）无懈可击的，没有漏洞的，严密的

example.ex: Mick had an airtight alibi.
example.tran: 米克有确凿的不在场证据。

entry.boxr: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 watertight

sense.def: The airtime that something gets is the amount of time taken up with broadcasts about it.

example.ex: Even the best women's teams get little air time...
example.tran: 就算是最优秀的女子队，上广播的时间都非常少。

example.ex: They devoted their entire airtime to covering the storm.
example.tran: 他们一直在全程播报这场暴风雨。

sense.def: Air-to-air combat is a battle between military aeroplanes where rockets or bullets are fired at one aeroplane from another.
sense.tran: （战役）空对空的，空中飞机对空中飞机的

example.ex: ...air-to-air missiles.
example.tran: 空对空导弹

sense.def: Air traffic control is the activity of organizing the routes that aircraft should follow, and telling pilots by radio which routes they should take.

example.ex: ...the nation's overburdened air-traffic-control system.
example.tran: 该国超负荷的空中交通管制系统

sense.def: Air traffic control is the group of people who organize the routes aircraft take.

example.ex: They have to wait for clearance from air traffic control.
example.tran: 他们需要等空中交通管制人员的放行。

sense.def: An air traffic controller is someone whose job is to organize the routes that aircraft should follow, and to tell pilots by radio which routes they should take.
sense.tran: 空中交通管制员;空管员

sense.def: The airwaves is used to refer to the activity of broadcasting on radio and television. For example, if someone says something over the airwaves, they say it on the radio or television.

example.ex: The election campaign has been fought not in street rallies but on the airwaves...
example.tran: 此次竞选大战不是以街头集会的方式进行，而是通过电视和广播一决胜负。

example.ex: The song was banned from the airwaves.
example.tran: 这首歌曲被禁止在电台或电视台播放。

sense.def: Airwaves are the radio waves which are used in radio and television broadcasting.
A person's airways are the passages from their nose and mouth down to their lungs, through which air enters and leaves their body.

example.ex: ...an inflammation of the airways.
example.tran: 呼吸道炎症

sense.def: The airways are all the routes that planes can travel along.

example.ex: How does a private pilot get access to the airways?
example.tran: 私人飞行员如何进入航空路线呢？

sense.def: Airways means the same as airwaves .

example.ex: The interview went out over the airways.
example.tran: 采访通过电台和电视台播出。

sense.def: An airwoman is a woman who flies aircraft, especially one who serves in her country's air force.
sense.tran: 女飞行员；（尤指）空军女兵

sense.def: If an aircraft is airworthy, it is safe to fly.

example.ex: The mechanics work hard to keep the helicopters airworthy.
example.tran: 机修工努力维持直升机的飞行性能。

example.ex: All our aircraft have certificates of airworthiness.
example.tran: 我们所有的飞机都有适航证书。

sense.def: If a building or room is airy, it has a lot of fresh air inside, usually because it is large.

example.ex: The bathroom has a light and airy feel.
example.tran: 浴室给人以明亮通风之感。

sense.def: You can use airy to describe someone's behaviour when they are light-hearted and casual about things which some people take seriously.
sense.tran: 轻率的；轻浮的；非真诚的

example.ex: Giving them an airy wave of his hand, the Commander sailed past.
example.tran: 这位海军中校随意地朝他们挥挥手便扬帆而过。

example.ex: 'I'll be all right,' he said airily. 'It was only a thought.'
example.tran: “我会没事的，”他漫不经心地说，“那只是想想而已。”

sense.def: If you describe someone's ideas as airy-fairy, you are critical of them because you think the ideas are vague, impractical, and unrealistic.
sense.tran: 虚幻的；不切实际的；不现实的

example.ex: ...their airy-fairy principles.
example.tran: 他们不切实际的准则

sense.def: An aisle is a long narrow gap that people can walk along between rows of seats in a public building such as a church or between rows of shelves in a supermarket.
sense.tran: （教堂等公共建筑物里座席间或超市货架间的）纵直通道，走道

example.ex: He started down the centre aisle.
example.tran: 他从中间过道开始往前走。

example.ex: ...the frozen food aisle.
example.tran: 冷冻食物通道

sense.def: The aisle is used in expressions such as walking down the aisle to refer to the activity of getting married.
sense.tran: （用于walking down the aisle等短语中）行婚礼的仪式

example.ex: He was in no hurry to walk down the aisle.
example.tran: 他并不急于结婚。

sense.def: If a door is ajar, it is slightly open.

example.ex: He left the door ajar in case I needed him.
example.tran: 他虚掩房门，以防我会需要他。

sense.def: aka is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'also known as'. aka is used especially when referring to someone's nickname or stage name.
sense.tran: （尤指某人的昵称或艺名）又名，亦称

example.ex: ...the writer Barbara Vine, aka Ruth Rendell.
example.tran: 作家芭芭拉·瓦因，又名露丝·伦德尔

sense.def: If you stand arms akimbo or with arms akimbo, you stand with your hands on your hips and your elbows pointing outwards.
If one thing is akin to another, it is similar to it in some way.

example.ex: Listening to his life story is akin to reading a good adventure novel.
example.tran: 听他的人生故事犹如阅读一本精彩的冒险小说。

sense.def: If you do something à la a particular person, you do it in the same style or in the same way that they would do it.

example.ex: ...a crisp, tailored dress à la Audrey Hepburn.
example.tran: 仿照奥黛丽·赫本风格的面料挺括、裁剪合体的连衣裙

sense.def: Alabaster is a white stone that is used for making statues, vases, and ornaments.
sense.tran: 雪花石膏（用于雕塑及装饰）

example.ex: ...four carved alabaster figures of maidens.
example.tran: 四座雪花石膏雕刻的少女像

sense.def: If you say that someone has alabaster skin, you mean that their skin is very beautiful because it is so white and smooth.

example.ex: She wore a fine chain about her alabaster neck.
example.tran: 她细腻光滑、美丽白皙的脖子上戴着一条精致的链子。

sense.def: An à la carte menu in a restaurant offers you a choice of individually priced dishes for each course.
sense.tran: （菜单）可供单点的，可随意点的

example.ex: You could choose as much or as little as you wanted from an à la carte menu.
example.tran: 你可以从单点菜单上随意点自己想要的量。

posc.def: à la carte is also an adverb.

example.ex: A set meal is £6, or you can eat à la carte.
example.tran: 套餐价格为6英镑，你也可以根据菜单单点。

sense.def: If you do something with alacrity, you do it quickly and eagerly.

example.ex: As you can imagine, I accepted with alacrity.
example.tran: 你可以想象得到，我欣然接受了。

sense.hdgr:
oft
with/in N, N
over/about n
sense.def: Alarm is a feeling of fear or anxiety that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen.

example.ex: The news was greeted with alarm by MPs...
example.tran: 得知这个消息，议员们忧心忡忡。

example.ex: She sat up in alarm...
example.tran: 她惊慌得坐了起来。

example.ex: The moves reflect growing alarm over recent events.
example.tran: 这些举动表明人们愈加担心最近发生的事件。

sense.def: If something alarms you, it makes you afraid or anxious that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen.

example.ex: We could not see what had alarmed him.
example.tran: 我们搞不明白是什么使他忧虑不安。

sense.def: An alarm is an automatic device that warns you of danger, for example by ringing a bell.

example.ex: He heard the alarm go off.
example.tran: 他听见警报响了。

example.ex: ...an extremely sophisticated alarm system...
example.tran: 极其先进的警报系统

example.ex: The other man rang the alarm bell.
example.tran: 另一名男子按响了警铃。

sense.def: An alarm is the same as an alarm clock .

phrase.def: If you say that something sets alarm bells ringing, you mean that it makes people feel worried or concerned about something.

example.ex: This has set the alarm bells ringing in Moscow...
example.tran: 这已给莫斯科拉响了警报。

example.ex: Alarm bells are beginning to sound at Westminster.
example.tran: 威斯敏斯特的警钟已开始敲响。

phrase.def: If you raise the alarm or sound the alarm, you warn people of danger.

example.ex: His family raised the alarm when he had not come home by 9pm.
example.tran: 等到晚上9点他还未回家，他的家人便报警了。

sense.def: An alarm clock is a clock that you can set to make a noise so that it wakes you up at a particular time.

example.ex: I set my alarm clock for 4.30.
example.tran: 我把闹钟定在4点半。

sense.hdgr:
usu v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
by/at n
sense.def: If someone is alarmed, they feel afraid or anxious that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen.

example.ex: They should not be too alarmed by the press reports...
example.tran: 对于新闻报道他们不应过于担心。

example.ex: The Americans are alarmed at this prospect.
example.tran: 美国人对于这样的前景表示忧虑。

sense.def: Something that is alarming makes you feel afraid or anxious that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen.
sense.tran: 使人惊恐的；令人忧虑的；让人担心的

example.ex: The disease has spread at an alarming rate.
example.tran: 这种病以惊人的速度传播开来。

example.ex: ...the alarming increase in crime.
example.tran: 令人忧虑的犯罪攀升现象

example.ex: ...the alarmingly high rate of heart disease.
example.tran: 高得令人担心的心脏病发病率

sense.def: Someone or something that is alarmist causes unnecessary fear or anxiety that something unpleasant or dangerous is going to happen.
sense.tran: 轻事重报的；危言耸听的；杞人忧天的

example.ex: Contrary to the more alarmist reports, he is not going to die.
example.tran: 那些更加危言耸听的报道说他生命垂危，但事实并非如此。

sense.def: An alarmist is someone who causes unnecessary fear or anxiety that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen.
sense.tran: 轻事重报的人；危言耸听的人；杞人忧天的人

sense.def: You use alas to say that you think that the facts you are talking about are sad or unfortunate.

example.ex: Such scandals have not, alas, been absent...
example.tran: 这样的丑事，唉，也不是没有。

example.ex: Alas, it's not that simple.
example.tran: 哎呀，事情不是那么简单的。

sense.def: Albanian means belonging or relating to Albania, its people, language, or culture.
sense.tran: 阿尔巴尼亚的；阿尔巴尼亚人的；阿尔巴尼亚语的；阿尔巴尼亚文化的

example.ex: Her parents were Albanian.
example.tran: 她的父母是阿尔巴尼亚人。

example.ex: ...the Albanian coast.
example.tran: 阿尔巴尼亚海岸

sense.def: An Albanian is an Albanian citizen or a person of Albanian origin.
sense.tran: 阿尔巴尼亚人;阿尔巴尼亚裔人

sense.def: Albanian is the language spoken by people who live in Albania.
An albatross is a very large white seabird.
If you describe something or someone as an albatross around your neck, you mean that they cause you great problems from which you cannot escape, or they prevent you from doing what you want to do.
sense.tran: 沉重的负担；无法摆脱的苦恼；障碍

example.ex: Privatization could become a political albatross for the ruling party.
example.tran: 私有化可能会成为该执政党一个难以摆脱的政治障碍。

sense.def: You use albeit to introduce a fact or comment which reduces the force or significance of what you have just said.

example.ex: Charles's letter was indeed published, albeit in a somewhat abbreviated form.
example.tran: 尽管有所删节，查尔斯的信确实被刊登出来了。

sense.def: An albino is a person or animal with very white skin, white hair, and pink eyes.

example.ex: ...an albino rabbit.
example.tran: 患白化病的兔子

sense.def: An album is a record with about 25 minutes of music on each side. You can also refer to a collection of songs that is available on a record, cassette, or CD as an album .

example.ex: Chris likes music and has a large collection of albums and cassettes.
example.tran: 克里斯喜欢音乐，收集了大量的唱片和磁带。

sense.def: An album is a book in which you keep things such as photographs or stamps that you have collected.
sense.tran: （用于保存照片、邮票等的）专册，专辑簿

example.ex: Theresa showed me her photo album.
example.tran: 特雷莎给我看她的相册。

sense.def: Albumen is the same as albumin .
Albumin is a protein that is found in blood plasma, egg white, and some other substances.
Alchemical means relating to the science of alchemy.

example.ex: ...alchemical experiments.
example.tran: 炼金实验

example.ex: ...Ruland's Alchemical Dictionary.
example.tran: 《鲁兰炼金字典》

sense.def: An alchemist was a scientist in the Middle Ages who tried to discover how to change ordinary metals into gold.
Alchemy was a form of chemistry studied in the Middle Ages, which was concerned with trying to discover ways to change ordinary metals into gold.
Alchemy is the power to change or create things in a way which seems mysterious and magical.

example.ex: Let us imagine that by some political alchemy it had been possible to make all men equal.
example.tran: 让我们想象通过某种政治魔力能使人人平等。

sense.def: Drinks that can make people drunk, such as beer, wine, and whisky, can be referred to as alcohol .

example.ex: Do either of you smoke cigarettes or drink alcohol?...
example.tran: 你们俩有人吸烟或喝酒吗？

example.ex: No alcohol is allowed on the premises.
example.tran: 场内禁止带酒。

sense.def: Alcohol is a colourless liquid that is found in drinks such as beer, wine, and whisky. It is also used in products such as perfumes and cleaning fluids.

example.ex: ...low-alcohol beer...
example.tran: 低醇啤酒

example.ex: Products for dry skin have little or no alcohol.
example.tran: 用于干性皮肤的产品含酒精较少或不含酒精。

sense.def: An alcoholic is someone who cannot stop drinking large amounts of alcohol, even when this is making them ill.

example.ex: He showed great courage by admitting that he is an alcoholic.
example.tran: 他以极大的勇气承认自己酗酒。

sense.def: Alcoholic drinks are drinks that contain alcohol.

example.ex: ...the serving of alcoholic drinks.
example.tran: 供应含酒精的饮料

example.ex: ...tea, coffee, and alcoholic beverages.
example.tran: 茶、咖啡和酒类

sense.def: People who suffer from alcoholism cannot stop drinking large quantities of alcohol.

example.ex: ...the problems of alcoholism.
example.tran: 酗酒的问题

sense.def: An alcove is a small area of a room which is formed by one part of a wall being built further back than the rest of the wall.

example.ex: In the alcoves on either side of the fire were bookshelves.
example.tran: 火炉两边的凹室里是书架。

sense.def: If you cook pasta or a vegetable until it is al dente, you cook it just long enough so that it is neither hard nor soft but is firm and slightly chewy.
sense.tran: （面点或蔬菜）有嚼头的，软硬适中的

sense.def: An alder is a species of tree or shrub that grows especially in cool, damp places and loses its leaves in winter.
In some parts of the United States and Canada, an alderman is a member of the governing body of a city.
sense.tran: （美国和加拿大部分地区的）市政委员会委员

sense.def: Until 1974 in England and Wales, an alderman was a senior member of a local council who was elected by other councillors.
sense.tran: （1974年以前英格兰和威尔士的）高级市政官

sense.def: Ale is a kind of strong beer.
sense.tran: 麦芽酒（一种酒精含量较高的啤酒）

example.ex: ...our selection of ales and spirits.
example.tran: 我们可供选择的麦芽酒和烈性酒

sense.def: An alehouse is a pub.
If you are alert, you are paying full attention to things around you and are able to deal with anything that might happen.
sense.tran: 警觉的；警惕的；留神的；机敏的

example.ex: We all have to stay alert...
example.tran: 我们大家都必须保持警惕。

example.ex: He had been spotted by an alert neighbour.
example.tran: 一个警觉的邻居发现了他。

example.ex: The drug improved mental alertness.
example.tran: 该药有助于提神。

sense.def: If you are alert to something, you are fully aware of it.
sense.tran: 充分意识到…的;完全感觉到…的

example.ex: The bank is alert to the danger.
example.tran: 银行充分意识到了危险。

sense.def: An alert is a situation in which people prepare themselves for something dangerous that might happen soon.

example.ex: Due to a security alert, this train will not be stopping at Oxford Circus.
example.tran: 由于安全戒备的原因，该次列车在“牛津街口广场”站将不停留。

sense.def: If you alert someone to a situation, especially a dangerous or unpleasant situation, you tell them about it.
sense.tran: 向…报警；使警觉；使警惕；使注意

example.ex: He wanted to alert people to the activities of the group...
example.tran: 他想提醒人们小心该团体的活动。

example.ex: I was hoping he'd alert the police.
example.tran: 我当时希望他会报警。

phrase.def: If soldiers or police are on alert, they are ready to deal with anything that may happen.
phrase.tran: 处于警戒状态;保持戒备

example.ex: Soldiers and police have been put on alert.
example.tran: 士兵和警方都已进入警戒状态。

phrase.def: If you are on the alert for something, you are ready to deal with it if it happens.

example.ex: They want to be on the alert for similar buying opportunities.
example.tran: 他们希望随时掌握有关类似购买机会的信息。

sense.def: A levels are British educational qualifications which schoolchildren take when they are seventeen or eighteen years old. People usually need A levels if they want to go to university in Britain.
sense.tran: （英国中学生17或18岁时参加的）高级程度考试；高级程度考试证书

example.ex: He left school with four A levels...
example.tran: 他中学毕业时通过了4门高级程度考试。

example.ex: Laura is taking A levels next summer in theatre and religious studies.
example.tran: 明年暑假劳拉将参加戏剧和宗教研究两门课的高级程度考试。
