sense.def: Alfalfa is a plant that is used for feeding farm animals. The shoots that develop from its seeds are sometimes eaten as a vegetable.
An alfresco activity, especially a meal, is one that takes place in the open air.

example.ex: ... an al fresco breakfast of fresh fruit.
example.tran: 以新鲜水果为主的露天早餐

example.ex: He came across the man shaving alfresco.
example.tran: 他碰见那个男人正在外面刮胡子。

sense.def: Algae is a type of plant with no stems or leaves that grows in water or on damp surfaces.
Algal means relating to algae.

example.ex: Sewage nutrients do increase algal growth in the harbour.
example.tran: 污水中的营养物确实会加快港口的海藻生长。

sense.def: Algebra is a type of mathematics in which letters are used to represent possible quantities.
Algebraic equations, expressions, and principles are based on or use algebra.
Algerian means belonging or relating to Algeria, or its people or culture.
sense.tran: 阿尔及利亚的；阿尔及利亚人的；阿尔及利亚文化的

example.ex: ...the Algerian desert.
example.tran: 阿尔及利亚沙漠

example.ex: ...a young Algerian actor.
example.tran: 一位年轻的阿尔及利亚演员

sense.def: An Algerian is an Algerian citizen or a person of Algerian origin.
sense.tran: 阿尔及利亚人；阿尔及利亚裔人

sense.def: An algorithm is a series of mathematical steps, especially in a computer program, which will give you the answer to a particular kind of problem or question.
sense.tran: （尤指电脑程序中的）算法，运算法则

sense.def: An alias is a false name, especially one used by a criminal.

example.ex: Using an alias, he had rented a house in Fleet, Hampshire.
example.tran: 他用化名在汉普郡的舰队街租了间房子。

sense.def: You use alias when you are mentioning another name that someone, especially a criminal or an actor, is known by.
sense.tran: （尤指罪犯或演员的）别名，又名

example.ex: ...the defendant Pericles Pericleous, alias Peter Smith.
example.tran: 被告佩里克莱斯·佩里克利奥斯，又名彼得·史密斯

sense.def: If you have an alibi, you can prove that you were somewhere else when a crime was committed.
You can say that someone has an alibi when they can prove that something was not their fault.

example.ex: A role as senior diplomat would be a good alibi for his absence.
example.tran: 高级外交官的角色将是他缺席的上佳托词。

sense.def: Alien means belonging to a different country, race, or group, usually one you do not like or are frightened of.

example.ex: He said they were opposed to the presence of alien forces in the region.
example.tran: 他说他们反对外国军队驻扎在该地区。

sense.def: You use alien to describe something that seems strange and perhaps frightening, because it is not part of your normal experience.

example.ex: His work offers an insight into an alien culture.
example.tran: 他的作品能让人们对一种异域文化产生较深入的了解。

sense.def: If something is alien to you or to your normal feelings or behaviour, it is not the way you would normally feel or behave.
sense.tran: 陌生的；格格不入的；不相容的

example.ex: Such an attitude is alien to most businessmen.
example.tran: 大多数商界人士都会对这样的态度感到陌生。

sense.def: An alien is someone who is not a legal citizen of the country in which they live.

example.ex: Both women had hired illegal aliens for child care...
example.tran: 两个女人都曾雇过非法入境者照看孩子。

example.ex: When war broke out, he was interned as an enemy alien.
example.tran: 战争爆发时，他作为敌国人士遭到关押。

sense.def: In science fiction, an alien is a creature from outer space.
If you alienate someone, you make them become unfriendly or unsympathetic towards you.

example.ex: The government cannot afford to alienate either group.
example.tran: 疏远两个团体中的任何一方都是政府承受不起的。

sense.def: To alienate a person from someone or something that they are normally linked with means to cause them to be emotionally or intellectually separated from them.

example.ex: His second wife, Alice, was determined to alienate him from his two boys.
example.tran: 他的第二任妻子艾丽斯，决意要疏远他和两个儿子的感情。

rnon.hdgr:
usu v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
from n

example.ex: He felt alienated from his peers.
example.tran: 他感觉和同僚疏远了。

example.ex: ...the alienation of many from the political process...
example.tran: 许多人与政治活动脱节

example.ex: Her sense of alienation from the world disappeared.
example.tran: 她与世界脱节的感觉消失了。

sense.def: If something is alight, it is burning.

example.ex: Several buildings were set alight...
example.tran: 几幢大楼着了火。

example.ex: The gas fire was still alight.
example.tran: 燃气引起的大火还在熊熊燃烧。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
with n
sense.def: If someone's eyes are alight or if their face is alight, the expression in their eyes or on their face shows that they are feeling a strong emotion such as excitement or happiness.
sense.tran: （脸色、眼神因激动、高兴）熠熠放光的，闪闪发亮的

example.ex: Her eyes were alight with a girlish enjoyment of life...
example.tran: 她的眼睛闪闪发亮，闪烁着少女般的幸福和满足。

example.ex: She paused and turned, her face alight with happiness.
example.tran: 她停住转过身，脸上洋溢着幸福。

sense.def: If a bird or insect alights somewhere, it lands there.

example.ex: A thrush alighted on a branch of the pine tree.
example.tran: 一只鸫落在松树的树枝上。

sense.def: When you alight from a train, bus, or other vehicle, you get out of it after a journey.

example.ex: Two men alighted from the vehicle.
example.tran: 两个男人从车上下来。

sense.def: If someone alights on something, they suddenly see it, think of it, or take an interest in it.
sense.tran: 偶然发现;偶然想到;突然对…产生兴趣

example.ex: He would then suddenly alight on the tune he really wanted to play.
example.tran: 他常会在那时突然想起他真正想弹的曲子。

sense.def: If you align yourself with a particular group, you support them because you have the same political aim.

example.ex: There are signs that the prime minister is aligning himself with the liberals...
example.tran: 有迹象表明首相正在与自由党人结盟。

example.ex: He has attempted to align the Socialists with the environmental movement.
example.tran: 他已试图争取社会党人支持环境运动。

sense.def: If you align something, you place it in a certain position in relation to something else, usually parallel to it.

example.ex: A tripod will be useful to align and steady the camera...
example.tran: 三脚架有助于调准和稳定相机。

example.ex: Keep the rough edge of the fabric aligned with the raw edge of the piping.
example.tran: 将织物的毛边与滚边未经加工的边对齐。

sense.def: An alignment is support for a particular group, especially in politics, or for a side in a quarrel or struggle.

example.ex: The church should have no political alignment...
example.tran: 教会不应与政治结盟。

example.ex: His increasing alignment with the Reagan administration nearly cost him re-election.
example.tran: 与里根政府日益紧密的关系差点让他失去了连任的机会。

sense.def: The alignment of something is its position in relation to something else or to its correct position.

example.ex: ...the alignment of mirrors in the telescope.
example.tran: 校正望远镜中的镜片

sense.def: If two or more things are alike, they are similar in some way.

example.ex: We looked very alike.
example.tran: 我们长得很像。

sense.def: Alike means in a similar way.

example.ex: They even dressed alike.
example.tran: 他们甚至连穿戴都相似。

example.ex: ...their assumption that all men and women think alike.
example.tran: 他们关于所有男人和女人思考问题的方式都类似的假定

sense.def: You use alike after mentioning two or more people, groups, or things in order to emphasize that you are referring to both or all of them.

example.ex: The techniques are being applied almost everywhere by big and small firms alike.
example.tran: 无论在大公司还是小公司，这些技术的应用几乎无处不在。

sense.def: The alimentary canal in a person or animal is the passage in their body through which food passes from their mouth to their anus.
Alimony is money that a court of law orders someone to pay regularly to their former wife or husband after they have got divorced.
sense.tran: （分居或离婚后根据法院指令定期付给对方的）赡养费

example.ex: A great deal of Jeff's money went in alimony to his three former wives.
example.tran: 杰夫的很大一部分钱都用在了向他的前三任妻子支付赡养费。

sense.def: An A-list celebrity is a celebrity who is very famous indeed.

example.ex: ...an A-list Hollywood actress.
example.tran: 好莱坞人气女星

example.ex: Quinn's connections are strictly A-list.
example.tran: 奎因所交往的人都是最有名气的。

sense.def: An A-list of celebrities is a group of celebrities who are very famous indeed.
sense.tran: 最具人气的名人榜;一线明星红人榜

example.ex: ...the A-list of Hollywood stars.
example.tran: 好莱坞一线明星

sense.def: If people or animals are alive, they are not dead.

example.ex: She does not know if he is alive or dead...
example.tran: 她不知道他是生是死。

example.ex: They kept her alive on a life support machine.
example.tran: 他们用呼吸机维持她的生命。

sense.def: If you say that someone seems alive, you mean that they seem to be very lively and to enjoy everything that they do.

example.ex: Our relationship made me feel more alive...
example.tran: 我们的关系使我感到更有活力。

example.ex: I never expected to feel so alive in my life again.
example.tran: 我怎么也没想到自己会再一次这样活力焕发。

sense.def: If an activity, organization, or situation is alive, it continues to exist or function.
sense.tran: 继续存在的;在起作用的

example.ex: The big factories are trying to stay alive by cutting costs...
example.tran: 大型工厂正试图通过削减成本以维持生存。

example.ex: Both communities have a tradition of keeping history alive.
example.tran: 两个团体都有延续历史的传统。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, usu ADJ
with n
sense.def: If a place is alive with something, there are a lot of people or things there and it seems busy or exciting.

example.ex: The river was alive with birds...
example.tran: 沿河活跃着各种鸟类。

example.ex: The street was alive with the sounds of the soldiers.
example.tran: 这条街道上到处都是士兵的声音。

sense.def: If you are alive to a situation or problem, you are aware of it and realize how important it is.
sense.tran: 注意到的；意识到的；觉察到的

example.ex: You must be alive to op-portunity!...
example.tran: 你必须注意机会！

example.ex: He was alive to what he was doing.
example.tran: 他很清楚他在做什么。

phrase.def: If people, places, or events come alive, they start to be lively again after a quiet period. If someone or something brings them alive, they cause them to come alive.

example.ex: The doctor's voice had come alive and his small eyes shone.
example.tran: 医生的嗓音恢复了活力，两只小眼睛也有了神采。

example.ex: ...the songs of birds that bring the garden alive.
example.tran: 使花园恢复了生机的小鸟的鸣啭

phrase.def: If a story or description comes alive, it becomes interesting, lively, or realistic. If someone or something brings it alive, they make it seem more interesting, lively, or realistic.
phrase.tran: （使）变得生动；（使）变得有趣；（使）显得逼真

example.ex: She made history come alive with tales from her own memories...
example.tran: 通过讲述自己记忆中的故事，她把逝去的岁月变得生动起来。

example.ex: From here on he brings the character confidently alive.
example.tran: 从这里开始他真正将这个角色演活了。

phrase.def: If you say that someone will be eaten alive, you mean that they will be completely destroyed or defeated by someone who is much stronger.
phrase.tran: 将被生吞活剥；将被彻底打败

example.ex: He was certain Sid would be eaten alive by the hardened criminals in the jail.
example.tran: 他确信锡德在监狱中肯定会被那些怙恶不悛的罪犯们扒掉一层皮。

phrase.def: If you say that someone or something is alive and kicking, you are emphasizing not only that they continue to survive, but also that they are very active.
phrase.tran: 活蹦乱跳的；健壮的；活跃的

example.ex: ...worries that the secret police may still be alive and kicking.
example.tran: 担心秘密警察可能依旧在四处活动

phrase.def: If you say that someone or something is alive and well, you are emphasizing that they continue to survive.

example.ex: A man who went missing yesterday during a blizzard has been found alive and well.
example.tran: 昨天在暴风雪中失踪的一名男子已经被找到，人安然无恙。

sense.def: An alkali is a substance with a pH value of more than 7. Alkalis form chemical salts when they are combined with acids.
Something that is alkaline contains an alkali or has a pH value of more than 7.

example.ex: Some soils are actually too alkaline for certain plant life.
example.tran: 有些土壤其实碱性过强，不利于某些植物生长。

example.ex: A pH test measures the acidity or alkalinity of a substance.
example.tran: pH值测试可检测物质的酸碱度。

sense.def: You use all to indicate that you are referring to the whole of a particular group or thing or to everyone or everything of a particular kind.

example.ex: ...the restaurant that Hugh and all his friends go to...
example.tran: 休和他所有的朋友都光顾的餐馆

example.ex: He lost all his money at a blackjack table in Las Vegas.
example.tran: 在拉斯维加斯的21点纸牌桌上，他把钱输得精光。

example.ex: There is built-in storage space in all bedrooms...
example.tran: 所有的卧室都有嵌入式储藏空间。

example.ex: 85 percent of all American households owe money on mortgages...
example.tran: 85%的美国家庭背有按揭债务。

example.ex: Germany, like all great nations, will not change its personality...
example.tran: 德国，和所有伟大的国家一样，将不会改变自己的特性。

example.ex: He was passionate about all literature.
example.tran: 他热爱所有的文学作品。

example.ex: He was told to pack up all of his letters and personal belongings...
example.tran: 他被告知收拾好自己所有的信件和私人物品。

example.ex: He was talking to all of us.
example.tran: 他在对我们所有的人说话。

example.ex: We produce our own hair-care products, all based on herbal recipes...
example.tran: 我们自己生产护发产品，全部采用草本配方。

example.ex: I'd spent all I had, every last penny.
example.tran: 我已花光了所有的钱，一分不剩。

posc.def: All is also an emphasizing pronoun.

example.ex: Milk, oily fish and egg all contain vitamin D...
example.tran: 牛奶、油性鱼类和鸡蛋都含有维生素D。

example.ex: We all admire professionalism and dedication.
example.tran: 我们大家都对专业素质和奉献精神表示钦佩。

boxu.usage: All is often used to mean the same as whole but when used in front of plurals, all and whole have different meanings. For example, if you say 'All the buildings have been destroyed', you mean that every building has been destroyed. If you say 'Whole buildings have been destroyed', you mean that some buildings have been destroyed completely. Note that when all is used to consider a group, this means that the group has more than two members. To refer to two people or things, you use both. Tony and Nigel both laughed. You use every to refer to all the members of a group that has more than two members. He listened to every news bulletin. ...an equal chance for every child. You use each to refer to every person or thing in a group when you are thinking about them as individuals. Note that each can be used to refer to both members of a pair. Each apartment has two bedrooms... We each carried a suitcase. Note that each and every are only used with singular nouns.
boxu.tran: all的含义通常与whole相同，但用于复数名词前时，两者意义不同。例如，All the buildings have been destroyed 意为所有大楼都被毁了。若说Whole buildings have been destroyed 则意为一些大楼被整栋摧毁了。注意当all用来指一个团体时，该团体有两个以上的成员。若指两者，用both，例如：Tony and Nigel both laughed（托尼和奈杰尔都笑了）。every用于指包括两个以上成员的团体的所有成员：He listened to every news bulletin（每次新闻简报他都听），an equal chance for every child(所有孩子都享有的平等机会）。each用于指被视作个体的每位团体成员。注意each也可指两者中的任一个：Each apartment has two bedrooms (每套公寓都有两间卧室），We each carried a suitcase（我俩每人拎一个箱子）。注意each和every只和单数名词连用。

sense.def: You use all to refer to the whole of a particular period of time.

example.ex: George had to cut grass all afternoon...
example.tran: 乔治整个下午都得割草。

example.ex: She's been feeling bad all week.
example.tran: 她整整一周都感觉很糟糕。

example.ex: She's worked all her life...
example.tran: 她工作了一辈子。

example.ex: He was looking at me all the time.
example.tran: 他一直看着我。

example.ex: He spent all of that afternoon polishing the silver...
example.tran: 他那天整个下午都在擦拭银器具。

example.ex: Two-thirds of the women interviewed think about food a lot or all of the time.
example.tran: 2/3的被访女性表示自己经常或总是要考虑吃什么的问题。

sense.def: You use all to refer to a situation or to life in general.

example.ex: All is silent on the island now...
example.tran: 此时岛上一片沉寂。

example.ex: As you'll have read in our news pages, all has not been well of late.
example.tran: 正如你会从我们的新闻版面中看到的一样，最近一切都不太顺利。

sense.def: You use all to emphasize that something is completely true, or happens everywhere or always, or on every occasion.
sense.tran: （用于强调真实性或普遍性）完全，遍及，一直

example.ex: He loves animals and he knows all about them...
example.tran: 他热爱动物并且对它们了如指掌。

example.ex: Parts for the aircraft will be made all round the world...
example.tran: 这架飞机的部件将在世界各地制造。

example.ex: I got scared and I ran and left her all alone...
example.tran: 我一害怕就跑了，把她一个人扔下了。

example.ex: He was doing it all by himself...
example.tran: 他独自一人在做那件事。

example.ex: All around he could hear people calling out his name.
example.tran: 他听见人们在四周喊着他的名字。

sense.def: You use all at the beginning of a clause when you are emphasizing that something is the only thing that is important.
sense.tran: （用于句首表示强调某事的唯一重要性）一切，全部

example.ex: He said all that remained was to agree to a time and venue...
example.tran: 他说剩下的只是商定一个时间和集会地点。

example.ex: All you ever want to do is go shopping!...
example.tran: 你想做的事就只是去购物！

example.ex: All I could say was, 'I'm sorry'.
example.tran: 我所能说的只有“对不起”。

sense.def: You use all in expressions such as in all sincerity and in all probability to emphasize that you are being sincere or that something is very likely.
sense.tran: (表示强调）非常真诚/极有可能

example.ex: In all fairness he had to admit that she was neither dishonest nor lazy...
example.tran: 公正地说，他必须承认她既没有作假也没有偷懒。

example.ex: If the pool was open, we'd in all probability still be swimming in it...
example.tran: 如果游泳池还开着，我们完全可能还在里面游泳。

example.ex: In all seriousness, there is nothing else I can do.
example.tran: 可以非常诚恳地说，我没有其他能做的。

sense.def: You can use all in front of an adjective when you want to emphasize a quality that affects someone or something temporarily.
sense.tran: （用于形容词前，强调暂时的一种特征）

example.ex: You've gone all chatty...
example.tran: 你变得真唠叨。

example.ex: He came over all dizzy when he stood up.
example.tran: 他一站起身就觉得天旋地转。

sense.def: You use all when you are talking about an equal score in a game. For example, if the score is three all, both players or teams have three points.
sense.tran: （球赛等双方得分相等时）每人，各（如three all为“三平”）

sense.def: All is used in structures such as all the more or all the better to mean even more or even better than before.
sense.tran: （用于all the more, all the better等结构中）更加，愈加

example.ex: The living room is decorated in pale colours that make it all the more airy...
example.tran: 起居室装饰成淡雅的颜色，显得更加宽敞明亮。

example.ex: 'How are you?' —'All the better for seeing you.'
example.tran: “你好吗？”—“好，看见你更好了。”

sense.def: You use all in expressions such as seen it all and done it all to emphasize that someone has had a lot of experience of something.

example.ex: ...women who have it all: career, husband and children...
example.tran: 拥有一切的女性：事业、丈夫和孩子

example.ex: Here's a man who has seen it all, tasted and heard it all.
example.tran: 这是一个已经见闻过世间万象、尝尽人间百味的人。

phrase.def: You say above all to indicate that the thing you are mentioning is the most important point.

example.ex: Above all, chairs should be comfortable...
example.tran: 椅子首先应该舒适。

example.ex: Social services departments must accept, above all, the role of the parents.
example.tran: 社会服务部门必须认可的，首先是父母的角色。

phrase.def: You use after all when introducing a statement which supports or helps explain something you have just said.

example.ex: I thought you might know somebody. After all, you're the man with connections.
example.tran: 我以为你可能认识某个重要人物。毕竟你交游甚广。

phrase.def: You use after all when you are saying that something that you thought might not be the case is in fact the case.

example.ex: I came out here on the chance of finding you at home after all...
example.tran: 我到这儿来就想碰碰运气，没想到你居然真的在家。

example.ex: The Social Democrats say they are ready after all to begin talks on joining a coalition government.
example.tran: 社会民主党人竟然说他们准备开始谈判加入联合政府了。

boxu.usage: Note that you do not use after all if you want to talk about what happens at the end of a long period, instead you use at last, finally, in the end, lastly, or last of all. You use at last or finally when you have been waiting for or expecting something for a long time. At last usually comes at the end of a sentence. The storm that had threatened came at last. Finally usually comes at the beginning of a sentence or before a verb. After another search they finally located the house. You also use finally to talk about something that is the last in a series of things. He lived in Turkey, France, Norway, and finally Mexico. You use in the end when talking about something that happens after a long time or a long process. Perhaps the police got him in the end... In the end, Peter seemed quite happy. You use lastly to talk about the last of a series of people or things. I went through the bathroom, the bedroom, and lastly the sitting room. You use last of all to emphasize that there is nobody or nothing else after the person or thing you mention. Last of all came the cat.
boxu.tran: 请注意，谈论很长一段时间之后最终发生的事时，不用after all而用at last, finally, in the end, lastly或last of all。表示经历了长久的等待或期待时用at last或finally。at last通常用于句末，例如，The storm that had threatened came at last（酝酿已久的暴风雨最终来临了）。finally通常用于句首或动词前：After another search they finally located the house（再次搜寻之后，他们终于找到了那幢房子）。finally也用于表示一系列事物的最后一件：He lived in Turkey, France, Norway, and finally Mexico (他曾在土耳其、法国、挪威生活过，最后来到了墨西哥）。in the end表示经历了较长的时间或过程之后事情才发生：Perhaps the police got him in the end（可能警方最终将他抓获了）；In the end, Peter seemed quite happy（最后，彼得似乎挺高兴的）。lastly用于谈论一连串人或事物的最后一个或一件：I went through the bathroom, the bedroom, and lastly the sitting room（我把浴室、卧室，最后还有起居室都找了个遍）。last of all用于强调所提及人或事物之后再无其他了：Last of all came the cat（最后出场的是猫）。

phrase.def: You use and all when you want to emphasize that what you are talking about includes the thing mentioned, especially when this is surprising or unusual.

example.ex: He dropped his sausage on the pavement and someone's dog ate it, mustard and all.
example.tran: 他把香肠丢在人行道上，不知是谁家的狗将香肠甚至连带芥末都吃个了精光。

phrase.def: You use all in all to introduce a summary or general statement.
phrase.tran: 总的说来；从各方面来说；总之

example.ex: We both thought that all in all it might not be a bad idea...
example.tran: 我们两人都认为总的说来它或许不是个坏主意。

example.ex: All in all, it appeared that a pretty depressing summer awaited Jones.
example.tran: 总之，等待琼斯的似乎是一个相当令人沮丧的夏天。

phrase.def: You use at all at the end of a clause to give emphasis in negative statements, conditional clauses, and questions.
phrase.tran: （用于否定句、条件句、疑问句等的句末）全然，一点，根本，究竟

example.ex: Robin never really liked him at all...
example.tran: 罗宾从未真正喜欢过他。

example.ex: There were no roads at all...
example.tran: 那儿根本没有公路。

example.ex: Surely if the woman had any decency at all, she'd have withdrawn at once...
example.tran: 当然如果这个女人懂点礼节的话，她会马上离开。

example.ex: 'Are you dizzy at all?' he asked her.
example.tran: “你是否有点儿头晕呢？”他问她。

phrase.def: All but a particular person or thing means everyone or everything except that person or thing.

example.ex: The general was an unattractive man to all but his most ardent admirers...
example.tran: 除了他那些铁杆崇拜者外，这位将军对于其他人并无吸引力。

example.ex: The plant will stand all but the worst winters out of doors.
example.tran: 除了最严寒的冬季，这种植物都能在户外生长。

phrase.def: You use all but to say that something is almost the case.

example.ex: The concrete wall that used to divide this city has now all but gone...
example.tran: 曾经将这座城市分隔开的混凝土墙现在已几乎不复存在。

example.ex: He has been all but forgotten.
example.tran: 他几乎已被人遗忘。

phrase.def: You use for all to indicate that the thing mentioned does not affect or contradict the truth of what you are saying.

example.ex: For all its faults, the film instantly became a classic.
example.tran: 尽管有缺陷，这部电影还是迅速成为了一部经典作品。

phrase.def: You use for all in phrases such as for all I know, and for all he cares, to emphasize that you do not know something or that someone does not care about something.
phrase.tran: （用于强调）我可不知道/他才不在乎呢

example.ex: For all we know, he may even not be in this country...
example.tran: 说不定他或许都已不在这个国家了。

example.ex: You can go right now for all I care.
example.tran: 你可以马上走，我才不在乎呢。

phrase.def: If you give your all or put your all into something, you make the maximum effort possible.

example.ex: He puts his all into every game.
example.tran: 每次比赛他都全力以赴。

phrase.def: In all means in total.

example.ex: In all some 15 million people live in the selected areas...
example.tran: 总共有大概1,500万人住在所选定的区域内。

example.ex: There was evidence that thirteen people in all had taken part in planning the murder.
example.tran: 有证据表明共计13人参与策划了这起谋杀。

phrase.def: If you say that you are all in, you mean that you are extremely tired.

example.ex: 'Have you eaten? — You look all in!'
example.tran: “你吃饭了吗？——你看上去累坏了！”

phrase.def: If something such as an activity is a particular price all in, that price includes everything that is offered.

example.ex: Dinner is about £25 all in.
example.tran: 正餐价格什么都算上大约为25英镑。

phrase.def: You use of all to emphasize the words 'first' or 'last', or a superlative adjective or adverb.
phrase.tran: （用于强调first, last或最高级形容词或副词）最，最为

example.ex: First of all, answer these questions...
example.tran: 首先，回答这些问题。

example.ex: Now she faces her toughest task of all.
example.tran: 现在她面临着最艰巨的任务。

phrase.def: You use of all in expressions such as of all people or of all things when you want to emphasize someone or something surprising.
phrase.tran: 在所有的人(或事物）中偏偏

example.ex: They met and fell in love in a supermarket, of all places.
example.tran: 那么多地方，他们偏偏就在超市里相遇并相爱了。

phrase.def: You use all in expressions like of all the cheek or of all the luck to emphasize how angry or surprised you are at what someone else has done or said.
phrase.tran: （用于对他人的言行表示愤怒或吃惊）真不要脸/运气真好

example.ex: Of all the lazy, indifferent, unbusinesslike attitudes to have!
example.tran: 这是多么懒惰、冷漠、不敬业的态度！

phrase.def: You use all of before a number to emphasize how small or large an amount is.

example.ex: It took him all of 41 minutes to score his first goal...
example.tran: 足足过了41分钟他才进了第一个球。

example.ex: I'm just checking up on Kim. It'll take me all of five minutes.
example.tran: 我只是要督促一下金，总共也就需要5分钟。

phrase.def: One and all means everyone present or everyone in a particular group.

example.ex: Being in charge of the National Health Service reforms did not endear him to one and all.
example.tran: 负责国民医疗服务制度改革并未使得所有人都喜欢他。

phrase.def: You use all that in statements with negative meaning when you want to weaken the force of what you are saying.
phrase.tran: （用于否定句中削弱语气）那么

example.ex: He wasn't all that older than we were...
example.tran: 他并不真比我们老多少。

example.ex: He said it would not be all that difficult to reach a peaceful conclusion to the conflict.
example.tran: 他说和平解决这一冲突并不会太困难。

phrase.def: You can say that's all at the end of a sentence when you are explaining something and want to emphasize that nothing more happens or is the case.
phrase.tran: 没别的了；就是这么回事

example.ex: 'Why do you want to know that?' he demanded.—'Just curious, that's all.'
example.tran: “你为什么想知道那件事？”他问道。——“只是好奇，仅此而已。”

example.ex: 'I had no desire to be a mother — I had a child, that's all.'
example.tran: “我不渴望当妈妈，我有一个孩子了，如此而已。”

phrase.def: You use all very well to suggest that you do not really approve of something or you think that it is unreasonable.

example.ex: It is all very well to urge people to give more to charity when they have less, but is it really fair?
example.tran: 鼓励那些自身并不富裕的人更多地投身慈善事业固然没错，但这么做真的公平吗？

sense.def: All- is added to nouns or adjectives in order to form adjectives which describe something as consisting only of the thing mentioned or as having only the quality indicated.
sense.tran: （用于名词或形容词前构成形容词）表示“全…”，“纯…”

example.ex: ...an all-star cast...
example.tran: 全明星阵容

example.ex: It is often very hard to compare all-male and all-female jobs.
example.tran: 纯男性工作和纯女性工作之间常常很难作比较。

example.ex: ...all-cotton sheeting.
example.tran: 纯棉床单布

sense.def: All- is added to present participles or adjectives in order to form adjectives which describe something as including or affecting everything or everyone.
sense.tran: （用于现在分词或形容词前构成形容词）表示“全面的”

example.ex: Nursing a demented person is an all-consuming task...
example.tran: 照顾一个精神病人是时刻都要劳神费力的苦差事。

example.ex: There are no all-embracing EC directives on race equality.
example.tran: 关于种族平等，欧盟指令也无法面面俱到。

sense.def: All- is added to nouns in order to form adjectives which describe something as being suitable for or including all types of a particular thing.
sense.tran: （用于名词前构成形容词）表示“适合各种…的”，“包含各种…的”

example.ex: He wanted to form an all-party government of national unity...
example.tran: 他想成立一个维护国家团结的多党执政政府。

example.ex: Jeans, the all-purpose denim trousers, have been around for over a hundred years.
example.tran: 牛仔裤，这种适合各种用途的斜纹粗棉布裤子，已经有一百多年历史了。

sense.def: Allah is the name of God in Islam.
sense.tran: 安拉，真主（穆斯林信奉的神）

sense.def: If you describe someone as an all-American boy or girl, you mean that they seem to have all the typical qualities that are valued by ordinary Americans, such as good looks and love of their country.

example.ex: ...the image of the standard all-American boy.
example.tran: 典型的美国男孩形象

sense.def: If you allay someone's fears or doubts, you stop them feeling afraid or doubtful.

example.ex: He did what he could to allay his wife's fears.
example.tran: 他竭尽所能来消除妻子的各种恐惧。

sense.def: The all clear is a signal that a dangerous situation, for example an air raid, has ended.
sense.tran: 险情解除的信号；警报解除的信号

example.ex: The all clear was sounded about 10 minutes after the alert was given.
example.tran: 警报发出10分钟后又响起解除的信号。

posc.def: All clear is also a convention.

example.ex: 'All clear,' Misha growled.
example.tran: “警报解除，”米莎吼道。

sense.def: If someone in authority gives you the all clear, they give you permission to continue with a plan or activity, usually after a problem has been sorted out.

example.ex: I was given the all clear by the doctor to resume playing.
example.tran: 医生准许我重新开始训练。

sense.def: You use all-comers to refer to everyone who wants to take part in an activity, especially a competition.
sense.tran: 所有来者；所有申请者；所有参赛者

example.ex: This offer is open to all comers, so long as they own a home...
example.tran: 该条件适合于有住宅的所有申请者。

example.ex: This is her second season offering residential courses for all-comers.
example.tran: 这是她给所有报名者设置的第二期住校攻读的课程。

sense.def: An allegation is a statement saying that someone has done something wrong.

example.ex: The company has denied the allegations...
example.tran: 公司否认了这些指控。

example.ex: Allegations of brutality and theft have been levelled at the army.
example.tran: 有人指责军队中存在着野蛮暴行和盗窃行为。

sense.def: If you allege that something bad is true, you say it but do not prove it.
sense.tran: （未提出证据而）断言，指称，声称

example.ex: She alleged that there was rampant drug use among the male members of the group...
example.tran: 她声称该团体中有大量的男性成员吸毒。

example.ex: The accused is alleged to have killed a man...
example.tran: 被告据称谋杀了一名男子。

example.ex: It was alleged that the restaurant discriminated against black customers.
example.tran: 据称该饭馆歧视黑人顾客。

sense.def: An alleged fact has been stated but has not been proved to be true.
sense.tran: 声称的；被断言的；涉嫌的

example.ex: They have begun a hunger strike in protest at the alleged beating.
example.tran: 他们开始绝食以抗议有人所宣称的殴打行为。

example.ex: ...a list of alleged war criminals.
example.tran: 战争嫌犯名单

example.ex: His van allegedly struck the two as they were crossing a street.
example.tran: 据称，他的货车在那两人过马路时撞上了他们。

sense.def: Your allegiance is your support for and loyalty to a particular group, person, or belief.
sense.tran: （对组织、人物、信仰的）忠诚，拥护

example.ex: My allegiance to Kendall and his company ran deep.
example.tran: 我对肯德尔及其公司的忠诚加深了。

example.ex: ...a community driven by strong ties and allegiances.
example.tran: 紧密团结、精诚合作的团体

sense.def: An allegorical story, poem, or painting uses allegory.

example.ex: Every Russian knows the allegorical novel The Master And Margarita.
example.tran: 每个俄罗斯人都知道这本寓言式小说，《大师和玛格丽特》。

sense.def: An allegory is a story, poem, or painting in which the characters and events are symbols of something else. Allegories are often moral, religious, or political.

example.ex: The book is a kind of allegory of Latin American history.
example.tran: 这本书是对拉丁美洲历史的一种讽喻。

sense.def: Allegory is the use of characters and events in a story, poem, or painting to represent other things.

example.ex: The poem's comic allegory was transparent.
example.tran: 该诗的喜剧讽喻法是显而易见的。

sense.def: An allegro is a piece of classical music that should be played quickly and in a lively way.
Alleluia means the same as hallelujah .
Something that is all-embrac-ing includes or affects everyone or everything.
sense.tran: 无所不包的；概括一切的

example.ex: His hospitality was instantaneous and all-embracing.
example.tran: 无论何时无论对谁他都是很好客的。

sense.def: An allergen is a substance that causes an allergic reaction in someone.
If you are allergic to something, you become ill or get a rash when you eat it, smell it, or touch it.

example.ex: I'm allergic to cats.
example.tran: 我对猫过敏。

sense.def: If you have an allergic reaction to something, you become ill or get a rash when you eat it, smell it, or touch it.

example.ex: Soya milk can cause allergic reactions in some children.
example.tran: 有些孩子会对豆浆过敏。

sense.def: If you say that you are allergic to something or someone, you mean that you dislike them very strongly and try to avoid them.

example.ex: He was allergic to risk.
example.tran: 他极其厌恶冒险。

sense.def: An allergist is a doctor who specializes in treating people with allergies.
If you have a particular allergy, you become ill or get a rash when you eat, smell, or touch something that does not normally make people ill.

example.ex: Food allergies can result in an enormous variety of different symptoms...
example.tran: 食物过敏会引发很多不同的症状。

example.ex: Allergy to cats is one of the commonest causes of asthma.
example.tran: 对猫类过敏是哮喘病发作最常见的诱因之一。

sense.def: If you say that you have an allergy to something or someone, you mean that you dislike them very strongly and try to avoid them.

example.ex: I developed a temporary allergy to the company of couples.
example.tran: 我一时间很反感和情侣们在一起。

sense.def: If you alleviate pain, suffering, or an unpleasant condition, you make it less intense or severe.

example.ex: Nowadays, a great deal can be done to alleviate back pain.
example.tran: 如今，减轻背部疼痛可以有许多方法。

example.ex: ...the problem of alleviating mass poverty.
example.tran: 摆脱普遍贫困的难题

example.ex: Their energies were focussed on the alleviation of the refugees' misery.
example.tran: 他们把精力集中在减轻难民们的苦难上。

sense.def: An alley is a narrow passage or street with buildings or walls on both sides.
An alley cat is a cat that lives in the streets of a town, is rather fierce, and is usually not owned by anyone.
An alleyway is the same as an alley .
An alliance is a group of countries or political parties that are formally united and working together because they have similar aims.

example.ex: The two parties were still too much apart to form an alliance.
example.tran: 两党分歧甚大，还远未能结成同盟。

sense.hdgr:
oft N
with/between n, also
in N
with n
sense.def: An alliance is a relationship in which two countries, political parties, or organizations work together for some purpose.

example.ex: What will be the effect of the alliance between IBM and Apple?...
example.tran: 若IBM公司和苹果公司联合将会有什么效果呢？

example.ex: They are now in a position to govern the state in alliance with either the Free Democrats or the Green Party.
example.tran: 他们现在可以选择与自由民主党人或绿党结盟来执掌国家政权。

sense.def: Allied forces or troops are armies from different countries who are fighting on the same side in a war.

example.ex: ...the approaching Allied forces...
example.tran: 正在到来的盟军

example.ex: They're backed by allied warplanes and tanks.
example.tran: 他们受到盟军战机和坦克的掩护。

sense.hdgr:
ADJ n, v-link ADJ
to n
sense.def: Allied countries, troops, or political parties are united by a political or military agreement.
sense.tran: （国家、军队、政党等）同盟的，结盟的

example.ex: ...forces from three allied nations.
example.tran: 来自三个同盟国的军队

example.ex: ...a think-tank allied to the right wing of the Democratic Party.
example.tran: 与民主党右翼结盟的智囊团

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ
to/with n, ADJ n
sense.def: If one thing or group is allied to another, it is related to it because the two things have particular qualities or characteristics in common.

example.ex: ...lectures on subjects allied to health, beauty and fitness...
example.tran: 与保健、美容和健身等主题相关的讲座

example.ex: Only now have doctors, and allied medical professionals, come to appreciate this.
example.tran: 直到现在医生和相关医学人士才开始对此有所认识。

sense.def: Something that is allied to another thing occurs with the other thing.

example.ex: He possessed a raw energy allied to a feeling of something special.
example.tran: 他粗犷豪放，给人一种特殊的感觉。

example.ex: ...a disastrous rise in interest rates allied with a stock market slump.
example.tran: 股市下跌的同时，利率却在灾难性地上涨

sense.def: An alligator is a large reptile with short legs, a long tail and very powerful jaws.
Alligator boots and bags are made from the skin of an alligator.

example.ex: ...alligator cowboy boots.
example.tran: 鳄鱼皮的牛仔皮靴

sense.def: All-inclusive is used to indicate that a price, especially the price of a holiday, includes all the charges and all the services offered.
sense.tran: （尤指度假的费用或价格）无所不包的，包括一切的

example.ex: An all-inclusive two-week holiday costs around £880 per person.
example.tran: 为期两周、包括所有费用的度假大约每人花费880英镑。

sense.def: Alliteration is the use in speech or writing of several words close together which all begin with the same letter or sound.
Alliterative means relating to or connected with alliteration.
sense.tran: 头韵的；以头韵法为特征的

example.ex: Her campaign slogan, 'a president for the people', was pleasantly alliterative but empty.
example.tran: 她的竞选宣传口号“服务大众的总统”虽然押了头韵，听着很悦耳，其实内容空洞。

sense.def: If one item or share of something is allocated to a particular person or for a particular purpose, it is given to that person or used for that purpose.

example.ex: Tickets are limited and will be allocated to those who apply first...
example.tran: 票数有限，先申请者先得。

example.ex: The 1985 federal budget allocated $7.3 billion for development programmes...
example.tran: 1985年的联邦预算将73亿美元拨给了开发项目。

example.gram: Also V n n, V n
example.ex: Our plan is to allocate one member of staff to handle appointments.
example.tran: 我们的计划是分派一位职员处理预约事宜。

sense.def: An allocation is an amount of something, especially money, that is given to a particular person or used for a particular purpose.
sense.tran: 分配物；分配额；（尤指）划拨款项

example.ex: The aid allocation for Pakistan was still under review...
example.tran: 拨给巴基斯坦的援助物资仍在审核当中。

example.ex: During rationing we had a sugar allocation.
example.tran: 定量配给时期，糖是限量配给的。

sense.def: The allocation of something is the decision that it should be given to a particular person or used for a particular purpose.

example.ex: His sons quarrelled bitterly over the allocation of family resources...
example.tran: 他的儿子们为家产如何分配而吵得很凶。

example.ex: Town planning and land allocation had to be coordinated.
example.tran: 必须协调城市规划和土地分配之间的关系。

sense.def: If something is allotted to someone, it is given to them as their share.

example.ex: The seats are allotted to the candidates who have won the most votes...
example.tran: 席位被分配给了赢得选票最多的候选人。

example.ex: We were allotted half an hour to address the committee.
example.tran: 给了我们半个小时向委员会作陈述。

sense.def: In Britain, an allotment is a small area of land in a town which a person rents to grow plants and vegetables on.
sense.tran: （英国城镇里租给个人种菜用的）小块园地

sense.def: An allotment of something is a share or amount of it that is given to someone.

example.ex: His meager allotment of gas had to be saved for emergencies.
example.tran: 他分到的那一点点煤气必须留着急用。

sense.def: You use all-out to describe actions that are carried out in a very energetic and determined way, using all the resources available.

example.ex: He launched an all-out attack on his critics.
example.tran: 他全力抨击批评他的人。

example.ex: ...an all-out effort to bring the fire under control.
example.tran: 全力以赴控制火势

posc.def: All out is also an adverb.

example.ex: We will be going all out to ensure it doesn't happen again.
example.tran: 我们要全力保证此事不再发生。

sense.def: If someone is allowed to do something, it is all right for them to do it and they will not get into trouble.

example.ex: The children are not allowed to watch violent TV programmes...
example.tran: 儿童不准收看含暴力内容的电视节目。

example.ex: The Government will allow them to advertise on radio and television...
example.tran: 政府将准许他们在广播和电视上做广告。

example.ex: They will be allowed home...
example.tran: 他们将获准回家。

example.ex: Smoking will not be allowed.
example.tran: 吸烟将被禁止。

sense.def: If you are allowed something, you are given permission to have it or are given it.

example.ex: Gifts like chocolates or flowers are allowed...
example.tran: 巧克力、鲜花等礼物在允许之列。

example.ex: He should be allowed the occasional treat.
example.tran: 应该准许他偶尔也轻松一下。

sense.def: If you allow something to happen, you do not prevent it.

example.ex: He won't allow himself to fail...
example.tran: 他不会任由自己失败的。

example.ex: If the soil is allowed to dry out the tree could die.
example.tran: 如果听任土壤变干，树木可能会枯死。

sense.def: If one thing allows another thing to happen, the first thing creates the opportunity for the second thing to happen.

example.ex: The compromise will allow him to continue his free market reforms.
example.tran: 妥协将使他得以继续他的自由市场改革。

example.ex: ...an attempt to allow the Moslem majority a greater share of power...
example.tran: 使穆斯林多数派拥有更大权力的尝试

example.ex: She said this would allow more effective planning.
example.tran: 她说这会为更有效的规划创造可能。

sense.def: If you allow a particular length of time or a particular amount of something for a particular purpose, you include it in your planning.

example.ex: Please allow 28 days for delivery...
example.tran: 请留出28天的送货时间。

example.ex: Allow about 75ml (3fl oz) per six servings.
example.tran: 每6份酌加约75毫升(3液盎司)。

sense.def: If you allow that something is true, you admit or agree that it is true.

example.ex: Warren also allows that capitalist development may, in its early stages, result in increased social inequality.
example.tran: 沃伦也承认资本主义发展初级阶段可能会导致社会不平等现象加剧。

sense.def: Some people say 'Allow me' as a polite way of offering to do something for someone.
sense.tran: 请允许我（用以礼貌地表示为某人提供服务）

example.ex: Allow me to buy you a drink at the bar.
example.tran: 让我来请你喝一杯。

sense.def: Some people use Allow me to... as a way of introducing something that they want to say or do.
sense.tran: 请允许我（用以引出要说的话）

example.ex: Allow me to introduce Dr Amberg.
example.tran: 请允许我介绍安伯格博士。

sense.def: If you allow for certain problems or expenses, you include some extra time or money in your planning so that you can deal with them if they occur.
sense.tran: 考虑到；将…计算在内；为…酌留余地

example.ex: You have to allow for a certain amount of error...
example.tran: 你必须将一定量的误差考虑在内。

example.ex: The Agency's budget simply did not allow for such a massive increase.
example.tran: 该机构的预算根本没有将如此大额的超支计算在内。

sense.def: If people decide that something is allowable, they let it happen without trying to stop it.
sense.tran: 可允许的；可准许的；可容许的

example.ex: Capital punishment is allowable only under exceptional circumstances.
example.tran: 只有特殊情况才允许执行死刑。

sense.def: Allowable costs or expenses are amounts of money that you do not have to pay tax on.

example.ex: Her expenses were allowable deductions.
example.tran: 她的费用开支是免税的。

sense.hdgr:
usu with supp, oft N
of amount
sense.def: An allowance is money that is given to someone, usually on a regular basis, in order to help them pay for the things that they need.

example.ex: He lives on a single parent's allowance of £70 a week...
example.tran: 他靠每周70英镑的单亲家庭生活补助过日子。

example.ex: She gets an allowance for looking after Lillian.
example.tran: 她因为照顾莉莲而拿补贴。

sense.def: A child's allowance is money that is given to him or her every week or every month by his or her parents.

entry.boxr: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 pocket money

sense.def: Your tax allowance is the amount of money that you are allowed to earn before you have to start paying income tax.

example.ex: ...those earning less than the basic tax allowance.
example.tran: 那些收入低于基本免税额的人

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 personal exemption

sense.def: A particular type of allowance is an amount of something that you are allowed in particular circumstances.

example.ex: Most of our flights have a baggage allowance of 44lbs per passenger.
example.tran: 我们大多数航班行李限重为每位乘客44磅。

phrase.hdgr:
V and N inflect, oft PHR
for n
phrase.def: If you make allowances for something, you take it into account in your decisions, plans, or actions.
phrase.tran: 考虑到；将…计算在内；为…酌留余地

example.ex: We'll make allowances in the schedule for time off...
example.tran: 日程安排时我们会把休息时间考虑在内。

example.ex: The raw exam results make no allowance for social background.
example.tran: 原始的考试成绩是不受社会背景影响的。

phrase.hdgr:
V inflects, oft PHR
for n
phrase.def: If you make allowances for someone, you accept behaviour which you would not normally accept or deal with them less severely than you would normally, because of a problem that they have.

example.ex: He's tired so I'll make allowances for him.
example.tran: 他很累，所以我会体谅他。

sense.def: An alloy is a metal that is made by mixing two or more types of metal together.

example.ex: Bronze is an alloy of copper and tin...
example.tran: 青铜是铜和锡的合金。

example.ex: The company produces titanium alloy.
example.tran: 该公司生产钛合金。

sense.def: An all-powerful person or organization has the power to do anything they want.

example.ex: ...the all-powerful labour unions.
example.tran: 无所不能的工会

sense.def: You use all-purpose to refer to things that have lots of different uses or can be used in lots of different situations.

example.ex: Use all-purpose flour if you cannot find pastry flour.
example.tran: 如果找不到面点专用粉，可以用通用面粉。

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 alright

sense.def: If you say that someone or something is all right, you mean that you find them satisfactory or acceptable.

example.ex: Is it all right with you if we go now?...
example.tran: 我们若现在就走，你同意吗？

example.ex: 'How was school?' — 'It was all right.'
example.tran: “在学校还好吗？”——“还可以。”

posc.def: All right is also used before a noun.

example.ex: He's an all right kind of guy really.
example.tran: 他这个人很不错。

sense.def: If you say that something happens or goes all right, you mean that it happens in a satisfactory or acceptable manner.

example.ex: Things have thankfully worked out all right...
example.tran: 谢天谢地，事情终于圆满解决了。

example.ex: 'Can you walk all right?' the nurse asked him.
example.tran: “你走路有困难吗？”护士问他。

sense.def: If someone or something is all right, they are well or safe.
sense.tran: 安全健康（的）；平安无恙（的）

example.ex: All she's worried about is whether he is all right...
example.tran: 她所担心的只是他是否安然无恙。

example.ex: Are you feeling all right now?
example.tran: 现在你感觉还好吗？

sense.def: If you say that something is true all right or something will happen all right, you are emphasizing that there is no doubt that it is true or that it will happen.

example.ex: It's an isolated spot all right...
example.tran: 它确实是个偏僻的地方。

example.ex: It looks like water down there all right...
example.tran: 看起来水的确流到那儿了。

example.ex: I remember him, all right.
example.tran: 我记得他，真的。

sense.def: You say 'all right' when you are agreeing to something.

example.ex: 'I think you should go now.' — 'All right.'...
example.tran: “我想你应该走了。”——“好的。”

example.ex: 'I'll explain later.' — 'All right then.'
example.tran: “我以后会作解释的。”——“那好吧。”

sense.def: You say 'all right?' after you have given an instruction or explanation to someone when you are checking that they have understood what you have just said, or checking that they agree with or accept what you have just said.

example.ex: Peter, you get half the fees. All right?...
example.tran: 彼得，你拿一半报酬。明白吗？

example.ex: I'll see you tomorrow, all right?...
example.tran: 我明天见你，好吗？

example.ex: 'We'll see what other prisoner officers think, all right?'
example.tran: “我们要了解一下其他监狱官的想法，好吗？”

sense.def: If someone in a position of authority says 'all right', and suggests talking about or doing something else, they are indicating that they want you to end one activity and start another.
sense.tran: 就这样吧，那么（表示想结束一项活动，开始另一活动）

example.ex: All right, Bob. You can go now...
example.tran: 就这样吧，鲍勃，你现在可以走了。

example.ex: All right, boys and girls, let's meet again next week.
example.tran: 就这样吧，孩子们，我们下星期再见。

sense.def: You say 'all right' during a discussion to show that you understand something that someone has just said, and to introduce a statement that relates to it.
sense.tran: 好吧（在讨论中用以表示理解对方的话并引入相关的话）

example.ex: 'I'm a bit busy now.' — 'All right, why don't I come back later?'
example.tran: “我现在有点忙。”——“好吧，我何不以后再来呢？”

sense.def: You say all right before a statement or question to indicate that you are challenging or threatening someone.
sense.tran: 唉，喂（表示责难或威胁某人）

example.ex: All right, who are you and what are you doing in my office?...
example.tran: 喂，你是谁，在我的办公室做什么？

example.ex: All right, let's stop playing games. Hand over the goods right now.
example.tran: 唉，别耍花招了。马上将货物交过来。

entry.boxr: in AM, also use 美国英语亦用 all-around

sense.def: An all-round person is good at a lot of different skills, academic subjects, or sports.
sense.tran: 全能的；多面的；多才多艺的

example.ex: He is a great all-round player.
example.tran: 他是个出色的全能运动员。

sense.def: All-round means doing or relating to all aspects of a job or activity.

example.ex: He demonstrated the all-round skills of a quarterback.
example.tran: 他展示了一个枢纽前卫非常全面的技术。

example.ex: ...if you want the best all-round quality of life.
example.tran: 如果你想要全方位最优质的生活

example.ex: ...an excellent all-round guide on how to shop for the very best foods.
example.tran: 一本关于如何买到最佳食品的全面而实用的指南

sense.def: Someone who is an all-rounder is good at a lot of different skills, academic subjects, or sports.

example.ex: I class myself as an all-rounder.
example.tran: 我将自己归为多面手。

sense.def: An all-seater stadium has enough seats for all the audience, rather than having some areas without seats where people stand.
sense.tran: （体育场）所有观众均有席位的

sense.def: If you describe something new as all-singing ,all-dancing, you mean that it is very modern and advanced, with a lot of additional features; used especially to show that you think a lot of these features are silly or unnecessary.
sense.tran: 时髦先进且功能繁多的

example.ex: ...the executive's new all-singing, all-dancing website.
example.tran: 行政部门异常花哨的新网站

sense.def: Allspice is a powder used as a spice in cooking, which is made from the berries of a tropical American tree.
sense.tran: 多香果粉（一种烹调用香料）

sense.def: An all-star cast, performance, or game is one which contains only famous or extremely good performers or players.
sense.tran: 由明星演员组成的；由明星运动员组成的；全明星的

sense.def: You use all-time when you are comparing all the things of a particular type that there have ever been. For example, if you say that something is the all-time best, you mean that it is the best thing of its type that there has ever been.
sense.tran: 迄今最…的；空前的；创纪录的

example.ex: The president's popularity nationally is at an all-time low...
example.tran: 总统在全国的人气目前正处于历史最低点。

example.ex: Duane Eddy is John Peel's all-time favourite artist.
example.tran: 杜安·艾迪是约翰·皮尔迄今最喜欢的艺术家。

sense.def: If you allude to something, you mention it in an indirect way.

example.ex: She also alluded to her rival's past marital troubles.
example.tran: 她还影射了对手过去的婚姻问题。

sense.def: The allure of something or someone is the pleasing or exciting quality that they have.

example.ex: It's a game that has really lost its allure.
example.tran: 这是一项的确已失去了魅力的游戏。

example.ex: ...the captivating allure of Isabelle Adjani.
example.tran: 伊莎贝拉·阿佳妮令人倾倒的魅力

sense.def: Someone or something that is alluring is very attractive.

example.ex: Why are the contents of the next person's shopping trolley always more alluring than one's own?
example.tran: 为什么旁边人购物车里的东西看起来总是比自己车里的更诱人呢？

example.ex: ...the most alluring city in South-East Asia.
example.tran: 东南亚地区最迷人的城市

example.ex: She turned and smiled alluringly at Douglas.
example.tran: 她转过身对道格拉斯报以迷人的一笑。

sense.def: An allusion is an indirect reference to someone or something.
sense.tran: 间接提到；暗指；影射；典故

example.ex: The title is perhaps an allusion to AIDS.
example.tran: 该题目可能暗指艾滋病。

sense.def: Allusive speech, writing, or art is full of indirect references to people or things.
sense.tran: 间接提到的；暗指的；影射的；含典故的

example.ex: His new play, Arcadia, is as intricate, elaborate and allusive as anything he has yet written.
example.tran: 他的新剧《阿卡迪亚》和他写过的任何作品一样，错综复杂、构思精巧并且富含典故。

sense.def: Alluvial soils are soils which consist of earth and sand left behind on land which has been flooded or where a river once flowed.
All-weather sports take place on an artificial surface instead of on grass.
sense.tran: 人工赛场上的;全天候的

example.ex: ...all-weather racing.
example.tran: 人工赛道上举行的赛马

example.ex: ...an all-weather tennis court.
example.tran: 全天候网球场

entry.boxr: The noun is pronounced /'ælaɪ/. The verb is pronounced /ə'laɪ/. 名词读作/'ælaɪ/，动词读作/ə'laɪ/。

sense.def: A country's ally is another country that has an agreement to support it, especially in war.

example.ex: Washington would not take such a step without its allies' approval...
example.tran: 没有盟国的同意，华盛顿将不会采取这样一种行动。

example.ex: The United States is a close ally of South Korea.
example.tran: 美国是韩国的亲密盟友。

sense.def: The Allies were the armed forces that fought against Germany and Japan in the Second World War.
sense.tran: （第二次世界大战时的）同盟国

sense.def: If you describe someone as your ally, you mean that they help and support you, especially when other people are opposing you.

example.ex: He is a close ally of the Prime Minister...
example.tran: 他是首相的亲密支持者。

example.ex: She will regret losing a close political ally.
example.tran: 她将为失去一个亲密的政治盟友而懊悔。

sense.def: If you ally yourself with someone or something, you give your support to them.

example.ex: He will have no choice but to ally himself with the new movement.
example.tran: 他除了与新运动结盟别无选择。

sense.def: Your alma mater is the school or university which you went to.
A school or college's alma mater is its official song.
An almanac is a book published every year which contains information about the movements of the planets, the changes of the moon and the tides, and the dates of important anniversaries.
An almanac is a book published every year which contains information about events connected with a particular subject or activity, and facts and statistics about that activity.
The Almighty is another name for God. You can also refer to Almighty God .
sense.tran: 全能者（指上帝）；全能的上帝

example.ex: Adam sought guidance from the Almighty...
example.tran: 亚当寻求上帝的指引。

example.ex: Let us now confess our sins to Almighty God.
example.tran: 现在让我们向上帝忏悔我们的罪恶。

sense.def: People sometimes say God Almighty or Christ Almighty to express their surprise, anger, or horror. These expressions could cause offence.
sense.tran: （表示惊奇、愤怒或恐惧，可能具冒犯意味）上帝呀，耶稣呀

sense.def: Almighty means very serious or great in extent.

example.ex: I had the most almighty row with the waitress...
example.tran: 我和女招待大吵了一架。

example.ex: I heard an almighty bang.
example.tran: 我听到一声巨响。

sense.def: Almonds are pale oval nuts. They are often used in cooking.

example.ex: ...sponge cake flavoured with almonds.
example.tran: 加入杏仁的松糕

sense.def: An almond or an almond tree, is a tree on which almonds grow.

example.ex: On the left was a plantation of almond trees.
example.tran: 左边是一个杏树园。

example.ex: ...groves of almond and cherry.
example.tran: 杏树和樱桃树果园

sense.def: In Britain, an almoner is a social worker who works in a hospital.
You use almost to indicate that something is not completely the case but is nearly the case.

example.ex: The couple had been dating for almost three years...
example.tran: 这对情侣相恋已近3年。

example.ex: Storms have been hitting almost all of Britain recently...
example.tran: 最近几乎整个英国都受到了暴风雨的侵袭。

example.ex: The effect is almost impossible to describe...
example.tran: 这种影响几乎无法用言语描述。

example.ex: He was almost as tall as Pete, but skinnier...
example.tran: 他和皮特差不多高，但更瘦。

example.ex: The arrested man will almost certainly be kept at this police station...
example.tran: 几乎可以肯定，被逮捕的男子将被扣押在该警察局。

example.ex: He contracted Spanish flu, which almost killed him.
example.tran: 他得了西班牙流感，险些丧命。

sense.def: Alms are gifts of money, clothes, or food to poor people.

example.ex: Alms were distributed to those in need.
example.tran: 救济品被分发给困难人群。

sense.def: Almshouses are houses in Britain which were built and run by charities to provide accommodation for poor or old people who could not afford to pay rent.
Aloe vera is a substance that contains vitamins and minerals and is often used in cosmetics. Aloe vera is also the name of the plant from which this substance is extracted.
sense.tran: 芦荟叶汁（常用于化妆品）；芦荟

sense.def: Something that is aloft is in the air or off the ground.

example.ex: He held the trophy proudly aloft.
example.tran: 他自豪地高举起奖杯。

example.ex: Four of the nine starting balloons were still aloft the next day.
example.tran: 9个开幕气球第二天还有4个飘在空中。

sense.def: When you are alone, you are not with any other people.

example.ex: There is nothing so fearful as to be alone in a combat situation...
example.tran: 没有比孤身奋战更可怕的了。

example.ex: He was all alone in the middle of the hall.
example.tran: 他独自一人在大厅中间。

example.ex: She has lived alone in this house for almost five years now...
example.tran: 她已在这所房子里独自住了近5年。

example.ex: He was sitting alone at a table in a wine bar, smoking a big cigar.
example.tran: 他独自一人坐在酒吧的一张桌旁，抽着一支大雪茄。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
with n
sense.def: If one person is alone with another person, or if two or more people are alone, they are together, without anyone else present.
sense.tran: 单独的（无其他人在场的）

example.ex: I couldn't imagine why he would want to be alone with me...
example.tran: 我想象不出为什么他会想和我独处。

example.ex: My brother and I were alone with Vincent.
example.tran: 我和弟弟与文森特单独呆着。

sense.def: If you say that you are alone or feel alone, you mean that nobody who is with you, or nobody at all, cares about you.
sense.tran: 孤苦伶仃的;无依无靠的；孤单的

example.ex: Never in her life had she felt so alone, so abandoned...
example.tran: 她一生中从来没有感到如此孤单，如此无助。

example.ex: He found himself alone in a hostile world.
example.tran: 他感到自己处在一个充满敌意的环境中，孤立无援。

sense.def: You say that one person or thing alone does something when you are emphasizing that only one person or thing is involved.

example.ex: You alone should determine what is right for you...
example.tran: 只有你自己才能决定什么适合你。

example.ex: They were convicted on forensic evidence alone.
example.tran: 仅凭着法医证据，他们就被判有罪。

sense.def: If you say that one person or thing alone is responsible for part of an amount, you are emphasizing the size of that part and the size of the total amount.
sense.tran: 单单（强调部分或整体的数量）

example.ex: The BBC alone is sending 300 technicians, directors and commentators...
example.tran: 单单英国广播公司就派出技术人员、导演、解说员等一行300人。

example.ex: Megastars like Jack Nicholson, who made $500 million from Batman alone, are unlikely to be affected.
example.tran: 像杰克·尼科尔森这样的巨星，单从《蝙蝠侠》一部片子中就赚了5亿美元，是不太可能受影响的。

sense.def: If someone is alone in doing something, they are the only person doing it, and so are different from other people.

example.ex: Newcastle is far from alone. Colleges around the country have developed programmes of student support...
example.tran: 远不止是纽卡斯尔，全国的许多大学都推出了助学项目。

example.ex: Am I alone in thinking that this scandal should finish his career?
example.tran: 只有我认为这件丑闻会断送他的事业吗？

example.ex: Alone among the major candidates, Gaviria expressed a determination to continue the campaign to defeat the drugs cartels...
example.tran: 在主要的候选人中，只有加维里亚一人坚决表示要继续打击药品同业联盟。

example.ex: I alone was sane, I thought, in a world of crazy people.
example.tran: 我认为，在一群疯子的世界里只有我自己是理性的。

sense.def: When someone does something alone, they do it without help from other people.

example.ex: Bringing up a child alone should give you a sense of achievement...
example.tran: 自己一个人带大孩子会给你一种成就感。

example.ex: He was working alone and did not have an accomplice.
example.tran: 他在单干，没有同伙。

sense.def: If you go it alone, you do something without any help from other people.

example.ex: I missed the stimulation of working with others when I tried to go it alone.
example.tran: 当我试图单干时，我很怀念与他人一起工作的那股兴奋劲。

xrse.def: to leave someone or something alone

boxx.note: In addition to the uses shown below, along is used in phrasal verbs such as ‘go along with’, ‘play along’, and ‘string along’.
boxx.tran: 除下列用法外，along 还可用于go along with, play along 和 string along 等短语动词中。

sense.def: If you move or look along something such as a road, you move or look towards one end of it.

example.ex: Newman walked along the street alone...
example.tran: 纽曼独自走在街上。

example.ex: The young man led Mark Ryle along a corridor...
example.tran: 那个年轻人领着马克·赖尔沿走廊而去。

example.ex: I looked along the length of the building.
example.tran: 我的视线掠过整幢大楼。

sense.def: If something is situated along a road, river, or corridor, it is situated in it or beside it.

example.ex: ...enormous traffic jams all along the roads.
example.tran: 马路上严重的交通阻塞

example.ex: ...houses built on piles along the river...
example.tran: 沿河打桩盖的房子

example.ex: Along each wall stretched green metal filing cabinets.
example.tran: 绿色金属文件柜靠着各面墙依次排开。

sense.def: When someone or something moves along, they keep moving in a particular direction.

example.ex: She skipped and danced along...
example.tran: 她蹦蹦跳跳地往前走着。

example.ex: He raised his voice a little, talking into the wind as they walked along...
example.tran: 他们往前走时，他略微提高了嗓音，迎着风说话。

example.ex: The wide road was blocked solid with traffic that moved along sluggishly.
example.tran: 宽阔的马路被缓慢前行的车辆堵得严严实实。

sense.def: If you say that something is going along in a particular way, you mean that it is progressing in that way.

example.ex: ...the negotiations which have been dragging along interminably...
example.tran: 一直在无休止拖延的谈判

example.ex: Everything was coming along fine after all...
example.tran: 一切居然进行得很顺利。

example.ex: My life is going along nicely.
example.tran: 我的生活一帆风顺。

sense.def: If you take someone or something along when you go somewhere, you take them with you.

example.ex: This is open to women of all ages, so bring along your friends and colleagues...
example.tran: 这对所有年龄段的女性开放，所以请带上你的朋友和同事一起光临。

example.ex: Wives will have to bring along their marriage certificate.
example.tran: 已婚妇女必须携带结婚证。

sense.def: If someone or something is coming along or is sent along, they are coming or being sent to a particular place.

example.ex: She invited everyone she knew to come along...
example.tran: 她邀请了每一个她认识的人前来。

example.ex: He had the material tested and sent along the results.
example.tran: 他对材料做了检验并送出了检验结果。

sense.def: You use along with to mention someone or something else that is also involved in an action or situation.

example.ex: The baby's mother escaped from the fire along with two other children...
example.tran: 婴儿的母亲和另外两个孩子一起逃离了火海。

example.ex: There are 32 different kinds of chocolate on sale along with the bread and cakes.
example.tran: 有32种不同的巧克力与面包和蛋糕一起出售。

sense.hdgr: PHR with cl, PHR after v
sense.def: If something has been true or been present all along, it has been true or been present throughout a period of time.

example.ex: I've been fooling myself all along...
example.tran: 我一直在欺骗自己。

example.ex: I think she had been planning all along to leave Hungary.
example.tran: 我想她一直在计划离开匈牙利。

sense.def: If one thing is alongside another thing, the first thing is next to the second.
sense.tran: 在…旁边；沿着…的边；与…并排靠拢

example.ex: He crossed the street and walked alongside Central Park...
example.tran: 他穿过街道，沿着中央公园走。

example.ex: Much of the industry was located alongside rivers.
example.tran: 许多工厂都设在河边。

example.ex: He waited several minutes for a car to pull up alongside.
example.tran: 他等了几分钟，直到一辆汽车靠边停下。

sense.def: If you work alongside other people, you all work together in the same place.

example.ex: He had worked alongside Frank and Mark and they had become friends...
example.tran: 他与弗兰克和马克一起工作过，并且成了朋友。

example.ex: Men aged 60 are fighting alongside young boys.
example.tran: 年届六十的男人们和少年小伙们并肩作战。

sense.def: If one thing exists or develops alongside another, the two things exist or develop together at the same time.

example.ex: Her self-confidence will develop alongside her technique...
example.tran: 随着她的技术不断提高，她会愈发自信。

example.ex: Alongside the Job Creation Programme they launched a Work Experience Programme.
example.tran: 在开展创造就业项目的同时，他们还启动了工作经历项目。

sense.def: Someone who is aloof is not very friendly and does not like to spend time with other people.

example.ex: He seemed aloof and detached.
example.tran: 他显得冷漠离群。

example.ex: He had an air of aloofness about him.
example.tran: 他给人一种冷冰冰的感觉。

sense.def: If someone stays aloof from something, they do not become involved with it.

example.ex: The Government is keeping aloof from the controversy...
example.tran: 政府对争论保持置身事外的态度。

example.ex: I will hold myself aloof from wrong and corruption.
example.tran: 我会让自己远离错误和腐败。

sense.def: When you say something, read, or laugh aloud, you speak or laugh so that other people can hear you.

example.ex: When we were children, our father read aloud to us...
example.tran: 我们小的时候，父亲会给我们朗读。

example.ex: 'You fool,' he said aloud.
example.tran: “你这个傻瓜，”他大声说。

sense.def: If you think aloud, you express your thoughts as they occur to you, rather than thinking first and then speaking.
sense.tran: 说话不加思索；说话不经大脑

example.ex: He really must be careful about thinking aloud. Who knew what he might say?
example.tran: 他的确该注意自己说话不经思索的问题。谁知道他会说些什么？

sense.def: Alpaca is a type of soft wool.

example.ex: ...a light-grey alpaca suit.
example.tran: 浅灰色的羊驼毛套装

sense.def: Alpacas are South American animals similar to llamas. Their hair is the source of alpaca wool.
An alphabet is a set of letters usually presented in a fixed order which is used for writing the words of a particular language or group of languages.
sense.tran: （一种语言的）全部字母，字母表

example.ex: The modern Russian alphabet has 31 letters...
example.tran: 现代俄语字母表有31个字母。

example.ex: By two and a half he knew the alphabet.
example.tran: 两岁半时他已认识全部字母。

sense.def: Alphabetical means arranged according to the normal order of the letters in the alphabet.
sense.tran: 按字母顺序的；字母（表）的

example.ex: Their herbs and spices are arranged in alphabetical order.
example.tran: 他们的香草和调味料按字母顺序摆放。

example.ex: The catalog is organized alphabetically by label name.
example.tran: 这个目录按标签名的字母顺序排列而成。

sense.def: Alpine means existing in or relating to mountains, especially the ones in Switzerland.

example.ex: ...grassy, alpine meadows.
example.tran: 高山上长满青草的草地

example.ex: ...picturesque alpine villages.
example.tran: 景色如画的高山村落

sense.def: Alpines are small flowering plants that grow high up on mountains and are sometimes grown in gardens. There are many different types of alpines.

You use already to show that something has happened, or that something had happened before the moment you are referring to. Speakers of British English use already with a verb in a perfect tense, putting it after 'have', 'has', or 'had', or at the end of a clause. Some speakers of American English use already with the simple past tense of the verb instead of a perfect tense.
sense.tran: 已经（用already时，英国英语中动词用完成时态，美国英语有时则用一般过去时）

example.ex: They had already voted for him at the first ballot...
example.tran: 在第一次投票选举时，他们已经投票给他了。

example.ex: The group has already shed 10,000 jobs...
example.tran: 该集团已经裁去1万个工作岗位。

example.ex: I already told you not to come over...
example.tran: 我已经告诉你别过来了。

example.ex: They've spent nearly a billion dollars on it already.
example.tran: 他们已经在那上面花了近10亿美元。

sense.hdgr: ADV before v, ADV with group
sense.def: You use already to show that a situation exists at this present moment or that it exists at an earlier time than expected. You use already after the verb 'be' or an auxiliary verb, or before a verb if there is no auxiliary. When you want add emphasis, you can put already at the beginning of a sentence.
sense.tran: 早已（用于be动词或助动词之后，或一般动词之前，表示强调时可置于句首）

example.ex: The authorities believe those security measures are already paying off...
example.tran: 当局相信那些安全措施已经奏效。

example.ex: He was already rich...
example.tran: 他已经很富有了。

example.ex: He was already late for his appointment...
example.tran: 他约会已经晚了。

example.ex: Get 10% off our already low prices!...
example.tran: 把我们已经很低的价格再下调10%！

example.ex: Already, he has a luxurious villa in Formello.
example.tran: 他已经在福尔梅洛拥有了一幢豪华别墅。

boxu.usage: Already is often used to add emphasis or to suggest that it is surprising that something has happened so soon. They were already eating their lunch. If you say that something is still happening or is still the case, you are usually emphasising your surprise that it has been happening or has been the case for so long. She was still looking at me... There are still plenty of horses round here. You use yet in negative sentences and in questions. It is often used to add emphasis, to suggest surprise that something has not happened, or to say that it will happen later. Have you seen it yet?... The troops could not yet see the shore... It isn't dark yet. In British English, already and yet are usually used with the present perfect tense. I have already started knitting baby clothes... Have they said sorry yet? In American English, a past tense is commonly used. She already told the neighbors not to come... I didn't get any sleep yet. This usage is becoming more common in British English.
boxu.tran: already常用于强调或暗示某件事的发生快得令人惊奇：They were already eating their lunch（他们已经在吃午饭了）。still可用来强调对某件事发生或持续如此长时间感到惊奇：She was still looking at me（她还在看着我），There are still plenty of horses round here（这附近还有很多匹马）。yet常用在否定句和疑问句中表示强调，或对某事还未发生表示惊奇，或表示某事将要发生：Have you seen it yet（你看过了吗），The troops could not yet see the shore（部队还是看不见海岸），It isn’t dark yet（天色还没有暗下来）。英国英语中already和yet通常用于现在完成时：I have already started knitting baby clothes(我已经开始织婴儿衣服了），Have they said sorry yet（他们道过歉了吗）。美国英语中，常用于过去时：She already told the neighbors not to come（她已经告诉邻居们别来了），I didn’t get any sleep yet（我还没合过眼）。这种用法在英国英语中也越来越普遍。

sense.def: An Alsatian is a large, usually fierce dog that is often used to guard buildings or by the police to help them find criminals.
sense.tran: 德国牧羊犬，阿尔萨斯狼狗（一种凶猛的大狼狗，常用作看家狗或警犬）

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 German shepherd

sense.hdgr: ADV before v, ADV with cl/group
sense.def: You can use also to give more information about a person or thing, or to add another relevant fact.

example.ex: It is the work of Ivor Roberts-Jones, who also produced the statue of Churchill in Parliament Square...
example.tran: 这是艾弗·罗伯茨-琼斯的作品，他还创作了议会广场上的丘吉尔塑像。

example.ex: He is an asthmatic who was also anaemic...
example.tran: 他是个曾患贫血症的哮喘患者。

example.ex: She has a reputation for brilliance. Also, she is gorgeous.
example.tran: 她以才华出众而闻名。此外，她还非常漂亮。

sense.hdgr: ADV before v, ADV with group
sense.def: You can use also to indicate that something you have just said about one person or thing is true of another person or thing.

example.ex: His father, also a top-ranking officer, had perished during the war...
example.tran: 他的父亲，也是位高级军官，在战争中牺牲了。

example.ex: We have been working very hard, and our families have also worked hard...
example.tran: 我们一直很努力工作，并且我们的家人也是如此。

example.ex: Not only cancer, but also heart and lung disease are influenced by smoking.
example.tran: 不仅是癌症，还有心脏病和肺部疾病也都会受吸烟影响。

boxu.usage: Also and too are similar in meaning. Also never comes at the end of a clause, whereas too usually comes at the end. He was also an artist and lived at Compton... He's a singer and an actor too.
boxu.tran: also 和 too 意义相近。also 不用于句尾，而 too 则通常用于句尾：He was also an artist and lived at Compton（他也是个艺术家，家住康普顿），He’s a singer and an actor too（他是个歌手，同时也是演员）。

sense.def: If you describe someone as an also-ran, you mean that they have been or are likely to be unsuccessful in a contest.
sense.tran: （比赛等的）失败者;（竞选的）落选者;很难获胜的竞争者

sense.def: An altar is a holy table in a church or temple.

example.ex: ...the high altar at Chichester Cathedral.
example.tran: 奇切斯特大教堂内的主祭坛

sense.def: If you say that someone or something is sacrificed at the altar of another thing, you mean they suffer or are destroyed because of that thing.
sense.tran: 作…的祭品；成为…的牺牲品

example.ex: Napoleon's army was sacrificed on the altar of folly in the disastrous Russian campaign.
example.tran: 在灾难性的俄国战役中，拿破仑的军队成了这一愚蠢之举的牺牲品。

sense.def: In the Roman Catholic church, an altar boy is a boy who helps the priest during Mass.
sense.tran: （天主教庭协助牧师做弥撒的）辅祭

sense.def: An altarpiece is a work of art behind the altar in a church.
If something alters or if you alter it, it changes.

example.ex: Little had altered in the village...
example.tran: 村子里几乎没有什么变化。

example.ex: They have never altered their programmes by a single day.
example.tran: 他们一天也未变更过他们的节目。

sense.def: An alteration is a change in or to something.

example.ex: Making some simple alterations to your diet will make you feel fitter...
example.tran: 对日常饮食做些简单的调整就会让你身体更健康。

example.ex: The structural alterations made to the house were planned with Gail's help.
example.tran: 对房屋结构调整的规划是在盖尔的帮助下完成的。

sense.def: The alteration of something is the process of changing it.

example.ex: Her jacket was at the boutique waiting for alteration.
example.tran: 她的短上衣放在时装店里，要做些改动。

sense.def: An altercation is a noisy argument or disagreement.

example.ex: I had a slight altercation with some people who objected to our filming.
example.tran: 我和一些反对我们拍摄的人发生了小小的口角。

sense.def: Your alter ego is the other side of your personality from the one which people normally see.
sense.tran: 另一个自我；个性的另一面

sense.def: You can describe the character that an actor usually plays on television or in films as his or her alter ego.

example.ex: Barry Humphries's alter ego Dame Edna has taken the US by storm.
example.tran: 巴里·汉弗莱斯凭借埃德娜夫人一角轰动全美。

sense.def: An alter ego is a very close and intimate friend whose character is often the opposite of your own.

example.ex: She is, first and foremost, her husband's alter ego.
example.tran: 她首先是丈夫的知己。

entry.boxr: The verb is pronounced /'ɔːltəneɪt/. The adjective and noun are pronounced /ɔːl'tɜːnət/. 动词读作 /'ɔːltəneɪt/，形容词和名词读作 /ɔːl'tɜːnət/。

sense.def: When you alternate two things, you keep using one then the other. When one thing alternates with another, the first regularly occurs after the other.

example.ex: Her aggressive moods alternated with gentle or more co-operative states...
example.tran: 她情绪多变，时而咄咄逼人，时而又显得温柔平和或乐于合作。

example.ex: The three acts will alternate as headliners throughout the tour...
example.tran: 这3个节目将在整个巡回演出中轮流打头牌。

example.ex: Now you just alternate layers of that mixture and eggplant...
example.tran: 现在你只需把茄子和拌料一层层交替放好。

example.ex: The band alternated romantic love songs with bouncy dance numbers.
example.tran: 乐队轮番献上浪漫情歌和劲歌热舞。

example.ex: ...an imaginative novel, with alternating chapters presenting each partner's point of view.
example.tran: 分章节轮流呈现各个角色观点的富有想象力的小说

example.ex: The alternation of sun and snow continued for the rest of our holiday.
example.tran: 我们剩余的假期里依旧时而晴天时而下雪。

sense.def: Alternate actions, events, or processes regularly occur after each other.

example.ex: They were streaked with alternate bands of colour.
example.tran: 它们都带有各种色彩相间的条纹。

example.ex: He could alternately bully and charm people...
example.tran: 他一会儿欺负人一会儿取悦人。

example.ex: She became alternately angry and calm.
example.tran: 她时而愤怒时而平静。

sense.def: If something happens on alternate days, it happens on one day, then happens on every second day after that. In the same way, something can happen in alternate weeks, years, or other periods of time.

example.ex: Lesley had agreed to Jim going skiing in alternate years.
example.tran: 莱斯莉已同意吉姆每隔一年去滑一次雪。

sense.def: You use alternate to describe a plan, idea, or system which is different from the one already in operation and can be used instead of it.
sense.tran: 供选择的；备用的；其他的

example.ex: His group was forced to turn back and take an alternate route.
example.tran: 他的小组被迫返回并选择了另一条路线。

example.ex: ...alternate forms of medical treatment.
example.tran: 其他可供选择的医疗方案

sense.def: An alternate is a person or thing that replaces another, and can act or be used instead of them.

example.ex: In most jurisdictions, twelve jurors and two alternates are chosen...
example.tran: 大多数辖区都会选出12名陪审员和2名候补陪审员。

example.ex: The six food groups include grain products, vegetables, fruits, milk and milk products, meats and meat alternates, and a miscellaneous group.
example.tran: 这6类食物包括谷类产品、蔬菜、水果、牛奶和奶制品、肉类和肉类替代品以及杂类食品。

sense.def: Alternate is sometimes used, especially in American English, instead of alternative in meanings 3, 4, and 5.
sense.tran: （尤其在美国英语中，当alternative作义项3、4和5解时，代替alternative使用）

example.ex: ...an alternate lifestyle.
example.tran: 另一种生活方式

sense.def: An alternating current is an electric current that continually changes direction as it flows. The abbreviation AC is also used.

entry.boxr: The form alternate is sometimes used, especially in American English, instead of alternative in meanings 3, 4, and 5. 尤其在美国英语中，当alternative作义项3、4和5解时，有时可用alternate替代。

sense.def: If one thing is an alternative to another, the first can be found, used, or done instead of the second.
sense.tran: 可供选择的；可供替代的

example.ex: New ways to treat arthritis may provide an alternative to painkillers.
example.tran: 关节炎的新疗法可能是止痛药之外的另一种选择。

sense.def: An alternative plan or offer is different from the one that you already have, and can be done or used instead.

example.ex: There were alternative methods of travel available...
example.tran: 还有其他可选的旅行方式。

example.ex: They had a right to seek alternative employment.
example.tran: 他们有权另谋高就。

sense.def: Alternative is used to describe something that is different from the usual things of its kind, or the usual ways of doing something, in modern Western society. For example, an alternative lifestyle does not follow conventional ways of living and working.

example.ex: ...unconventional parents who embraced the alternative lifestyle of the Sixties...
example.tran: 欣然接受60年代另类生活模式而不因循守旧的父母

example.ex: If you like alternative comedy you'll love this book.
example.tran: 如果你喜欢另类喜剧的话，你就会喜欢这本书。

sense.def: Alternative medicine uses traditional ways of curing people, such as medicines made from plants, massage, and acupuncture.
sense.tran: （医疗）传统的，替代的（如提取植物成分制成药物、按摩和针灸）

example.ex: ...alternative health care.
example.tran: 传统的医疗保健

sense.def: Alternative energy uses natural sources of energy such as the sun, wind, or water for power and fuel, rather than oil, coal, or nuclear power.
You use alternatively to introduce a suggestion or to mention something different to what has just been stated.

example.ex: Allow about eight hours for the drive from Calais. Alternatively, you can fly to Brive.
example.tran: 从加来开车去，要留出大约8小时的时间。或者，你可以坐飞机前往布里夫。

sense.def: An alternator is a device, used especially in a car, that creates an electrical current that changes direction as it flows.
You use although to introduce a subordinate clause which contains a statement which contrasts with the statement in the main clause.

example.ex: Although he is known to only a few, his reputation among them is very great...
example.tran: 虽然知道他的人不多，但他在这些人中名声却很响。

example.ex: Although the shooting has stopped for now, the destruction left behind is enormous.
example.tran: 虽然枪战目前已停止，但造成的破坏是巨大的。

sense.def: You use although to introduce a subordinate clause which contains a statement which makes the main clause of the sentence seem surprising or unexpected.
sense.tran: 虽然（表示惊奇或出乎意料）

example.ex: Although I was only six, I can remember seeing it on TV...
example.tran: 虽然那时我只有6岁，我依然记得在电视上见过它。

example.ex: Although he was twice as old as us, he became the life and soul of the company.
example.tran: 虽然他的年纪是我们的两倍，但他却成为了公司的灵魂人物。

sense.def: You use although to introduce a subordinate clause which gives some information that is relevant to the main clause but modifies the strength of that statement.

example.ex: He was in love with her, although he did not put that name to it.
example.tran: 他爱着她，虽然他没有将其称为爱。

sense.def: You use although when admitting a fact about something which you regard as less important than a contrasting fact.
sense.tran: 尽管;虽然（表示承认所述是事实）

example.ex: Although they're expensive, they last forever and never go out of style...
example.tran: 尽管价格昂贵，但它们经久耐用，永不过时。

example.ex: Although not ideal, this attitude is not entirely destructive.
example.tran: 这种态度虽然不够理想，但还不至于消极透顶。

sense.def: An altimeter is an instrument in an aircraft that shows the height of the aircraft above the ground.
