If something is at a particular altitude, it is at that height above sea level.

example.ex: The aircraft had reached its cruising altitude of about 39,000 feet...
example.tran: 飞机已到达约3.9万英尺的巡航高度。

example.ex: The following day I ran my first race at high altitude.
example.tran: 第二天我第一次在高海拔地区参加了赛跑。

sense.def: An alto is a woman who has a low singing voice.

example.ex: ...the altos, the tenors, the sopranos.
example.tran: 女低音歌手、男高音歌手、女高音歌手

example.ex: ...the famous alto aria 'Have Mercy Lord on me'.
example.tran: 著名的女低音咏叹调《请主赐福于我》

sense.def: An alto or male alto is a man who has the highest male singing voice.

example.ex: In the recording I have today, it is sung by a male alto.
example.tran: 我今天带的唱片是由一位男高音歌手唱的。

sense.def: An alto musical instrument has a range of notes of medium pitch.

example.ex: ...the alto saxophone.
example.tran: 中音萨克斯管

sense.def: You use altogether to emphasize that something has stopped, been done, or finished completely.

example.ex: When Artie stopped calling altogether, Julie found a new man...
example.tran: 当阿蒂彻底不再上门后，朱莉又找了个男人。

example.ex: His tour may have to be cancelled altogether...
example.tran: 他的旅行可能不得不彻底取消。

example.ex: Clinical test results are certainly encouraging — 10 per cent of wrinkles disappear altogether.
example.tran: 临床试验的结果无疑是令人振奋的——10%的皱纹完全消失了。

sense.def: You use altogether in front of an adjective or adverb to emphasize a quality that someone or something has.
sense.tran: （用于形容词或副词前表示强调）显然，完全

example.ex: The choice of language is altogether different...
example.tran: 对语言的选择完全是另一回事。

example.ex: Today's celebrations have been altogether more sedate...
example.tran: 今天的庆祝活动显然更加庄重。

example.ex: This wine has an altogether stronger, more pronounced flavour than their other white wines.
example.tran: 与他们其他的白葡萄酒相比，这种葡萄酒的口味显然更加浓郁醇厚。

sense.def: You use altogether to modify a negative statement and make it less forceful.

example.ex: We were not altogether sure that the comet would miss the Earth...
example.tran: 我们不能完全肯定彗星不会与地球相撞。

example.ex: The fashion business, he claims, not altogether convincingly, is more real than the film business...
example.tran: 他声称时尚业比电影业更真实，但他的话并不完全令人信服。

example.ex: 'I'm not altogether a fool,' she said gruffly.
example.tran: “我还不太傻，”她生硬地说。

sense.def: You can use altogether to introduce a summary of what you have been saying.

example.ex: Altogether, it was a delightful town garden, peaceful and secluded.
example.tran: 总体上说，这是个令人愉快的城市花园，宁静而偏僻。

sense.def: If several amounts add up to a particular amount altogether, that amount is their total.

example.ex: Britain has a dozen warships in the area, with a total of five thousand military personnel altogether...
example.tran: 英国在该地区驻有12艘战舰，共有5,000名军人。

example.ex: Altogether seven inmates escaped by scaling a wall and climbing down scaffolding.
example.tran: 总共有7名犯人攀墙从脚手架上爬下来逃走了。

sense.def: Altruism is unselfish concern for other people's happiness and welfare.
If your behaviour or motives are altruistic, you show concern for the happiness and welfare of other people rather than for yourself.

example.ex: ...motives and ambitions that are not entirely altruistic.
example.tran: 不完全利他的动机和抱负

sense.def: Aluminium is a lightweight metal used, for example, for making cooking equipment and aircraft parts.

example.ex: ...aluminium cans.
example.tran: 铝罐

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 aluminum

sense.def: The alumni of a school, college, or university are the people who used to be students there.
If you always do something, you do it whenever a particular situation occurs. If you always did something, you did it whenever a particular situation occurred.
sense.tran: 总是；每次都是；无例外地

example.ex: Whenever I get into a relationship, I always fall madly in love...
example.tran: 我每次谈恋爱都深陷其中，无法自拔。

example.ex: She's always late for everything...
example.tran: 她事事都迟到。

example.ex: We've always done it this way...
example.tran: 我们一直是这么做的。

example.ex: Always lock your garage.
example.tran: 每次都要锁上车库。

sense.def: If something is always the case, was always the case, or will always be the case, it is, was, or will be the case all the time, continuously.

example.ex: We will always remember his generous hospitality...
example.tran: 我们将永远记得他的慷慨好客。

example.ex: He has always been the family solicitor...
example.tran: 他一直做家庭事务律师。

example.ex: He was always cheerful.
example.tran: 他总是兴高采烈的。

sense.def: If you say that something is always happening, especially something which annoys you, you mean that it happens repeatedly.

example.ex: She was always moving things around.
example.tran: 她老是将东西搬来搬去。

sense.def: You use always in expressions such as can always or could always when you are making suggestions or suggesting an alternative approach or method.
sense.tran: （用于提出建议或提示其他解决方法）总还，总还是

example.ex: If you can't find any decent apples, you can always try growing them yourself...
example.tran: 如果你找不到像样的苹果，你总还可以试着自己种。

example.ex: 'What are you going to do?' — 'I don't know. I could always go back in the Navy or something.'
example.tran: “你打算做什么？”——“不知道，我总还是能回到海军或者什么的。”

sense.def: You can say that someone always was, for example, awkward or lucky to indicate that you are not surprised about what they are doing or have just done.

example.ex: She's going to be fine. She always was pretty strong...
example.tran: 她会好的。她一直都很强壮。

example.ex: You always were a good friend.
example.tran: 你从来都是我的好朋友。

boxu.usage: Do not confuse always and ever. If something always happens, it happens regularly or on every occasion. I would always ask for the radio to be turned down... He's always been an active person. If something is always the case, it is true at all times. No matter what she did, she would always be forgiven. You use ever, for example in negative sentences, questions, and with superlatives, to talk about any time at all when referring to the past, present, or future. No one ever came... Will I ever see France? ...the nicest thing anyone's ever said to me.
boxu.tran: 不要混淆always和ever。always指总是或每次都是：I would always ask for the radio to be turned down（我总是要求将收音机的音量调小），He’s always been an active person（他总是很积极）。always也可指始终或一直：No matter what she did, she would always be forgiven（无论她做了什么，总是可以得到谅解）。ever用于否定句、疑问句或最高级，表示过去、现在或将来的任何时候：No one ever came（没有人来过），Will I ever see France（我以后能有机会去法国吗），the nicest thing anyone’s ever said to me（别人对我说过的最中听的话）。

sense.def: Alzheimer's disease is a condition in which a person's brain gradually stops working properly.
sense.tran: 阿尔茨海默病；早老性痴呆病

sense.def: Am is the first person singular of the present tense of be .Am is often shortened to 'm in spoken English. The negative forms are 'I am not' and 'I'm not'. In questions and tags in spoken English, these are usually changed to 'aren't I'.
sense.tran: （be的第一人称单数现在式；口语中常略作’m；否定形式为I am not和I’m not；反意疑问句中形式为aren’t I）

sense.def: AM is a method of transmitting radio waves that can be used to broadcast sound. AM is an abbreviation for（缩略=）'amplitude modulation'.
An AM is a member of the Welsh Assembly. AM is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'assembly member'.
Am. is a written abbreviation for (书面缩略=) American.
a.m. is used after a number to show that you are referring to a particular time between midnight and noon.

example.ex: The program starts at 9 a.m.
example.tran: 节目上午9点开始。

sense.def: Something that is an amalgam of two or more things is a mixture of them.
Amalgam is a mixture of mercury and another metal, usually silver, that is used in dentistry to make fillings.
sense.tran: （用作补牙材料的）汞齐，汞合金

example.ex: ...amalgam fillings.
example.tran: 汞合金填充物

sense.def: When two or more things, especially organizations, amalgamate or are amalgamated, they become one large thing.

example.ex: The firm has amalgamated with an American company...
example.tran: 该公司和一家美国公司合并了。

example.ex: The chemical companies had amalgamated into a vast conglomerate...
example.tran: 那些化学品公司已经合并成一个庞大的企业集团。

example.ex: The Visitors' Centre amalgamates the traditions of the Old World with the technology of the New.
example.tran: 来宾中心将欧洲的传统与美洲的技术结合在一起。

example.ex: Athletics South Africa was formed by an amalgamation of two organisations.
example.tran: 南非体育协会由两个组织合并而成。

sense.def: If you amass something such as money or information, you gradually get a lot of it.

example.ex: How had he amassed his fortune?
example.tran: 他是如何积累财富的呢？

sense.def: An amateur is someone who does something as a hobby and not as a job.

example.ex: Jerry is an amateur who dances because he feels like it...
example.tran: 杰里是个业余跳舞爱好者，他跳舞是因为自己喜欢。

example.ex: Taylor began his playing career as an amateur goalkeeper.
example.tran: 泰勒的运动生涯是从一名业余守门员开始的。

sense.def: Amateur sports or activities are done by people as a hobby and not as a job.
sense.tran: （体育运动或活动）业余爱好的

example.ex: ...the local amateur dramatics society...
example.tran: 地方业余戏剧社团

example.ex: At college he studied English and did amateur boxing.
example.tran: 大学时，他学习英语，同时还参加业余拳击。

sense.def: If you describe something as amateurish, you think that it is not skilfully made or done.
sense.tran: 业余水准的；不熟练的；（像）外行的

example.ex: We have to develop a less amateurish approach to our organisations...
example.tran: 我们必须使我们对待自己组织的态度变得较为专业。

example.ex: The paintings looked amateurish.
example.tran: 这些画作看起来只具备业余水准。

sense.def: Amateurism is the belief that people should take part in sports and other activities as a hobby, for pleasure, rather than as a job, for money.
sense.tran: 业余主义（认为享受体育和其他活动的乐趣比从中谋利更为重要）

example.ex: He is a staunch supporter of amateurism.
example.tran: 他是业余主义的坚定支持者。

sense.def: If something amazes you, it surprises you very much.

example.ex: He amazed us by his knowledge of Welsh history...
example.tran: 他对威尔士的历史知之甚多，让我们惊讶。

example.ex: The Riverside Restaurant promises a variety of food that never ceases to amaze!
example.tran: 滨河饭店总能提供品种繁多、令人称奇的食物。

example.ex: He said most of the cast was amazed by the play's success...
example.tran: 他说大部分演员都对该剧的成功感到惊讶。

example.ex: I was amazed to learn she was still writing her stories...
example.tran: 得知她仍然在写自己的小说，我感到很惊讶。

example.ex: She is amazed that people still risk travelling without insurance.
example.tran: 对于人们仍然不上保险就冒险去旅行，她很惊愕。

sense.def: Amazement is the feeling you have when something surprises you very much.

example.ex: I stared at her in amazement.
example.tran: 我惊愕地瞪眼看着她。

sense.def: You say that something is amazing when it is very surprising and makes you feel pleasure, approval, or wonder.

example.ex: It's amazing what we can remember with a little prompting...
example.tran: 稍加提醒我们就能想起很多东西，真是让人惊奇。

example.ex: This movie has some of the most amazing stunts you're ever likely to see.
example.tran: 这部电影里有一些可能是你见所未见、让人惊叹的特技。

example.ex: She was an amazingly good cook.
example.tran: 她是个厨艺精湛的厨师。

sense.def: In Greek mythology, the Amazons were a tribe of women who were very good at fighting.
sense.tran: （古希腊故事中的）亚马孙族女战士

sense.def: People sometimes refer to a tall, strong woman as an Amazon .

example.ex: In China Grace Thompson observed the great variety of loads that were carried by 'slim, erect but muscular Amazons'.
example.tran: 在中国，格雷丝·汤普森看见“苗条、挺直而强健的女人们”携带着各种物品。

sense.def: Amazonian means related to the area around the river Amazon.
sense.tran: 亚马孙河的；亚马孙流域的

example.ex: ...the Amazonian rainforest.
example.tran: 亚马孙流域的雨林

sense.def: People sometimes describe a tall, strong woman as Amazonian.

example.ex: ...an Amazonian blonde.
example.tran: 高大强悍的金发女子

sense.def: Amazonian means belonging to or connected with the Amazons in Greek mythology.

example.ex: ...Amazonian queens.
example.tran: 亚马孙人的女王

example.ex: ...Amazonian mythology.
example.tran: 亚马孙神话传说

sense.hdgr:
oft adj N, N
to n
sense.def: An ambassador is an important official who lives in a foreign country and represents his or her own country's interests there.

example.ex: ...the German ambassador to Poland.
example.tran: 德国驻波兰大使

sense.def: Ambassadorial means belonging or relating to an ambassador.

example.ex: ...an ambassadorial post.
example.tran: 大使级职位

sense.def: Amber is a hard yellowish-brown substance used for making jewellery.

example.ex: ...an amber choker with matching earrings.
example.tran: 有配套耳环的琥珀短项链

example.ex: ...a Victorian cigar holder of amber and sterling silver.
example.tran: 维多利亚时代的琥珀和纯银制雪茄烟嘴

sense.def: Amber is used to describe things that are yellowish-brown in colour.

example.ex: A burst of sunshine sent a beam of amber light through the window...
example.tran: 破云而出的阳光透过窗户送来一束琥珀色的光线。

example.ex: He shook the amber bottle vigorously.
example.tran: 他用力摇晃这个琥珀色的瓶子。

sense.def: An amber traffic light is orange.

example.ex: Cars did not stop when the lights were on amber.
example.tran: 交通灯变成橙黄色时，汽车没有停下来。

sense.def: Ambergris is a waxy substance produced by sperm whales. It is used to make some perfumes.
sense.tran: 龙涎香（产自抹香鲸体内的一种可作香料的蜡状物质）

sense.def: Someone who is ambidextrous can use both their right hand and their left hand equally skilfully.
sense.tran: 左右手都灵巧的；两手都善用的

sense.hdgr:
also no det, oft N
of n
sense.def: The ambience of a place is the character and atmosphere that it seems to have.

example.ex: The overall ambience of the room is cosy.
example.tran: 房间整体的感觉是温暖舒适。

sense.def: The ambient temperature is the temperature of the air above the ground in a particular place.
Ambient sound or light is the sound or light which is all around you.

example.ex: ...ambient sounds of children in the background.
example.tran: 背景里环绕着孩子们的声音

sense.def: If you say that there is ambiguity in something, you mean that it is unclear or confusing, or it can be understood in more than one way.
sense.tran: 含糊不清；不明确；模棱两可

example.ex: There is considerable ambiguity about what this part of the agreement actually means.
example.tran: 协议这一部分的真正含义很不明确。

example.ex: ...the ambiguities of language.
example.tran: 语言的模棱两可

sense.def: If you say that there is an ambiguity in a situation or in someone's character, you mean that it contains several different qualities or attitudes which do not fit well together.

example.ex: The author's style suggests a certain ambiguity in his moral view.
example.tran: 该作家的风格表明其道德观有点暧昧不明。

sense.def: If you describe something as ambiguous, you mean that it is unclear or confusing because it can be understood in more than one way.
sense.tran: 含糊不清的;不明确的;模棱两可的

example.ex: This agreement is very ambiguous and open to various interpretations...
example.tran: 这份协议非常含糊，可以有多种解释。

example.ex: The Foreign Secretary's remarks clarify an ambiguous statement issued earlier this week.
example.tran: 外交大臣的话对本周较早时候发表的一份模棱两可的声明作出了澄清。

rnon.hdgr: usu ADV with v, also ADV adj

example.ex: Zaire's national conference on democracy ended ambiguously.
example.tran: 扎伊尔关于民主的全国大会结束了，但未有结果。

sense.def: If you describe something as ambiguous, you mean that it contains several different ideas or attitudes that do not fit well together.
sense.tran: 暧昧不清的；不协调的；捉摸不定的

example.ex: Students have ambiguous feelings about their role in the world.
example.tran: 学生们对于自己在这个世界上的角色认识模糊不清。

sense.def: The ambit of something is its range or extent.

example.ex: Her case falls within the ambit of moral law.
example.tran: 她的案例属于道德法律的范畴。

sense.def: If you have an ambition to do or achieve something, you want very much to do it or achieve it.

example.ex: His ambition is to sail round the world...
example.tran: 他的梦想是环球航行。

example.ex: He harboured ambitions of becoming a Tory MP.
example.tran: 他梦想成为托利党下院议员。

sense.def: Ambition is the desire to be successful, rich, or powerful.

example.ex: Even when I was young I never had any ambition.
example.tran: 即使是年轻时，我也从没有什么雄心壮志。

example.ex: ...a mixture of ambition and ruthlessness.
example.tran: 既野心勃勃又冷酷无情

sense.def: Someone who is ambitious has a strong desire to be successful, rich, or powerful.
sense.tran: 有雄心的；有抱负的；有野心的

example.ex: Chris is so ambitious, so determined to do it all...
example.tran: 克里斯踌躇满志，决心要将它都做完。

example.ex: He's a very ambitious lad and he wants to play at the highest level.
example.tran: 他是个很有抱负的小伙子，想参加最高水平的比赛。

sense.def: An ambitious idea or plan is on a large scale and needs a lot of work to be carried out successfully.

example.ex: The ambitious project was completed in only nine months...
example.tran: 这个规模宏大的项目只用了9个月就完成了。

example.ex: Their goal was extraordinarily ambitious.
example.tran: 他们的目标极其宏伟。

example.ex: Its trade and industrial policies should be used more ambitiously...
example.tran: 其贸易和工业政策的适用范围应该扩大。

example.ex: He is working on his life story, ambitiously planned as a 50-volume work.
example.tran: 他正着力于写作他的传记，雄心勃勃地计划要写50卷。

sense.def: If you say that someone is ambivalent about something, they seem to be uncertain whether they really want it, or whether they really approve of it.
sense.tran: 摇摆不定的；犹豫不决的

example.ex: She remained ambivalent about her marriage...
example.tran: 她对于自己的婚事仍然拿不定主意。

example.ex: He maintained an ambivalent attitude to the Church throughout his long life.
example.tran: 在他漫长的一生中，他对基督教信仰始终是一种摇摆不定的态度。

rnon.hdgr:
usu with supp, oft N
about/towards n

example.ex: I've never lied about my feelings, including my ambivalence about getting married again.
example.tran: 对于自己的感情，我从来不说谎，包括我对于再婚游移不定的态度。

example.ex: They ambivalently condemn both the disorders and the jury verdict that touched off the disorders.
example.tran: 他们既对骚乱予以谴责，同时又指责陪审团的裁决引发了骚乱，立场很不明确。

sense.def: When you amble, you walk slowly and in a relaxed manner.

example.ex: We ambled along in front of the houses...
example.tran: 我们在房子前面漫步。

example.ex: Slowly they ambled back to the car.
example.tran: 他们慢慢地走回到汽车那儿。

example.ex: ...an afternoon's amble around the oldest parts of Paris.
example.tran: 在巴黎最古老街区午后漫步

sense.def: In Greek mythology, ambrosia is the food of the gods.
An ambulance is a vehicle for taking people to and from hospital.
An ambulanceman is a man who drives an ambulance or takes care of people in an ambulance on the way to hospital.
sense.tran: 救护车驾驶员；救护车护理人员

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 ambulance driver

sense.def: If a group of people ambush their enemies, they attack them after hiding and waiting for them.

example.ex: The Guatemalan army says rebels ambushed and killed 10 patrolmen.
example.tran: 危地马拉军方说叛乱分子伏击打死了10名巡逻兵。

sense.def: An ambush is an attack on someone by people who have been hiding and waiting for them.

example.ex: A policeman has been shot dead in an ambush.
example.tran: 一次伏击中一名警察中弹身亡。

sense.def: If someone is lying in ambush, they are hiding and waiting for someone, usually to attack them.

example.ex: The gunmen, lying in ambush, opened fire, killing the driver.
example.tran: 埋伏的枪手开枪打死了司机。

sense.def: If someone or something ameliorates a situation, they make it better or easier in some way.

example.ex: Nothing can be done to ameliorate the situation...
example.tran: 做什么也无法使情况好转。

example.ex: He expected me to do something to ameliorate his depression.
example.tran: 他希望我做点什么好让他不那么沮丧。

example.ex: ...a demand for amelioration of conditions.
example.tran: 改善条件的需求

sense.def: Amen is said by Christians at the end of a prayer.
sense.tran: 阿门（基督教徒祈祷结束时用语）

example.ex: In the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Ghost, Amen.
example.tran: 以圣父、圣子和圣灵的名义，阿门。

sense.hdgr:
usu v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
to n/-ing
sense.def: If you are amenable to something, you are willing to do it or accept it.

example.ex: The Jordanian leader seemed amenable to attending a conference...
example.tran: 约旦领导人似乎愿意参加会议。

example.ex: I never had a long-term relationship as I wasn't good enough, or interesting or amenable enough.
example.tran: 因为我不够优秀，不够有趣或者不够亲切，所以恋爱关系从来都维持不长。

sense.def: If you amend something that has been written such as a law, or something that is said, you change it in order to improve it or make it more accurate.

example.ex: The president agreed to amend the constitution and allow multi-party elections...
example.tran: 总统同意修订宪法，允许多党选举。

example.ex: 'You must admit that the man has got charm,' said Nicolson. 'Glamour,' amended Wells.
example.tran: “你必须承认这个男人有魅力，”尼科尔森说。“是诱惑力，”韦尔斯纠正说。

example.ex: ...the amended version of the Act.
example.tran: 该法令的修正案

sense.hdgr:
V inflects, oft PHR
for n/-ing
sense.def: If you make amends when you have harmed someone, you show that you are sorry by doing something to please them.

example.ex: He wanted to make amends for causing their marriage to fail.
example.tran: 他导致了他们的婚姻破裂，因此想作出补偿。

sense.def: An amendment is a section that is added to a law or rule in order to change it.
sense.tran: （法令或法规的）修正条款，修正案

example.ex: ...an amendment to the defense bill.
example.tran: 防御法案的修正案

example.ex: ...a constitutional amendment...
example.tran: 宪法修正条款

example.ex: Parliament gained certain rights of amendment.
example.tran: 议会得到一定的修正权利。

sense.def: An amendment is a change that is made to a piece of writing.
Amenities are things such as shopping centres or sports facilities that are provided for people's convenience, enjoyment, or comfort.
sense.tran: 生活福利设施；便利设施

example.ex: The hotel amenities include health clubs, conference facilities, and banqueting rooms.
example.tran: 饭店的便利设施包括健身俱乐部、会议设施和宴会厅。

sense.def: People who have one American parent and one Asian parent are sometimes referred to as Amerasians .

example.ex: ...discrimination against Amerasians in Vietnam.
example.tran: 在越南对美亚混血儿的歧视现象

example.ex: ...an Amerasian boy.
example.tran: 美亚混血男孩

sense.def: An American person or thing belongs to or comes from the United States of America.

example.ex: ...the American Ambassador at the United Nations.
example.tran: 美国驻联合国大使

example.ex: ...the influence of American television and movies.
example.tran: 美国电视和电影产生的影响

posc.def: An American is someone who is American.

example.ex: The 1990 Nobel Prize for medicine was won by two Americans.
example.tran: 1990年诺贝尔医学奖由两位美国人获得。

sense.def: Objects that come from or relate to America are referred to as Americana, especially when they are in a collection.
sense.tran: （尤指收集成册的）美国（或美洲）史料，美国（或美洲）文物集锦

example.ex: ...1950s Americana.
example.tran: 20世纪50年代美国史料全集

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 football

sense.def: American football is a game similar to rugby that is played by two teams of eleven players using an oval-shaped ball. Players try to score points by carrying the ball to their opponents' end of the field, or by kicking it over a bar fixed between two posts.
sense.tran: 美式橄榄球（运动）；美式足球（运动）

sense.def: An American football is an oval-shaped ball used for playing American football.
American Indian people or things belong to or come from one of the native peoples of America.
sense.tran: 美洲印第安人的;美洲原住民的

posc.def: An American Indian is someone who is American Indian.

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 Indian, Native American

sense.def: An Americanism is an expression that is typical of people living in the United States of America.

example.ex: He was, to adopt an Americanism, 'an empty suit'.
example.tran: 他，套用一句美国人的说法，就是“徒有其表”。

sense.def: Americanism is the quality or state of being American.

example.ex: I liked the film's Americanism.
example.tran: 我喜欢这部电影的美国特色。

example.ex: ...his deep-seated Americanism.
example.tran: 他根深蒂固的美派风格

entry.boxr: in BRIT, use 英国英语亦用 Americanisation

sense.def: Americanization is the process by which people or countries become more and more similar to Americans and the United States.

example.ex: ...the Americanization of French culture.
example.tran: 法国文化的美国化

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 Americanised

sense.def: If someone is Americanized, they do things in a way that is typical of the United States.
sense.tran: 美国化的；带上美国特点的

example.ex: He is getting much too Americanized.
example.tran: 他变得过于美国化了。

sense.def: Amerindian means the same as American Indian .
Amethysts are clear purple stones, sometimes used to make jewellery.
sense.tran: 紫（水）晶，水碧（有时用于制作珠宝）

example.ex: The necklace consisted of amethysts set in gold.
example.tran: 这是一条金镶紫水晶项链。

example.ex: ...rows of amethyst beads...
example.tran: 一排排紫水晶珠子

example.ex: Amethyst was believed by the Greeks to protect a person from drunkenness.
example.tran: 希腊人认为紫水晶可以防止人喝醉。

sense.def: Amethyst is used to describe things that are pale purple in colour.

example.ex: ...as the colours changed from green to amethyst.
example.tran: 当颜色从绿色转变成淡紫色

example.ex: ...amethyst glass.
example.tran: 淡紫色的杯子

sense.def: Amiability is the quality of being friendly and pleasant.

example.ex: I found his amiability charming.
example.tran: 我觉得他和蔼可亲，富有魅力。

sense.def: Someone who is amiable is friendly and pleasant to be with.
sense.tran: 和蔼可亲的；令人愉悦的

example.ex: She had been surprised at how amiable and polite he had seemed.
example.tran: 看到他如此和蔼可亲、彬彬有礼，她非常惊讶。

example.ex: We chatted amiably about old friends.
example.tran: 谈及老朋友，我们聊得非常愉快。

sense.def: When people have an amicable relationship, they are pleasant to each other and solve their problems without quarrelling.

example.ex: The meeting ended on reasonably amicable terms...
example.tran: 会议在较为友好的气氛中结束了。

example.ex: Our discussions were amicable and productive.
example.tran: 我们的讨论气氛非常友好并且富有成果。

example.ex: He hoped the dispute could be settled amicably.
example.tran: 他希望纠纷能得到和解。

entry.boxr: The form amidst is also used, but is more literary. 亦使用amidst，但文学性更强。

sense.def: If something happens amid noises or events of some kind, it happens while the other things are happening.

example.ex: A senior leader cancelled a trip to Britain yesterday amid growing signs of a possible political crisis...
example.tran: 爆发政治危机的迹象日趋明显，一位高级领导人昨天取消了预定的英国之行。

example.ex: Children were changing classrooms amid laughter and shouts.
example.tran: 孩子们在欢笑声和喊叫声中换教室。

sense.def: If something is amid other things, it is surrounded by them.

example.ex: ...a tiny bungalow amid clusters of trees.
example.tran: 在树丛中的一间小平房

sense.def: Amidships means halfway along the length of a ship.

example.ex: The ferry hit us amidships.
example.tran: 渡船拦腰撞上了我们的船。

sense.def: Amidst means the same as amid .
Amino acids are substances containing nitrogen and hydrogen and which are found in proteins. Amino acids occur naturally in the body.
Amir means the same as emir .
If you say that something is amiss, you mean there is something wrong.
sense.tran: 不对的；不正常的；错误的

example.ex: Their instincts warned them something was amiss...
example.tran: 他们直觉上感到有什么地方不对劲儿。

example.ex: Something is radically amiss in our health care system.
example.tran: 我们的保健制度存在重大缺陷。

sense.def: If you say that something would not go amiss or would not come amiss, you mean that it would be pleasant and useful.
sense.tran: 会起作用；会称心如意；不会出错

example.ex: A bit of charm and humour would not go amiss...
example.tran: 人有点吸引力和幽默感总是好的。

example.ex: The cracks are showing in the walls and a lick of paint would not come amiss.
example.tran: 墙面开始出现裂缝了，刷一点油漆就能补好。

sense.def: Amity is peaceful, friendly relations between people or countries.

example.ex: He wished to live in amity with his neighbour.
example.tran: 他希望与邻居和睦相处。

sense.def: Ammo is ammunition for guns and other weapons.
Ammonia is a colourless liquid or gas with a strong, sharp smell. It is used in making household cleaning substances.
Ammunition is bullets and rockets that are made to be fired from guns.

example.ex: He had only seven rounds of ammunition for the revolver.
example.tran: 他这把左轮手枪只有7梭子子弹。

sense.def: You can describe information that you can use against someone in an argument or discussion as ammunition.
sense.tran: （辩论或讨论中可攻击对方的）信息，事实，炮弹

example.ex: The improved trade figures have given the government fresh ammunition.
example.tran: 有所改观的贸易数据给政府提供了新的有力证据。

sense.def: If someone is suffering from amnesia, they have lost their memory.

example.ex: People suffering from amnesia don't forget their general knowledge of objects.
example.tran: 患健忘症的人不会忘记关于物体的一些基本知识。

sense.def: Someone who is amnesiac has lost their memory.
sense.tran: 记忆缺失的；患健忘症的

example.ex: She was taken to hospital, apparently amnesiac and shocked.
example.tran: 她被送往医院，好像是受了惊吓出现了失忆。

posc.def: An amnesiac is someone who is amnesiac.

example.ex: Even profound amnesiacs can usually recall how to perform daily activities.
example.tran: 即使病情严重的健忘症患者通常也能记起如何进行日常活动。

sense.def: An amnesty is an official pardon granted to a group of prisoners by the state.

example.ex: Activists who were involved in crimes of violence will not automatically be granted amnesty.
example.tran: 参与暴力犯罪的激进分子将不会自动得到赦免。

sense.def: An amnesty is a period of time during which people can admit to a crime or give up weapons without being punished.
sense.tran: 赦免期限（此期间交代罪行或交出武器可获赦免）

example.ex: The government has announced an immediate amnesty for rebel fighters.
example.tran: 政府已对叛乱士兵宣布了即刻生效的赦免期限。

sense.def: If a pregnant woman has an amniocentesis, fluid is removed from her womb in order to check that her unborn baby is not affected by certain genetic disorders.
sense.tran: 羊膜穿刺术（抽取孕妇子宫羊水以检查胎儿健康状况）

sense.def: An amoeba is the smallest kind of living creature. Amoebae consist of only one cell, and are found in water or soil.
sense.tran: 阿米巴，变形虫（单细胞生物）

sense.def: If a person or animal runs amok, they behave in a violent and uncontrolled way.

example.ex: A soldier was arrested after running amok with a vehicle through Berlin.
example.tran: 一名士兵在疯狂飙车穿越柏林后被逮捕。

entry.boxr: The form amongst is also used, but is more literary. 亦使用amongst，但文学性更强。

sense.def: Someone or something that is situated or moving among a group of things or people is surrounded by them.

example.ex: ...youths in their late teens sitting among adults...
example.tran: 坐在成人中间的15到19岁之间的小伙子

example.ex: They walked among the crowds in Red Square.
example.tran: 他们在熙熙攘攘的红场散步。

example.ex: ...a little house among the trees.
example.tran: 掩映于树丛中的小房子

sense.def: If you are among people of a particular kind, you are with them and having contact with them.
sense.tran: 与…在一起;在…的集体之中

example.ex: Things weren't so bad, after all. I was among friends again...
example.tran: 情况还不是那么糟糕，毕竟我又回到了朋友当中。

example.ex: I was brought up among people who read and wrote a lot.
example.tran: 我周围是些经常读书写文章的人，我是在他们的熏陶下长大的。

sense.def: If someone or something is among a group, they are a member of that group and share its characteristics.

example.ex: A fifteen year old girl was among the injured...
example.tran: 受伤者中有一位15岁的女孩。

example.ex: Also among the speakers was the new American ambassador to Moscow.
example.tran: 发言者当中还有驻莫斯科的新任美国大使。

sense.def: If you want to focus on something that is happening within a particular group of people, you can say that it is happening among that group.

example.ex: Homicide is the leading cause of death among black men...
example.tran: 谋杀是黑人死亡的主要原因。

example.ex: Unemployment is quite high, especially among young people.
example.tran: 失业情况相当严重，特别是在年轻人当中。

sense.def: If something happens among a group of people, it happens within the whole of that group or between the members of that group.

example.ex: The calls for reform come as intense debate continues among the leadership over the next five-year economic plan...
example.tran: 领导层继续在为下一个五年经济计划激烈争论之际，有人发出了改革的呼声。

example.ex: I am sick of all the quarrelling among politicians who should be concentrating on vital issues.
example.tran: 我厌恶政客间的所有那些争吵，他们本应把注意力集中在重大问题上。

sense.def: If something such as a feeling, opinion, or situation exists among a group of people, most of them have it or experience it.
sense.tran: 对…中的大多数成员而论；据…的普遍看法

example.ex: The biggest fear among parents thinking of using the Internet is that their children will be exposed to pornography...
example.tran: 大多数父母认为使用因特网最可怕的是他们的孩子将接触到色情内容。

example.ex: The resort is popular among ski enthusiasts.
example.tran: 这个度假地深受滑雪爱好者的喜爱。

sense.def: You use among before a noun to mention a group when talking about a smaller group within it.

example.ex: Among those 18 and over, 510,000 benefit claimants were not unemployed...
example.tran: 18岁及以上人群当中，有51万救济金申领者并非是失业者。

example.ex: Among the varieties available, my preference stays with the old and lovely pink-flowered variety, 'Apple Blossom'.
example.tran: 可供选择的品种当中，我还是偏好这种老式、可爱、带有粉色花朵的类型，“苹果花”。

sense.def: If something applies to a particular person or thing among others, it also applies to other people or things.

example.ex: ...a news conference attended among others by our foreign affairs correspondent...
example.tran: 由我们的外事记者及其他许多人共同出席的一次新闻发布会

example.ex: She knew many theatrical personalities and had worked, among others, with George Bernard Shaw.
example.tran: 她认识许多戏剧界人物，并与乔治·萧伯纳等很多人共过事。

sense.def: If something is shared among a number of people, some of it is given to all of them.

example.ex: Most of the furniture was left to the neighbours or distributed among friends...
example.tran: 大多数家具留给了邻居或分发给了朋友们。

example.ex: She tried to ensure her affection was equally shared among all three children.
example.tran: 她尽力确保三个孩子从自己这里分享到同等的爱。

sense.def: If people talk, fight, or agree among themselves, they do it together, without involving anyone else.
sense.tran: 在…内部（谈论、争斗或达成一致）

example.ex: European farm ministers disagree among themselves...
example.tran: 欧洲各国的农业部长之间意见不一致。

example.ex: The directors have been arguing among themselves.
example.tran: 经理们内部一直争论不休。

boxu.usage: If there are more than two people or things, you should use among or amongst. If there are only two people or things you should use between...an area between Mars and Jupiter. You can also talk about relationships between or among people or things, and discussions between or among people. ...an argument between his mother and another woman. ...an opportunity to discuss these issues amongst themselves. Amongst is a bit old-fashioned. Note that if you are between things or people, the things or people are on either side of you. If you are among or amongst things or people, they are all around you ...the bag standing on the floor between us. ...the sound of a pigeon among the trees.
boxu.tran: 人或物的数量超过两个时应该用among或amongst。要是其数量只有两个，应该用between。例如，an area between Mars and Jupiter（火星和木星之间的区域）。between或among可用来表示人或事物之间的关系或是人们之间的讨论：an argument between his mother and another woman（他母亲和另一个女人之间的争论），an opportunity to discuss these issues amongst themselves（他们内部讨论这些问题的一个机会）。amongst则略显过时。between表示在两者之间。当被人或物包围时，用among或amongst。例如，the bag standing on the floor between us（书包放在我们俩之间的地板上），the sound of a pigeon among the trees（树林里鸽子的叫声）。

sense.def: Amongst means the same as among .
If you describe someone as amoral, you do not like the way they behave because they do not seem to care whether what they do is right or wrong.
sense.tran: 无道德观念的；不辨是非的

example.ex: I strongly disagree with this amoral approach to politics...
example.tran: 我强烈反对这种对待政治不辨是非的态度。

example.ex: The film was violent and amoral.
example.tran: 这部电影非常暴力并且无视道德标准。

example.ex: Anita envied her sister's amorality and contempt for public opinion.
example.tran: 安妮塔羡慕姐姐不受道德观念的制约，藐视公众舆论。

sense.def: If you describe someone's feelings or actions as amorous, you mean that they involve sexual desire.

example.ex: The object of his amorous intentions is Martina.
example.tran: 他想和马丁娜发生性关系。

sense.def: Something that is amorphous has no clear shape or structure.
sense.tran: 无固定形状（或结构）的；不规则的；无组织的

example.ex: A dark, strangely amorphous shadow filled the room.
example.tran: 一团形状怪异的黑影笼罩了整个房间。

example.ex: ...the amorphous mass of the unemployed.
example.tran: 散漫的失业人群

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 amortise

sense.def: In finance, if you amortize a debt, you pay it back in regular payments.

example.ex: Business expenses had to be amortized over a 60 month period.
example.tran: 营业费用必须在60个月的时间内分期偿还。

sense.def: The amount of something is how much there is, or how much you have, need, or get.

example.ex: He needs that amount of money to survive...
example.tran: 他需要那样一笔钱以生存下去。

example.ex: I still do a certain amount of work for them...
example.tran: 我仍然为他们做一些工作。

example.ex: Postal money orders are available in amounts up to $700.
example.tran: 邮政汇票的金额最高可达700美元。

sense.def: If something amounts to a particular total, all the parts of it add up to that total.

example.ex: Consumer spending on sports-related items amounted to £9.75 billion.
example.tran: 消费者在体育相关产品上的花费共计97.5亿英镑。

sense.def: If you say that there is any amount of something, there is a lot of it. If you say that there are any amount of people or things, there are many people or things.

example.ex: I'm able to lay my hands on any amount of cash at a minute's notice...
example.tran: 多少钱我都可以马上弄到。

example.ex: There are any amount of clubs you could join.
example.tran: 有无数个俱乐部你可以加入。

boxu.usage: You should avoid using a plural noun after amount of; instead you should use number of with a plural noun. ...the number of people out of work.
boxu.tran: amount of后不用复数名词，而number of后要用复数名词：the number of people out of work（失业人数）。

sense.def: If you say that one thing amounts to something else, you consider the first thing to be the same as the second thing.

example.ex: The confessions were obtained by what amounts to torture.
example.tran: 这些供状是用近乎逼供的方式得来的。

example.ex: ...a schoolboy comedy, which amounted to little more than slapstick.
example.tran: 接近于打闹剧的校园男孩喜剧

sense.def: An amour is a love affair, especially one which is kept secret.
An amp is the same as an ampere .

example.ex: Use a 3 amp fuse for equipment up to 720 watts.
example.tran: 功率不超过720瓦的设备用3安培的保险丝。

sense.def: An amp is the same as an amplifier .
An amp is the same as an ampoule .

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 ampère

sense.def: An ampere is a unit which is used for measuring electric current. The abbreviation amp is also used.
sense.tran: 安，安培（电流单位，缩略形式为amp）

sense.def: Amphetamine is a drug which increases people's energy, makes them excited, and reduces their desire for food.
Amphibians are animals such as frogs and toads that can live both on land and in water.
An amphibian is a vehicle which is able to move on both land and water, or an aeroplane which can land on both land and water.
In an amphibious military operation, army and navy forces attack a place from the sea.

example.ex: A third brigade is at sea, ready for an amphibious assault.
example.tran: 还有一个旅已在海上待命，准备两栖进攻。

sense.def: An amphibious vehicle is able to move on both land and water.

example.ex: ...an amphibious landing craft which can carry helicopters and up to 2,000 troops.
example.tran: 能运送直升机和多达两千人的部队的水陆两用登陆艇

sense.def: Amphibious animals are animals such as frogs and toads that can live both on land and in water.

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 amphitheater

sense.def: An amphitheatre is a large open area surrounded by rows of seats sloping upwards. Amphitheatres were built mainly in Greek and Roman times for the performance of plays.
sense.tran: （多建于古希腊、古罗马时期的）圆形露天大剧场

sense.def: You can describe land which partly or completely surrounds an open area as an amphitheatre.
sense.tran: （部分或整个被包围的）露天场地，圆形凹地

example.ex: ...a natural amphitheatre of mountains.
example.tran: 被群山环绕的天然露天场地

sense.def: If there is an ample amount of something, there is enough of it and usually some extra.

example.ex: There'll be ample opportunity to relax, swim and soak up some sun...
example.tran: 将会有充足的机会去放松、游泳和晒太阳。

example.ex: The design of the ground floor created ample space for a good-sized kitchen.
example.tran: 底层的设计为建一个大厨房提供了充足的空间。

rnon.hdgr: usu ADV with v, also ADV adj

example.ex: They have been amply rewarded with huge salaries.
example.tran: 高额的薪水给了他们丰厚的回报。

sense.def: If you describe someone's figure as ample, you mean that they are large in a pleasant or attractive way.

example.ex: ...a young mother with a baby resting against her ample bosom.
example.tran: 丰满的怀里抱着婴儿的年轻妈妈

sense.def: An amplifier is an electronic device in a radio or stereo system which causes sounds or signals to get louder.
If you amplify a sound, you make it louder, usually by using electronic equipment.
sense.tran: （通常用电子设备）放大，扩大（声音）

example.ex: This landscape seemed to trap and amplify sounds...
example.tran: 这种地貌好像可以笼住并放大声音。

example.ex: The music was amplified with microphones...
example.tran: 音乐声通过麦克风被放大。

example.ex: 'This is the police,' came the amplified voice from the helicopter.
example.tran: “我们是警察，”直升机上传来扩音器中的声音。

example.ex: ...a voice that needed no amplification.
example.tran: 不需要使用扩音设备的大嗓门

sense.def: To amplify something means to increase its strength or intensity.

example.ex: The mist had been replaced by a kind of haze that seemed to amplify the heat...
example.tran: 薄雾散了，取而代之的是一种似乎更添酷热的烟霭。

example.ex: Her anxiety about the world was amplifying her personal fears about her future.
example.tran: 她对世界的忧虑加剧了她对自己未来的恐惧。

example.ex: ...that amplification of the elements in his character that made him able to dominate her.
example.tran: 他性格中的某些因素不断强化使他得以主宰她

sense.def: In physics, the amplitude of a sound wave or electrical signal is its strength.

example.ex: As we fall asleep the amplitude of brain waves slowly becomes greater.
example.tran: 进入睡眠状态时，我们的脑电波振幅慢慢变大。

sense.def: Amplitude is the quality of being large in size or quantity.

example.ex: ...a man of nineteenth-century amplitude.
example.tran: 有着19世纪的广阔思维的男子

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 ampule

sense.def: An ampoule is a small container, usually made of glass, that contains a drug which will be injected into someone. The abbreviation amp is also used.
sense.tran: 安瓿（装注射药液的小玻璃瓶，缩略形式为amp）

sense.def: To amputate someone's arm or leg means to cut all or part of it off in an operation because it is diseased or badly damaged.

example.ex: To save his life, doctors amputated his legs...
example.tran: 为了挽救他的生命，医生们截掉了他的双腿。

example.ex: He had to have one leg amputated above the knee.
example.tran: 他的一条腿不得不从膝部以上截断。

example.ex: He lived only hours after the amputation.
example.tran: 截肢后，他只活了几个小时。

sense.def: An amputee is someone who has had all or part of an arm or a leg amputated.
An amulet is a small object that you wear or carry because you think it will bring you good luck and protect you from evil or injury.
If something amuses you, it makes you want to laugh or smile.

example.ex: The thought seemed to amuse him...
example.tran: 这种想法好像把他逗乐了。

example.ex: Their antics never fail to amuse.
example.tran: 他们滑稽的举止总是让人发笑。

sense.def: If you amuse yourself, you do something in order to pass the time and not become bored.

example.ex: I need distractions. I need to amuse myself so I won't keep thinking about things...
example.tran: 我需要分散我的注意力。需要消遣一下，让自己不去想这样那样的事。

example.ex: Put a selection of baby toys in his cot to amuse him if he wakes early.
example.tran: 要在婴儿床里放一些玩具，以便他醒得早时可以自己玩。

sense.hdgr:
usu v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
by/at n, ADJ to-inf
sense.def: If you are amused by something, it makes you want to laugh or smile.

example.ex: Sara was not amused by Franklin's teasing...
example.tran: 被富兰克林揶揄之后，萨拉的脸上全无笑意。

example.ex: We were amused to see how assiduously the animal groomed its fur.
example.tran: 看着这只动物如此认真地梳理自己的毛，我们被逗乐了。

sense.def: If you keep someone amused, you find things to do which stop them getting bored.

example.ex: Having pictures to colour will keep children amused for hours...
example.tran: 有画可用来涂色会让孩子们玩很长时间。

example.ex: Archie kept us amused with his stories.
example.tran: 阿奇一直给我们讲故事来逗我们开心。

sense.def: Amusement is the feeling that you have when you think that something is funny or amusing.

example.ex: He stopped and watched with amusement to see the child so absorbed...
example.tran: 他停下来，饶有兴趣地看着孩子如此投入。

example.ex: Steamers tooted at us as sailors on deck waved in amusement.
example.tran: 汽船向我们嘟嘟鸣笛时，甲板上的水手们饶有趣味地挥着手。

sense.def: Amusement is the pleasure that you get from being entertained or from doing something interesting.

example.ex: I stumbled sideways before landing flat on my back, much to the amusement of the rest of the lads...
example.tran: 让其他小伙子们笑不可支的是，我被绊了一跤，身子一歪，结果仰面摔倒在地。

example.ex: She excelled at impersonations, which provided great amusement for him and his friends.
example.tran: 她擅长模仿，给他和他的朋友们带来了很多欢乐。

sense.def: Amusements are ways of passing the time pleasantly.

example.ex: People had very few amusements to choose from. There was no radio, or television.
example.tran: 人们几乎没有什么消遣可以选择。没有广播，也没有电视。

sense.def: Amusements are games, rides, and other things that you can enjoy, for example at a fairground or at the seaside.
sense.tran: （游乐场或海边的）娱乐活动，游戏，消遣活动

example.ex: ...a place full of swings and amusements.
example.tran: 装有秋千并设有许多娱乐活动的地方

sense.def: An amusement arcade is a place where you can play games on machines which work when you put money in them.
An amusement park is the same as a funfair .
Someone or something that is amusing makes you laugh or smile.
sense.tran: 逗人笑的；有乐趣的；好笑的

example.ex: He had a terrific sense of humour and could be very amusing...
example.tran: 他极具幽默感，很会逗人发笑。

example.ex: They recounted amusing stories about their first sexual experiences.
example.tran: 他们讲述了他们第一次性经历的趣事。

example.ex: It must be amusingly written...
example.tran: 必须要把它写得趣味盎然。

example.ex: Recline & Sprawl is an amusingly named furniture shop in London.
example.tran: Recline & Sprawl 是伦敦一家店名有趣的家具店。

sense.def: An is used instead of 'a', the indefinite article, in front of words that begin with vowel sounds.
sense.tran: （在发音以元音开始的单词前，代替不定冠词a）

sense.def: -an is added to the names of some places in order to form adjectives or nouns that refer to people or things which come from that place.
sense.tran: （用于某些地名后构成形容词或名词）表示“…地方的（人或物）”

example.ex: The Australian foreign minister...
example.tran: 澳大利亚外交部长

example.ex: Mitch was a San Franciscan by birth.
example.tran: 米奇出生于旧金山。

sense.def: -an is added to the names of famous people to form adjectives or nouns that refer to people or things which are connected with or typical of that person's work or the time at which they lived.
sense.tran: （用于名人的姓名后构成形容词或名词）表示“…时期的（人）”，“具有…特征的（人）”

example.ex: ...a great Shakespearean actor.
example.tran: 莎士比亚时期一位杰出的演员

example.ex: ...an exhibition of fine Victorian furniture.
example.tran: 维多利亚时代风格的精品家具展

example.ex: ...a tradition perfected by the Elizabethans.
example.tran: 一种被伊丽莎白时期的人完善了的传统

sense.def: Anabolic steroids are drugs which people, especially athletes, take to make their muscles bigger and to give them more strength.
sense.tran: 促蛋白合成甾类；促蛋白合成类固醇

example.ex: He was stripped of his Olympic title after testing positive for anabolic steroids.
example.tran: 在促蛋白合成类固醇检测呈阳性后，他被取消了奥林匹克冠军头衔。

sense.def: You say that something is an anachronism when you think that it is out of date or old-fashioned.
sense.tran: 不合时代的事；过时现象

example.ex: The President tended to regard the Church as an anachronism.
example.tran: 总统常常认为教会属于落伍之物。

sense.def: An anachronism is something in a book, play, or film that is wrong because it did not exist at the time the book, play, or film is set.
sense.tran: 时代错误，年代误植（指所叙人、事与时代不符的错误）

example.ex: The last paragraph contains an anachronism. The Holy Office no longer existed at that time.
example.tran: 最后一段有一个时代错误。异端裁判所那时已经不存在了。

sense.def: You say that something is anachronistic when you think that it is out of date or old-fashioned.

example.ex: Many of its practices seem anachronistic.
example.tran: 它的很多习俗显得落伍过时。

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 anemia

sense.def: Anaemia is a medical condition in which there are too few red cells in your blood, causing you to feel tired and look pale.

example.ex: She suffered from anaemia and even required blood transfusions.
example.tran: 她患有贫血症，甚至需要输血。

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 anemic

sense.def: Someone who is anaemic suffers from anaemia.

example.ex: Losing a lot of blood makes you tired and anaemic.
example.tran: 失血过多会导致你疲劳并且贫血。

sense.def: If you describe something as anaemic, you mean that it is not as strong or effective as you think it should be.
sense.tran: 无力的;无生气的;委顿衰弱的

example.ex: We will see some economic recovery, but it will be very anaemic...
example.tran: 我们将看到经济有所复苏，但这种复苏将是非常无力的。

example.ex: They insist on tastier chocolate than the anaemic British stuff.
example.tran: 他们坚持要比淡而无味的英国货味道更好的巧克力。

sense.def: Anaerobic creatures or processes do not need oxygen in order to function or survive.
sense.tran: 厌氧的；由厌氧菌引起的

example.ex: Anaerobic respiration occurs only in particularly active tissues such as muscles during severe exercise.
example.tran: 厌氧呼吸只有在处于剧烈运动状态的肌肉等特别活跃的组织中才会发生。

sense.def: Anaerobic exercise is exercise such as weight training that improves your strength but does not raise your heart rate.

example.ex: ...an anaerobic workout.
example.tran: 无氧训练

sense.def: Anaesthesia is the use of anaesthetics in medicine and surgery.

example.ex: The operation can be done under local anaesthesia.
example.tran: 该手术可以在局部麻醉的情况下实施。

sense.def: Anaesthetic is a substance that doctors use to stop you feeling pain during an operation, either in the whole of your body when you are unconscious, or in a part of your body when you are awake.

example.ex: The operation is carried out under a general anaesthetic.
example.tran: 该手术是在全身麻醉情况下实施的。

sense.def: An anaesthetist is a doctor who specializes in giving anaesthetics to patients.

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 anesthesiologist
The spellings anesthetize in American English, and anaesthetise in British English are also used. 亦拼作anesthetize（美国英语），或anaesthetise（英国英语）。

sense.def: When a doctor or other trained person anaesthetizes a patient, they make the patient unconscious or unable to feel pain by giving them an anaesthetic.
If something such as a drug anaesthetizes part or all of your body, it makes you unable to feel anything in that part of your body.

example.ex: Alcohol is a potent drug that anaesthetizes the brain.
example.tran: 酒精是一种能麻醉大脑的烈性药物。

sense.def: An anagram is a word or phrase formed by changing the order of the letters in another word or phrase. For example, 'triangle' is an anagram of 'integral'.
sense.tran: 变位词（指变换某个词或短语的字母顺序构成的新词或短语）

sense.def: Anal means relating to the anus of a person or animal.
An analgesic drug reduces the effect of pain.

example.ex: Aloe may have an analgesic effect on inflammation and minor skin irritations.
example.tran: 芦荟可能对发炎以及轻微的皮肤炎症具有镇痛作用。

posc.def: An analgesic is an analgesic drug.

example.ex: The hospital advised an analgesic for chest and shoulder pains.
example.tran: 医院建议用止痛药治疗胸部和肩部疼痛。

sense.def: If one thing is analogous to another, the two things are similar in some way.
sense.tran: 相似的；类似的；可比拟的

example.ex: Marine construction technology like this is very complex, somewhat analogous to trying to build a bridge under water.
example.tran: 像这样的海底建造技术很复杂，与尝试在水下建桥有些相似。

entry.boxr: The spelling analog is used in American English, and also in British English for meaning 2. 拼写analog用于美国英语，在英国英语中用于义项2。

sense.def: If one thing is an analogue of another, it is similar in some way.

example.ex: No model can ever be a perfect analogue of nature itself.
example.tran: 任何模型都无法完全模拟自然本身。

sense.def: Analogue technology involves measuring, storing, or recording an infinitely variable amount of information by using physical quantities such as voltage.

example.ex: The analogue signals from the video tape are converted into digital code.
example.tran: 采自该录像带的模拟信号被转换成数字代码。

sense.def: An analogue watch or clock shows what it is measuring with a pointer on a dial rather than with a number display.
If you make or draw an analogy between two things, you show that they are similar in some way.

example.ex: It is probably easier to make an analogy between the courses of the planets, and two trains travelling in the same direction.
example.tran: 将行星的运行比作两列火车朝同一方向行驶可能更容易些。

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 analyze

sense.def: If you analyse something, you consider it carefully or use statistical methods in order to fully understand it.

example.ex: McCarthy was asked to analyse the data from the first phase of trials of the vaccine...
example.tran: 麦卡锡被要求对第一阶段疫苗试验的数据作出分析。

example.ex: This book teaches you how to analyse what is causing the stress in your life.
example.tran: 这本书教你分析生活压力形成的原因。

sense.def: If you analyse something, you examine it using scientific methods in order to find out what it consists of.

example.ex: We haven't had time to analyse those samples yet...
example.tran: 我们还没有时间分析那些样本。

example.ex: They had their tablets analysed to find out whether they were getting the real drug or not.
example.tran: 他们将药片拿去化验以查明他们得到的是否是真药。

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 analyzer

sense.def: An analyser is a piece of equipment which is used to analyse the substances that are present in something such as a gas.

example.ex: ...an oxygen analyser.
example.tran: 氧气分析器

sense.def: An analyser is someone who analyses information.
Analysis is the process of considering something carefully or using statistical methods in order to understand it or explain it.

example.ex: Her criteria defy analysis...
example.tran: 她的标准让人搞不明白。

example.ex: We did an analysis of the way that government money has been spent in the past.
example.tran: 我们分析了政府资金过去的使用情况。

sense.def: Analysis is the scientific process of examining something in order to find out what it consists of.

example.ex: They collect blood samples for analysis at a national laboratory...
example.tran: 他们采集血样供一个国家实验室进行分析。

example.ex: Jacobsen based his conclusion on an analysis of the decay of samarium-147 into neodymium-143.
example.tran: 雅各布森得出的结论是基于对钐-147衰变成钕-143所作的分析。

sense.def: An analysis is an explanation or description that results from considering something carefully.

example.ex: ...coming up after the newscast, an analysis of President Bush's domestic policy.
example.tran: 在新闻报道之后是对布什总统国内政策的解读

sense.def: You use the expression in the final analysis or in the last analysis to indicate that the statement you are making is the most important or basic aspect of an issue.

example.ex: I'm on the right track and I think in the final analysis people will understand that...
example.tran: 我的思路对头，我认为最终人们会明白的。

example.ex: Violence in the last analysis produces more violence.
example.tran: 暴力最终会产生更多的暴力。

sense.def: An analyst is a person whose job is to analyse a subject and give opinions about it.

example.ex: ...a political analyst.
example.tran: 政治分析家

sense.def: An analyst is someone, usually a doctor, who examines and treats people who are emotionally disturbed.
Analytic means the same as analytical .
An analytical way of doing something involves the use of logical reasoning.

example.ex: I have an analytical approach to every survey.
example.tran: 对每项调查我都采用分析方法。

example.ex: A teacher can encourage children to think analytically.
example.tran: 老师可鼓励学生进行分析思考。

sense.def: Analytical research involves using chemical analysis.

example.ex: All raw materials are subjected to our latest analytical techniques.
example.tran: 所有的原材料都将用我们最新的分析技术进行解析。

sense.def: If you describe someone or something as anarchic, you disapprove of them because they do not recognize or obey any rules or laws.
sense.tran: 无政府的；无法无天的；无秩序的

example.ex: ...anarchic attitudes and complete disrespect for authority.
example.tran: 无政府态度和对权威的全然不尊重

sense.def: Anarchism is the belief that the laws and power of governments should be replaced by people working together freely.

example.ex: He advocated anarchism as the answer to social problems.
example.tran: 他提倡以无政府主义来解决社会问题。

sense.def: An anarchist is a person who believes in anarchism.

example.ex: West Berlin always had a large anarchist community.
example.tran: 西柏林一直有一个庞大的无政府主义群体。

example.ex: ...a well-known anarchist poet.
example.tran: 知名的无政府主义诗人

sense.def: If someone has anarchist beliefs or views, they believe in anarchism.

example.ex: He was apparently quite converted from his anarchist views.
example.tran: 显然他基本上完全放弃无政府主义的观点了。

sense.def: If you say that someone is an anarchist, you disapprove of them because they seem to pay no attention to the rules or laws that everyone else obeys.
sense.tran: 无法无天的人；扰乱分子

example.ex: He was a social anarchist.
example.tran: 他是个社会扰乱分子。

sense.def: An anarchistic person believes in anarchism. Anarchistic activity or literature promotes anarchism.

example.ex: ...an anarchistic revolutionary movement.
example.tran: 无政府主义的革命运动

sense.def: If you describe someone as anarchistic, you disapprove of them because they pay no attention to the rules or laws that everyone else obeys.
sense.tran: 无法无天的；扰乱分子的

example.ex: The Hell's Angels were once the most notorious and anarchistic of motorbike gangs.
example.tran: “地狱天使”曾是飞车党中最臭名昭著和无法无天的一伙。

sense.def: Anarcho- combines with nouns and adjectives to form words indicating that something is both anarchistic and the other thing that is mentioned.
sense.tran: （构成复合名词或形容词）表示“无政府主义者和…”

example.ex: In France there was a long tradition of anarchosyndicalism.
example.tran: 在法国无政府工团主义的传统由来已久。

sense.def: If you describe a situation as anarchy, you mean that nobody seems to be paying any attention to rules or laws.
sense.tran: 无政府（状态）；无法无天；无秩序；混乱

example.ex: Civil war and famine sent the nation plunging into anarchy.
example.tran: 内战和饥荒使该国陷入了无政府状态。

example.ex: In June, 1960, the Congo was plunged into five years of civil war and political anarchy.
example.tran: 1960年的6月，刚果陷入了5年的内战和政治上的无政府状态。

sense.def: If something is anathema to you, you strongly dislike it.

example.ex: Violence was anathema to them.
example.tran: 他们对暴力深恶痛绝。

sense.def: Anatomical means relating to the structure of the bodies of people and animals.
sense.tran: 解剖的；（人体或动物体）结构上的

example.ex: ...minute anatomical differences between insects.
example.tran: 昆虫身体结构之间的细微差别

example.ex: I need my pictures to be anatomically correct.
example.tran: 我要我的相片比例适当。

sense.def: An anatomist is an expert in anatomy.

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 anatomise

sense.def: If you anatomise a subject or an issue, you examine it in great detail.

example.ex: The magazine is devoted to anato-mizing the inadequacies of liberalism.
example.tran: 该杂志致力于剖析自由主义的不足之处。

sense.def: Anatomy is the study of the structure of the bodies of people or animals.
You can refer to your body as your anatomy.

example.ex: The ball hit him in the most sensitive part of his anatomy.
example.tran: 球击中了他身上最敏感的部位。

sense.def: An animal's anatomy is the structure of its body.

example.ex: He had worked extensively on the anatomy of living animals.
example.tran: 他在活体解剖方面经验丰富。

sense.def: The anatomy of a subject or an idea is an examination or investigation of it.

example.ex: This was a troubling essay on the anatomy of nationhood.
example.tran: 这是一篇剖析民族主义的让人不安的文章。

sense.def: Your ancestors are the people from whom you are descended.

example.ex: ...our daily lives, so different from those of our ancestors...
example.tran: 与我们祖先的生活有着天壤之别的我们的日常生活

example.ex: He could trace his ancestors back seven hundred years.
example.tran: 他的先祖可以上溯到700年前。

sense.def: An ancestor of something modern is an earlier thing from which it developed.

example.ex: The direct ancestor of the modern cat was the Kaffir cat of ancient Egypt...
example.tran: 现代猫的直系原种是古埃及的卡菲尔猫。

example.ex: The immediate ancestor of rock 'n' roll is rhythm-and-blues.
example.tran: 摇滚乐直接源自节奏布鲁斯。

sense.def: You use ancestral to refer to a person's family in former times, especially when the family is important and has property or land which they have had for a long time.

example.ex: ...the family's ancestral home in southern Germany.
example.tran: 这个家族在德国南部的祖居

example.ex: ...the ancestral portraits in the hallway.
example.tran: 走廊里祖先的画像

sense.def: Your ancestry is the fact that you are descended from certain people.

example.ex: ...a family who could trace their ancestry back to the sixteenth century.
example.tran: 世系可上溯到16世纪的家族

sense.def: An anchor is a heavy hooked object that is dropped from a boat into the water at the end of a chain in order to make the boat stay in one place.
When a boat anchors or when you anchor it, its anchor is dropped into the water in order to make it stay in one place.

example.ex: We could anchor off the pier...
example.tran: 我们可以在码头附近下锚停泊。

example.ex: They anchored the boat.
example.tran: 他们抛锚停船。

sense.def: If you anchor an object somewhere, you fix it to something to prevent it moving from that place.

example.ex: The roots anchor the plant in the earth...
example.tran: 根部使植物固定在土壤中。

example.ex: The child seat belt was not properly anchored to the car.
example.tran: 儿童坐椅的安全带并未在车上固定到位。

sense.def: If one thing is the anchor for something else, it makes that thing stable and secure.
sense.tran: 固定桩；系缚物；支柱；靠山

example.ex: He provided an emotional anchor for her...
example.tran: 他是她的精神支柱。

example.ex: He remains the anchor of the country's fragile political balance.
example.tran: 他仍然是维系该国脆弱的政治平衡的支柱。

sense.def: If something is anchored in something or to something, it has strong links with it.
sense.tran: 与…有紧密联系;使扎根;使固守

example.ex: A united Germany must be firmly anchored in NATO if Europe is to remain stable...
example.tran: 欧洲要保持稳定，德国必须统一并固守北约。

example.ex: His basic outlook remains anchored in the liberal tradition.
example.tran: 他的基本观念依旧扎根于自由主义传统。

sense.def: The person who anchors a television or radio programme, especially a news programme, is the person who presents it and acts as a link between interviews and reports which come from other places or studios.
sense.tran: 主持（电视或电台节目，尤指新闻节目）

example.ex: Viewers saw him anchoring a five-minute summary of regional news.
example.tran: 观众看见他主持一个5分钟的地方新闻摘要节目。

example.ex: ...a series of cassettes on the Vietnam War, anchored by Mr. Cronkite.
example.tran: 克朗凯特先生主持的关于越南战争的系列节目录像带

sense.def: The anchor on a television or radio programme, especially a news programme, is the person who presents it.
sense.tran: （尤指新闻节目的）电（视）台节目主持人

example.ex: He worked in the news division of ABC — he was the anchor of its 15-minute evening newscast.
example.tran: 他在美国广播公司的新闻部工作——他是晚间15分钟新闻播报的主持人。

phrase.def: If a boat is at anchor, it is floating in a particular place and is prevented from moving by its anchor.

example.ex: Sailing boats lay at anchor in the narrow waterway.
example.tran: 帆船停泊在狭窄的水道上。

phrase.def: When the people on a boat drop anchor or cast anchor, they drop the boat's anchor into the water in order to prevent the boat from moving.

example.ex: We dropped anchor in a sheltered spot.
example.tran: 我们在一个能够遮风挡雨的地方下了锚。

phrase.def: When the people on a boat weigh anchor or up anchor, they pull the anchor of the boat out of the water so that they can sail away.

sense.def: An anchorage is a place where a boat can anchor safely.

example.ex: The nearest safe anchorage was in Halifax, Nova Scotia...
example.tran: 最近的安全泊地在新斯科舍省的哈利法克斯。

example.ex: The vessel yesterday reached anchorage off Dubai.
example.tran: 船昨天到达了迪拜附近的泊地。

sense.def: The anchorman on a television or radio programme, especially a news programme, is the person who presents it.
sense.tran: （尤指新闻节目的）电（视）台节目主持人

sense.def: The anchorwoman on a television or radio programme, especially a news programme, is the woman who presents it.
sense.tran: （尤指新闻节目的）电（视）台节目女主持人

sense.def: Anchovies are small fish that live in the sea. They are often eaten salted.
sense.tran: 鳀（小型海鱼，常用盐腌制后食用）

example.ex: ...a tin of anchovies.
example.tran: 一罐鳀鱼

example.ex: ...anchovy fillets.
example.tran: 去骨鳀鱼片

sense.def: The an-cien regime was the political and social system in France before the revolution of 1789.
If a country has had the same political system for a long time and you disapprove of it, you can refer to it as the ancien regime .
Ancient means belonging to the distant past, especially to the period in history before the end of the Roman Empire.

example.ex: They believed ancient Greece and Rome were vital sources of learning.
example.tran: 他们认为古代希腊罗马是知识的重要发源地。

example.ex: Salisbury Plain was known anciently as Ellendune.
example.tran: 索尔兹伯里平原在古代被称为Ellendune。

sense.def: Ancient means very old, or having existed for a long time.

example.ex: ...ancient Jewish tradition.
example.tran: 古老的犹太传统

example.ex: ...ancient fishing rights.
example.tran: 由来已久的捕鱼权

example.ex: ...a few acres of ancient woodland.
example.tran: 几英亩古老的林地

sense.def: The ancients are the people of an old civilization, especially classical Greece or Rome.
sense.tran: 古代人；（尤指）古希腊人，古罗马人

example.ex: The ancients knew more than we do about the heavens.
example.tran: 古代人对于上天比我们知道得多。

sense.def: Ancient history is the history of ancient civilizations, especially Greece and Rome.
If you describe something as ancient history, you mean that it happened in the past and is no longer relevant to the present.
sense.tran: （发生在过去，与现在无关的）旧闻，陈年老账

example.ex: It does not bother me now at all. It is all ancient history.
example.tran: 现在它丝毫不让我感到烦恼。它只不过是陈年老账。

sense.def: The ancillary workers in an institution are the people such as cleaners and cooks whose work supports the main work of the institution.

example.ex: ...ancillary staff.
example.tran: 后勤人员

example.ex: ...ancillary services like cleaning.
example.tran: 清洁等后勤工作

example.ex: ...ancillaries who look after the children in the playground.
example.tran: 在操场上看护孩子们的后勤人员

sense.def: Ancillary means additional to something else.

example.ex: Ancillary charges are at least $30 per day...
example.tran: 附加收费每天至少30美元。

example.ex: Scientific development meant the growth of numerous professions ancillary to medicine.
example.tran: 科技发展意味着许多医学衍生职业的增长。

example.ex: Ancillaries can force the bill up rather alarmingly.
example.tran: 附加项目能使账单费用出现惊人的增长。

sense.def: You use and to link two or more words, groups, or clauses.
sense.tran: （连接两个以上的单词、词组或子句）和，与，同

example.ex: When he returned, she and Simon had already gone...
example.tran: 他回来时，她和西蒙已经走了。

example.ex: Between 1914 and 1920 large parts of Albania were occupied by the Italians...
example.tran: 在1914年至1920年间阿尔巴尼亚的大部分地区被意大利人占据。

example.ex: I'm going to write good jokes and become a good comedian...
example.tran: 我打算写一些精彩的笑话，成为出色的喜剧作家。

example.ex: I'm 53 and I'm very happy.
example.tran: 我53岁而且我很幸福。

sense.def: You use and to link two words or phrases that are the same in order to emphasize the degree of something, or to suggest that something continues or increases over a period of time.
sense.tran: （连接两个相同的单词或短语，以强调某事物的程度、暗示某事继续发生或在一段时间内不断增加）接连，越…越…

example.ex: Learning becomes more and more difficult as we get older...
example.tran: 随着年龄增长，学习变得越来越难。

example.ex: Day by day I am getting better and better...
example.tran: 我在一天天地好转。

example.ex: We talked for hours and hours...
example.tran: 我们谈了很久很久。

example.ex: He lay down on the floor and cried and cried.
example.tran: 他躺在地板上，哭个不停。

sense.def: You use and to link two statements about events when one of the events follows the other.
sense.tran: （连接两件相继发生的事件）然后，就

example.ex: I waved goodbye and went down the stone harbour steps...
example.tran: 我挥手告别，然后走下港口石阶。

example.ex: He asked for ice for his whiskey and proceeded to get drunk.
example.tran: 他要求给他的威士忌里面加冰，接着喝得大醉。

sense.def: You use and to link two statements when the second statement continues the point that has been made in the first statement.
sense.tran: （连接两句话，第二句话的意思是第一句的延伸）则，而

example.ex: You could only really tell the effects of the disease in the long term, and five years wasn't long enough...
example.tran: 真的，这种病只能在很久以后才能看出它的影响，而5年的时间还不够长。

example.ex: The cure for bad teaching is good teachers, and good teachers cost money.
example.tran: 解决教学质量差的办法就是请好的教师，但请好的教师是需要花钱的。

sense.def: You use and to link two clauses when the second clause is a result of the first clause.
sense.tran: （连接两个从句，表示因果关系）那么，于是

example.ex: All through yesterday crowds have been arriving and by midnight thousands of people packed the square.
example.tran: 昨天陆续有大批人到来，午夜时有几千人聚集在广场上。

sense.def: You use and to interrupt yourself in order to make a comment on what you are saying.
sense.tran: （表示停顿，以便对所说的话进行评论）再说，而

example.ex: As Downing claims, and as we noted above, reading is best established when the child has an intimate knowledge of the language...
example.tran: 如唐宁所说，也正如我们前文所指出的，当孩子对语言非常熟悉时，阅读的效果最佳。

example.ex: Finally — and I really ought to stop in a minute — I wish to make the following recommendations.
example.tran: 最后——我确实应该停一下——我想作以下推荐。

sense.def: You use and at the beginning of a sentence to introduce something else that you want to add to what you have just said. Some people think that starting a sentence with and is ungrammatical, but it is now quite common in both spoken and written English.
sense.tran: （用于句首，引出补充说明）还有，不过

example.ex: Commuter airlines fly to out-of-the-way places. And business travelers are the ones who go to those locations.
example.tran: 支线航空公司航班飞往偏僻地区。商务旅客就是会前往那些地区的人。

sense.def: You use and to introduce a question which follows logically from what someone has just said.
sense.tran: （用以引导与某人之谈话有关的问句）那么，还有

example.ex: 'He used to be so handsome.' — 'And now?'...
example.tran: “他以前是那么英俊。”——“那么现在呢？”

example.ex: 'Well, of course, they haven't won a football game.' — 'And what would you expect?'.
example.tran: “嗯，当然，他们一场足球比赛也没有赢过。”——“那么你所期望的是什么呢？”

sense.def: And is used by broadcasters and people making announcements to change a topic or to start talking about a topic they have just mentioned.
sense.tran: （广播员等用以转换话题或讨论刚才提及的话题）也

example.ex: And now the drought in Sudan...
example.tran: 现在苏丹也有旱情。

example.ex: Football, and Aston Villa will reclaim their lead at the top of the English First Division.
example.tran: 来看足球，阿斯顿维拉队将在英格兰甲级联赛重登榜首。

sense.def: You use and to indicate that two numbers are to be added together.

example.ex: What does two and two make?
example.tran: 2加2等于几？

sense.def: And is used before a fraction that comes after a whole number.

example.ex: McCain spent five and a half years in a prisoner of war camp in Vietnam.
example.tran: 麦凯恩在越南的战俘营里度过了5年半的时间。

example.ex: ...fourteen and a quarter per cent.

sense.def: You use and in numbers larger than one hundred, after the words 'hundred' or 'thousand' and before other numbers.
sense.tran: （用在大于一百的数字中，置于百位或千位之后，十位及个位之前）

example.ex: We printed two hundred and fifty invitations.
example.tran: 我们印了250份请柬。

example.ex: ...three thousand and twenty-six pounds.

sense.def: Andante written above a piece of music means that it should be played fairly slowly.
An andante is a piece of music that is played fairly slowly.

example.ex: ...the lovely central Andante.
example.tran: 中间部动听的行板

example.ex: ...the violas' Andante theme.
example.tran: 中提琴的行板主旋律

sense.def: In biology, an androgynous person, animal, or plant has both male and female sexual characteristics.
sense.tran: （人、动物或植物）有两性特征的，雌雄同体的，雌雄同序的

sense.def: If you describe someone as androgynous, you mean that they are not distinctly masculine or feminine in appearance or in behaviour.
sense.tran: 兼具两性的；双性并存的；男女不分的

example.ex: Belinda was always attracted to men with an androgynous quality to them...
example.tran: 贝琳达常能以自己的中性特质令男人倾心。

example.ex: The style was quite androgynous.
example.tran: 这种风格较为中性。

sense.def: Androgyny is the state of being neither distinctly masculine nor distinctly feminine.
In science fiction books and films, an android is a robot that looks like a human being.
sense.tran: （科幻小说或电影中的）机器人偶，仿真机器人

sense.def: Anecdotal evidence is based on individual accounts, rather than on reliable research or statistics, and so may not be valid.

example.ex: Anecdotal evidence suggests that sales in Europe have slipped.
example.tran: 传闻有证据表明欧洲的销售量已经下滑。

example.ex: ...countless anecdotal reports.
example.tran: 无数的八卦消息

sense.def: Anecdotal speech or writing is full of anecdotes or is based on anecdotes.
sense.tran: （讲演或写作）含轶事的，多轶闻的

example.ex: Gray's book is anecdotal and entertaining.
example.tran: 格雷的书中尽是些八卦消息，颇具娱乐性。

sense.def: An anecdote is a short, amusing account of something that has happened.

example.ex: Pete was telling them an anecdote about their mother...
example.tran: 皮特正在给他们讲一件他们母亲的趣闻。

example.ex: He has a talent for recollection and anecdote.
example.tran: 他在记忆力和讲述趣闻轶事方面颇具天赋。

sense.def: Anecdotes are individual accounts of something that are not reliable evidence.

example.ex: The image of the fox as a pest is grossly exaggerated in anecdote and folklore.
example.tran: 狐狸的害人精形象在传闻和民间故事中遭到严重的夸大。

sense.def: An anemone is a garden plant with red, purple, or white flowers.
sense.tran: 银莲花，风花（花色分红、紫、白等颜色的园圃植物）

sense.def: An anesthesiologist is a doctor who specializes in giving anaesthetics to patients.

entry.boxr: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 anaesthetist

sense.def: An anesthetist is a nurse or other person who gives an anaesthetic to a patient.
If you do something anew, you do it again, often in a different way from before.

example.ex: She's ready to start anew...
example.tran: 她准备重新开始。

example.ex: He began his work anew.
example.tran: 他重新开始工作。

sense.def: Angels are spiritual beings that some people believe are God's servants in heaven.
You can call someone you like very much an angel in order to show affection, especially when they have been kind to you or done you a favour.
sense.tran: （尤用于得到友好对待或帮助时）大好人，大善人

example.ex: Thank you a thousand times, you're an angel.
example.tran: 万分感谢，你真是个大好人。

sense.def: If you describe someone as an angel, you mean that they seem to be very kind and good.

example.ex: Poppa thought her an angel...
example.tran: 爸爸视她为小天使。

example.ex: He was such an angel to put up with it.
example.tran: 他这都能忍，真是个大好人。

phrase.def: If you say that someone is on the side of the angels, you believe very strongly that what they are doing is right.

example.ex: Billy is on the side of the angels when it comes to racial tolerance.
example.tran: 说起种族间的包容，比利可真是宅心仁厚。

phrase.def: If you say that someone rushes in where angels fear to tread, you are criticizing them gently because they get themselves into dangerous or difficult situations without thinking carefully enough about what they are doing.
phrase.tran: 愚蠢地冒险;鲁莽行事;暴虎冯河

example.ex: Martin is inclined to rush in where angels fear to tread.
example.tran: 马丁总是喜欢贸然行事。

sense.def: You can describe someone as angelic if they are, or seem to be, very good, kind, and gentle.
sense.tran: 天使般的；善良的；温柔的

example.ex: ...an angelic face...
example.tran: 天使般的脸蛋儿

example.ex: He looked angelic.
example.tran: 他看上去善良温柔。

sense.def: Angelic means like angels or relating to angels.

example.ex: ...angelic choirs.
example.tran: 天籁之音唱诗班

sense.def: Angelica is the candied stems of the angelica plant which can be used in making cakes or sweets.
sense.tran: 糖渍白芷（可用于做蛋糕或糖果）

sense.def: Anger is the strong emotion that you feel when you think that someone has behaved in an unfair, cruel, or unacceptable way.

example.ex: He cried with anger and frustration...
example.tran: 他愤怒而又沮丧得哭了起来。

example.ex: Ellen felt both despair and anger at her mother.
example.tran: 埃伦对她的母亲感到既绝望又生气。

sense.def: If something angers you, it makes you feel angry.

example.ex: The decision to allow more offshore oil drilling angered some Californians.
example.tran: 允许进行更多近海石油钻探的决定激怒了一些加利福尼亚人。

sense.def: Anger management is a set of guidelines that are designed to help people control their anger.

example.ex: ...anger management courses
example.tran: 制怒课程

sense.def: Angina is severe pain in the chest and left arm, caused by heart disease.
An angle is the difference in direction between two lines or surfaces. Angles are measured in degrees.

example.ex: The boat is now leaning at a 30 degree angle.
example.tran: 船正以30度角倾斜。

sense.def: An angle is the shape that is created where two lines or surfaces join together.
sense.tran: （两条线或两个平面相交的）夹角，边角

example.ex: ...the angle of the blade.
example.tran: 刀口的夹角

example.ex: ...brackets to adjust the steering wheel's angle.
example.tran: 用于调整方向盘角度的支架

sense.def: An angle is the direction from which you look at something.

example.ex: Thanks to the angle at which he stood, he could just see the sunset...
example.tran: 由于站的位置视角好，他刚好能看见日落。

example.ex: His face will be discreetly concealed by camera angles.
example.tran: 通过调整照相机的角度，他的脸将被巧妙地遮住。

sense.def: You can refer to a way of presenting something or thinking about it as a particular angle .
sense.tran: 角度；观点；立场；侧重点；倾向性

example.ex: We had to do the scene over and over again, from different angles...
example.tran: 我们不得不翻来覆去地从不同的角度拍这个场面。

example.ex: He was considering the idea from all angles.
example.tran: 他正从各个角度考虑这个想法。

sense.def: If someone is angling for something, they are trying to get it without asking for it directly.

example.ex: It sounds as if he's just angling for sympathy.
example.tran: 听起来好像他只是在博取同情。

sense.def: If you angle something or if it angles in a particular direction, it faces or points in that direction.

example.ex: You can open the slats for a bright light or angle them for more shade...
example.tran: 可以调节百叶窗使光线亮一些，也可以暗一些。

example.ex: The path angled downhill and northwards...
example.tran: 小路向山下伸展，然后向北延伸。

example.ex: He drove down the long, steeply angled driveway.
example.tran: 他驱车从又长又陡的车道驶下。

sense.def: If something is at an angle, it is leaning in a particular direction so that it is not straight, horizontal, or vertical.

example.ex: An iron bar stuck out at an angle...
example.tran: 一根铁棍斜伸出来。

example.ex: The wall's at a slight angle.
example.tran: 这面墙有点歪。

sense.def: An angler is someone who fishes with a fishing rod as a hobby.
Anglican means belonging or relating to the Church of England, or to the churches related to it.

example.ex: ...the Anglican Church.
example.tran: 圣公会

example.ex: ...an Anglican priest.
example.tran: 圣公会牧师

example.ex: ...the Anglican community.
example.tran: 英国国教会团体

sense.def: An Anglican is a Christian who is a member of the Church of England, or of one of the churches related to it.

example.ex: Both my parents were devout Anglicans.
example.tran: 我的父母都是虔诚的圣公会教徒。

sense.def: Anglicanism is the beliefs and practices of the Church of England, and of the churches related to it.

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 anglicise

sense.def: If you anglicize something, you change it so that it resembles or becomes part of the English language or English culture.
sense.tran: （在语言或风俗习惯方面）使英语化，使英国化

example.ex: He had anglicized his surname...
example.tran: 他已将他的姓氏英语化了。

example.ex: When Dutch colonial rule ended in the 19th century the civil service was anglicised.
example.tran: 荷兰殖民统治在19世纪结束时，文职部门已被英国化了。

example.ex: ...an Anglicised version of the Welsh name 'Llywelyn'.
example.tran: 威尔士名字Llywelyn的英语化版本

sense.def: Angling is the activity or sport of fishing with a fishing rod.
Anglo- combines with adjectives indicating nationality to form adjectives which describe something connected with relations between Britain and another country.
sense.tran: （加在表示国家、民族的形容词之前构成新的形容词）表示“英国的”，“英国和…的”

example.ex: ...the future of Anglo-American relations.
example.tran: 英美关系的未来

example.ex: ...the Anglo-Irish Agreement.
example.tran: 《英爱协议》

sense.def: Anglo- combines with adjectives indicating nationality to form adjectives which describe a person who has one British parent and one non-British parent.
sense.tran: （加在表示国家、民族的形容词之前构成新的形容词）表示“英裔的”

example.ex: He was born of Anglo-American parentage.
example.tran: 他是英美混血儿。

sense.def: An Anglo-Asian person is someone of Indian, Pakistani, or Bangladeshi origin who has grown up in Britain.
sense.tran: 侨居英国有亚洲血统的；亚裔英国的

example.ex: ...the Anglo-Asian community.
example.tran: 亚裔英国人群体

posc.def: An Anglo-Asian is someone who is Anglo-Asian.

sense.def: The Anglo-Catholic part of the Church of England, or of the churches related to it, is the part whose beliefs and practices are similar to those of the Catholic Church.
sense.tran: （仍坚持承袭天主教传统的）英国国教高教会派的

example.ex: ...a parish in the Anglo-Catholic tradition.
example.tran: 英国国教高教会派的牧师

sense.def: An Anglo-Catholic is a Christian who belongs to the Anglo-Catholic section of the Church of England, or to the churches related to it.
sense.tran: 英国国教高教会派教徒

sense.def: An Anglo-Indian person is someone whose family is partly British and partly Indian.

example.ex: ...Anglo-Indian writer Amitav Ghosh.
example.tran: 英印混血作家阿米塔夫·高希

sense.def: An Anglo-Indian is someone who is Anglo-Indian.
If you describe a non-British person as Anglophile, you mean that they admire Britain and British culture.

example.ex: ...a Shake-speare sonnet taught to him by his Anglophile uncle.
example.tran: 他那亲英的叔叔教给他的一首莎士比亚的十四行诗
