example.ex: He became a fanatical Anglophile.
example.tran: 他成为狂热的亲英分子。

sense.def: Anglophone communities are English-speaking communities in areas where more than one language is commonly spoken.
sense.tran: （使用多种语言的地区里）讲英语的

example.ex: ...anglophone Canadians.
example.tran: 说英语的加拿大人

example.ex: ...anglophone Africa.
example.tran: 非洲的英语社区

sense.def: Anglophones are people whose native language is English or who speak English because they live in a country where English is one of the official languages.
sense.tran: （指母语为英语或因所在国的官方语言为英语而）讲英语的人

example.ex: It's felt there's no future for Anglophones in the province.
example.tran: 让人感觉在这个省讲英语的人是没有前途的。

example.ex: ...sub-Sahara Anglophones.
example.tran: 撒哈拉沙漠以南讲英语的人

sense.def: The Anglo-Saxon period is the period of English history from the fifth century A.D. to the Norman Conquest in 1066.
sense.tran: 盎格鲁-撒克逊的（指英国从公元5世纪至1066年诺曼征服这段时期）

example.ex: Excavations have revealed Roman and Anglo-Saxon remains in the area.
example.tran: 挖掘工作已显示在该地区有罗马和盎格鲁-撒克逊时代的遗迹。

example.ex: ...the grave of an early Anglo-Saxon king.
example.tran: 一位早期盎格鲁-撒克逊国王的坟墓

posc.def: An Anglo-Saxon was someone who was Anglo-Saxon.

example.ex: ...the mighty sea power of the Anglo-Saxons.
example.tran: 盎格鲁-撒克逊人强大的海上力量

sense.def: Anglo-Saxon people are members of or are descended from the English race.
sense.tran: 盎格鲁-撒克逊族的;英国血统的

example.ex: ...white Anglo-Saxon Protestant men.
example.tran: 信仰新教的英国白种男人

example.ex: The difference is, you are Anglo-Saxons, we are Latins.
example.tran: 差异在于，你们是英国血统，而我们是拉丁裔的。

sense.def: Anglo-Saxon attitudes or ideas have been strongly influenced by English culture.

example.ex: Debilly had no Anglo-Saxon shyness about discussing money.
example.tran: 在谈到钱时，德比利毫无英国式的羞涩。

sense.def: Anglo-Saxon is the language that was spoken in England between the fifth century A.D. and the Norman Conquest in 1066.
sense.tran: （指英格兰自公元5世纪至1066年诺曼征服这段时期的）盎格鲁-撒克逊语，古英语

sense.def: Angolan means belonging or relating to Angola or its people.

example.ex: ...the Angolan government.
example.tran: 安哥拉政府

sense.def: An Angolan is someone who comes from Angola.

example.ex: Angolans are worrying about a return to war.
example.tran: 安哥拉人担心战火重燃。

sense.def: An angora goat or rabbit is a particular breed that has long silky hair.
sense.tran: （山羊或兔）安哥拉种的（长有光亮的长毛）

sense.def: Angora cloth or clothing is made from the hair of the angora goat or rabbit.
sense.tran: 安哥拉山羊毛；安哥拉兔毛

example.ex: ...an angora sweater.
example.tran: 安哥拉山羊毛毛衣

sense.hdgr:
usu v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
at/with/about n
sense.def: When you are angry, you feel strong dislike or impatience about something.

example.ex: She had been very angry at the person who stole her new bike...
example.tran: 她很生气有人偷走了她的新自行车。

example.ex: Are you angry with me for some reason?...
example.tran: 你是因为什么原因在生我的气吗？

example.ex: I was angry about the rumours...
example.tran: 我对于这些谣言很愤怒。

example.ex: He's angry that people have called him a racist...
example.tran: 人们把他叫做种族主义者，他对此愤愤不平。

example.ex: An angry mob gathered outside the courthouse.
example.tran: 一群愤怒的暴民聚集在法院外。

example.ex: Officials reacted angrily to those charges...
example.tran: 官员们对那些指控很生气。

example.ex: Health workers are angrily demanding higher pay.
example.tran: 医务人员正怒气冲冲地要求增加工资。

sense.def: An angry wound or rash is red and painful.

example.ex: He was badly concussed, the glass leaving two angry cuts across his forehead.
example.tran: 他遭受了严重的脑震荡，脑门上留下的两道被玻璃划破的口子已经红肿。

sense.def: If you describe the sky or sea as angry, you mean that it is dark and stormy.
sense.tran: （天空或海洋）天昏地暗的，狂风暴雨的

boxu.usage: Angry is normally used to talk about some-one's mood or feelings on a particular occasion. If someone is often angry, you can describe them as bad-tempered. She's a bad-tempered young lady. If someone is very angry, you can describe them as furious. Senior police officers are furious at the blunder. If they are less angry, you can describe them as annoyed or irritated. The Premier looked annoyed but calm. ...a man irritated by the barking of his neighbour's dog. Typically, someone is irritated by something because it happens constantly or continually. If someone is often irritated, you can describe them as irritable.
boxu.tran: angry通常指某人在某种特定情况下的情绪或感觉。经常生气的人可被形容为bad-tempered：She’s a bad-tempered young lady（她是个爱发脾气的少妇）。如果某人非常生气，则可用furious形容：Senior police officers are furious at the blunder (高级警官们因为这个大错大发雷霆）。若不是特别生气，可用annoyed或irritated形容：The Premier looked annoyed but calm（总理看起来有些恼火，但还是很镇静），a man irritated by the barking of his neighbour’s dog（被邻居家狗的叫声搞得很烦躁的男人）。通常某人会因某事持续或不断发生感到irritated。如果某人常常发脾气，则可用irritable形容。

sense.def: Angst is a feeling of anxiety and worry.

example.ex: Many kids suffer from acne and angst.
example.tran: 许多年轻人都会受到青春痘和焦虑的困扰。

sense.def: Anguish is great mental suffering or physical pain.
sense.tran: （精神上的）悲痛；（身体上的）剧痛

example.ex: A cry of anguish burst from her lips...
example.tran: 她突然痛苦地大叫了一声。

example.ex: Mark looked at him in anguish.
example.tran: 马克痛苦地看着他。

sense.def: Anguished means showing or feeling great mental suffering or physical pain.

example.ex: She let out an anguished cry.
example.tran: 她痛苦地大叫了一声。

example.ex: ...an anguished mother.
example.tran: 伤心欲绝的母亲

sense.def: Angular things have shapes that seem to contain a lot of straight lines and sharp points.

example.ex: He had an angular face with prominent cheekbones.
example.tran: 他的脸棱角分明，颧骨突出。

example.ex: ...the angularity of her face.
example.tran: 她瘦削的脸庞

sense.def: An animal is a living creature such as a dog, lion, or rabbit, rather than a bird, fish, insect, or human being.
sense.tran: （除鸟、鱼、昆虫或人类之外的）动物，兽类

example.ex: He was attacked by wild animals...
example.tran: 他遭到野兽的袭击。

example.ex: He had a real knowledge of animals, birds and flowers.
example.tran: 他在花鸟走兽方面知之甚多。

sense.def: Any living creature other than a human being can be referred to as an animal .
sense.tran: 动物（泛指人类以外的任何生物）

example.ex: Language is something which fundamentally distinguishes humans from animals.
example.tran: 语言是将人类与动物区分开来的基本特征。

example.ex: ...a habitat for plants and animals.
example.tran: 动植物的栖息地

sense.def: Any living creature, including a human being, can be referred to as an animal .
sense.tran: 动物（包括人类在内的任何生物）

example.ex: Watch any young human being, or any other young animal.
example.tran: 注意儿童或其他幼小动物。

sense.def: Animal products come from animals rather than from plants.
sense.tran: 动物的；野兽的；取自动物的

example.ex: The illegal trade in animal products continues to flourish...
example.tran: 野生动物制品的非法交易仍旧猖獗。

example.ex: Cut down on animal fats found in red meat, hard cheeses and so on.
example.tran: 减少摄入存在于红色肉类、硬干酪等中的动物脂肪。

sense.def: If you say that someone is an animal, you find their behaviour disgusting or very unpleasant.

example.ex: This man is an animal, a beast...
example.tran: 这人是个畜生，是个野兽。

example.ex: He was an animal in his younger days.
example.tran: 他年轻时，是个衣冠禽兽。

sense.def: Animal qualities, feelings, or abilities relate to someone's physical nature and instincts rather than to their mind.
sense.tran: 肉体的；肉欲的；动物的；非理性的

example.ex: There was no doubting the animal magnetism of the man...
example.tran: 这个男人无疑有一种野性的魅力。

example.ex: You feel an animal panic to run and hide.
example.tran: 你会感到一种本能的恐惧而想要去逃避。

sense.def: You can refer to someone as a particular type of animal in order to say what their interests are or what their typical behaviour is.

example.ex: You're quite a party animal aren't you, out there every night...
example.tran: 你就是为派对而生的，不是吗，每天晚上你都去参加派对。

example.ex: The entrepreneur at twenty-five is a different animal from the entrepreneur at fifty.
example.tran: 25岁的企业家和50岁的企业家是两种不同的人。

sense.def: People who are concerned with animal rights believe very strongly that animals should not be exploited or harmed by humans.
Animal testing involves doing scientific tests on animals when developing new products or drugs.
sense.tran: （研发新药或新产品时在动物身上进行的）动物试验

entry.boxr: The adjective is pronounced /'ænɪmət/. The verb is pronounced /'ænɪmeɪt/. 形容词读作 /'ænɪmət/，动词读作 /'ænɪmeɪt/。

sense.def: Something that is animate has life, in contrast to things like stones and machines which do not.

example.ex: ...all aspects of the material world, animate and inanimate.
example.tran: 物质世界的方方面面，包括有生命的和无生命的

sense.def: To animate something means to make it lively or more cheerful.
sense.tran: 使有生气；使活泼；激励；鼓舞

example.ex: There was precious little about the cricket to animate the crowd...
example.tran: 板球比赛能激起观众热情的地方很少。

example.ex: The girls watched, little teasing smiles animating their faces.
example.tran: 女孩们注视着，脸上挂着调皮的微笑，显得愈加活泼。

sense.def: Someone who is animated or who is having an animated conversation is lively and is showing their feelings.
sense.tran: 生气勃勃的；活泼的；热烈的

example.ex: She was seen in animated conversation with the singer Yuri Marusin...
example.tran: 有人看见她与歌手尤里·马鲁辛交谈甚欢。

example.ex: Everyone became more animated.
example.tran: 每个人都变得更加活泼热情。

example.ex: Sammy was standing close to Ned, talking animatedly with him.
example.tran: 萨米紧挨着内德站着，两人谈兴正浓。

sense.def: An animated film is one in which puppets or drawings appear to move.

example.ex: Disney has returned to what it does best: making full-length animated feature films.
example.tran: 迪斯尼又回到了它最擅长的领域：制作动画长片。

sense.def: Animation is the process of making films in which drawings or puppets appear to move.
sense.tran: 动画片绘制；卡通片制作

example.ex: The films are a mix of animation and full-length features.
example.tran: 这些电影将动画制作和长篇故事片融为一体。

example.ex: ...computer animation.
example.tran: 电脑动画制作

sense.def: An animation is a film in which drawings or puppets appear to move.

example.ex: This film is the first British animation sold to an American network.
example.tran: 这是第一部出售给美国电视网的英国动画片。

sense.def: Someone with animation shows liveliness in the way that they speak, look, or behave.

example.ex: They both spoke with animation.
example.tran: 他们兴致勃勃地说着。

sense.def: An animator is a person who makes films by means of animation.
sense.tran: 动画片制作者;动画片绘制者

sense.def: Animosity is a strong feeling of dislike and anger. Animosities are feelings of this kind.

example.ex: There's a long history of animosity between the two nations...
example.tran: 两国之间宿怨已久。

example.ex: Sir Geoffrey had no personal animosity towards the Prime Minister.
example.tran: 杰弗里爵士对首相并无私人恩怨。

example.ex: ...the age-old animosities in the Middle East.
example.tran: 中东地区由来已久的敌对情绪

sense.def: If a person has an animus against someone, they have a strong feeling of dislike for them, even when there is no good reason for it.

example.ex: Your animus towards him suggests that you are the wrong man for the job.
example.tran: 你对他有看法表明你不是这份工作的合适人选。

example.ex: ...Mr Milner's animus towards Mr Stevens.
example.tran: 米尔纳先生对史蒂文斯先生的敌意

sense.def: Anise is a plant with seeds that have a strong smell and taste. It is often made into an alcoholic drink.
sense.tran: 茴芹（一种植物，其种子有很浓的气味和味道，常用于制作酒精饮料）

sense.def: Aniseed is a substance made from the seeds of the anise plant. It is used as a flavouring in sweets, drinks, and medicine.
sense.tran: 茴芹籽（用作糖果、饮料和药物的调味剂）

example.ex: Fennel has a very distinctive aniseed flavour.
example.tran: 茴香有一种与众不同的茴芹籽的味道。

sense.def: Your ankle is the joint where your foot joins your leg.

example.ex: John twisted his ankle badly.
example.tran: 约翰的脚脖子崴得很严重。

sense.hdgr:
usu
in the N
of n
sense.def: If something is in the annals of a nation or field of activity, it is recorded as part of its history.

example.ex: He has become a legend in the annals of military history.
example.tran: 他已成为军事史上的一个传奇。

sense.hdgr:
with supp, usu
the N
of n
sense.def: Annals is used in the titles of journals of a particular field of academic research.

example.ex: It was published in the 'Annals of Internal Medicine'.
example.tran: 它发表在《内科医学年鉴》上。

sense.def: If a country annexes another country or an area of land, it seizes it and takes control of it.

example.ex: Rome annexed the Nabatean kingdom in 106 AD...
example.tran: 公元106年罗马吞并了纳巴泰王国。

example.ex: Hitler was determined to annex Austria to Germany.
example.tran: 希特勒决定将奥地利并入德国。

rnon.hdgr:
usu sing, usu N
of n

example.ex: ...Indonesia's annexation of East Timor.
example.tran: 印度尼西亚对东帝汶的吞并

sense.def: An annexe is a building which is joined to or is next to a larger main building.

example.ex: ...setting up a museum in an annexe to the theatre.
example.tran: 在剧院的侧楼中建一个博物馆

sense.def: An annexe to a document is a section added to it at the end.

example.ex: The Annex lists and discusses eight titles.
example.tran: 附录列举并讨论了8本书。

sense.def: To annihilate something means to destroy it completely.
sense.tran: 歼灭；消灭；毁灭；彻底击溃

example.ex: There are lots of ways of annihilating the planet...
example.tran: 毁灭地球有很多方法。

example.ex: The Army was annihilated.
example.tran: 陆军被彻底击溃了。

example.ex: ...the threat of nuclear war and annihilation of the human race.
example.tran: 核战争的威胁和人类的灭绝

sense.def: If you annihilate someone in a contest or argument, you totally defeat them.
sense.tran: （在竞赛或争论中）彻底击败，大胜

example.ex: The Dutch annihilated the Olympic champions 5-0.
example.tran: 荷兰队以5比0完胜奥运冠军队。

sense.hdgr:
usu ord N,
the N
of n
sense.def: An anniversary is a date which is remembered or celebrated because a special event happened on that date in a previous year.

example.ex: ...the one hundredth anniversary of the birth of Ho Chi Minh.
example.tran: 胡志明诞辰一百周年纪念

sense.def: If you annotate written work or a diagram, you add notes to it, especially in order to explain it.

example.ex: Historians annotate, check and interpret the diary selections.
example.tran: 历史学家对日记选篇进行加注、核查以及阐释。

example.ex: ...an annotated bibliography.
example.tran: 附有注释的参考书目

sense.def: Annotation is the activity of annotating something.

example.ex: She retained a number of copies for further annotation.
example.tran: 她保留了许多副本以便作进一步的注解。

sense.def: An annotation is a note that is added to a text or diagram, often in order to explain it.

example.ex: He supplied annotations to nearly 15,000 musical works.
example.tran: 他给近1.5万部音乐作品作过注解。

sense.def: If you announce something, you tell people about it publicly or officially.

example.ex: He will announce tonight that he is resigning from office...
example.tran: 他将于今晚宣布辞职。

example.ex: She was planning to announce her engagement to Peter...
example.tran: 她正计划宣布她和彼得订婚一事。

example.ex: It was announced that the groups have agreed to a ceasefire.
example.tran: 据宣告称这些组织已经同意停火。

sense.def: If you announce a piece of news or an intention, especially something that people may not like, you say it loudly and clearly, so that everyone you are with can hear it.
sense.tran: 大声宣告，郑重地说（尤指令人不快之事）

example.ex: Peter announced that he had no intention of wasting his time at any university...
example.tran: 彼得宣称他无意在任何一所大学浪费时间。

example.ex: 'I'm having a bath and going to bed,' she announced, and left the room.
example.tran: “我要洗个澡然后上床睡觉，”她大声说完便离开了房间。

sense.def: If an airport or railway employee announces something, they tell the public about it by means of a loudspeaker system.
sense.tran: （机场或火车站工作人员通过扬声器）播报，通知

example.ex: Station staff announced the arrival of the train over the tannoy...
example.tran: 车站工作人员通过广播告知火车到站了。

example.ex: They announced his plane was delayed.
example.tran: 广播通知他所乘的航班晚点了。

sense.def: If a letter, sound, or sign announces something, it informs people about it.
sense.tran: （以信件、声音、信号等）通知，告知

example.ex: The next letter announced the birth of another boy...
example.tran: 下一封信通知又一个男孩出生了。

example.ex: His entrance was announced by a buzzer connected to the door.
example.tran: 他刚一进去，与门相连的门铃便嗡嗡作响。

sense.def: If a meal or a guest is announced by a servant at a formal party, the servant says clearly that the meal is ready or the guest has arrived.
sense.tran: （仆人）通报，宣布（膳食备齐或来宾到达）

example.ex: Dinner was announced, and served.
example.tran: 已宣布开饭了，菜都上齐了。

sense.def: An announcement is a statement made to the public or to the media which gives information about something that has happened or that will happen.

example.ex: Sir Robert made his announcement after talks with the President...
example.tran: 在与总统会谈之后，罗伯特爵士发表了声明。

example.ex: There has been no formal announcement by either government.
example.tran: 双方政府都未作正式通告。

sense.def: The announcement of something that has happened is the act of telling people about it.

example.ex: ...the announcement of their engagement...
example.tran: 他们订婚消息的宣布

example.ex: There has been no official announcement of the arrests.
example.tran: 还没有正式发布逮捕这些人的消息。

sense.def: An announcement in a public place, such as a newspaper or the window of a shop, is a short piece of writing telling people about something or asking for something.
sense.tran: （在报纸、商店橱窗等处刊登的）启事，广告，通告

example.ex: He will place an announcement in the personal column of The Daily Telegraph.
example.tran: 他将在《每日电讯报》的个人专栏上登一则启事。

sense.def: An announcer is someone who introduces programmes on radio or television or who reads the text of a radio or television advertisement.
sense.tran: （广播电台或电视台的）广播员，播音员

example.ex: The radio announcer said it was nine o'clock...
example.tran: 电台播音员报时9点整。

example.ex: In the commercial an announcer interviews a Texan.
example.tran: 在这则广告中播音员采访了一个得克萨斯人。

sense.def: The announcer at a railway station or airport is the person who makes the announcements.
sense.tran: （火车站、机场等的）广播员，播报员

example.ex: The announcer apologised for the delay.
example.tran: 播报员就晚点表示歉意。

sense.def: If someone or something annoys you, it makes you fairly angry and impatient.
sense.tran: 使生气；使不耐烦；使烦恼

example.ex: Try making a note of the things which annoy you...
example.tran: 试着把烦心事写下来。

example.ex: It annoyed me that I didn't have time to do more reading...
example.tran: 腾不出时间多看会儿书让我很烦。

example.ex: It just annoyed me to hear him going on.
example.tran: 听他说个不停，真让我不堪其烦。

sense.def: Annoyance is the feeling that you get when someone makes you feel fairly angry or impatient.

example.ex: To her annoyance the stranger did not go away...
example.tran: 让她恼火的是，那个陌生人并没有走。

example.ex: He denied there was any annoyance with the British among other EC members.
example.tran: 他否认其他欧盟委员会委员对英国人有不满。

sense.def: An annoyance is something that makes you feel angry or impatient.
sense.tran: 令人烦恼的事物；令人厌烦的事物

example.ex: Inconsiderate neighbours can be more than an annoyance.
example.tran: 不为他人着想的邻居会非常惹人厌。

sense.hdgr: usu v-link ADJ, oft ADJ prep, ADJ that
sense.def: If you are annoyed, you are fairly angry about something.

example.ex: She tapped her forehead and looked annoyed with herself...
example.tran: 她拍打着脑门，看上去在生自己的气。

example.ex: She is hurt and annoyed that the authorities have banned her from working with children.
example.tran: 当局禁止她从事照管儿童的工作，她为此感到很伤心也很恼怒。

boxu.usage: Take care not to confuse annoyed and annoying. See also note at angry.
boxu.tran: 注意不要混淆annoyed和annoying，亦见angry词条下的说明。

sense.def: Someone or something that is annoying makes you feel fairly angry and impatient.
sense.tran: 令人生气的；令人厌烦的

example.ex: You must have found my attitude annoying...
example.tran: 你肯定觉得我的态度讨人厌。

example.ex: The annoying thing about the scheme is that it's confusing.
example.tran: 这项计划可气的地方是它让人一头雾水。

example.ex: Alex looked annoyingly cheerful.
example.tran: 亚历克斯看上去还挺高兴，真让人生气。

sense.def: Annual events happen once every year.

example.ex: ...the annual conference of Britain's trade union movement...
example.tran: 英国工会运动的年会

example.ex: In its annual report, UNICEF says at least 40,000 children die every day.
example.tran: 在其年度报告中，联合国儿童基金会称每天至少有4万名儿童死亡。

example.ex: Companies report to their shareholders annually.
example.tran: 各公司每年向其股东汇报一次。

sense.def: Annual quantities or rates relate to a period of one year.

example.ex: Annual costs, tuition and fees, £6,600...
example.tran: 每年的花销、学费和各项杂费6,600英镑。

example.ex: The electronic and printing unit has annual sales of about $80 million.
example.tran: 电子印刷部门每年销售额约为8,000万美元。

example.ex: El Salvador produces 100,000 tons of refined copper annually...
example.tran: 萨尔瓦多每年生产10万吨纯铜。

example.ex: Holiday World hires 300 new employees annually.
example.tran: 假日世界每年雇佣300名新员工。

sense.def: An annual is a book or magazine that is published once a year.

example.ex: I looked for Wyman's picture in my high-school annual...
example.tran: 我在中学年刊中寻找怀曼的照片。

example.ex: He tried the various almanacs, annuals and gazettes which were held in the library.
example.tran: 他试着在图书馆里找过各种历书、年鉴和报纸。

sense.def: An annual is a plant that grows and dies within one year.

example.ex: The simplest way to deal with these hardy annuals is to sow them where they are to flower.
example.tran: 处理这些一年生耐寒植物最简单的办法是将他们种在能开花的地方。

sense.def: An annuity is an investment or insurance policy that pays someone a fixed sum of money each year.
sense.tran: 年金保险合同;年金保险

sense.def: If an election or a contract is annulled, it is declared invalid, so that legally it is considered never to have existed.
sense.tran: 废除，取消（合同等）；宣告（选举等）无效

example.ex: Opposition party leaders are now pressing for the entire election to be annulled...
example.tran: 反对党领导人现正强烈要求宣告这次选举无效。

example.ex: The marriage was annulled last month.
example.tran: 上个月这桩婚姻被宣告无效。

sense.def: The annulment of a contract or marriage is an official declaration that it is invalid, so that legally it is considered never to have existed.

example.ex: ...the annulment of the elections...
example.tran: 选举被宣告无效

example.ex: He may appeal to the Pope for an annulment of his 24-year marriage.
example.tran: 他可能会请求主教宣告他那长达24年的婚姻无效。

sense.def: In Christianity, the Annunciation was the announcement by the Archangel Gabriel to the Virgin Mary that she was going to give birth to the son of God.
sense.tran: （基督教中的）天使报喜（天使长加百列奉告圣母马利亚她将诞下圣子耶稣）

sense.def: In electronics, an anode is the positive electrode in a cell such as a battery.
If you describe something as anodyne, you are criticizing it because it has no strong characteristics and is not likely to excite, interest, or upset anyone.
sense.tran: 平淡无奇的；四平八稳的；乏味无趣的

example.ex: Their quarterly meetings were anodyne affairs.
example.tran: 他们的季度会议乏善可陈。

sense.def: To anoint someone means to put oil or water on a part of their body, usually for religious reasons.
sense.tran: （常指在宗教仪式中）涂油（或水）于（人体）

example.ex: He anointed my forehead...
example.tran: 他给我的前额涂上了油。

example.ex: The Pope has anointed him as Archbishop.
example.tran: 教皇给他施了涂油礼，任命其为大主教。

example.ex: ...the anointed king.
example.tran: 神权帝王

sense.def: If a person in a position of authority anoints someone, they choose them to do a particular important job.

example.ex: The populist party anointed him as its candidate...
example.tran: 平民党选定他做候选人。

example.ex: Mr. Olsen has always avoided anointing any successor...
example.tran: 奥尔森先生总是回避指定继任者。

example.ex: His message about moderation and the middle class captured the attention of the press, which anointed him front-runner.
example.tran: 他关于中庸和中产阶级的观点引起媒体的注意，使他成为获胜的热门人选。

sense.def: Something that is anomalous is different from what is usual or expected.

example.ex: For years this anomalous behaviour has baffled scientists...
example.tran: 几年来这种反常行为让科学家们很困惑。

example.ex: His position here is anomalous.
example.tran: 他在此的身份很不寻常。

sense.def: If something is an anomaly, it is different from what is usual or expected.

example.ex: The British public's wariness of opera is an anomaly in Europe.
example.tran: 英国公众对歌剧不大轻易接受的态度在欧洲来说很反常。

sense.def: Anon means quite soon.

example.ex: You shall see him anon.
example.tran: 只消片刻你就会见到他。

sense.def: Anon. is often written after poems or other writing to indicate that the author is not known. Anon. is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'anonymous'.
sense.tran: （注于诗歌等作品后）表示“作者不详”,“佚名”

sense.def: If you remain anonymous when you do something, you do not let people know that you were the person who did it.
sense.tran: 匿名的;无名的;不知名的

example.ex: You can remain anonymous if you wish...
example.tran: 你愿意的话可以不透露姓名。

example.ex: An anonymous benefactor stepped in to provide the prize money.
example.tran: 一个匿名捐助者施以援手提供了奖金。

example.ex: ...anonymous phone calls.
example.tran: 匿名电话

example.ex: Both mother and daughter, who have requested anonymity, are doing fine.
example.tran: 这对不愿意透露姓名的母女俩目前情况良好。

example.ex: The latest photographs were sent anonymously to the magazine's Paris headquarters.
example.tran: 最新的照片以匿名方式寄到了该杂志的巴黎总部。

sense.def: Something that is anonymous does not reveal who you are.

example.ex: Of course, that would have to be by anonymous vote.
example.tran: 当然，那必须通过不记名投票的方式。

example.ex: He claims many more people would support him in the anonymity of a voting booth.
example.tran: 他声称会有更多的人通过投票站匿名投票的方式来支持他。

sense.def: If you describe a place as anonymous, you dislike it because it has no unusual or interesting features and seems unwelcoming.

example.ex: ...the most anonymous part of north-west Washington...
example.tran: 华盛顿西北部最无特色的地区

example.ex: It's nice to stay in a home rather than in an anonymous holiday villa.
example.tran: 呆在家里比呆在单调乏味的度假别墅里要惬意得多。

example.ex: ...the anonymity of the rented room.
example.tran: 租住的房间的单调无趣

sense.def: An anorak is a warm waterproof jacket, usually with a hood.
sense.tran: 带风帽的夹克;短风雨衣

sense.def: If you refer to someone as an anorak, you mean that they are boring because they devote too much time to a particular hobby or interest.
sense.tran: （对某种爱好过于痴迷以至于乏味的）…痴，…呆，狂热爱好者

example.ex: He's such an anorak...
example.tran: 他真是个闷蛋。

example.ex: Computer games are the ultimate anorak pursuit.
example.tran: 电脑游戏是电脑迷的大爱。

sense.def: Anorexia or anorexia nervosa is an illness in which a person has an overwhelming fear of becoming fat, and so refuses to eat enough and becomes thinner and thinner.
If someone is anorexic, they are suffering from anorexia and so are very thin.
sense.tran: 食欲缺乏的;厌食的;瘦骨嶙峋的

example.ex: Claire had been anorexic for three years.
example.tran: 克莱尔曾经遭受厌食症3年的折磨。

example.ex: ...an anorexic teenager.
example.tran: 患有厌食症的少年

posc.def: An anorexic is someone who is anorexic.

example.ex: Not eating makes an anorexic feel in control.
example.tran: 禁食让厌食者感到能掌握自我。

sense.def: Another thing or person means an additional thing or person of the same type as one that already exists.
sense.tran: （同类事物中的）另一个，再一个

example.ex: Mrs. Madrigal buttered another piece of toast...
example.tran: 马德里加尔夫人给另一片烤面包涂上了黄油。

example.ex: We're going to have another baby.
example.tran: 我们又要有一个孩子。

example.ex: The demand generated by one factory required the construction of another...
example.tran: 一家工厂产生的需求使得必须再建造一家工厂。

example.ex: MPs have one free trip to Brussels and another to Strasbourg, headquarters of the EC, each year.
example.tran: 议员每年可免费去布鲁塞尔和欧洲委员会总部斯特拉斯堡旅行一次。

sense.def: You use another when you want to emphasize that an additional thing or person is different to one that already exists.

example.ex: I think he's just going to deal with this problem another day...
example.tran: 我想他改天就会处理这个问题。

example.ex: The counsellor referred her to another therapist.
example.tran: 咨询指导让她去看另一位治疗专家。

example.ex: He said one thing when he came here, and he's gone back to Washington and done quite another...
example.tran: 他来这儿说的是一回事，等回到华盛顿做的又是另一回事。

example.ex: He didn't really believe that any human being could read another's mind.
example.tran: 他并不真的相信有谁会读心术。

sense.def: You use another at the beginning of a statement to link it to a previous statement.

example.ex: Another time of great excitement for us boys was when war broke out...
example.tran: 对我们男孩子来说另一个极度刺激的时刻是战争爆发。

example.ex: Another change that Sue made was to install central heating.
example.tran: 休所作的另一个改变是安装中央供暖系统。

sense.def: You use another before a word referring to a distance, length of time, or other amount, to indicate an additional amount.
sense.tran: （用在距离、时间段或其他量词之前）又…的，再…的

example.ex: Continue down the same road for another 2 kilometres until you reach the church of Santa Maria...
example.tran: 沿同一条路再往前走两公里，直至到达圣马丽亚教堂。

example.ex: He believes prices will not rise by more than another 4 per cent.
example.tran: 他认为物价涨幅不会再超过4个百分点。

sense.def: You use another in front of the name of a well-known person, place, or event to indicate that you think someone or something is just like that person, place, or event.
sense.tran: （用于有名的人物、地点或事件前表示与其类似的）另一个…，类似…的

example.ex: You may never be another Hemingway, but you can learn to write well.
example.tran: 你可能成不了第二个海明威，但你可以练就一手好文笔。

sense.def: You use one another to indicate that each member of a group does something to or for the other members.

example.ex: ...women learning to help themselves and one another...
example.tran: 学着自助和互助的妇女们

example.ex: The two countries do little trade with one another.
example.tran: 两国之间很少有贸易往来。

boxu.usage: Do not confuse another and other. When you are talking about another thing or person, you often mean one more of the same type. Rick's got another camera... I waited another few minutes. You use other to refer to more than one type of person or thing, usually followed by a plural count noun but sometimes by an uncount noun. Other boys were arriving now... There was certainly other evidence. When you are talking about two people or things and have already referred to one of them, you refer to the second one as the other or the other one. One daughter was a baby, the other a girl of twelve. When you are talking about several people or things and have already referred to one or more of them, you usually refer to the remaining ones as the others. Jack and the others paid no attention. More people or things of the same type are referred to simply as others. Some writers are better than others.Other can also be used after words such as 'the', 'few', or 'any', and after numbers. ...the other side of the room... I love my son, like any other mother. ...the Hogans and three other couples.
boxu.tran: 不要混淆another和other。another指另一个同一类型的人或事物：Rick’s got another camera（里克又添置了一架相机），I waited another few minutes（我又等了几分钟）。other指不同类的人或事物，通常后接可数名词复数形式，但有时也接不可数名词：Other boys were arriving now（其他男孩马上也要到了），There was certainly other evidence（当然还有其他证据）。在谈及两个人或事物，并且已经说到其中一个，在说第二个时用the other或the other one：One daughter was a baby, the other a girl of twelve（一个女儿尚在襁褓中，另一个女儿12岁了）。当说到几个人或事物，并且已经提到了其中一个或几个时，指剩下的通常用the others: Jack and the others paid no attention (杰克和其他人都没留意）。指更多的同类人或事物时用others：Some writers are better than othes (有些作家比其同行要出色)。other也可用在the, few, any和数字后面：the other side of the room (房间另一头)，I love my son, like any other mother (像其他任何一位母亲一样，我爱我的儿子），the Hogans and three other couples (霍根夫妇和其他3对夫妇)。

phrase.def: If you talk about one thing after another, you are referring to a series of repeated or continuous events.

example.ex: They had faced one difficulty after another with bravery and dedication...
example.tran: 他们以无畏和无私奉献的精神迎接了一个又一个的困难。

example.ex: They kept going, destroying one store after another.
example.tran: 他们并未停手，摧毁了一家又一家商店。

phrase.def: You use or another in expressions such as one kind or another when you do not want to be precise about which of several alternatives or possibilities you are referring to.
phrase.tran: （表示不确指）各种不同的，各种各样的

example.ex: ...family members and visiting artists of one kind or another crowding the huge kitchen...
example.tran: 聚集在这个宽敞厨房里的家庭成员和来访的各类艺术家

example.ex: All of these industries have at one time or another been linked to cancer.
example.tran: 所有这些产业都曾在不同时期与癌症有过联系。

sense.def: When you answer someone who has asked you something, you say something back to them.

example.ex: I knew Ben was lying when he answered me...
example.tran: 我知道本回答我时在撒谎。

example.ex: Just answer the question...
example.tran: 只回答问题。

example.ex: He paused before answering...
example.tran: 他停顿了一下才回答。

example.ex: 'When?' asked Alba, 'Tonight', answered Tom...
example.tran: “什么时候？”阿尔芭问道。“今晚，”汤姆回答。

example.ex: Williams answered that he had no specific proposals yet.
example.tran: 威廉斯回答说他还没有具体的提案。

sense.def: An answer is something that you say when you answer someone.

example.ex: Without waiting for an answer, he turned and went in through the door...
example.tran: 未等答复，他就转身进了门。

example.ex: I don't quite know what to say in answer to your question.
example.tran: 我不太清楚如何回答你的问题。

sense.def: If you say that someone will not take no for an answer, you mean that they go on trying to make you agree to something even after you have refused.
sense.tran: 接受反对意见;接受拒绝

example.ex: She is tough, unwilling to take no for an answer...
example.tran: 她很强硬，不达目的誓不罢休。

example.ex: He would never take no for an answer.
example.tran: 他从来都坚持己见。

sense.def: If you answer a letter or advertisement, you write to the person who wrote it.

example.ex: Did he answer your letter?...
example.tran: 他给你回信了吗？

example.ex: She answered an advert for a job as a cook.
example.tran: 她看到一则招聘厨师的广告后写信应征。

sense.def: An answer is a letter that you write to someone who has written to you.

example.ex: I wrote to him but I never had an answer back...
example.tran: 我写了信给他，但一直没收到回信。

example.ex: She wrote to Roosevelt's secretary in answer to his letter of the day before.
example.tran: 她写了信给罗斯福的秘书，回复罗斯福前一天的来信。

sense.def: When you answer the telephone, you pick it up when it rings. When you answer the door, you open it when you hear a knock or the bell.

example.ex: She answered her phone on the first ring...
example.tran: 电话刚一响，她就接了。

example.ex: A middle-aged woman answered the door.
example.tran: 一个中年妇女应声开了门。

example.ex: I knocked at the front door and there was no answer.
example.tran: 我敲了敲前门，没有人应。

sense.def: An answer to a problem is a solution to it.

example.ex: There are no easy answers to the problems facing the economy...
example.tran: 解决经济所面临的问题并非易事。

example.ex: Prison is not the answer for most young offenders...
example.tran: 就大多数年轻的犯法者来说，把他们关进监狱不是解决问题的办法。

example.ex: Legislation is only part of the answer.
example.tran: 立法只是解决方案中的一部分。

sense.def: Someone's answer to a question in a test or quiz is what they write or say in an attempt to give the facts that are asked for. The answer to a question is the fact that was asked for.

example.ex: Simply marking an answer wrong will not help the pupil to get future examples correct...
example.tran: 仅仅在答案上打叉号不会有助于学生做对日后的题目。

example.ex: Below are printed the answers to the Brain of Soccer 1993 quiz.
example.tran: 以下所印的是1993年“脑力足球”小测验的答案。

sense.def: When you answer a question in a test or quiz, you write or say something in an attempt to give the facts that are asked for.

example.ex: To obtain her degree, she answered 81 questions over 10 papers.
example.tran: 为获得学位，她回答了10页纸上的81个问题。

sense.def: Your answer to something that someone has said or done is what you say or do in response to it or in defence of yourself.

example.ex: In answer to speculation that she wouldn't finish the race, she boldly declared her intention of winning it.
example.tran: 为了回应她会中途退赛的猜测，她大胆地宣布她要赢得这场比赛。

sense.def: If you answer something that someone has said or done, you respond to it.

example.ex: He answered her smile with one of his own...
example.tran: 他对她的微笑回以同礼。

example.ex: That statement seemed designed to answer criticism of allied bombing missions.
example.tran: 那份声明似乎是专门就联合轰炸任务的批评作出反击。

sense.def: If you say that something is a place's answer to a famous thing, you mean that the first thing is the equivalent of the second in that place.
sense.tran: （某地）与…相似的东西，相当于…的东西

example.ex: Cachaca is Brazil's answer to tequila.
example.tran: 巴西甜酒相当于是巴西的龙舌兰酒。

sense.def: If something answers a need or purpose, it satisfies it, because it has the right qualities.
sense.tran: 满足，适合，符合（需要、目的）

example.ex: We provide specially designed shopping trolleys to answer the needs of parents with young children.
example.tran: 我们提供特别设计的购物车，以满足带幼儿的父母的需要。

sense.def: If someone or something answers a particular description or answers to it, they have the characteristics described.

example.ex: Two men answering the description of the suspects tried to enter Switzerland...
example.tran: 与描述的疑犯样子相符的两名男子试图进入瑞士。

example.ex: The Japanese never built any aircraft remotely answering to this description.
example.tran: 日本人从未制造过与此描述有丝毫相近的飞机。

sense.def: If someone, especially a child, answers back, they speak rudely to you when you speak to them.

example.ex: She was punished by teachers for answering back...
example.tran: 她由于顶嘴而受到了老师的惩罚。

example.ex: I always answered him back when I thought he was wrong.
example.tran: 我觉得他说得不对时总是要顶他几句。

sense.def: If you have to answer for something bad or wrong you have done, you are punished for it.
sense.tran: 为了…而受惩罚；为…付出代价

example.ex: He must be made to answer for his terrible crimes.
example.tran: 他必须为他的严重罪行付出代价。

sense.def: If you say that someone has a lot to answer for, you are saying that their actions have led to problems which you think they are responsible for.
If you are answerable to someone, you have to report to them and explain your actions.
sense.tran: （对某人）应负责的，有责任的，须作交代的

example.ex: Councils should be answerable to the people who elect them...
example.tran: 市政会成员应对推选他们的人负责。

example.ex: All ministers, including the prime minister, will be answerable directly to him.
example.tran: 所有大臣，包括首相都将直接对他负责。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, usu ADJ
for n
sense.def: If you are answerable for your actions or for someone else's actions, you are considered to be responsible for them and if necessary must accept punishment for them.
sense.tran: 为（某事）负责任的；承担（某种行为的）后果的

example.ex: He must be made answerable for these terrible crimes.
example.tran: 他必须对这些可恶的罪行负责。

sense.def: An answering machine is the same as an answerphone .
An answerphone is a device which you connect to your telephone and which records telephone calls while you are out.
sense.tran: 电话答录机;录音电话机

sense.def: Ants are small crawling insects that live in large groups.

example.ex: Ants swarmed up out of the ground and covered her shoes and legs.
example.tran: 蚂蚁从地下成群地钻出来，爬满了她的鞋子和双腿。

sense.def: Antacid is a substance that reduces the level of acid in the stomach.
Antagonism between people is hatred or dislike between them. Antagonisms are instances of this.

example.ex: There is still much antagonism between trades unions and the oil companies...
example.tran: 工会和石油公司之间仍然存在着相当大的敌意。

example.ex: Old antagonisms resurfaced.
example.tran: 旧怨重生。

sense.def: Your antagonist is your opponent or enemy.

example.ex: Spassky had never previously lost to his antagonist.
example.tran: 斯帕斯基以往从未输给过他的对手。

sense.hdgr:
usu v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
to/towards n
sense.def: If a person is antagonistic to someone or something, they show hatred or dislike towards them.
sense.tran: 对抗的；敌对的；有敌意的

example.ex: Nearly all the women I interviewed were aggressively antagonistic to the idea.
example.tran: 几乎我采访过的所有女性都对这个观点表示了强烈的反感。

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用antagonise

sense.def: If you antagonize someone, you make them feel angry or hostile towards you.
sense.tran: 惹恼；引起…的敌意（或反感）

example.ex: He didn't want to antagonize her.
example.tran: 他不想引起她的反感。

sense.def: The Antarctic is the area around the South Pole.
If you up the ante or raise the ante, you increase your demands when you are in dispute or fighting for something.
sense.tran: （在争议或争夺中）提高要求，增加筹码

sense.def: If you ante up an amount of money, you pay your share, sometimes unwillingly.

example.ex: Paul Reichmann offered to ante up $2 million.
example.tran: 保罗·赖克曼出价到200万美金。

sense.def: An anteater is an animal with a long nose that eats termites or ants. Anteaters live in warm countries.
An antecedent of something happened or existed before it and was similar to it in some way.

example.ex: We shall first look briefly at the historical antecedents of this theory.
example.tran: 我们首先应大致看一下该理论在历史上的前身。

sense.def: An antecedent thing or event happened or existed before another related thing or event.

example.ex: It was permissible to take account of antecedent legislation.
example.tran: 允许考虑先前的法律。

sense.def: Your antecedents are your ancestors.

example.ex: ...a Frenchman with Irish antecedents.
example.tran: 祖先为爱尔兰人的法国人

sense.def: An antechamber is a small room leading into a larger room.
Antediluvian things are old or old-fashioned.

example.ex: ...antediluvian attitudes to women.
example.tran: 看待女性的旧观念

sense.def: Anantelope is an animal like a deer, with long legs and horns, that lives in Africa or Asia. Antelopes are graceful and can run fast. There are many different types of antelope.
Antenatal means relating to the medical care of women when they are expecting a baby.
sense.tran: 产前保健的;怀孕期护理的

example.ex: ...antenatal classes.
example.tran: 产前课程

example.ex: ...antenatal care.
example.tran: 产前护理

entry.boxr: antennas is the usual plural form for meaning 2. 义项2的复数形式通常为antennas。

sense.def: The antennae of something such as an insect or crustacean are the two long, thin parts attached to its head that it uses to feel things with.
sense.tran: （昆虫或甲壳纲动物的）触须，触角

sense.def: An antenna is a device that sends and receives television or radio signals.

xrse.see: See pictures on pages A1 and A3. A1和A3页图

sense.def: In gambling, ante-post bets are placed before the day of a particular race or competition.
sense.tran: （赌注）下于赛马或比赛之前的

example.ex: ...the ante-post favourite for the Epsom Classic, Celtic Swing.
example.tran: 埃普瑟姆赛马大会的赛前赌盘大热门——凯尔特·斯温

sense.def: Anterior describes a part of the body that is situated at or towards the front of another part.
sense.tran: （指身体某部位）位于前部的，前面的

example.ex: ...the left anterior descending artery.
example.tran: 左前方下行动脉

sense.def: An anteroom is a small room leading into a larger room.

example.ex: He had been patiently waiting in the anteroom for an hour.
example.tran: 他在前厅耐心地等了一个小时。

sense.def: An anthem is a song which is used to represent a particular nation, society, or group and which is sung on special occasions.
sense.tran: 国歌；（代表某一社会或团体的）颂歌，赞歌

example.ex: The band played the Czech anthem.
example.tran: 乐队演奏了捷克国歌。

example.ex: ...the Olympic anthem.
example.tran: 奥运会会歌

sense.def: An anthill is a pile of earth formed by ants when they are making a nest.
An anthology is a collection of writings by different writers published together in one book.

example.ex: ...an anthology of poetry.
example.tran: 诗歌选集

sense.def: Anthracite is a type of very hard coal which burns slowly, producing a lot of heat and very little smoke.
Anthrax is a disease of cattle and sheep, in which they get painful sores and a fever. Anthrax can be used in biological weapons.
sense.tran: 炭疽（牛羊畜疫，可用于制造生物武器）

sense.def: Anthropology is the scientific study of people, society, and culture.

example.ex: ...an anthropologist who had been in China for three years.
example.tran: 曾在中国呆了3年的人类学家

example.ex: ...anthropological research.
example.tran: 人类学研究

sense.def: Anthropomorphic means relating to the idea that an animal, a god, or an object has feelings or characteristics like those of a human being.
sense.tran: 被赋予人形（或人性）的；拟人的

example.ex: ...the anthropomorphic attitude to animals...
example.tran: 对待动物像对待人的态度

example.ex: The world of the gods is anthropomorphic, an imitative projection of ours.
example.tran: 神界是拟人化的，是模仿我们人类世界的一个投影。

sense.def: Anthropomorphism is the idea that an animal, a god, or an object has feelings or characteristics like those of a human being.
sense.tran: （认为动物、神和物体都具有人类的情感或特征的）拟人论，拟人观

sense.def: You can refer to people who are opposed to a particular activity or idea as antis .
sense.tran: 反对者；反对分子；持反对论者

example.ex: Despite what the antis would tell you, hunting is for people from all walks of life.
example.tran: 不管持反对意见的人将告诉你什么，狩猎适合于各个阶层的人。

sense.def: If someone is opposed to something you can say that they are anti it.

example.ex: That's why you're so anti other people smoking.
example.tran: 那就是为什么你如此反对别人吸烟。

sense.def: Anti- is used to form adjectives and nouns that describe someone or something that is opposed to a particular system, practice, or group of people.
sense.tran: （用来构成形容词和名词，表示反对某种制度、做法或群体的人或事）反…

example.ex: ...anti-government demonstrations.
example.tran: 反政府的示威游行

example.ex: ...anti-racist campaigners.
example.tran: 反种族主义活动家

example.ex: ...anti-Fascists.
example.tran: 反法西斯主义分子

sense.def: Anti- is used to form adjectives and nouns that describe things that are intended to destroy something harmful or to prevent something from happening.
sense.tran: （用来构成形容词和名词）表示“防…”，“抗…”，“阻止”

example.ex: ...anti-aircraft guns.
example.tran: 高射炮

example.ex: ...anti-discrimination legislation.
example.tran: 反歧视法

example.ex: ...anti-inflammatory drugs.
example.tran: 消炎药

sense.def: An anti-abortionist is someone who wants to limit or prevent the legal availability of abortions.
sense.tran: 反对堕胎者；反对流产者

example.ex: An attempt by anti-abortionists to tighten the rules was defeated.
example.tran: 反堕胎者所作的加强法规的尝试失败了。

sense.def: Antibiotics are medical drugs used to kill bacteria and treat infections.

example.ex: Your doctor may prescribe a course of antibiotics.
example.tran: 你的医生可能会开一个疗程的抗生素。

sense.def: Antibodies are substances which a person's or an animal's body produces in their blood in order to destroy substances which carry disease.
If you anticipate an event, you realize in advance that it may happen and you are prepared for it.

example.ex: At the time we couldn't have anticipated the result of our campaigning...
example.tran: 那时我们不可能预料到我们这项运动的结果。

example.ex: It is anticipated that the equivalent of 192 full-time jobs will be lost...
example.tran: 预计将失去相当于192份全职工作的岗位。

example.ex: Officials anticipate that rivalry between leaders of the various drug factions could erupt into full scale war.
example.tran: 官员们预计各个毒品团伙头目之间的对抗可能会引发一场全面的冲突。

sense.def: If you anticipate a question, request, or need, you do what is necessary or required before the question, request, or need occurs.
sense.tran: 未待提出就回答（问题）；预先考虑并满足（请求、需要等）

example.ex: What Jeff did was to anticipate my next question...
example.tran: 杰夫预先回答了我的下一个问题。

example.ex: Do you expect your partner to anticipate your needs?
example.tran: 你是否期望你的伴侣不等你提出就主动满足你的需要？

sense.def: If you anticipate something, you do it, think it, or say it before someone else does.
sense.tran: 早于…做（或想、说）；先于…行动

example.ex: In the 50s, Rauschenberg anticipated the conceptual art movement of the 80s.
example.tran: 上世纪50年代时，劳申伯格就早早地预见到了80年代的概念艺术运动。

sense.def: If an event, especially a cultural event, is eagerly anticipated, people expect that it will be very good, exciting, or interesting.

example.ex: ...the most eagerly anticipated rock event of the year.
example.tran: 最让人殷切期盼的年度摇滚乐盛事

example.ex: ...one of the conference's most keenly anticipated debates...
example.tran: 这次大会中受到最热烈期待的辩论之一

example.ex: The long-anticipated study drew criticism from the tobacco industry.
example.tran: 让人期待已久的研究遭到了烟草行业的批评。

sense.def: Anticipation is a feeling of excitement about something pleasant or exciting that you know is going to happen.

example.ex: There's been an atmosphere of anticipation around here for a few days now...
example.tran: 几天来这里一直有一种满怀期待的气氛。

example.ex: We await the next volume of this superb edition with keen anticipation.
example.tran: 我们殷切期盼着这本精装版下一卷的面世。

sense.def: If something is done in anticipation of an event, it is done because people believe that event is going to happen.

example.ex: Troops in the Philippines have been put on full alert in anticipation of trouble during a planned general strike.
example.tran: 因料到在有组织的大罢工期间可能会出现骚乱，菲律宾的军队已进入全面戒备状态。

sense.def: An anticipatory feeling or action is one that you have or do because you are expecting something to happen soon.

example.ex: ...an anticipatory smile.
example.tran: 期许的笑容

sense.def: You can describe something as an anticlimax if it disappoints you because it happens after something that was very exciting, or because it is not as exciting as you expected.
sense.tran: （激动人心的事情之后）令人失望的情况，令人扫兴的事件

example.ex: Barry's speech followed Dirk Bogarde's appearance, and was an inevitable anticlimax...
example.tran: 巴里紧随德克·博加德之后发表了演讲，不出所料，演讲顿时变得索然无味。

example.ex: It was sad that his international career should end in such anticlimax.
example.tran: 令人悲哀的是，他的国际职业生涯竟如此惨淡收场。

sense.def: If something is moving anticlockwise, it is moving in the opposite direction to the direction in which the hands of a clock move.

example.ex: The cutters are opened by turning the knob anticlockwise.
example.tran: 逆时针转动旋钮可以开启切割机。

example.ex: ...an anticlockwise route around the coast.
example.tran: 环海岸的逆时针路线

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 counterclockwise

sense.def: Antics are funny, silly, or unusual ways of behaving.
sense.tran: 滑稽动作；愚蠢行为；古怪举动

example.ex: Elizabeth tolerated Sarah's antics.
example.tran: 伊丽莎白容忍了萨拉的搞怪。

sense.def: An anticyclone is an area of high atmospheric pressure which causes settled weather conditions and, in summer, clear skies and high temperatures.
An anti-depressant is a drug which is used to treat people who are suffering from depression.
You can use anti-depressant to talk about something that makes people feel happier and more relaxed.
sense.tran: 使人放松（或快乐）的事物;解忧良药

example.ex: Exercise is a powerful antidepressant.
example.tran: 锻炼能够使人一扫阴霾。

sense.def: An antidote is a chemical substance that stops or controls the effect of a poison.

example.ex: When he returned, he noticed their sickness and prepared an antidote.
example.tran: 他回来后注意到了他们的病状，于是配制了解毒剂。

sense.def: Something that is an antidote to a difficult or unpleasant situation helps you to overcome the situation.

example.ex: Massage is a wonderful antidote to stress.
example.tran: 按摩是舒缓压力的一剂妙方。

sense.def: Antifreeze is a liquid which is added to water to stop it freezing. It is used in car radiators in cold weather.
An antigen is a substance that helps the production of antibodies.
An anti-hero is the main character in a novel, play, or film who is not morally good and does not behave like a typical hero.
sense.tran: （小说、戏剧或电影中的）反英雄，非正统派主角

sense.def: An antihistamine is a drug that is used to treat allergies.
sense.tran: 抗组（织）胺药（用于抗过敏）

sense.def: In science, antimatter is a form of matter whose particles have characteristics and properties opposite to those of ordinary matter.
An antioxidant is a substance which slows down the damage that can be caused to other substances by the effects of oxygen. Foods which contain antioxidants are thought to be very good for you.
sense.tran: 抗氧（化）剂；阻氧化剂；防老（化）剂

sense.def: Antipasto is the sort of food that is often served at the beginning of an Italian meal, for example cold meats and vegetables in olive oil.
Antipathy is a strong feeling of dislike or hostility towards someone or something.

example.ex: She'd often spoken of her antipathy towards London.
example.tran: 她常提及她对伦敦的反感。

sense.def: Antipodean describes people or things that come from or relate to Australia and New Zealand.

example.ex: This New Zealand winery produces some of the best antipodean wines.
example.tran: 这家新西兰酿酒厂出产一些最好的澳新葡萄酒。

sense.def: People sometimes refer to Australia and New Zealand as the Antipodes .
Antiquarian means concerned with old and rare objects.

example.ex: ...an antiquarian bookseller.
example.tran: 古籍商

example.ex: ...antiquarian and second-hand books.
example.tran: 古籍和二手书

sense.def: An antiquarian is the same as an antiquary .
An antiquary is a person who studies the past, or who collects or buys and sells old and valuable objects.
sense.tran: 古文物收藏家;古文物研究者;古文物经营者

sense.def: If you describe something as antiquated, you are criticizing it because it is very old or old-fashioned.

example.ex: Many factories are so antiquated they are not worth saving...
example.tran: 很多工厂过于陈旧落后，已不值得挽救。

example.ex: Do we really want a return to an antiquated system of privilege and elitism?
example.tran: 我们真的想回归到一种特权和精英政治的过时制度中吗？

sense.def: An antique is an old object such as a piece of china or furniture which is valuable because of its beauty or rarity.

example.ex: ...a genuine antique.
example.tran: 一件古董真品

example.ex: ...antique silver jewellery...
example.tran: 古董银首饰

example.ex: He finds material at auctions, antique shops and flea markets.
example.tran: 他在拍卖行、古玩店和跳蚤市场中寻宝。

sense.def: An antiqued object is modern but has been made to look like an antique.

example.ex: Both rooms have antiqued pine furniture.
example.tran: 两个房间里都有仿古松木家具。

sense.def: Antiquity is the distant past, especially the time of the ancient Egyptians, Greeks, and Romans.
sense.tran: 古代，古时（尤指古埃及、古希腊、古罗马时期）

example.ex: ...famous monuments of classical antiquity...
example.tran: 古典时期的著名纪念碑

example.ex: The town was famous in antiquity for its white bulls.
example.tran: 该镇在古时以其白色公牛闻名。

sense.def: Antiquities are things such as buildings, statues, or coins that were made in ancient times and have survived to the present day.

example.ex: ...collectors of Roman antiquities.
example.tran: 古罗马时期物品的收藏家

sense.def: The antiquity of something is its great age.

example.ex: ...a town of great antiquity...
example.tran: 历史悠久的小镇

example.ex: It indicates the antiquity of the tradition.
example.tran: 这表明该传统源远流长。

sense.def: An anti-Semite is someone who strongly dislikes and is prejudiced against Jewish people.
sense.tran: 反对犹太人的人；歧视犹太人的人

sense.def: Someone or something that is anti-Semitic is hostile to or prejudiced against Jewish people.
sense.tran: 反对犹太人的；歧视犹太人的

example.ex: His anti-Semitic beliefs were well-known in America.
example.tran: 他的反犹信仰在美国很出名。

sense.def: Anti-Semitism is hostility to and prejudice against Jewish people.

example.ex: The extreme right-wing National Front promoted anti-semitism.
example.tran: 右翼极端政党“国民阵线”支持反犹太主义。

sense.def: Antiseptic is a substance that kills germs and harmful bacteria.

example.ex: She bathed the cut with antiseptic.
example.tran: 她用消毒剂浸洗伤口。

sense.def: Something that is antiseptic kills germs and harmful bacteria.

example.ex: These vegetables and herbs have strong antiseptic qualities.
example.tran: 这些蔬菜和草本植物有很强的杀菌性。

sense.def: Someone who is anti-social is unwilling to meet and be friendly with other people.
sense.tran: 不爱交际的；孤僻的；不合群的

example.ex: ...teenagers who will become aggressive and anti-social.
example.tran: 将会变得好斗、孤僻的青少年一代

sense.def: Anti-social behaviour is annoying or upsetting to other people.
sense.tran: （行为）反社会的，危害社会的，令人讨厌的

example.ex: Playing these games can lead to anti-social behaviour.
example.tran: 玩这类游戏会引发反社会行为。

sense.def: The antithesis of something is its exact opposite.
sense.tran: 对立面；形成对立（或对照）的事物

example.ex: The little black dress is the anithesis of fussy dressing.
example.tran: 与花哨的打扮形成鲜明对比的是这件小黑裙子。

sense.def: If there is an antithesis between two things, there is a contrast between them.

example.ex: ...the antithesis between instinct and reason.
example.tran: 本能和理智的对立

sense.def: Something that is antithetical to something else is the opposite of it and is unable to exist with it.
sense.tran: 相反的;对立的;不相容的

example.ex: Their priorities are antithetical to those of environmentalists.
example.tran: 他们心中的当务之急和环保人士的想法背道而驰。

sense.def: In the United States, antitrust laws are intended to stop large firms taking over their competitors, fixing prices with their competitors, or interfering with free competition in any way.
sense.tran: （指美国法律）反托拉斯的，反垄断的

example.ex: The jury found that the NFL had violated antitrust laws.
example.tran: 陪审团裁决全国橄榄球联盟触犯了反垄断法。

sense.def: Anti-virus software is software that protects a computer against viruses.
A male deer's antlers are the branched horns on its head.
The antonym of a word is a word which means the opposite.
If someone is antsy, they are nervous or impatient.

example.ex: This is the end of a tour so I'm a little antsy, I guess.
example.tran: 旅途就此结束了，这让我有点坐立不安，我想是吧。

sense.def: A person's anus is the hole from which faeces leaves their body.
An anvil is a heavy iron block on which hot metals are beaten into shape.
You can refer to a difficult experience that changes someone or leads to something good as a particular type of anvil .

example.ex: His independence had been forged on the anvil of a harsh environment.
example.tran: 他的独立性是在艰苦的环境中锤炼出来的。

sense.def: Anxiety is a feeling of nervousness or worry.

example.ex: Her voice was full of anxiety...
example.tran: 她的声音满是焦虑不安。

example.ex: Many editorials express their anxieties about the economic chaos in the country.
example.tran: 许多社论对该国经济的混乱状况表示忧虑。

sense.hdgr: v-link ADJ, ADJ to-inf, ADJ that, ADJ prep
sense.def: If you are anxious to do something or anxious that something should happen, you very much want to do it or very much want it to happen.

example.ex: Both the Americans and the Russians are anxious to avoid conflict in South Asia...
example.tran: 美国人和俄罗斯人都迫切希望避免在南亚发生冲突。

example.ex: He is anxious that there should be no delay...
example.tran: 他非常希望不会出现延误。

example.ex: Those anxious for reform say that the present system is too narrow.
example.tran: 那些渴望改革的人声称现有的体制过于狭隘。

sense.def: If you are anxious, you are nervous or worried about something.

example.ex: The foreign minister admitted he was still anxious about the situation in the country...
example.tran: 外交部长承认对于该国的局势他仍然颇感忧虑。

example.ex: A friend of mine is a very anxious person.
example.tran: 我的一个朋友是个非常容易焦虑不安的人。

example.ex: They are waiting anxiously to see who will succeed him.
example.tran: 他们焦急地等待着看谁会接替他上任。

sense.def: An anxious time or situation is one during which you feel nervous and worried.
sense.tran: （时间或局势）紧张的，令人焦虑的，让人担忧的

example.ex: The Prime Minister faces anxious hours before the votes are counted tomorrow night.
example.tran: 在明晚计票完成之前，首相将面临数小时的煎熬等待。

sense.def: You use any in statements with negative meaning to indicate that no thing or person of a particular type exists, is present, or is involved in a situation.
sense.tran: （用于否定句）一点，丝毫，若干，任何

example.ex: I never make any big decisions...
example.tran: 我从未作过任何重大决定。

example.ex: I'm not making any promises...
example.tran: 我不会作任何保证。

example.ex: We are doing this all without any support from the hospital...
example.tran: 我们正在没有得到医院方面任何支持的情况下做这件事。

example.ex: Earlier reports were unable to confirm that there were any survivors...
example.tran: 早先的报道无法证实是否有幸存者。

example.ex: It is too early to say what effect, if any, there will be on the workforce.
example.tran: 如果会对劳动力产生一些影响，现在就说是什么影响还言之过早。

example.ex: You don't know any of my friends...
example.tran: 我的朋友你一个都不认识。

example.ex: There was nothing you could do, nothing any of us could do.
example.tran: 你帮不上什么忙，我们中的任何人也都无能为力。

example.ex: The children needed new school clothes and Kim couldn't afford any.
example.tran: 孩子们需要新校服，可是金一件也买不起。

sense.def: You use any in questions and conditional clauses to ask whether there is some of a particular thing or some of a particular group of people, or to suggest that there might be.
sense.tran: （用于疑问句或条件从句）若干，一点，什么，任何一个（或一些）

example.ex: Do you speak any foreign languages?...
example.tran: 你会说外语吗？

example.ex: Are there any ladies in the audience?...
example.tran: 观众当中有女士吗？

example.ex: Have you got any cheese I can have with this bread?
example.tran: 你有没有奶酪，我好就着面包一起吃？

example.ex: Introduce foods one at a time and notice if you feel uncomfortable with any of them...
example.tran: 一次加进一种食物，注意是否有哪一种令你感到不适。

example.ex: Have you ever used a homeopathic remedy for any of the following reasons?
example.tran: 你是否因为以下任何一种理由采用过顺势疗法？

example.ex: If any bright thoughts occur to you pass them straight to me. Have you got any?...
example.tran: 你有什么高见就立马告诉我。现在有吗？

example.ex: The plants are inspected for insects and if I find any, they are squashed.
example.tran: 这些植物常进行虫害检查，如果发现害虫我就把它们捏死。

sense.def: You use any in positive statements when you are referring to someone or something of a particular kind that might exist, occur, or be involved in a situation, when their exact identity or nature is not important.

example.ex: Any actor will tell you that it is easier to perform than to be themselves...
example.tran: 每一个演员都会告诉你演戏比做自己容易。

example.ex: I'm prepared to take any advice...
example.tran: 我愿意接受任何忠告。

example.ex: I would overcome any weakness, any despair, any fear.
example.tran: 我要克服所有的软弱、绝望和恐惧。

example.ex: Nealy disappeared two days ago, several miles away from any of the fighting...
example.tran: 尼利两天前失踪了，所有战斗地点周围几英里内都不见他的踪影。

example.ex: It had been the biggest mistake any of them could remember.
example.tran: 这是他们每一个人所能记得的最重大的错误。

example.ex: Clean the mussels and discard any that do not close.
example.tran: 把贻贝洗干净，凡是合不上口的都扔掉。

example.ex: ...mangoes, bananas, pineapples, pears, and grapes as delicious as any you have ever eaten.
example.tran: 吃过的最美味的芒果、香蕉、菠萝、梨和葡萄

sense.def: You can also use any to emphasize a comparative adjective or adverb in a negative statement.
sense.tran: （用于否定句中强调形容词或副词的比较级）任何，丝毫，略微，多少

example.ex: I can't see things getting any easier for graduates...
example.tran: 我没看出毕业生的境遇有丝毫好转。

example.ex: Anne's not getting any younger.
example.tran: 安妮一点没有变年轻。

boxu.usage: Any is mainly used in questions and negative sentences. You use not any instead of some in negative sentences. There isn't any money.
boxu.tran: any主要用于疑问句和否定句。在否定句中，用not any代替some：There isn’t any money（一分钱都没有）。

phrase.def: If you say that someone or something is not just any person or thing, you mean that they are special in some way.

example.ex: Finzer is not just any East Coast businessman...
example.tran: 芬泽不是个普通的东海岸生意人。

example.ex: It's fashionable for young people to wear trainers, but not just any trainers.
example.tran: 年轻人穿旅游鞋很时尚，但不是说所有的旅游鞋都如此。

phrase.def: If something does not happen or is not true any more or any longer, it has stopped happening or is no longer true.

example.ex: I don't want to see her any more...
example.tran: 我不想再见到她。

example.ex: We felt we had no home any more, no family, nothing...
example.tran: 我们觉得我们没有了家，也没有了家人，一无所有。

example.ex: I couldn't keep the tears hidden any longer.
example.tran: 我再也掩饰不住泪水。

sense.def: Anybody means the same as anyone .
Anyhow means the same as anyway .
If you do something anyhow, you do it in a careless or untidy way.
sense.tran: 马马虎虎地；杂乱无章地

example.ex: ...her long legs which she displayed all anyhow getting in and out of her car.
example.tran: 她上下车时不经意露出的长腿

entry.boxr: In British English, the spelling anymore is sometimes considered incorrect, and any more is used instead. 在英国英语中，拼写形式anymore有时被认为不正确，而要用any more。

sense.def: If something does not happen or is not true anymore, it has stopped happening or is no longer true.

example.ex: I don't ride my motorbike much anymore...
example.tran: 我不怎么骑我的摩托车了。

example.ex: I couldn't trust him anymore...
example.tran: 我无法再相信他。

example.ex: People are not interested in movies anymore.
example.tran: 人们不再对电影感兴趣了。

sense.def: You use anyone or anybody in statements with negative meaning to indicate in a general way that nobody is present or involved in an action.

example.ex: I won't tell anyone I saw you here...
example.tran: 我不会告诉任何人我在这儿见过你。

example.ex: You needn't talk to anyone if you don't want to...
example.tran: 不想说话的时候，你可以不说。

example.ex: He was far too scared to tell anybody...
example.tran: 他害怕极了，不敢告诉任何人。

example.ex: Presidents are not any different from anybody else; they're human beings.
example.tran: 总统跟一般人没有什么不同；他们也是人。

sense.def: You use anyone or anybody in questions and conditional clauses to ask or talk about whether someone is present or doing something.
sense.tran: （用于疑问句或条件从句）任何人

example.ex: Why would anyone want that job?...
example.tran: 为什么会有人想要那份工作呢？

example.ex: How can anyone look sad at an occasion like this?...
example.tran: 在这样的场合怎么会有人显得忧伤呢？

example.ex: If anyone deserves to be happy, you do.
example.tran: 如果有谁应该获得幸福的话，那就是你。

sense.def: You use anyone or anybody before words which indicate the kind of person you are talking about.
sense.tran: （用于描述所谈论的人的词语前）…人

example.ex: I always had been the person who achieved things before anyone else at my age...
example.tran: 我过去总是比同龄人要捷足先登。

example.ex: It's not a job for anyone who is slow with numbers...
example.tran: 这份工作不适合不擅长算术的人。

example.ex: Anybody interested in pop culture at all should buy 'Pure Cult'.
example.tran: 任何对流行文化有一点兴趣的人都应该买《完全崇拜》这张专辑。

sense.def: You use anyone or anybody to refer to a person when you are emphasizing that it could be any person out of a very large number of people.
sense.tran: （用于强调）任何人，随便哪个人

example.ex: Anyone could be doing what I'mdoing...
example.tran: 我在做的事，谁都可能正在做。

example.ex: Al Smith could make anybody laugh.
example.tran: 阿尔·史密斯能把所有人逗乐。

sense.def: You use anyone who is anyone and anybody who is anybody to refer to people who are important or influential.
sense.tran: 重要人物;有影响的人物

example.ex: It seems anyone who's anyone in business is going to the conference.
example.tran: 似乎商界所有重要人物都将参加那个会议。

boxu.usage: Do not confuse anyone with any one. Anyone always refers to people. In the phrase any one, 'one' is a pronoun or a determiner that can refer to either a person or a thing, depending on the context. It is often followed by the word of. Parting from any one of you for even a short time is hard... None of us stay in any one place for a very long time. In these examples, any one is a more emphatic way of saying any. Anyone or anybody is mainly used in questions and negative sentences. You use not anyone instead of someone in negative sentences. There isn't anyone here... There isn't anybody here.
boxu.tran: 切勿混淆anyone和any one。anyone总是指人，而短语any one中的one可以作代词也可作限定词，根据上下文既可指人也可指物，后面常跟of：Parting from any one of you for even a short time is hard（要离开你们中的任何一人，即使时间很短暂，也是件令人难受的事），None of us stay in any one place for a very long time（我们谁也没有在任何一个地方久留过）。在上述例子中，any one是any的强调性说法。anyone或anybody主要用于疑问句或否定句。在否定句中不用someone，而用not anyone：There isn’t anyone here（这儿没有人），There isn’t anybody here（这儿没有人）。

sense.def: Anyplace means the same as anywhere .

example.ex: She didn't have anyplace to go...
example.tran: 她无处可去。

example.ex: You can go anyplace to get the car serviced.
example.tran: 你可以去任何地方给汽车作检修。

sense.def: You use anything in statements with negative meaning to indicate in a general way that nothing is present or that an action or event does not or cannot happen.
sense.tran: （用于否定句）任何事物，什么事情

example.ex: We can't do anything...
example.tran: 我们什么都做不了。

example.ex: Dad sat, not saying anything...
example.tran: 爸爸坐着，一声不吭。

example.ex: She couldn't see or hear anything at all...
example.tran: 她什么也看不见，什么也听不见。

example.ex: By the time I get home, I'm too tired to do anything active...
example.tran: 我到家时累得无法动弹。

example.ex: I couldn't manage anything without you.
example.tran: 没有你，我一事无成。

sense.def: You use anything in questions and conditional clauses to ask or talk about whether something is present or happening.
sense.tran: （用于疑问句或条件从句）任何事物，任何事情

example.ex: What happened, is anything wrong?...
example.tran: 怎么了，出什么事了吗？

example.ex: Did you find anything?...
example.tran: 你找到什么了吗？

example.ex: Is there anything you can do to help?...
example.tran: 你能帮忙做点什么吗？

example.ex: If there's anything I could do for him, I would.
example.tran: 如果需要我帮他做点什么，我会帮忙的。

sense.def: You can use anything before words which indicate the kind of thing you are talking about.
sense.tran: （用于描述所谈论事物的词语前）…的东西，…的事情

example.ex: More than anything else, he wanted to become a teacher...
example.tran: 他最想成为一名教师。

example.ex: Anything that's cheap this year will be even cheaper next year...
example.tran: 今年的便宜货明年会更便宜。

example.ex: She collects anything that has charm.
example.tran: 她收集一切有特色的东西。

sense.def: You use anything to emphasize a possible thing, event, or situation, when you are saying that it could be any one of a very large number of things.
sense.tran: （用于加强语气）无论什么东西，随便什么事情

example.ex: He is young, fresh, and ready for anything...
example.tran: 他年轻又富有朝气，什么事都愿意做。

example.ex: At that point, anything could happen...
example.tran: 那一刻，什么事都可能发生。

example.ex: He is convinced he just has to say 'please' and he can have anything.
example.tran: 他深信只要说一个“请”字，他就能拥有任何东西。

sense.def: You use anything in expressions such as anything near ,anything close to and anything like to emphasize a statement that you are making.

example.ex: Doctors have decided the only way he can live anything near a normal life is to give him an operation...
example.tran: 医生的结论是只有做手术，他才有可能过上基本正常的生活。

example.ex: Only Cowans played anything close to his true form...
example.tran: 只有考恩斯算是发挥出了正常水平。

example.ex: Plainer examples of the early period do not fetch anything like these sums.
example.tran: 早期更为普通的样本卖不到这种价钱。

sense.hdgr:
PRON
from n
to n, PRON
between n
and n
sense.def: When you do not want to be exact, you use anything to talk about a particular range of things or quantities.

example.ex: Factory farming has turned the cow into a milk machine, producing anything from 25 to 40 litres of milk per day...
example.tran: 集约饲养把奶牛变成了生产牛奶的机器，每天差不多要挤出25升到40升的牛奶。

example.ex: Fights with his father lasted anything between fifteen minutes and an hour.
example.tran: 和他父亲争吵了大约15分钟到一个小时。

boxu.usage: Anything is mainly used in questions and negative sentences. You use not anything instead of something in negative sentences. There isn't anything here.
boxu.tran: anything主要用于疑问句和否定句。否定句中用not anything代替something，如：There isn’t anything here（这儿什么也没有）。

phrase.def: You use as anything after an adjective to emphasize a quality that someone has.
phrase.tran: （用于形容词后表示强调）非常，十分

example.ex: He used to be as smart as anything...
example.tran: 他过去聪明绝顶。

example.ex: She opened the door and jumped out, quick as anything.
example.tran: 她打开门，飞快地跳了出来。

phrase.def: You use anything but in expressions such as anything but quiet and anything but attractive to emphasize that something is not the case.
phrase.tran: 单单除…之外;根本不;远非

example.ex: I will be anything but quiet on Saturday night!...
example.tran: 星期六的晚上我根本静不下心来！

example.ex: There's no evidence that he told anyone to say anything but the truth...
example.tran: 并无证据表明他让什么人隐瞒真相。

example.ex: The Los Angeles police chief was not always so insulated from politicians; anything but.
example.tran: 洛杉矶警察局局长并不总是如此疏远政客，根本不会。

phrase.def: You can say that you would not do something for anything to emphasize that you definitely would not want to do or be a particular thing.

example.ex: I wouldn't want to move for anything in the world...
example.tran: 就是天塌了我也不搬走。

example.ex: I wouldn't have missed this summer in England for anything...
example.tran: 我本来说什么也不会错过在英格兰的这个夏季的。

example.ex: I wouldn't be without Matthew for anything.
example.tran: 我决不会离开马修。

phrase.def: You use if anything, especially after a negative statement, to introduce a statement that adds to what you have just said.
phrase.tran: （尤用于否定句后，对所说之事进行补充说明）甚至正相反，甚至还不如说

example.ex: I never had to clean up after him. If anything, he did most of the cleaning.
example.tran: 我从来不用跟在他后面打扫卫生。恰恰相反，他包揽了大部分的清洁工作。

phrase.def: You can add or anything to the end of a clause or sentence in order to refer vaguely to other things that are or may be similar to what has just been mentioned.
phrase.tran: 或其他什么的；诸如此类

example.ex: Listen, if you talk to him or anything make sure you let us know, will you...
example.tran: 听着，如果你和他说话或什么的，一定要让我们知道，好吗？

example.ex: He didn't cry or scream or anything.
example.tran: 他没哭也没喊，什么事也没有。

sense.hdgr: ADV with v, oft ADV prep/cl
sense.def: You use anytime to mean a point in time which is not fixed or set.

example.ex: The college admits students anytime during the year...
example.tran: 该学院一年中随时招生。

example.ex: He can leave anytime he wants...
example.tran: 他想走的话随时可以走。

example.ex: He can call me anytime.
example.tran: 他随时可以给我打电话。

sense.def: You use anyway or anyhow to indicate that a statement explains or supports a previous point.

example.ex: I'm certain David's told you his business troubles. Anyway, it's no secret that he owes money...
example.tran: 我敢肯定戴维已经告诉过你他生意上有麻烦了。反正他欠钱也不是什么秘密了。

example.ex: Mother certainly won't let him stay with her and anyhow he wouldn't.
example.tran: 母亲当然不会让他和她住在一起，再说他也不愿意。

sense.def: You use anyway or anyhow to suggest that a statement is true or relevant in spite of other things that have been said.

example.ex: I don't know why I settled on Aberdeen, but anyway I did...
example.tran: 我不知道为什么我定居在阿伯丁，尽管如此，我还是这么做了。

example.ex: I wasn't qualified to apply for the job really but I got it anyhow.
example.tran: 实际上我并不具备申请这份工作的资格，但不管怎样，我还是被录用了。

sense.def: You use anyway or anyhow to correct or modify a statement, for example to limit it to what you definitely know to be true.

example.ex: Mary Ann doesn't want to have children. Not right now, anyway.
example.tran: 玛丽·安不想要孩子，至少现在不想。

sense.def: You use anyway or anyhow to indicate that you are asking what the real situation is or what the real reason for something is.

example.ex: What do you want from me, anyway?...
example.tran: 你到底想从我这儿得到什么？

example.ex: Where the hell was Bud, anyhow?
example.tran: 巴德到底在哪儿？

sense.def: You use anyway or anyhow to indicate that you are missing out some details in a story and are passing on to the next main point or event.
sense.tran: （表示略去一些细节转到下一个主要话题）总之

example.ex: I was told to go to Reading for this interview. It was a very amusing affair. Anyhow, I got the job.
example.tran: 我被通知前往雷丁面试。整个过程很有意思。总之，我被录用了。

sense.def: You use anyway or anyhow to change the topic or return to a previous topic.
sense.tran: （用于转移话题或回到原话题）对了，好吧

example.ex: 'I've got a terrible cold.' — 'Have you? Oh dear. Anyway, so you're not going to go away this weekend?'
example.tran: “我得了重感冒。”——“是吗？哦，天啊。对了，那你这个周末就不走了吧？”

sense.def: You use anyway or anyhow to indicate that you want to end the conversation.

example.ex: 'Anyway, I'd better let you have your dinner. Give our love to Francis. Bye.'
example.tran: “那么，我不打扰你用餐了。代我们向弗朗西斯问好。再见。”

example.ex: 'Anyhow, thanks a lot. Bye bye.'
example.tran: “那么，多谢了。再见。”

sense.def: Anyways is a non-standard form of anyway.

sense.hdgr:
ADV after v,
be ADV, oft ADV cl/group
sense.def: You use anywhere in statements with negative meaning to indicate that a place does not exist.
sense.tran: （用于否定句）哪儿，到处（都没有）

example.ex: I haven't got anywhere to live...
example.tran: 我还没找到住的地方。

example.ex: There had never been such a beautiful woman anywhere in the world.
example.tran: 世界上从未有过如此美丽的女人。

sense.hdgr:
ADV after v,
be ADV,
from ADV, oft ADV cl/group
sense.def: You use anywhere in questions and conditional clauses to ask or talk about a place without saying exactly where you mean.
sense.tran: （用于疑问句和条件从句）某个地方，哪里

example.ex: Did you try to get help from anywhere?...
example.tran: 你尝试过从哪里寻求帮助吗？

example.ex: If she wanted to go anywhere at all she had to wait for her father to drive her.
example.tran: 她想去任何地方都只能等父亲开车送她去。

sense.def: You use anywhere before words that indicate the kind of place you are talking about.
sense.tran: （用于描述所谈论的某个地方的词语前）…地方

example.ex: In America most leisure-time activities are about a million times better than anywhere else...
example.tran: 美国大多数休闲娱乐活动比其他地方要丰富得多的多。

example.ex: He'll meet you anywhere you want...
example.tran: 他随你在哪儿见面都行。

example.ex: Let us know if you come across anywhere that has something special to offer.
example.tran: 如果你碰上哪儿有什么特别的东西出售，就告诉我们。

sense.def: You use anywhere to refer to a place when you are emphasizing that it could be any of a large number of places.

example.ex: Rachel would have known Julia Stone anywhere.
example.tran: 甭管到哪儿，雷切尔都会认出朱莉娅·斯通。

example.ex: ...jokes that are so funny they always work anywhere.
example.tran: 屡试不爽的极为有趣的笑话

sense.hdgr:
ADV
from/to n, ADV
between pl-n, ADV
up
sense.def: When you do not want to be exact, you use anywhere to refer to a particular range of things.

example.ex: His shoes cost anywhere from $200 up...
example.tran: 他买的鞋子总在200美元以上。

example.ex: My visits lasted anywhere from three weeks to two months.
example.tran: 我每次逗留时间从3个星期到两个月不等。

sense.def: You use anywhere in expressions such as anywhere near and anywhere close to to emphasize a statement that you are making.
sense.tran: （用于强调）根本，一点儿，将近，几乎

example.ex: There weren't anywhere near enough empty boxes...
example.tran: 空箱子数量远远不够。

example.ex: The only one who's anywhere close to the truth is my mother.
example.tran: 唯一算得上了解真相的人是我的母亲。

sense.def: If you say that someone or something is not getting anywhere or is not going anywhere, you mean that they are not making progress or achieving a satisfactory result.

example.ex: The conversation did not seem to be getting anywhere...
example.tran: 会谈好像没有取得任何进展。

example.ex: I didn't see that my career as a film-maker was going anywhere.
example.tran: 我发现我作为电影制片人的职业没有什么发展前途。

boxu.usage: Anywhere is mainly used in questions and negative sentences. You use not anywhere instead of somewhere in negative sentences. He isn't going anywhere.
boxu.tran: anywhere主要用于疑问句和否定句。在否定句中，用not anywhere代替somewhere：He isn’t going anywhere（他哪儿也不去）。

sense.def: AOB is a heading on an agenda for a meeting, to show that any topics not listed separately can be discussed at this point, usually the end. AOB is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'any other business'.
sense.tran: 其他事项（指通常于正式会议末尾所讨论的未列入议事日程的事项）

sense.def: The aorta is the main artery through which blood leaves your heart before it flows through the rest of your body.
If something develops or continues apace, it is developing or continuing quickly.

example.ex: Land reclamation continues apace...
example.tran: 土地开垦继续快速进行。

example.ex: The plan is proceeding apace, with another 13 superstores opened in the first half of this year.
example.tran: 该计划进展迅速，在今年上半年又增开了13家大型超市。

boxx.note: In addition to the uses shown below, apart is used in phrasal verbs such as ‘grow apart’ and ‘take apart’.
boxx.tran: 除下列用法外，apart还可用于grow apart, take apart等短语动词中。

sense.hdgr:
ADV after v, oft ADV
from n
sense.def: When people or things are apart, they are some distance from each other.

example.ex: He was standing a bit apart from the rest of us, watching us...
example.tran: 他站在离我们其余人不远的地方，看着我们。

example.ex: She saw Sheila standing some distance apart...
example.tran: 她看见希拉站开了一段距离。

example.ex: Ray and sister Renee lived just 25 miles apart from each other.
example.tran: 雷和妹妹勒妮的住处仅相隔25英里。

example.ex: ...regions that were too far apart to have any way of knowing about each other...
example.tran: 相隔太远而无法互相了解的地区

example.ex: He was standing, feet apart.
example.tran: 他叉腿站着。

sense.def: If two people or things move apart or are pulled apart, they move away from each other.

example.ex: John and Isabelle moved apart, back into the sun...
example.tran: 约翰和伊莎贝拉彼此分开，回到了阳光下。

example.ex: He tried in vain to keep the two dogs apart before the neighbour intervened.
example.tran: 邻居过来帮忙前，他费了半天劲儿也没把两只狗分开。

sense.def: If two people are apart, they are no longer living together or spending time together, either permanently or just for a short time.

example.ex: It was the first time Jane and I had been apart for more than a few days...
example.tran: 那是我第一次和简分开数日。

example.ex: Mum and Dad live apart.
example.tran: 妈妈和爸爸分居。

sense.def: If you take something apart, you separate it into the pieces that it is made of. If it comes or falls apart, its parts separate from each other.

example.ex: When the clock stopped he took it apart to find out what was wrong...
example.tran: 钟一不走了，他就把它拆开看看哪儿出毛病了。

example.ex: Many school buildings are unsafe, and some are falling apart.
example.tran: 许多校舍不安全，有些简直是摇摇欲坠。

sense.def: If something such as an organization or relationship falls apart, or if something tears it apart, it can no longer continue because it has serious difficulties.

example.ex: Any manager knows that his company will start falling apart if his attention wanders...
example.tran: 每个经理都知道只要自己的注意力有所分散，公司就会分崩离析。

example.ex: Her marriage to film producer Michael Greenburg fell apart.
example.tran: 她和电影制片人迈克尔·格林伯格的婚姻破裂了。

sense.def: If something sets someone or something apart, it makes them different from other people or things.

example.ex: What really sets Mr Thaksin apart is that he comes from northern Thailand...
example.tran: 他信先生真正与众不同之处是他来自泰国北部。

example.ex: Health spending tends to rise disproportionately as countries become richer; but even adjusting for this, America is a case apart.
example.tran: 随着国家愈加富有，医疗保健费用增加的幅度却往往与之不成比例；但即使美国为此作出调整，还是与别国不同。

sense.hdgr:
v-link amount ADJ, oft ADJ
on n
