sense.def: If people or groups are a long way apart on a particular topic or issue, they have completely different views and disagree about it.
sense.tran: 意见不一致的；有分歧的

example.ex: Officials say they're so far apart on such a wide range of issues there's no telling how long the talks could drag on...
example.tran: 官员们声称他们在许多问题上分歧甚大，所以无法预见谈判将拖多久。

example.ex: Their concept of a performance and our concept were miles apart.
example.tran: 他们对于表演的理解和我们的大相径庭。

sense.def: If you can't tell two people or things apart, they look exactly the same to you.

example.ex: I can still only tell Mark and Dave apart by the colour of their shoes!
example.tran: 我仍然只能根据鞋子的颜色来区分马克和戴夫！

example.ex: Free range and battery eggs, boiled for four minutes, were hard to tell apart.
example.tran: 柴鸡蛋和笼养鸡蛋在煮过4分钟之后很难区分。

sense.def: You use apart from when you are making an exception to a general statement.

example.ex: The room was empty apart from one man seated beside the fire...
example.tran: 除了有个男人坐在火炉边，房间里空荡荡的。

example.ex: She was the only British competitor apart from Richard Meade.
example.tran: 她是除了理查德·米德之外唯一的英国参赛者。

sense.def: You use apart when you are making an exception to a general statement.

example.ex: This was, New York apart, the first American city I had ever been in where people actually lived downtown.
example.tran: 除了纽约，这是我到过的第一个人们确实住在市中心的美国城市。

sense.def: You use apart from to indicate that you are aware of one aspect of a situation, but that you are going to focus on another aspect.

example.ex: Illiteracy threatens Britain's industrial performance. But, quite apart from that, the individual who can't read or write is unlikely to get a job...
example.tran: 文盲的存在影响着英国的产业效益。但是，除此以外，更重要的是那些不具备读写能力的人也不太可能找到工作。

example.ex: There was always something to look forward to, apart from Rachel's visits.
example.tran: 除了雷切尔的来访，总还有别的事情可以期待。

sense.def: You use apart to indicate that you are aware of one aspect of a situation, but that you are going to focus on another aspect.

example.ex: That argument apart, it is for the Germans themselves to work out how their forces should come together.
example.tran: 撇开那场纷争不谈，德国人自己也应该考虑一下如何将各种力量拧成一股绳。

sense.def: Apartheid was a political system in South Africa in which people were divided into racial groups and kept apart by law.
sense.tran: （南非曾经施行的）种族隔离制

example.ex: He praised her role in the struggle against apartheid.
example.tran: 他称赞了她在反种族隔离制的斗争中发挥的重要作用。

example.ex: ...the anti-apartheid movement.
example.tran: 反种族隔离制运动

sense.def: An apartment is a set of rooms for living in, usually on one floor of a large building.
sense.tran: （通常指在同一楼层的）公寓套房

example.ex: Christina has her own apartment, with her own car.
example.tran: 克里斯蒂娜有自己的公寓和汽车。

example.ex: ...bleak cities of concrete apartment blocks.
example.tran: 到处是水泥公寓楼群的沉闷的城市

entry.boxr: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 flat

sense.def: The apartments of an important person such as a king, queen, or president are a set of large rooms which are used by them.
sense.tran: （国王、王后、总统等要人居住的）套间，套房

example.ex: ...the private apartments of the Prince of Wales at St James's Palace.
example.tran: 威尔士亲王在圣詹姆斯宫的私人套房

sense.def: An apartment building or apartment house is a tall building which contains different apartments on different floors.

example.ex: ...the Manhattan apartment house where they live.
example.tran: 他们居住的曼哈顿公寓大楼

entry.boxr: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 block of flats

sense.def: If you describe someone as apathetic, you are criticizing them because they do not seem to be interested in or enthusiastic about doing anything.
sense.tran: 漠然的;漠不关心的;无动于衷的

example.ex: Even the most apathetic students are beginning to sit up and listen...
example.tran: 连最不感兴趣的学生都开始坐直了听讲。

example.ex: Others feel apathetic about the candidates in both parties.
example.tran: 其他人对两党的候选人都不感兴趣。

sense.def: You can use apathy to talk about someone's state of mind if you are criticizing them because they do not seem to be interested in or enthusiastic about anything.

example.ex: They told me about isolation and public apathy.
example.tran: 他们向我谈到了孤立无助和公众的冷漠。

example.ex: ...the political apathy and emotional uncertainty of young Americans.
example.tran: 美国年轻人对政治的漠不关心和情感上的多变

sense.def: Apes are chimpanzees, gorillas, and other animals in the same family.

example.ex: ...the theory that man is descended from the apes.
example.tran: 认为人类是从类人猿演变而来的理论

sense.def: If you ape someone's speech or behaviour, you imitate it.

example.ex: Modelling yourself on someone you admire is not the same as aping all they say or do.
example.tran: 以偶像为榜样并不是说要模仿他们的一言一行。

example.ex: ...French films which merely aped Hollywood.
example.tran: 只是照搬好莱坞模式的法国电影

sense.def: If someone goes ape, they become very angry and upset.

example.ex: When Colonel Harper found out, he would go ape.
example.tran: 哈珀上校发现了一定会勃然大怒。

sense.def: An aperitif is an alcoholic drink that you have before a meal.

example.ex: ...a garden terrace where you can drink your aperitifs.
example.tran: 可用来餐前小酌的花园露台

sense.def: An aperture is a narrow hole or gap.

example.ex: Through the aperture he could see daylight.
example.tran: 透过缝隙，他能看见日光。

sense.def: In photography, the aperture of a camera is the size of the hole through which light passes to reach the film.

example.ex: Use a small aperture and position the camera carefully...
example.tran: 用小光圈，仔细调整相机位置。

example.ex: The camera has a 32mm lens with a maximum aperture of f/4.5 and a fixed shutter speed of 1/100sec.
example.tran: 这架相机有一个32毫米的镜头，最大孔径为f/4.5，固定快门速度为1/100秒。

sense.def: The apex of an organization or system is the highest and most important position in it.
sense.tran: （机构、体系的）最高地位，最高职位

example.ex: At the apex of the party was its central committee.
example.tran: 该党的最高权力机构是中央委员会。

sense.hdgr:
usu sing, oft
the N
of n
sense.def: The apex of something is its pointed top or end.

example.ex: ...the apex of the pyramid.
example.tran: 金字塔的顶端

sense.def: An Apex or an Apex ticket is a ticket for a journey by air or rail which costs less than the standard ticket, but which you have to book a specified period in advance.
sense.tran: （在一定时间之前预定即可享受折扣的）优惠机票（或火车票）

example.ex: The Apex fare is £195 return.
example.tran: 优惠往返机票价格为195英镑。

sense.def: Aphasia is a mental condition in which people are often unable to remember simple words or communicate.
Aphids are very small insects which live on plants and suck their juices.
An aphorism is a short witty sentence which expresses a general truth or comment.

example.ex: 'What if they gave a war and nobody came?' was one of his generation's favored aphorisms.
example.tran: “如果他们宣战却无人应战该怎么办？”是他那一代人钟爱的格言。

sense.def: An aphrodisiac is a food, drink, or drug which is said to make people want to have sex.

example.ex: Asparagus is reputed to be an aphrodisiac.
example.tran: 据说芦笋可以催情。

example.ex: ...plants with narcotic or aphrodisiac qualities.
example.tran: 具有催眠或催情作用的植物

sense.def: If people have a particular number of things apiece, they have that number each.

example.ex: He and I had two fish apiece...
example.tran: 他和我各有两条鱼。

example.ex: The World Series between the Atlanta Braves and Toronto Blue Jays is tied at one game apiece.
example.tran: 世界系列赛上，亚特兰大勇士队和多伦多蓝鸟队双方各赢一场，战成平局。

sense.def: If a number of similar things are for sale at a certain price apiece, that is the price for each one of them.

example.ex: Entire roast chickens were sixty cents apiece.
example.tran: 烤全鸡每只60美分。

sense.def: If you have something aplenty, you have a lot of it.

example.ex: There were problems aplenty at work.
example.tran: 工作中的问题俯拾皆是。

sense.def: If you do something with aplomb, you do it with confidence in a relaxed way.
sense.tran: 沉着;镇定;从容不迫;泰然自若

example.ex: The whole cast executed the production with truly professional aplomb.
example.tran: 全体演职人员以一种真正的专业精神，从容不迫地开始了影片的制作。

sense.def: The apocalypse is the total destruction and end of the world.

example.ex: We live in the shadow of the apocalypse, of a catastrophe that will mean the end of the world itself.
example.tran: 我们生活在意味着世界末日将要到来的灾难的阴影当中。

sense.def: Apocalyptic means relating to the total destruction of something, especially of the world.

example.ex: ...the reformer's apocalyptic warnings that the nation was running out of natural resources.
example.tran: 改革者发出的国家自然资源即将枯竭的末世警诫

sense.def: Apocalyptic means relating to or involving predictions about future disasters and the destruction of the world.
sense.tran: 预示世界末日的；预示世界覆灭的；预示大灾难的

example.ex: ...a gloomy and apocalyptic vision of a world hastening towards ruin.
example.tran: 未来世界加速迈向毁灭的暗淡而恐怖的景象

sense.def: An apocryphal story is one which is probably not true or did not happen, but which may give a true picture of someone or something.
sense.tran: （指可能会说明真相的故事）真实性可疑的，虚构的，杜撰的

example.ex: This may well be an apocryphal story...
example.tran: 这很可能是个杜撰的故事。

example.ex: There is a story, probably apocryphal, about a British motorcyclist on holiday in America.
example.tran: 故事讲述一位英国摩托车手在美国度假，但未必真实。

sense.def: The apogee of something such as a culture or a business is its highest or its greatest point.

example.ex: The Alliance for Progress reached its apogee during the first half of the decade.
example.tran: 这十年中的前五年是进步联盟迈向顶峰的时期。

sense.def: Someone who is apolitical is not interested in politics.
sense.tran: （指人）不关心政治的，对政治不感兴趣的

example.ex: As a musician, you cannot be apolitical.
example.tran: 作为一个音乐人，你不能不关心政治。

sense.def: If you describe an organization or an activity as apolitical, you mean that it is not linked to a particular political party.
sense.tran: （组织或活动）与政党无关的，不支持任何政党的

example.ex: ...the normally apolitical European Commission...
example.tran: 通常不支持任何政党的欧盟委员会

example.ex: Others maintain the violence is apolitical and the perpetrators are just gangs bent on defying authority.
example.tran: 其他人坚称该暴力事件与任何政党无关，行凶者只是意欲反抗权威的一伙人。

sense.def: If you are apologetic, you show or say that you are sorry for causing trouble for someone, for hurting them, or for disappointing them.
sense.tran: 表示歉意的；认错的；愧疚的

example.ex: The hospital staff were very apologetic but that couldn't really compensate...
example.tran: 医院的工作人员深表歉意，但这真的于事无补。

example.ex: They were almost apologetic about the improvements they'd made...
example.tran: 对于他们所做的改进，他们简直感到愧疚。

example.ex: 'I don't follow football,' she said with an apologetic smile.
example.tran: “我不懂足球，”她歉然一笑道。

example.ex: 'It's of no great literary merit,' he said, almost apologetically.
example.tran: “它没多大的文学价值，”他近乎愧疚地说道。

sense.def: An apologia is a statement in which you defend something that you strongly believe in, for example a way of life, a person's behaviour, or a philosophy.

example.ex: The left have seen the work as an apologia for privilege and property.
example.tran: 左派将此作品看成是为特权和所有权作的辩护。

sense.def: An apologist is a person who writes or speaks in defence of a belief, a cause, or a person's life.

example.ex: 'I am no apologist for Hitler,' observed Pyat.
example.tran: “我不是为希特勒辩护，”皮亚说。

example.ex: ...the great Christian apologist Origen.
example.tran: 伟大的基督教辩护士奥利金

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 apologise

sense.def: When you apologize to someone, you say that you are sorry that you have hurt them or caused trouble for them. You can say 'I apologize' as a formal way of saying sorry.

example.ex: Two years ago, Congress formally apologized for the internment...
example.tran: 两年前，国会就此拘留事件正式道歉。

example.ex: I apologize for being late...
example.tran: 我为自己的迟到致歉。

example.ex: Costello later apologized, saying he'd been annoyed by the man...
example.tran: 科斯特洛后来表示了歉意，说他是被那人惹怒的。

example.ex: He apologized to the people who had been affected.
example.tran: 他向受到影响的人赔了不是。

sense.def: An apology is something that you say or write in order to tell someone that you are sorry that you have hurt them or caused trouble for them.

example.ex: I didn't get an apology...
example.tran: 还没有向我道歉。

example.ex: We received a letter of apology...
example.tran: 我们收到了一封致歉信。

example.ex: He made a public apology for the team's performance.
example.tran: 他就队伍的表现公开道歉。

sense.def: If you offer or make your apologies, you apologize.

example.ex: His mother offered her apologies to the Jones family...
example.tran: 他的母亲向琼斯一家赔了不是。

example.ex: When Mary finally appeared, she made her apologies to Mrs Madrigal.
example.tran: 最终露面时，玛丽向马德里加尔夫人表示了歉意。

sense.def: If you say that you make no apologies for what you have done, you are emphasizing that you feel that you have done nothing wrong.

example.ex: Union officials made no apologies for the threatened chaos.
example.tran: 工会干部们对于迫在眉睫的混乱局面不予道歉。

sense.def: If someone is apoplectic, they are extremely angry about something.
sense.tran: 怒不可遏的；愤怒至极的

example.ex: It's enough to make them choke with apoplectic rage...
example.tran: 足以气得让他们说不出话来。

example.ex: My father was apoplectic when he discovered the truth.
example.tran: 我父亲在发现真相后勃然大怒。

sense.def: Apoplexy is a stroke.
Apoplexy is extreme anger.

example.ex: He has already caused apoplexy with his books on class and on war.
example.tran: 他关于阶级和战争的书已经激起了极大的愤怒。

sense.def: If someone is accused of apostasy, they are accused of abandoning their religious faith, political loyalties, or principles.

example.ex: ...a charge of apostasy.
example.tran: 叛教的指控

sense.def: An apostate is someone who has abandoned their religious faith, political loyalties, or principles.
The apostles were the followers of Jesus Christ who went from place to place telling people about him and trying to persuade them to become Christians.

example.ex: ...the twelve apostles.
example.tran: 十二门徒

sense.def: An apostle of a particular philosophy, policy, or cause is someone who strongly believes in it and works hard to promote it.
sense.tran: （政策或思想等的）信奉者，倡导者，鼓吹者

example.ex: Her mother was a dedicated apostle of healthy eating.
example.tran: 她母亲是健康饮食矢志不渝的倡导者。

sense.def: Apostolic means belonging or relating to a Christian religious leader, especially the Pope.

example.ex: He was appointed Apostolic Administrator of Minsk by Pope John Paul II.
example.tran: 他被教皇约翰·保罗二世任命为明斯克区的宗座署理。

sense.def: Apostolic means belonging or relating to the early followers of Christ and to their teaching.

example.ex: He saw his vocation as one of prayer and apostolic work.
example.tran: 他认为从事祷告和门徒的工作是他的使命。

sense.def: An apostrophe is the mark ' when it is written to indicate that one or more letters have been left out of a word, as in 'isn't' and 'we'll'. It is also added to nouns to form possessives, as in 'Mike's car'.
sense.tran: 撇号，省字号，所有格符号（符号为’）

sense.def: An apothecary was a person who prepared medicines for people.
If something is the apotheosis of something else, it is an ideal or typical example of it.

example.ex: The Oriental in Bangkok is the apotheosis of the grand hotel.
example.tran: 曼谷的东方饭店是豪华饭店的典范。

sense.def: If you describe an event or a time as someone's apotheosis, you mean that it was the high point in their career or their life.

example.ex: That night was Richard's apotheosis.
example.tran: 是夜，理查德登上了人生的顶峰。

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 appall

sense.def: If something appals you, it disgusts you because it seems so bad or unpleasant.

example.ex: His ignorance appals me...
example.tran: 他的无知让我震惊。

example.ex: My wife now looks like her mother, which appals me.
example.tran: 我老婆现在看着就跟丈母娘似的，可吓人了。

sense.hdgr:
usu v-link ADJ, usu ADJ
by/at n
sense.def: If you are appalled by something, you are shocked or disgusted because it is so bad or unpleasant.
sense.tran: 震惊的;惊恐的;感到厌恶的

example.ex: She said that the Americans are appalled at the statements made at the conference...
example.tran: 她说美国人对会上所作的陈述感到震惊。

example.ex: We are all, of course, appalled that such items are still on sale in the shops.
example.tran: 我们当然对这些物品竟然还在商店里出售表示震惊。

sense.def: Something that is appalling is so bad or unpleasant that it shocks you.
sense.tran: 令人震惊的；使人惊骇的；极为恶劣的

example.ex: They have been living under the most appalling conditions for two months.
example.tran: 他们已经在恶劣不堪的条件下生活两个月了。

example.ex: He says that he understands why they behaved so appallingly...
example.tran: 他说他知道为什么他们的行为如此恶劣。

example.ex: The detection rate for racial crimes is appallingly low.
example.tran: 种族罪案的侦破率之低让人震惊。

sense.def: You can use appalling to emphasize that something is very great or severe.

example.ex: I developed an appalling headache.
example.tran: 我头痛欲裂。

example.ex: It's been an appallingly busy morning.
example.tran: 那是一个忙得不可开交的早晨。

sense.def: An apparatchik is someone who works for a government or a political party and who always obeys orders.

example.ex: Political party apparatchiks are appointed to every office of social authority.
example.tran: 每个具有社会权力的官职都由政党官僚出任。

sense.def: The apparatus of an organization or system is its structure and method of operation.

example.ex: For many years, the country had been buried under the apparatus of the regime.
example.tran: 多年来，这个国家一直处于该政权机构的高压统治下。

example.ex: ...a massive bureaucratic apparatus.
example.tran: 庞大的官僚机构

sense.def: Apparatus is the equipment, such as tools and machines, which is used to do a particular job or activity.

example.ex: One of the boys had to be rescued by firemen wearing breathing apparatus.
example.tran: 其中一个男孩须由带着呼吸装置的消防员才能救出。

sense.def: Apparel means clothes, especially formal clothes worn on an important occasion.

example.ex: Women's apparel is offered in petite, regular, and tall models.
example.tran: 出售的女装有小号、中号和大号。

sense.def: An apparent situation, quality, or feeling seems to exist, although you cannot be certain that it does exist.
sense.tran: 貌似的；表面上的；似乎真实的

example.ex: I was a bit depressed by our apparent lack of progress...
example.tran: 我对我们看似缓慢的进展感到有些沮丧。

example.ex: There is at last an apparent end to the destructive price war.
example.tran: 这场惨烈的价格战貌似终于结束了。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, oft
it v-link ADJ that
sense.def: If something is apparent to you, it is clear and obvious to you.

example.ex: It has been apparent that in other areas standards have held up well...
example.tran: 显然，这些标准在其他地区执行得很好。

example.ex: The presence of a star is already apparent in the early film.
example.tran: 在早期影片中已经显露出了明星相。

sense.def: If you say that something happens for no apparent reason, you cannot understand why it happens.

example.ex: The person may become dizzy for no apparent reason.
example.tran: 这类人可能会莫名其妙地感到头晕。

sense.hdgr: ADV with cl/group, ADV before v
sense.def: You use apparently to indicate that the information you are giving is something that you have heard, but you are not certain that it is true.

example.ex: Apparently the girls are not at all amused by the whole business...
example.tran: 据说女孩们觉得整件事情一点也不好笑。

example.ex: Oil prices fell this week to their lowest level in fourteen months, apparently because of over-production.
example.tran: 据说因为产量过剩，这个星期石油价格跌至14个月以来的最低点。

sense.hdgr: ADV with cl/group, ADV before v
sense.def: You use apparently to refer to something that seems to be true, although you are not sure whether it is or not.

example.ex: The recent deterioration has been caused by an apparently endless recession...
example.tran: 看似永无止境的经济衰退导致了最近的恶化。

example.ex: Rudolph said no more. Apparently he was a man of few words.
example.tran: 鲁道夫没再说话。看来他是个寡言少语的人。

sense.def: An apparition is someone you see or think you see but who is not really there as a physical being.

example.ex: The patient recognized one of the women as the apparition she had seen.
example.tran: 病人认出其中一个女的是她曾见过的幽灵。

example.ex: ...these apparitions of the Virgin.
example.tran: 圣母显灵

sense.def: If you appeal to someone to do something, you make a serious and urgent request to them.

example.ex: The Prime Minister appealed to young people to use their vote...
example.tran: 首相呼吁年轻人行使他们的投票权。

example.ex: He will appeal to the state for an extension of unemployment benefits...
example.tran: 他将呼吁国家延长领取失业救济金的时限。

example.ex: The United Nations has appealed for help from the international community.
example.tran: 联合国已经呼吁国际社会提供援助。

sense.hdgr:
oft N
for/to n, N to-inf
sense.def: An appeal is a serious and urgent request.

example.ex: He has a message from King Fahd, believed to be an appeal for Arab unity...
example.tran: 法赫德国王传话给他，据信内容是呼吁整个阿拉伯世界团结起来。

example.ex: Romania's government issued a last-minute appeal to him to call off his trip.
example.tran: 罗马尼亚政府最后一刻恳请他取消行程。

sense.hdgr:
oft N to-inf, N
for n
sense.def: An appeal is an attempt to raise money for a charity or for a good cause.

example.ex: ...an appeal to save a library containing priceless manuscripts...
example.tran: 为挽救存有珍贵手稿的图书馆的一次募捐

example.ex: This is not another appeal for famine relief.
example.tran: 这不是为赈济饥荒的又一次募捐。

sense.def: If you appeal to someone in authority against a decision, you formally ask them to change it. In British English, you appeal against something. In American English, you appeal something.

example.ex: He said they would appeal against the decision...
example.tran: 他说他们将对该决议提出申诉。

example.ex: We intend to appeal the verdict...
example.tran: 我们打算对裁决提出上诉。

example.ex: Maguire has appealed to the Supreme Court to stop her extradition.
example.tran: 马圭尔已向最高法院提出上诉，要求停止对她的引渡。

sense.def: An appeal is a formal request for a decision to be changed.

example.ex: Heath's appeal against the sentence was later successful...
example.tran: 希思对判决不服提出上诉，后来胜诉了。

example.ex: The jury agreed with her, but she lost the case on appeal.
example.tran: 陪审团同意她的说法，但在上诉时她败诉了。

sense.def: If something appeals to you, you find it attractive or interesting.

example.ex: On the other hand, the idea appealed to him...
example.tran: 从另一方面来说，这个想法又使他很感兴趣。

example.ex: The range has long appealed to all tastes.
example.tran: 该系列长期受到各类人士的欢迎。

sense.def: The appeal of something is a quality that it has which people find attractive or interesting.

example.ex: Its new title was meant to give the party greater public appeal...
example.tran: 新的党名意在使该党对公众具有更强的吸引力。

example.ex: Johnson's appeal is to people in all walks of life.
example.tran: 约翰逊广受各界人士欢迎。

sense.def: An appeal court is the same as a Court of Appeal .
Someone or something that is appealing is pleasing and attractive.
sense.tran: 有吸引力的;有趣的;动人的

example.ex: There was a sense of humour to what he did that I found very appealing...
example.tran: 他举手投足间流露出一种幽默感，我觉得很有魅力。

example.ex: That's a very appealing idea.
example.tran: 那是个十分吸引人的想法。

example.ex: Irish whiskeys, rather like the Irish themselves, have an appealingly direct charm about them.
example.tran: 爱尔兰威士忌，就像爱尔兰人一样，一下子就能打动你的心。

sense.def: An appealing expression or tone of voice indicates to someone that you want help, advice, or approval.

example.ex: She gave him a soft appealing look that would have melted solid ice.
example.tran: 她恳求地看了他一眼，温柔的眼神足以融化坚冰。

example.ex: Dena looked appealingly at Blair, hoping to hear a contrary opinion.
example.tran: 德娜恳切地看着布莱尔，希望听到相反的观点。

sense.def: An appeal tribunal is a special court or committee that is formed to reconsider a decision made by another court or committee.
If you say that something appears to be the way you describe it, you are reporting what you believe or what you have been told, though you cannot be sure it is true.

example.ex: There appears to be increasing support for the leadership to take a more aggressive stance...
example.tran: 好像有越来越多的人支持领导层采取更为强势的立场。

example.ex: The aircraft appears to have crashed near Katmandu...
example.tran: 飞机似乎在加德满都附近坠毁了。

example.ex: It appears that some missiles have been moved...
example.tran: 一些导弹似乎已经被移走了。

example.ex: It appears unlikely that the UN would consider making such a move...
example.tran: 看起来联合国不太可能考虑采取这样一种行动。

example.ex: The presidency is beginning to appear a political irrelevance...
example.tran: 总统一职似乎正在沦为政治上的摆设。

example.ex: Nine months later, those talks appear as distant as ever...
example.tran: 9个月以后，那些会谈似乎仍然遥遥无期。

example.ex: He appeared willing to reach an agreement.
example.tran: 他似乎愿意达成协议。

sense.def: If someone or something appears to have a particular quality or characteristic, they give the impression of having that quality or characteristic.

example.ex: She did her best to appear more self-assured than she felt...
example.tran: 她竭力让自己表现得比实际更自信。

example.ex: He is anxious to appear a gentleman...
example.tran: 他急于想表现得像个绅士。

example.ex: Under stress these people will appear to be superficial, over-eager and manipulative.
example.tran: 这些人在压力下会显得浅薄无知、操之过急，而且爱摆布人。

sense.def: When someone or something appears, they move into a position where you can see them.

example.ex: A woman appeared at the far end of the street...
example.tran: 一个女人远远出现在街的尽头。

example.ex: Last night some of the prisoners appeared on the roof.
example.tran: 昨晚，其中几个犯人出现在房顶上。

sense.def: When something new appears, it begins to exist or reaches a stage of development where its existence can be noticed.

example.ex: ...small white flowers which appear in early summer...
example.tran: 初夏时绽放的白色小花

example.ex: Slogans have appeared on walls around the city.
example.tran: 标语已出现在全城周围的墙上。

example.ex: ...a test which can reveal infection at an early stage, before symptoms appear...
example.tran: 可在症状出现前检测出早期感染的测试

sense.def: When something such as a book appears, it is published or becomes available for people to buy.

example.ex: I could hardly wait for 'Boys' World' to appear each month.
example.tran: 每个月我都翘首期盼着《男孩世界》的出版。

example.ex: ...a poem which appeared in his last collection of verse.
example.tran: 发表在他最后一部诗集中的一首诗

sense.def: When someone appears in something such as a play, a show, or a television programme, they take part in it.

example.ex: Jill Bennett became John Osborne's fourth wife, and appeared in several of his plays...
example.tran: 吉尔·本内特成为了约翰·奥斯本的第四任妻子，并参演过他的几部戏剧。

example.ex: Student leaders appeared on television to ask for calm.
example.tran: 学生领袖出现在电视上请求大家保持冷静。

sense.def: When someone appears before a court of law or before an official committee, they go there in order to answer charges or to give information as a witness.

example.ex: Two other executives appeared at Worthing Magistrates' Court charged with tax fraud...
example.tran: 又有两个经理因偷税漏税指控被传唤到沃辛治安法庭。

example.ex: The American will appear before members of the disciplinary committee at Portman Square.
example.tran: 那个美国人将在波特曼广场接受纪律委员会成员的审问。

sense.hdgr: usu with supp, oft supp N
sense.def: When someone makes an appearance at a public event or in a broadcast, they take part in it.

example.ex: It was the president's second public appearance to date...
example.tran: 这是总统到那时为止的第二次公开露面。

example.ex: Keegan made 68 appearances in two seasons for Southampton, scoring 37 times.
example.tran: 基冈为南安普敦队踢了两个赛季，共上场68次，进球37个。

sense.def: Someone's or something's appearance is the way that they look.

example.ex: She used to be so fussy about her appearance...
example.tran: 她过去非常在意自己的容貌。

example.ex: He had the appearance of a college student...
example.tran: 他的模样就像个大学生。

example.ex: A flat-roofed extension will add nothing to the value or appearance of the house.
example.tran: 增建一个平顶房既不会使房子增值也不会使其更美观。

sense.hdgr:
with supp, oft N
of n
sense.def: The appearance of someone or something in a place is their arrival there, especially when it is unexpected.

example.ex: The sudden appearance of a few bags of rice could start a riot.
example.tran: 突然出现几袋大米可能会引起骚乱。

example.ex: ...last Christmas, when there'd been the welcome appearance of Cousin Fred.
example.tran: 去年圣诞，堂兄弗雷德的现身受到热烈欢迎。

sense.hdgr:
with supp, oft N
of n
sense.def: The appearance of something new is its coming into existence or use.

example.ex: Flowering plants were making their first appearance, but were still a rarity...
example.tran: 显花植物开始出现了，但仍然很少。

example.ex: Fears are growing of a cholera outbreak following the appearance of a number of cases in the city.
example.tran: 该市出现几起霍乱病例之后，人们对霍乱爆发的恐惧越来越强烈。

sense.def: If something has the appearance of a quality, it seems to have that quality.

example.ex: We tried to meet both children's needs without the appearance of favoritism or unfairness...
example.tran: 我们尽力对两个孩子的需要都予以满足，而不显得有所偏向或袒护。

example.ex: The US president risked giving the appearance that the US was taking sides.
example.tran: 美国总统冒险作出美国正在摆明立场的姿态。

phrase.def: If something is true to all appearances ,from all appearances, or by all appearances, it seems from what you observe or know about it that it is true.

example.ex: He was a small and to all appearances an unassuming man.
example.tran: 他个子小，看上去不事张扬。

phrase.def: If you keep up appearances, you try to behave and dress in a way that people expect of you, even if you can no longer afford it.
phrase.tran: 装样子；撑场面；打肿脸充胖子

example.ex: His parents' obsession with keeping up appearances haunted his childhood.
example.tran: 父母过于爱面子的做法在他儿时一直困扰着他。

phrase.def: If you put in an appearance at an event, you go to it for a short time although you may not really want to, but do not stay.
phrase.tran: 露一下面;到场稍作停留

example.ex: You must put in an appearance, at least, or she'll think you're avoiding her.
example.tran: 至少，你必须露一下面，否则她会认为你在躲避她。

sense.def: Appearance money is money paid to a famous person such as a sports star or film star for taking part in a public event.
If you try to appease someone, you try to stop them from being angry by giving them what they want.

example.ex: Gandhi was accused by some of trying to appease both factions of the electorate...
example.tran: 一些人指责甘地试图安抚两派选民。

example.ex: The offer has not appeased separatists.
example.tran: 该提议未能平抚分裂分子。

example.ex: Not many such appeasers were left in 1941.
example.tran: 1941年这类绥靖分子所剩无几。

sense.def: Appeasement means giving people what they want to prevent them from harming you or being angry with you.

example.ex: He denied there is a policy of appeasement...
example.tran: 他否认有绥靖政策存在。

example.ex: They have already been accused of appeasement by more militant organisations.
example.tran: 已有更多的好战组织谴责他们采取姑息态度。

sense.def: An appellant is someone who is appealing against a court's decision after they have been judged guilty of a crime.

example.ex: The Court of Appeal upheld the appellants' convictions.
example.tran: 上诉法院维持了对上诉人的原判。

sense.def: In the United States, an appellate court is a special court where people who have been convicted of a crime can appeal against their conviction.

example.ex: A racially mixed jury in Miami convicted Lozano of manslaughter, but an appellate court overturned the convictions.
example.tran: 在迈阿密，由多种族人士组成的陪审团裁决洛扎诺犯过失杀人罪，但上诉法庭推翻了该判决。

entry.boxr: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 Court of Appeal

sense.def: An appellation is a name or title that a person, place, or thing is given.

example.ex: He earned the appellation 'rebel priest.'
example.tran: 他赢得了“反叛牧师”的称号。

sense.def: When you append something to something else, especially a piece of writing, you attach it or add it to the end of it.
sense.tran: （尤指在文章的末尾）附加，增补

example.ex: Violet appended a note at the end of the letter...
example.tran: 维奥莱特在信的末尾附加了一条备注。

example.ex: It was a relief that his real name hadn't been appended to the manuscript.
example.tran: 令人庆幸的是，手稿未落上他的真实姓名。

sense.def: An appendage is something that is joined to or connected with something larger or more important.

example.ex: ...the growing demand in Wales for recognition that it was not just an appendage to England...
example.tran: 有越来越多的威尔士人要求得到认可，即威尔士不只是英格兰的附属

example.ex: Macmillan must have loathed being judged as a mere appendage to domestic politics.
example.tran: 麦克米伦肯定极不喜欢只被当成国内政治的附属品。

sense.def: Appendices is a plural form of appendix.
Appendicitis is an illness in which a person's appendix is infected and painful.

example.ex: He is recovering in hospital after an operation for acute appendicitis.
example.tran: 做完急性阑尾炎手术后，他正在医院康复。

entry.boxr: In British English, the plural form appendices /ə'pendɪsiːz/ is usually used for meaning 2. 英国英语中，义项2的复数形式通常为appendices /ə'pendɪsiːz/。

sense.def: Your appendix is a small closed tube inside your body which is attached to your digestive system.

example.ex: ...a burst appendix.
example.tran: 阑尾穿孔

sense.def: An appendix to a book is extra information that is placed after the end of the main text.
Your appetite is your desire to eat.

example.ex: He has a healthy appetite...
example.tran: 他胃口很好。

example.ex: Symptoms are a slight fever, headache and loss of appetite.
example.tran: 症状包括低烧、头痛和食欲不振。

sense.def: Someone's appetite for something is their strong desire for it.

example.ex: ...his appetite for success.
example.tran: 他对成功的强烈渴望

example.ex: ...Americans' growing appetite for scandal...
example.tran: 美国人对丑闻日益增强的好奇心

example.ex: She gave him just enough information to whet his appetite.
example.tran: 她向他透露的信息刚好能吊起他的胃口。

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 appetiser

sense.def: An appetizer is the first course of a meal. It consists of a small amount of food.

example.ex: Seafood soup is a good appetizer.
example.tran: 海鲜汤是一道很好的开胃菜。

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用appetising

sense.def: Appetizing food looks and smells good, so that you want to eat it.
sense.tran: 色香俱佳的；引起食欲的

example.ex: ...the appetising smell of freshly baked bread...
example.tran: 新鲜出炉的面包发出的诱人香味

example.ex: Kippers are dyed yellow to make them more appetizing.
example.tran: 烟熏鲱鱼被腌成了黄色，令人垂涎欲滴。

example.ex: The tables were simply and appetisingly laid out.
example.tran: 餐桌摆好了，食物虽然简单但很能激起食欲。

sense.def: When a group of people applaud, they clap their hands in order to show approval, for example when they have enjoyed a play or concert.

example.ex: The audience laughed and applauded...
example.tran: 观众边笑边鼓掌。

example.ex: Every person stood to applaud his unforgettable act of courage.
example.tran: 所有人起立为他不可磨灭的英勇之举鼓掌。

sense.def: When an attitude or action is ap-plauded, people praise it.

example.ex: He should be applauded for his courage...
example.tran: 他的勇气值得称道。

example.ex: This last move can only be applauded...
example.tran: 最后这招令人拍手叫绝。

example.ex: She applauds the fact that they are promoting new ideas.
example.tran: 他们在宣传新思想，对此她表示赞许。

sense.def: Applause is the noise made by a group of people clapping their hands to show approval.

example.ex: They greeted him with thunderous applause.
example.tran: 他们以雷鸣般的掌声欢迎他。

example.ex: ...a round of applause.
example.tran: 一阵掌声

sense.def: An apple is a round fruit with smooth green, yellow, or red skin and firm white flesh.

example.ex: I want an apple.
example.tran: 我想要一个苹果。

example.ex: ...2kg cooking apples.
example.tran: 两公斤烹调用的苹果

example.ex: ...his ongoing search for the finest varieties of apple.
example.tran: 他对最优种苹果坚持不懈的寻找

example.ex: ...a large garden with apple trees in it.
example.tran: 种着苹果树的大果园

sense.def: If you say that someone is the apple of your eye, you mean that they are very important to you and you are extremely fond of them.

example.ex: Penny's only son was the apple of her eye.
example.tran: 彭妮的独子是她的心肝宝贝。

sense.def: If you upset the applecart, you do something which causes a plan, system, or arrangement to go wrong.
sense.tran: 破坏计划;扰乱制度;打乱安排

example.ex: They may also be friends of the chairman, so they are reluctant to upset the applecart.
example.tran: 他们也可能是主席的朋友，所以他们不愿从中作梗。

sense.def: An apple pie is a kind of pie made with apples.

phrase.def: If a room or a desk is in apple pie order, it is neat and tidy, and everything is where it should be.
phrase.tran: 整整齐齐的;井井有条的

example.ex: They found everything in apple-pie order.
example.tran: 他们发现一切都整整齐齐。

phrase.def: If you say that something is as American as apple pie, you mean that it is typically American.
phrase.tran: 十足美国味的；地道美国式的

example.ex: Jeans are as American as apple pie.
example.tran: 牛仔裤极具美国特色。

sense.def: Apple sauce is a type of sauce made from puréed cooked apples.
sense.tran: 苹果沙司;苹果泥;苹果酱

sense.def: An applet is a computer program which is contained within a page on the World Wide Web, and which transfers itself to your computer and runs automatically while you are looking at that Web page.
sense.tran: 小（应用）程序；（网页上的）小程序

sense.def: An appliance is a device or machine in your home that you use to do a job such as cleaning or cooking. Appliances are often electrical.

example.ex: He could also learn to use the vacuum cleaner, the washing machine and other household appliances.
example.tran: 他可以再学学使用吸尘器、洗衣机和其他家用电器。

example.ex: ...Maytag, one of America's biggest domestic appliance manufacturers.
example.tran: 美泰克公司，美国最大的家电制造商之一

sense.def: The appliance of a skill or of knowledge is its use for a particular purpose.

example.ex: These advances were the result of the intellectual appliance of science.
example.tran: 这些进步是巧妙应用科学的结果。

sense.hdgr:
usu v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
to n
sense.def: Something that is applicable to a particular situation is relevant to it or can be applied to it.
sense.tran: 适用的；适当的；可实施的

example.ex: What is a reasonable standard for one family is not applicable for another...
example.tran: 对一个家庭合理的标准并不适用于另一个家庭。

example.ex: Appraisal has traditionally been seen as most applicable to those in management and supervisory positions...
example.tran: 传统上认为业绩评定最适用于那些身处管理和监督职位之人。

example.ex: It should include a review of energy usage and, where applicable, the production and disposal of waste.
example.tran: 它应该包括对能耗的检查结果，适当时还应包括对垃圾的产生和处理的审查结果。

example.ex: Piaget himself wrote relatively little about the applicability of his theories to education.
example.tran: 皮亚热本人就其理论对教育的适用性论述相对很少。

sense.def: An applicant for something such as a job or a place at a college is someone who makes a formal written request to be given it.
sense.tran: 申请人（尤指提交正式书面申请的求职或求学的人）

sense.hdgr:
usu with supp, oft N
for n, N to-inf, also
on/upon N
sense.def: An application for something such as a job or membership of an organization is a formal written request for it.
sense.tran: 申请；请求；申请书；申请表

example.ex: His application for membership of the organisation was rejected...
example.tran: 他想要加入该组织的申请遭到了拒绝。

example.ex: ...Turkey's application to join the European Community...
example.tran: 土耳其要求加入欧共体的申请

example.ex: Applications should be submitted as early as possible...
example.tran: 申请表应尽早提交。

example.ex: Tickets are available on application.
example.tran: 票可以通过申请获得。

sense.def: The application of a rule or piece of knowledge is the use of it in a particular situation.

example.ex: Students learned the practical application of the theory they had learned in the classroom...
example.tran: 学生们学会了将课堂上学到的理论付诸实际应用。

example.ex: Simon's book provides a succinct outline of artificial intelligence and its application to robotics.
example.tran: 西蒙的书简明扼要地概括了人工智能及其在机器人技术方面的应用。

sense.def: In computing, an application is a piece of software designed to carry out a particular task.
Application is hard work and concentration on what you are doing over a period of time.

example.ex: ...his immense talent, boundless energy and unremitting application.
example.tran: 他横溢的才华、充沛的精力和不懈的努力

sense.def: The application of something to a surface is the act or process of putting it on or rubbing it into the surface.

example.ex: With repeated applications of weedkiller, the weeds were overcome.
example.tran: 经过反复施用除草剂，杂草得以彻底根除。

sense.def: An applicator is a device that you use to put something somewhere when you do not want to touch it or do it with your hands.
An applied subject of study has a practical use, rather than being concerned only with theory.

example.ex: ...Applied Physics.
example.tran: 应用物理学

example.ex: ...plans to put more money into applied research.
example.tran: 将更多资金投入应用研究的计划

sense.def: Applique is the craft of sewing fabric shapes onto larger pieces of cloth. You can also use applique to refer to things you make using this craft.

example.ex: Bead-work, applique and embroidery add a uniquely feminine touch.
example.tran: 珠饰、嵌花和刺绣可增添一种独特的女人味。

sense.def: Appliqued shapes or fabric are formed from pieces of fabric which are stitched on to clothes or larger pieces of cloth.

example.ex: ...a centrepiece of appliqued flowers and birds.
example.tran: 摆在中心、缝着花鸟的装饰品

example.ex: ...a magnificent appliqued bedspread.
example.tran: 华美的嵌花床罩

sense.def: If you apply for something such as a job or membership of an organization, you write a letter or fill in a form in order to ask formally for it.

example.ex: I am continuing to apply for jobs...
example.tran: 我正在继续找工作。

example.gram:
Also V
to n
for n
example.ex: They may apply to join the organization.
example.tran: 他们可以申请加入该组织。

sense.def: If you apply yourself to something or apply your mind to something, you concentrate hard on doing it or on thinking about it.
sense.tran: 使（自己）全神贯注于；使（注意力等）集中于

example.ex: Faulks has applied himself to this task with considerable energy...
example.tran: 福克斯为这项任务倾注了大量精力。

example.ex: In spare moments he applied his mind to how rockets could be used to make money.
example.tran: 在业余时间他潜心研究如何能用火箭来赚钱。

sense.def: If something such as a rule or a remark applies to a person or in a situation, it is relevant to the person or the situation.

example.ex: The convention does not apply to us...
example.tran: 这条惯例对我们不适用。

example.ex: The rule applies where a person owns stock in a corporation.
example.tran: 该规定适用于持有公司股票的人。

sense.def: If you apply something such as a rule, system, or skill, you use it in a situation or activity.

example.ex: The Government appears to be applying the same principle...
example.tran: 政府似乎是在运用相同的原则。

example.ex: His project is concerned with applying the technology to practical business problems.
example.tran: 他的项目是将这项技术应用于实际的商务问题。

sense.def: A name that is applied to someone or something is used to refer to them.

example.ex: Connell said a new medical term should be applied to Berg's actions. He calls it 'medicide'.
example.tran: 康奈尔说应该用一个新的医学名词描述伯格的行为。他称之为“医生协助自杀”。

sense.def: If you apply something to a surface, you put it on or rub it into the surface.

example.ex: The right thing would be to apply direct pressure to the wound...
example.tran: 正确的做法是直接按住伤口。

example.ex: Applying the dye can be messy, particularly on long hair.
example.tran: 涂抹染发剂可能会搞得一团糟，特别是长发。

sense.def: When the driver of a vehicle applies the brakes, he or she uses them to slow the vehicle down or to stop it from moving.

example.ex: They forgot to apply the handbrake and the car rolled 60ft into the river.
example.tran: 他们忘了拉手刹，汽车翻滚了60英尺，掉进了河里。

sense.def: If you appoint someone to a job or official position, you formally choose them for it.

example.ex: It made sense to appoint a banker to this job...
example.tran: 指派一位银行家做这份工作是明智之举。

example.ex: The commission appointed a special investigator to conduct its own inquiry...
example.tran: 委员会委派了一个特别调查员自行调查。

example.ex: The Prime Minister has appointed a civilian as defence minister...
example.tran: 首相已委任一位平民为国防部长。

example.gram: Also V n n, V n
example.ex: She was appointed a US delegate to the United Nations.
example.tran: 她被任命为美国驻联合国代表。

sense.def: If something happens at the appointed time, it happens at the time that was decided in advance.

example.ex: The appointed hour of the ceremony was drawing nearer.
example.tran: 既定的典礼时间就快到了。

sense.def: -appointed combines with adverbs to form adjectives such as well-appointed that describe a building or room that is equipped or furnished in the way that is mentioned.
sense.tran: （与副词组合，构成形容词）表示“有…装潢的”，“有…摆设的”

example.ex: Sloan looked round the well-appointed kitchen...
example.tran: 斯隆环顾了一下这间设备齐全的厨房。

example.ex: We ended up in a tastefully-appointed sitting room.
example.tran: 我们最后到了一间装潢雅致的起居室里。

sense.def: An appointee is someone who has been chosen for a particular job or position of responsibility.
sense.tran: 被任命的人；被委派的人

example.ex: ...Becket, a recent appointee to the Supreme Court.
example.tran: 贝克特，最高法院新任命的一员

example.ex: ...Diane Ravitch, a political appointee in charge of federal education research.
example.tran: 黛安娜·拉维奇，一个受政府委派负责联邦教育研究的人

sense.hdgr:
usu with poss, oft N
to/as n
sense.def: The appointment of a person to a particular job is the choice of that person to do it.

example.ex: His appointment to the Cabinet would please the right-wing.
example.tran: 他被任命为内阁成员会让右翼党派很高兴。

example.ex: ...his appointment as foreign minister in 1985.
example.tran: 在1985年他被委任为外交部长

sense.def: An appointment is a job or position of responsibility.

example.ex: Mr Fay is to take up an appointment as a researcher with the Royal Society.
example.tran: 费伊先生将担任皇家学会研究员的职务。

sense.hdgr:
oft N
with n, N to-inf
sense.def: If you have an appointment with someone, you have arranged to see them at a particular time, usually in connection with their work or for a serious purpose.

example.ex: She has an appointment with her accountant...
example.tran: 她和她的会计约好了见面。

example.ex: I made an appointment to see a specialist.
example.tran: 我约好去见一位专家。

example.ex: ...a dental appointment.
example.tran: 看牙医的预约

sense.def: If something can be done by appointment, people can arrange in advance to do it at a particular time.

example.ex: Viewing is by appointment only.
example.tran: 参观须事先预约。

sense.def: When you apportion something such as blame, you decide how much of it different people deserve or should be given.

example.ex: The experts are even-handed in apportioning blame among EU governments...
example.tran: 专家们在明确对欧盟各国政府所应追究的责任时十分公正。

example.ex: The allowable deduction is apportioned between the estate and the beneficiaries.
example.tran: 减免的税额在地产和受益人之间分摊。

example.ex: ...the apportionment of resources.
example.tran: 对资源的分配

sense.def: Something that is apposite is suitable for or appropriate to what is happening or being discussed.

example.ex: Recent events have made his central theme even more apposite...
example.tran: 新近发生的事情使得他的中心主题显得更加有的放矢。

example.ex: She thought in both languages, and selected the most apposite phrase from either.
example.tran: 她用两种语言思考，然后从中选择最贴切的一种表达。

sense.def: If two noun groups referring to the same person or thing are in apposition, one is placed immediately after the other, with no conjunction joining them, as in 'Her father, Nigel, left home three months ago.'
If you make an appraisal of something, you consider it carefully and form an opinion about it.

example.ex: What is needed in such cases is a calm appraisal of the situation...
example.tran: 在此类情况下需要对形势有一个冷静的评估。

example.ex: Self-appraisal is never easy.
example.tran: 进行自我评价向来很难。

sense.def: Appraisal is the official or formal assessment of the strengths and weaknesses of someone or something. Appraisal often involves observation or some kind of testing.
sense.tran: （官方或正式的常带考核性质的）评定，评价

example.ex: Staff problems should be addressed through training and appraisals.
example.tran: 职员问题应该通过培训和考核评定来解决。

example.ex: ...an appraisal of your financial standing.
example.tran: 对你的财务状况的评估

sense.def: If you appraise something or someone, you consider them carefully and form an opinion about them.

example.ex: This prompted many employers to appraise their selection and recruitment policies...
example.tran: 这促使许多雇主考量其人才选拔和招聘政策。

example.ex: Gloria slid an appraising eye over the rest of the rack before reaching for the dress.
example.tran: 格洛丽亚以审视的眼光向货架上其余的衣服扫了一遍，才伸手去拿那件连衣裙。

sense.def: An appraiser is someone whose job is to estimate the cost or value of something such as property.

entry.boxr: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 valuer

sense.def: An appreciable amount or effect is large enough to be important or clearly noticed.
sense.tran: 可觉察的；相当大的；明显的

example.ex: It contains less than 1 per cent fat, an appreciable amount of protein, and a high content of minerals...
example.tran: 它所含脂肪不到1%，富含蛋白质，矿物质含量也很高。

example.ex: This has not had an appreciable effect on production.
example.tran: 此事未对生产造成显著影响。

example.ex: Travel had not mellowed him appreciably...
example.tran: 游历并未使他明显成熟。

example.ex: Summer temperatures are appreciably more comfortable there.
example.tran: 那里夏天的气温明显舒服得多。

sense.def: If you appreciate something, for example a piece of music or good food, you like it because you recognize its good qualities.

example.ex: Anyone can appreciate our music...
example.tran: 任何人都能欣赏我们的音乐。

example.ex: In time you'll appreciate the beauty and subtlety of this language.
example.tran: 总有一天你会体会到这门语言的优美和微妙之处。

sense.def: If you appreciate a situation or problem, you understand it and know what it involves.

example.ex: She never really appreciated the depth and bitterness of the Irish conflict...
example.tran: 她从来没有真正认识到爱尔兰矛盾的深刻和激烈。

example.ex: He appreciates that co-operation with the media is part of his professional duties.
example.tran: 他懂得与媒体合作是自己工作职责的一部分。

sense.def: If you appreciate something that someone has done for you or is going to do for you, you are grateful for it.

example.ex: Peter stood by me when I most needed it. I'll always appreciate that...
example.tran: 当我最需要的时候，彼得在我身边支持我。我将永存感激。

example.ex: Thanks, lads. I appreciate it...
example.tran: 谢了，哥们儿。我很感激。

example.ex: I'd appreciate it if you wouldn't mention it.
example.tran: 如果你不提它，我会很感激。

sense.def: If something that you own appreciates over a period of time, its value increases.

example.ex: They don't have any confidence that houses will appreciate in value.
example.tran: 他们完全不相信房子会升值。

sense.hdgr:
also no det, oft N
of n
sense.def: Appreciation of something is the recognition and enjoyment of its good qualities.

example.ex: ...an investigation into children's understanding and appreciation of art...
example.tran: 就孩子对艺术的理解和欣赏所作的调查

example.ex: Brian whistled in appreciation.
example.tran: 布赖恩吹口哨以示赞赏。

sense.hdgr:
also no det, oft with poss, N
for n
sense.def: Your appreciation for something that someone does for you is your gratitude for it.

example.ex: He expressed his appreciation for what he called Saudi Arabia's moderate and realistic oil policies.
example.tran: 他表示很感激沙特阿拉伯推行的被他称作稳健而务实的石油政策。

example.ex: ...the gifts presented to them in appreciation of their work.
example.tran: 为感谢他们所做的工作而赠与他们的礼物

sense.hdgr:
also no det, with supp, oft N
of n
sense.def: An appreciation of a situation or problem is an understanding of what it involves.

example.ex: They have a stronger appreciation of the importance of economic incentives.
example.tran: 他们对经济激励的重要性有了更深的理解。

sense.def: Appreciation in the value of something is an increase in its value over a period of time.

example.ex: You have to take capital appreciation of the property into account.
example.tran: 你必须将该处房产的资本增值考虑在内。

sense.def: An appreciation of an artist or performer or of their work is a speech or piece of writing in which they are discussed and assessed.
sense.tran: （对艺术家、表演者或其作品的）评论，评价

example.ex: I had written an appreciation of Hernandez for a magazine.
example.tran: 我为一家杂志社写过一篇评论埃尔南德斯的文章。

sense.def: An appreciative reaction or comment shows the enjoyment that you are getting from something.

example.ex: There is a murmur of appreciative laughter...
example.tran: 发出一阵赞赏的低笑声。

example.ex: Mrs Hastings' eyes grow warmer and more appreciative with my every word.
example.tran: 我讲的每句话让黑斯廷斯夫人的眼神变得越来越热情，越来越充满欣赏。

example.ex: She looked appreciatively at Blair's lovely pictures.
example.tran: 她欣赏着布莱尔可爱的照片。

sense.def: If you are appreciative of something, you are grateful for it.

example.ex: We have been very appreciative of their support...
example.tran: 我们对他们的支持一直心存感激。

example.ex: Tom is genuinely appreciative of all the success he's had.
example.tran: 汤姆为他自己获得的所有成功由衷地感激。

sense.def: If the police apprehend someone, they catch them and arrest them.

example.ex: Police have not apprehended her killer.
example.tran: 警察还未抓获谋杀她的凶手。

sense.def: If you apprehend something, you understand it fully.

example.ex: Only now can I begin to apprehend the power of these forces.
example.tran: 直到现在我才真正了解这些队伍的力量。

sense.def: Apprehension is a feeling of fear that something bad may happen.

example.ex: It reflects real anger and apprehension about the future...
example.tran: 它反映出对未来真实的愤怒和恐惧。

example.ex: I tensed every muscle in my body in apprehension.
example.tran: 我吓得全身肌肉紧绷。

sense.def: The apprehension of someone who is thought to be a criminal is their capture or arrest by the police.

example.ex: ...information leading to the apprehension of the alleged killer.
example.tran: 致使凶杀嫌犯被捕的信息

sense.def: The apprehension of something is awareness and understanding of it.

example.ex: ...the sudden apprehension of something familiar as something alien.
example.tran: 突然间领悟到熟悉的事物原来如此陌生

sense.hdgr:
usu v-link ADJ, oft ADJ
about n/-ing
sense.def: Someone who is apprehensive is afraid that something bad may happen.

example.ex: People are still terribly apprehensive about the future.
example.tran: 人们对于将来仍然非常担心。

example.ex: I waited apprehensively for him to comment.
example.tran: 我战战兢兢地等着他给出评论。

sense.def: An apprentice is a young person who works for someone in order to learn their skill.

example.ex: I started off as an apprentice and worked my way up...
example.tran: 我从学徒开始干起，逐步上升。

example.ex: He left school at 15 and trained as an apprentice carpenter.
example.tran: 他15岁辍学，当上木工学徒。

sense.def: If a young person is apprenticed to someone, they go to work for them in order to learn their skill.

example.ex: I was apprenticed to a builder when I was fourteen.
example.tran: 14岁时，我拜一个建筑工人为师当学徒。

sense.def: Someone who has an apprenticeship works for a fixed period of time for a person who has a particular skill in order to learn the skill. Apprenticeship is the system of learning a skill like this.

example.ex: After serving his apprenticeship as a toolmaker, he became a manager.
example.tran: 结束了工具匠的学徒期以后，他当上了经理。

example.ex: ...a period of apprenticeship.
example.tran: 学徒期

sense.def: When you are apprised of something, someone tells you about it.

example.ex: Have customers been fully apprised of the advantages?...
example.tran: 顾客们已充分了解这些好处吗？

example.ex: We must apprise them of the dangers that may be involved.
example.tran: 我们必须告诉他们可能涉及的危险。

sense.def: When you approach something, you get closer to it.

example.ex: He didn't approach the front door at once...
example.tran: 他没有马上走向前门。

example.ex: When I approached, they grew silent...
example.tran: 当我走近时，他们就不说话了。

example.ex: We turned to see the approaching car slow down.
example.tran: 我们转身看见驶近的车慢慢停下。

example.ex: At their approach the little boy ran away and hid.
example.tran: 他们一走近，小男孩就逃走藏了起来。

example.ex: ...the approach of a low-flying helicopter.
example.tran: 一架低空飞行的直升机的逼近

sense.def: An approach to a place is a road, path, or other route that leads to it.

example.ex: The path serves as an approach to the boat house.
example.tran: 这条小路通往船屋。

sense.def: If you approach someone about something, you speak to them about it for the first time, often making an offer or request.

example.ex: When Chappel approached me about the job, my first reaction was of disbelief...
example.tran: 当查普尔为这份工作找我商量时，我的第一反应是不相信。

example.ex: He approached me to create and design the restaurant...
example.tran: 他请我建造并设计该饭店。

example.ex: Anna approached several builders and was fortunate to come across Eddie.
example.tran: 安娜与几个建筑商有过接洽，并且很幸运地碰到了埃迪。

example.ex: There had already been approaches from buyers interested in the whole of the group.
example.tran: 已有对整组感兴趣的买家来进行洽谈。

sense.def: When you approach a task, problem, or situation in a particular way, you deal with it or think about it in that way.

example.ex: The Bank has approached the issue in a practical way...
example.tran: 银行已经实际解决了这个问题。

example.ex: Employers are interested in how you approach problems.
example.tran: 雇主们对你如何处理问题感兴趣。

sense.hdgr:
usu with supp, oft N
to -ing/n
sense.def: Your approach to a task, problem, or situation is the way you deal with it or think about it.

example.ex: We will be exploring different approaches to gathering information.
example.tran: 我们将探索收集信息的不同方法。

example.ex: ...the adversarial approach of the British legal system.
example.tran: 英国法律制度采用的辩论式审判模式

sense.def: As a future time or event approaches, it gradually gets nearer as time passes.

example.ex: As autumn approached, the plants and colours in the garden changed.
example.tran: 秋天临近，花园中的草木和颜色也发生了变化。

example.ex: ...the approaching crisis.
example.tran: 步步逼近的危机

example.ex: ...the festive spirit that permeated the house with the approach of Christmas.
example.tran: 随着圣诞节临近房子里洋溢着的节日气氛

sense.def: As you approach a future time or event, time passes so that you get gradually nearer to it.

example.ex: We approach the end of the year with the economy slowing and little sign of cheer.
example.tran: 接近年末时，我们面临经济迟滞、处处萧条的局面。

sense.def: If something approaches a particular level or state, it almost reaches that level or state.

example.ex: Oil prices have approached their highest level for almost ten years...
example.tran: 石油价格已接近近10年中的最高水平。

example.ex: Mansell will race at average speeds approaching 200mph.
example.tran: 曼塞尔将以接近每小时200英里的平均车速参赛。

sense.def: If you describe someone as approachable, you think that they are friendly and easy to talk to.

example.ex: We found him very approachable and easy to talk with.
example.tran: 我们认为他非常和蔼可亲，容易交谈。

sense.def: If you describe an idea or piece of work as approachable, you think that it is presented in a way which people find enjoyable and easy to understand.
sense.tran: 易于理解的；容易接受的

example.ex: The text is approachable, coping well with quite complicated subjects.
example.tran: 这篇课文把相当复杂的主题讲述得深入浅出、通俗易懂。

sense.def: Approbation is approval of something or agreement to it.

example.ex: Julian Lloyd Webber thinks his brother would like the approbation of serious critics...
example.tran: 朱利安·劳埃德·韦伯认为他弟弟希望获得严肃批评家的认可。

example.ex: The result has not met universal approbation.
example.tran: 该结果尚未获得普遍认同。

entry.boxr: The adjective is pronounced /ə'prəʊpriət/. The verb is pronounced /ə'prəʊprieɪt/. 形容词读作/ə'prəʊpriət/，动词读作/ə'prəʊprieɪt/。

sense.hdgr:
oft
it v-link ADJ that/to-inf, ADJ
for/to n
sense.def: Something that is appropriate is suitable or acceptable for a particular situation.

example.ex: It is appropriate that Irish names dominate the list...
example.tran: 名单上大部分是爱尔兰名字，这没什么不合适的。

example.ex: Dress neatly and attractively in an outfit appropriate to the job...
example.tran: 着装要整洁美观，适合于这份工作。

example.ex: The teacher can then take appropriate action.
example.tran: 老师到时可以采取适当的行动。

rnon.hdgr: ADV with v, ADV with cl/group

example.ex: Dress appropriately and ask intelligent questions...
example.tran: 穿着要得体，提问要机敏。

example.ex: It's entitled, appropriately enough, 'Art for the Nation'.
example.tran: 它被恰如其分地取名为“为了国家的艺术”。

example.ex: He wonders about the appropriateness of each move he makes.
example.tran: 他对自己的每次行动都再三思量是否合适。

sense.def: If someone appropriates something which does not belong to them, they take it, usually without the right to do so.

example.ex: Several other newspapers have appropriated the idea...
example.tran: 另外有几家报社已盗用了这个创意。

example.ex: The land was simply appropriated by the rulers.
example.tran: 土地完全被统治者霸占。

sense.def: If a government or organization appropriates an amount of money for a particular purpose, it reserves it for that purpose.

example.ex: Senator Lugar is skeptical that Congress will appropriate more funding for this purpose.
example.tran: 参议员卢格怀疑国会是否会拨出更多资金用于此目的。

sense.def: An appropriation is an amount of money that a government or organization reserves for a particular purpose.

example.ex: The government raised defence appropriations by 12 per cent.
example.tran: 政府将国防拨款提高了12%。

sense.hdgr:
also
a N, usu N
of n
sense.def: Appropriation of something that belongs to someone else is the act of taking it, usually without having the right to do so.

example.ex: Other charges include fraud and illegal appropriation of land.
example.tran: 其他指控包括欺诈罪和非法侵占土地罪。

sense.hdgr:
usu with supp, oft with poss, N
for n
sense.def: If you win someone's approval for something that you ask for or suggest, they agree to it.

example.ex: ...efforts to win congressional approval for an aid package for Moscow...
example.tran: 为获得国会准许向莫斯科提供一揽子援助而付出的努力

example.ex: The chairman has also given his approval for an investigation into the case...
example.tran: 主席也已同意对此案进行调查。

example.ex: The proposed modifications met with widespread approval.
example.tran: 修改提议得到了广泛的赞同。

sense.def: Approval is a formal or official statement that something is acceptable.

example.ex: The testing and approval of new drugs will be speeded up.
example.tran: 新药品的检测和审批速度将会加快。

sense.def: If someone or something has your approval, you like and admire them.

example.ex: His son had an obsessive drive to gain his father's approval...
example.tran: 他儿子非常渴望得到父亲的嘉许。

example.ex: The president's approval rating had risen.
example.tran: 总统的支持率上升了。

sense.def: If a person or organization gives something their seal of approval or their stamp of approval, they officially say that they like it or think it is acceptable.

example.ex: Ministers have put their seal of approval on the proposal...
example.tran: 部长们已经批准了该提案。

example.ex: Last November the commission gave its stamp of approval to the deal.
example.tran: 去年11月，委员会核准了这宗交易。

sense.def: If you approve of an action, event, or suggestion, you like it or are pleased about it.

example.ex: Not everyone approves of the festival...
example.tran: 不是所有人都赞成庆祝该节日。

example.ex: I approved of the proposal.
example.tran: 我赞成该提案。

sense.def: If you approve of someone or something, you like and admire them.

example.ex: You've never approved of Henry, have you?...
example.tran: 你从来没有喜欢过亨利，对吗？

example.ex: I didn't approve of his manner.
example.tran: 我不喜欢他的态度。

sense.def: If someone in a position of authority approves a plan or idea, they formally agree to it and say that it can happen.

example.ex: The Russian Parliament has approved a program of radical economic reforms...
example.tran: 俄罗斯议会已经通过一项重大经济改革方案。

example.ex: MPs approved the Bill by a majority of 97.
example.tran: 议员们以97票的多数票通过了该议案。

sense.def: If a product or person is approved by an official organization, they are declared to be of a good enough standard to be used or employed.

example.ex: We have three suppliers in all who are approved by the Organic Farm Food Association.
example.tran: 我们总共有3家获有机农产品协会认可的供货商。

sense.def: An approved method or course of action is officially accepted as appropriate in a particular situation.
sense.tran: （方法或行为）被正式接受的，被正式认可的

example.ex: The approved method of cleaning is industrial sand-blasting.
example.tran: 得到正式认可的清洁方法是工业喷砂清洗。

sense.def: In Britain in the past, an approved school was a boarding school where young people could be sent to stay if they had been found guilty of a crime.
sense.tran: （旧时英国的）少年犯管教所，少年犯教养院

sense.def: An approving reaction or remark shows support for something, or satisfaction with it.
sense.tran: （反应、话语等）表示赞许的，表示嘉许的

example.ex: His mother leaned forward and gave him an approving look.
example.tran: 他的母亲探身向前，对他投以赞许的目光。

example.ex: He nodded approvingly.
example.tran: 他点头表示赞许。

sense.def: Approx. is a written abbreviation for (书面缩略=) approximately .

example.ex: Group Size: Approx. 12 to 16.
example.tran: 团队人数：约12至16人。

entry.boxr: The adjective is pronounced /ə'prɒksɪmət/. The verb is pronounced /ə'prɒksɪmeɪt/. 形容词读作 /ə'prɒksɪmət/，动词读作 /ə'prɒksɪ- meɪt/。

sense.def: An approximate number, time, or position is close to the correct number, time, or position, but is not exact.

example.ex: The approximate cost varies from around £150 to £250...
example.tran: 费用大概介于150至250英镑之间。

example.ex: The times are approximate only.
example.tran: 这些只是大致的时间。

example.ex: Approximately $150 million is to be spent on improvements.
example.tran: 大约1.5亿美元将用于作出改善。

sense.def: An idea or description that is approximate is not intended to be precise or accurate, but to give some indication of what something is like.

example.ex: They did not have even an approximate idea what the Germans really wanted.
example.tran: 他们完全不清楚德国人真正想要什么。

sense.def: If something approximates to something else, it is similar to it but is not exactly the same.

example.ex: Something approximating to a fair outcome will be ensured...
example.tran: 保证会有大致公正的结果。

example.ex: By about 6 weeks of age, most babies begin to show something approximating a day/night sleeping pattern.
example.tran: 到6个星期大时，大多数婴儿开始表现出近似于日夜分明的睡觉模式。

sense.def: An approximation is a fact, object, or description which is similar to something else, but which is not exactly the same.

example.ex: That is a fair approximation of the way in which the next boss is being chosen.
example.tran: 那和下一任老板的选任方式相当类似。

sense.def: An approximation is a number, calculation, or position that is close to a correct number, time, or position, but is not exact.

example.ex: Clearly that's an approximation, but my guess is there'll be a reasonable balance.
example.tran: 很明显那是个粗略的估计，但我猜会有一笔不少的余额。

sense.def: Appt is a written abbreviation for (书面缩略=) appointment.
Apr. is a written abbreviation for (书面缩略=) April .

example.ex: An agreement was reached on Apr. 27.
example.tran: 4月27号达成了一项协议。

sense.def: apres-ski is evening entertainment and social activities in places where people go skiing.
An apricot is a small, soft, round fruit with yellowish-orange flesh and a stone inside.

example.ex: ...12 oz apricots, halved and stoned.
example.tran: 12盎司切成两半并去核的杏子

example.ex: ...apricot tart.
example.tran: 杏肉馅饼

sense.def: Apricot is used to describe things that are yellowish-orange in colour.

example.ex: The bridesmaids wore apricot and white organza...
example.tran: 伴娘身着杏黄色和白色相间的透明硬纱礼服。

example.ex: The heavy curtains were a warm apricot.
example.tran: 这些厚重的窗帘是温暖的杏黄色。

sense.def: April is the fourth month of the year in the Western calendar.

example.ex: The changes will be introduced in April...
example.tran: 这些变更将于4月开始实行。

example.ex: They were married on 7 April 1927 at Paddington Register Office.
example.tran: 他们于1927年4月7日在帕丁顿登记处注册结婚。

sense.def: An April Fool is a trick that is played on April Fool's Day.
April Fool's Day is the 1st of April, the day on which people traditionally play tricks on each other.
An a priori argument, reason, or probability is based on an assumed principle or fact, rather than on actual observed facts.
sense.tran: 由因及果的；演绎的；推理的

example.ex: In the absence of such evidence, there is no a priori hypothesis to work with.
example.tran: 没有此类证据，就没有可以推理的前提。

posc.hdgr:
usu ADV
with cl, also ADV after v
posc.def: A priori is also an adverb.

example.ex: One assumes, a priori, that a parent would be better at dealing with problems.
example.tran: 人们总是想当然地认为父母更善于处理问题。

sense.def: An apron is a piece of clothing that you put on over the front of your normal clothes and tie round your waist, especially when you are cooking, in order to prevent your clothes from getting dirty.

defx.def: If you say that someone is tied to another person's apron strings, you mean that they are controlled or influenced too much by the other person.

example.ex: If you try to keep him under control and tethered to your apron strings there will almost certainly be a row.
example.tran: 如果你试图控制他，让他什么都听你的，十有八九你们会吵架。

sense.def: At an airport, the apron is the area of hard ground where aircraft are parked.
Something which is apropos, or apropos of, a subject or event, is connected with it or relevant to it.

example.ex: All my suggestions apropos the script were accepted...
example.tran: 我所有有关该剧本的建议均被采纳了。

example.ex: George Orwell once asked, apropos of publishers, 'Why don't they just say, “We don't want your poems”?'
example.tran: 乔治·奥威尔一次提及出版商时曾问道：“为什么他们不干脆说，‘我们不想要你的诗作’？”

sense.def: Apropos or apropos of is used to introduce something that you are going to say which is related to the subject you have just been talking about.

example.ex: Apropos Dudley Moore living in California he said, 'He loves the space, Californians have a lot of space.'
example.tran: 提到住在加利福尼亚的达德利·穆尔，他说：“他喜欢开阔，加利福尼亚人的生活空间非常开阔。”

sense.def: Something that is apropos is very suitable in a particular situation.

example.ex: It was a verse from the book of Job. It was so apropos.
example.tran: 这是摘自乔布书中的一句诗，用得非常恰当。

sense.def: An apt remark, description, or choice is especially suitable.
sense.tran: （话语、描述或选择）合适的，恰当的，贴切的

example.ex: The words of this report are as apt today as in 1929.
example.tran: 这份报告的措词用在今天和用在1929年一样贴切。

example.ex: ...an apt description of the situation.
example.tran: 对这种情况恰如其分的描述

example.ex: ...the beach in the aptly named town of Oceanside.
example.tran: 名字起得十分贴切的海洋边镇的海滩

sense.def: If someone is apt to do something, they often do it and so it is likely that they will do it again.

example.ex: She was apt to raise her voice and wave her hands about...
example.tran: 她动不动就拔高嗓门，并挥舞双手。

example.ex: This type of weather is apt to be more common in winter.
example.tran: 这种天气在冬季往往更为常见。

sense.def: Someone's aptitude for a particular kind of work or activity is their ability to learn it quickly and to do it well.

example.ex: An aptitude for computing is beneficial for students taking this degree.
example.tran: 计算才能对于攻读这个学位的学生有益处。

example.ex: Some students have more aptitude for academic work than others.
example.tran: 一些学生比其他学生更有学术才能。

sense.def: An aptitude test is a test that is specially designed to find out how easily and how well you can do something.
sense.tran: 能力倾向测验;能力测试

sense.def: Aqua is the same as the colour aquamarine .

example.ex: ...floor-length curtains in restful aqua and lavender colours.
example.tran: 色调柔和的浅绿和淡紫色相间的落地窗帘

sense.def: Aquamarines are clear, greenish-blue stones, sometimes used to make jewellery.

example.ex: A necklace set with aquamarines.
example.tran: 项链镶嵌着海蓝宝石。

example.ex: ...a large aquamarine ring.
example.tran: 大颗海蓝宝石戒指

sense.def: Aquamarine is used to describe things that are greenish-blue in colour.

example.ex: ...warm aquamarine seas and white beaches.
example.tran: 暖洋洋的蓝绿色海面和白色沙滩

example.ex: ...a shimmering suit of aquamarine satin.
example.tran: 海蓝色缎子做的华贵套装

sense.def: An aquarium is a building, often in a zoo, where fish and underwater animals are kept.
An aquarium is a glass tank filled with water, in which people keep fish.
Aquarius is one of the twelve signs of the zodiac. Its symbol is a person pouring water. People who are born approximately between 20th January and 18th February come under this sign.
sense.tran: 宝瓶宫，宝瓶座（黄道十二宫之一。出生于1月20日至2月18日之间的人属此星座）

sense.def: An Aquarius is a person whose sign of the zodiac is Aquarius.
sense.tran: 出生于宝瓶宫时段的人

sense.def: An aquatic animal or plant lives or grows on or in water.

example.ex: The pond is quite small but can support many aquatic plants and fish.
example.tran: 池塘虽小，但能为许多水生植物和鱼类提供足够的养分。

example.ex: ...aquatic birds.
example.tran: 水生鸟类

sense.def: Aquatic means relating to water.
sense.tran: 与水相关的;水上的;水中的

example.ex: ...aquatic consultant Ben Tucker.
example.tran: 水项目顾问本·塔克

example.ex: ...our aquatic resources.
example.tran: 我们的水资源

sense.def: An aqueduct is a long bridge with many arches, which carries a water supply or a canal over a valley.

example.ex: ...an old Roman aqueduct.
example.tran: 一道古老的罗马时代的高架渠

sense.def: An aqueduct is a large pipe or canal which carries a water supply to a city or a farming area.

example.ex: ...a nationwide system of aqueducts to carry water to the arid parts of this country.
example.tran: 将水输送到该国干旱地区的全国性导水系统

sense.def: In chemistry, an aqueous solution or cream has water as its base.

example.ex: ...an aqueous solution containing various sodium salts.
example.tran: 含各种钠盐的水溶液

example.ex: ...a soap substitute such as an aqueous cream, available from chemists.
example.tran: 药店出售的水质乳液之类的香皂替代品

sense.def: In geology, an aquifer is an area of rock underneath the surface of the earth which absorbs and holds water.
sense.tran: 地下蓄水层;砂石含水层

sense.def: If someone has an aquiline nose or profile, their nose is large, thin, and usually curved.

example.ex: He had a thin aquiline nose and deep-set brown eyes.
example.tran: 他长着窄长的鹰钩鼻和深陷的褐色眼睛。

sense.def: Arabs are people who speak Arabic and who come from the Middle East and parts of North Africa.
Arab means belonging or relating to Arabs or to their countries or customs.

example.ex: On the surface, it appears little has changed in the Arab world.
example.tran: 表面上，阿拉伯世界好像没什么变化。

sense.def: An arabesque is a position in ballet dancing. The dancer stands on one leg with their other leg lifted and stretched out backwards, and their arms stretched out in front of them.
sense.tran: 阿拉贝斯克舞姿（芭蕾基本舞姿之一，单腿直立，另一腿往后抬起，两臂前伸）

example.ex: The ballerina remained suspended in a faultless arabesque.
example.tran: 这位芭蕾舞女演员一直保持着完美的阿拉贝斯克舞姿不动。

sense.def: In art, an arabesque is a design of flowing lines.

example.ex: ...a clay water jug decorated with painted arabesques.
example.tran: 绘有阿拉伯式花饰的泥制水罐

sense.def: Arabian means belonging or relating to Arabia, especially to Saudi Arabia.
sense.tran: 阿拉伯的；（尤指）沙特阿拉伯的

example.ex: ...the Arabian Peninsula.
example.tran: 阿拉伯半岛

example.ex: ... an Arabian stallion.
example.tran: 阿拉伯牡马

sense.def: Arabic is a language that is spoken in the Middle East and in parts of North Africa.
Something that is Arabic belongs or relates to the language, writing, or culture of the Arabs.
sense.tran: 阿拉伯语的；阿拉伯文字的；阿拉伯文化的

example.ex: ...a large tapestry with swirling Arabic script.
example.tran: 绘有螺旋形阿拉伯字母的大幅花毯

example.ex: ...the development of modern Arabic literature.
example.tran: 现代阿拉伯文学的发展

example.ex: ...Arabic music.
example.tran: 阿拉伯音乐

sense.def: An Arabic numeral is one of the written figures such as 1, 2, 3, or 4.

example.ex: The clock is available with either Roman or Arabic numerals.
example.tran: 这款钟有带罗马数字的，也有带阿拉伯数字的。

sense.def: An Arabist is a person who supports Arab interests or knows a lot about the Arabic language.
sense.tran: 阿拉伯主义者；阿拉伯语言学家

example.ex: ...a leading Arabist.
example.tran: 一位杰出的阿拉伯语言学家

sense.def: Arable farming involves growing crops such as wheat and barley rather than keeping animals or growing fruit and vegetables. Arable land is land that is used for arable farming.
sense.tran: （农业）耕种的;（土地）适于耕种的，可开垦的

example.ex: ...arable farmers.
example.tran: 从事农耕的农场主

example.ex: ...arable crops.
example.tran: 庄稼

sense.def: An arbiter is a person or institution that judges and settles a quarrel between two other people or groups.

example.ex: He was the ultimate arbiter on both theological and political matters.
example.tran: 他在神学和政治事务上都是最终的仲裁人。

example.ex: ...the court's role as arbiter in the law-making process.
example.tran: 法庭在制定法律过程中担任裁决机构的角色

sense.def: An arbiter of taste or style is someone who has a lot of influence in deciding what is fashionable or socially desirable.

example.ex: Sequins have often aroused the scorn of arbiters of taste.
example.tran: 闪光装饰片经常引起时尚引领者的鄙视。

sense.def: In finance, arbitrage is the activity of buying shares or currency in one financial market and selling it at a profit in another.

In finance, an arbitrager is someone who buys currencies, securities, or commodities on one country's market in order to make money by immediately selling them at a profit on another country's market.
If you describe an action, rule, or decision as arbitrary, you think that it is not based on any principle, plan, or system. It often seems unfair because of this.
sense.tran: 武断的;任意的;任性的;主观的

example.ex: Arbitrary arrests and detention without trial were common.
example.tran: 随意逮捕和拘留屡见不鲜。

example.ex: The victims were not chosen arbitrarily.
example.tran: 下手对象不是随便选择的。

example.ex: He is horrified by the apparent arbitrariness by which she sets the prices.
example.tran: 她定价时貌似的随意性让他很惊讶。

sense.def: When someone in authority arbitrates between two people or groups who are in dispute, they consider all the facts and make an official decision about who is right.

example.ex: He arbitrates between investors and members of the association...
example.tran: 他在投资者和该协会成员之间作出仲裁。

example.ex: The tribunal had been set up to arbitrate in the dispute.
example.tran: 曾设立过特别法庭对此纷争作出仲裁。

example.ex: He served as an arbitrator in a series of commercial disputes in India.
example.tran: 他担任过印度一系列商业纠纷的仲裁者。

sense.def: Arbitration is the judging of a dispute between people or groups by someone who is not involved.

example.ex: ...the independent arbitration service, ACAS...
example.tran: 独立的仲裁部门，咨询调解仲裁处

example.ex: The matter is likely to go to arbitration.
example.tran: 这件事很有可能要提请仲裁。

sense.def: Arboreal animals live in trees.
sense.tran: 生活在树上的；栖于树木的

example.ex: ...arboreal marsupials which resemble monkeys.
example.tran: 和猴类相似的树栖有袋动物

sense.def: Arboreal means relating to trees.

example.ex: ...the arboreal splendor of the valley.
example.tran: 这个山谷的树木奇观

sense.def: An arboretum is a specially designed garden of different types of trees.

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 arbor

sense.def: An arbour is a shelter in a garden which is formed by leaves and stems of plants growing close together over a light framework.
sense.tran: （花园中由树枝、藤蔓等交叉而成的）棚架，凉棚

sense.def: An arc is a smoothly curving line or movement.

example.ex: The Aleutian chain is a long arc of islands in the North Pacific.
example.tran: 阿留申群岛是北太平洋上一长串呈弧形排列的小岛。

sense.def: In geometry, an arc is a part of the line that forms the outside of a circle.
If something arcs in a particular direction, it makes a smoothly curving line or movement.

example.ex: A rainbow arced gracefully over the town.
example.tran: 彩虹在小城上空画出了一道优美的弧线。

sense.def: An arcade is a covered passage where there are shops or market stalls.

example.ex: ...a shopping arcade.
example.tran: 室内购物商场

sense.def: An arcade is the same as an amusement arcade .

example.ex: ...13 year-olds spending their pocket money on fruit machines in arcades.
example.tran: 将零花钱花在游戏机室中水果盘老虎机上的13岁的少年们

sense.def: An arcade game is a computer game of the type that is often played in amusement arcades.
sense.tran: （游戏机室里常有的)电子游戏

sense.def: Something that is arcane is secret or mysterious.

example.ex: Until a few months ago few people outside the arcane world of contemporary music had heard of Gorecki.
example.tran: 直至几个月前，在现代音乐神秘殿堂之外很少有人听说了戈莱斯基。

sense.def: An arch is a structure that is curved at the top and is supported on either side by a pillar, post, or wall.
An arch is a curved line or movement.
The arch of your foot is the curved section at the bottom in the middle.
If you arch a part of your body such as your back or if it arches, you bend it so that it forms a curve.

example.ex: Don't arch your back, keep your spine straight.
example.tran: 别佝着背，把腰挺直。

sense.def: If you arch your eyebrows or if they arch, you move them upwards as a way of showing surprise or disapproval.
sense.tran: （表示惊奇或不赞同）扬起（眉毛）

example.ex: 'Oh really?' he said, arching an eyebrow.
example.tran: “哦，真的吗？”他扬起一边的眉毛说。

sense.def: If something arches in a particular direction, it makes a curved line or movement.
sense.tran: 拱起；成弓形；呈弧形运动

example.ex: I gazed up at the domed ceiling arching overhead.
example.tran: 我抬头凝望着上方弧形的穹顶。

sense.def: An arch look is mysterious and mischievous.

example.ex: Both of them looked at him with that curious, slightly amused and even arch expression.
example.tran: 他们俩都看着他，带着一副好奇的、有点觉得好笑甚至是淘气的表情。

example.ex: She looked at me rather archly.
example.tran: 她有些调皮地看着我。

sense.def: If you say that someone is arch, you are criticizing them for talking or behaving as if they are better or more important than other people.

example.ex: Their attempts to be casual have so far just looked arch or patronising.
example.tran: 他们本想做出漫不经心的样子，结果反而显得傲慢自大或自视甚高。

example.ex: 'You can't fool me,' Shirley said archly.
example.tran: “你骗不了我，”雪莉傲慢地说。

sense.def: Arch- combines with nouns referring to people to form new nouns that refer to people who are extreme examples of something. For example, your arch-rival is the rival you most want to beat.
sense.tran: （与指人的名词连用，构成复合名词）表示“主要的”，“最重要的”

example.ex: Neither he nor his arch-rival, Giuseppe De Rita, won.
example.tran: 他和他的死对头朱塞佩·德里察双双落败。

example.ex: ...his arch-enemy.
example.tran: 他的死敌

sense.def: Archaeology is the study of the societies and peoples of the past by examining the remains of their buildings, tools, and other objects.

example.ex: ...one of the region's most important archaeological sites.
example.tran: 该地区最重要的考古地点之一

example.ex: The archaeologists found a house built around 300 BC, with a basement and attic.
example.tran: 考古学家发现了一座建于公元前300年左右的带地下室和阁楼的房子。
