sense.def: Archaic means extremely old or extremely old-fashioned.

example.ex: ...archaic laws that are very seldom used...
example.tran: 已很少采用的过时法律

example.ex: Archaic practices such as these are usually put forward by people of limited outlook.
example.tran: 视野狭隘的人通常会提出类似于这些的陈腐做法。

example.ex: ...archaic sculpture and porcelain.
example.tran: 古老的雕塑和瓷器

sense.def: In the Jewish, Christian, and Muslim religions, an archangel is an angel of the highest rank.
sense.tran: （犹太教、基督教和伊斯兰教中的）大天使，天使长

sense.def: In the Roman Catholic, Orthodox, and Anglican Churches, an archbishop is a bishop of the highest rank, who is in charge of all the bishops and priests in a particular country or region.
sense.tran: （天主教、东正教和英国国教的）大主教，主教长

example.ex: ...the Archbishop of Canterbury.
example.tran: 坎特伯雷大主教

example.ex: ...Archbishop Desmond Tutu.
example.tran: 德斯蒙德·图图大主教

sense.def: An archdeacon is a high-ranking clergyman who works as an assistant to a bishop, especially in the Anglican church.
sense.tran: （尤指圣公会的）会吏长，副主教

sense.def: An archdiocese is the area over which an archbishop has control.
An arched roof, window, or doorway is curved at the top.
An arched bridge has arches as part of its structure.

example.ex: ...a fortified arched bridge spanning the River Severn.
example.tran: 横跨塞文河的加固拱桥

sense.def: You use arched to describe something that is curved like an arch.

example.ex: A frown formed between her arched brows.
example.tran: 她皱起两道弯眉。

sense.def: An archer is someone who shoots arrows using a bow.
Archery is a sport in which people shoot arrows at a target using a bow.

example.ex: ...a traditional national festival of horse racing, wrestling and archery.
example.tran: 有赛马、摔跤和射箭的全国传统庆祝活动

sense.def: Someone or something that is archetypal has all the most important characteristics of a particular kind of person or thing and is a perfect example of it.

example.ex: Cricket is the archetypal English game.
example.tran: 板球是典型的英格兰运动。

sense.def: An archetype is something that is considered to be a perfect or typical example of a particular kind of person or thing, because it has all their most important characteristics.

example.ex: He came to this country 20 years ago and is the archetype of the successful Asian businessman.
example.tran: 他20年前来到这个国家，是成功亚裔商人的典范。

sense.def: Archetypical means the same as archetypal .

example.ex: ...an archetypical BBC voice.
example.tran: 极具代表性的英国广播公司的嗓音

sense.def: An archipelago is a group of islands, especially small islands.

example.ex: ...the Azores, a rugged, volcanic archipelago of nine islands.
example.tran: 亚速尔群岛，由9个小岛组成的多岩石的火山群岛

sense.def: An architect is a person who designs buildings.

sense.hdgr:
with supp, oft N
of n
sense.def: You can use architect to refer to a person who plans large projects such as landscaping or railways.
sense.tran: （景观美化、铁路等大型项目的）规划者，设计者

example.ex: ...Merrick Denton-Thompson, the landscape architect for Hampshire county council.
example.tran: 梅里克·登顿-汤普森，汉普郡议会的园林设计师

example.ex: ...Paul Andreu, chief architect of French railways.
example.tran: 保罗·安德鲁，法国铁路的总设计师

sense.def: The architect of an idea, event, or institution is the person who invented it or made it happen.
sense.tran: （想法、事件或组织的）发起者，创立者

example.ex: ...Russia's chief architect of economic reform.
example.tran: 俄罗斯经济改革的总规划师

sense.def: Architectural means relating to the design and construction of buildings.

example.ex: ...Italy's architectural heritage.
example.tran: 意大利的建筑传统

example.ex: ...the unique architectural style of towns like Lamu.
example.tran: 拉姆这种小镇独特的建筑风格

example.ex: The old city centre is architecturally rich...
example.tran: 老城中心的建筑风格多种多样。

example.ex: Architecturally, the chapel would be the perfect match for the school.
example.tran: 就建筑风格而言，这座小教堂和学校会很相称。

sense.def: Architecture is the art of planning, designing, and constructing buildings.

example.ex: He studied classical architecture and design in Rome.
example.tran: 他在罗马学习了古典建筑学和设计。

sense.def: The architecture of a building is the style in which it is designed and constructed.

example.ex: ...modern architecture.
example.tran: 现代建筑式样

example.ex: ...a fine example of Moroccan architecture.
example.tran: 摩洛哥建筑风格的典范

example.ex: ...the architecture of the city's buildings.
example.tran: 该城市建筑物的建筑风格

sense.hdgr:
also N in pl, N
of n
sense.def: The architecture of something is its structure.

example.ex: ...the crumbling intellectual architecture of modern society.
example.tran: 现代社会处于崩溃边缘的知识结构

example.ex: ...the architecture of muscle fibres.
example.tran: 肌肉纤维的结构

sense.def: Archival means belonging or relating to archives.

example.ex: ...his extensive use of archival material.
example.tran: 他对档案资料的广泛应用

sense.def: The archive or archives are a collection of documents and records that contain historical information. You can also use archives to refer to the place where archives are stored.

example.ex: ...the archives of the Imperial War Museum...
example.tran: 帝国战争博物馆里的档案

example.ex: I decided I would go to the Archive the next day and look up the appropriate issue.
example.tran: 我决定第二天去档案馆查找对应的问题。

sense.def: Archive material is information that comes from archives.

example.ex: ...archive material.
example.tran: 档案资料

example.ex: ...pieces of archive film.
example.tran: 影像资料的片段

sense.def: An archivist is a person whose job is to collect, sort, and care for historical documents and records.
An archway is a passage or entrance that has a curved roof.

example.ex: Access was via a narrow archway.
example.tran: 通道入口是一道狭窄的拱门。

sense.def: Arc lights are a type of very bright electric light.

example.ex: ...the brilliant glare of the arc lights.
example.tran: 弧光灯的强光

sense.def: The Arctic is the area of the world around the North Pole. It is extremely cold and there is very little light in winter and very little darkness in summer.

example.ex: ...winter in the Arctic.
example.tran: 北极的冬天

example.ex: ...Arctic ice.
example.tran: 北极地区的冰

sense.def: If you describe a place or the weather as arctic, you are emphasizing that it is extremely cold.

example.ex: The bathroom, with its ancient facilities, is positively arctic.
example.tran: 该浴室设备陈旧，肯定非常寒冷。

sense.def: The Arctic Circle is an imaginary line drawn around the northern part of the world at approximately 66° North.
Ardent is used to describe someone who has extremely strong feelings about something or someone.

example.ex: He's been one of the most ardent supporters of the administration's policy.
example.tran: 他一向是政府政策最热情的支持者之一。

example.ex: ...an ardent opponent of the Vietnam War.
example.tran: 越南战争的强烈反对者

rnon.hdgr: usu ADV with v, also ADV adj

example.ex: Why had Hilton defended him so ardently?...
example.tran: 为什么希尔顿如此激动地为他辩护呢？

example.ex: His reports are often ardently pro-Russian.
example.tran: 他的报告常常是力挺俄罗斯的。

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 ardor

sense.def: Ardour is a strong, intense feeling of love or enthusiasm for someone or something.

example.ex: ...songs of genuine passion and ardour.
example.tran: 真正富有激情的歌曲

example.ex: ...my ardor for football.
example.tran: 我对足球的热情

sense.def: Something that is arduous is difficult and tiring, and involves a lot of effort.

example.ex: ...a long, hot and arduous journey...
example.tran: 一段漫长、炎热而又艰苦的旅程

example.ex: The task was more arduous than he had calculated.
example.tran: 这项任务比他所估计的要艰巨得多。

sense.def: Are is the plural and the second person singular of the present tense of the verb be .Are is often shortened to -'re after pronouns in spoken English.
sense.tran: （be的复数和第二人称单数现在时形式，口语中在代词后常略作-’re）

sense.def: An area is a particular part of a town, a country, a region, or the world.

example.ex: ...the large number of community groups in the area...
example.tran: 该地区大量的社团

example.ex: 60 years ago half the French population still lived in rural areas.
example.tran: 60年前有一半法国人仍然生活在乡村地区。

example.ex: ...mountainous areas of Europe, Asia, North and South America.
example.tran: 欧洲、亚洲、南北美洲的山区

sense.def: Your area is the part of a town, country, or region where you live. An organization's area is the part of a town, country, or region that it is responsible for.

example.ex: Local authorities have been responsible for the running of schools in their areas...
example.tran: 地方当局一直负责管理本地区的学校。

example.ex: If there is an election in your area, you should go and vote.
example.tran: 如果你所居住的地区进行选举，你应该去参加投票。

sense.def: A particular area is a piece of land or part of a building that is used for a particular activity.

example.ex: ...a picnic area.
example.tran: 野餐区

example.ex: ...the main check-in area located in Terminal 1.
example.tran: 位于1号候机厅的主检票区

sense.def: An area is a particular place on a surface or object, for example on your body.
sense.tran: （某一表面或物体上的）区；（身体上的）部分

example.ex: You will notice that your baby has two soft areas on the top of his head.
example.tran: 你会注意到你的宝宝头顶上有两处柔软的地方。

sense.def: The area of a surface such as a piece of land is the amount of flat space or ground that it covers, measured in square units.

example.ex: The islands cover a total area of 625.6 square kilometers...
example.tran: 这些岛屿总面积为625.6平方公里。

example.ex: Although large in area, the flat did not have many rooms.
example.tran: 这套公寓虽然面积很大，但并没有太多房间。

sense.def: You can use area to refer to a particular subject or topic, or to a particular part of a larger, more general situation or activity.

example.ex: ...the politically sensitive area of old age pensions.
example.tran: 有关养老金的政治敏感话题

example.ex: ...the internationalization of the economy and all other areas of society...
example.tran: 社会的经济和其他领域的国际化

example.ex: She wants to be involved in every area of your life.
example.tran: 她想参与入你生活中的方方面面。

sense.def: On a football pitch, the area is the same as the penalty area.
The area code for a particular city or region is the series of numbers that you have to dial before someone's personal number if you are making a telephone call to that place from a different area.

example.ex: The area code for western Pennsylvania is 412.
example.tran: 宾夕法尼亚西部的电话区号是412。

entry.boxr: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 dialling code

sense.def: An arena is a place where sports, entertainments, and other public events take place. It has seats around it where people sit and watch.

example.ex: ...the largest indoor sports arena in the world.
example.tran: 世界上最大的室内体育场

sense.def: You can refer to a field of activity, especially one where there is a lot of conflict or action, as an arena of a particular kind.

example.ex: He made it clear he had no intention of withdrawing from the political arena...
example.tran: 他清楚地表明他无意退出政治舞台。

example.ex: Oil speculation proved a natural arena for his skills.
example.tran: 在石油业中进行投机活动对他来说游刃有余。

sense.def: Aren't is the usual spoken form of 'are not'.
Aren't is the form of 'am not' that is used in questions or tags in spoken English.
sense.tran: （am not的口语形式，用于疑问句或附加问句中）

sense.def: Argentine means the same as Argentinian .

example.ex: ...Argentine agricultural products.
example.tran: 阿根廷的农产品

posc.def: An Argentine is the same as an Argentinian .

sense.def: Argentinian means belonging or relating to Argentina or its people.

example.ex: ...the Argentinian capital, Buenos Aires.
example.tran: 阿根廷首都，布宜诺斯艾利斯

posc.def: An Argentinian is someone who comes from Argentina.

sense.def: Argon is an inert gas which exists in very small amounts in the atmosphere. It is used in electric lights.
An argot is a special language used by a particular group of people, which other people find difficult to understand.

example.ex: ...the argot of teenagers.
example.tran: 青少年俚语

example.ex: ...footballing argot.
example.tran: 足球行话

sense.def: If you say that it is arguable that something is true, you believe that it can be supported by evidence and that many people would agree with it.

example.ex: It is arguable that this was not as grave a handicap as it might appear...
example.tran: 有证据表明，这种残障不如看起来那么严重。

example.ex: The judges said there was at least a good arguable case of negligence to answer.
example.tran: 法官们说至少有一个证据确凿的渎职案可作答辩。

sense.hdgr:
usu v-link ADJ, oft
it v-link ADJ whether
sense.def: An idea, point, or comment that is arguable is not obviously true or correct and should be questioned.
sense.tran: 不确定的;无把握的;有疑问的

example.ex: It is arguable whether he ever had much control over the real economic power...
example.tran: 他是否掌控过真正的经济大权还有待证实。

example.ex: He said that her remarks disgusted every practising Christian. That claim is arguable.
example.tran: 他说她的言论让每个虔诚的基督教信徒感到厌恶。这种说法存在疑问。

sense.hdgr: ADV with cl/group, ADV before v
sense.def: You can use arguably when you are stating your opinion or belief, as a way of giving more authority to it.
sense.tran: 可论证地;可以说;按理说

example.ex: They are arguably the most important band since The Rolling Stones...
example.tran: 他们无疑是继滚石之后最出色的乐队。

example.ex: Arguably, 1932 was the year of greatest achievement at the Laboratories.
example.tran: 可以说1932年是该实验室最有收获的一年。

sense.def: If one person argues with another, they speak angrily to each other about something that they disagree about. You can also say that two people argue .

example.ex: The committee is concerned about players' behaviour, especially arguing with referees...
example.tran: 委员会很关注运动员的行为，特别是与裁判争吵的行为。

example.ex: They were still arguing; I could hear them down the road.
example.tran: 他们还在争吵；我在马路的那头都能听见他们的声音。

sense.def: If you tell someone not to argue with you, you want them to do or believe what you say without protest or disagreement.

example.ex: Don't argue with me...
example.tran: 别和我争辩。

example.ex: The children go to bed at 10.30. No one dares argue.
example.tran: 孩子们10点半上床睡觉。没有人敢说不。

sense.def: If you argue with someone about something, you discuss it with them, with each of you giving your different opinions.

example.ex: He was arguing with the King about the need to maintain the cavalry at full strength...
example.tran: 他正和国王讨论保留骑兵全部力量的必要性。

example.ex: They are arguing over foreign policy...
example.tran: 他们正就外交政策进行讨论。

example.ex: The two of them sitting in their office were arguing this point.
example.tran: 他们两人坐在办公室里讨论这一点。

sense.def: If you argue that something is true, you state it and give the reasons why you think it is true.

example.ex: His lawyers are arguing that he is unfit to stand trial...
example.tran: 他的律师正在提出理由说明他不适合出庭受审。

example.gram: Also V with quote, V n
example.ex: It could be argued that the British are not aggressive enough.
example.tran: 可以说英国人不够强势。

sense.def: If you argue for something, you say why you agree with it, in order to persuade people that it is right. If you argue against something, you say why you disagree with it, in order to persuade people that it is wrong.

example.ex: The report argues against tax increases...
example.tran: 报告提出理由反对提高税率。

example.ex: I argued the case for an independent central bank.
example.tran: 我支持设立独立的中央银行。

sense.def: If you argue, you support your opinions with evidence in an ordered or logical way.

example.ex: I've argued deductively from the text...
example.tran: 我已依文字作过推理论证。

example.ex: He argued persuasively, and was full of confidence.
example.tran: 他的论证很有说服力，且充满自信。

sense.def: If you say that no-one can argue with a particular fact or opinion, you are emphasizing that it is obviously true and so everyone must accept it.

example.ex: We produced the best soccer of the tournament. Nobody would argue with that.
example.tran: 本届比赛中我们踢出了最漂亮的足球，谁都不会否认这一点。

sense.def: If two or more people argue something out, they discuss it thoroughly in order to reach a conclusion or decision.
sense.tran: （为得出结论或决定而）充分讨论

example.ex: If there's a dispute we argue it out...
example.tran: 如果有了纷争，我们就说清楚。

example.ex: The question of divorce was discussed and argued out in the frankest tones.
example.tran: 离婚问题经过开诚公布的商讨最终得出了结果。

sense.hdgr:
oft N
for/against n/-ing, N that
sense.def: An argument is a statement or set of statements that you use in order to try to convince people that your opinion about something is correct.

example.ex: There's a strong argument for lowering the price...
example.tran: 有充分理由要求降低价格。

example.ex: The doctors have set out their arguments against the proposals...
example.tran: 医生们已经陈述了他们反对这些提案的理由。

example.ex: It is better to convince by argument than seduce by example.
example.tran: 以理说服强于举例诱导。

sense.def: An argument is a discussion or debate in which a number of people put forward different or opposing opinions.

example.ex: The incident has triggered fresh arguments about the role of the extreme right in France...
example.tran: 该事件引发了关于极右翼势力在法国所起作用的新一轮讨论。

example.ex: The issue has caused heated political argument.
example.tran: 这个问题已经引发了激烈的政治争论。

sense.hdgr:
oft N
with n, N
between pl-n
sense.def: An argument is a conversation in which people disagree with each other angrily or noisily.

example.ex: Anny described how she got into an argument with one of the marchers.
example.tran: 安妮描述了她是如何与其中一位游行者发生争执的。

example.ex: ...a heated argument.
example.tran: 激烈的争吵

sense.def: If you accept something without argument, you do not question it or disagree with it.

example.ex: He complied without argument...
example.tran: 他二话不说就服从了。

example.ex: It should of course be given back. There is no argument about that.
example.tran: 它当然应该还回去，这是无可争议的。

boxu.usage: Be careful with the spelling of this word, and do not confuse argument and dispute. An argument is a disagreement between people who may or may not know each other. A dispute is a serious argument that can last for a long time. Disputes generally occur between organizations, political parties, or countries. Note that dispute can also be a verb.
boxu.tran: 请注意该词拼写，不要混淆argument和dispute。argument指认识或不认识的人之间的争论。dispute指可延续很长时间的严重纷争，通常发生于组织、政党和国家之间。注意，dispute也可作动词。

sense.def: Argumentation is the process of arguing in an organized or logical way, for example in philosophy.
Someone who is argumentative is always ready to disagree or start quarrelling with other people.
sense.tran: 好辩的;好争论的;好争吵的

example.ex: Great chess players have a reputation for being both eccentric and argumentative...
example.tran: 国际象棋大师们以性格怪异和好与人争辩而闻名。

example.ex: You're in an argumentative mood today!
example.tran: 你今天就是找人吵架的。

sense.def: An aria is a song for one of the leading singers in an opera or choral work.
Arid land is so dry that very few plants can grow on it.

example.ex: ...new strains of crops that can withstand arid conditions.
example.tran: 能抵抗干旱条件的新品种作物

example.ex: ...the arid zones of the country.
example.tran: 该国的干旱区域

sense.def: If you describe something such as a period of your life or an academic subject as arid, you mean that it has so little interest, excitement, or purpose that it makes you feel bored or unhappy.
sense.tran: 枯燥无味的；乏善可陈的

example.ex: She had given him the only joy his arid life had ever known.
example.tran: 她为他枯燥无味的生活带来了从未有过的乐趣。

example.ex: ...the politically arid years of military dictatorship in the 1960s and '70s.
example.tran: 在20世纪60和70年代军事独裁期间政事荒芜的岁月

sense.def: Aries is one of the twelve signs of the zodiac. Its symbol is a ram. People who are born approximately between 21st March and 19th April come under this sign.
sense.tran: 白羊宫，白羊座（黄道十二宫之一。出生于3月21日至4月19日之间的人属此星座）

sense.def: An Aries is a person whose sign of the zodiac is Aries.
sense.tran: 出生于白羊宫时段的人

sense.def: If a situation or problem arises, it begins to exist or people start to become aware of it.

example.ex: ...if a problem arises later in the pregnancy...
example.tran: 如果在怀孕后期出现问题

example.ex: The birds also attack crops when the opportunity arises.
example.tran: 一有机会鸟儿们也会破坏庄稼。

sense.def: If something arises from a particular situation, or arises out of it, it is created or caused by the situation.

example.ex: ...an overwhelming sense of guilt arising from my actions...
example.tran: 我的行为带来的沉重的罪恶感

example.ex: The charges arise out of a long-running fraud enquiry by Merseyside police.
example.tran: 这些指控是默西赛德郡警方对诈骗案进行长期调查后提出的。

sense.def: If something such as a new species, organization, or system arises, it begins to exist and develop.

example.ex: Heavy Metal music really arose in the late 60s.
example.tran: 重金属音乐真正形成于60年代后期。

sense.def: When you arise, you get out of bed in the morning.

example.ex: He arose at 6:30 a.m. as usual.
example.tran: 同往常一样，他在早上6:30起了床。

sense.def: When you arise from a sitting or kneeling position, you stand up.

example.ex: When I arose from the chair, my father and Eleanor's father were in deep conversation...
example.tran: 当我从椅子上站起来时，我父亲和埃莉诺的父亲谈兴正浓。

example.ex: Arise, Sir William.
example.tran: 起立，威廉爵士。

sense.def: You can say that something tall such as a building or mountain arises from the ground around it.

example.ex: ...the flat terrace, from which arises the cubic volume of the house.
example.tran: 上面矗立着立方形房屋的露天平台

sense.def: The aristocracy is a class of people in some countries who have a high social rank and special titles.

example.ex: ...a member of the aristocracy.
example.tran: 一个贵族成员

sense.def: An aristocrat is someone whose family has a high social rank, especially someone who has a title.
Aristocratic means belonging to or typical of the aristocracy.

example.ex: ...a wealthy, aristocratic family...
example.tran: 富有的贵族家庭

example.ex: He laughed it off with aristocratic indifference.
example.tran: 他带着贵族式的漠然对其一笑置之。

entry.boxr: The noun is pronounced /ə'rɪθmətɪk/. The adjective is pronounced /ˌærɪθ'metɪk/. 名词读作/ə'rɪθmətɪk/，形容词读作/ˌærɪθ'metɪk/。

sense.def: Arithmetic is the part of mathematics that is concerned with the addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division of numbers.

example.ex: ...teaching the basics of reading, writing and arithmetic.
example.tran: 教授阅读、写作和算术的基础知识

example.ex: ...an arithmetic test.
example.tran: 算术测验

sense.def: You can use arithmetic to refer to the process of doing a particular sum or calculation.

example.ex: 4,000 women put in ten rupees each, which if my arithmetic is right adds up to 40,000 rupees.
example.tran: 4,000名妇女每人放入10个卢比，如果我算得对的话，总数将达到4万卢比。

sense.def: If you refer to the arithmetic of a situation, you are concerned with those aspects of it that can be expressed in numbers, and how they affect the situation.

example.ex: The budgetary arithmetic suggests that government borrowing is set to surge...
example.tran: 预算数字表明政府借款将要大幅增加。

example.ex: The arithmetic is finely balanced: the socialists and their allies do not have an overall majority.
example.tran: 该估算是经过仔细权衡的：社会主义者和他们的同盟并不占绝大多数。

sense.def: Arithmetic means relating to or consisting of calculations involving numbers.

example.ex: ...a processor which performs simple arithmetic operations such as adding or multiplying numbers.
example.tran: 可进行加法或乘法等简单运算的处理器

sense.def: Arithmetical calculations, processes, or skills involve the addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division of numbers.

example.ex: ...complex arithmetical formulae.
example.tran: 复杂的算术方程式

sense.def: In the Bible, the ark was a large boat which Noah built in order to save his family and two of every kind of animal from the Flood.
sense.tran: 方舟（《圣经》中，大洪水时挪亚为救家人和动物而建造的大船）

menu-item.item: ACE7PART OF YOUR BODY OR OF SOMETHING ELSE
menu-item.tran: 人体或其他物体的一 部分

sense.def: Your arms are the two long parts of your body that are attached to your shoulders and that have your hands at the end.

example.ex: She stretched her arms out...
example.tran: 她张开双臂。

example.ex: He had a large parcel under his left arm.
example.tran: 他左胳膊下夹着一个大包裹。

sense.def: The arm of a piece of clothing is the part of it that covers your arm.
The arm of a chair is the part on which you rest your arm when you are sitting down.
An arm of an object is a long thin part of it that sticks out from the main part.

example.ex: ...the lever arm of the machine.
example.tran: 机器的操纵杆

example.ex: ...the arms of the doctor's spectacles.
example.tran: 医生的眼镜腿

sense.def: An arm of land or water is a long thin area of it that is joined to a broader area.

example.ex: At the end of the other arm of Cardigan Bay is Bardsey Island.
example.tran: 在卡迪根湾的另一狭长地段的尾端是巴德西岛。

sense.hdgr:
usu sing, usu N
of n
sense.def: An arm of an organization is a section of it that operates in a particular country or that deals with a particular activity.

example.ex: Millicom Holdings is the British arm of an American company.
example.tran: 米雷康姆控股有限公司是一家美国公司在英国的分支机构。

example.ex: ...the research arm of Congress.
example.tran: 国会的研究部门

phrase.hdgr:
usu v PHR, oft PHR
with n
phrase.def: If two people are walking arm in arm, they are walking together with their arms linked.

example.ex: He walked from the court arm in arm with his wife.
example.tran: 他和妻子挽着胳膊走出法庭。

phrase.def: If you say that something costs an arm and a leg, you mean that it is very expensive.

example.ex: A week at a health farm can cost an arm and a leg.
example.tran: 在健身中心呆一个星期的花费会很昂贵。

phrase.def: If you hold something at arm's length, you hold it away from your body with your arm straight.
phrase.tran: 一臂之远；在伸手可及处

example.ex: He struck a match, and held it at arm's length.
example.tran: 他划亮一根火柴，伸长胳膊举着。

phrase.def: If you keep someone at arm's length, you avoid becoming too friendly or involved with them.

example.ex: She had always kept his family at arm's length.
example.tran: 她一直与他的家人保持一定距离。

phrase.def: If you say that a list is as long as your arm, you are emphasizing that it is very long.
If you welcome some action or change with open arms, you are very pleased about it. If you welcome a person with open arms, you are very pleased about their arrival.

example.ex: They would no doubt welcome the action with open arms...
example.tran: 他们无疑将热烈欢迎这一举动。

example.ex: Many Panamanians welcomed the troops with open arms.
example.tran: 许多巴拿马人热烈欢迎部队到来。

phrase.def: If you twist someone's arm, you persuade them to do something.

example.ex: She had twisted his arm to get him to invite her.
example.tran: 她说服他向自己发出邀请。

sense.def: Arms are weapons, especially bombs and guns.
sense.tran: 武器，军火，军备（尤指炸弹和枪支）

example.ex: The IRA had extensive supplies of arms.
example.tran: 爱尔兰共和军有庞大的军备。

example.ex: ...arms control.
example.tran: 军备控制

sense.def: If you arm someone with a weapon, you provide them with a weapon.

example.ex: She'd been so terrified that she had armed herself with a loaded rifle...
example.tran: 她吓坏了，于是拿了一支上了膛的步枪。

example.ex: Arming the police doesn't deter crime.
example.tran: 仅仅靠给警察配备武器是无法制止犯罪的。

sense.def: If you arm someone with something that will be useful in a particular situation, you provide them with it.

example.ex: She thought that if she armed herself with all the knowledge she could gather she could handle anything...
example.tran: 她以为，如果获取了所有能学到的知识，就能处理任何事。

example.ex: Armed only with a BBC microphone, I travelled across South Africa meeting writers.
example.tran: 仅仅凭借着一支英国广播公司的话筒，我走遍了南非，会见了许多作家。

sense.def: The arms of a city or of a noble family are its coat of arms. Arms is often used in the names of British pubs.
sense.tran: （城市或贵族家庭的）盾徽，（盾形）徽章，纹章（常用于英国酒馆名中）

example.ex: ...china painted with the arms of Philippe V.
example.tran: 画有腓力五世的盾徽的瓷器

example.ex: ...his local pub, the Abercorn Arms.
example.tran: 他在当地开的酒馆“阿伯康徽章”

phrase.def: A person's right to bear arms is their right to own and use guns, as a means of defence.
If soldiers lay down their arms, they stop fighting and give up their weapons.

phrase.hdgr:
V inflects, oft PHR
against n
phrase.def: If one group or countrytakes up arms against another, they prepare to attack and fight them.

example.ex: They threatened to take up arms against the government if their demands were not met.
example.tran: 他们威胁，如果要求得不到满足就要以武力抵抗政府。

phrase.def: If a country has people under arms, it has people trained to use weapons and to fight a war.
phrase.tran: 武装起来的;处于战备状态

example.ex: There are nearly four million soldiers under arms in this country.
example.tran: 该国有将近400万现役士兵。

phrase.def: If people are up in arms about something, they are very angry about it and are protesting strongly against it.
phrase.tran: 非常愤怒;极力反对;强烈抗议

example.ex: Environmental groups are up in arms about plans to sink an oil well close to Hadrian's Wall.
example.tran: 环保组织极力反对在哈德良长城附近打油井。

sense.def: An armada is a large group of warships.

example.ex: An armada of U.S. Navy ships participated in the invasion.
example.tran: 美国海军舰队参加了入侵行动。

example.ex: ...the defeat of the Spanish Armada, 1588.
example.tran: 西班牙无敌舰队1588年的战败

sense.def: An armadillo is a small animal whose body is covered with large bony scales and which rolls itself into a ball when it is attacked. Armadillos are mainly found in South and Central America.
sense.tran: 犰狳（体表有骨质鳞甲的小动物，主要栖息于南美洲和中美洲）

sense.def: Armageddon is a terrible battle or war that some people think will lead to the total destruction of the world or the human race.
sense.tran: （会导致世界或人类毁灭的）大决战；善恶大决战

sense.def: Armagnac is a type of brandy made in southwest France.
sense.tran: 阿马尼亚克酒（产于法国西南部的一种白兰地酒）

sense.def: Armament is used to refer to weapons and bombs carried by an aircraft or other military vehicle.
sense.tran: （飞机或军用车辆配备的）武器，军械，火力装备

example.ex: ...a bomber with twin engines and heavy defensive armament.
example.tran: 配有双引擎和重型防御装备的轰炸机

sense.def: A country's increase in the number and effectiveness of its weapons is its armament .

example.ex: ...the pursuit of national security through national armament...
example.tran: 通过全国性战备保障国家安全

example.ex: The fears have prompted several countries to embark on massive armament plans.
example.tran: 几个国家开始实施大规模的军备计划,以防患于未然。

sense.def: Armaments are weapons and military equipment belonging to an army or country.

example.ex: ...global efforts to reduce nuclear and other armaments.
example.tran: 减少核武器和其他军备的全球性措施

example.ex: ...the armaments industry.
example.tran: 军工产业

sense.def: An armband is a band of fabric that you wear round your upper arm in order to show that you have an official position or belong to a particular group. Some people also wear a black armband to show that a friend or relation has died.
Armbands are plastic rings filled with air that people who are learning to swim wear on their upper arms to help them float.
sense.tran: （用于学游泳的）充气臂圈，救生臂环

sense.def: An armchair is a big comfortable chair which has a support on each side for your arms.

example.ex: She was sitting in an armchair with blankets wrapped round her.
example.tran: 她坐在扶手椅中，身上裹着毯子。

sense.def: An armchair critic, fan, or traveller knows about a particular subject from reading or hearing about it rather than from practical experience.
sense.tran: （通过阅读或倾听）间接了解的，非亲身经历的

example.ex: The last thing we need are words of wisdom from an armchair critic...
example.tran: 我们最不需要的是纸上谈兵的评论家发表的“智慧”言论。

example.ex: This great book is ideal for both the travelling supporter and the armchair fan.
example.tran: 这本好书对于喜欢出门旅行的人和足不出户的神游爱好者都是理想的选择。

sense.def: Someone who is armed is carrying a weapon, usually a gun.
sense.tran: 携带武器（通常为枪支）的

example.ex: City police said the man was armed with a revolver.
example.tran: 市警方称那名男子携带了一支左轮手枪。

example.ex: ...a barbed-wire fence patrolled by armed guards...
example.tran: 有武装警卫巡逻的带刺铁丝网围栏

example.ex: The rebels are well organised, disciplined and very well armed.
example.tran: 叛乱者组织有序，纪律性强，武装精良。

sense.def: An armed attack or conflict involves people fighting with guns or carrying weapons.

example.ex: I call on everyone to renounce the use of violence and armed struggle...
example.tran: 我呼吁每个人都放弃使用暴力和武装斗争。

example.ex: They had been found guilty of armed robbery.
example.tran: 他们被判犯有持械抢劫罪。

sense.def: -armed is used with adjectives to indicate what kind of arms someone has.
sense.tran: （与形容词连用）表示“有…胳膊的”

example.ex: ...plump-armed women in cotton dresses.
example.tran: 胳膊圆润、身穿棉制连衣裙的妇女

sense.def: -armed is used with adjectives such as 'nuclear' and nouns such as 'missile' to form adjectives that indicate what kind of weapons an army or person has.
sense.tran: （和形容词或名词连用，构成形容词）表示“配备…武器的”，“持有…武器的”

example.ex: ...nuclear-armed navy vessels.
example.tran: 装备核武器的海军舰只

sense.def: The armed forces or the armed services of a country are its military forces, usually the army, navy, marines, and air force.
sense.tran: 武装部队；（一国的）海陆空三军

sense.def: An armful of something is the amount of it that you can carry fairly easily.

example.ex: He hurried out with an armful of brochures.
example.tran: 他抱着一摞小册子匆匆出去了。

sense.def: The armholes of something such as a shirt or dress are the openings through which you put your arms, or the places where the sleeves are attached.
An armistice is an agreement between countries who are at war with one another to stop fighting and to discuss ways of making peace.

example.ex: Finally, the Bolsheviks signed an armistice with Germany.
example.tran: 最终布尔什维克和德国签署了停战协议。

sense.def: An armload of something is the same as an armful of something.

example.ex: ...an armload of books.
example.tran: 一抱书

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 armor

sense.def: In former times, armour was special metal clothing that soldiers wore for protection in battle.

example.ex: ...the collection of weapons and armour in the historic White Tower.
example.tran: 历史古迹白塔中所收藏的武器和盔甲

example.ex: ...knights in armour.
example.tran: 身穿盔甲的骑士

example.ex: ...a medieval suit of armour.
example.tran: 一套中世纪的盔甲

sense.def: Armour consists of tanks and other military vehicles used in battle.
sense.tran: 装甲部队（作战中使用的坦克等军用车辆的总称）

example.ex: ...the biggest movement of heavy British armour since the Second World War.
example.tran: 二战以来规模最大的英国重型装甲部队调动

sense.def: Armour is a hard, usually metal, covering that protects a vehicle against attack.

example.ex: ...a formidable warhead that can penetrate the armour of most tanks.
example.tran: 能穿透大多数坦克装甲的威力巨大的弹头

example.ex: ...armour-piercing missiles.
example.tran: 穿甲导弹

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 armored

sense.def: Armoured vehicles are fitted with a hard metal covering in order to protect them from gunfire and other missiles.

example.ex: More than forty armoured vehicles carrying troops have been sent into the area.
example.tran: 载着部队官兵的40多辆装甲车被派往该地区。

sense.def: Armoured troops are troops in armoured vehicles.
sense.tran: （部队）装甲的，配备装甲车辆的

example.ex: These front-line defences are backed up by armoured units in reserve.
example.tran: 前线的防务得到后备装甲部队的支援。

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 armorer

sense.def: An armourer is someone who makes or supplies weapons.

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 armor-plated

sense.def: An armour-plated vehicle or building has a hard metal covering in order to protect it from gunfire and other missiles.
sense.tran: （车或建筑）装甲的，装有钢板的

example.ex: He has taken to travelling in an armour-plated car.
example.tran: 他喜欢上了坐装甲车。

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 armor-plating

sense.def: The armour-plating on a vehicle or building is the hard metal covering which is intended to protect it from gunfire and other missiles.

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 armory

sense.def: A country's armoury is all the weapons and military equipment that it has.

example.ex: Nuclear weapons will play a less prominent part in NATO's armoury in the future...
example.tran: 今后核武器在北约武器装备中所起的作用将不那么显著。

example.ex: Delegates signed a treaty to reduce the armouries of conventional weapons in Europe.
example.tran: 各代表签署了协议以减少欧洲的常规武器装备。

sense.def: An armoury is a place where weapons, bombs, and other military equipment are stored.
In the United States, an armoury is a building used by the National Guard or Army Reserve for meetings and training.
sense.tran: （美国国民警卫队或陆军后备队的）操练厅，会议厅

sense.def: An armoury is a factory where weapons are made.
You can refer to a large number of things which someone has available for a particular purpose as their armoury .

example.ex: The strongest weapon in the government's armoury is the price cuts announced on Saturday...
example.tran: 政府最有力的对策是在星期六宣布价格下调。

example.ex: Modern medicine has a large armoury of drugs for the treatment of mental illness.
example.tran: 现代医学有大量可以用来治疗精神疾病的药物。

sense.def: Your armpits are the areas of your body under your arms where your arms join your shoulders.
The armrests on a chair are the two pieces on either side that support your arms when you are sitting down.
An arms race is a situation in which two countries or groups of countries are continually trying to get more and better weapons than each other.

example.ex: ...a conference on ways to control the arms race in the region.
example.tran: 商讨如何控制该地区军备竞赛的会议

sense.def: An army is a large organized group of people who are armed and trained to fight on land in a war. Most armies are organized and controlled by governments.

example.ex: After returning from France, he joined the army...
example.tran: 从法国回来之后，他参了军。

example.ex: The army is about to launch a major offensive.
example.tran: 陆军部队即将发动一次大规模进攻。

example.ex: ...a top-ranking army officer.
example.tran: 级别最高的陆军军官

sense.def: An army of people, animals, or things is a large number of them, especially when they are regarded as a force of some kind.

example.ex: ...data collected by an army of volunteers.
example.tran: 由大批志愿者收集的资料

example.ex: ...armies of shoppers looking for bargains.
example.tran: 成群的寻找便宜货的购物者

example.ex: ...the army of television cameras outside his house.
example.tran: 装在他家外面的大量的电视摄像机

sense.def: In some countries, an A-road is a major road. A-roads are narrower than motorways but are wider and straighter than B-roads.
An aroma is a strong, pleasant smell.

example.ex: ...the wonderful aroma of freshly baked bread.
example.tran: 新鲜出炉的面包散发出的美妙香味

sense.def: An aromatherapist is a person who is qualified to practise aromatherapy.
sense.tran: 芳香理疗师;香薰理疗师

sense.def: Aromatherapy is a type of treatment which involves massaging the body with special fragrant oils.
An aromatic plant or food has a strong, pleasant smell of herbs or spices.
sense.tran: （植物或食品）有香味的，芳香的

example.ex: ...an evergreen shrub with deep green, aromatic leaves...
example.tran: 叶子呈深绿色且带芳香气息的常青灌木丛

example.ex: An aromatic beef stew waited on the stove.
example.tran: 炉子上放着香味四溢的炖牛肉。

sense.def: Arose is the past tense of arise.

boxu.usage: Around is an adverb and a preposition. In British English, the word 'round' is often used instead. Around is often used with verbs of movement, such as 'walk' and 'drive', and also in phrasal verbs such as 'get around' and 'hand around'.
boxu.tran: around用作副词和介词。在英国英语中，常用round来替代。around常与表示动作的动词连用，如walk和drive，也常用在get around, hand around等短语动词中。

sense.def: To be positioned around a place or object means to surround it or be on all sides of it. To move around a place means to go along its edge, back to your starting point.

example.ex: She looked at the papers around her...
example.tran: 她看了看四周的文件。

example.ex: Today she wore her hair down around her shoulders.
example.tran: 今天她的头发披在肩上。

example.ex: ...a prosperous suburb built around a new mosque.
example.tran: 在新盖的清真寺周围建起的繁华市郊住宅区

example.ex: ...a village with a rocky river, a ruined castle and hills all around...
example.tran: 有一条多石的河流、一座破败的城堡并且四面环山的村庄

example.ex: The Memorial seems almost ugly, dominating the landscape for miles around.
example.tran: 那座纪念碑耸立在方圆数英里景致之中显得近乎难看。

sense.def: If you move around a corner or obstacle, you move to the other side of it. If you look around a corner or obstacle, you look to see what is on the other side.

example.ex: The photographer stopped clicking and hurried around the corner...
example.tran: 摄影师停止按动快门，匆匆绕过拐角。

example.ex: I peered around the edge of the shed — there was no sign of anyone else.
example.tran: 我仔细察看了棚子周边，没有其他人。

sense.def: If you turn around, you turn so that you are facing in the opposite direction.
sense.tran: 朝着相反方向；向着对立面

example.ex: I turned around and wrote the title on the blackboard...
example.tran: 我转过身，在黑板上写下了题目。

example.ex: He straightened up slowly and spun around on the stool to face us.
example.tran: 他慢慢直起身子，坐在凳子上转过身来面对着我们。

sense.def: If you move around a place, you travel through it, going to most of its parts. If you look around a place, you look at every part of it.

example.ex: I've been walking around Moscow and the town is terribly quiet...
example.tran: 我在莫斯科到处游逛，城里非常安静。

example.ex: He glanced discreetly around the room at the other people.
example.tran: 他谨慎地瞥了一眼房间里的其他人。

example.ex: He backed away from the edge, looking all around at the flat horizon.
example.tran: 他从边上退了回来，环顾着周围平直的地平线。

sense.def: If someone moves around a place, they move through various parts of that place without having any particular destination.

example.ex: These days much of my time is spent weaving my way around drinks parties...
example.tran: 这些天，我多半都是在酒会上晃悠过去的。

example.ex: They milled around the ballroom with video cameras.
example.tran: 他们扛着摄像机在舞厅里转来转去。

example.ex: My mornings are spent rushing around after him.
example.tran: 我每天早上都跟着他到处跑。

example.ex: ...a scruffy youth wandering around looking lost.
example.tran: 一个四处徘徊、貌似迷了路的邋遢青年

sense.def: If you go around to someone's house, you visit them.

example.ex: She helped me unpack my things and then we went around to see the other girls.
example.tran: 她帮我打开行李，然后我们去看望其他女孩们。

sense.def: You use around in expressions such as sit around and hang around when you are saying that someone is spending time in a place and not doing anything very important.

example.ex: I'm just going to be hanging around twiddling my thumbs...
example.tran: 我只会闲呆着，什么事也不做。

example.ex: After breakfast the next morning they sat around for an hour discussing political affairs.
example.tran: 第二天早饭后，他们闲坐着聊了一个小时政治话题。

example.ex: He used to skip lessons and hang around the harbor with some other boys.
example.tran: 他过去经常逃课，在码头上和其他几个男孩瞎混。

sense.def: If you move things around, you move them so that they are in different places.

example.ex: Furniture in the classroom should not be changed around without warning the blind child...
example.tran: 教室中的桌椅如需要挪动，应事先告诉这个盲童。

example.ex: She moved things around so the table was beneath the windows.
example.tran: 她挪动家具使桌子靠在窗边。

sense.def: If a wheel or object turns around, it turns.

example.ex: The boat started to spin around in the water.
example.tran: 船开始在水中打旋。

sense.def: You use around to say that something happens in different parts of a place or area.

example.ex: Police in South Africa say ten people have died in scattered violence around the country...
example.tran: 南非警方称，在全国各地零星发生的暴力事件中，有10人死亡。

example.ex: Elephants were often to be found in swamp in eastern Kenya around the Tana River.
example.tran: 在肯尼亚东部的塔纳河一带经常发现陷入沼泽的大象。

example.ex: ...pests and diseases around the garden.
example.tran: 遍布花园各个角落的病虫害

example.ex: What the hell do you think you're doing following me around?...
example.tran: 你到处跟着我到底想干什么？

example.ex: Giovanni has the best Parma ham for miles around.
example.tran: 方圆数英里内，乔瓦尼的帕尔马火腿最棒。

sense.def: If someone or something is around, they exist or are present in a place.

example.ex: The blackbird had a quick, wary look in case the cat was anywhere around...
example.tran: 这只乌鸫迅速警惕地张望了一眼，以防那只猫就在附近。

example.ex: Just having lots of people around that you can talk to is important...
example.tran: 有许多能交谈的人在身边很重要。

example.ex: You see very little of this wine around these days.
example.tran: 近来很少看见这种葡萄酒。

sense.def: The people around you are the people who you come into contact with, especially your friends and relatives, and the people you work with.

example.ex: We change our behaviour by observing the behaviour of those around us...
example.tran: 我们通过观察周围人的举止改变自己的行为。

example.ex: Those around her would forgive her for weeping.
example.tran: 她身边的人会原谅她掉眼泪的。

sense.def: If something such as a film, a discussion, or a plan is based around something, that thing is its main theme.

example.ex: ...the gentle comedy based around the Larkin family...
example.tran: 根据拉金一家的故事改编的轻喜剧

example.ex: The discussion centered around four subjects.
example.tran: 讨论围绕4个主题展开。

example.ex: ...a government whose economic policy was built around low interest rates.
example.tran: 以低利率为基础制定经济政策的政府

sense.def: You use around in expressions such as this time around or to come around when you are describing something that has happened before or things that happen regularly.

example.ex: Senator Bentsen has declined to get involved this time around...
example.tran: 这次本特森参议员又拒绝参与。

example.ex: When July Fourth comes around, the residents of Columbia City throw a noisy party.
example.tran: 每逢7月4号美国独立日，哥伦比亚城的居民们都会举行热闹的聚会。

sense.def: When you are giving measurements, you can use around to talk about the distance along the edge of something round.

example.ex: She was 40 inches around the hips.
example.tran: 她臀围40英寸。

sense.def: Around means approximately.

example.ex: My salary was around £9,000 plus a car and expenses...
example.tran: 我的薪水大约是9,000英镑，还有一辆车和业务经费可支配。

example.ex: Rolls Royce produces around 1,000 extremely desirable cars a year.
example.tran: 劳斯莱斯公司每年生产约1,000辆非常吸引人的汽车。

example.ex: He expects the elections to be held around November.
example.tran: 他预计选举在11月左右举行。

boxu.usage: Around and round are used in various ways as prepositions and adverbs, often as part of phrasal verbs. In most cases, you can use either word without any difference of meaning. In American English, around is much more common than round or about. When you are talking about casual or random movement in no particular direction, you can use about as well as around and round. It's so romantic up there, flying around in a small plane... I spent a couple of hours driving round Richmond... Police constables walk about with guns on their hips. When you are talking about something being generally present or available, you can use around or about, but not round, as adverbs. There is a lot of talent around at the moment... There are not that many jobs about.Round has a lot of other meanings, as a noun, verb, and adjective. You cannot use around in these cases.
boxu.tran: around和round都可用作介词和副词，用法很多，常用于短语动词中。很多情况下，两者可以通用，意义相同。美国英语中，around比round和about常见得多。指无具体方向的随意移动时，除around和round外，也可用about：It’s so romantic up there, flying around in a small plane（坐小型飞机在空中翱翔真浪漫），I spent a couple of hours driving round Richmond（我开车在里士满转悠了几小时），Police constables walk about with guns on their hips（警员们胯上别枪四处巡逻）。表示某物就在手头或能够获得，可用around或about作副词, 不可用round：There is a lot of talent around at the moment（目前有大量现成人才），There are not that many jobs about（眼下没有那么多工作机会）。round作名词、动词和形容词时有许多其他意思，参见round词条;在这些情况下不可用around。

phrase.def: Around about means approximately.

example.ex: There is a Green party but it only scored around about 10 percent in the vote...
example.tran: 虽然有一个绿党，但在选举中该党只得到了大约10%的选票。

example.ex: He's charging you around about a hundred pounds an hour for his services.
example.tran: 他提供一小时服务，要价大约100英镑。

phrase.def: You say all around to indicate that something affects all parts of a situation or all members of a group.

example.ex: He compared the achievements of the British and the French during 1916 and concluded that the latter were better all around.
example.tran: 他比较了1916年英国人和法国人的成就，结论是法国人在各方面都做得更好。

phrase.def: If someone has been around, they have had a lot of experience of different people and situations.
phrase.tran: 见过世面；经验丰富；老于世故

example.ex: He knows what to do. He's been around...
example.tran: 他知道该做什么。他阅历很丰富。

example.ex: He's been around a long time and has acquired a number of skills.
example.tran: 长久以来他见过很多世面，学了很多技术。

xrse.see: to get your tongue around something

sense.def: Arousal is the state of being sexually excited.

example.ex: ...sexual arousal...
example.tran: 性欲的激起

example.ex: Use this technique to control your level of arousal.
example.tran: 用这种方法来控制性兴奋程度。

sense.def: Arousal is a state in which you feel excited or very alert, for example as a result of fear, stress, or anger.

example.ex: Thinking angry thoughts can provoke strong physiological arousal.
example.tran: 想着生气的事情能激起强烈的生理反应。

sense.def: If something arouses a particular reaction or attitude in people, it causes them to have that reaction or attitude.

example.ex: We left in the daytime so as not to arouse suspicion.
example.tran: 我们在白天离开以避免引起怀疑。

example.ex: ...the deep public anger you have aroused.
example.tran: 你所激起的强烈公愤

sense.def: If something arouses a particular feeling or instinct that exists in someone, it causes them to experience that feeling or instinct strongly.

example.ex: There is nothing like a long walk to arouse the appetite...
example.tran: 没有什么比走很长的路更能激起食欲的了。

example.ex: He aroused her mothering instincts.
example.tran: 他激发了她母性的本能。

sense.def: If you are aroused by something, it makes you feel sexually excited.

example.ex: Some men are aroused when their partner says erotic words to them.
example.tran: 有些男人在性伴侣对他们说撩人情话时会被激起性欲。

example.ex: Some men feel that they get most sexually aroused in the morning.
example.tran: 一些男人感觉自己在早上性欲最强。

example.ex: Being stroked by a partner is usually more arousing than stroking yourself.
example.tran: 被性伴侣抚摸通常比自己抚摸更能激起性欲。

sense.def: If something arouses you, it makes you feel angry.

example.ex: He apologized, saying this subject always aroused him.
example.tran: 他道歉说这个话题总是会让他生气。

sense.def: If something arouses you from sleep, it wakes you up.

example.ex: About two o'clock, we were aroused from our sleep by a knocking at the door.
example.tran: 大约两点时，我们被一通敲门声唤醒。

sense.def: Arr. is a written abbreviation for (书面缩略=) arrives. It is used on timetables to indicate what time a bus, train, or plane will reach a place.
sense.tran: （用于火车、公共汽车或飞机时刻表）到达（时间）

example.ex: ...dep. Victoria 1927, arr. Ramsgate 2110.
example.tran: 19点27分从维多利亚出发，21点10分到达拉姆斯盖特

sense.def: Arr. is a written abbreviation for (书面缩略=) arranged. It is used to show that a piece of music written by one person has been rewritten in a different way or for different instruments by another person.

example.ex: 'A Good New Year', sung by Kenneth McKellar, (Trad., Arr. Knight).
example.tran: 《新年好》由肯尼思·麦凯勒演唱（传统曲目，改编者：奈特）

sense.def: If someone is arraigned on a particular charge, they are brought before a court of law to answer that charge.

example.ex: She was arraigned today on charges of assault and kidnapping...
example.tran: 她今天因被控人身侵犯和绑架而受到提审。

example.ex: He was arraigned for criminally abetting a traitor.
example.tran: 他因怂恿他人叛国而受到传讯。

sense.def: Arraignment is when someone is brought before a court of law to answer a particular charge.

example.ex: They are scheduled for arraignment October 5th...
example.tran: 他们定于10月5号接受提审。

example.ex: Crowds appeared at the arraignments, clashing with security forces.
example.tran: 审讯时，涌入的人群和安全部队发生冲突。

sense.def: If you arrange an event or meeting, you make plans for it to happen.

example.ex: She arranged an appointment for Friday afternoon at four-fifteen...
example.tran: 她在星期五下午4点15分安排了一次会面。

example.ex: This time it was a friend ringing to try to arrange a fishing trip in Scotland...
example.tran: 这次是一个朋友打来电话，想组织一次到苏格兰的钓鱼旅行。

example.ex: The Russian leader threw the carefully arranged welcome into chaos.
example.tran: 这位俄罗斯领导人将这场精心安排的欢迎会搞成了一场闹剧。

sense.def: If you arrange with someone to do something, you make plans with them to do it.

example.ex: I've arranged to see him on Friday morning...
example.tran: 我已安排好星期五上午见他。

example.ex: It was arranged that the party would gather for lunch in the Royal Garden Hotel...
example.tran: 已经和这一行人说好将在皇家花园宾馆吃午餐。

example.ex: He had arranged for the boxes to be stored until they could be collected.
example.tran: 他已安排好这些箱子的存放事宜，直到被取走。

sense.def: If you arrange something for someone, you make it possible for them to have it or to do it.

example.ex: I will arrange for someone to take you round...
example.tran: 我会安排人带你转转。

example.ex: The hotel manager will arrange for a babysitter...
example.tran: 宾馆经理会安排人照看婴儿。

example.ex: I've arranged your hotels for you...
example.tran: 我已为你们安排好了旅馆。

example.ex: Transport is not included but can be arranged.
example.tran: 不含交通费用，但可负责安排。

sense.def: If you arrange things somewhere, you place them in a particular position, usually in order to make them look attractive or tidy.

example.ex: When she has a little spare time she enjoys arranging dried flowers...
example.tran: 她稍有空闲便喜欢摆弄干花。

example.ex: He started to arrange the books in piles...
example.tran: 他开始将书成堆摆放。

example.ex: A number of seats have been arranged in front of the painting.
example.tran: 在这幅油画前摆了一些座位。

sense.def: If a piece of music is arranged by someone, it is changed or adapted so that it is suitable for particular instruments or voices, or for a particular performance.

example.ex: The songs were arranged by another well-known bass player, Ron Carter.
example.tran: 另一位著名的低音提琴演奏家罗恩·卡特改编了这些歌曲。

sense.def: If you say how things are arranged, you are talking about their position in relation to each other or to something else.
sense.tran: 安置于…的;建于…的;…布置的

example.ex: The house itself is three stories high and arranged around a courtyard...
example.tran: 房子本身有三层高，绕着一个庭院而建。

example.ex: They lived in neatly-arranged little houses.
example.tran: 他们住在布置整洁的小房子里。

sense.def: In an arranged marriage, the parents choose the person who their son or daughter will marry.

sense.hdgr:
usu pl, oft N
for n, N to-inf
sense.def: Arrangements are plans and preparations which you make so that something will happen or be possible.

example.ex: The staff is working frantically on final arrangements for the summit...
example.tran: 工作人员正紧张忙乱地为峰会做最后准备。

example.ex: She telephoned Ellen, but made no arrangements to see her.
example.tran: 她给埃伦打了电话，但没有约她见面。

example.ex: ...travel arrangements.
example.tran: 旅行安排

sense.def: An arrangement is an agreement that you make with someone to do something.

example.ex: The caves can be visited only by prior arrangement...
example.tran: 这些洞穴只接受预约参观。

example.ex: Her class teacher made a special arrangement to discuss her progress at school once a month.
example.tran: 她班上的老师作了特别安排，每月讨论一次她在学业上的进展情况。

sense.def: An arrangement of things, for example flowers or furniture, is a group of them displayed in a particular way.

example.ex: The house was always decorated with imaginative flower arrangements.
example.tran: 这所房子总是摆放着富有创意的插花。

example.ex: ...an arrangement of dark-blue armchairs around a coffee table.
example.tran: 咖啡桌周围摆放了一些深蓝色扶手椅

sense.def: If someone makes an arrangement of a piece of music, they change it so that it is suitable for particular voices or instruments, or for a particular performance.

example.ex: ...an arrangement of a well-known piece by Mozart...
example.tran: 莫扎特一首名曲的改编曲

example.ex: Glen Bronka wrote his own orchestral arrangements.
example.tran: 格伦·布朗卡把自己的曲子改编成了管弦乐曲。

sense.def: An arranger is a musician who arranges music by other composers, either for particular instruments or voices, or for a particular performance.
An arranger is a person who arranges things for other people.

example.ex: ...a loan arranger.
example.tran: 贷款协调人

sense.def: Arrant is used to emphasize that something or someone is very bad in some way.

example.ex: That's arrant nonsense.
example.tran: 那完全是一派胡言。

example.ex: ...an arrant coward.
example.tran: 十足的懦夫

sense.def: An array of different things or people is a large number or wide range of them.

example.ex: As the deadline approached she experienced a bewildering array of emotions...
example.tran: 随着最后期限的临近，她开始心绪纷乱，不知所措。

example.ex: A dazzling array of celebrities are expected at the Mayfair gallery to see the pictures.
example.tran: 梅费尔美术馆期待星光璀璨的各界名流来欣赏这些画。

sense.def: An array of objects is a collection of them that is displayed or arranged in a particular way.

example.ex: There was an impressive array of pill bottles stacked on top of the fridge...
example.tran: 冰箱上显眼地摆放着许多药瓶。

example.ex: We visited the local markets and saw wonderful arrays of fruit and vegetables.
example.tran: 我们去了当地的市场，看见了一排排摆放整齐的水果和蔬菜。

sense.hdgr:
usu with supp, oft adj N, N
of n
sense.def: An array of instruments such as telescopes or solar panels is a number of them that are connected together to form a single unit.
sense.tran: （多个望远镜、太阳能电池板之类的仪器设备连接在一起构成的）阵列

sense.def: In science and mathematics, an array of things such as atoms or numbers is a regular pattern or structure that is formed by them.

example.ex: ...methods which can be used to create an ordered array of molecules within materials...
example.tran: 能使材料内部的分子有序排列的方法

example.ex: The image is then stored on the computer hard disk as a vast array of black or white dots.
example.tran: 这幅图像当时就以大量黑点或白点排列的形式被存入电脑硬盘。

sense.def: If things are arrayed in a particular way, they are arranged or displayed in that way.

example.ex: Cartons of Chinese food were arrayed on a large oak table.
example.tran: 在一张宽大的橡树桌上摆放着一盒盒中式食品。

example.ex: ...how molecules are arrayed in materials such as plastics and other polymers.
example.tran: 在塑料和其他聚合物材料中，分子如何排列

sense.def: If something such as a military force is arrayed against someone, it is ready and able to be used against them.

example.ex: The trouble with all such proposals is that so many powerful interests are arrayed against them...
example.tran: 所有这类提案遇到的困难是有太多强大的利益集团表示反对。

example.ex: Napoleon ultimately failed in his plan to defeat the two armies arrayed against him.
example.tran: 拿破仑计划击溃那两支列队待战的部队，却最终失利。

sense.def: If someone is arrayed in particular clothes, especially attractive or beautiful ones, they are dressed in those clothes.

example.ex: Sabrina has discarded her habitual boilersuit and is arrayed in black mini and tights.
example.tran: 萨布丽娜脱下平日穿的工作服，换上了黑色的超短裙和连裤袜。

example.ex: ...gorgeously arrayed priests.
example.tran: 穿戴华丽的牧师

sense.def: Arrears are amounts of money that you owe, especially regular payments that you should have made earlier.
sense.tran: 应付欠款；（尤指）逾期债款

example.ex: They have promised to pay the arrears over the next five years...
example.tran: 他们保证在随后的5年内偿付逾期债款。

example.ex: These 50,000 arrears cases represent a tiny fraction of all home owners.
example.tran: 这5万个欠款案例只代表所有业主中的一小部分人。

phrase.hdgr:
v-link PHR, PHR after v, oft amount PHR, PHR
with/on n
phrase.def: If someone is in arrears with their payments, or has got into arrears, they have not paid the regular amounts of money that they should have paid.

example.ex: ...the 300,000 households who are more than six months in arrears with their mortgages.
example.tran: 拖欠抵押贷款超过6个月的30万户家庭

example.ex: ...debtor countries which fall into arrears with the banks.
example.tran: 拖欠银行贷款的债务国

phrase.def: If sums of money such as wages or taxes are paid in arrears, they are paid at the end of the period of time to which they relate, for example after a job has been done and the wages have been earned.

example.ex: Unemployment benefit is paid fortnightly in arrears.
example.tran: 失业救济金延后两个星期支付。

phrase.def: If someone is in arrears in a sports match or race, they are not winning, because they have a lower score or slower time than other competitors.
phrase.tran: （体育比赛中成绩或比分）落后的

example.ex: Davies finished almost two seconds in arrears for third place.
example.tran: 戴维斯落后了差不多两秒，获得第三名。

sense.def: If the police arrest you, they take charge of you and take you to a police station, because they believe you may have committed a crime.

example.ex: Police arrested five young men in connection with one of the attacks...
example.tran: 警方逮捕了与其中一次袭击有关的5名青年男子。

example.ex: The police say seven people were arrested for minor offences.
example.tran: 警方称有7人因轻罪被捕。

example.ex: ...a substantial reward for information leading to the arrest of the bombers...
example.tran: 为抓捕放置炸弹者提供线索的人设置的巨额奖金

example.ex: Police chased the fleeing terrorists and later made two arrests...
example.tran: 警方追踪逃跑的恐怖分子，后来逮捕了其中两人。

example.ex: Murder squad detectives approached the man and placed him under arrest.
example.tran: 凶杀侦破组警探靠近那名男子，将其逮捕。

sense.def: If something or someone arrests a process, they stop it continuing.

example.ex: The sufferer may have to make major changes in his or her life to arrest the disease...
example.tran: 患者可能必须对生活习惯作出重大调整以控制病情。

example.ex: The law could arrest the development of good research if applied prematurely.
example.tran: 如果草率施行，该法律将会阻滞高质量研究的进展。

sense.def: If something interesting or surprising arrests your attention, you suddenly notice it and then continue to look at it or consider it carefully.

example.ex: The work of an architect of genius always arrests the attention no matter how little remains...
example.tran: 天才建筑师的作品无论残留多少都能最大限度地吸引眼球。

example.ex: As he reached the hall after her, he saw what had arrested her.
example.tran: 他跟随她到了大厅，看见了吸引她注意的东西。

example.ex: The most arresting feature is the painted wall decoration.
example.tran: 最醒目的特点是绘有图画的墙面装饰。

sense.def: An arrestable offence is an offence that you can be arrested for.

example.ex: Possession of cannabis will no longer be an arrestable offence.
example.tran: 持有大麻将不再会被拘捕。

sense.def: When a person or vehicle arrives at a place, you can refer to their arrival .

example.ex: ...the day after his arrival in England...
example.tran: 他到英格兰的第二天

example.ex: He was dead on arrival at the nearby hospital.
example.tran: 到达附近的医院时他已经死亡。

example.ex: ...the airport arrivals hall.
example.tran: 机场到港大厅

example.ex: ...the arrival gate at Penn Station.
example.tran: 佩恩车站的出站口

sense.def: When someone starts a new job, you can refer to their arrival in that job.

example.ex: ...the power vacuum created by the arrival of a new president...
example.tran: 新主席接任造成的权力真空

example.ex: The company had eight departures and 11 new arrivals on its management board in 1980-1989.
example.tran: 在1980至1989年间，公司管理委员会离职8人，新吸收11人。

sense.def: When something is brought to you or becomes available, you can refer to its arrival .

example.ex: I was flicking idly through a newspaper while awaiting the arrival of orange juice and coffee...
example.tran: 我一边无所事事地翻着报纸，一边等着我点的橙汁和咖啡。

example.ex: The coronation broadcast marked the arrival of television.
example.tran: 加冕典礼的转播标志着电视时代的到来。

sense.def: When a particular time comes or a particular event happens, you can refer to its arrival.
sense.tran: （某一时间的）到来；（某一事件的）发生

example.ex: He celebrated the arrival of the New Year with a party for his friends.
example.tran: 他为朋友们举行了一个聚会，庆祝新年的到来。

sense.def: You can refer to someone who has just arrived at a place as a new arrival .

example.ex: A high proportion of the new arrivals are skilled professionals...
example.tran: 新来的人中很大一部分是技术熟练的专业人士。

example.ex: He was the most junior and most recent arrival at the embassy.
example.tran: 在大使馆里，他是职位最低也是入职最晚的一位。

sense.def: When a baby is born, you can refer to its arrival.

example.ex: ...a couple anticipating the arrival of a new child.
example.tran: 盼望着孩子出生的一对夫妇

sense.def: You can refer to a baby who has just been born as a new arrival .

example.ex: Her father was besotted with the new arrival.
example.tran: 她的父亲完全沉浸在新生儿带来的喜悦中。

sense.def: When a person or vehicle arrives at a place, they come to it at the end of a journey.

example.ex: Fresh groups of guests arrived...
example.tran: 新的客人接踵而来。

example.ex: ...a small group of commuters waiting for their train, which arrived on time...
example.tran: 几个通勤者等候的列车按时到达了

example.ex: The Princess Royal arrived at Gatwick this morning from Jamaica.
example.tran: 长公主殿下从牙买加出发，今天早上抵达盖特威克机场。

sense.def: When you arrive at a place, you come to it for the first time in order to stay, live, or work there.

example.ex: ...in the old days before the European settlers arrived in the country.
example.tran: 在欧洲殖民者来到这个国家之前的旧日时光

example.ex: ...a young student newly arrived in England from New Zealand.
example.tran: 从新西兰初次来到英格兰的年轻学生

sense.def: When something such as letter or meal arrives, it is brought or delivered to you.

example.ex: Any entry arriving after the closing date will not be considered...
example.tran: 截止日期之后报名参赛的人将不予考虑。

example.ex: Breakfast arrived while he was in the bathroom.
example.tran: 早餐送来的时候他还在浴室里。

sense.def: When something such as a new product or invention arrives, it becomes available.
sense.tran: （新产品或发明）出现，到来，问世

example.ex: Several long-awaited videos will finally arrive in the shops this month...
example.tran: 几部让人翘首企盼的录像片终于将在这个月到货。

example.ex: They'll be ready to embrace the new technology when it arrives.
example.tran: 他们随时准备迎接新技术的问世。

sense.def: When a particular moment or event arrives, it happens, especially after you have been waiting for it or expecting it.
sense.tran: （尤指经过等待或期盼后）来临，到来

example.ex: The time has arrived when I need to give up smoking.
example.tran: 我戒烟的时机已到。

example.ex: ...the belief that the army would be much further forward before winter arrived.
example.tran: 认为军队在冬季来临之前将会向前大举推进的看法

sense.def: When you arrive at something such as a decision, you decide something after thinking about it or discussing it.

example.ex: ...if the jury cannot arrive at a unanimous decision...
example.tran: 如果陪审团不能作出一致判决

example.ex: These figures are arrived at on the basis of dentists' receipts for 1991-1992.
example.tran: 这些数字是根据1991至1992年间的牙医收据统计得出的。

sense.def: When a baby arrives, it is born.

example.ex: It's very unlikely that your baby will arrive before you get to hospital.
example.tran: 你的孩子不大可能在你到达医院之前就出生。

sense.def: If you say that someone has arrived, you mean that they have become successful or famous.

example.ex: These are cars which show you've arrived and had a good time along the way.
example.tran: 这样的车可以显示你已功成名就，并且一路顺风顺水。

boxu.usage: You use both arrive and reach to talk about coming to a particular place. You can use arrive to emphasize being in a place rather than travelling to it. When I arrived in England I was exhausted. Reach is always followed by a noun or pronoun referring to a place, and you can use it to emphasize the effort required to get there. To reach the capital might not be easy. Arrive at and reach can also be used to say that someone eventually makes a decision or finds the answer to something. It took hours to arrive at a decision... They were unable to reach a decision.
boxu.tran: arrive和reach都可表示到达某地。arrive强调“在某地”，而非“去某地”：When I arrived in England I was exhausted（我到达英格兰的时候已经精疲力竭了）。reach后面总是接表示地点的名词或代词，强调到达某地的不易：To reach the capital might not be easy（到达首都可能不太容易）。arrive at和reach也可以用来表示终于作出决定或是找到答案：It took hours to arrive at a decision（作决定花了几个小时的时间），They were unable to reach a decision（他们没能达成一项决议）。

sense.def: You describe someone as an arriviste when you are criticizing them because they are trying very hard to belong to an influential or important social group which you feel they have no right to belong to.
sense.tran: （一心想跨入社会权贵阶层的）攀高结贵者，野心勃勃的人

example.ex: A woman regarded by some as a pushy arriviste.
example.tran: 被一些人认为是一心想攀龙附骥的女人

example.ex: ...political arrivistes.
example.tran: 政治野心家

sense.def: Someone who is arrogant behaves in a proud, unpleasant way towards other people because they believe that they are more important than others.

example.ex: He was so arrogant...
example.tran: 他是如此傲慢。

example.ex: That sounds arrogant, doesn't it?
example.tran: 那话听起来很嚣张，是不是？

example.ex: ...an air of arrogant indifference.
example.tran: 自高自大、事不关己的态度

example.ex: At times the arrogance of those in power is quite blatant.
example.tran: 有时那些当权者颇为傲慢嚣张。

example.ex: Later, Simpson arrogantly claimed: 'We won't lose another game.'
example.tran: 稍后，辛普森傲慢地宣称：“我们不会再输了。”

sense.def: If someone arrogates to themselves something such as a responsibility or privilege, they claim or take it even though they have no right to do so.

example.ex: The assembly arrogated to itself the right to make changes...
example.tran: 大会越权作出变更。

example.ex: He arrogated the privilege to himself alone.
example.tran: 他为自己僭取特权。

sense.def: An arrow is a long thin weapon which is sharp and pointed at one end and which often has feathers at the other end. An arrow is shot from a bow.

example.ex: Warriors armed with bows and arrows and spears have invaded their villages.
example.tran: 佩带弓箭和长矛的武士闯入了他们的村庄。

sense.def: An arrow is a written or printed sign that consists of a straight line with another line bent at a sharp angle at one end. This is a printed arrow: →. The arrow points in a particular direction to indicate where something is.
sense.tran: 箭头（用来指示方向，符号为→）

example.ex: A series of arrows points the way to the modest grave of Andrei Sakharov.
example.tran: 一连串的箭头指示着通往安德烈·萨哈罗夫的朴素的墓地的路。

sense.def: An arrowhead is the sharp, pointed part of an arrow.
Arrowroot is a substance obtained from a West Indian plant. It is used in cooking, for example for thickening sauces or in making biscuits.
sense.tran: 竹芋粉，葛粉（取自西印度群岛的一种植物，用于烹饪，使汤汁变稠或制作饼干）

sense.def: Your arse is your bottom.

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 ass

sense.def: If you say that someone is arsing around or arsing about, you mean that they are behaving in a silly, irritating way instead of getting something done.
If one person calls another person an arsehole, they think that person is extremely stupid or has behaved in a stupid way.

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 asshole

sense.def: An arsenal is a large collection of weapons and military equipment held by a country, group, or person.

example.ex: Russia and the other republics are committed to destroying most of their nuclear arsenals...
example.tran: 俄罗斯和其他加盟共和国承诺销毁他们储存的大部分核武器。

example.ex: They possess a formidable arsenal of rifles, machine guns, landmines and teargas.
example.tran: 他们持有的步枪、机枪、地雷和催泪弹数量惊人。

sense.def: An arsenal is a building where weapons and military equipment are stored.

example.ex: The murder weapon was part of a haul stolen in a raid on a South African air-force arsenal in 1990.
example.tran: 1990年南非空军武器库遭到突袭，这件凶器就是当时被盗走的武器中的一件。

sense.def: You can use arsenal to refer to a large number of tools, methods, or resources that someone has available to help them achieve what they want to do.
sense.tran: （方法、资源等的）宝库；(储藏工具的)仓库

example.ex: Managers use a full arsenal of motivational techniques to get employees to take risks...
example.tran: 管理者运用各种激励措施使雇员勇于冒险。

example.ex: He has more punches in his arsenal than other boxers.
example.tran: 他比其他拳击手出拳花样多。

sense.def: Arsenic is a very strong poison which can kill people.
Arson is the crime of deliberately setting fire to a building or vehicle.

example.ex: ...a terrible wave of rioting, theft and arson...
example.tran: 可怕的骚乱、盗窃和纵火事件接连发生

example.ex: They vented their anger by carrying out arson attacks.
example.tran: 他们四处纵火以泄愤。

sense.def: An arsonist is a person who deliberately sets fire to a building or vehicle.
Art consists of paintings, sculpture, and other pictures or objects which are created for people to look at and admire or think deeply about.

example.ex: ...the first exhibition of such art in the West.
example.tran: 此类艺术品在西方的首次展览

example.ex: ...contemporary and modern American art.
example.tran: 近现代美洲艺术

example.ex: ...Whitechapel Art Gallery.
example.tran: 白教堂美术馆

sense.def: Art is the activity or educational subject that consists of creating paintings, sculptures, and other pictures or objects for people to look at and admire or think deeply about.
sense.tran: （作为活动或教学科目的）美术

example.ex: ...a painter, content to be left alone with her all-absorbing art.
example.tran: 甘愿独自沉浸于绘画中的画家

example.ex: ...Farnham College of Art and Design.
example.tran: 法纳姆美术设计学院

example.ex: ...art lessons.
example.tran: 美术课

sense.def: The arts are activities such as music, painting, literature, cinema, and dance, which people can take part in for enjoyment, or to create works which express serious meanings or ideas of beauty.
sense.tran: 艺术（活动）（如音乐、绘画、文学、电影、舞蹈等）

example.ex: Catherine the Great was a patron of the arts and sciences.
example.tran: 叶卡捷琳娜大帝赞助过各种艺术创作和科学研究。

example.ex: ...the Arts Council of Great Britain.
example.tran: 大不列颠艺术委员会

example.ex: ...the Wexner Centre for the Visual Arts.
example.tran: 威克斯纳视觉艺术中心

example.ex: ...the art of cinema.
example.tran: 电影艺术

sense.def: At a university or college, arts are subjects such as history, literature, or languages in contrast to scientific subjects.

example.ex: ...arts and social science graduates.
example.tran: 人文和社会科学毕业生

example.ex: ...the Faculty of Arts.
example.tran: 文学院

sense.def: Arts or art is used in the names of theatres or cinemas which show plays or films that are intended to make the audience think deeply about the content, and not simply to entertain them.
sense.tran: （用于剧院或电影院的名称中）上演艺术作品的，艺术的

example.ex: ...the Cambridge Arts Cinema.
example.tran: 剑桥艺术影院

sense.def: If you describe an activity as an art, you mean that it requires skill and that people learn to do it by instinct or experience, rather than by learning facts or rules.

example.ex: Fishing is an art.
example.tran: 钓鱼是一门技术。

example.ex: ...the unscientific arts of seduction and romance.
example.tran: 勾引异性和谈情说爱的不科学的技巧

sense.def: Art is an old-fashioned form of the second person singular of the present tense of the verb be.
sense.tran: （be的现在式单数第二人称形式，过时用法）

example.ex: Father, I know thou art aware of me at all times.
example.tran: 父亲，我知道您无时无刻不在关心着我。

sense.def: Art Deco is a style of decoration and architecture that was common in the 1920s and 30s. It uses simple, bold designs on materials such as plastic and glass.
sense.tran: 装饰派艺术（20世纪20至30年代流行的装饰和建筑风格）

example.ex: ...art deco lamps.
example.tran: 具有装饰派艺术风格的灯具

sense.def: An artefact is an ornament, tool, or other object that is made by a human being, especially one that is historically or culturally interesting.
sense.tran: 人工制品；（尤指具有历史或文化价值的）手工制品，手工艺品

sense.def: Arterial means involving or relating to your arteries and the movement of blood through your body.

example.ex: ...people with arterial disease.
example.tran: 动脉疾病患者

sense.def: An arterial road or railway is a main road or railway within a complex road or railway system.

example.ex: ...one of the main arterial roads through the city.
example.tran: 该城市的主干道之一

sense.def: Arteriosclerosis is a medical condition in which the walls of your arteries become hard and thick, so your blood cannot flow through them properly.
Arteries are the tubes in your body that carry blood from your heart to the rest of your body.

example.ex: ...patients suffering from blocked arteries.
example.tran: 患动脉栓塞的病人

sense.def: You can refer to an important main route within a complex road, railway, or river system as an artery .

example.ex: Clarence Street was one of the northbound arteries of the central business district.
example.tran: 克拉伦斯街是中央商业区北段部分的主干路之一。

example.ex: ...the point where the Ohio River, itself a great artery, joins the Mississippi.
example.tran: 本身就是一条主干河道的俄亥俄河和密西西比河的交汇处

sense.def: If you describe an activity as an art form, you mean that it is concerned with creating objects, works, or performances that are beautiful or have a serious meaning.

example.ex: Graffiti is now an art form in Nor-thampton.
example.tran: 涂鸦如今在北安普顿是一种艺术形式。

example.ex: ...Indian dance and related art forms.
example.tran: 印度舞蹈和相关的艺术形式

sense.def: If you describe someone as artful, you mean that they are clever and skilful at achieving what they want, especially by deceiving people.
sense.tran: 狡猾的；狡诈的；有手腕的

example.ex: ...the smiles and artifices of a subtle artful woman...
example.tran: 阴险狡诈的女子的笑里藏刀

example.ex: Some politicians have realised that there are more artful ways of subduing people than shooting or jailing them.
example.tran: 一些政客已经意识到有比枪和监狱更高明的使民众屈服的方法。

example.ex: He artfully inveigled the Prime Minister into committing his government to the venture.
example.tran: 他狡猾地哄骗总理，使政府卷进这个危险的行动。

sense.def: If you use artful to describe the way someone has done or arranged something, you approve of it because it is clever or elegant.

example.ex: There is also an artful contrast of shapes...
example.tran: 形状的对比也很巧妙。

example.ex: Despite some artful editing, the anthology is a weak one.
example.tran: 除了编辑上的一些巧妙之处，这本选集乏善可陈。

example.ex: ...artfully arranged flowers.
example.tran: 精美的插花

sense.def: An art-house film is a film that is intended to be a serious artistic work rather than a piece of popular entertainment.
sense.tran: （电影）严肃的，艺术的，非娱乐性的

example.ex: ...a quirky art-house film...
example.tran: 一部另类艺术片

example.ex: The movies he made became art-house classics.
example.tran: 他拍摄的影片成了艺术片的经典之作。

sense.def: Arthritic is used to describe the condition, the pain, or the symptoms of arthritis.
sense.tran: 关节炎的；与关节炎有关的

example.ex: I developed serious arthritic symptoms and chronic sinusitis.
example.tran: 我得了严重的关节炎和慢性鼻窦炎。

sense.def: An arthritic person is suffering from arthritis, and cannot move very easily. Arthritic joints or hands are affected by arthritis.

example.ex: ...an elderly lady who suffered with arthritic hands.
example.tran: 双手受关节炎折磨的老妇人

sense.def: Arthritis is a medical condition in which the joints in someone's body are swollen and painful.

example.ex: I have a touch of arthritis in the wrist.
example.tran: 我的手腕患有轻微关节炎。

sense.def: Artichokes or globe artichokes are round green vegetables that have fleshy leaves arranged like the petals of a flower.
An article is a piece of writing that is published in a newspaper or magazine.

example.ex: ...a newspaper article...
example.tran: 一篇报载文章

example.ex: ...a travel article...
example.tran: 一篇游记

example.ex: According to an article in The Economist the drug could have side effects.
example.tran: 《经济学家》杂志上的一篇文章讲到这种药可能有副作用。

example.ex: ...Canning's article about the Buxton Festival.
example.tran: 坎宁的一篇关于巴克斯顿艺术节的文章

sense.def: You can refer to objects as articles of some kind.

example.ex: ...articles of clothing...
example.tran: 衣物

example.ex: He had stripped the house of all articles of value.
example.tran: 他把房间里值钱的东西洗劫一空。

example.ex: ...household articles.
example.tran: 家居用品

sense.def: If you describe something as the genuine article, you are emphasizing that it is genuine, and often that it is very good.

example.ex: The vodka was the genuine article.
example.tran: 这种伏特加酒是正品。

sense.hdgr:
oft N
of n, N num
sense.def: An article of a formal agreement or document is a section of it which deals with a particular point.

example.ex: The country appears to be violating several articles of the convention.
example.tran: 这个国家看起来违反了公约中的好几项条款。

example.ex: ...Article 50 of the UN charter.
example.tran: 《联合国宪章》第50条

sense.def: Someone who is in articles is being trained as a lawyer or accountant by a firm with whom they have a written agreement.

example.ex: In 1986, 44 per cent of those admitted to articles were women.
example.tran: 1986年，44％的实习生为女性。

sense.def: In grammar, an article is a kind of determiner. In English, 'a' and 'an' are called the indefinite article, and 'the' is called the definite article .
sense.tran: 冠词（a和an是不定冠词，the是定冠词）

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ
to n, ADJ n
sense.def: In Britain, someone who is articled to a firm of lawyers or accountants is employed by the firm and is training to become qualified.
sense.tran: （在律师或会计师事务所）签约当学徒的，见习的

example.ex: He was initially articled to a solicitor.
example.tran: 他最初订约给一位律师当学徒。

example.ex: ...an articled clerk.
example.tran: 实习文员

sense.def: If something is an article of faith for a person or group, they believe in it totally.

example.ex: For Republicans it is almost an article of faith that this tax should be cut.
example.tran: 共和党人几乎是坚定不移地主张这项税收需削减。

entry.boxr: The adjective is pronounced /ɑː'tɪkjʊlət/. The verb is pronounced /ɑː'tɪkjʊleɪt/. 形容词读作 /ɑː'tɪkjʊlət/，动词读作 /ɑː'tɪkjʊleɪt/。

sense.def: If you describe someone as articulate, you mean that they are able to express their thoughts and ideas easily and well.
sense.tran: 善于表达的;口齿伶俐的

example.ex: She is an articulate young woman...
example.tran: 她是一个口才很好的年轻女子。

example.ex: The child was unable to offer an articulate description of what she had witnessed.
example.tran: 孩子无法对她所目睹的事情作出清楚的描述。

example.ex: To start a revolution, you need discipline, incisiveness and articulacy.
example.tran: 要革命，就要守纪律、看得远、善表达。

sense.def: When you articulate your ideas or feelings, you express them clearly in words.
sense.tran: 清楚地表达（思想或感情）

example.ex: The president has been accused of failing to articulate an overall vision in foreign affairs.
example.tran: 总统因未能清晰表述对外交事务的整体构想而受到指责。

sense.def: If you articulate something, you say it very clearly, so that each word or syllable can be heard.

example.ex: He articulated each syllable carefully.
