example.tran: 他小心而清晰地发出每个音节。

sense.def: An articulated vehicle, especially a lorry, is made in two or more sections which are joined together by metal bars, so that the vehicle can turn more easily.

entry.boxr: in AM, usually use 美国英语通常用rig, trailer truck

sense.def: Articulation is the action of producing a sound or word clearly, in speech or music.

example.ex: ...a singer able to sustain a full tone and clear articulation over extremely long periods.
example.tran: 可以很长时间保持声音洪亮并且吐字清楚的歌手

sense.def: The articulation of an idea or feeling is the expression of it, especially in words.

example.ex: This was seen as a way of restricting women's articulation of grievances.
example.tran: 这被认为是一种限制妇女发牢骚的方式。

sense.def: The articulation of a structure or system is the way in which its different parts or elements are connected.
sense.tran: （不同部分、元素之间的）连接，联系，相互关系

example.ex: Capitalist social formations reflect the interaction, or articulation, of different modes of production.
example.tran: 资本主义社会结构反映了不同形式的生产方式之间的互动，或者说相互联系。

sense.def: Artifice is the clever use of tricks and devices.

example.ex: Weegee's photographs are full of artfulness, and artifice.
example.tran: 维基的摄影作品运用了丰富的艺术手段和技巧。

sense.def: Artificial objects, materials, or processes do not occur naturally and are created by human beings, for example using science or technology.

example.ex: ...a wholefood diet free from artificial additives, colours and flavours...
example.tran: 不含人工添加剂、色素和香料的天然食品

example.ex: The city is dotted with small lakes, natural and artificial...
example.tran: 这个城市小型湖泊星罗棋布，有天然的也有人工的。

example.ex: He did not want his life to be prolonged by artificial means.
example.tran: 他不想靠人为方式延长生命。

example.ex: ...artificially sweetened lemonade.
example.tran: 添加人造甜味剂的柠檬水

example.ex: ...drugs which artificially reduce heart rate.
example.tran: 可以人为降低心率的药物

sense.def: An artificial state or situation exists only because someone has created it, and therefore often seems unnatural or unnecessary.

example.ex: Even in the artificial environment of an office, our body rhythms continue to affect us...
example.tran: 即使是在办公室这样的非自然环境中，我们的人体生物钟依然影响着我们。

example.ex: Removed from the artificial atmosphere of the fashion show, high-fashion clothes often look cheap and silly.
example.tran: 脱离了时装表演营造的氛围，非常时尚的时装看上去常常显得既廉价又可笑。

example.ex: ...another example of the capriciousness and artificiality of our adversarial system of justice.
example.tran: 关于对抗制审判方式的多变性和虚假性的又一个例子

example.ex: ...state subsidies that have kept retail prices artificially low.
example.tran: 人为地把零售价格限制在低水平的国家补贴

sense.def: If you describe someone or their behaviour as artificial, you disapprove of them because they pretend to have attitudes and feelings which they do not really have.
sense.tran: 假装的；虚伪的；矫揉造作的

example.ex: The voice was patronizing and affected, the accent artificial.
example.tran: 声音拿腔拿调的，听上去矫揉造作。

example.ex: ...the novel's use of homosexuality to suggest the artificiality of all relationships in that nervous city.
example.tran: 小说通过对同性恋的描写向读者暗示了在那个浮躁的城市里人际往来的虚情假意

sense.def: If you say that food tastes or looks artificial, you do not like it because its taste or appearance does not seem genuine, and seems to be created by added substances.
sense.tran: （味道、外观）不自然的，不真实的，添加非天然成分的

example.ex: The meat was chewy and the sauce was glutinous and tasted artificial.
example.tran: 肉嚼不烂，酱汁黏稠，味道也不自然。

example.ex: ...complaints that their tinned peas were an artificial shade of green.
example.tran: 对他们的听装豌豆添加人工合成绿色素的投诉

sense.def: Artificial insemination is a medical technique for making a woman pregnant by injecting previously stored sperm into her womb. Female animals can also be made pregnant by artificial insemination. The abbreviation AI is also used.

Artificial intelligence is a type of computer technology which is concerned with making machines work in an intelligent way, similar to the way that the human mind works. The abbreviation AI is also used.

Artificial respiration is the forcing of air into the lungs of someone who has stopped breathing, usually by blowing through their mouth or nose, in order to keep them alive and to help them to start breathing again.

example.ex: She was given artificial respiration and cardiac massage.
example.tran: 有人给她做了人工呼吸和心脏按压。

sense.def: Artillery consists of large, powerful guns which are transported on wheels and used by an army.

example.ex: Using tanks and heavy artillery, they seized the town.
example.tran: 他们倚仗坦克和重型火炮占领了这个镇。

example.ex: ...the sound of artillery fire.
example.tran: 炮火声

sense.def: The artillery is the section of an army which is trained to use large, powerful guns.

example.ex: At some stage he left the Artillery to command a radar unit.
example.tran: 有段时间他离开了炮兵部队去指挥一支雷达小分队。

sense.def: An artisan is someone whose job requires skill with their hands.
An artist is someone who draws or paints pictures or creates sculptures as a job or a hobby.

example.ex: ...the studio of a great artist...
example.tran: 一个伟大的艺术家的工作室

example.ex: Each poster is signed by the artist...
example.tran: 每幅海报都有这个艺术家的签名。

example.ex: I'm not a good artist.
example.tran: 我不是优秀的艺术家。

sense.def: An artist is a person who creates novels, poems, films, or other things which can be considered as works of art.
sense.tran: 艺术家（如小说家、诗人、导演等）

example.ex: His books are enormously easy to read, yet he is a serious artist...
example.tran: 虽然他是一个不折不扣的艺术家，但是他的作品极其通俗易懂。

example.ex: Engel is quoted as saying that balanced people do not become artists.
example.tran: 引用恩格尔的话说就是理性的人是成不了艺术家的。

sense.def: An artist is a performer such as a musician, actor, or dancer.

example.ex: ...a popular artist who has sold millions of records.
example.tran: 唱片销量达到数百万张的当红音乐家

sense.def: If you say that someone is an artist at a particular activity, you mean they are very skilled at it.

example.ex: He is an exceptional footballer — an artist.
example.tran: 他是一名出色的足球运动员，一个足球高手。

sense.def: An artiste is a professional entertainer, for example a singer or a dancer.

example.ex: ...a cabaret artiste.
example.tran: 夜总会的艺人

sense.def: Someone who is artistic is good at drawing or painting, or arranging things in a beautiful way.
sense.tran: 有艺术天赋的;有艺术鉴赏力的

example.ex: They encourage boys to be sensitive and artistic...
example.tran: 他们鼓励培养男孩子的敏感和艺术气质。

example.ex: Mary's got it all so nice — you remember how artistic she always was with colors.
example.tran: 玛丽把一切弄得都很漂亮——你还记得她以前总是对色彩很有艺术品位吧。

sense.def: Artistic means relating to art or artists.

example.ex: ...the campaign for artistic freedom.
example.tran: 艺术自由运动

example.ex: ...their 1,300 year old artistic traditions.
example.tran: 他们1,300年的艺术传统

example.ex: ...artistically gifted children...
example.tran: 有艺术天分的孩子

example.ex: Artistically, the photographs are stunning.
example.tran: 从艺术角度来说，这些照片精美绝伦。

sense.def: An artistic design or arrangement is beautiful.

example.ex: ...an artistic arrangement of stone paving.
example.tran: 石子路的精美图案

example.ex: ...artistically carved garden ornaments.
example.tran: 精雕细琢的庭园装饰物

example.ex: ...vegetarian dishes which can be presented artistically.
example.tran: 可以做得很精美的素菜

sense.def: Artistry is the creative skill of an artist, writer, actor, or musician.

example.ex: ...his artistry as a cellist.
example.tran: 他作为大提琴演奏家的艺术造诣

example.ex: ...portrait sculptors of considerable skill and artistry.
example.tran: 具有高超技巧和艺术造诣的人像雕塑家

sense.def: You can use artistry to refer to a high level of skill in a sport or activity.

example.ex: John McEnroe beat Jimmy Connors with the most complete display of artistry the game had ever seen...
example.tran: 约翰·麦肯罗将球技发挥得淋漓尽致，从而击败了吉米·康纳斯，这在比赛中前所未见。

example.ex: Tea processing requires both technique and artistry.
example.tran: 茶叶加工对工艺和手法都有要求。

sense.def: Someone who is artless is simple and honest, and does not think of deceiving other people.
sense.tran: 单纯的；诚实的；不耍手段的

example.ex: She was curiously artless.
example.tran: 她单纯得令人难以置信。

example.ex: ...Hemingway's artless air and charming smile.
example.tran: 海明威的纯朴气质和迷人微笑

sense.def: Art Nouveau is a style of decoration and architecture that was common in the 1890s. It is characterized by flowing lines and patterns of flowers and leaves.
sense.tran: 新艺术（19世纪90年代盛行的装饰和建筑风格）

example.ex: ...the Art Nouveau posters of Alphonse Mucha...
example.tran: 阿方斯·穆哈的新艺术海报画

example.ex: We lunched at the stunning art nouveau Café American.
example.tran: 我们在一家装饰精美的具有新艺术风格的美国咖啡屋吃的午饭。

sense.def: Artsy means the same as arty .
Artwork is drawings and photographs that are prepared in order to be included in something such as a book or advertisement.

example.ex: The artwork for the LP was done by Bill Hofstadter.
example.tran: 林肯公园的广告插图出自比尔·霍夫斯塔特之手。

sense.def: Artworks are paintings or sculptures which are of high quality.

example.ex: The museum contains 6,000 contemporary and modern artworks.
example.tran: 博物馆收藏了6,000件近现代艺术作品。

example.ex: ...a magnificent collection of priceless artwork.
example.tran: 令人叹为观止的价值连城的艺术收藏品

sense.def: Someone who is arty seems very interested in drama, film, music, poetry, or painting. People often describe someone as arty when they want to suggest that the person is pretentious.
sense.tran: 附庸风雅的;装作对艺术感兴趣的

example.ex: Didn't you find her a little bit too arty?
example.tran: 你不觉得她有点太附庸风雅了吗？

example.ex: ...an arty French film.
example.tran: 一部附庸风雅的法国电影

sense.def: If you describe someone as arty-farty, you are criticizing them for being interested in artistic ideas or activities that most people do not think are interesting or worthwhile.

example.ex: ...money wasted on elitist arty-farty groups.
example.tran: 浪费在附庸风雅的精英团体上的钱

example.ex: ...an artsy-fartsy pretentious film.
example.tran: 矫揉造作、附庸风雅的影片

menu-item.item: USED WITH OTHER PREPOSITIONS ACE7AND CONJUNCTIONS
menu-item.tran: 与其他介词或连词连用

sense.def: If something happens as something else happens, it happens at the same time.
sense.tran: （表示两件事情同时发生）当…的时候，在…的同时

example.ex: Another policeman has been injured as fighting continued this morning...
example.tran: 今早又有一名警员在冲突中受伤。

example.ex: All the jury's eyes were on him as he continued...
example.tran: 在他继续陈述的时候，全体陪审员的目光都集中在他身上。

example.ex: The play started as I got there.
example.tran: 我到那里的时候演出开始了。

sense.def: You use the structure as...as when you are comparing things.

example.ex: I never went through a final exam that was as difficult as that one...
example.tran: 我从来没有碰到过像那次那么难的期末考试。

example.ex: There was no obvious reason why this could not be as good a film as the original.
example.tran: 找不出明显的理由来解释为什么这部片子拍得不如原先的好。

example.ex: Being a mother isn't as bad as I thought at first!...
example.tran: 做母亲并不像我一开始想的那样糟！

example.ex: I don't think he was ever as fit as he should have been.
example.tran: 我认为他本该更健康的。

sense.def: You use as...as to emphasize amounts of something.

example.ex: You can look forward to a significant cash return by saving from as little as £10 a month...
example.tran: 只要每个月存下区区10英镑，你就有希望得到相当可观的现金收益。

example.ex: She gets as many as eight thousand letters a month.
example.tran: 她一个月里收到的信件多达8,000封。

sense.def: You use as when you are indicating what someone or something is or is thought to be, or what function they have.

example.ex: He has worked as a diplomat in the US, Sudan and Saudi Arabia...
example.tran: 他曾任驻美国、苏丹和沙特阿拉伯的外交官。

example.ex: The news apparently came as a complete surprise...
example.tran: 这个消息显然让人大吃一惊。

example.ex: I had natural ability as a footballer.
example.tran: 我天生就是当足球运动员的料。

sense.def: If you do something as a child or as a teenager, for example, you do it when you are a child or a teenager.

example.ex: She loved singing as a child and started vocal training at 12.
example.tran: 她从小就喜欢唱歌，12岁开始了声乐训练。

sense.def: You use as to say how something happens or is done, or to indicate that something happens or is done in the same way as something else.

example.ex: I'll behave toward them as I would like to be treated...
example.tran: 我会以希望别人对待我的方式来对待他们。

example.ex: Today, as usual, he was wearing a three-piece suit...
example.tran: 像往常一样，他今天穿的是三件套。

example.ex: The book was banned in the US, as were two subsequent books.
example.tran: 这本书在美国遭禁，随后出版的两本也是一样。

sense.def: You use as in expressions like as a result and as a consequence to indicate how two situations or events are related to each other.

example.ex: As a result of the growing fears about home security, more people are arranging for someone to stay in their home when they're away...
example.tran: 因为越来越担心住宅安全，更多的人在出门的时候会在家中留人。

example.ex: In this changing business environment, different demands are being placed on employees. As a consequence, the education system needs to change.
example.tran: 在当今变幻莫测的商业环境下，员工被提出各种不同的要求。因此，教育体系有必要随之改变。

sense.def: You use as to introduce short clauses which comment on the truth of what you are saying.

example.ex: As you can see, we're still working...
example.tran: 如你所见，我们仍在工作。

example.ex: We were sitting, as I remember, in a riverside restaurant.
example.tran: 我记得我们当时是坐在一个河畔的餐馆里。

sense.def: You can use as to mean 'because' when you are explaining the reason for something.

example.ex: They are regularly sent booklets about personal safety, but they barely read them as they have so much paperwork to deal with...
example.tran: 他们经常会收到关于人身安全问题的宣传册，但因为大量文案工作缠身，他们几乎无暇阅读。

example.ex: Enjoy the first hour of the day. This is important as it sets the mood for the rest of the day.
example.tran: 好好享受每天的第一个小时。这之所以重要是因为它会决定你一整天的心情。

boxu.usage: You can use as, because, since, or for to give an explanation for something. Because is the commonest of these, and is used when answering a question beginning with 'why?'.You can use as or since instead of because to introduce a clause containing a reason for something, especially in writing. ...a note about The National Portrait Gallery, as the word 'Gallery' can be misleading... Since the juice is quite strong, you should always dilute it. In stories, for is sometimes used to explain or justify something. He seemed to be in need of company, for he suddenly went back into the house. Note that because is a conjunction, and is used to link two ideas within one sentence. I'm unsocial, because of my deafness.
boxu.tran: as, because, since 和 for 都可以表示“因为”。because 最常用，往往用来回答以why开头的疑问句。as 和 since 尤用于书面语中，可以代替 because 引导原因从句。如：a note about The National Portrait Gallery, as the word ‘Gallery’can be misleading（对 The National Portrait Gallery 的注释，因为 Gallery 一词易产生歧义），Since the juice is quite strong, you should always dilute it（这果汁很浓，你应该把它冲淡一些）。在讲故事时，for 用来解释或证明某事。如：He seemed to be in need of company, for suddenly he went back into the house （他看上去需要有个伴，因为他突然又回到屋里去了）。注意，because是连词，用于连接一个句子中的两个部分，如：I’m unsocial, because of my deafness （由于失聪，我不喜欢社交）。

phrase.def: You say as it were in order to make what you are saying sound less definite.

example.ex: I'd understood the words, but I didn't, as it were, understand the question.
example.tran: 字面的意思我懂了，但是可以说我并不能理解这个问题。

phrase.def: You use expressions such as as it is ,as it turns out, and as things stand when you are making a contrast between a possible situation and what actually happened or is the case.
phrase.tran: 事实上，实际上（表示实际情况和可能情况的对比）

example.ex: I want to work at home on a Tuesday but as it turns out sometimes it's a Wednesday or a Thursday.
example.tran: 我想周二在家工作，但实际上有时却是周三或是周四。

sense.def: You use as for and as to at the beginning of a sentence in order to introduce a slightly different subject that is still connected to the previous one.

example.ex: I feel that there's a lot of pressure put on policemen. And as for putting guns in their hands, I don't think that's a very good idea at all.
example.tran: 我觉得给警员的压力太大了。至于让他们佩枪，我并不认为是一个明智之举。

sense.def: You use as to to indicate what something refers to.

example.ex: They should make decisions as to whether the student needs more help...
example.tran: 他们应该决定学生是否需要更多的帮助。

example.ex: Andy sat down at the table and inquired as to what the problem was.
example.tran: 安迪在桌边落座，询问出了什么问题。

sense.def: If you say that something will happen as of, or in British English as from, a particular date or time, you mean that it will happen from that time on.

example.ex: The border, effectively closed since 1981, will be opened as of January the 1st...
example.tran: 实质上从1981年就已关闭的边境将于1月1日开放。

example.ex: She is to retire as from 1 October.
example.tran: 她将于10月1日退休。

sense.def: You use as if and as though when you are giving a possible explanation for something or saying that something appears to be the case when it is not.

example.ex: Anne shrugged, as if she didn't know...
example.tran: 安妮耸了耸肩，好像她并不知晓。

example.ex: He burst into a high-pitched laugh, as though he'd said something funny.
example.tran: 他突然放声大笑，好像讲了什么好笑的事似的。

sense.def: asap is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'as soon as possible'.

example.ex: The colonel ordered, 'I want two good engines down here asap.'
example.tran: 上校命令道：“尽快给我找两台性能好的发动机来。”

sense.def: Asbestos is a grey material which does not burn and which has been used as a protection against fire or heat.

An ASBO is a legal order restricting the activities or movements of someone who has repeatedly behaved in a way that upsets or annoys other people. ASBO is an abbreviation for（缩略=）'anti-social behaviour order'.

example.ex: Breach of an ASBO is a criminal offence.
example.tran: 违反反社会行为令是刑事犯罪。

sense.def: If you ascend a hill or staircase, you go up it.

example.ex: Mrs Clayton had to hold Lizzie's hand as they ascended the steps...
example.tran: 拾级而上的时候克莱顿夫人不得不抓着莉齐的手。

example.ex: Then we ascend steeply through forests of rhododendron.
example.tran: 然后我们在杜鹃花丛中沿着陡坡向上爬。

sense.def: If a staircase or path ascends, it leads up to a higher position.

example.ex: A number of staircases ascend from the cobbled streets onto the ramparts.
example.tran: 一段石阶从鹅卵石路上一直向上直通城墙。

example.ex: ...an ascending spiral path leading to a tower.
example.tran: 螺旋上升的通向一座塔的路

sense.def: If something ascends, it moves up, usually vertically or into the air.

example.ex: Keep the drill steady while it ascends and descends...
example.tran: 打钻和提钻时要保持钻头平稳。

example.ex: Nott and Dickinson set a new altitude record when they ascended 55,900 feet in their balloon.
example.tran: 诺特和迪金森乘坐热气球上升了55，900英尺，创造了一项新的高度纪录。

sense.def: If someone ascends to an important position, they achieve it or are appointed to it. When someone ascends a throne, they become king, queen, or pope.
sense.tran: 升迁；升职；(君主)登基,即位

example.ex: ...the same year he ascended to power...
example.tran: 同年，他上台掌权。

example.ex: Before ascending to the bench, she was a lawyer in a large New York firm.
example.tran: 在升为法官之前，她是纽约一家大型律所的律师。

example.ex: ...a few years before Sixtus V ascended the papal throne.
example.tran: 在西克斯图斯五世登上教皇宝座的几年之前

sense.def: If you ascend in your career or in society, you gradually achieve success or a higher status.

example.ex: Mobutu ascended through the ranks, eventually becoming commander of the army...
example.tran: 蒙博托出身行伍，通过一级级晋升，最终成为了陆军司令。

example.ex: They move freely from one department to another as they ascend the civil service ladder.
example.tran: 随着仕途晋升，他们可以在部门间随意调动。

sense.def: In some religions, when someone's soul goes to heaven, you can say that they ascend to heaven.
sense.tran: （在某些宗教中指灵魂）升天，进入天堂

example.ex: ...the belief that the souls of the faithful and virtuous would ascend to heaven.
example.tran: 虔诚和善良的灵魂会升入天堂的信仰

sense.def: If something or someone ascends to a higher level, they reach a state that is better than the one they were in before.

example.ex: The story ascends from a gothic tragedy to a miraculous fairy-tale.
example.tran: 故事从一个哥特式悲剧升华为神奇的童话。

sense.def: If one group has ascendancy over another group, it has more power or influence than the other group.

example.ex: Although geographically linked, the two provinces have long fought for political ascendancy...
example.tran: 尽管在地理上彼此依存，两省却长期为获取政治支配权你争我夺。

example.ex: The extremists are gaining ascendancy.
example.tran: 极端分子正逐渐占据上风。

sense.def: If someone or something is in the ascendant, they have or are getting more power, influence, or popularity than other people or things.
sense.tran: 权势日隆;影响变大;日益受欢迎

example.ex: Radical reformers are once more in the ascendant...
example.tran: 激进派改革者再度占据了统治地位。

example.ex: Why are Geography, Drama, Art and English in the ascendant?
example.tran: 为什么地理、戏剧、艺术和英语逐渐受宠？

sense.def: If a group of things is arranged in ascending order, each thing is bigger, greater, or more important than the thing before it.

example.ex: Now draw or trace ten dinosaurs in ascending order of size.
example.tran: 现在按照体型由小到大的顺序画出或是临摹出10只恐龙。

example.ex: ...an ascending spiral of antisocial behaviour.
example.tran: 反社会行为盘旋上升的态势

sense.def: In some religions, when someone goes to heaven, you can refer to their ascension to heaven.

example.ex: ...the crucifixion, resurrection and ascension of Jesus Christ.
example.tran: 耶稣基督的受难、复活和升天

example.ex: ...the two-day holiday marking the Prophet's ascension to heaven.
example.tran: 纪念先知穆罕默德升天的双休假日

sense.hdgr:
with poss, usu N
to n
sense.def: The ascension of a person to a high rank or important position is the act of reaching this position.

example.ex: ...50 years after his ascension to the Cambodian throne.
example.tran: 在他登上柬埔寨王位50年后

sense.def: An ascent is an upward journey, especially when you are walking or climbing.

example.ex: In 1955 he led the first ascent of Kangchenjunga, the world's third highest mountain.
example.tran: 他于1955年带队首攀世界第三高峰——干城章嘉峰。

sense.def: An ascent is an upward slope or path, especially when you are walking or climbing.

example.ex: It was a tough course over a gradual ascent before the big climb of Bluebell Hill.
example.tran: 在爬崎岖的蓝钟山之前有一段很难走的上行缓坡路。

sense.def: An ascent is an upward, vertical movement.

example.ex: Burke pushed the button and the elevator began its slow ascent.
example.tran: 伯克按下按钮，电梯开始缓缓上升。

sense.def: The ascent of a person to a more important or successful position is the process of reaching this position.

example.ex: His own career continues its inexorable ascent...
example.tran: 他事业的上升势头锐不可当。

example.ex: It would be wrong to portray his life as a calculated ascent to power at any cost.
example.tran: 如果把他的一生描述成不惜任何代价一心想向上爬，那就错了。

sense.def: In some religions, when someone goes to heaven, you can refer to their ascent to heaven.

example.ex: ...Elijah's ascent to heaven in a chariot of fire.
example.tran: 以利亚乘着烈火熊熊的战车升天了

sense.def: If you ascertain the truth about something, you find out what it is, especially by making a deliberate effort to do so.
sense.tran: （尤指经过努力后）查明，弄清，确定

example.ex: Through doing this, the teacher will be able to ascertain the extent to which the child understands what he is reading...
example.tran: 这样一来，老师就能确定孩子们对他所读的内容理解多少了。

example.ex: Once they had ascertained that he was not a spy, they agreed to release him...
example.tran: 一旦确认他并非间谍，他们即同意将他释放。

example.ex: Take time to ascertain what services your bank is providing, and at what cost.
example.tran: 花些时间确认一下你的银行会提供什么样的服务，费用是多少。

sense.def: An ascetic person has a way of life that is simple and strict, usually because of their religious beliefs.
sense.tran: （通常因为宗教信仰）苦行的，禁欲的

example.ex: She has never been close to her ascetic, workaholic father.
example.tran: 她从来没有和她那个清心寡欲、只顾工作的父亲亲近过。

example.ex: ...priests practising an ascetic life.
example.tran: 过着苦行修道生活的教士们

example.ex: ...his bony, ascetic face.
example.tran: 他瘦削的像苦行僧一样的脸庞

posc.def: An ascetic is someone who is ascetic.
posc.tran: 苦行者;禁欲者;生活清苦的人

example.ex: He left the luxuries of the court for the life of an ascetic.
example.tran: 他放弃了宫廷的奢华，过起了清贫的生活。

sense.def: Asceticism is a simple, strict way of life with no luxuries or physical pleasures.
Ascorbic acid is another name for vitamin C.
If you ascribe an event or condition to a particular cause, you say or consider that it was caused by that thing.

example.ex: An autopsy eventually ascribed the baby's death to sudden infant death syndrome.
example.tran: 尸检最终认定孩子死于婴儿猝死综合征。

sense.def: If you ascribe a quality to someone, you consider that they possess it.
sense.tran: 认为是…的特点;认为…具有

example.ex: We do not ascribe a superior wisdom to government or the state.
example.tran: 我们并不认为政府或是国家有超凡的智慧。

sense.def: If you ascribe something such as a quotation or a work of art to someone, you say that they said it or created it.

example.ex: He mistakenly ascribes the expression 'survival of the fittest' to Charles Darwin.
example.tran: 他错误地认为“适者生存”是查尔斯·达尔文说的。

sense.def: Something that is asexual involves no sexual activity.
sense.tran: 无性的；非性的；与性无关的

example.ex: Their relationship was totally asexual.
example.tran: 他们之间的关系根本与性无关。

example.ex: ...asexual reproduction.
example.tran: 无性繁殖

rnon.hdgr: usu ADV with v, also ADV adj

example.ex: Many fungi can reproduce asexually.
example.tran: 许多真菌可以无性繁殖。

sense.def: Asexual creatures and plants have no sexual organs.

example.ex: ...asexual parasites.
example.tran: 无性器官的寄生虫

sense.def: Someone who is asexual is not sexually attracted to other people.

example.ex: It is another unfortunate myth of our culture that older people are asexual.
example.tran: 我们的文化里还有一种错误观念，就是认为上了年纪的人就不再有性欲了。

sense.def: Ash is the grey or black powdery substance that is left after something is burnt. You can also refer to this substance as ashes .

example.ex: A cloud of volcanic ash is spreading across wide areas of the Philippines...
example.tran: 火山灰云层正在菲律宾大范围扩散。

example.ex: He brushed the cigarette ash from his sleeve...
example.tran: 他掸掉了袖子上的烟灰。

example.ex: He ordered their villages burned to ashes.
example.tran: 他下令将他们的村庄烧成灰烬。

sense.def: A dead person's ashes are their remains after their body has been cremated.
An ash is a tree that has smooth grey bark and loses its leaves in winter.

example.ex: ...a high forest of oak and ash.
example.tran: 生长着橡树和白蜡树的高山林

posc.def: Ash is the wood from this tree.

example.ex: The rafters are made from ash.
example.tran: 椽是用木做的。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, usu ADJ
of/about n, ADJ that
sense.def: If someone is ashamed, they feel embarrassed or guilty because of something they do or they have done, or because of their appearance.

example.ex: I felt incredibly ashamed of myself for getting so angry...
example.tran: 我对自己发那么大的火而深感惭愧。

example.ex: She was ashamed that she looked so shabby...
example.tran: 她因为自己衣衫褴褛而感到无地自容。

example.ex: I'm a lesbian and I'm not ashamed about it.
example.tran: 我是个女同性恋，但我并不为此感到羞耻。

sense.def: If you are ashamed of someone, you feel embarrassed to be connected with them, often because of their appearance or because you disapprove of something they have done.
sense.tran: （为…）感到羞耻的，感到难为情的

example.ex: I've never told this to anyone, but it's true, I was terribly ashamed of my mum.
example.tran: 这件事我从来没告诉过别人，但是我真的为我妈感到很害臊。

sense.def: If someone is ashamed to do something, they do not want to do it because they feel embarrassed about it.
sense.tran: 羞于…的；因尴尬而不愿…的

example.ex: Women are often ashamed to admit they are being abused.
example.tran: 妇女对受到的侵犯常常羞于承认。

sense.def: Someone who is ashen looks very pale, especially because they are ill, shocked, or frightened.
sense.tran: （尤指因为生病、震惊或受到惊吓）脸色苍白的，面如死灰的

example.ex: He was ashen and trembling...
example.tran: 他脸色苍白，浑身发抖。

example.ex: He fell back, shocked, his face ashen.
example.tran: 他吓得往后退了一步，面如死灰。

sense.def: Someone who is ashen-faced looks very pale, especially because they are ill, shocked, or frightened.
sense.tran: （尤指因为生病、震惊或受到惊吓）面如土色的，没有血色的

example.ex: The survivors were ashen-faced and visibly shaken.
example.tran: 生还者们面色惨白，看起来仍然惊魂未定。

sense.def: Someone or something that comes ashore comes from the sea onto the shore.

example.ex: Oil has come ashore on a ten mile stretch to the east of Plymouth...
example.tran: 绵延10英里的浮油已经到达了普利茅斯东岸。

example.ex: Once ashore, the vessel was thoroughly inspected.
example.tran: 船只刚一靠岸就接受了彻底检查。

sense.def: An ashtray is a small dish in which smokers can put the ash from their cigarettes and cigars.
Ash Wednesday is the first day of Lent.
sense.tran: 圣灰星期三，大斋首日（四旬斋的第一天）

sense.def: Someone or something that is Asian comes from or is associated with Asia. British people use this term especially to refer to India, Pakistan, and Bangladesh. Americans use this term especially to refer to China, Korea, Thailand, Japan, or Vietnam.
sense.tran: 亚洲人的，亚洲的（英国人尤用此词指称印度、巴基斯坦和孟加拉，美国人尤用此词指称中国、朝鲜、韩国、泰国、日本和越南）

example.ex: ...Asian music.
example.tran: 亚洲音乐

example.ex: ...the Asian community in San Francisco.
example.tran: 旧金山的亚洲人社区

posc.def: An Asian is a person who comes from or is associated with a country or region in Asia.

example.ex: Many of the shops were run by Asians.
example.tran: 许多商店都是亚洲人经营的。

sense.def: Asiatic means belonging or relating to Asia or its people.

example.ex: ...his placid Asiatic face.
example.tran: 他那张安详的亚洲人的脸庞

sense.def: The A-side of a record that has been released as a single is the main song on it. You can also refer to the side of the record that contains this song as the A-side .
sense.tran: 主打歌曲；打榜歌曲；（唱片）包含主打歌曲的一面

boxx.note: In addition to the uses shown below, aside is used in phrasal verbs such as ‘cast aside’, ‘stand aside’, and ‘step aside’.
boxx.tran: 除下列用法外，aside 还可用于cast aside, stand aside 和 step aside等短语动词中。

sense.def: If you move something aside, you move it to one side of you.

example.ex: Sarah closed the book and laid it aside.
example.tran: 萨拉合上书，把它放在了一边。

sense.def: If you take or draw someone aside, you take them a little way away from a group of people in order to talk to them in private.

example.ex: Billy Ewing grabbed him by the elbow and took him aside...
example.tran: 比利·尤因拉着他的胳膊肘把他带到了一边。

example.ex: Will put his arm around her shoulders and drew her aside.
example.tran: 威尔一只胳膊搂着她的肩膀，把她拉到了一边。

sense.def: If you move aside, you get out of someone's way.

example.ex: She had been standing in the doorway, but now she stepped aside to let them pass.
example.tran: 她一直在门口站着，但是现在闪到了一边，让他们过去了。

sense.def: If you set something such as time, money, or space aside for a particular purpose, you save it and do not use it for anything else.

example.ex: She wants to put her pocket-money aside for holidays.
example.tran: 她想把零花钱攒起来用于度假。

example.ex: ...the ground set aside for the new cathedral.
example.tran: 为建新的大教堂留出的空地

sense.def: If you brush or sweep aside a feeling or suggestion, you reject it.

example.ex: Talk to a friend who will really listen and not brush aside your feelings...
example.tran: 和一个能真正倾听你诉说并重视你感受的朋友谈谈。

example.ex: The Prime Minister swept aside concern about the rising cost of mortgages.
example.tran: 首相对按揭费用上涨的忧虑置之不理。

sense.def: You use aside to indicate that you have finished talking about something, or that you are leaving it out of your discussion, and that you are about to talk about something else.

example.ex: Leaving aside the tiny minority who are clinically depressed, most people who have bad moods also have very good moods...
example.tran: 撇开极少数临床抑郁症患者不谈，大多数情绪低落的人也有心情非常愉快的时候。

example.ex: Emotional arguments aside, here are the facts.
example.tran: 撇开那些情绪化的争论不谈，下面只说客观事实。

sense.def: An aside is a comment that a character in a play makes to the audience, which the other characters are supposed not to be able to hear.

example.ex: Exasperated with her children, she rolls her eyes and mutters an aside to the camera, 'No wonder I drink!'
example.tran: 在被她的孩子们激怒后，她翻了一下白眼对着镜头嘀咕道，“难怪我会酗酒！”

sense.def: An aside is something that you say that is not directly connected with what you are talking about.

example.ex: The pace of the book is leisurely, with enjoyable literary and historical asides.
example.tran: 这本书节奏明快，另外还穿插了一些趣味盎然的文史掌故。

sense.def: Aside from means the same as apart from. This form is more usual in American English.
sense.tran: 同apart from（通常用于美国英语）

sense.def: If you describe something or someone as asinine, you mean that they are very foolish.

example.ex: ...an asinine discussion.
example.tran: 愚蠢透顶的讨论

sense.def: If you ask someone something, you say something to them in the form of a question because you want to know the answer.

example.ex: 'How is Frank?' he asked...
example.tran: “弗兰克怎么样了？”他问道。

example.ex: I asked him his name...
example.tran: 我询问了他的名字。

example.ex: I wasn't the only one asking questions...
example.tran: 不只是我一个人提出了问题。

example.ex: She asked me if I'd enjoyed my dinner...
example.tran: 她问我晚餐是否吃得满意。

example.ex: If Daniel asks what happened in court we will tell him...
example.tran: 如果丹尼尔问起庭审情况，我们会告诉他。

example.ex: You will have to ask David about that...
example.tran: 那件事你得问戴维。

example.ex: 'I'm afraid to ask what it cost.' — 'Then don't ask.'
example.tran: “我不敢问这个东西花了多少钱。”——“那就别问了。”

sense.def: If you ask someone to do something, you tell them that you want them to do it.

example.ex: We had to ask him to leave...
example.tran: 我们不得不要求他离开。

example.ex: She said she had been asked to take two suitcases to Africa by a man called Sean.
example.tran: 她说有个名叫肖恩的男人要她带两个手提箱去非洲。

sense.def: If you ask to do something, you tell someone that you want to do it.

example.ex: I asked to see the Director.
example.tran: 我要求见主任。

sense.def: If you ask for something, you say that you would like it.

example.ex: I decided to go to the next house and ask for food...
example.tran: 我决定去隔壁那家要点吃的。

example.ex: Who asked for your opinion?
example.tran: 谁问你的意见了？

sense.def: If you ask for someone, you say that you would like to speak to them.

example.ex: There's a man at the gate asking for you.
example.tran: 门口有个人想见你。

sense.def: If you ask someone's permission, opinion, or forgiveness, you try to obtain it by putting a request to them.
sense.tran: 请求，征求（许可、意见、谅解）

example.ex: Please ask permission from whoever pays the phone bill before making your call.
example.tran: 打电话前请先征得话费支付方的同意。

sense.def: If you ask someone to an event or place, you invite them to go there.

example.ex: Couldn't you ask Jon to the party?...
example.tran: 你不能邀请乔恩参加聚会吗？

example.ex: She asked me back to her house.
example.tran: 她又邀请我去了她家。

sense.def: If someone is asking a particular price for something, they are selling it for that price.

example.ex: Mr Pantelaras was asking £6,000 for his collection.
example.tran: 潘特莱拉斯先生为他的藏品要价6,000英镑。

sense.def: You reply 'don't ask me' when you do not know the answer to a question, usually when you are annoyed or surprised that you have been asked.
sense.tran: （通常用于表示对询问感到恼怒或惊讶）不要问我

example.ex: 'She's got other things on her mind, wouldn't you think?' 'Don't ask me,' murmured Chris. 'I've never met her.'
example.tran: “她还有别的心事，你不觉得吗？”“别问我，”克里斯嘀咕道，“我从未见过她。”

sense.def: If something is yours for the asking, you could get it very easily if you wanted to.
sense.tran: 只要开口（便可得到）；唾手可得

example.ex: He knew the nomination was his for the asking.
example.tran: 他知道只要他开口就能得到那项提名。

sense.def: If you say 'I ask you', you are emphasizing how much you disapprove of someone or something.
sense.tran: （强调反对）请问，真是，这还了得

example.ex: That silly old bat. I ask you, who'd she think she was?
example.tran: 那个老蠢货。我倒要问一问，她以为她是谁呀？

phrase.def: You can say 'may I ask' as a formal way of asking a question, which shows you are annoyed or suspicious about something.
phrase.tran: （一种正式的询问方式，表示感到困扰或心生疑虑）请问

example.ex: May I ask where you're going, sir?
example.tran: 先生，请问您要去哪？

phrase.def: You can say 'if you ask me' to emphasize that you are stating your personal opinion.

example.ex: He was nuts, if you ask me.
example.tran: 要我说的话，他是个疯子。

phrase.def: If you say that someone is asking for trouble or is asking for it, you mean that they are behaving in a way that makes it very likely that they will get into trouble.

example.ex: To go ahead with the match after such clear advice had been asking for trouble.
example.tran: 都劝说得这么明白了还要继续比赛，这简直就是自讨苦吃。

sense.def: If someone asks after you, they ask someone how you are.

example.ex: I had a letter from Jane. She asks after you.
example.tran: 我收到了一封简写来的信。她向你问好。

phvb.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 ask round

sense.def: If you ask around or ask round, you ask several people a question.

example.ex: Ask around to see what others living in your area think about their doctors.
example.tran: 打听一下你那片的居民对他们的医生都有什么看法。

sense.hdgr:
V inflects, usu PHR
at n
sense.def: If you look askance at someone or something, you have a doubtful or suspicious attitude towards them.

example.ex: They have always looked askance at the western notion of democracy.
example.tran: 他们一直都怀疑西方的民主观。

sense.hdgr:
V inflects, usu PHR
at n
sense.def: If you look askance at someone, you look at them in a doubtful or suspicious way.

example.ex: 'Do you play chess?' he asked, looking askance at Miguel.
example.tran: “你会下棋吗？”他斜睨着米格尔问道。

sense.def: Something that is askew is not straight or not level with what it should be level with.

example.ex: She stood there, hat askew...
example.tran: 她站在那里，歪戴着帽子。

example.ex: There were no shutters at the windows, and some of the doors hung askew.
example.tran: 窗户上没有百叶窗，有几扇门也歪歪扭扭的。

sense.def: The asking price of something is the price which the person selling it says that they want for it, although they may accept less.

example.ex: Offers 15% below the asking price are unlikely to be accepted.
example.tran: 低于要价15％的报价不大可能被接受。

sense.def: Someone who is asleep is sleeping.

example.ex: My four year-old daughter was asleep on the sofa.
example.tran: 我4岁的女儿在沙发上睡着了。

phrase.def: When you fall asleep, you start sleeping.

example.ex: Sam snuggled down in his pillow and fell asleep.
example.tran: 萨姆舒服地枕着枕头进入了梦乡。

phrase.def: Someone who is fast asleep or sound asleep is sleeping deeply.

example.ex: They were both fast asleep in their cots...
example.tran: 他们俩在婴儿床上酣睡着。

example.ex: Turning over, she was soon sound asleep again.
example.tran: 她翻了个身，很快又沉沉睡去。

sense.def: Asparagus is a vegetable that is long and green and has small shoots at one end. It is cooked and served whole.
An aspect of something is one of the parts of its character or nature.

example.ex: Climate and weather affect every aspect of our lives...
example.tran: 气候和天气影响着我们生活的方方面面。

example.ex: He was interested in all aspects of the work here...
example.tran: 他对这里工作的所有方面都感兴趣。

example.ex: Monroe described the financial aspect as crucial.
example.tran: 门罗认为金融方面至关重要。

sense.def: The aspect of a building or window is the direction in which it faces.

example.ex: The house had a south-west aspect.
example.tran: 这幢房子面向西南。

sense.def: If something begins to have a new aspect, it begins to have a new appearance or quality.

example.ex: Our journey had taken on a new aspect. The countryside was no longer familiar...
example.tran: 我们所到之地呈现出一派新景象。乡村变得不再熟悉。

example.ex: The snowy street, like the church, assumed a dumb, lifeless aspect.
example.tran: 积雪覆盖的街道就像教堂一样，显得沉闷、毫无生气。

sense.def: In grammar, aspect is the way that a verb group shows whether an activity is continuing, is repeated, or is completed. For example, in 'They were laughing', the verb is in the progressive aspect and shows that the action was continuing.
An aspen is a tall tree with leaves that move a lot in the wind.
If you say something with asperity, you say it impatiently and severely.

example.ex: 'I told you Preskel had no idea,' remarked Kemp with some asperity.
example.tran: “我告诉过你普雷斯克毫不知情的，”肯普颇为不耐烦地说道。

sense.hdgr:
V inflects, usu PHR
on n
sense.def: If you cast aspersions on someone or something, you suggest that they are not very good in some way.

example.ex: He has flatly denied casting aspersions on the rabbi's behaviour.
example.tran: 他已断然否认曾对拉比的行为进行过诋毁。

sense.def: Asphalt is a black substance used to make the surfaces of things such as roads and playgrounds.

example.ex: ...the school's asphalt driveway.
example.tran: 学校的柏油车道

sense.def: Asphyxia is death or loss of consciousness caused by being unable to breathe properly.

example.ex: Death was due to asphyxia through smoke inhalation.
example.tran: 死亡是吸入浓烟窒息导致的。

sense.def: If someone is asphyxiated, they die or lose consciousness because they are unable to breathe properly.

example.ex: Three people were asphyxiated in the crush for last week's train...
example.tran: 在上周的火车撞车事故中有3人窒息死亡。

example.ex: John Doe died in his bath, asphyxiated by the fumes from a gas water-heater.
example.tran: 一名男子死于浴室中，死因是吸入燃气热水器中排出的气体导致窒息。

example.ex: A post mortem examination found that she died from asphyxiation.
example.tran: 尸检结果发现她死于窒息。

sense.def: Aspic is a clear shiny jelly made from meat juices. It is used in making cold savoury meat dishes.

example.ex: ...cold chicken in aspic.
example.tran: 鸡肉冻

sense.def: Someone who is an aspirant to political power or to an important job has a strong desire to achieve it.
sense.tran: 有抱负者；（政治权力或重要职位的）追求者；雄心勃勃的人

example.ex: ...the young aspirant to power...
example.tran: 追逐权势的年轻人

example.ex: Any aspirant to the presidency here must be seriously rich...
example.tran: 要想当这儿的主席一定要家财万贯。

example.ex: He is among the few aspirants with administrative experience.
example.tran: 他是为数不多的几个志向远大而且有管理经验的人之一。

sense.def: Aspirant means the same as aspiring .

example.ex: ...aspirant politicians.
example.tran: 野心勃勃的政客们

sense.def: Some-one's aspirations are their desire to achieve things.

example.ex: ...the needs and aspirations of our pupils...
example.tran: 我们的学生的需要和志向

example.ex: He is unlikely to send in the army to quell nationalist aspirations.
example.tran: 他不可能派兵去扼杀民族主义理想。

example.ex: ...the republic's aspiration to statehood.
example.tran: 共和国想成为独立国家的愿望

sense.def: If you describe someone as aspirational, you mean that they have strong hopes of moving to a higher social status.
sense.tran: 有志向的；有抱负的；一心想出人头地的

example.ex: ...the typical tensions of an aspirational household.
example.tran: 在一心想要飞黄腾达的家庭中典型的紧张关系

sense.def: If you describe a product as aspirational, you mean that it is bought or enjoyed by people who have strong hopes of moving to a higher social class.
sense.tran: （产品）励志的，激励人心的，受到志向远大者欣赏的

example.ex: Fine music, particularly opera, has become aspirational, like fine wine or foreign travel.
example.tran: 高雅音乐，特别是歌剧，就像佳酿或出境游一样受到志存高远者的青睐。

sense.def: If you aspire to something such as an important job, you have a strong desire to achieve it.

example.ex: ...people who aspire to public office...
example.tran: 渴望担任公职的人

example.ex: They aspired to be gentlemen, though they fell far short of the ideal.
example.tran: 他们想要成为君子，虽然离这个理想还差得很远。

sense.def: Aspirin is a mild drug which reduces pain and fever.
If you use aspiring to describe someone who is starting a particular career, you mean that they are trying to become successful in it.

example.ex: Many aspiring young artists are advised to learn by copying the masters.
example.tran: 许多胸怀抱负的年轻画家被建议通过临摹大师的作品来学习绘画。

sense.def: An ass is an animal which is related to a horse but which is smaller and has long ears.
If you describe someone as an ass, you think that they are silly or do silly things.

example.ex: He was generally disliked and regarded as a pompous ass.
example.tran: 他常不招人待见，而且被看作是个自负的大傻帽儿。

sense.def: Your ass is your bottom.

entry.boxr: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 arse bum

phrase.def: To kick ass or to kick someone's ass means to show them that you are angry with them, either by telling them or by using physical force.
phrase.tran: （通过语言或暴力）泄愤，发泄不满情绪

example.ex: They've really been kicking ass lately — busting places up, harassing everybody...
example.tran: 他们最近真是让人气不打一处来，闹得天翻地覆，搅得每个人都不得安宁。

example.ex: He damn well better not try it now or he will damn well get his ass kicked.
example.tran: 他最好不要现在就试，否则铁定会被气个半死。

phrase.def: Saying that someone can kiss your ass is a very rude way of expressing anger or disagreement.
phrase.tran: （粗鲁地表示愤怒或异议）去你的，去死

phrase.def: If you say that someone makes an ass of themselves, you mean they behave in a way that you think is very silly.

example.ex: I find no pleasure in seeing people make asses of themselves.
example.tran: 我看见人们出洋相并不幸灾乐祸。

sense.def: If someone assails you, they criticize you strongly.

example.ex: The opposition's newspapers assail the government each day...
example.tran: 反对党的报纸每天都对政府进行猛烈抨击。

example.ex: The labour movement has been assailed by accusations of sexism and demands for change from feminists.
example.tran: 劳工运动遭到女权主义者的猛烈抨击，指责其存在性别歧视，并要求作出改善。

sense.def: If someone assails you, they attack you violently.

example.ex: Dividing his command, Morgan assailed both strongholds at the same time...
example.tran: 摩根派遣部队同时袭击了两个据点。

example.ex: Her husband was assailed by a young man with a knife in a Glasgow park.
example.tran: 她的丈夫在格拉斯哥的一所公园遭到一名持刀年轻男子的袭击。

sense.def: If you are assailed by something unpleasant such as fears or problems, you are greatly troubled by a large number of them.

example.ex: She is assailed by self-doubt and emotional insecurity.
example.tran: 她被自我怀疑和情感上的不安全感所困扰。

sense.def: If you say that a loud sound or a strong smell assails someone's ears or nostrils, you are emphasizing that it is very intense and seems shocking or unpleasant.

example.ex: The scent of burning metal assailed his nostrils.
example.tran: 燃烧的金属的味道刺激着他的嗅觉。

sense.def: Someone's assailant is a person who has physically attacked them.

example.ex: Other party-goers rescued the injured man from his assailant.
example.tran: 其他参加聚会的人把这名伤者从行凶者手中救了出来。

sense.def: An assassin is a person who assassinates someone.

example.ex: He saw the shooting and memorised the number of the assassin's car.
example.tran: 他目睹了枪击过程并记住了刺客的车牌号码。

sense.def: When someone important is assassinated, they are murdered as a political act.

example.ex: Would the USA be radically different today if Kennedy had not been assassinated?...
example.tran: 如果肯尼迪没有被暗杀，今天的美国会有根本性的不同吗？

example.ex: The plot to assassinate Martin Luther King had started long before he was actually killed.
example.tran: 刺杀马丁·路德·金的计划在实施前酝酿已久。

rnon.hdgr:
oft N
of n, N n

example.ex: She would like an investigation into the assassination of her husband...
example.tran: 她希望对她丈夫的遇刺展开调查。

example.ex: He lives in constant fear of assassination.
example.tran: 他一直提心吊胆，害怕被人暗杀。

example.ex: ...an assassination plot.
example.tran: 暗杀阴谋

sense.def: An assault by an army is a strong attack made on an area held by the enemy.

example.ex: The rebels are poised for a new assault on the government garrisons...
example.tran: 叛军准备好要对政府驻军发起新一轮的猛攻。

example.ex: Most US soldiers welcomed the ground assault when the order was finally given.
example.tran: 当命令最终下达的时候，大多数美军士兵都愿意发动地面进攻。

sense.def: Assault weapons such as rifles are intended for soldiers to use in battle rather than for purposes such as hunting.

example.ex: ...a high-powered assault rifle.
example.tran: 大火力军用步枪

sense.def: An assault on a person is a physical attack on them.
sense.tran: 人身攻击；殴打；（身体）侵犯

example.ex: The attack is one of a series of savage sexual assaults on women in the university area...
example.tran: 这次袭击是在大学校园内发生的一系列针对女性的野蛮性侵犯事件中的一起。

example.ex: At the police station, I was charged with assault.
example.tran: 在警察局，我被指控殴打他人。

sense.def: To assault someone means to physically attack them.

example.ex: The gang assaulted him with iron bars...
example.tran: 这伙人用铁棍殴打他。

example.ex: She may have been sexually assaulted by her killer.
example.tran: 她可能遭到过凶手的性侵犯。

sense.def: An assault on someone's beliefs is a strong criticism of them.

example.ex: He leveled a verbal assault against his Democratic opponents.
example.tran: 他猛烈抨击其民主党对手。

sense.def: Assault and battery is the crime of attacking someone and causing them physical harm.
sense.tran: 暴力殴打（罪）；人身攻击（罪）

sense.def: An assault course is an area of land covered with obstacles such as walls which people, especially soldiers, use to improve their skills and strength.
sense.tran: （尤指士兵的）突击训练场，障碍训练场

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 obstacle course

sense.def: An assay is a test of a substance to find out what chemicals it contains. It is usually carried out to find out how pure a substance is.
sense.tran: （确定物质纯度的）检验,化验,分析

sense.def: An assemblage of people or things is a collection of them.

example.ex: He had an assemblage of old junk cars filling the backyard.
example.tran: 他的后院里堆满了废旧汽车。

sense.def: When people assemble or when someone assembles them, they come together in a group, usually for a particular purpose such as a meeting.

example.ex: There wasn't even a convenient place for students to assemble between classes...
example.tran: 在课间，学生们连一个方便凑在一起的地方都没有。

example.ex: Thousands of people, mainly Zulus, assembled in a stadium in Thokoza...
example.tran: 数以千计的人，主要是祖鲁族人，聚集在托考查的一个体育场里。

example.ex: He has assembled a team of experts to handle queries...
example.tran: 他召集了一班专家来答疑解惑。

example.ex: The assembled multitude cheered and whistled as the political leaders arrived.
example.tran: 当政治领袖到达的时候，聚集的人群欢呼起来,并吹起了口哨。

sense.def: To assemble something means to collect it together or to fit the different parts of it together.

example.ex: Greenpeace managed to assemble enough boats to waylay the ship at sea...
example.tran: 绿色和平组织设法聚集起足够数量的小船在海上拦截该船。

example.ex: She had been trying to assemble the bomb when it went off in her arms...
example.tran: 在她试图组装炸弹时，炸弹在她怀里爆炸了。

example.ex: He is assembling evidence concerning a murder.
example.tran: 他正在收集一桩谋杀案的证据。

sense.def: An assembler is a person, a machine, or a company which assembles the individual parts of a vehicle or a piece of equipment such as a computer.
sense.tran: 装配工;装配器;装配型企业

sense.def: An assembly is a large group of people who meet regularly to make decisions or laws for a particular region or country.

example.ex: ...the campaign for the first free election to the National Assembly.
example.tran: 呼吁国民议会召开首次自由选举的运动

example.ex: ...an assembly of party members from the Russian republic.
example.tran: 俄罗斯共和国的党员代表大会

sense.def: An assembly is a group of people gathered together for a particular purpose.

example.ex: ...an assembly of women Olympic gold-medal winners...
example.tran: 奥林匹克金牌女性获得者的集会

example.ex: He waited until complete quiet settled on the assembly.
example.tran: 他一直等到集会的人群完全安静下来。

sense.def: When you refer to rights of assembly or restrictions on assembly, you are referring to the legal right that people have to gather together.

example.ex: The US Constitution guarantees free speech, freedom of assembly and equal protection...
example.tran: 美国宪法保证言论自由、集会自由和受到平等保护的权利。

example.ex: They were accused of unlawful assembly.
example.tran: 他们被控非法集会。

sense.def: In a school, assembly is a gathering of all the teachers and pupils at the beginning of every school day.

example.ex: By 9, the juniors are in the hall for assembly.
example.tran: 到9点时，三年级学生都在大厅里等待参加晨会。

example.ex: ...a long room with a stage at one end for assemblies.
example.tran: 一端设有早会用的高台的狭长房间

sense.def: The assembly of a machine, device, or object is the process of fitting its different parts together.

example.ex: For the rest of the day, he worked on the assembly of an explosive device.
example.tran: 在那天余下的时间里，他继续组装爆炸装置。

example.ex: ...workers at Sao Paulo's car assembly plants.
example.tran: 圣保罗汽车装配厂的工人

sense.def: An assembly line is an arrangement of workers and machines in a factory, where each worker deals with only one part of a product. The product passes from one worker to another until it is finished.

example.ex: ...a man who works on an assembly line.
example.tran: 装配线上的一名工人

sense.def: In the United States, an assemblyman is an elected member of an assembly of people who make decisions and laws.
An assembly plant is a factory where large items such as cars are put together, usually using parts which have been made in other factories.
In the United States, an assemblywoman is a female elected member of an assembly of people who make decisions and laws.

sense.hdgr:
oft with poss, N
to/for n
sense.def: If someone gives their assent to something that has been suggested, they formally agree to it.

example.ex: He gave his assent to the proposed legislation...
example.tran: 他批准了提请审议的法案。

example.ex: Without their assent a political settlement cannot be reached.
example.tran: 没有他们的同意，不可能达成政治上的和解。

sense.def: If you assent to something, you agree to it or agree with it.

example.ex: I assented to the request of the American publishers to write this book...
example.tran: 我同意了美国出版商的要求，答应写这本书。

example.ex: 'But it's good grub,' he added. 'You're right,' Pantieri assented.
example.tran: “但是伙食不错，”他补充道。“没错，”潘蒂埃里表示同意。

sense.def: If someone asserts a fact or belief, they state it firmly.

example.ex: Mr. Helm plans to assert that the bill violates the First Amendment...
example.tran: 赫尔姆先生打算声明该法案违反了宪法第一修正案。

example.ex: The defendants, who continue to assert their innocence, are expected to appeal...
example.tran: 各被告仍然坚称无辜，预计会提起上诉。

example.ex: Altman asserted, 'We were making a political statement about western civilisation and greed.'
example.tran: 奥尔特曼坚称，“我们那时正要发表一份关于西方文明和贪婪的政治宣言。”

example.ex: There is no concrete evidence to support assertions that the recession is truly over.
example.tran: 尚无确凿的证据支持经济衰退确已结束的论断。

sense.def: If you assert your authority, you make it clear by your behaviour that you have authority.

example.ex: After the war, the army made an attempt to assert its authority in the south of the country...
example.tran: 战后，军队试图在该国的南部地区维护其统治地位。

example.ex: The people have asserted their power and that will be very difficult to reverse.
example.tran: 人民已经维护了其当家作主的权力，这将难以改变。

example.ex: The decision is seen as an assertion of his authority within the company.
example.tran: 这个决定被看作是他在公司内部对自己权威的维护。

sense.def: If you assert your right or claim to something, you insist that you have the right to it.

example.ex: The republics began asserting their right to govern themselves.
example.tran: 各加盟共和国开始要求获得自治权。

example.ex: These institutions have made the assertion of ethnic identity possible.
example.tran: 这些制度使实现民族认同的主张成为可能。

sense.def: If you assert yourself, you speak and act in a forceful way, so that people take notice of you.
sense.tran: 坚持（自己）的主张;表现坚定

example.ex: He's speaking up and asserting himself confidently.
example.tran: 他明确表态，信心十足地阐述自己的观点。

sense.def: Someone who is assertive states their needs and opinions clearly, so that people take notice.
sense.tran: 观点明确的；坚决主张的

example.ex: Women have become more assertive in the past decade.
example.tran: 女性在过去十年中已变得更加自信。

example.ex: ...an assertive style of management.
example.tran: 果断的管理作风

example.ex: 'You don't need to do that,' said Pearl assertively.
example.tran: “你不需要那么做，”珀尔斩钉截铁地说道。

example.ex: Clare's assertiveness stirred up his deep-seated sense of inadequacy.
example.tran: 克莱尔的敢作敢为强烈触动了他内心深处的自卑感。

example.ex: ...an assertiveness training class.
example.tran: 自信心确立训练班

sense.def: When you assess a person, thing, or situation, you consider them in order to make a judgment about them.

example.ex: Our correspondent has been assessing the impact of the sanctions...
example.tran: 我们的记者一直在评估制裁带来的影响。

example.ex: The test was to assess aptitude rather than academic achievement...
example.tran: 这次测试是考查能力，而不是学习成绩。

example.ex: It would be a matter of assessing whether she was well enough to travel.
example.tran: 问题是要看她是否已康复到可以旅行。

sense.def: When you assess the amount of money that something is worth or should be paid, you calculate or estimate it.

example.ex: Ask them to send you information on how to assess the value of your belongings...
example.tran: 让他们把怎样评估你的财产价值的资料寄来。

example.ex: What's the property's assessed value?
example.tran: 这些财产的估值是多少？

sense.def: An assessment is a consideration of someone or something and a judgment about them.

example.ex: There is little assessment of the damage to the natural environment...
example.tran: 几乎未对自然环境破坏程度作出评估。

example.ex: The tests are supposed to provide a basis for the assessment of children...
example.tran: 这些测试应该可以为评价儿童提供一个基础。

example.ex: Heggie was remanded to a mental hospital for assessment by doctors.
example.tran: 赫吉被押往一所精神病院接受医生检查。

sense.def: An assessment of the amount of money that something is worth or that should be paid is a calculation or estimate of the amount.

example.ex: Price Waterhouse have traced the losses to lenders' inflated assessments of mortgaged property.
example.tran: 普华永道会计师事务所已经查明损失源于贷方对按揭财产估值过高。

example.ex: ...income assessment.
example.tran: 收入评估

sense.def: An assessor is a person who is employed to calculate the value of something, or the amount of money that should be paid, for example in tax.
sense.tran: 估价员;（资产）评估师;估税员

sense.def: An assessor is a person who is an expert in a subject, especially someone asked to advise a court of law on that subject.
sense.tran: 专家;（尤指法庭的）陪审推事，顾问

example.ex: Two judges and six lay assessors sentenced White to life in prison.
example.tran: 两名法官和六名大众陪审推事判决怀特终身监禁。

sense.def: An assessor is a person who judges the performance of someone else, for example in an exam, at an interview or at a sporting event.
sense.tran: （考试、面试、体育赛事等的）评分者，评委

example.ex: ...external assessors of GCSE exam results.
example.tran: 普通中等教育证书考试结果的外请评分者

sense.def: Something or someone that is an asset is considered useful or helps a person or organization to be successful.

example.ex: Her leadership qualities were the greatest asset of the Conservative Party...
example.tran: 她的领导才能是保守党最宝贵的财富。

example.ex: His Republican credentials made him an asset.
example.tran: 他作为共和党人的资历成了他的一笔财富。

sense.def: The assets of a company or a person are all the things that they own.

example.ex: By the end of 1989 the group had assets of 3.5 billion francs.
example.tran: 到1989年底该集团拥有的资产达35亿法郎。

sense.def: If a person or company is involved in asset-stripping, they buy companies cheaply, sell off their assets to make a profit, and then close the companies down.
sense.tran: 资产倒卖（廉价收购企业，再出售其资产以获利）

sense.def: If one person calls another person an asshole, they think that person is extremely stupid or has behaved in a stupid way.

entry.boxr: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 arsehole

sense.def: Someone who is assiduous works hard or does things very thoroughly.
sense.tran: 刻苦的；勤奋的；兢兢业业的

example.ex: ...an assiduous student...
example.tran: 勤勉的学生

example.ex: Podulski had been assiduous in learning his adopted language.
example.tran: 波多斯基一直很努力地学习外语。

example.ex: They planned their careers and worked assiduously to see them achieved...
example.tran: 他们规划了自己的事业，并且勤奋工作以实现目标。

example.ex: He liked beautiful women and courted them assiduously.
example.tran: 他喜欢美女，并且对她们大献殷勤。

sense.def: If you assign a piece of work to someone, you give them the work to do.

example.ex: When I taught, I would assign a topic to children which they would write about...
example.tran: 我教课时会给孩子们布置一个题目，让他们就这个题目写点东西。

example.ex: Later in the year, she'll assign them research papers...
example.tran: 今年晚些时候，她将给他们指定研究论文。

example.ex: When teachers assign homework, students usually feel an obligation to do it.
example.tran: 当老师布置家庭作业的时候，学生们通常觉得做作业是分内之事。

sense.def: If you assign something to someone, you say that it is for their use.

example.ex: The selling broker is then required to assign a portion of the commission to the buyer broker...
example.tran: 卖方经纪人须随后将部分佣金分给买方经纪人。

example.ex: He assigned her all his land in Ireland.
example.tran: 他把自己在爱尔兰的所有土地都转给了她。

sense.def: If someone is assigned to a particular place, group, or person, they are sent there, usually in order to work at that place or for that person.

example.ex: I was assigned to Troop A of the 10th Cavalry...
example.tran: 我被派往第10骑兵队的A连。

example.ex: Did you choose Russia or were you simply assigned there?...
example.tran: 你是自己选择去的俄罗斯还是就是被派到那里的？

example.ex: Each of us was assigned a minder, someone who looked after us.
example.tran: 我们每个人都被派了一个看护人来照顾我们。

sense.def: If you assign a particular function or value to someone or something, you say they have it.

example.ex: Under Mr. Harel's system, each business must assign a value to each job...
example.tran: 根据哈雷尔先生的体系，每个企业必须赋予每份工作一定的价值。

example.ex: Assign the letters of the alphabet their numerical values — A equals 1, B equals 2, etc.
example.tran: 给字母表里的每个字母赋予相应的数值——A等于1，B等于2，等等。

sense.def: An assignation is a secret meeting with someone, especially with a lover.
sense.tran: 私会；（尤指与情人的）幽会，约会

example.ex: She had an assignation with her boyfriend.
example.tran: 她和男友有个约会。

sense.def: An assignment is a task or piece of work that you are given to do, especially as part of your job or studies.

example.ex: The assessment for the course involves written assignments and practical tests.
example.tran: 这门功课的考核包括书面作业和实际操作考试。

sense.def: You can refer to someone being given a particular task or job as their assignment to the task or job.

example.ex: An Australian division scheduled for assignment to Greece was ordered to remain in Egypt.
example.tran: 原定去希腊执行任务的一支澳大利亚小分队接到命令后继续留在埃及。

sense.def: When people such as immigrants assimilate into a community or when that community assimilates them, they become an accepted part of it.

example.ex: There is every sign that new Asian-Americans are just as willing to assimilate...
example.tran: 种种迹象表明新一代亚裔美国人也愿意入乡随俗。

example.ex: His family tried to assimilate into the white and Hispanic communities...
example.tran: 他一家人试图融入白人和西班牙裔社区。

example.ex: The Vietnamese are trying to assimilate themselves and become Americans...
example.tran: 这些越南人正在努力融入美国社会，成为美国人。

example.gram:
Also V n, V n
into n
example.ex: French Jews generally had been assimilated into the nation's culture.
example.tran: 法裔犹太人已经被这个国家的文化同化了。

example.ex: They promote social integration and assimilation of minority ethnic groups into the culture.
example.tran: 他们提倡社会融合，促进少数民族群体融入社会文化。

sense.def: If you assimilate new ideas, techniques, or information, you learn them or adopt them.

example.ex: I was speechless, still trying to assimilate the enormity of what he'd told me.
example.tran: 我无话可说，一时还无法接受他对我所说之事的严重性。

example.ex: This technique brings life to instruction and eases assimilation of knowledge.
example.tran: 这一方法给教学带来了活力，也使知识的吸收变得容易了。

sense.def: If you assist someone, you help them to do a job or task by doing part of the work for them.

example.ex: Julia was assisting him to prepare his speech...
example.tran: 朱莉娅正在帮他准备讲演稿。

example.ex: The family decided to assist me with my chores...
example.tran: 全家人决定帮助我做家务。

example.ex: Dr Amid was assisted by a young Asian nurse.
example.tran: 阿米德医生的助手是一位年轻的亚裔护士。

sense.def: If you assist someone, you give them information, advice, or money.
sense.tran: （提供信息、意见或金钱）帮助，援助

example.ex: The public is urgently requested to assist police in tracing this man...
example.tran: 紧急要求公众帮助警方追踪此人。

example.ex: Foreign Office officials assisted with transport and finance problems...
example.tran: 外交部官员帮助解决运输和经费问题。

example.ex: The Authority will provide a welfare worker to assist you.
example.tran: 当局会派一名义工来帮助你。

sense.def: If something assists in doing a task, it makes the task easier to do.

example.ex: ...a chemical that assists in the manufacture of proteins...
example.tran: 有助于生成蛋白质的一种化学物质

example.ex: Here are some good sources of information to assist you in making the best selection...
example.tran: 这里是一些有价值的信息来源，可以帮助你作出最佳选择。

example.ex: Salvage operations have been greatly assisted by the good weather conditions.
example.tran: 天公作美，这大大促进了救援行动的顺利进行。

sense.def: If you give someone assistance, you help them do a job or task by doing part of the work for them.

example.ex: Since 1976 he has been operating the shop with the assistance of volunteers...
example.tran: 从1976年开始，他就在志愿者的帮助下经营这个店。

example.ex: She can still come downstairs with assistance but she's very weak.
example.tran: 在有人搀扶的情况下她还是能够下楼的，但是很虚弱。

sense.def: If you give someone assistance, you give them information or advice.
sense.tran: （以提供信息或意见的方式给予的）帮助，援助

example.ex: Any assistance you could give the police will be greatly appreciated...
example.tran: 您提供的任何帮助警方都将万分感谢。

example.ex: Employees are being offered assistance in finding new jobs.
example.tran: 正在帮助雇员另觅新职。

sense.def: If someone gives a person or country assistance, they help them by giving them money.

example.ex: ...a viable programme of economic assistance...
example.tran: 切实可行的经济援助方案

example.ex: We shall offer you assistance with legal expenses up to $5,000.
example.tran: 我们将为您提供最高5,000美元的法律援助金。

sense.def: If something is done with the assistance of a particular thing, that thing is helpful or necessary for doing it.

example.ex: The translations were carried out with the assistance of a medical dictionary.
example.tran: 这些翻译是借助一本医学词典完成的。

phrase.def: Someone or something that is of assistance to you is helpful or useful to you.

example.ex: He was of great assistance to me in researches for my books...
example.tran: 在我为写书所作的研究中，他提供了很大的帮助。

example.ex: Can I be of any assistance?
example.tran: 我能帮什么忙吗？

phrase.def: If you come to someone's assistance, you take action to help them.

example.ex: They are appealing to the world community to come to Jordan's assistance...
example.tran: 他们正在呼吁国际社会向约旦伸出援手。

example.ex: Ben suffered a heart attack and Helen rushed to his assistance.
example.tran: 本心脏病犯了，海伦急忙赶过来帮忙。

sense.def: Assistant is used in front of titles or jobs to indicate a slightly lower rank. For example, an assistant director is one rank lower than a director in an organization.
sense.tran: （用于头衔或职务前，表示级别略低）助理的，副的

example.ex: ...the Assistant Secretary of Defense.
example.tran: 助理国防部长

example.ex: ...a young assistant professor at Harvard.
example.tran: 年轻的哈佛助理教授

sense.def: Someone's assistant is a person who helps them in their work.

example.ex: Kalan called his assistant, Hashim, to take over while he went out...
example.tran: 考兰叫助理哈希姆在自己外出时代理其职。

example.ex: The salesman had been accompanied to the meeting by an assistant.
example.tran: 营销人员在助手的陪同下参加了会议。

sense.def: An assistant is a person who works in a shop selling things to customers.

example.ex: The assistant took the book and checked the price on the back cover...
example.tran: 店员拿起书，核对了一下封底的定价。

example.ex: She got a job as a sales assistant selling handbags.
example.tran: 她得到了一份手提包售货员的工作。

sense.def: An assistant referee is the same as a linesman .
sense.tran: 助理裁判员;边线裁判;司线员

sense.def: Assoc. is a written abbreviation for (书面缩略=) association ,associated, or associate.

entry.boxr: The verb is pronounced /ə'səʊsieɪt/. The noun and adjective are pronounced /ə'səʊsiət/. 动词读作/ə'səʊsieɪt/，名词和形容词读作/ə'səʊsiət/。

sense.def: If you associate someone or something with another thing, the two are connected in your mind.

example.ex: Through science we've got the idea of associating progress with the future...
example.tran: 通过科学我们知道了应该把进步和未来联系起来。

example.ex: Rap groups have been barred from large musical events because they are associated with vandalism.
example.tran: 说唱组合被禁止参加大型的音乐活动，因为他们使人联想到肆意破坏公共财产的行为。

sense.def: If you are associated with a particular organization, cause, or point of view, or if you associate yourself with it, you support it publicly.
sense.tran: 使与（某个组织、事业或观点）有关系;公开支持

example.ex: I haven't been associated with the project over the last year...
example.tran: 我去年一直没有参与那个项目。

example.ex: The press feels the need to associate itself with the green movement.
example.tran: 媒体感到有必要支持绿色运动。

sense.def: If you say that someone is associating with another person or group of people, you mean they are spending a lot of time in the company of people you do not approve of.

example.ex: What would they think if they knew that they were associating with a murderer?...
example.tran: 如果他们知道自己正在与一个杀人犯为伍会怎么想?

example.ex: They disapproved of her dancing at discos and associating with homosexuals.
example.tran: 他们不同意她在迪斯科舞厅跳舞并和同性恋鬼混。

sense.def: Your associates are the people you are closely connected with, especially at work.

example.ex: ...the restaurant owner's business associates.
example.tran: 餐馆老板的商业伙伴

sense.def: Associate is used before a rank or title to indicate a slightly different or lower rank or title.
sense.tran: （用于等级或头衔前，表示稍有不同或略低）副的，准的

example.ex: Mr Lin is associate director of the Institute...
example.tran: 林先生是研究所的副所长。

example.ex: She applied for associate membership last year.
example.tran: 她去年申请成为准会员。

example.ex: ...an associate professor of political science.
example.tran: 政治学副教授

sense.def: If one thing is associated with another, the two things are connected with each other.

example.ex: These symptoms are particularly associated with migraine headaches.
example.tran: 这些症状尤其与偏头痛相关。

sense.def: Associated is used in the name of a company that is made up of a number of smaller companies which have joined together.
sense.tran: （用于公司名称）联合的，联营的

example.ex: ...the Associated Press.
example.tran: 美联社

sense.def: An association is an official group of people who have the same job, aim, or interest.

example.ex: ...the British Olympic Association...
example.tran: 英国奥林匹克协会

example.ex: Research associations are often linked to a particular industry.
example.tran: 研究协会常与某个特定的行业挂钩。

sense.def: Your association with a person or a thing such as an organization is the connection that you have with them.

example.ex: ...the company's six-year association with retailer J.C. Penney Co...
example.tran: 该公司与零售商 J. C. 彭尼公司6年的业务往来

example.ex: Blyth's association with the sea began in 1966...
example.tran: 布莱思的航海生涯始于1966年。

example.ex: The association between the two companies stretches back thirty years.
example.tran: 这两家公司的往来可以追溯到30年前。

sense.def: If something has particular associations for you, it is connected in your mind with a particular memory, idea, or feeling.

example.ex: He has a shelf full of things, each of which has associations for him...
example.tran: 他的一个搁架上摆满了东西，每一样都能勾起他许多回忆。

example.ex: Black was considered inappropriate because of its associations with death.
example.tran: 不宜用黑色，因为它让人联想到死亡。

phrase.def: If you do something in association with someone else, you do it together.

example.ex: Published in association with the Council for the Protection of Rural England, the book provides refreshing solutions to the long-term problem of water conservation.
example.tran: 这本书与英格兰乡村保护委员会合作出版，就节约水资源这个长期问题提供了全新的解决方法。

phrase.def: If one thing is found in association with another, they are found together.

sense.def: Associative thoughts are things that you think of because you see, hear, or think of something that reminds you of those things or which you associate with those things.

example.ex: The associative guilt was ingrained in his soul...
example.tran: 由此产生的内疚感在他灵魂深处挥之不去。

example.ex: The real picture is more horrific and stronger but one must conjure up all the associative thoughts and emotions it evokes.
example.tran: 真实的画面更恐怖也更震撼，但是它带来的种种感受和情绪需要你自己去联想。

sense.def: A group of assorted things is a group of similar things that are of different sizes or colours or have different qualities.
sense.tran: 各式各样的;五颜六色的;混杂的

example.ex: It should be a great week, with overnight stops in assorted hotels in the West Highlands.
example.tran: 那一周会过得很开心，晚上可以在西部高地上的各式旅馆里过夜。

example.ex: ...swimsuits, sizes 12-18, in assorted colours.
example.tran: 12至18号的泳衣，颜色各异

sense.def: An assortment is a group of similar things that are of different sizes or colours or have different qualities.
sense.tran: 各式各样;五颜六色;什锦

example.ex: ...an assortment of cheese.
example.tran: 干酪什锦

sense.def: Asst. is an abbreviation for (缩略=) assistant.
If you assuage an unpleasant feeling that someone has, you make them feel it less strongly.

example.ex: To assuage his wife's grief, he took her on a tour of Europe...
example.tran: 为了减轻妻子的悲痛，他带她去了欧洲旅游。

example.ex: She was just trying to assuage her guilt by playing the devoted mother.
example.tran: 她装出一副慈母的样子只是想要减轻自己的罪恶感。

sense.def: If you assuage a need or desire for something, you satisfy it.

example.ex: The meat they'd managed to procure assuaged their hunger.
example.tran: 他们把搞到手的肉拿来充饥。

sense.def: If you assume that something is true, you imagine that it is true, sometimes wrongly.

example.ex: It is a misconception to assume that the two continents are similar...
example.tran: 关于这两块大陆相似的假设是一种误解。

example.ex: If the package is wrapped well, we assume the contents are also wonderful...
example.tran: 如果包装精美，我们就会认为里面装的也是好东西。

example.ex: If mistakes occurred, they were assumed to be the fault of the commander on the spot...
example.tran: 如果出现了错误，就会认为是现场指挥官的失误。

example.ex: 'Today?' — 'I'd assume so, yeah.'
example.tran: “今天？”——“对，我觉得是。”

sense.def: If someone assumes power or responsibility, they take power or responsibility.
sense.tran: 掌管，夺取，取得（权力）；承担（责任）

example.ex: Mr Cross will assume the role of Chief Executive with a team of four directors...
example.tran: 克劳斯先生将出任首席执行官，手下有4位经理。

example.ex: If there is no president, power will be assumed by the most extremist forces.
example.tran: 如果没有主席，权力就会落入最极端的过激分子手中。

sense.def: If something assumes a particular quality, it begins to have that quality.
sense.tran: 呈现，具有，显露（某种特质）

example.ex: In his dreams, the mountains assumed enormous importance.
example.tran: 在他的梦中，山有着至关重要的作用。

sense.def: If you assume a particular expression or way of behaving, you start to look or behave in this way.
sense.tran: 表现出（某种表情）；装出，做出（某种样子）

example.ex: He contented himself by assuming an air of superiority...
example.tran: 他表现出一副高高在上的样子以获得自我满足。

example.ex: Prue assumed a placatory tone of voice.
example.tran: 普吕以一种安慰人的语气说话。

sense.def: You can use let us assume or let's assume when you are considering a possible situation or event, so that you can think about the consequences.

example.ex: Let us assume those clubs actually win something. Then players will receive large bonuses...
example.tran: 倘若那些俱乐部真的赚了，那么球员就会获得一大笔奖金。

example.ex: Let's assume for a moment that I am a litigant in your court.
example.tran: 暂且假设我是你的诉讼当事人。

sense.def: If you do something under an assumed name, you do it using a name that is not your real name.

example.ex: The articles were published in San Francisco newspapers under the assumed name of Dorothy Dodge...
example.tran: 这些发表在旧金山报纸上的文章都出自一个化名为多萝西·道奇的人之手。

example.ex: In Arnham, she and her mother lived under assumed names and took care to speak Flemish rather than their more usual French and English.
example.tran: 在阿纳姆，她和母亲隐姓埋名，而且刻意说着一口佛兰芒语而不是她们更常用的法语和英语。

sense.def: You use assuming or assuming that when you are considering a possible situation or event, so that you can think about the consequences.

example.ex: 'Assuming you're right,' he said, 'there's not much I can do about it, is there?'...
example.tran: “就算你是对的，”他说，“这件事也没什么我可以做的，不是吗？”

example.ex: But assuming that the talks make progress, won't they do too little, too late?
example.tran: 就算会谈取得了进展，也未免太微不足道，且为时太晚了吧？

sense.hdgr:
usu with supp, oft N that, adj N, N
of n,
on N
sense.def: If you make an assumption that something is true or will happen, you accept that it is true or will happen, often without any real proof.

example.ex: They have taken a wrong turning in their assumption that all men and women think alike...
example.tran: 他们错误地设想所有男女均见解一致。

example.ex: Dr Subroto questioned the scientific assumption on which the global warming theory is based...
example.tran: 苏布罗托博士质疑全球变暖理论所依据的科学假设。

example.ex: Economists are working on the assumption of an interest rate cut.
example.tran: 经济学家正在研究降低利率的假设。

sense.def: Someone's assumption of power or responsibility is their taking of it.

example.ex: The government have retained the support which greeted their assumption of power last March.
example.tran: 自从在刚过去的三月掌权以来，政府的支持率依旧未减。

sense.hdgr:
oft N that, N
of n
sense.def: If you give someone an assurance that something is true or will happen, you say that it is definitely true or will definitely happen, in order to make them feel less worried.

example.ex: He would like an assurance that other forces will not move into the territory that his forces vacate...
example.tran: 他想确保其他势力不会在他的军队撤离后进入这个地区。

example.ex: He will have been pleased by Marshal Yazov's assurance of the armed forces' loyalty.
example.tran: 当亚佐夫元帅向他保证武装部队的忠诚时，他会感到心满意足的。

sense.def: If you do something with assurance, you do it with a feeling of confidence and certainty.

example.ex: Masur led the orchestra with assurance...
example.tran: 马苏尔神定气若地指挥乐团。

example.ex: The EU is now acquiring greater assurance and authority.
example.tran: 现在欧共体越来越有自信与权威性了。

sense.def: Assurance is insurance that provides cover in the event of death.

example.ex: ...endowment assurance.
example.tran: 养老保险

sense.def: If you assure someone that something is true or will happen, you tell them that it is definitely true or will definitely happen, often in order to make them less worried.

example.ex: He hastened to assure me that there was nothing traumatic to report...
example.tran: 他忙不迭地向我保证，并没有什么悲惨的事要诉说。

example.ex: 'Are you sure the raft is safe?' she asked anxiously. 'Couldn't be safer,' Max assured her confidently...
example.tran: “你确定木筏安全吗？”她不安地问道。“再安全不过了，”马克斯信心十足地向她保证道。

example.ex: Government officials recently assured Hindus of protection.
example.tran: 政府官员近来保证对印度教徒进行保护。

sense.def: To assure someone of something means to make certain that they will get it.

example.ex: Last night's resounding victory over Birmingham City has virtually assured them of promotion...
example.tran: 昨晚大胜伯明翰城队实际上已确保他们能够晋级。

example.ex: Ways must be found to assure our children a decent start in life.
example.tran: 必须想办法保证我们的孩子有一个不错的人生开端。

sense.def: You use phrases such as I can assure you or let me assure you to emphasize the truth of what you are saying.
sense.tran: 我可以向你保证；相信我

example.ex: I can assure you that the animals are well cared for...
example.tran: 我可以向你保证动物们得到了精心照顾。

example.ex: This may sound trivial, but I assure you it is quite important!...
example.tran: 这听上去也许微不足道，但是，相信我，它十分重要！

example.ex: And let me assure you I will use whatever force is necessary to restore order.
example.tran: 我向你保证，我将动用一切必要力量来恢复秩序。

sense.def: Someone who is assured is very confident and relaxed.
sense.tran: 自信的；放松的；有把握的

example.ex: He was infinitely more assured than in his more recent parliamentary appearances.
example.tran: 比起最近几次在国会中的露面，他表现得自信多了。

example.ex: This is a lyrical work written with the authority and assuredness of an experienced writer.
example.tran: 这部抒情作品由一位有经验的作家以老练、自信的笔触写成。

sense.def: If something is assured, it is certain to happen.

example.ex: Our victory is assured; nothing can stop us...
example.tran: 我们必胜，我们锐不可当。

example.ex: Yesterday, her future seemed assured.
example.tran: 昨天，她的未来似乎已经在握。

sense.def: If you are assured of something, you are certain to get it or achieve it.
sense.tran: 确定的;信心十足的;志在必得的

example.ex: Laura Davies is assured of a place in Europe's team...
example.tran: 劳拉·戴维斯确信能在欧洲队中占据一席之地。

example.ex: Bickerstaffe looks assured of being elected general secretary.
example.tran: 比克斯塔夫看上去对于当选总书记志在必得。

phrase.def: If you say that someone can rest assured that something is the case, you mean that it is definitely the case, so they do not need to worry about it.

example.ex: Their parents can rest assured that their children's safety will be of paramount importance...
example.tran: 家长尽可放心，孩子们的安全将成为重中之重。

example.ex: Rest assured, he probably has rather more common sense than you realize.
example.tran: 放心吧，他知道的常识很可能比你以为的要多得多。

phrase.def: You use rest assured when you want to emphasize your determination to do something.

example.ex: I will be seeing Mr and Mrs. Johnson. And rest assured I will tell them of your rudeness...
example.tran: 我将去见约翰逊夫妇。等着瞧吧，我一定会把你的无礼告诉他们。

example.ex: Rest assured, if you owe taxes, we will collect them.
example.tran: 不用多想，如果你欠税，我们会去收的。

sense.hdgr: ADV with cl/group, ADV before v
sense.def: If something is assuredly true, it is definitely true.
sense.tran: 确定地；一定地；毫无疑问地

example.ex: He is, assuredly, not alone in believing they will win...
example.tran: 毫无疑问，不止他一个人认为他们会赢。

example.ex: The government most assuredly does believe in organic farming.
example.tran: 政府确实坚信有机耕作切实可行。

sense.def: An asterisk is the sign *. It is used especially to indicate that there is further information about something in another part of the text.
sense.tran: 星号（即*，尤用于表示文中另外一处有更多信息）

sense.def: Something that is astern is at the back of a ship or behind the back part.

example.ex: The captain was astern, pretending he was sleeping.
