example.tran: 船长在船尾，假装睡着了。

sense.def: A ship that is moving astern is moving backwards.

example.ex: At the crucial moment, the barge would not go astern.
example.tran: 在关键时刻，驳船不能向后驶。

sense.def: An asteroid is one of the very small planets that move around the sun between Mars and Jupiter.
sense.tran: 小行星（在火星及木星轨道间围绕太阳运行）

sense.def: Asthma is a lung condition which causes difficulty in breathing.
People who suffer from asthma are sometimes referred to as asthmatics .
sense.tran: 气喘病患者；哮喘病患者

example.ex: I have been an asthmatic from childhood and was never able to play any sports.
example.tran: 我从小就患有气喘病，参加不了任何体育活动。

example.ex: One child in ten is asthmatic.
example.tran: 每十个孩子里就有一人患有气喘病。

sense.def: Asthmatic means relating to asthma.

example.ex: ...asthmatic breathing.
example.tran: 气喘

sense.def: If someone has astigmatism, the front of their eye has a slightly irregular shape, so they cannot see properly.
If something or someone astonishes you, they surprise you very much.

example.ex: My news will astonish you...
example.tran: 我的消息会让你感到十分惊讶的。

example.ex: Her dedication constantly astonishes me.
example.tran: 她的奉献精神总是让我震惊。

sense.hdgr:
oft ADJ
by/at n, ADJ to-inf, ADJ that
sense.def: If you are astonished by something, you are very surprised about it.
sense.tran: 感到惊讶的;十分惊奇的

example.ex: I was astonished by his stupidity...
example.tran: 他的愚笨让我大跌眼镜。

example.ex: They were astonished to find the driver was a six-year-old boy.
example.tran: 令他们吃惊的是，开车的居然是个6岁的小男孩。

sense.def: Something that is astonishing is very surprising.
sense.tran: 令人惊讶的；非常惊人的

example.ex: It's astonishing, he's learned Latin in three hours!
example.tran: 他花了3个小时就学会了拉丁文，真让人吃惊！

example.ex: ...an astonishing display of physical strength.
example.tran: 表现出的惊人体力

example.ex: Isabella was an astonishingly beautiful young woman...
example.tran: 伊莎贝拉是个美貌惊人的年轻女人。

example.ex: He was wearing, astonishingly, a frilly pink apron over shirt and trousers.
example.tran: 他穿得很奇怪，衬衫和裤子外面套着件镶褶边的粉红围裙。

sense.def: Astonishment is a feeling of great surprise.

example.ex: I spotted a shooting star which, to my astonishment, was bright green in colour...
example.tran: 我看见一颗流星，使我大为惊奇的是，它居然是鲜亮的绿色。

example.ex: 'What?' Meg asked in astonishment.
example.tran: ‘什么？’梅格惊讶地问道。

sense.def: If something astounds you, you are very surprised by it.
sense.tran: 使大吃一惊;使惊骇;使震惊

example.ex: He used to astound his friends with feats of physical endurance.
example.tran: 过去，他表现出来的惊人耐力常让朋友们大吃一惊。

sense.hdgr:
oft ADJ
by/at n, ADJ to-inf, ADJ that
sense.def: If you are astounded by something, you are very shocked or surprised that it could exist or happen.

example.ex: I was astounded by its beauty...
example.tran: 它的美丽震撼了我。

example.ex: I am astounded at the comments made by the Chief Superintendent.
example.tran: 主管的评语让我大吃一惊。

sense.def: If something is astounding, you are shocked or amazed that it could exist or happen.
sense.tran: 令人惊骇的；令人震惊的

example.ex: The results are quite astounding.
example.tran: 结果令人无比震惊。

example.ex: ...astoundingly blue eyes...
example.tran: 蓝得惊人的一双眼睛

example.ex: Astoundingly, an American had won the Tour de France.
example.tran: 令人惊讶的是，一个美国人获得了环法自行车赛的冠军。

sense.def: Astrakhan is black or grey curly fur from the skins of lambs. It is used for making coats and hats.
sense.tran: （用于制造大衣和帽子）阿斯特拉罕羔羊皮

example.ex: ...a coat with an astrakhan collar.
example.tran: 羔羊皮领大衣

sense.def: Astral means relating to the stars.
If you are led astray by someone or something, you behave badly or foolishly because of them.

example.ex: The judge thought he'd been led astray by older children.
example.tran: 法官认为他已经被那些年长的孩子们带坏了。

sense.def: If someone or something leads you astray, they make you believe something which is not true, causing you to make a wrong decision.

example.ex: The testimony would inflame the jurors, and lead them astray from the facts of the case...
example.tran: 证言会激怒陪审员，使他们背离案件事实。

example.ex: We drove east to Rostock, where my map led me astray.
example.tran: 我们驱车向东去罗斯托克，但地图却给我指错了方向。

sense.def: If something goes astray, it gets lost while it is being taken or sent somewhere.

example.ex: Many items of mail being sent to her have gone astray.
example.tran: 许多寄给她的邮件都不知所终。

sense.def: If you sit or stand astride something, you sit or stand with one leg on each side of it.

example.ex: ...three youths who stood astride their bicycles and stared.
example.tran: 站着跨在自行车上凝视的3个年轻人

sense.def: An astringent is a liquid that you put on your skin to make it less oily or to make cuts stop bleeding.

example.ex: ...an astringent lotion.
example.tran: 紧肤水

sense.def: Astringent means forceful and critical.

example.ex: Sunset Boulevard was originally conceived by Wilder as an astringent satire on Hollywood.
example.tran: 怀尔德最初是想把《日落大道》拍成一部对好莱坞的辛辣讽刺片。

sense.def: If something has an astringent taste, it is sharp or bitter.

example.ex: The fruit has a tart and astringent flavour.
example.tran: 这种水果又酸又涩。

example.ex: The process, in which the tea develops its characteristic astringency, is known as fermentation.
example.tran: 茶开始散发涩味的过程称作发酵。

sense.def: Astro- is used to form words which refer to things relating to the stars or to outer space.
sense.tran: （用于构词）表示“星的”，“天体的”,“外太空的”

example.ex: ...astro-navigation.
example.tran: 宇宙航行

sense.def: An astrologer is a person who uses astrology to try to tell you things about your character and your future.
Astrology is the study of the movements of the planets, sun, moon, and stars in the belief that these movements can have an influence on people's lives.

example.ex: He has had a keen and lifelong interest in astrological research.
example.tran: 他毕生热衷于占星术研究。

example.ex: ...an astrologically significant moment.
example.tran: 占星术上的伟大时刻

sense.def: An astronaut is a person who is trained for travelling in a spacecraft.
An astronomer is a scientist who studies the stars, planets, and other natural objects in space.
If you describe an amount, especially the cost of something as astronomical, you are emphasizing that it is very large indeed.
sense.tran: （数量，尤指费用）极其巨大的,天文数字的

example.ex: Houses in the village are selling for astronomical prices...
example.tran: 乡村的房价正在飙升。

example.ex: The cost will be astronomical.
example.tran: 费用将是一笔天文数字。

example.ex: He was astronomically wealthy...
example.tran: 他富甲一方。

example.ex: House prices had risen astronomically.
example.tran: 房价已经暴涨。

sense.def: Astronomical means relating to astronomy.

example.ex: ...the British Astronomical Association.
example.tran: 英国天文协会

sense.def: Astronomy is the scientific study of the stars, planets, and other natural objects in space.
An astrophysicist is someone who studies astrophysics.
Astrophysics is the study of the physical and chemical structure of the stars, planets, and other natural objects in space.
If you describe someone as astute, you think they show an understanding of behaviour and situations, and are skilful at using this knowledge to their own advantage.

example.ex: She was politically astute...
example.tran: 她很有政治头脑。

example.ex: He made a series of astute business decisions.
example.tran: 他作出了一系列精明的商业决策。

example.ex: Oxford, as Evelyn Waugh astutely observed, is a city best seen in early summer.
example.tran: 牛津城，正如伊夫林·沃的敏锐观察，初夏的时候最美。

example.ex: With characteristic astuteness, he spoke separately to all those involved.
example.tran: 凭着他特有的精明，他同有关人士一一进行了谈话。

sense.def: If something tears or is torn asunder, it is violently separated into two or more parts or pieces.

example.ex: ...a dress rent asunder from shoulder to hem...
example.tran: 从肩部到裙摆都被扯得粉碎的一件连衣裙

example.ex: The debate is tearing Wall Street asunder.
example.tran: 这场争论令华尔街分崩离析。

sense.def: If a government gives a person from another country asylum, they allow them to stay, usually because they are unable to return home safely for political reasons.

example.ex: He applied for asylum in 1987 after fleeing the police back home.
example.tran: 1987年他在本国逃脱警察追捕后，就申请了政治庇护。

sense.def: An asylum is a psychiatric hospital.
An asylum seeker is a person who is trying to get asylum in a foreign country.

example.ex: Fewer than 7% of asylum seekers are accepted as political refugees.
example.tran: 寻求避难者中有不到7%的人被视作政治难民。

sense.def: Asymmetric means the same as asymmetrical .
Something that is asymmetrical has two sides or halves that are different in shape, size, or style.

example.ex: ...asymmetrical shapes.
example.tran: 不对称形状

sense.def: Asymmetry is the appearance that something has when its two sides or halves are different in shape, size, or style.

example.ex: ...the asymmetry of Van de Velde's designs of this period.
example.tran: 范德费尔德这一时期设计作品的不对称性

sense.def: If someone with a disease is asymptomatic, it means that they do not show any symptoms of the disease.

example.ex: I have patients who are HIV-positive and asymptomatic.
example.tran: 我的一些病人艾滋病病毒检测呈阳性，但却无任何体征。

boxx.note: In addition to the uses shown below, at is used after some verbs, nouns, and adjectives to introduce extra information. At is also used in phrasal verbs such as ‘keep on at’ and ‘play at’.
boxx.tran: 除下列用法外，at用于某些动词、名词、形容词后以引出附加信息。at还可用于keep on at, play at等短语动词中。

sense.def: You use at to indicate the place or event where something happens or is situated.

example.ex: We had dinner at a restaurant in Attleborough...
example.tran: 我们在阿特尔伯勒的一家餐厅里吃的饭。

example.ex: He will be at the airport to meet her...
example.tran: 他将去机场接她。

example.ex: I didn't like being alone at home...
example.tran: 我不喜欢一个人呆在家里。

example.ex: Hamstrings are supporting muscles at the back of the thigh...
example.tran: 腿筋是位于大腿后侧起支撑作用的肌肉。

example.ex: The announcement was made at a news conference.
example.tran: 这项声明是在新闻发布会上宣布的。

sense.def: If someone is at school or college, or at a particular school or college, they go there regularly to study.

example.ex: He was shy and nervous as a boy, and unhappy at school...
example.tran: 他小时候既害羞又胆怯，在学校过得并不快乐。

example.ex: It was at university that he first encountered Hopkins...
example.tran: 他第一次遇见霍普金斯是在上大学的时候。

example.ex: I majored in psychology at Hunter College.
example.tran: 在亨特学院求学时，我主修心理学。

sense.def: If you are at something such as a table, a door, or someone's side, you are next to it or them.

example.ex: An assistant sat typing away at a table beside him...
example.tran: 助手坐在他身旁的一张桌子上埋头打字。

example.ex: Graham was already at the door...
example.tran: 格雷厄姆已经在门口了。

example.ex: At his side was a beautiful young woman...
example.tran: 他旁边是个年轻漂亮的女子。

example.ex: He gave the girl at the desk the message.
example.tran: 他把便条递给了桌旁的女孩。

sense.def: When you are describing where someone or something is, you can say that they are at a certain distance. You can also say that one thing is at an angle in relation to another thing.
sense.tran: 从相隔（一段距离）的地方;呈…角度

example.ex: The two journalists followed at a discreet distance...
example.tran: 那两个记者谨慎地保持距离跟在后面。

example.ex: The tree was leaning at a low angle from the ground.
example.tran: 那棵树倾斜得非常厉害。

sense.def: If something happens at a particular time, that is the time when it happens or begins to happen.

example.ex: The funeral will be carried out this afternoon at 3.00...
example.tran: 葬礼将在今天下午3点举行。

example.ex: He only sees her at Christmas and Easter.
example.tran: 他只有在圣诞节和复活节时才能见到她。

sense.def: If you do something at a particular age, you do it when you are that age.

example.ex: Blake emigrated to Australia with his family at 13...
example.tran: 布莱克在13岁时随家人移民到了澳大利亚。

example.ex: Mary Martin has died at her home in California at the age of seventy-six.
example.tran: 玛丽·马丁76岁时卒于加利福尼亚家中。

sense.def: You use at to express a rate, frequency, level, or price.
sense.tran: 以，达（某一速度、频率、水平或价格）

example.ex: I drove back down the highway at normal speed...
example.tran: 我以正常车速沿公路返回。

example.ex: Check the oil at regular intervals, and have the car serviced regularly...
example.tran: 定期检查汽油，并对车辆进行定期维护。

example.ex: The submarine lies at a depth of 6,000 feet in the Barents Sea.
example.tran: 潜艇位于巴伦支海水下6,000英尺深处。

example.ex: ...custom-designed rugs at $16 to $100 a sq ft.
example.tran: 价格在每平方英尺16至100美元不等的定制地毯。

sense.def: You use at before a number or amount to indicate a measurement.

example.ex: Weighing in at eighty tons, the B-19 was easily the largest and most sophisticated warplane in the world.
example.tran: B-19重达80吨，无疑是世界上最大、最先进的军用飞机。

example.ex: ...as unemployment stays pegged at three million.
example.tran: 当失业人数维持在300万

sense.def: If you look at someone or something, you look towards them. If you direct an object or a comment at someone, you direct it towards them.
sense.tran: 朝（某人或某物看）；向（某人掷物）；冲（某人说话）

example.ex: He looked at Michael and laughed...
example.tran: 他看着迈克尔笑了。

example.ex: The crowds became violent and threw petrol bombs at the police...
example.tran: 人群变得狂暴起来，并向警察投掷汽油弹。

example.ex: A couple of people started shouting abuse at them as they walked past a pub.
example.tran: 当他们经过一个酒吧时，有几个人开始朝他们谩骂。

sense.def: You can use at after verbs such as 'smile' or 'wave' and before nouns referring to people to indicate that you have put on an expression or made a gesture which someone is meant to see or understand.

example.ex: She opened the door and stood there, frowning at me...
example.tran: 她打开门站在那里，朝我皱着眉头。

example.ex: We waved at the staff to try to get the bill.
example.tran: 我们向工作人员招了招手，想要买单。

sense.def: If you point or gesture at something, you move your arm or head in its direction so that it will be noticed by someone you are with.

example.ex: He pointed at the empty bottle and the waitress quickly replaced it...
example.tran: 他指了指空瓶子，女服务员立即重新拿了一瓶。

example.ex: He gestured at the shelves. 'I've bought many books from him.'
example.tran: 他指着书架说，“我已经从他那里买了不少书了”。

sense.def: If you are working at something, you are dealing with it. If you are aiming at something, you are trying to achieve it.
sense.tran: 致力于;定位于;期望达到

example.ex: She has worked hard at her marriage.
example.tran: 她努力维系着她的婚姻。

example.ex: ...a $1.04m grant aimed at improving student performance on placement examinations.
example.tran: 旨在提高学生编班考试成绩的104万美元拨款

sense.def: If something is done at someone's invitation or request, it is done as a result of it.

example.ex: She left the light on in the bathroom at his request...
example.tran: 她按照他的要求将浴室里的灯开着。

example.ex: I visited Japan in 1987 at the invitation of the Foreign Minister.
example.tran: 应日本外相的邀请，我于1987年访问了日本。

sense.def: You use at to say that someone or something is in a particular state or condition.

example.ex: I am afraid we are not at liberty to disclose that information...
example.tran: 恐怕我们无权透露这一信息。

example.ex: Their countries had been at war for nearly six weeks.
example.tran: 他们的国家陷入战争状态已将近6个星期了。

sense.def: You use at before a possessive pronoun and a superlative adjective to say that someone or something has more of a particular quality than at any other time.
sense.tran: （用于所有格代词和形容词最高级前，表示某人或某物在此时的某一特征最鲜明）

example.ex: He was at his happiest whilst playing cricket...
example.tran: 玩板球时他最开心了。

example.ex: Howards End is old fashioned film-making at its best.
example.tran: 《霍华德庄园》是一部经典的老派电影。

sense.def: You use at to say how something is being done.

example.ex: Three people were killed by shots fired at random from a minibus...
example.tran: 3个人被从一辆面包车中发射的乱弹打死了。

example.ex: Mr Martin was taken out of his car at gunpoint.
example.tran: 马丁先生被人用枪指着从车里带了出来。

sense.def: You use at to show that someone is doing something repeatedly.

example.ex: She lowered the handkerchief which she had kept dabbing at her eyes...
example.tran: 她放下了那块一直用来擦眼睛的手帕。

example.ex: Miss Melville took a cookie and nibbled at it.
example.tran: 梅尔维尔小姐拿起一块饼干小口吃起来。

sense.hdgr: adj PREP n, n PREP n, v PREP n
sense.def: You use at to indicate an activity or task when saying how well someone does it.

example.ex: I'm good at my work...
example.tran: 我对自己的工作得心应手。

example.ex: Robin is an expert at cheesemaking...
example.tran: 罗宾是奶酪制作专家。

example.ex: She excels at sport.
example.tran: 她擅长体育运动。

sense.hdgr: adj PREP n, n PREP n, v PREP n
sense.def: You use at to indicate what someone is reacting to.

example.ex: Eleanor was annoyed at having had to wait so long for him...
example.tran: 埃莉诺为不得不等他这么长时间而感到很恼火。

example.ex: The British team did not disguise their delight at their success...
example.tran: 英国队毫不掩饰他们获胜的喜悦。

example.ex: Six months ago she would have laughed at the idea.
example.tran: 要是在6个月前，她会对这个想法嗤之以鼻。

sense.def: Atavistic feelings or behaviour seem to be very primitive, like the feelings or behaviour of our earliest ancestors.

example.ex: ...an atavistic fear of snakes.
example.tran: 对蛇的原始恐惧

sense.def: Ate is the past tense of eat.
An atelier is an artist's studio or workshop.
Atheism is the belief that there is no God.
An atheist is a person who believes that there is no God.
Atheistic means connected with or holding the belief that there is no God.

example.ex: ...atheistic values.
example.tran: 无神论价值观

example.ex: ...atheistic philosophers.
example.tran: 无神论哲学家

sense.def: An athlete is a person who does a sport, especially athletics, or track and field events.
sense.tran: （尤指田径项目的）运动员，运动选手

example.ex: Daley Thompson was a great athlete.
example.tran: 戴利·汤普森是位著名的运动员。

sense.def: You can refer to someone who is fit and athletic as an athlete .
sense.tran: 运动健儿;身强力壮的人

example.ex: I was no athlete.
example.tran: 我根本不是当运动员的料。

sense.def: Athlete's foot is a fungal infection in which the skin between the toes becomes cracked or peels off.
Athletic means relating to athletes and athletics.
sense.tran: 运动的;体育的;运动员的

example.ex: They have been given college scholarships purely on athletic ability...
example.tran: 他们完全是凭体育特长才获得了大学奖学金。

example.ex: Most athletic activities are about individual effort.
example.tran: 大多数体育项目是靠个人的拼搏。

example.ex: ...she's academically able and athletically outstanding.
example.tran: 她学业优秀，体育方面也很突出。

sense.def: An athletic person is fit, and able to perform energetic movements easily.

example.ex: Xandra is an athletic 36-year-old with a 21-year-old's body...
example.tran: 36岁的汉德拉身体健壮，有着21岁小伙子的体能。

example.ex: He was tall, with an athletic build.
example.tran: 他高大健壮。

example.ex: He jumped athletically out of the car.
example.tran: 他身手矫捷地跳出了车子。

sense.def: Athleticism is someone's fitness and ability to perform well at sports or other physical activities.

example.ex: Her athleticism drew the admiration of the crowd.
example.tran: 她的运动才能令众人赞叹不已。

sense.def: Athletics refers to track and field sports such as running, the high jump, and the javelin.

example.ex: As the modern Olympics grew in stature, so too did athletics.
example.tran: 随着现代奥林匹克运动会声名远扬，田径运动也越来越受关注。

example.ex: ...the International Amateur Athletics Federation.
example.tran: 国际业余田径联合会

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 track and field

sense.def: Athletics refers to any kind of physical sports, exercise, or games.

example.ex: ...students who play intercollegiate athletics.
example.tran: 参加大学校际体育竞赛的学生

sense.def: -ation and -ion are added to some verbs in order to form nouns. Nouns formed in this way often refer to a state or process; for example, starvation is the process of starving, and victimization is the process of being victimized.
sense.tran: (用于某些动词后构成名词，通常表示一种状态或过程）

sense.def: Atishoo is used, especially in writing, to represent the sound that you make when you sneeze.
sense.tran: 阿嚏（尤用于书面语，表示打喷嚏的声音）

sense.def: An atlas is a book of maps.

An ATM is a machine built into the wall of a bank or other building, which allows people to take out money from their bank account by using a special card. ATM is an abbreviation for（缩略=）'automated teller machine'.

entry.boxr: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 cash dispenser

sense.def: A planet's atmosphere is the layer of air or other gases around it.

example.ex: ...dangerous levels of pollution in the Earth's atmosphere...
example.tran: 地球大气层污染程度严重

example.ex: The Partial Test-Ban Treaty bans nuclear testing in the atmosphere.
example.tran: 《部分禁止核试验条约》禁止在大气层中进行核试验。

sense.def: The atmosphere of a place is the air that you breathe there.

example.ex: These gases pollute the atmosphere of towns and cities.
example.tran: 这些气体污染了城镇的空气。

sense.def: The atmosphere of a place is the general impression that you get of it.

example.ex: Pale wooden floors and plenty of natural light add to the relaxed atmosphere...
example.tran: 淡色木地板和充足的自然光平添了几分轻松的氛围。

example.ex: There's still an atmosphere of great hostility and tension in the city.
example.tran: 强烈的敌对和紧张气氛依然笼罩着这座城市。

sense.def: If a place or an event has atmosphere, it is interesting.

example.ex: The old harbour is still full of atmosphere and well worth visiting.
example.tran: 这座古老的港口依然充满了情趣，颇值得一游。

sense.def: Atmospheric is used to describe something which relates to the earth's atmosphere.
sense.tran: 大气的;大气层的;空气的

example.ex: ...atmospheric gases.
example.tran: 大气中的气体

example.ex: ...atmospheric pressure.
example.tran: 大气压

sense.def: If you describe a place or a piece of music as atmospheric, you like it because it has a particular quality which is interesting or exciting and makes you feel a particular emotion.
sense.tran: （地方、音乐等）有情调的，有魅力的，有感染力的

example.ex: ...beautiful, atmospheric music...
example.tran: 优美的、有情调的音乐

example.ex: One of the most atmospheric corners of Prague is the old Jewish ghetto.
example.tran: 古老的犹太人社区是布拉格最具特色的角落之一。

sense.def: Atmospherics are elements in something such as a piece of music or a book which create a certain atmosphere.

example.ex: ...Dickensian atmospherics.
example.tran: 狄更斯小说的情调

sense.def: An atoll is a ring of coral rock, or a group of coral islands surrounding a lagoon.
An atom is the smallest amount of a substance that can take part in a chemical reaction.

example.ex: A methane molecule is composed of one carbon atom attached to four hydrogens.
example.tran: 甲烷分子由1个碳原子与4个氢原子构成。

sense.def: Atomic means relating to power that is produced from the energy released by splitting atoms.

example.ex: ...atomic energy.
example.tran: 原子能

example.ex: ...atomic weapons.
example.tran: 核武器

sense.def: Atomic means relating to the atoms of substances.

entry.boxr: The form atom bomb is also used, mainly in British English. 亦写作atom bomb, 主要用于英国英语。

sense.def: An atomic bomb or an atom bomb is a bomb that causes an explosion by a sudden release of energy that results from splitting atoms.
Atonal music is music that is not written or played in any key or system of scales.
If you atone for something that you have done, you do something to show that you are sorry you did it.

example.ex: He felt he had atoned for what he had done to his son...
example.tran: 他觉得他对儿子已无亏欠。

example.ex: He atoned by apologizing...
example.tran: 他道歉赔罪。

example.ex: I'll never live long enough to atone.
example.tran: 我一生都无法弥补。

sense.def: If you do something as an atonement for doing something wrong, you do it to show that you are sorry.

example.ex: He's living in a monastery in a gesture of atonement for human rights abuses committed under his leadership...
example.tran: 为了弥补自己当权时对人权的践踏，他以出家来谢罪。

example.ex: True guilt is characterized by a readiness to make atonement for having done wrong.
example.tran: 真正的内疚表现为愿意弥补所犯的过错。

sense.def: If something is atop something else, it is on top of it.

example.ex: Under the newspaper, atop a sheet of paper, lay an envelope.
example.tran: 在报纸下面的一张纸上放着一个信封。

sense.def: An A to Z is a book of maps showing all the streets and roads in a particular city and its surrounding towns.
An A to Z of a particular subject is a book or programme which gives information on all aspects of it, arranging it in alphabetical order.
sense.tran: （按字母顺序排列的）名册，手册，大全

example.ex: An A to Z of careers gives helpful information about courses.
example.tran: 按字母顺序排列的职业大全提供了有助于课程选择的信息。

sense.def: An atrium is a part of a building such as a hotel or shopping centre, which extends up through several floors of the building and often has a glass roof.
If you describe something as atrocious, you are emphasizing that its quality is very bad.

example.ex: I remain to this day fluent in Hebrew, while my Arabic is atrocious...
example.tran: 时至今日，我的希伯来语仍很流利，但阿拉伯语却糟透了。

example.ex: The food here is atrocious.
example.tran: 这里的食物难以下咽。

example.ex: He had written the note from memory, word perfect, and spelled atrociously.
example.tran: 他凭着记忆作了记录，用词恰当但拼写错误百出。

sense.def: If you describe someone's behaviour or their actions as atrocious, you mean that it is unacceptable because it is extremely violent or cruel.
sense.tran: （行为、行动）残暴的，凶恶的，残忍的

example.ex: The judge said he had committed atrocious crimes against women...
example.tran: 法官说他对妇女犯下了滔天罪行。

example.ex: The treatment of the prisoners by their captors is atrocious and breaks all international laws.
example.tran: 俘获者对待囚犯异常凶残，违反一切国际法律。

sense.def: If you say that weather conditions are atrocious, you mean they are very bad, for example that it is extremely cold, wet, or windy.

example.ex: ...closed roads and atrocious weather: snow in the mountains, torrential rain elsewhere.
example.tran: 道路封锁，天气恶劣：山区雪花纷飞，其他地方大雨倾盆

sense.def: An atrocity is a very cruel, shocking action.

example.ex: The killing was cold-blooded, and those who committed this atrocity should be tried and punished.
example.tran: 杀戮异常残暴。那些犯下如此暴行的人都应该受到审判和惩罚。

sense.def: If a muscle or other part of the body atrophies, it decreases in size or strength, often as a result of an illness.

example.ex: Scott's muscle atrophied, his leg became stunted, and he was left lame...
example.tran: 斯科特的肌肉萎缩,一条腿发育不完全，成了个瘸子。

example.ex: Patients exercised their atrophied limbs in the swimming pool.
example.tran: 病人们在泳池里锻炼萎缩的四肢。

example.ex: ...exercises to avoid jelling and atrophy of cartilage.
example.tran: 防止软骨硬化和萎缩而进行的锻炼

sense.def: If something atrophies, its size, degree, or effectiveness decreases because it is not used or protected.
sense.tran: （事物的尺寸、程度、影响力等由于不使用或未受到保护而）变小，退化

example.ex: If you allow your mind to stagnate, this particular talent will atrophy...
example.tran: 如果你老不用脑，那么这一特殊才能就会退化。

example.ex: Many hoped he would renew the country's atrophied political system.
example.tran: 很多人都期望他能使该国萎靡的政治体系振作起来。

example.ex: ...levels of consciousness which are nowadays usurped by television and in danger of atrophy.
example.tran: 如今被电视所侵占而可能会逐渐丧失的思想意识

sense.def: If you attach something to an object, you join it or fasten it to the object.

example.ex: We attach labels to things before we file them away...
example.tran: 存档前，我们先贴上标签。

example.ex: The gadget can be attached to any vertical surface...
example.tran: 这小玩意儿可以粘在任何垂直表面上。

example.ex: The astronauts will attach a motor that will boost the satellite into its proper orbit...
example.tran: 宇航员们将安装一个发动机，以推动卫星进入正常运行轨道。

example.ex: For further information, please contact us on the attached form.
example.tran: 欲知详情，请使用所附表格联系我们。

sense.def: If someone attaches himself or herself to you, they join you and stay with you, often without being invited to do so.
sense.tran: （通常未受邀请而）加入，和…在一起，缠着

example.ex: Natasha attached herself to the film crew filming at her orphanage.
example.tran: 娜塔莎紧紧缠着在孤儿院拍摄电影的工作人员不放。

sense.def: If people attach a quality to someone or something, or if it attaches to them, people consider that they have that quality.

example.ex: The authorities attached much significance to his visit.
example.tran: 当局非常重视他的访问。

example.ex: ...the magic that still attaches to the word 'spy'.
example.tran: “间谍”一词依然具有的神奇魅力

example.ex: ...the stigma attached to mental illness.
example.tran: 精神病所背负的污名

sense.def: If you attach conditions to something such as an agreement, you state that specific things must be done before the agreement is valid.

example.ex: Activists are pressing the banks to attach political conditions to the signing of any new agreement...
example.tran: 激进分子强烈要求银行在签署任何新协议前要考虑政治条件。

example.ex: Magistrates will be able to attach conditions when juveniles are remanded.
example.tran: 地方法官将可以在少年犯送押时提出附加条件。

sense.def: In computing, if you attach a file to a message that you send to someone, you send it with the message but separate from it.

example.ex: It is possible to attach executable program files to e-mail.
example.tran: 可以在电子邮件里附上可执行程序文件。

sense.def: An attaché is a member of staff in an embassy, usually with a special responsibility for something.
sense.tran: （通常有特殊责任的）大使随员,大使馆专员，参赞

example.ex: He was working as a cultural attaché in Warsaw.
example.tran: 他那时是驻华沙的文化参赞。

sense.def: An attach case is a flat case for holding documents.
If you are attached to someone or something, you like them very much.

example.ex: She is very attached to her family and friends.
example.tran: 她非常热爱家人和朋友。

sense.def: If someone is attached to an organization or group of people, they are working with them, often only for a short time.
sense.tran: （通常只是短时间）从属于…的，为…工作的

example.ex: Ford was attached to the battalion's first line of transport.
example.tran: 福特曾在该营的第一运输队服役。

sense.def: If one organization or institution is attached to a larger organization, it is part of that organization and is controlled and run by it.

example.ex: At one time the schools were mainly attached to the church.
example.tran: 这些学校曾一度归教会主管。

example.ex: ...a think-tank, attached to the Academy of Sciences.
example.tran: 为科学院出谋划策的智囊团

sense.def: If you have an attachment to someone or something, you are fond of them or loyal to them.

example.ex: As a teenager she formed a strong attachment to one of her teachers...
example.tran: 少女时代的她曾迷上了自己的一个老师。

example.ex: Mother and child form a close attachment.
example.tran: 母子情深。

example.ex: ...a feeling of attachment to the land where their ancestors have lived.
example.tran: 他们对祖祖辈辈生活过的土地的深深依恋

sense.def: An attachment is a device that can be fixed onto a machine in order to enable it to do different jobs.

example.ex: Some models come with attachments for dusting.
example.tran: 一些模型上附带了除尘器。

sense.def: If someone is on attachment to another company, department, or place, they are working there temporarily.

example.ex: During her course she worked on attachment for six months at Kew Gardens...
example.tran: 在上学期间，她曾临时到基尤植物园工作了6个月。

example.ex: Before coming on my attachment to a City law firm, I spent a year at Strasbourg University.
example.tran: 在被临时派往伦敦的一家律师事务所工作前，我在斯特拉斯堡大学学习了一年。

sense.def: An attachment is an extra document that is added to another document.

example.ex: Justice Fitzgerald included a 120-page discussion paper as an attachment to the annual report.
example.tran: 在年度报告上，法官菲茨杰拉德附上了一篇长达120页的讨论稿。

sense.def: In computing, an attachment is a file which is attached separately to a message that you send to someone.

example.ex: When you send an e-mail you can also send a sound or graphic file as an attachment.
example.tran: 在发送电子邮件时，你也可以附上一份声音或图片文件。

sense.def: To attack a person or place means to try to hurt or damage them using physical violence.

example.ex: Fifty civilians in Masawa were killed when government planes attacked the town...
example.tran: 马萨瓦市遭到政府军飞机轰炸，有50名平民丧生。

example.ex: He bundled the old lady into her hallway and brutally attacked her...
example.tran: 他将老妇人推到她家走廊上，并对她一顿暴打。

example.ex: While Haig and Foch argued, the Germans attacked...
example.tran: 黑格和福克正在争论时，德国人发起了进攻。

example.ex: The infantry would use hit and run tactics to slow attacking forces.
example.tran: 步兵团可能会使用打了就跑的战术来阻滞进攻部队。

example.ex: ...a campaign of air attacks on strategic targets...
example.tran: 对战略目标的空袭行动

example.ex: Refugees had come under attack from federal troops.
example.tran: 难民遭到了联邦军队的袭击。

sense.def: If you attack a person, belief, idea, or act, you criticize them strongly.

example.ex: He publicly attacked the people who've been calling for secret ballot nominations...
example.tran: 他公开抨击了那些主张用不记名投票方式确定任命人选的人。

example.ex: A newspaper ran an editorial attacking him for being a showman.
example.tran: 一家报纸发表社论，批评他善于作秀。

example.ex: The role of the state as a prime mover in planning social change has been under attack...
example.tran: 国家扮演的规划社会变革的原动力角色颇受争议。

example.ex: The committee yesterday launched a scathing attack on British business for failing to invest.
example.tran: 昨天，该委员会严厉指责了英国商界未进行投资。

sense.def: If something such as a disease, a chemical, or an insect attacks something, it harms or spoils it.
sense.tran: （疾病、化学药品、昆虫等）攻击，侵蚀，破坏

example.ex: The virus seems to have attacked his throat...
example.tran: 病毒看来已经侵蚀到他喉部了。

example.ex: Several key crops failed when they were attacked by pests.
example.tran: 一些主要农作物由于遭受虫害而歉收。

example.ex: The virus can actually destroy those white blood cells, leaving the body wide open to attack from other infections.
example.tran: 该病毒实际上会破坏那些白血球，使身体极易受到其他传染病感染。

sense.def: If you attack a job or a problem, you start to deal with it in an energetic way.

example.ex: Any attempt to attack the budget problem is going to have to in some way deal with those issues.
example.tran: 要解决预算问题，在某种程度上就必须解决那些问题。

sense.def: In games such as football, when one team attacks the opponent's goal, they try to score a goal.

example.ex: Now the US is controlling the ball and attacking the opponent's goal...
example.tran: 现在美国队控球，向对方球门展开了进攻。

example.ex: The goal was just reward for Villa's decision to attack constantly in the second half.
example.tran: 在下半场，维拉队持续进攻的打法为他们赢得了这个进球。

example.ex: Lee was at the hub of some incisive attacks in the second half.
example.tran: 在下半场，李组织了几次快速进攻。

example.ex: Manchester City will play a more attacking style of football.
example.tran: 曼城队将大打攻势足球。

sense.def: An attack of an illness is a short period in which you suffer badly from it.

example.ex: It had brought on an attack of asthma.
example.tran: 这引发了哮喘。

sense.def: You can refer to a person who attacks someone as their attacker .

example.ex: There were signs that she struggled with her attacker before she was repeatedly stabbed.
example.tran: 有迹象表明，在她被连刺数刀前，曾与袭击者进行过搏斗。

sense.def: If you attain something, you gain it or achieve it, often after a lot of effort.

example.ex: Jim is halfway to attaining his pilot's licence.
example.tran: 吉姆就快要拿到飞行员执照了。

sense.def: If you attain a particular state or condition, you may reach it as a result of natural development or work hard to attain this state.
sense.tran: 达到，进入，实现（某种状态或情况）

example.ex: ...attaining a state of calmness and confidence.
example.tran: 达到镇定自若、信心十足的状态

sense.def: Something that is attainable can be achieved.

example.ex: It is unrealistic to believe perfection is an attainable goal.
example.tran: 相信完美可以企及是不现实的。

sense.def: The attainment of an aim is the achieving of it.

example.ex: ...the attainment of independence.
example.tran: 实现独立

sense.def: An attainment is a skill you have learned or something you have achieved.

example.ex: ...their educational attainments.
example.tran: 他们的学业成就

sense.def: If you attempt to do something, especially something difficult, you try to do it.
sense.tran: 尝试，试图（尤指做困难的事）

example.ex: The only time that we attempted to do something like that was in the city of Philadelphia...
example.tran: 只有在费城那次我们曾试着做那样的事。

example.ex: Before I could attempt a reply he added over his shoulder: 'Wait there.'
example.tran: 还没等我回答他就回头又说了一句：“在那儿等着。”

sense.hdgr: usu with supp, oft N to-inf
sense.def: If you make an attempt to do something, you try to do it, often without success.
sense.tran: （通常指不成功的）尝试，企图，试图

example.ex: ...a deliberate attempt to destabilise the defence...
example.tran: 经过深思熟虑的破坏该防御的尝试

example.ex: It was one of his rare attempts at humour.
example.tran: 那是他极不常见的想要表现幽默的一次。

example.ex: ...their involvement in a coup attempt in September.
example.tran: 他们参与了9月的那场失败的政变

sense.def: An attempt on some-one's life is an attempt to kill them.

example.ex: ...an attempt on the life of the former Iranian Prime Minister.
example.tran: 试图杀害伊朗前总理

sense.def: In British English, if a sportsman or sportswoman makes an attempt on a sporting record, they try to beat it. In American English you say that they make an attempt to break it.
sense.tran: （运动员创造纪录的）尝试，冲击

example.ex: Everything is almost ready for me to make another attempt on the record.
example.tran: 一切几乎都已准备就绪，就等我向纪录发起再一次冲击了。

sense.def: An attempted crime or unlawful action is an unsuccessful effort to commit the crime or action.
sense.tran: （犯罪、不法行为）未遂的，未得手的

example.ex: ...a case of attempted murder...
example.tran: 谋杀未遂案

example.ex: The attempted coup took place in January.
example.tran: 那场未遂政变发生在1月份。

sense.def: If you attend a meeting or other event, you are present at it.

example.ex: Thousands of people attended the funeral...
example.tran: 数千人参加了葬礼。

example.ex: The meeting will be attended by finance ministers from many countries...
example.tran: 很多国家的财政部长将出席会议。

example.ex: We want the maximum number of people to attend to help us cover our costs.
example.tran: 我们希望有尽量多的人参加，以帮我们平衡支出。

sense.def: If you attend an institution such as a school, college, or church, you go there regularly.

example.ex: They attended college together at the University of Pennsylvania.
example.tran: 他们一起就读于宾夕法尼亚大学。

sense.def: If you attend to something, you deal with it. If you attend to someone who is hurt or injured, you care for them.
sense.tran: 处理，料理（事情）；照顾，护理（受伤的人）

example.ex: The staff will helpfully attend to your needs...
example.tran: 工作人员会帮忙满足您的需求。

example.ex: There are more pressing matters to be attended to today...
example.tran: 今天有更紧急的事情要处理。

example.ex: The main thing is to attend to the injured.
example.tran: 首要任务是照顾伤者。

sense.def: Someone's attendance at an event or an institution is the fact that they are present at the event or go regularly to the institution.

example.ex: Her attendance at school was sporadic.
example.tran: 她三天两头旷课。

sense.def: The attendance at an event is the number of people who are present at it.

example.ex: Average weekly cinema attendance in February was 2.41 million...
example.tran: 2月份，平均每周的观影人数为241万。

example.ex: This year attendances were 28% lower than forecast...
example.tran: 今年的出席人数比预期少28%。

example.ex: Some estimates put the attendance at 60,000.
example.tran: 一些预测认为将有6万人参加。

phrase.def: If someone is in attendance at a place or an event, they are there.

example.ex: Councillor Paul Tisley will be in attendance at the start of the meeting to welcome us...
example.tran: 议员保罗·提斯里将在会议开始时出席，以欢迎我们。

example.ex: Police with riot gear and several fire engines are in attendance.
example.tran: 防暴警察和数辆消防车都到了。

phrase.def: If someone is in attendance on an important person, they are accompanying that person as a servant or assistant.

example.ex: He lived in considerable style, travelling widely, usually with a cook, valet, butler and chauffeur in attendance.
example.tran: 他活得相当潇洒，通常带着厨师、用人、管家和司机到处游玩。

sense.def: An attendant is someone whose job is to serve or help people in a place such as a petrol station, a car park, or a cloakroom.
sense.tran: （加油站、停车场、更衣室等的）服务员，侍者

example.ex: Tony Williams was working as a car-park attendant in Los Angeles.
example.tran: 托尼·威廉斯在洛杉矶的一个停车场当服务生。

sense.hdgr:
ADJ n, v-link ADJ
on/upon n
sense.def: You use attendant to describe something that results from a thing already mentioned or that is connected with it.

example.ex: Mr Branson's victory, and all the attendant publicity, were well deserved.
example.tran: 布兰森先生的胜利，以及随之而来的关注度，都是理所应当的。

example.ex: ...the risks attendant on the exploration of the unknown.
example.tran: 探索未知所带来的危险

sense.def: The attendees at something such as a meeting or a conference are the people who are attending it.

example.ex: Only one-half of the attendees could fit into the large hall at any one time.
example.tran: 这个大厅一次只能容下一半的出席者。

sense.hdgr:
usu adj N, oft N
at/in/of n
sense.def: The attenders at a particular place or event are the people who go there.

example.ex: He was a regular attender at the opera.
example.tran: 他是剧院的常客。

sense.hdgr: also N in pl, usu with poss
sense.def: If you give someone or something your attention, you look at it, listen to it, or think about it carefully.

example.ex: You have my undivided attention...
example.tran: 我专心听你所讲。

example.ex: Later he turned his attention to the desperate state of housing in the province.
example.tran: 其后，他将注意力转向了该省形势严峻的住房问题。

example.ex: ...young children with short attention spans.
example.tran: 很难长时间保持注意力集中的小孩子

sense.def: Attention is great interest that is shown in someone or something, particularly by the general public.

example.ex: Volume Two, subtitled 'The Lawyers', will also attract considerable attention...
example.tran: 副标题为“律师”的第二册也将获得广泛关注。

example.ex: The conference may help to focus attention on the economy.
example.tran: 此次会议可能有助于将关注焦点放在经济上。

sense.def: If someone or something is getting attention, they are being dealt with or cared for.

example.ex: Each year more than two million household injuries need medical attention.
example.tran: 每年有超过200万起家中受伤事件需要医疗处理。

example.ex: ...a demanding baby who seems to want attention 24 hours a day.
example.tran: 好像一天24小时都要人照看的难缠的宝宝

sense.def: You can refer to someone's efforts to help you, or the interest they show in you, as their attentions, especially if you dislike or disapprove of them.

example.ex: The only way to escape the unwanted attentions of the local men was not to go out...
example.tran: 避免被当地人指指点点的唯一办法就是闭门不出。

example.ex: The meeting was held away from the attentions of the media...
example.tran: 会议的举行避开了媒体的关注。

example.ex: Some men are flattered by the attentions of a young woman.
example.tran: 年轻女性的倾心会使一些男人飘飘然起来。

sense.def: If you bring something to someone's attention or draw their attention to it, you tell them about it or make them notice it.

example.ex: If we don't keep bringing this to the attention of the people, nothing will be done...
example.tran: 如果我们无法让群众一直关注此事，那将一事无成。

example.ex: We conclude by drawing attention to the issues around which the debate should focus.
example.tran: 我们作总结时着重提到了辩论应该关注的一些问题。

phrase.def: If someone or something attracts your attention or catches your attention, you suddenly notice them.

example.ex: A faint aroma of coffee attracted his attention...
example.tran: 淡淡的咖啡香味一下子吸引了他。

example.ex: He sat at one of the round tables and tried to attract her attention.
example.tran: 他坐在其中一张圆桌旁边，想引起她的注意。

phrase.def: If you pay attention to someone, you watch them, listen to them, or take notice of them. If you pay no attention to someone, you behave as if you are not aware of them or as if they are not important.
phrase.tran: 关心/不关心；注意/不注意

example.ex: More than ever before, the food industry is paying attention to young consumers...
example.tran: 食品工业比以往任何时候都更加关注年轻消费者。

example.ex: Other people walk along the beach at night, so I didn't pay any attention at first...
example.tran: 入夜后还有人在沙滩上散步，起先我并没注意到。

example.ex: I was living just for myself and paying little attention to God.
example.tran: 我过去只为自己活，哪管上帝怎么想。

phrase.def: When people stand to attention or stand at attention, they stand straight with their feet together and their arms at their sides.

example.ex: Soldiers in full combat gear stood at attention...
example.tran: 全副武装的士兵们立正站着。

example.ex: The waiters stood to attention with napkins folded over their arms.
example.tran: 服务员笔直站立着，餐巾折叠着放在他们的手臂上。

sense.def: Attention deficit disorder is a condition where people, especially children, are unable to concentrate on anything for very long and so find it difficult to learn and often behave in inappropriate ways. The abbreviation ADD is often used.
sense.tran: （尤指儿童的）注意力缺乏症（常使用缩略形式ADD）

sense.def: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder is a condition where people, especially children, are extremely active and unable to concentrate on anything for very long, with the result that they find it difficult to learn and often behave in inappropriate ways. The abbreviation ADHD is often used.
sense.tran: （尤指儿童的）注意力缺乏多动症（常使用缩略形式ADHD）

sense.def: An attention-grabbing remark or activity is one that is intended to make people notice it.
sense.tran: （言语或行为）吸引公众注意的

example.ex: ...an attention-grabbing marketing campaign.
example.tran: 吸引眼球的营销活动

sense.def: If you are attentive, you are paying close attention to what is being said or done.

example.ex: The vast majority of the attentive audience applauded these sentiments...
example.tran: 大多数聚精会神听讲的观众都对这些观点表示赞赏。

example.ex: He wishes the government would be more attentive to detail in their response.
example.tran: 他希望政府的回应能更加关注细节。

example.ex: He questioned Chrissie, and listened attentively to what she told him.
example.tran: 他询问了克里茜，并仔细聆听她所说的话。

sense.def: Someone who is attentive is helpful and polite.

example.ex: At society parties he is attentive to his wife...
example.tran: 在社交聚会上，他对妻子体贴周到。

example.ex: The staff is well trained in courteous and attentive service to each and every guest.
example.tran: 员工训练有素，为每一位客人提供礼貌周到的服务。

example.ex: Anne was both flattered and surprised by Danny's attentiveness to her.
example.tran: 丹尼的大献殷勤让安妮受宠若惊。

sense.def: To attenuate something means to reduce it or weaken it.

example.ex: You could never eliminate risk, but preparation and training could attenuate it...
example.tran: 风险不可能完全消除，但可以通过防范和培训来降低。

example.ex: Theirs had been an increasingly attenuated relationship.
example.tran: 他们的关系日益冷淡。

sense.def: An attenuated object is unusually long and thin.

example.ex: ...round arches and attenuated columns.
example.tran: 圆拱门和细长石柱

sense.def: To attest something or attest to something means to say, show, or prove that it is true.
sense.tran: 说明，表示，证明（某事属实）

example.ex: Police records attest to his long history of violence...
example.tran: 警方记录证明他有长期从事暴力活动的前科。

example.ex: I can personally attest that the cold and flu season is here...
example.tran: 感冒和流感季节来了，对此我有切身体会。

example.ex: His beautifully illustrated book well attested his love of the university.
example.tran: 他那本带有精美插图的书见证了他对大学的热爱。

sense.def: An attic is a room at the top of a house just below the roof.
Your attire is the clothes you are wearing.

example.ex: ...seven women dressed in their finest attire.
example.tran: 七个盛装打扮的女子

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ
in n, adv ADJ
sense.def: If you describe how someone is attired, you are describing how they are dressed.

example.ex: He was faultlessly attired in black coat and striped trousers.
example.tran: 他穿着黑色上衣和条纹裤子，简直无可挑剔。

sense.hdgr:
usu with supp, oft N
to/towards n
sense.def: Your attitude to something is the way that you think and feel about it, especially when this shows in the way you behave.
sense.tran: （尤指从行为中表现出来的）态度，看法

example.ex: ...the general change in attitude towards handicapped people...
example.tran: 对残疾人态度的整体转变

example.ex: Being unemployed produces negative attitudes to work...
example.tran: 失业会产生对工作的消极态度。

example.ex: His attitude made me angry...
example.tran: 他的态度让我很生气。

example.ex: I don't think it's fair to accuse me of having an attitude problem.
example.tran: 我觉得指责我有态度问题有失公允。

sense.def: If you refer to someone as a person with attitude, you mean that they have a striking and individual style of behaviour, especially a forceful or aggressive one.
sense.tran: 个人风格;（尤指）咄咄逼人的作派

example.ex: Patti Smith and Janis Joplin did it all years ago and they were women with attitude and talent.
example.tran: 帕蒂·史密斯和詹妮斯·乔普林多年前就这样做过，她们当时是两位个性鲜明的才女。

sense.def: Your attitude of mind is your general way of thinking and feeling.

example.ex: Writing calls for a critical attitude of mind that he did not possess.
example.tran: 写作需要有批判性思维，而这正是他所不具备的。

sense.def: Attitudinal means related to people's attitudes and the way they look at their life.

example.ex: Does such an attitudinal change reflect real experiences in daily life?
example.tran: 人生观的这种转变是否反映了日常生活中的真实遭遇？

sense.def: In the United States, an attorney or attorney at law is a lawyer.

example.ex: ...a prosecuting attorney.
example.tran: 检察官

sense.def: A country's Attorney General is its chief law officer, who advises its government or ruler.
sense.tran: 检察总长;首席检察官;司法部长

sense.def: If something attracts people or animals, it has features that cause them to come to it.

example.ex: The Cardiff Bay project is attracting many visitors...
example.tran: 加的夫海湾项目吸引了众多游客。

example.ex: Warm weather has attracted the flat fish close to shore...
example.tran: 煦暖的气候将比目鱼引到了近海。

example.ex: Summer attracts visitors to the countryside.
example.tran: 在夏季，乡村游很吸引游客。

sense.def: If someone or something attracts you, they have particular qualities which cause you to like or admire them. If a particular quality attracts you to a person or thing, it is the reason why you like them.
sense.tran: 引起…的注意（或兴趣、赞赏等）；诱惑

example.ex: He wasn't sure he'd got it right, although the theory attracted him by its logic...
example.tran: 该理论的逻辑性吸引了他，但他不能确定自己的理解是否正确。

example.ex: What first attracted me to her was her incredible experience of life...
example.tran: 她离奇的人生经历最先吸引了我。

example.ex: More people would be attracted to cycling if conditions were right.
example.tran: 如果天气适宜，会有更多的人被吸引到骑自行车的行列中来。

sense.def: If you are attracted to someone, you are interested in them sexually.

example.ex: In spite of her hostility, she was attracted to him...
example.tran: 尽管自己心存敌意，她还是为他所吸引。

example.ex: I was married to a man who had ceased to attract me.
example.tran: 我嫁给了一个我已不再钟情的男人。

rnon.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, usu ADJ
to n

example.ex: He was nice looking, but I wasn't deeply attracted to him...
example.tran: 他长得很帅，可我对他不是很有感觉。

example.ex: Men swarmed around her, attracted by her beautiful blonde looks.
example.tran: 男人们被她金发碧眼的美貌迷得团团转。

sense.def: If something attracts support, publicity, or money, it receives support, publicity, or money.
sense.tran: 吸引，招引（支持、关注或金钱）

example.ex: President Mwinyi said his country would also like to attract investment from private companies...
example.tran: 姆维尼总统说他的国家同样愿意吸收来自私营公司的投资。

example.ex: Opinion polls suggest that the two rebels have attracted a lot of sympathy.
example.tran: 民意测验显示两名反对者获得了大量支持。

sense.def: If one object attracts another object, it causes the second object to move towards it.

example.ex: Anything with strong gravity attracts other things to it.
example.tran: 任何有较强重力的物体都会对其他物体产生引力。

sense.def: Attraction is a feeling of liking someone, and often of being sexually interested in them.

example.ex: Our level of attraction to the opposite sex has more to do with our inner confidence than how we look...
example.tran: 我们对异性的吸引程度更多的来自内在的自信，而不是长相。

example.ex: His love for her was not just physical attraction.
example.tran: 他对她的爱慕不只是肉体的吸引。

sense.def: An attraction is a feature which makes something interesting or desirable.

example.ex: ...the attractions of living on the waterfront.
example.tran: 令人神往的滨水生活

sense.def: An attraction is something that people can go to for interest or enjoyment, for example a famous building.
sense.tran: 有吸引力的地方（或事物）

example.ex: The walled city is an important tourist attraction.
example.tran: 这座由城墙围绕的城市是个重要的旅游胜地。

sense.def: A person who is attractive is pleasant to look at.

example.ex: She's a very attractive woman...
example.tran: 她是个妩媚动人的女子。

example.ex: I thought he was very attractive and obviously very intelligent...
example.tran: 我觉得他魅力非凡，才智过人。

example.ex: He was always immensely attractive to women.
example.tran: 他总是让女人们神魂颠倒。

example.ex: Most of us would maintain that physical attractiveness does not play a major part in how we react to the people we meet.
example.tran: 我们大部分人坚持认为我们对遇到的人作出何种反应并不取决于其外在的魅力。

sense.def: Something that is attractive has a pleasant appearance or sound.

example.ex: The flat was small but attractive, if rather shabby...
example.tran: 虽然有些老旧，这仍不失为一个漂亮的小公寓。

example.ex: The creamy white flowers are attractive in the spring.
example.tran: 在春天，这种乳白色的花朵分外迷人。

example.ex: It's an attractively illustrated, detailed guide that's very practical.
example.tran: 这是一本很实用的指南，插图精美，内容详尽。

example.ex: The forest will enhance the attractiveness of the region.
example.tran: 这片森林会为该地区平添更多魅力。

sense.def: You can describe something as attractive when it seems worth having or doing.
sense.tran: 吸引人的;值得拥有（或做）的

example.ex: Co-operation was more than just an attractive option, it was an obligation...
example.tran: 合作不仅仅是诱人的选择，它也是一种责任。

example.ex: Smoking is still attractive to many young people who see it as glamorous.
example.tran: 吸烟对很多年轻人还是很有诱惑力，他们觉得这让自己显得魅力十足。

example.ex: The services are attractively priced and are tailored to suit individual requirements.
example.tran: 服务费价格诱人且内容按个人需求量身定制。

example.ex: The attractiveness of the schemes depends almost entirely on tax relief.
example.tran: 该方案之所以吸引人几乎全倚仗其税费减免政策。

sense.def: If something is attributable to an event, situation, or person, it is likely that it was caused by that event, situation or person.
sense.tran: 可归因于…的，可归结于…的

example.ex: 10,000 deaths a year from chronic lung disease are attributable to smoking...
example.tran: 吸烟导致每年有1万人死于慢性肺病。

example.ex: The mess was directly attributable to a corrupt and incompetent official.
example.tran: 某个腐败无能的官员是导致这一烂摊子的罪魁祸首。

entry.boxr: The verb is pronounced /ə'trɪbjuːt/. The noun is pronounced /'ætrɪbjuːt/. 动词读作/ə'trɪbjuːt/，名词读作/'ætrɪbjuːt/。

sense.def: If you attribute something to an event or situation, you think that it was caused by that event or situation.

example.ex: Women tend to attribute their success to external causes such as luck.
example.tran: 女性倾向于将她们的成功归因于外部因素，比如运气。

sense.def: If you attribute a particular quality or feature to someone or something, you think that they have got it.
sense.tran: 将（品质或特征）加于…;认为…为…所有

example.ex: People were beginning to attribute superhuman qualities to him.
example.tran: 人们开始觉得他超人一等。

example.ex: There's usually a lot of attribution of evil intent to those who have different views.
example.tran: 那些持异议者通常多被认为心怀邪念。

sense.def: If a piece of writing, a work of art, or a remark is attributed to someone, people say that they wrote it, created it, or said it.
sense.tran: 认为(文章、艺术品或评论）出自…

example.ex: This, and the remaining frescoes, are not attributed to Giotto.
example.tran: 这个，还有那些残存的湿壁画，都不是乔托的作品。

example.ex: ...a Madonna and Child attributed to Pietro Lorenzetti.
example.tran: 被认为出自彼得罗·洛伦泽蒂之手的作品《圣母子》

sense.def: An attribute is a quality or feature that someone or something has.

example.ex: Cruelty is a normal attribute of human behaviour...
example.tran: 残忍是人的天性之一。

example.ex: He has every attribute you could want and could play for any team.
example.tran: 他具备你想要的所有品质，放在哪个队都行。

sense.def: Attrition is a process in which you steadily reduce the strength of an enemy by continually attacking them.

example.ex: The rebels have declared a ceasefire in their war of attrition against the government.
example.tran: 在与政府的消耗战中，反叛者宣布停火。

sense.def: At a university or place of work, attrition is the decrease in the number of students or employees caused by people leaving and not being replaced.

example.ex: The company plans to cut a quarter of its workforce over six years through natural attrition and fewer hirings.
example.tran: 公司计划在6年内通过人员自然流失和减少雇用使员工总数减少1/4。

sense.def: If you are attuned to something, you can understand and appreciate it.
sense.tran: 适应的;理解的;与…合拍的

example.ex: I have become attuned to Carlisle's industrial past...
example.tran: 我对于卡莱尔市过去的工业史已经有所了解。

example.ex: He seemed unusually attuned to people's feelings.
example.tran: 他似乎特别善解人意。

sense.def: If your ears are attuned to a sound, you can hear it and recognize it quickly.
sense.tran: 听得出的;习惯于（某种声音）的

example.ex: Their ears were still attuned to the sounds of the London suburb.
example.tran: 他们依然很熟悉伦敦市郊的喧闹声。

sense.def: Someone or something that is atypical is not typical of its kind.

example.ex: The economy of the province was atypical because it was particularly small...
example.tran: 该省的经济比较特殊，因为它的规模特别小。

example.ex: He was an atypical English schoolboy.
example.tran: 他跟一般的英国男学生不太一样。

sense.def: An aubergine is a vegetable with a smooth, dark purple skin.

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 eggplant

sense.def: Auburn hair is reddish brown.

example.ex: ...a tall woman with long auburn hair.
example.tran: 有着红褐色长发的高个女子

sense.def: An auction is a public sale where goods are sold to the person who offers the highest price.

example.ex: Lord Salisbury bought the picture at auction in London some years ago...
example.tran: 几年前，索尔兹伯里勋爵在伦敦拍得了这幅画。

example.ex: Britain's two main auction houses, Sotheby's and Christies, have been involved in valuing the works.
example.tran: 英国最大的两家拍卖行，苏富比和佳士得参与了对这些作品的估价。

sense.def: If something is auctioned, it is sold in an auction.

example.ex: Eight drawings by French artist Jean Cocteau will be auctioned next week...
example.tran: 下周法国画家让·科克托的8幅作品将被拍卖。

example.ex: The airline plans to auction its international routes to former competitors...
example.tran: 这家航空公司打算把他们的国际线路拍卖给以前的竞争对手。

example.ex: We'll auction them for charity.
example.tran: 我们将为它们举办慈善拍卖。

sense.def: If you auction off something, you sell it to the person who offers the most money for it, often at an auction.

example.ex: Her dresses will be auctioned off for charity...
example.tran: 她的衣物将被拍卖以资助慈善事业。

example.ex: They take drug dealers' boats, cars and houses and auction them off after the crooks are convicted.
example.tran: 他们收缴毒贩的船、车和房产，并在这些恶棍被定罪后将其拍卖掉。

sense.def: An auctioneer is a person in charge of an auction.
Someone who is audacious takes risks in order to achieve something.

example.ex: ...an audacious plan to win the presidency.
example.tran: 为当选总统而制订的大胆计划

example.ex: 'What did you do?' asked Bethany audaciously...
example.tran: “你做了什么？”贝萨妮大胆地问道。

example.ex: They are raking in the profits from each more audaciously violent movie.
example.tran: 通过一部部更加大胆的暴力电影，他们攫取了巨额利润。

sense.def: Audacity is audacious behaviour.

example.ex: I was shocked at the audacity and brazenness of the gangsters.
example.tran: 这伙歹徒如此胆大妄为、厚颜无耻，让我很是震惊。

sense.def: A sound that is audible is loud enough to be heard.

example.ex: The Co-lonel's voice was barely audible...
example.tran: 上校微弱的声音几不可闻。

example.ex: There was an audible sigh of relief.
example.tran: 听得出来松了一口气。

example.ex: Hugh sighed audibly.
example.tran: 休叹了一口气。

sense.def: The audience at a play, concert, film, or public meeting is the group of people watching or listening to it.

example.ex: The entire audience broke into loud applause...
example.tran: 全场观众爆发出热烈的掌声。

example.ex: He was speaking to an audience of students at the Institute for International Affairs.
example.tran: 他在国际事务学院给学生们作演讲。

sense.def: The audience for a television or radio programme consists of all the people who watch or listen to it.
sense.tran: （电视或广播节目的）观众，听众

example.ex: The concert will be relayed to a worldwide television audience estimated at one thousand million.
example.tran: 这场音乐会将向全球约10亿电视观众转播。

sense.def: The audience of a writer or artist is the people who read their books or look at their work.

example.ex: Say's writings reached a wide audience during his lifetime...
example.tran: 在塞伊有生之年，他的作品拥有大量的读者。

example.ex: She began to find a receptive audience for her work.
example.tran: 她开始为作品寻找知音。

sense.hdgr:
usu sing, oft N
with n
sense.def: If you have an audience with someone important, you have a formal meeting with them.

example.ex: The Prime Minister will seek an audience with the Queen later this morning.
example.tran: 今天上午晚些时候首相将会觐见女王陛下。

sense.def: Audio equipment is used for recording and reproducing sound.

example.ex: She uses her vocal training to record audio tapes of books for blind people.
example.tran: 她利用接受的声乐训练给盲人录制磁带图书。

sense.def: Audiotape is magnetic tape which is used to record sound.
An audiotape is a recording of speech, music, or other sounds on magnetic tape.

entry.boxr: in BRIT, usually use 英国英语通常用 cassette

sense.def: If you audiotape speech, music, or other sounds, you record them on magnetic tape.

example.ex: We always audiotape these interviews.
example.tran: 我们总是对这些采访进行磁带录音。

example.ex: ...an audiotaped recording of family members' discussions.
example.tran: 家庭成员讨论的磁带录音

entry.boxr: in BRIT, usually use 英国英语通常用 tape

sense.def: Audio-visual equipment and materials involve both recorded sound and pictures.

example.ex: Visitors are shown an audio-visual presentation before touring the cellars.
example.tran: 参观酒窖前，游客们先观看了有声的视频介绍。

sense.def: When an accountant audits an organization's accounts, he or she examines the accounts officially in order to make sure that they have been done correctly.

example.ex: Each year they audit our accounts and certify them as being true and fair.
example.tran: 他们每年对我们进行账务审核，以确保其真实无误。

example.ex: The bank first learned of the problem when it carried out an internal audit.
example.tran: 银行是在进行内部审计的时候首次发现了这个问题。

sense.def: An audition is a short performance given by an actor, dancer, or musician so that a director or conductor can decide if they are good enough to be in a play, film, or orchestra.
sense.tran: （艺人等的）试镜，试演，试唱，试奏

sense.def: If you audition or if someone auditions you, you do an audition.
sense.tran: 试镜;让…试演（或试唱、试音）

example.ex: I was auditioning for the part of a jealous girlfriend...
example.tran: 我试演一个喜欢吃醋的女友角色。

example.ex: They're auditioning for new members of the cast for 'Miss Saigon' today...
example.tran: 他们今天参加《西贡小姐》剧组招募新演员的试镜。

example.gram:
Also V n, V n
for n
example.ex: I heard your record and I want you to come and audition.
example.tran: 我听过了你的录音，希望你能过来试唱一下。

sense.def: An auditor is an accountant who officially examines the accounts of organizations.
An auditorium is the part of a theatre or concert hall where the audience sits.
An auditorium is a large room, hall, or building which is used for events such as meetings and concerts.

example.ex: The Albert Hall is a huge auditorium.
example.tran: 艾伯特音乐厅是一个大型音乐厅。

sense.def: Auditory means related to hearing.

example.ex: ...the limits of the human auditory range.
example.tran: 人耳听觉范围的限度

sense.def: If you are au fait with something, you are familiar with it and know about it.

example.ex: ...children who are so much more au fait with today's technology.
example.tran: 精通当今技术的孩子们

sense.def: Aug. is a written abbreviation for (书面缩略=) August.
To augment something means to make it larger, stronger, or more effective by adding something to it.

example.ex: While searching for a way to augment the family income, she began making dolls.
example.tran: 为了想法子增加家庭收入，她开始制作洋娃娃。

example.ex: The augmentation of the army began along traditional lines.
example.tran: 军队扩编是沿着传统路线开始的。

sense.def: If something augurs well or badly for a person or a future situation, it is a sign that things will go well or badly.

example.ex: The renewed violence this week hardly augurs well for smooth or peaceful change...
example.tran: 本周新一轮的暴力事件预示着顺利平和的转变几乎不可能实现。

example.ex: Already there were problems. It didn't augur well.
example.tran: 已经有问题了，这不是好兆头。

sense.def: An augury is a sign of what will happen in the future.

example.ex: The auguries of death are fast gathering round his head.
example.tran: 死亡凶兆迅速地在他脑海中盘旋。

sense.def: Someone or something that is august is dignified and impressive.

example.ex: Being so near the august person of the Empress, he was overcome with awe.
example.tran: 如此靠近威严的女皇，他心中充满了敬畏。

example.ex: ...the august surroundings of the Liberal Club.
example.tran: 自由党俱乐部的庄严环境

sense.def: August is the eighth month of the year in the Western calendar.

example.ex: The world premiere took place in August 1956...
example.tran: 全球首映是在1956年8月。

example.ex: The trial will resume on August the twenty-second...
example.tran: 审讯将于8月22日继续进行。

example.ex: This August has been the wettest for four years.
example.tran: 4年来就数今年8月雨水最多。

sense.def: An auk is a seabird with a heavy body and short tail.
Auld Lang Syne is a Scottish song about friendship that is traditionally sung as clocks strike midnight on New Year's Eve.
sense.tran: 友谊地久天长（苏格兰歌曲，多在新年钟声敲响时吟唱）

sense.def: Someone's aunt is the sister of their mother or father, or the wife of their uncle.

example.ex: She wrote to her aunt in America...
example.tran: 她给远在美国的姨妈写了封信。

example.ex: It was a present from Aunt Vera.
example.tran: 这是薇拉姑妈送的礼物。

sense.def: Someone's auntie is their aunt.

example.ex: His uncle is dead, but his auntie still lives here.
example.tran: 他伯父已经过世，可他伯母还在这儿生活。

example.ex: ...my Auntie Elsie.
example.tran: 我的姑妈埃尔茜

sense.def: An au pair is a young person from a foreign country who lives with a family in order to learn the language and who helps to look after the children.
sense.tran: 互惠生，互裨青年（为学习语言而寄宿在某一家庭并帮助照看孩子的年轻外国人）

sense.def: An aura is a quality or feeling that seems to surround a person or place or to come from them.

example.ex: She had an aura of authority.
example.tran: 她给人一种很有权威的感觉。

sense.def: Aural means related to the sense of hearing.

example.ex: He became famous as an inventor of astonishing visual and aural effects.
example.tran: 他因发明了神奇的视听效果而出名。

sense.def: If something is done under the auspices of a particular person or organization, or under someone's auspices, it is done with their support and approval.

example.ex: ...a walk in support of Forests of the World, under the auspices of the World Wildlife Fund.
example.tran: 由世界自然基金会赞助的支持“保护世界森林”的徒步行走活动

example.ex: ...a peace conference under United Nations auspices.
example.tran: 联合国主办的和平大会

sense.def: Something that is auspicious indicates that success is likely.

example.ex: His career as a playwright had an auspicious start.
example.tran: 他的剧作家生涯有了一个好的开头。

sense.def: Aussie means Australian.

example.ex: ...Aussie comedy actor Paul Hogan.
example.tran: 澳大利亚喜剧演员保罗·霍根

posc.def: An Aussie is a person from Australia.

example.ex: The Aussie was in agony with a broken finger.
example.tran: 这个澳大利亚人承受着断指之痛。

sense.def: If you describe something as austere, you approve of its plain and simple appearance.

example.ex: ...a cream linen suit and austere black blouse...
example.tran: 乳白色亚麻套装和简朴的黑色衬衫

example.ex: The church was austere and simple.
example.tran: 教堂的布置很简朴。

sense.def: If you describe someone as austere, you disapprove of them because they are strict and serious.

example.ex: I found her a rather austere, distant, somewhat cold person.
example.tran: 我发现她相当严厉，拒人于千里之外，近乎冷漠。

example.ex: ...an extraordinarily austere and puritanical organization.
example.tran: 有着非常严厉的清规戒律的组织

sense.def: An austere way of life is one that is simple and without luxuries.
sense.tran: （生活）简朴的，不奢华的，苦行的

example.ex: The life of the troops was still comparatively austere.
example.tran: 军队的生活还是相对清苦的。

sense.def: An austere economic policy is one which reduces people's living standards sharply.

example.ex: ...a set of very austere economic measures to control inflation.
example.tran: 一套大力控制通货膨胀的紧缩性经济措施

sense.hdgr: also N in pl, oft N n
sense.def: Austerity is a situation in which people's living standards are reduced because of economic difficulties.

example.ex: ...an economic austerity programme.
example.tran: 经济紧缩方案

example.ex: ...the years of austerity which followed the war.
example.tran: 战后的艰苦岁月

sense.def: If you refer to something as showing austerity, you like its plain and simple appearance.

example.ex: ...many abandoned buildings, some of which have a compact classical austerity and dignity.
example.tran: 许多废弃建筑，其中一些布局紧凑、古朴典雅

sense.def: Australasian means belonging or relating to Australasia or to its people.
Something that is Australian belongs or relates to Australia, or to its people or culture.
sense.tran: 澳大利亚的;澳大利亚人的;澳大利亚文化的

example.ex: She went solo backpacking for eight months in the Australian outback.
example.tran: 她独自在澳大利亚内陆地区进行了8个月的徒步旅行。

sense.def: An Australian is someone who comes from Australia.
Something that is Austrian belongs or relates to Austria, or to its people or culture.
sense.tran: 奥地利的;奥地利人的;奥地利文化的

example.ex: ...the Austrian government.
example.tran: 奥地利政府

sense.def: An Austrian is someone who comes from Austria.
Austro- combines with adjectives indicating nationality to form adjectives which describe something connected with Austria and another country.
sense.tran: （与表示国籍的形容词连用构成形容词）表示 “与奥地利有关的”

example.ex: ...the Austro-Hungarian Empire.
example.tran: 奥匈帝国

sense.def: You can refer to a film director as an auteur when they have a very strong artistic influence on the films they make.
sense.tran: （对所拍电影具有很强艺术影响力的）风格导演

example.ex: ...French auteur Jacques Rivette, responsible for 'La Belle Noiseuse'.
example.tran: 执导《不羁的美女》的法国个性导演雅克·里维特

sense.def: An authentic person, object, or emotion is genuine.
sense.tran: 真的;真正的;真实的;真诚的

example.ex: ...authentic Italian food...
example.tran: 真正的意大利食品

example.ex: She has authentic charm whereas most people simply have nice manners...
example.tran: 她散发出真正的魅力，而大多数人只是举止优雅。

example.ex: They have to look authentic.
example.tran: 它们必须得看上去像真的。

example.ex: There are factors, however, that have cast doubt on the statue's authenticity.
example.tran: 然而，有些因素让人对该雕塑的真伪产生了怀疑。

example.ex: Consumers are increasingly interested in the authentically exotic tastes...
example.tran: 消费者对于真正的异国风味越来越情有独钟。

example.ex: The enamel gives new brass an authentically tarnished finish.
example.tran: 用瓷釉作末道漆使新的黄铜器看似自然地失去了光泽。

sense.def: If you describe something as authentic, you mean that it is such a good imitation that it is almost the same as or as good as the original.
sense.tran: （仿制品）能够以假乱真的，逼真的

example.ex: ...patterns for making authentic frontier-style clothing.
example.tran: 制造仿潮流服装所用的图案

example.ex: The team decided to try and replicate the missing curtains as authentically as possible.
example.tran: 小组决定尽可能照原样重新制作丢失的幕帘。

sense.def: An authentic piece of information or account of something is reliable and accurate.
sense.tran: (信息或记述）准确的，可靠的，可信的

example.ex: I had obtained the authentic details about the birth of the organization.
example.tran: 我已经掌握了有关该组织诞生的可靠的详细资料。

example.ex: The book authentically and intimately describes the small details of her daily life.
example.tran: 本书翔实地记述了她日常生活中的小细节。

example.ex: The film's authenticity of detail has impressed critics.
example.tran: 电影在细节上的真实性给影评人士留下了深刻的印象。

sense.def: If you authenticate something, you state officially that it is genuine after examining it.

example.ex: He says he'll have no problem authenticating the stamp...
example.tran: 他说自己可以对这枚邮票进行鉴定。

example.ex: All the antiques have been authenticated and recorded.
example.tran: 所有的古董都已经过鉴别并进行记录。

example.ex: He had purchased a painting in reliance upon the authentication of a well-regarded expert.
example.tran: 他买下了一幅经知名专家鉴定过的画。

sense.def: If you authenticate something, you prove or confirm that it is true.

example.ex: Documentaries offered the chance to authenticate the accuracy of the various details in these models...
example.tran: 纪录片为核实这些模型中各种细节的准确性提供了机会。

example.ex: There have now been well authenticated reports that the use of this drug is very occasionally responsible for heart attacks.
example.tran: 现在已有非常可靠的报告证明该药物偶可引发心脏病。

sense.def: The author of a piece of writing is the person who wrote it.

example.ex: ...Jill Phillips, author of the book 'Give Your Child Music'.
example.tran: 吉尔·菲利普斯，《给孩子音乐》一书的作者

sense.def: An author is a person whose job is writing books.

example.ex: Haruki Murakami is Japan's best-selling author.
example.tran: 村上春树是日本当红的畅销书作家。

sense.def: The author of a plan or proposal is the person who thinks of it and works out the details.
sense.tran: (计划或建议的）筹划者，制定者

example.ex: The authors of the plan believe they can reach this point within about two years.
example.tran: 该计划的提出者相信他们约在两年内可以达成该目标。

sense.def: To author something means to be the author of it.

example.ex: Then he opened a restaurant, authored a book, and landed his own radio show.
example.tran: 后来他开了个餐馆，写了本书，还制作了自己的广播剧。

example.ex: ...a proposal authored by subcommittee chairman Quentin Burdick.
example.tran: 专门小组委员会主席昆廷·伯迪克提出的建议

sense.def: An authoress is a female author. Many female writers object to this word, and prefer to be called authors.
sense.tran: 女作家（很多女作家反对这样的称呼，更喜欢被称为 author)

sense.def: Authorial means relating to the author of something such as a book or play.

example.ex: There are times when the book suffers from excessive authorial control.
example.tran: 该书曾几次受到作者过多的制约。

sense.def: Authoring is the creation of documents, especially for the Internet.

example.ex: ...software authoring tools.
example.tran: 软件创建工具

sense.def: If you describe a person or an organization as authoritarian, you are critical of them controlling everything rather than letting people decide things for themselves.

example.ex: Senior officers could be considering a coup to restore authoritarian rule.
example.tran: 高官们可能会策划一场政变来复辟独裁统治。

posc.def: An authoritarian is someone who is authoritarian.

example.ex: Don became the overly strict authoritarian he felt his brother needed.
example.tran: 顿成为了一个他觉得哥哥需要的极度刻薄的独裁者。

sense.def: Authoritarianism is the state of being authoritarian or the belief that people with power, especially the State, have the right to control other people's actions.

example.ex: ...the long revolt against authoritarianism.
example.tran: 对独裁主义的长期反抗

sense.def: Someone or something that is authoritative gives an impression of power and importance and is likely to be obeyed.
sense.tran: 权威的;威严的;有威信的

example.ex: He has a commanding presence and deep, authoritative voice...
example.tran: 他仪态威严，声音低沉，说话有威信。

example.ex: Her smile was warm but authoritative.
example.tran: 她的笑容很和蔼，同时又透着威严。

example.ex: The man pushed his way authoritatively through the crowd.
example.tran: 那个人从人群中硬挤出一条路。

sense.def: Someone or something that is authoritative has a lot of knowledge of a particular subject.
sense.tran: （在某一方面）权威性的，可信的

example.ex: The first authoritative study of polio was published in 1840...
example.tran: 关于小儿麻痹症的第一篇权威性研究报告发表于1840年。

example.ex: The evidence she uses is usually highly authoritative.
example.tran: 她采用的证据通常都具有很高的可信度。

example.ex: My own life is the only thing I can speak authoritatively about.
example.tran: 我只对自己的生活有发言权。

sense.def: The authorities are the people who have the power to make decisions and to make sure that laws are obeyed.

example.ex: This provided a pretext for the authorities to cancel the elections...
example.tran: 这给当局取消此次选举提供了借口。

example.ex: The prison authorities have been criticised for not moving more quickly to end the protest by inmates.
example.tran: 监狱当局因没有尽快采取行动制止犯人抗议而受到批评。

sense.hdgr: usu with supp, oft in names
sense.def: An authority is an official organization or government department that has the power to make decisions.

example.ex: ...the Health Education Authority...
example.tran: 卫生教育局

example.ex: Any alterations had to meet the approval of the local planning authority.
example.tran: 任何改建都要取得当地规划机构的批准。

sense.def: Authority is the right to command and control other people.

example.ex: Local police chiefs should re-emerge as figures of authority and reassurance in their areas...
example.tran: 各地警察局局长应当重树其维护辖区安定的执法者形象。

example.ex: The judge had no authority to order a second trial.
example.tran: 法官无权进行二次审判。

sense.def: If someone has authority, they have a quality which makes other people take notice of what they say.

example.ex: He had no natural authority and no capacity for imposing his will on others.
example.tran: 他天生缺乏威信，根本没有能力把他的意志强加于人。

sense.def: Authority is official permission to do something.

example.ex: The prison governor has refused to let him go, saying he must first be given authority from his own superiors.
example.tran: 监狱长拒绝释放他，说他首先必须得到上级官员的许可。

sense.def: Someone who is an authority on a particular subject knows a lot about it.

example.ex: He's universally recognized as an authority on Russian affairs.
example.tran: 他是公认的俄罗斯事务专家。

sense.def: If you say you have it on good authority that something is true, you mean that you believe it is true because you trust the person who told you about it.

example.ex: I have it on good authority that there's no way this light can cause skin cancer.
example.tran: 我有来自权威人士的说法，这种光不可能引起皮肤癌。

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 authorise

sense.def: If someone in a position of authority authorizes something, they give their official permission for it to happen.

example.ex: It would certainly be within his power to authorize a police raid like that...
example.tran: 他绝对有权批准那样的一次警方突袭行动。

example.ex: We are willing to authorize the president to use force if necessary.
example.tran: 我们愿意授权总统在必要的时候使用武力。

example.ex: The United Nations will approve his request for authorization to use military force to deliver aid.
example.tran: 联合国将批准他动用军队运送救援物资的请求。

sense.def: The authorship of a piece of writing is the identity of the person who wrote it.

example.ex: Its authorship has been disputed.
example.tran: 谁是作者尚无定论。

sense.def: Authorship is the activity or job of writing books or articles.

example.ex: It was her first try at authorship and proved a great success.
example.tran: 这是她第一次尝试写作，结果证明非常成功。

sense.def: Autism is a mental disorder that affects children, particularly their ability to relate to other people.
An autistic person suffers from autism.
sense.tran: 患孤独症的;患自闭症的

sense.def: An auto is a car.

example.ex: ...the auto industry.
example.tran: 汽车工业

sense.def: An autobahn is a German motorway.
An autobiographical piece of writing relates to events in the life of the person who has written it.

example.ex: ...a highly autobiographical novel of a woman's search for identity.
example.tran: 关于一位女性寻找自我的自传体色彩浓厚的小说

sense.def: Your autobiography is an account of your life, which you write yourself.

example.ex: He published his autobiography last autumn.
example.tran: 他去年秋天出版了自己的自传。

sense.def: Autocracy is government or control by one person who has complete power.

example.ex: Many poor countries are abandoning autocracy.
example.tran: 很多贫穷国家都在放弃独裁统治。

sense.def: An autocracy is a country or organization that is ruled by one person who has complete power.

example.ex: She ceded all power to her son-in-law who now runs the country as an autocracy.
example.tran: 她把权力全部交给自己的女婿，他现在对国家实行独裁统治。

sense.def: An autocrat is a person in authority who has complete power.
An autocratic person or organization has complete power and makes decisions without asking anyone else's advice.
sense.tran: 独裁的;专制的;独断专行的

example.ex: The people have grown intolerant in recent weeks of the King's autocratic ways.
example.tran: 最近几周国王的专制行径让民众忍无可忍。

sense.def: An Autocue is a device used by people speaking on television or at a public event, which displays words for them to read.
sense.tran: （电视上或公共活动中使用的）电子提词机，自动提示器

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 Teleprompter

sense.def: An autograph is the signature of someone famous which is specially written for a fan to keep.

example.ex: He went backstage and asked for her autograph...
example.tran: 他去后台跟她要了签名。

example.ex: Young autograph hunters clustered around the players' entrance.
example.tran: 年轻人都挤在演员入口处索要签名。

sense.def: If someone famous autographs something, they put their signature on it.

example.ex: I autographed a copy of one of my books.
example.tran: 我在自己的一本书上签了名。

example.ex: ...an autographed photo of Clark Gable.
example.tran: 克拉克·盖博的签名照片

sense.def: Auto-immune describes medical conditions in which normal cells are attacked by the body's immune system.

example.ex: ...auto-immune diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis.
example.tran: 风湿性关节炎等自身免疫疾病

example.ex: ...an auto-immune reaction in which the body becomes sensitive to aspects of itself.
example.tran: 机体对自身各个方面变得敏感的自身免疫反应

sense.def: To automate a factory, office, or industrial process means to put in machines which can do the work instead of people.

example.ex: He wanted to use computers to automate the process.
example.tran: 他想通过计算机实现流程的自动化。

example.ex: In the last ten years automation has reduced the work force here by half.
example.tran: 过去的10年里，自动化使这里的工人总数减少了一半。

sense.def: An automated factory, office, or industrial process uses machines to do the work instead of people.

example.ex: The equipment was made on highly automated production lines.
example.tran: 该设备是在高度自动化的生产线上制造的。

sense.def: An automatic machine or device is one which has controls that enable it to perform a task without needing to be constantly operated by a person. Automatic methods and processes involve the use of such machines.
