example.ex: Modern trains have automatic doors.
example.tran: 现代火车装有自动门。

sense.def: An automatic is a gun that keeps firing shots until you stop pulling the trigger.

example.ex: He drew his automatic and began running in the direction of the sounds...
example.tran: 他拔出自动手枪，向声音传来的方向跑去。

example.ex: The gunmen opened fire with automatic weapons.
example.tran: 歹徒用自动武器开火了。

sense.def: An automatic is a car in which the gears change automatically as the car's speed increases or decreases.
sense.tran: 自动挡汽车;自动变速汽车

sense.def: An automatic action is one that you do without thinking about it.

example.ex: All of the automatic body functions, even breathing, are affected.
example.tran: 身体所有的无意识功能，甚至呼吸，都受到影响。

rnon.hdgr: usu ADV with v, also ADV n/adj

example.ex: Strangely enough, you will automatically wake up after this length of time...
example.tran: 奇怪的是，过了这样一段时间你就会自己醒来。

example.ex: Automatically Tommy's hand went to his forehead.
example.tran: 汤米不由自主地用手去摸额头。

sense.def: If something such as an action or a punishment is automatic, it happens without people needing to think about it because it is the result of a fixed rule or method.

example.ex: Those drivers should face an automatic charge of manslaughter...
example.tran: 那些司机必然会受到过失杀人的指控。

example.ex: Israel offers automatic citizenship to all Jews who want it.
example.tran: 以色列为所有希望获得公民身份的犹太人敞开大门。

example.ex: As an account customer, you are automatically entitled to a variety of benefits...
example.tran: 作为立有存款账户的客户，您自然可以享受一系列的优惠。

example.ex: Anyone giving in excess of £100 automatically becomes a member of the Trust.
example.tran: 任何出资超过100英镑者均会自动成为信托基金的成员。

sense.def: If you are on automatic pilot or on autopilot, you are acting without thinking about what you are doing, usually because you have done it many times before.
sense.tran: 轻车熟路;驾轻就熟;习惯性地做

example.ex: You've made that same trip so many times before that you're on automatic pilot...
example.tran: 这一行程你以前已经走过多次了，早就了如指掌了。

example.ex: My body was on autopilot as I trailed through passport control, baggage reclaim and customs.
example.tran: 我机械性地跟着通过了过境检查、行李认领和海关。

sense.def: An automatic pilot or an autopilot is a device in an aircraft that automatically keeps it on a particular course.
A car that is fitted with automatic transmission has a gear system in which the gears change automatically.
If you say that someone is an automaton, you are critical of them because they behave as if they are so tired or bored that they do things without thinking.
sense.tran: （因为疲惫、厌烦等）动作机械的人

example.ex: I get sick of being thought of as a political automaton.
example.tran: 我讨厌被看作政治机器。

sense.def: An automaton is a small, mechanical figure that can move automatically.
An automobile is a car.
Automotive is used to refer to things relating to cars.

example.ex: ...a chain of stores selling automotive parts.
example.tran: 销售汽车零件的连锁店

sense.def: An autonomous country, organization, or group governs or controls itself rather than being controlled by anyone else.

example.ex: They proudly declared themselves part of a new autonomous province.
example.tran: 他们自豪地宣布成为新自治省的一部分。

example.ex: ...a highly decentralised company, with each of its subsidiaries operating autonomously.
example.tran: 一个权力高度分散的公司，各子公司自主经营

sense.def: An autonomous person makes their own decisions rather than being influenced by someone else.

example.ex: He treated us as autonomous individuals who had to learn to make up our own minds about important issues.
example.tran: 他把我们当作独立自主的个体来看待，认为我们必须学会在重大问题面前自己拿主意。

sense.def: Autonomy is the control or government of a country, organization, or group by itself rather than by others.

example.ex: Activists stepped up their demands for local autonomy last month.
example.tran: 上个月激进分子对地方自治的呼声更高了。

sense.def: Autonomy is the ability to make your own decisions about what to do rather than being influenced by someone else or told what to do.

example.ex: Each of the area managers enjoys considerable autonomy in the running of his own area.
example.tran: 每个区域经理在他们各自负责的地区的运营上都享有高度的自主权。

sense.def: An autopsy is an examination of a dead body by a doctor who cuts it open in order to try to discover the cause of death.

example.ex: The autopsy report gave the cause of death as poisoning.
example.tran: 验尸报告上显示死因为中毒。

sense.def: Autumn is the season between summer and winter when the weather becomes cooler and the leaves fall off the trees.

example.ex: We are always plagued by wasps in autumn.
example.tran: 每年秋天，我们这里总是黄蜂成灾。

entry.boxr: in AM, usually use 美国英语通常用 fall

sense.def: Autumnal means having features that are characteristic of autumn.

example.ex: ...the autumnal colours of the trees...
example.tran: 秋天树木的颜色

example.ex: We used shades of gold and green to give the room a fresh, autumnal look.
example.tran: 我们用金色和绿色的色调为房间平添了一种清爽的秋日感觉。

sense.def: Autumnal means happening in autumn.

example.ex: ...the autumnal equinox.
example.tran: 秋分

example.ex: ...autumnal gales.
example.tran: 秋风

sense.def: An auxiliary is a person who is employed to assist other people in their work. Auxiliaries are often medical workers or members of the armed forces.
sense.tran: （通常指医务或军队中的）辅助人员

example.ex: Nursing auxiliaries provide basic care, but are not qualified nurses.
example.tran: 助理护士只提供基本护理，不具备护士资格。

sense.def: Auxiliary staff and troops assist other staff and troops.

example.ex: The government's first concern was to augment the army and auxiliary forces.
example.tran: 政府关心的首要问题是扩充军队及辅助队伍。

sense.def: Auxiliary equipment is extra equipment that is available for use when necessary.

example.ex: ...an auxiliary motor.
example.tran: 备用发动机

example.ex: ...auxiliary fuel tanks.
example.tran: 备用油箱

sense.def: An auxiliary is an organization that is connected with, but less important than, another organization; for example, an organization for the wives of the members of the main organization.

example.ex: The restaurant is operated by the Palo Alto Auxiliary for the benefit of the Lucile Salter Packard Children's Hospital.
example.tran: 这家餐厅由帕洛阿尔托附院经营，收益用来资助露西尔·帕卡德儿童医院。

sense.def: In grammar, an auxiliary or auxiliary verb is a verb which is used with a main verb, for example to form different tenses or to make the verb passive. In English, the basic auxiliary verbs are 'be', 'have', and 'do'. Modal verbs such as 'can' and 'will' are also sometimes called auxiliaries.
If you do something to no avail or to little avail, what you do fails to achieve what you want.

example.ex: His efforts were to no avail...
example.tran: 他徒劳无功。

example.ex: I apologized repeatedly, but to little avail.
example.tran: 我一再道歉，但丝毫没有奏效。

sense.def: If you avail yourself of an offer or an opportunity, you accept the offer or make use of the opportunity.

example.ex: Guests should feel at liberty to avail themselves of your facilities.
example.tran: 宾客们应该可以随意使用你们的各种设施。

sense.def: If something you want or need is available, you can find it or obtain it.

example.ex: Since 1978, the amount of money available to buy books has fallen by 17%...
example.tran: 自1978年以来，可用于采购图书的经费已经减少了17％。

example.ex: There are three small boats available for hire...
example.tran: 有3艘小船可供出租。

example.ex: According to the best available information, the facts are these.
example.tran: 根据最可靠的消息，事实如下。

example.ex: ...the easy availability of guns.
example.tran: 枪支的唾手可得

sense.def: Someone who is available is not busy and is therefore free to talk to you or to do a particular task.

example.ex: Mr Leach is on holiday and was not available for comment.
example.tran: 利奇先生休假了，不方便作出评论。

sense.def: An avalanche is a large mass of snow that falls down the side of a mountain.
You can refer to a very large quantity of things that all arrive or happen at the same time as an avalanche of them.

example.ex: The newcomer was greeted with an avalanche of publicity.
example.tran: 新来者受到了广泛的关注。

sense.def: Avant-garde art, music, theatre, and literature is very modern and experimental.
sense.tran: （艺术、音乐、戏剧、文学）先锋派的，前卫的，实验性的

example.ex: ...avant-garde concert music.
example.tran: 音乐会演奏的前卫音乐

example.ex: He was an enthusiast for the avant-garde.
example.tran: 他是个先锋艺术的狂热拥护者。

sense.def: You can refer to the artists, writers, and musicians who introduce new and very modern ideas as the avant-garde .

example.ex: In Paris he made friends among the avant-garde.
example.tran: 他在巴黎结交先锋人士。

sense.def: Avarice is extremely strong desire for money and possessions.

example.ex: He paid a month's rent in advance, just enough to satisfy the landlord's avarice.
example.tran: 他预交了一个月的房租，正好满足房东的贪心。

sense.def: An avaricious person is very greedy for money or possessions.
sense.tran: 贪财的;贪婪的;贪得无厌的

example.ex: He sacrificed his own career so that his avaricious brother could succeed.
example.tran: 他牺牲了自己的事业，这样他贪婪的弟弟才能成功。

sense.def: Ave. is a written abbreviation for (书面缩略=) avenue .

example.ex: ...90 Dayton Ave.
example.tran: 代顿大街90号

sense.def: If you avenge a wrong or harmful act, you hurt or punish the person who is responsible for it.

example.ex: He has devoted the past five years to avenging his daughter's death...
example.tran: 他过去5年一心报丧女之仇。

example.ex: She had decided to avenge herself and all the other women he had abused.
example.tran: 她决定为自己和所有其他被他侮辱的女性报仇。

example.ex: He saw himself as a Master of the Universe, an avenger of wrongs.
example.tran: 他把自己当成宇宙的统帅，惩治万恶。

sense.def: Avenue is sometimes used in the names of streets. The written abbreviation Ave. is also used.
sense.tran: （有时用于街名）大街，街道（书面缩略形式为Ave.）

example.ex: ...the most expensive stores on Park Avenue.
example.tran: 帕克大街上最贵的商店

sense.def: An avenue is a wide, straight road, especially one with trees on either side.

sense.hdgr:
with supp, oft N
of n
sense.def: An avenue is a way of getting something done.

example.ex: Talbot was presented with 80 potential avenues of investigation...
example.tran: 给塔尔博特提出了80种进行调查的可能途径。

example.ex: There is another avenue to pursue — it involves further negotiations.
example.tran: 还有一个办法可用，但需要进一步的磋商。

sense.def: If you aver that something is the case, you say very firmly that it is true.

example.ex: He avers that chaos will erupt if he loses...
example.tran: 他断言，如果他失败将会爆发动乱。

example.ex: 'Enter-taining is something that everyone in the country can enjoy,' she averred.
example.tran: “娱乐消遣是每个国民都能享受的事，”她坚定地说。

sense.def: An average is the result that you get when you add two or more numbers together and divide the total by the number of numbers you added together.

example.ex: Take the average of those ratios and multiply by a hundred.
example.tran: 算出那些比率的平均值再乘以100。

example.ex: The average price of goods rose by just 2.2%...
example.tran: 商品平均价格只上涨了2.2％。

example.ex: Of America's million millionaires in 1985, the average age was 63.
example.tran: 1985年美国上百万的百万富翁的平均年龄是63岁。

sense.def: You use average to refer to a number or size that varies but is always approximately the same.

example.ex: It takes an average of ten weeks for a house sale to be completed.
example.tran: 售出一幢房子平均需要10周的时间。

sense.def: An average person or thing is typical or normal.

example.ex: The average adult man burns 1,500 to 2,000 calories per day...
example.tran: 普通成年男子每天消耗的热量为1,500到2,000卡路里。

example.ex: Packaging is about a third of what is found in an average British dustbin.
example.tran: 英国垃圾桶里平均约有1/3是产品包装。

sense.def: An amount or quality that is the average is the normal amount or quality for a particular group of things or people.

example.ex: Most areas suffered more rain than usual, with Northern Ireland getting double the average for the month.
example.tran: 大部分地区降雨超过通常水平，北爱尔兰地区本月的降水量则为平均值的两倍。

example.ex: £2.20 for a beer is average.
example.tran: 一杯啤酒价格通常为2.2英镑。

example.ex: ...a woman of average height.
example.tran: 一个中等身材的妇女

sense.def: Something that is average is neither very good nor very bad, usually when you had hoped it would be better.

example.ex: I was only average academically.
example.tran: 我的学习成绩一般。

example.ex: Most children are not geniuses or stars. They just do averagely well...
example.tran: 大多数孩子既不是天才也不是明星，他们只是表现平平。

example.ex: The songs are performed averagely, although the band seem to be enjoying themselves.
example.tran: 歌曲演唱得很一般，不过乐队好像很自我陶醉。

sense.def: To average a particular amount means to do, get, or produce that amount as an average over a period of time.

example.ex: We averaged 42 miles per hour.
example.tran: 我们的平均时速是每小时42英里。

example.ex: ...pay increases averaging 9.75%.
example.tran: 9.75％的工资平均增长幅度

phrase.def: You say on average or on an average to indicate that a number is the average of several numbers.

example.ex: American shares rose, on average, by 38%...
example.tran: 美国股票价格平均上涨了38％。

example.ex: On an average we would be spending £300 per day.
example.tran: 平均下来，我们每天要花费300英镑。

phrase.def: If you say that something is true on average, you mean that it is generally true.

example.ex: On average, American firms remain the most productive in the world.
example.tran: 总体来讲，美国公司在全球范围内还是产值最高。

sense.def: If a set of numbers average out to a particular figure or if you average them out to that figure, their average is calculated to be that figure.

example.ex: There are six glasses of wine in one bottle, which averages out to 50p a glass...
example.tran: 一瓶酒可以分6杯，平均一杯50便士。

example.ex: Averaging it out between us there's less than £10 a month each to live on.
example.tran: 咱俩把这笔钱平均分一下，每人每月的生活费还不到10英镑。

sense.hdgr:
usu with neg, v-link ADJ
to n
sense.def: If you say that you are not averse to something, you mean that you quite like it or quite want to do it.

example.ex: He's not averse to publicity, of the right kind.
example.tran: 他不反对正当的宣传。

sense.def: If you have an aversion to someone or something, you dislike them very much.

example.ex: Many people have a natural and emotional aversion to insects.
example.tran: 很多人生来讨厌昆虫。

sense.def: If you avert something unpleasant, you prevent it from happening.

example.ex: Talks with the teachers' union over the weekend have averted a strike...
example.tran: 周末与教师工会举行的谈判避免了一场罢工。

example.ex: A fresh tragedy was narrowly averted yesterday.
example.tran: 昨天险些酿成一场新的悲剧。

sense.def: If you avert your eyes or gaze from someone or something, you look away from them.

example.ex: He avoids any eye contact, quickly averting his gaze when anyone approaches...
example.tran: 他避免任何眼神接触，一有人靠近就把目光迅速移开。

example.ex: He kept his eyes averted.
example.tran: 他的眼睛滴溜溜乱转。

sense.def: Avian flu is a serious illness that can be transmitted to people from chickens, ducks, and other birds.
An aviary is a large cage or covered area in which birds are kept.
Aviation is the operation and production of aircraft.
An aviator is a pilot of a plane, especially in the early days of flying.
sense.tran: （尤指早期的）飞行员，飞机驾驶员

sense.def: You use avid to describe someone who is very enthusiastic about something that they do.

example.ex: He misses not having enough books because he's an avid reader.
example.tran: 他是个酷爱阅读的人，总觉得书不够读。

example.ex: ...an avid collector of art and history.
example.tran: 一个热衷收集艺术品和历史文物的收藏家

example.ex: Thank you for a most entertaining magazine, which I read avidly each month.
example.tran: 感谢你们把杂志编得如此有趣，我每个月都如痴如醉地阅读。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, usu ADJ
for n
sense.def: If you say that someone is avid for something, you mean that they are very eager to get it.

example.ex: He was intensely eager, indeed avid, for wealth.
example.tran: 他嗜财如命。

example.ex: Western suppliers too are competing avidly for business abroad.
example.tran: 西方国家的供应商也在疯狂抢夺国外商机。

sense.def: Avionics is the science of electronics used in aviation.

entry.boxr: in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用avocado pear

sense.def: Avocados are pear-shaped vegetables, with hard skins and large stones, which are usually eaten raw.

example.ex: The ham is delicious with avocado.
example.tran: 火腿鳄梨非常好吃。

sense.def: Your avocation is a job or activity that you do because you are interested in it, rather than to earn your living.

example.ex: He was a printer by trade and naturalist by avocation.
example.tran: 他从事印刷业，同时是个博物学爱好者。

sense.def: If you avoid something unpleasant that might happen, you take action in order to prevent it from happening.

example.ex: The pilots had to take emergency action to avoid a disaster...
example.tran: 飞行员不得不采取紧急措施避免灾难的发生。

example.ex: Women have to dress modestly, to avoid being harassed by the locals.
example.tran: 女士穿着应当庄重，以免受到当地人的骚扰。

sense.def: If you avoid doing something, you choose not to do it, or you put yourself in a situation where you do not have to do it.

example.ex: By borrowing from dozens of banks, he managed to avoid giving any of them an overall picture of what he was up to...
example.tran: 他向许多银行借款，使得任何一家都搞不清楚他到底要做什么。

example.ex: He was always careful to avoid embarrassment.
example.tran: 他总是小心谨慎地避免尴尬。

sense.def: If you avoid a person or thing, you keep away from them. When talking to someone, if you avoid the subject, you keep the conversation away from a particular topic.

example.ex: She eventually had to lock herself in the toilets to avoid him...
example.tran: 她最后只好把自己锁在厕所里来躲开他。

example.ex: All through lunch he had carefully avoided the subject of the house.
example.tran: 整个午饭期间，他一直在小心翼翼地回避房子的话题。

sense.def: If a person or vehicle avoids someone or something, they change the direction they are moving in, so that they do not hit them.

example.ex: The driver had ample time to brake or swerve and avoid the woman.
example.tran: 司机有足够的时间刹车或急转弯，来避开那个女人。

xrse.def: to avoid someone or something like the plague

boxu.usage: When you try not to do something, you say that you avoid doing it, not that you 'avoid to do it'. This leaflet tells you how to avoid getting ill. If you want to suggest that you cannot stop yourself from doing something, you should use the expression can't help. I'm sorry, I can't help being suspicious... Nobody liked her to cough, but she couldn'thelp it. If you prevent something, you do something to ensure that it does not happen. They must take urgent action to prevent a famine. If you prevent accidents or diseases, you stop them from happening. If you avoid accidents or diseases, you succeed in not having them or catching them. ...a rope that prevented her from falling. ...a sound recommendation for avoiding cancer. Note that you do not use prevent when telling people about danger. The word you use is warn, and you can warn people about or of a danger. You can also warn them that something is happening or warn them to do something. I warned her about the hole in the floor... She warned me to stay away.
boxu.tran: 当表示避免做某事时，用avoid doing it, 不能用avoid to do it。例如：This leaflet tells you how to avoid getting ill（这个小册子指导人们如何预防疾病）。如果想表示情不自禁地做某事，用短语can’t help。例如：I’m sorry, I can’t help being suspicious（对不起，我忍不住要表示怀疑），Nobody liked her to cough, but she couldn’t help it（大家都不希望她咳嗽，但她忍不住）。prevent意为防止某事发生，例如：They must take urgent action to prevent a famine（他们必须立即采取行动预防饥荒）。prevent后接事故或疾病，表示防止其发生。avoid后接事故或疾病，表示成功地避免受影响或感染。例如：a rope that prevented her from falling（让她不至于摔倒的绳子），a sound recommendation for avoiding cancer（预防癌症的合理建议）。注意，在告诉别人有危险时，不用prevent，而用warn。警告某人某事要发生或告诫某人做某事也可用warn。例如：I warned her about the hole in the floor (我提醒她地上有个洞), She warned me to stay away (她警告我离远点儿)。

sense.def: Something that is avoidable can be prevented from happening.

example.ex: More than a quarter of the avoidable deaths in the developing world are caused by TB...
example.tran: 发展中国家的可避免死亡中超过1/4是由肺结核引起的。

example.ex: The tragedy was entirely avoidable.
example.tran: 那场悲剧是完全可以避免的。

sense.def: Avoidance of someone or something is the act of avoiding them.

example.ex: ...the avoidance of stress.
example.tran: 避免压力

sense.def: If you avow something, you admit it or declare it.

example.ex: ...a public statement avowing neutrality...
example.tran: 宣布中立的公开声明

example.ex: The Prime Minister avowed that he saw no need to change his country's policies.
example.tran: 首相公开表示他觉得没有必要改变国家政策。

sense.def: If you are an avowed supporter or opponent of something, you have declared that you support it or oppose it.

example.ex: She is an avowed vegetarian.
example.tran: 她宣称是个素食主义者。

example.ex: He remained for some years avowedly radical in his political outlook.
example.tran: 他多年来保持公然激进的政治观。

sense.def: An avowed belief or aim is one that you have declared formally or publicly.

example.ex: ...the council's avowed intention to stamp on racism.
example.tran: 理事会宣布要消灭种族歧视

sense.def: An avuncular man or a man with avuncular behaviour is friendly and helpful towards someone younger.
sense.tran: 慈祥的;照顾年轻人的;有长者风范的

example.ex: He began to talk in his most gentle and avuncular manner.
example.tran: 他开始讲话了，态度极其和蔼而慈祥。

sense.def: If you await someone or something, you wait for them.

example.ex: Very little was said as we awaited the arrival of the chairman...
example.tran: 我们等候主席到来的时候都没怎么说话。

example.ex: He's awaiting trial, which is expected to begin early next year.
example.tran: 他在等候审判，预计明年初开始。

sense.def: Something that awaits you is going to happen or come to you in the future.
sense.tran: 即将发生于；将降临到…身上

example.ex: A nasty surprise awaited them in Rosemary Lane.
example.tran: 在罗斯玛丽巷，一起严重的意外事件正等待着他们。

sense.def: Someone who is awake is not sleeping.

example.ex: I don't stay awake at night worrying about that...
example.tran: 我并没有因为那件事而担心得彻夜不眠。

example.ex: Nightmares kept me awake all night.
example.tran: 噩梦扰得我整夜未眠。

sense.def: Someone who is wide awake is fully awake and unable to sleep.

example.ex: I could not relax and still felt wide awake.
example.tran: 我没法放松下来，还是觉得睡意全无。

sense.def: When you awake or when something awakes you, you wake up.

example.ex: At midnight he awoke and listened to the radio for a few minutes...
example.tran: 他半夜醒来，听了一会儿收音机。

example.ex: I awoke to the sound of the wind in the trees...
example.tran: 外面风吹树响把我吵醒了。

example.ex: The sound of many voices awoke her with a start.
example.tran: 一阵杂乱的说话声把她惊醒了。

sense.def: To awaken a feeling in a person means to cause them to start having this feeling.

example.ex: The aim of the cruise was to awaken an interest in and an understanding of foreign cultures.
example.tran: 此次巡游旨在唤起我们对外国文化的兴趣和理解。

sense.def: When you awaken to a fact or when someone awakens you to it, you become aware of it.

example.ex: The British never awaken to peril until it is almost too late.
example.tran: 英国人从来不懂得防患于未然。

example.ex: ...the picture of the Earth, so blue and fragile, that awakened a generation to the Earth's mortality.
example.tran: 照片上的地球，如此的忧郁而脆弱，唤起了一代人对地球生命的意识

sense.def: When you awaken, or when something or someone awakens you, you wake up.

example.ex: Unfortunately, Grandma always seems to awaken at awkward moments...
example.tran: 不幸的是，奶奶好像总是醒来的不是时候。

example.ex: He was snoring when Desmond awakened him.
example.tran: 德斯蒙德叫醒他的时候他还在打呼噜呢。

sense.def: The awakening of a feeling or realization is the start of it.

example.ex: ...the awakening of national consciousness in people.
example.tran: 民众中国民意识的觉醒

example.ex: ...a young woman's sexual awakening.
example.tran: 少女的性萌动

sense.def: If you have a rude awakening, you are suddenly made aware of an unpleasant fact.

example.ex: It was a rude awakening to learn after I left home that I wasn't so special anymore.
example.tran: 离家后我才猛然意识到自己不再有什么特别。

sense.hdgr:
oft supp N, N
for n
sense.def: An award is a prize or certificate that a person is given for doing something well.

example.ex: ...the Booker prize, Britain's top award for fiction...
example.tran: 布克奖，英国小说界的最高荣誉

example.ex: She presented a bravery award to schoolgirl Caroline Tucker.
example.tran: 她向女学生卡罗琳·塔克颁发了英勇奖状。

sense.def: In law, an award is a sum of money that a court decides should be given to someone.

example.ex: ...workmen's compensation awards.
example.tran: 判给工人的赔偿金

sense.def: A pay award is an increase in pay for a particular group of workers.

example.ex: ...this year's average pay award for teachers of just under 8%.
example.tran: 今年教师平均加薪幅度将近8%

sense.def: If someone is awarded something such as a prize or an examination mark, it is given to them.

example.ex: She was awarded the prize for both films...
example.tran: 她的两部电影双双获奖。

example.ex: For his dedication the Mayor awarded him a medal of merit.
example.tran: 为表彰他的奉献精神，市长授予他荣誉奖章。

sense.def: To award something to someone means to decide that it will be given to that person.

example.ex: We have awarded the contract to a British shipyard...
example.tran: 我们将合同给了一家英国造船厂。

example.ex: A High Court judge had awarded him £6 million damages.
example.tran: 高级法院法官裁定他获得600万英镑的损失赔偿金。

sense.def: An award-winning person or thing has won an award, especially an important or valuable one.

example.ex: ...an award-winning photojournalist.
example.tran: 获奖的摄影记者

example.ex: ...his award-winning film.
example.tran: 他的获奖电影

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, ADJ
of n, ADJ that
sense.def: If you are aware of something, you know about it.

example.ex: Smokers are well aware of the dangers to their own health...
example.tran: 吸烟的人都知道吸烟对自身健康的危害。

example.ex: He should have been aware of what his junior officers were doing...
example.tran: 他本应该清楚自己下级们的所作所为。

example.ex: He must have been aware that my parents' marriage was breaking up.
example.tran: 他一定已经知道我父母的婚姻即将破裂。

example.ex: The 1980s brought an awareness of green issues...
example.tran: 20世纪80年代人们开始意识到“绿色问题”。

example.ex: There has been an increasing awareness that many people are affected by crime.
example.tran: 人们越来越清楚地认识到很多人受到犯罪活动的影响。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, ADJ
of n, ADJ that
sense.def: If you are aware of something, you realize that it is present or is happening because you hear it, see it, smell it, or feel it.
sense.tran: 注意到的；察觉到的；意识到的

example.ex: She was acutely aware of the noise of the city...
example.tran: 她对城市噪音很敏感。

example.ex: Jane was suddenly aware that she was digging her nails into her thigh.
example.tran: 简突然间意识到她正在用指甲抠大腿。

sense.def: Someone who is aware notices what is happening around them or happening in the place where they live.

example.ex: They are politically very aware.
example.tran: 他们政治上非常警觉。

example.ex: He introduced radio to the school to increase the children's awareness.
example.tran: 他在学校开通广播，以提高孩子们的警觉性。

sense.def: If the ground or a floor is awash, it is covered in water, often because of heavy rain or as the result of an accident.

example.ex: The bathroom floor was awash.
example.tran: 浴室地板浸在水中。

sense.hdgr:
v-link ADJ, usu ADJ
with n
sense.def: If a place is awash with something, it contains a large amount of it.

example.ex: This, after all, is a company which is awash with cash.
example.tran: 这毕竟是一家现金充裕的公司。

boxx.note: Away is often used with verbs of movement, such as ‘go’ and ‘drive’, and also in phrasal verbs such as ‘do away with’ and ‘fade away’.
boxx.tran: away常与行为动词连用，如go和drive，还可用于do away with, fade away等短语动词中。

sense.hdgr:
ADV after v,
be ADV, oft ADV prep
sense.def: If someone or something moves or is moved away from a place, they move or are moved so that they are no longer there. If you are away from a place, you are not in the place where people expect you to be.

example.ex: An injured policeman was led away by colleagues...
example.tran: 受伤的警察被同伴带走了。

example.ex: He walked away from his car...
example.tran: 他从自己的车边走开了。

example.ex: She drove away before either of them could speak again...
example.tran: 没等他俩中任何一人再开口，她就驾车而去。

example.ex: Jason was away on a business trip...
example.tran: 贾森出差在外。

example.ex: Simon had been away a good deal lately.
example.tran: 西蒙最近经常出门。

sense.hdgr: ADV after v, oft ADV prep
sense.def: If you look or turn away from something, you move your head so that you are no longer looking at it.

example.ex: She quickly looked away and stared down at her hands...
example.tran: 她马上将目光移开，低头盯着自己的手。

example.ex: As he stands up, he turns his face away from her so that she won't see his tears.
example.tran: 站起身时，他将脸别过去，以免让她看到眼中的泪水。

sense.def: If you put or tidy something away, you put it where it should be. If you hide someone or something away, you put them in a place where nobody can see them or find them.

example.ex: I put my journal away and prepared for bed...
example.tran: 我把杂志收好，准备睡觉。

example.ex: All her letters were carefully filed away in folders...
example.tran: 她所有的信件都整齐地放在文件夹中。

example.ex: I have $100m hidden away where no one will ever find it.
example.tran: 我把1亿美元藏到了一个永远没人会找到的地方。

sense.def: If something is away from a person or place, it is at a distance from that person or place.
sense.tran: 离（某人或某地）有一定距离

example.ex: The two women were sitting as far away from each other as possible...
example.tran: 那两个女人坐在离对方尽可能远的地方。

example.ex: I was anxious to get him here, away from family and friends.
example.tran: 我急于把他带到这儿，远离家人和朋友。

example.ex: ...a country estate thirty miles away from town.
example.tran: 离城30英里的乡间庄园

sense.def: You use away to talk about future events. For example, if an event is a week away, it will happen after a week.

example.ex: ...the Washington summit, now only just over two weeks away...
example.tran: 还有两周多时间即召开的华盛顿峰会

example.ex: Peace it seemed might at last be no more than a few months away.
example.tran: 看起来，几个月内也许会最终实现和平。

sense.def: When a sports team plays away, it plays on its opponents' ground.

example.ex: ...a sensational 4-3 victory for the team playing away.
example.tran: 该队在客场以4比3取得的引起轰动的胜利

example.ex: Charlton are about to play an important away match.
example.tran: 查尔顿队即将在客场进行一场重要比赛。

sense.def: You can use away to say that something slowly disappears, becomes less significant, or changes so that it is no longer the same.
sense.tran: （表示慢慢消失、变得不重要或慢慢改变）

example.ex: So much snow has already melted away...
example.tran: 大片雪都慢慢融化了。

example.ex: His voice died away in a whisper...
example.tran: 他的声音渐渐变为了小声低语。

example.ex: The Liberal Democrat's support fell away at the last minute.
example.tran: 自由民主党的支持率在最后一刻有所下降。

sense.hdgr: ADV after v, n ADV, oft ADV prep
sense.def: You use away to show that there has been a change or development from one state or situation to another.
sense.tran: （表示从一种状态到另一种状态的变化或发展）

example.ex: British courts are increasingly moving away from sending young offenders to prison...
example.tran: 英国法院渐渐地不再将少年犯送进监狱。

example.ex: There's been a dramatic shift away from traditional careers towards business and commerce.
example.tran: 从传统职业转向商贸领域的巨大转变已然发生了。

sense.def: You can use away to emphasize a continuous or repeated action.

example.ex: He would often be working away on his word processor late into the night...
example.tran: 他经常在文字处理机上一直工作到深夜。

example.ex: She sighed, her heart banging away against her ribs as she opened the door.
example.tran: 她叹了口气，开门时心一直在怦怦直跳。

sense.def: You use away to show that something is removed.

example.ex: If you take my work away I can't be happy anymore...
example.tran: 如果你炒我鱿鱼，我就再也高兴不起来了。

example.ex: The waitress whipped the plate away and put down my bill...
example.tran: 服务员把盘子撤走，放下了我的账单。

example.ex: Weeks of heavy rain have washed away roads and bridges.
example.tran: 几周的大雨将道路和桥梁都冲垮了。

sense.def: Awe is the feeling of respect and amazement that you have when you are faced with something wonderful and often rather frightening.

example.ex: She gazed in awe at the great stones...
example.tran: 她惊叹地盯着那些巨石。

example.ex: His fellow officers regarded him with awe as some sort of genius...
example.tran: 同事们很敬畏他，视他如天才。

example.ex: She filled me with a sense of awe.
example.tran: 她让我心生敬畏。

sense.def: If you are awed by someone or something, they make you feel respectful and amazed, though often rather frightened.

example.ex: I am still awed by David's courage...
example.tran: 戴维的勇敢依然让我敬佩。

example.ex: The crowd listened in awed silence.
example.tran: 充满敬畏的人群安静地聆听。

sense.def: If you are in awe of someone or if you stand in awe of them, you have a lot of respect for them and are slightly afraid of them.

example.ex: Caroline hardly dared talk in Alex's presence, she was so in awe of him.
example.tran: 卡罗琳在亚历克斯面前几乎不敢说话，她对他很是敬畏。

sense.def: If you describe someone or something as awe-inspiring, you are emphasizing that you think that they are remarkable and amazing, although sometimes rather frightening.
sense.tran: 令人敬佩的;令人惊叹的;令人望而生畏的

example.ex: ...a museum with an awe-inspiring display of jewellery...
example.tran: 展出了一批令人无比惊叹的珠宝的博物馆

example.ex: The higher we climbed, the more awe-inspiring the scenery became.
example.tran: 我们爬得越高，风景越是让人叹绝。

sense.def: An awesome person or thing is very impressive and often frightening.
sense.tran: 让人惊叹的；令人敬畏的；使人畏怯的

example.ex: The church in Ireland has always exercised an awesome power.
example.tran: 爱尔兰的教堂一直掌握着令人敬畏的权力。

example.ex: ...the awesome responsibility of sending men into combat.
example.tran: 将士兵送上战场的神圣责任

example.ex: It was quiet in the streets, awesomely quiet.
example.tran: 街上安静得让人有些害怕。

sense.def: If someone is awestruck, they are very impressed and amazed by something.

example.ex: I stood and gazed at him, awestruck that anyone could be so beautiful.
example.tran: 我站在那里凝望着他，惊叹竟有这么美的人。

sense.def: If you say that someone or something is awful, you dislike that person or thing or you think that they are not very good.

example.ex: We met and I thought he was awful...
example.tran: 我们见了面，我觉得他很讨人厌。

example.ex: I couldn't stand London! Bloody awful place.
example.tran: 我在伦敦再也呆不下去了！简直是个糟糕至极的地方。

example.ex: ...an awful smell of paint...
example.tran: 难闻的油漆味

example.ex: Even if the weather's awful there's lots to do...
example.tran: 即使天气很差，也还有好多事情可做。

example.ex: Jeans look awful on me.
example.tran: 我穿牛仔裤难看极了。

example.ex: The programme's awfulness has ensured it is talked about.
example.tran: 节目如此糟糕，肯定会被人议论。

sense.def: If you say that something is awful, you mean that it is extremely unpleasant, shocking, or bad.
sense.tran: 使人不愉快的；令人震惊的；可怕的；极坏的

example.ex: Her injuries were massive. It was awful...
example.tran: 她遍体鳞伤。太可怕了。

example.ex: Some of their offences are so awful they would chill the blood.
example.tran: 他们的一些罪行骇人听闻，简直令人毛骨悚然。

sense.def: If you look or feel awful, you look or feel ill.

example.ex: I hardly slept at all and felt pretty awful...
example.tran: 我基本上没睡，觉得很难受。

example.ex: I looked awful and felt quite shaky.
example.tran: 我貌似生病了，觉得很虚弱。

sense.def: You can use awful with noun groups that refer to an amount in order to emphasize how large that amount is.

example.ex: I've got an awful lot of work to do.
example.tran: 我有一大堆事情要做。

example.ex: The caramel looks awfully good...
example.tran: 黄油奶糖看上去非常好吃。

example.ex: 'I'm awfully sorry,' she told him regretfully...
example.tran: “我非常抱歉”，她懊悔地向他说道。

example.ex: Would you mind awfully waiting a bit, I'll be back right away.
example.tran: 不介意稍微等一会儿吧，我马上就回来。

sense.def: You can use awful with adjectives that describe a quality in order to emphasize that particular quality.
sense.tran: （与表示特征的形容词连用，用于强调）极度地，非常

example.ex: Gosh, you're awful pretty...
example.tran: 天哪，你太漂亮了！

example.ex: You know, 10 years sounds like an awful long time.
example.tran: 你知道，10年听起来遥遥无期。

sense.def: Awhile means for a short time. It is more commonly spelled 'a while', which is considered more correct, especially in British English.
sense.tran: 片刻，一会儿（英国英语中常拼作a while)

example.ex: He worked awhile as a pharmacist in Cincinnati.
example.tran: 他有一段时间在辛辛那提当药剂师。

example.ex: Authorities had been looking for him for awhile and he finally turned himself in late last night.
example.tran: 一段时间来当局一直在搜寻他，直至昨天深夜他最终向警方自首。

sense.def: An awkward situation is embarrassing and difficult to deal with.
sense.tran: 使人尴尬的；难处理的；棘手的

example.ex: I was the first to ask him awkward questions but there'll be harder ones to come...
example.tran: 我是第一个向他提出尴尬问题的人，不过还会有人问更难回答的问题。

example.ex: There was an awkward moment as couples decided whether to stand next to their partners.
example.tran: 大家在决定是否要站到自己配偶身旁时，这一刻令人尴尬。

example.ex: There was an awkwardly long silence.
example.tran: 有很长一段时间陷入了难堪的沉默。

example.ex: ...an awkwardly timed meeting.
example.tran: 时间安排不当的会议

sense.hdgr: usu v-link ADJ, oft ADJ to-inf
sense.def: Something that is awkward to use or carry is difficult to use or carry because of its design. A job that is awkward is difficult to do.
sense.tran: 难使用的；难携带的；（工作）难处理的

example.ex: It was small but heavy enough to make it awkward to carry...
example.tran: 它虽然小，但很重，不便携带。

example.ex: Full-size tripods can be awkward, especially if you're shooting a low-level subject.
example.tran: 标准尺寸的三脚架可能会不便于使用，用于拍摄低角度的物体时尤其如此。

example.ex: The autoexposure button is awkwardly placed under the lens release button.
example.tran: 自动曝光按钮安装在镜头脱卸按钮下面，十分不便。

sense.def: An awkward movement or position is uncomfortable or clumsy.

example.ex: Amy made an awkward gesture with her hands.
example.tran: 埃米笨拙地做了个手势。

example.ex: He fell awkwardly and went down in agony clutching his right knee...
example.tran: 他笨拙地摔倒了，痛苦地抱住右膝倒在地上。

example.ex: He lay beside her awkwardly, propped on an elbow.
example.tran: 他用一只胳膊肘支着身体，别扭地躺在她旁边。

sense.def: Someone who feels awkward behaves in a shy or embarrassed way.
sense.tran: 害羞的；尴尬的；局促不安的

example.ex: Women frequently say that they feel awkward taking the initiative in sex...
example.tran: 女人们经常说她们不好意思在性生活上采取主动。

example.ex: He was rather awkward with his godson.
example.tran: 在教子面前，他非常局促不安。

example.ex: 'This is Malcolm,' the girl said awkwardly, to fill the silence.
example.tran: 女孩尴尬地说了句“这是马尔科姆”，打破了沉默。

example.ex: He displayed all the awkwardness of adolescence.
example.tran: 他表现出了青春期的各种羞涩不安。

sense.def: If you say that someone is awkward, you are critical of them because you find them unreasonable and difficult to live with or deal with.
sense.tran: 不可理喻的；难打交道的；难相处的

example.ex: She's got to an age where she is being awkward.
example.tran: 她到了难相处的年龄。

sense.def: An awning is a piece of material attached to a caravan or building which provides shelter from the rain or sun.
sense.tran: （篷车或建筑物上的）遮阳篷，雨篷

sense.def: Awoke is the past tense of awake.
Awoken is the past participle of awake.
If someone in the Armed Forces goes AWOL, they leave their post without the permission of a superior officer. AWOL is an abbreviation for（缩略=）'absent without leave'.
sense.tran: （军队中）擅离职守的，无故离队的

example.ex: The troops went AWOL to express their complaints about the camp.
example.tran: 部队擅自撤离了，以表示他们对军营的不满。

sense.def: If you say that someone has gone AWOL, you mean that they have disappeared without telling anyone where they were going.

example.ex: His real father had gone AWOL about 17 years earlier, and after that his mother had remarried.
example.tran: 他的生父在17年前不辞而别，自那以后他母亲就改嫁了。

sense.def: If something goes awry, it does not happen in the way it was planned.

example.ex: She was in a fury over a plan that had gone awry.
example.tran: 计划出了问题，她很愤怒。

sense.def: If something is awry, it is not in its normal or proper position.

example.ex: His dark hair was all awry.
example.tran: 他的黑头发全乱了。

entry.boxr: in AM, use 美国英语用 ax

sense.def: An axe is a tool used for cutting wood. It consists of a heavy metal blade which is sharp at one edge and attached by its other edge to the end of a long handle.
If someone's job or something such as a public service or a television programme is axed, it is ended suddenly and without discussion.

example.ex: Community projects are being axed by hard-pressed social services departments.
example.tran: 处于困境的社会服务部门被迫砍掉社区项目。

sense.def: If a person or institution is facing the axe, that person is likely to lose their job or that institution is likely to be closed, usually in order to save money.
sense.tran: （通常为节省资金而进行的）解雇，撤销，关闭

example.ex: St Bartholomew's is one of four London hospitals facing the axe.
example.tran: 圣巴塞洛缪医院是伦敦4个面临关闭的医院之一。

sense.def: If someone has an axe to grind, they are doing something for selfish reasons.
sense.tran: 有私心；有个人打算；另有企图

example.ex: He seems like a decent bloke and I've got no axe to grind with him.
example.tran: 他看上去像是个正派的家伙，而且我对他没有任何企图。

entry.boxr: Pronounced /'æksɪz/ for meaning 1, and /'æksiːz/ for meaning 2. 义项1读作 /'æksɪz/，义项2读作/'æksiːz/。

sense.def: Axes is the plural of axe.
Axes is the plural of axis.
An axiom is a statement or idea which people accept as being true.

example.ex: ...the long-held axiom that education leads to higher income.
example.tran: 教育会带来高收入这一长期公认的观念

sense.def: If something is axiomatic, it seems to be obviously true.
sense.tran: 不言而喻的;不证自明的

example.ex: It is axiomatic that as people grow older they generally become less agile.
example.tran: 人年纪越大通常灵活性越差，这是不言而喻的。

sense.def: An axis is an imaginary line through the middle of something.
An axis of a graph is one of the two lines on which the scales of measurement are marked.
An axle is a rod connecting a pair of wheels on a car or other vehicle.
An ayatollah is a type of Muslim religious leader.
sense.tran: 阿亚图拉（伊斯兰教派的宗教领袖）

sense.def: Aye means yes; used in some dialects of British English.
sense.tran: 是，对，同意（用于英国英语方言中）

example.ex: 'Do you remember your first day at school?' — 'Oh aye. Yeah.'
example.tran: “你还记得第一天上学吗？”“噢，是的，当然。”

sense.def: If you vote aye, you vote in favour of something.
The ayes are the people who vote in favour of something.
Ayurvedic medicine is a type of complementary medicine, originally from India, that uses herbs and other natural treatments.
sense.tran: （传自印度的医学）阿育吠陀的

example.ex: ...an Ayurvedic practitioner.
example.tran: 阿育吠陀医术的执业医生

sense.def: An azalea is a woody plant with shiny, dark-green leaves which produces many brightly-coloured flowers in the spring.
Azure is used to describe things that are bright blue.

example.ex: ...an azure sky.
example.tran: 蓝蓝的天空

example.ex: ...warm azure seas and palm fringed beaches.
example.tran: 蔚蓝和煦的大海和棕榈环绕的沙滩
